reviewContent: First time I tried United from New York to Orlando my flight got cancelled and my trip delayed by 2 days. This time my flight got delayed by 5 hrs. What gets me is the gate agents attitude, they are unhelpful and not very accommodating. United is an unreliable travel partner.
Air Hostess Susie is an exceptional and thoughtful person. She went above and beyond to assist me on the flight. Because of her kind hospitality, I will continue to fly with United Airlines.

commentHeader: “gate agents not willing to be helpful”
reviewContent: Initially, our flight from Portland was cancelled. When this happened there was minimal to no accommodations for the flight. The gate agents were not willing to be helpful. Furthermore, they were scheduled off and so they were just trying to hand out cards to have people call customer service and reschedule. When I called customer service they continued to transfer me to three different people resulting in being hung up on. At the counter, as the passenger, I had to contact another airline and they were able to assist even though it was not their issue. The lady that was initially helping us was more concerned about whether or not she had clocked back in. To add, the customer service line that they opened had closed in the middle of trying to arrange our new flights. The supervisor on duty told us that the line was still open, and made zero efforts to try and open that line. As the customer I had to research the phone number to talk to reservations. The guy who was trying to switch the flights was getting very frustrated and visibly angry. As a customer we felt the same emotions but we needed the support from the airline in order to make our trip happen. To sum this up, United got us a flight on delta airlines. This flight was not properly confirmed when we got to the delta agent. The delta agent then was able to switch us to the flight that we originally wanted, making our travel day 20 hours rather than 36. United took over three hours to make accommodations and this would not of happened without me as the customer contracting both United and delta. I will never be flying United again because of how terrible this experience was. If I could leave a no star I would.

commentHeader: beware of this companies lack of care
reviewContent: On 7/15/2024 my connecting flight from NJ to VA was cancelled, rebooked for twelve hours later. Minor inconvenience so I spent the day in NYC to kill time. Upon returning to the airport for my rebooked flight, all passengers were told to debark due to mechanical issues. Still not the biggest problem, but now there is not rebooking. The gate agent was extremely volatile with multiple customers. United did not issue any hotel, rental, bus, train, or food compensation for this inconvenience. I called the customer service line and that got me nowhere. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told they are not answering the call. I was trapped in the Newark airport for over a day with no help from United. I eventually booked an Amtrak train ticket to make a deadline I had at work the next day since I hadn't arrived home on the scheduled day 7/15/2024. Buyer beware of this companies lack of care for their customers time and money since the services were not completed.

commentHeader: continues to deny our request to reimburse us
reviewContent: We booked a flight with United from Appleton, WI to Seattle, WA the day before our cruise was supposed to depart from Seattle. They cancelled the first leg of our flight from Appleton to Chicago so we drove to Chicago to get on the flight from there. They then continued to delay our flight continuously until they cancelled it at 1 am. It’s was then too late for us to get on a different flight to Seattle. We missed our cruise embarkation because of them. We were able to book another flight on Alaskan airlines two days later in Juneau, Alaska to catch up with our cruise in that port. United continues to deny our request to reimburse us for that airline ticket. We tried to book something thru them but they had no flights going into Alaska. We fly United on a regular basis but we will no longer be using their airline because of this. If they had cancelled our flight earlier we would have been able to book another flight to catch our cruise. Instead they delayed us 5 times and even had us on the plane for two hours and then deplaned us and delayed us repeatedly before cancelling. The whole situation is totally ridiculous. They were 100% at fault and offered no remedy or reimbursement.

route: New York to Perth via LAX, Sydney
reviewContent: Worst airline ever and they are probably aware of it - contacting anyone in the airline is impossible. We've tried webchat, calling and email. No replies and just automated messages. Do not expect to be treated fair if anything goes wrong. Did not even get on my flight as they delayed and cancelled and then had me flying out from somewhere else with no connection to it - they refuse to refund as they say we have used this flight ticket (that got rebooked departing wrong destination). Ground staff had no clue and gave no help.

commentHeader: lack of respect for their customers
reviewContent: Boarded plane late only because of the lack of organization which I listed to as I stood by the counter. Once we boarded plane, literally sat on plane for 45 minutes, pilots said nothing over the intercom the entire time. Once they backed us out the gate, sat on runway for another 1/2 hour. Nothing for airline to blame it on, weather was great, etc. Pilots provided passengers nothing, what a lack of respect for their customers

United is the worst airline ever I’ll never ever fly with them again I’d rather take Spirit or walk. They canceled our flights saying due to weather but we seen 5 planes take off and someone over heard them say they are short staff but telling people it’s “weather” did not put us in a hotel, did not help with food, very careless the people that work here have no clue about anything at all. Idk how this airline is still open they need to shut it down. We’ve been waiting for another flights for 14 hrs now had to sleep at ohare airport with my kids just a terrible experience they’ll never get a penny from me again! I thought Spirit was bad but no United is truly the worst airline ever!

United Airlines has got to be the worst US based carrier. These people have no business running an Airline. We arrived at ORD from an overseas trip. The departure time was changed 5 times. We boarded twice and had to disembark twice because lack of crew. Instead of taking off at 8:10OM we were asked to leave the plane at 2:20AM because of crew issue. No hotel voucher were given because they rescheduled the flight for 9:30AM. According to the agent we don’t have enough time to sleep and come back. No meal vouchers. We were told it will emailed, which it was not. We were told to go to another terminal near the day flight and cots will be provided. Very few cots weee there, not enough, and the cots are provided by the city of Chicago not US. I can write a book about the miserable experience provided by this miserable and poor excuse for an airline. Their staff was incompetent, lacking knowledge and unhelpful. They lied just to get rid of us. It turned out they knew they had a staffing problem with several flights, judging by the number of folks sleeping on the floor. They delayed announcing it in order to save money. It is 3:22AM and still no email, no text message and no vouchers. Flying United is a one-way ticket to hell. I will never fly them again.

The worst travel experience of my life. United will never get another penny from me connecting through Guam first United didn’t share that we had to meet in front of a specific door and only had eight minutes to do this so me and multiple other passengers, missed the open door and got trapped in the concourse for over two hours broke my bag. This is still an issue.

United airlines changed my flight at 3am on the day of my departure. We had booked the flight for 7:30am and online it said 7:30 departure. I received a text at 3:14 am, (I was sound asleep, not expecting to get up until 5:20am) saying my flight was leaving at 6:14am. When I woke up at 5:20, I received a reminder text stating my plane was boarding at 5:37am. We rushed out the door and made it to the airport by 5:50am. I was unaware that United airlines did not require a boarding pass and so I could have went through TSA with only my ID. But because I could not find a kiosk to print my boarding pass, I went to the front counter to try to get a boarding pass. I have never flown united airlines before this so I was unaware of their new ID only policy. When I got to the front counter the lady was on both her cell phone and the landline. She did not look up at me. She did not even acknowledge. I was standing there. About 10 minutes later she asked me for my name, then told me that I was missing my flight. Another man walked up, and my brother and sister came at the same time. We told the man That my flight was supposed to leave at 7:30 not 6:14, He looked it up and saw that we were telling the truth. But he said they hadn't had a flight to san Francisco that leaves at 7:30am for 2 months. Their system never updated that information. So now if you go online and book your flight out for 7:30, it is incorrect, but you won't find out until 3am on the day of your departure by text message. It seems like a scam. We feel cheated and upset that we had to go through so much stress. The woman on the phone was very rude and did not even acknowledge us or apologize. When we ask her to apologize she responded with "stop yelling at me" Which none of us were yelling. Her supervisor also defended her and acted as though we were wrong. It felt like narcissistic abuse. I will never book another flight on united airlines.

The flight attendants on Flight #1185 on Friday, August 23, 2024, were very rude. I believe the management should review the staff working on this flight, address their attitude, and ensure they receive proper training on how to treat clients with respect.

Firstly, nothing against the pilot or traffic built up. We arrived in New Jersey at around 8:10pm and did not exit the plane until 8:50pm due to arriving earlier than scheduled, traffic, and the gate was changed. The upsetting part is that there are children, elderly, people with health issues, and pregnant women on board. We were told to stay in our seats but those who got up to use the washroom were yelled at very rudely by the air flight attendant. When some of us went to the washroom she yelled out “make it quick!”, making people look around and then she proceeded to use the microphone to yell out “the aircraft won’t move unless everyone is seated” but children and mothers and elderly still got up during the wait. The airplane was not in motion during the whole time it was landed. This flight attendant also made us feel unwelcome during the flight. She would stare and look us people up and down without any greetings or smile as the flight attendants normally do. It was a terrible flight simply for the way she treated us and made people feel ashamed for having to use the washroom during such a lengthy wait to the gate. A young person who flew for their first time even mentioned “there is a way to speak to people, but that is not the way she should have explained the situation, she could have kindly reminded everyone to remain seated”. I feel bad for this new flyer since this is her first impression of flight attendants. I can’t imagine talking to anyone to “make it quick!”

I am a disabled woman that suffers from chronic pain. I very rarely travel because it is often difficult and painful, but my mom is sick so me and my son are tying to fly down to see her. Our flight was delayed for 6 hrs yesterday, then canceled and rescheduled for 6am. We arrived at 5am as requested, only to be delayed another 4 hours by 530. Now as I sit here head pounding, fighting tears and trying to ignore the spreading pain, I am listening to announcements offering $500 travel vouchers for anyone willing to take later flight than the one currently boarding. Really? I don't understand, or appreciate being forced to wait hour after hour, day after day for a single fight that keeps getting pushed off while they are happily paying people to wait while their planes leave on time. Further more while the staff I have had contact with have been super kind, it is obvious to me that this airline could care less how inconvenient their overpriced flights are or how stressful, expensive, and plain frustrating these delays are to their customers. For goodness sake, you have to pay extra to bring a carry-on, to check even 1 bag, to have any space on the plane, or even to be able to sit next to your child, yet they leave you stranded in the terminal where water cost $5 bucks for hours, and now days in a row! I for one will NEVER make the mistake of flying United Airlines again.

The most horrible airline I ever got across in my entire travel experience. I had a flight with UA from West Palm Beach - Newark - Fra. Well the first flight was totally a hell, the flight from PBI- Newark was delayed for 5 hours! I ended up arriving at Newark after 5 hours! After the original time, I was supposed to take a flight to Germany FRA and because they were super delayed I missed the flight to Germany, I arrived at New Jersey around 11:45 pm at that time there was no more available flights to Germany, well I had to wait until next day to get another flight to Germany, I went to the UA airport counter, the employees were so rude, they said they couldn’t give me another flight because the flight was operated by Lufthansa, I went to Lufthansa and they told me that United Airlines had to do it, I went back to UA counter and one of the employees told me she cannot help me and told me to call the customer service phone line. Let me tell you their customer service is the most ugliest and horrible customer service I ever experienced in my whole life. To begin with this endless nightmare, they kept me on hold for 3 hours on the phone , 3 hours! I even screenshot the reordered phone calls with these idiots!! At the end of the phone call the customer service agent told me that she refuses to give me a hotel voucher. Yeah alright after their flight being delayed for 5 hours. I arrived so late at Newark airport. The second thing that made me explode was that after 3 hour phone call the agent told me to go back to the UA airport counter and ask for the alternative flight for my missed flight, at this point my blood was boiling! She said she couldn’t help me and that I had to go to the counter again. I spent the whole night at Newark airport walking around, sitting around because this airport is so dangerous, lots of homeless people walking around trying to do something bad to others. Then the next morning again I went to the UA counter, again they refused to help me again. They told me to go to Lufthansa because the flight was operated by Lufthansa.  At this point I was crying because no airline wanted to help me, I felt so helpless, then I went and looked for a manager of the UA, he said that he was gonna take a look to my reservation, again he told me to go to Lufthansa , I told him that I been bounced like 7 times already back and forth between those 2 airlines, he came with me to Lufthansa counter and spoke to the Lufthansa staff, they looked at my ticket number and said that the ticket number did not exist. Then the UA manager told me to give him 2 hours to figure this out, after 2 hours I came to the UA counter and he said to me that he is sorry that him and his staff crew didn’t type the numbers of the ticket or reservation code correctly on their computers.  They have complete fools working at this airlines, these people gave me a hell because they are so incompetent and stupid to even know what they are doing? And on top of everything their staff was so rude. Finally after 16 hours I got my flight to Germany. The nightmare doesn’t end here. My returning flights from this horrible airline were messed up and disorganized, I must said this airline is extremely unreliable. I had to run like in a marathon throughout the airport of Holland to not miss my flight to America. Their damn flight was again delayed for 2 hour.  Never again UA.

United is not a good airline, but it's not a bad one either. The main meals are better left alone, but throughout the flight they did serve snacks that were pretty good. Given my average size and height, the legroom and seat width were completely acceptable (tip: you gain a LOT of feet space by stowing carry-ons in the overhead bins rather than under the seat in front of you). That said, the recline was awful. Compared to other overseas carriers like Air France or Lufthansa, they barely recline at ALL.

Switched from Delta for this flight to see the differences between it and united. Had heard decent things before, and wow....I could not have been more disappointed. To start with, they have a "phone stand" attached to the seat for your "own personal entertainment station". A set up as low quality as a dollar store phone stand. And the in-flight food both to AND from our destination was FROZEN. The chicken was absolutely disgusting (And frozen), and when I asked the flight attendant if she could possibly heat the chicken, she just repepated no over and over with a deer in headlights smile, (will post her name later) till I finally got fed up with her absolute lack of care and told her to take the lunchable style brown bag excuse they'd tried to paddle off as food. The seats are a huge downgrade from other flights on the same aircraft, and when I wasn't being nickel and dimed for everything from bags to drinks the pilot was upselling items. This seriously feels like the dollar store knockoff of a real flight. What an absolute embarrassment.

Worst experience of our life, they don’t care about you at all. They canceled our flight and didn’t offer any new flight, no meals, no transportation, no hotel rooms nothing. They won’t even refund our money for the original flight. Then when you ask for help they tell you to go the website and fill out a form. My sister in law had this exact thing happen two months ago no call back no email no refund.  Do not waste your time or money. I would have rather walked.

My flight from Fort Lauderdale (FLL) to Newark was supposed to depart at 13:52, with a connecting flight to Dubai. Instead, it turned into a nightmare. The flight was delayed six times due to weather conditions, which is understandable, but the way United handled it was terrible. After each delay, we were asked to line up and prepare for boarding, only to be told to wait more. Eventually, after hours of waiting and false hope, they canceled the flight. If they had just canceled it earlier, my mother and I wouldn't have wasted our entire day at the airport. To make matters worse, when the cancellation was announced, we were told to stand in two lines—one for international travelers. My mother and I stood in line for 2 hours, only to be cut off by someone who had already been served but didn’t like the hotel they were given. Despite Assistant Maria already talking to me, she decided to help this person instead. Then, another assistant, Nina, ignored me and left while I was still waiting. When we went "upstairs" to United's main kiosk to get new reservations, it was another disaster. Unlike everyone else who was in line "downstairs," I was told I couldn't be reimbursed, with the excuse that the system wouldn’t allow it. This left me to cover additional costs for transportation, accommodation, and food—all over my budget. To top it off, when I reached out to United’s customer service about this, I received a lazy, dismissive response: "Unfortunately, I'm unable to reimburse your costs as the flight interruption was outside of our control." This reply was both upsetting and offensive. It feels incredibly unfair and ridiculous that I was left standing out, almost like I was being discriminated against. My mother went through all of this with me, standing and waiting without any proper support from United. Now, after saying my goodbyes, I have to spend more money just to get home. I’m extremely disappointed with how United Airlines handled this situation. I want to be reimbursed, but even more than that, I want to be heard. United Airlines, you've lost a customer for good—I’m switching to Delta.

route: Singapore to Washington via San Francisco
commentHeader: really seem to hate their job
reviewContent: The flight attendants really seem to hate their job and hate being there. They can’t time the trash pick up properly. They distributed snack and drinks, followed immediately by a meal. So when they came around with the drink cart and asked if we wanted a drink, I wanted to say I can’t because my tray is full. Then at snack time, they came with the trash cart 10 mins after we got our food. And it’s been another 10+ minutes and they haven’t made their rounds yet. Food is really bad too.

Booked a flight from Appleton - 3 hr delay prior to arriving was able to change flights easily (impressed at the ease at the time - now I know why clearly rebooking if a continuious activity if flying United) had a delay with the new flight. Got to Denver (layover) another delay 1/2 hr, 2nd delay another 1/2 hr, start boarding, de board -flat tire -then 2 flat tires. Landed 9:45 pm in San Francisco vs 7:15 days gone - so much for paying for flight with good landing times. Return flight San Francisco to Appleton - loaded late then a 1/2 hr delay, while in plane another delay of 1 and a half hours. Scheduled flight 12:55pm new fly time was 2:55! Denver was layover had weather while flying - airport was a mess BUT most flights were back to being on time - not United. My flight was delayed for 6 hrs 8:45 pm leaving vs landing in Appleton at 9:15pm - landing time changed to 12:15 am. Was able to change flights and land at Madison at 11pm. To conclude -9 delays involving 4 planes totals for 1 trip. Fun fact : 3 different airports never did go to the airport that I booked out of. Way to go United - take the $$ the leave it to the customers to do your job and juggle numerous flights to complete their trip!! Will say their staff was nice but assuming they have to be since the actual purpose of United is to fly people and they fail at that!

United is the worst airline out there. Every single flight I’ve had over the last 10 years has been delayed, cancelled or rerouted. All this while getting less room, no meals, barely any snacks and higher prices. I love waking up at 5:30am for a flight they’ve delayed for 6.5 hours and then getting kicked off the tarmac because they forgot a food cart causing the flight to be flat out cancelled. Absolutely disgraceful that they’re allowed to run a company like this.

commentHeader: staff are clueless for what happening
reviewContent: Flight from London to Washington DC on 08/01/2024 before boarding have remind the staff regarding for luggage transfer from Emirate airline to United Airline, staff was promised to make it in system , when landed queues 3 hrs in United airline lost bag to register for lost bag. Waiting 3 days in Washing DC for baggage delivery to hotel however no new, no email, call them 1000 times no answer. I need to flight To Seattle as flight had booked in advance. When reached Seattle try to call 1000 times they either no pick up or don't have information . Have to go to airport and register again after 6 days i got my bag with total damages, and open. Second baggage was no new. Call them day by day , today 08/11 my second bag still in Washington DC without transfer to my address. What is worst customer service they have. No email , non phone call : no apology / staff are clueless for what happening.

This review is not for flying but for customer service. Our family experienced with one of our cousins a terrible accident. When we called United and expressed concern regarding our family member traveling with mental and physical health issues, United with little questions after initial disclosure refunded the flight cost to our family credit card. The agent on August 9, 2024  was polite, sensitive, and efficient. There was no playing games with needing to go to a supervisor. And since our family member who called was and is experiencing PTS because of observing the accident, this aware service agent eased our family pain. Thank you United. We will use the refund to have another family member fly soon. You have our business because of this sensitivity of your agent.

commentHeader: What a mess this flight was
reviewContent: Passenger TV screen didn't work. Overhead reading light didn't work and it was a long flight from Newark to Portland. The seat was uncomfortable, and my bags were lost and will be returned today. What a mess this flight was!

Worst experience flying. The outgoing flight from Little Rock to Denver was delayed by an hour 4 hrs before the departure time. Ended up being 2hrs late. Because of this we missed our flight out of Denver causing us (me and 2 small children) to book the next flight which was 12 hours later. Meaning I could either sleep in the airport with small kids or pick from the very limited hotels. The hotel they booked is had bugs in the lobby, but was fine otherwise. The flight on the way home was fine except they put my checked bags on a different plane, so we drove the hour home with no bags. They were supposed to be delivered today, 7/7/24, but they haven't moved since 1pm according to the app and I cannot get ahold of anyone via phone. Flight attendants were the highlight on all flights. All very nice.

commentHeader: They were not at all helpful
reviewContent: They are the worst airline to fly with. Their customer service is rude and condescending. The flight was cancelled because of a mechanic issue which led to waiting until the bad weather came in. If they were not delayed by the 2 hours for mechanical issues we would have made it to the destination before thunderstorm started. They are unable to rebook people for 2-3 days because they overbook the flights. There was no compensation for food or hotels. They would not allow anyone to have their luggage even though some people completely cancelled their plans because of the long delay. They were not at all helpful. There is not 1 good thing I can say about them.

commentHeader: went above and beyond for me
reviewContent: United Airlines flight was perfect. Everything went well, all attendants were so nice, and it was a great experience! I especially want to think the crew of flight 567. What a wonderful bunch of stewards and stewardesses were on that flight! They went above and beyond for me!

commentHeader: United Airlines employees put extra effort
reviewContent: I was on a family vacation with my two adult children from New Jersey. Our vacation was over and we were flying back home on Saturday, August 3, 2024. Unfortunately, our flight home to Newark Liberty Airport from New Orleans was cancelled about two hours prior to scheduled departure. United Airlines employees put extra effort in to making a nightmare experience into a tolerable one. First, on Saturday afternoon, they helped us out through the entire process of rebooking our flight for 6 am the next day, taking care of hotel accomodations, airport transfers, meal vouchers, and reassuring us throughout the process that we will be well taken care of. They guided us on how to get our checked luggage back and what we needed to do the next day. On early Sunday morning around 3:30 AM, another United Airlines employee, helped my two children to get their bags retagged, as the kiosk would not print out updated luggage tags. They also helped all three of us to get Gate passes we needed, since our boarding pass said delayed flight and we were already checked in yesterday. She also rebooked my children's tickets to make sure that sat next to each other. This was something we did not even ask her to do. Thanks to both.

We were flying to Houston to connect with a Air New Zealand international flight to Auckland, then onward to Adelaide, Australia. Arrived at checkin with 3 hrs to spare at Raleigh-Durham. Our agent gave us etickets. Tried to checkin on line but got message "proceed to checkin counter". The lady at the counter could not find us on the passenger list for quite some time. Finally she says. OH you just have etickets. Yes, that's what we showed her. She said the flight is fully booked, I don't have room. I said we are connecting with an international flight and United is the carrier. She looked some more and found seats, apart, but at least we were on board. Come boarding time, we get are in group 3 and get told no more room for carry on. We explained to staff we had a stop over in New Zealand and needed what we had. Our cabin bag weighed less than 5kg each. She suggested we condense into 1 bag not over 7kg. Thankful for her suggestion we did that. One cabin bag was then checked through all the way to Australia. Go to step onboard the aircraft to have a flight attendant step forward and scream at top of her voice to us .. I have no more room, get off, go back and check the bag in. We explained what had just transpired during boarding and proceeded to find out seats. She gets on the PA and screams down the isle .. no more room for baggage, means no more room. Other passengers said to us how rude they found her too. When my husband reached his seat, he was holding the cabin bag while checking the nearby overhead lockers. Again she gets on PA and screams .. Sir, you can not stand there holding you bag. He wasn't holding anyone up in the isle at all. A male attendant came along and said .. come with me Sir, there is room down the back of the plane. My husband said there were 2 empty overhead bins still. While all this was going on I was watching other passengers get on with 2 pieces of cabin luggage each. The female Head Attendant was rude and abrupt during the flight to others, which thankfully was a short flight. We have travelled extensively and never been spoken to in such a rude demeaning manner. United Airlines should enfirce the rule 1 carryon piece each passenger so there is room for everyone's luggage. We will never travel with United Airlines again, which unfortunately means we won't travel to visit family in USA on Air New Zealand with United being their carrier. Obviously United Airlines is quite affluent because it does not need repeat customers. Extremely disappointed in that staff member and the lack of luggage space onboard for a passenger transiting to an international flight when we arrived 3 hours before departure time.

I had the worst time flying United on 8/3/2024 from Orlando to Newark! We had a direct flight to Newark. They cancelled that flight and booked us on a connecting flight. We were ok with that. But then while boarding and waiting an hour on the plane in Orlando we noticed they had cancelled our connecting flight to Newark and they did not rebook us. Then as we were trying to get information they gave us a card and basically said fend for yourself! We had to take a 40 minute Uber from IAD Dulles international airport to Newark Penn Station and then take an UBER home from there!

route: Cancun to Vancouver via Los Angeles
reviewContent: I had a flight from Cancun to Vancouver. Airplane legroom was quite tight and was not comfortable, Flight attendant were not responsible, nor polite and didn't care for any request. It was my first flight with United Airlines and it'll be my last one with them. I wont recommend this airline to anybody else. Flight had more than 4 hours delay, that was announced each half an hour, so no body could even have an idea when can ask their family to pick them up at YVR. Ultimately, after provide a $ 15 dinner voucher, too late to use, so we paid almost $ 80 to buy a brief dinner together with my wife and I didn't apply the voucher at all. I don't have any idea how they dared to provide $15 dinner voucher after this more than 4 hours delay. Ultimately our landing was changed from 10.30 PM to 2.30 AM, that ruined our day after, too, since we reached home in Port Moody around 4.30 AM. I regret to choose United Airline and for sure it'll be the last time to choose United Airlines. Worst experience with an airline.

Complete failure. Bad weather expected so we moved the flight up to a 9 AM flight. That was canceled. No reason for us back to our original flight without having business class. Delayed because of rest. Got to Washington and missed flight by four minutes. They didn’t wait for us. We were told that they needed four empty seats. got put on a flight several hours later to Frankfurt. That flight was late and they waited for people for this flight. Now don’t know if we’ll even make our next flight. Going to miss at least one or more of our days in Athens. Tickets that were bought cannot be refunded. Fail every way.

Flight was canceled at the last minute with vague reason given. This caused a major disruption to an extended family vacation involving delay and cancellation for several family groups. There were no other flights available the same day and United sent a rescheduled flight that was to a different destination on a different day. This was ridiculous and unacceptable. I cannot describe how poorly and nonchalantly we were treated. I will never fly United again.

Flight was delayed 2 hours and then we were put into holding pattern for 3 hours in the sky. We got rerouted to another airport because running out of fuel and once landed there, sat on tarmac for another few hours. This was all due to thunderstorms around the destination. This is all well and good as nature happens, but when I tried to contact customer service to get on another flight, I never got a response back and I waited on the phone for 41 minutes on hold. Customer service sorely lacking.

Why do we need to open up an account with United to file a complaint with the airline? Why aren't staff trained on hidden disabilities (such as ASD)? Why are children not seated with parents on flights.. is that a policy or just randomly seat people wherever? These questions I would like to get an answer for. I don't want to get into all the details but typically a child with a disability is seated next to a parent. Why they would seat them separate is bizarre to me. I got lots of attitude when I had asked them nicely about the seating. I got rude and snappy remarks and they just escalated the situation further while I remained calm the whole time. United is by far the worst airline I have traveled on and worst experience in my entire travelling history.

commentHeader: “the human touch makes all the difference”
reviewContent: We booked our tickets the day we were traveling. We boarded Flight UA52 from Washington DC to Zurich, on July 18th at 8 pm instead of 6 pm. Our flight was delayed due to some parts that needed to be replaced by two hours. Our connecting flight from Zurich to Mumbai had a window of two hours. The United Airline personnel reassured us we will not miss our connecting flight as the pilot will make up time and the connecting flight was at the same terminal as our landing terminal. Once we boarded, I spoke to the crew who was servicing us of our situation. We were flying to my brother's funeral and his son, who was traveling with me, needed to make the connection as he had to do the last rites. The pilot made up one and half hours. We had only 30 minutes in hand. The crew were so helpful and understanding. They moved us to business class for the last 10 minutes before landing so we were the first ones to deboard. I cannot thank the crew enough for their support and for making this happen. We made our connecting flight with 10 minutes to spare. And we made it to Mumbai. Thank you to the crew of Flight UA52. I wish I remembered your names. It is the human touch that makes all the difference.

I purchased two tickets to LAX. Unfortunately my mother passed and I had to cancel my trip. United Airlines didn't care, wouldn't refund anything except my seat fare and they even upgraded my ticket without asking and charged me more money for the upgrade. I just can't believe that I have the death certificate and everything to give them and I can't get my money for the ticket refunded they gave me a voucher that's only good for a year and I'm not a frequent flyer and will never use the voucher because I'll never fly with United again.

commentHeader: disgusted with the service of United
reviewContent: I have been flying United for years but recently I have been less than impressed. On my recent flight to Newark NJ I experienced a 1 plus hour delay in addition to a freezing cabin temperature. Then on our flight home we were again delayed 1 hour due to no pilot available! I mean really. The flight prior to ours was delayed coming in and I honestly believe the “missing pilot “ excuse was just a cover for their inability to get their flights on time. So in addition after waiting the extra hour and paying extra to have priority boarding, I was told I had to check my carry on at the gate due to they had reached the maximum amount of luggage. Yet when I boarded the plane I found numerous over head bins completely empty. So I get seated in my seat and watch as the passengers board the plane only to notice that after awhile people were entering the plane and able to use the overhead bins. I'm utterly disgusted with the service of United and after years of flying I am over their sub par services and over charges. Delta is going to be my choice from now on.

commentHeader: not worth half the fare paid
reviewContent: This was a really bizarre flight, like being thrust 20 years into the past. Despite the app telling us Wifi was available on the flight, it does not appear to be offered on this class of plane in the fleet (specifically the 737s used in the Pacific). United routes in Micronesia use planes that have not been updated since the routes were flown by Continental Micronesia, and the cabin is showing its age. Seats barely holding together, no power outlets, no real entertainment selections since the entertainment system is just a screen and buttons to change channels to see continuously-looped content. If you want to know what it was like to fly United in 2002, this is a good way to experience it, but ultimately the inflight experience was not worth half the fare paid.

United Airlines does not support the US military traveler. They advertise free checked bags and carry on for active duty military. But this is dependent on the type of ticket purchased. If you must purchase an expensive ticket to get the bags this is not offering a service for US military. Deceiving practice.

commentHeader: the last time I fly United Airlines
reviewContent: Horrible experience from A to Z. Purchasing the ticket was a nightmare. I had to change my flight and I payed a penalty (which is ok) But the agent 1 told me I would have a credit to purchase my next ticket. Agent 2 said I would have a refund on my credit card but 3 weeks later the refund wasn’t done. I had to talk with a manager to have that corrected (after hours on the phone) Arrived to destination my luggage got lost. No help to cover was offered at all. I had to purchase shoes, shorts and more. To be compensated it really seems to be a nightmare. One week later the luggage was found and sent but all the content was wet. They sent my luggage to my first destination but too late as I had to leave to the next city for work. On the FOUR flights I had separated seats from my wife and the boarding was so messy that nobody wanted to change seats. This is the last time I fly United Airlines.
Amazing service from Jessica! Above and beyond compared to normal UA flights. Still would not recondited to travel issues, but even with a problem this time. Worth it because of the service!

route: Salt Lake to Dallas via San Francisco
reviewContent: Our flight to SFO had been delayed due to a mechanical problem. We had to sit 5 hours in the plane! All Americans in the plane just acted like it's all good and just another day. I missed my connection to Dallas because of this. Getting a new flight, apparently goes through their app only. Nobody in person that you can help at a desk. Even though there was a direct flight available (from United) the app did not give the possibility to rebook this flight. Instead they offered an indirect flight through Houston. The only way to contact them is by phone. Nobody really helping you to get as soon as possible to your destination. I can't believe Americans take this kind of low service level. In a 'consumer oriented' society like the US I expected people to be more assertive. The service United delivers is dehumanized. In total it took me 14 hours to get to Dallas! I think it's totally unacceptable. Even though a mechanical failure can happen, getting you another flight to get you asap to your destination is a minimum in such a situation. After this experience I think I will never fly United again.

commentHeader: disgusted with how things were handled
reviewContent: I will never fly them again. I was supposed to arrive to my destination but due to the global outage my partner and I could not make it in the time we were supposed to (not our fault. Once we were redirected they had transfered our luggage to another state and we did not even board that flight. Not sure how it was flown over to the state when the flight was cancelled. Not only did we not get our luggage for 3 days, once we did land to our destination, the zipper on my luggage had been broken off. When we did arrive to the destination we were told to leave our keys so they can check for anything during customs and then once we got the luggage they would be returned to us. My luggage was complete destroyed. I am on vacation I paid for my time and I decided to call them once I got back with that broken luggage and now I am being told it was over 7 days they cant do anything about it. I find that extremely messed up. Not only did I miss my time to decompress due to the global outage, it is what it is, but, I also had no luggage for 3 days when we arrived and had to buy clothes. I decided to take it easy and call once I got back and on Friday late night, I decided to call Monday (working days) just to be told cant do anything about it. So not only did I miss a couple of days of no luggage bought clothes out of pocket, then to have a damage luggage to bring back and to now be told oh wells sorry cant do anything about it. That's absolutely disgusting. People spend thousands of dollars to travel and save up for that and then some. To be treated like it's nothing is so rude. I will never travel United again, it was not only the most dirtiest flight but the staff was extremely unwelcoming. Customer care was not helpful at all. I've never had to call an airline more than 2 times, I think I have called United at least 8 times in the matter of a week just to connect with someone. I suggest you guys do better with how you show empathy. It's all a money grab for you guys. Absolutely disgusted with how things were handled.

commentHeader: they still treat me this way
reviewContent: I am not upset about the flight. I am upset because I am a memeber and have 18K worth miles plus $2K of flight money or i guess cash due to me, and all I wanted was to use my miles the same way i do on the plane and get snacks, but this time for my daughter who is visiting from college, and I bought her ticket through my account. But they refuse do do that. You are the only one who can use it. They owe me money after getting off a flight so others could travel because plane was to heavy, and I was first to say yes. And they still treat me this way.

Brazen swindlers. My bag fit easily into the carry-on size box. I bought a ticket with hand luggage. But they refused to put me on the plane until I paid for my hand luggage as baggage. Why did they create the measuring box? If it doesn't make sense. I showed a screenshot from their corporate website, where the dimensions of hand luggage were indicated. But the company employees didn’t care about the site.

We had a terrible experience with United Airlines. Our flight was scheduled for 5:45 am, and we arrived at the airport on time. However, the check-in process was unusually slow, taking much longer than expected. After finally getting through check-in, we proceeded to security, but we were stopped by the employee who checked us in. They realized there was an issue with my boarding pass and spent another 15 minutes verifying it. Once we reached security, we encountered another problem: the TSA agent noticed a discrepancy between my boarding pass and passport. This required us to go back to the check-in counter, where it took them another 10 minutes to identify that my birthdate was entered incorrectly. By the time everything was sorted out and we returned to the security checkpoint, there was a lengthy queue. Despite rushing through security, we arrived at the gate just 5 minutes late, only to be informed that we had missed our boarding window. The airline staff instructed us to reschedule our flight due to the delay caused by these issues. Which where all caused by United Airlines.

commentHeader: told us we have to check in our carry ons
reviewContent: We were the last group going on the plane. We had a connection in New York. They let first people to take three bags and they told us we have to check in our carry ons. They were absolutely rude and not professional. They threatened us with police. We had computers and learning books for our medical conference in Geneva. This is absurd This is the first and last time we flying United.

commentHeader: flight was overbooked and was delayed
reviewContent: I normally fly Delta, but chose United due to the availability of a direct flight. As usual my United flight was overbooked and was delayed so bad (due to technical issues and needing a new plane, that a Delta flight with a Layover would have been better. This seems to happen every time I give an airline other than Delta a try. I have said I’ll never use United again more than once. Maybe they will eventually get one right.

route: Boston to Corpus Christi via Houston
reviewContent: I first flew United from Indianapolis to Boston via New Jersey, and my flight was delayed by two hours causing me to miss my connection. The worst part was, we were on the tarmac when they told us the flight had been delayed. And the flight on this review is my second ever flight with United trying to get from Boston to Corpus with a connection in Houston. Once again, they waited until the very last second to inform me of a 1hr and 5 minute delay (as of the time of writing this review). With their track record, I’m not that optimistic they will successfully take off at the new time, either. The gate changed twice, and they didn’t inform me of the delayed time until boarding was supposed to have ended. The flight was supposed to leave at 12:15pm, and the flight time wasn’t changed until 12:00pm. According to their information, it was a scheduling error, and I’ve honestly had such a horrible experience with getting anywhere on time with them, I will be doing my absolute best to never fly with them again.

Horrible airline. The inflight entertainment was broken, for a 13 hour flight. A mobility aid was lost on arrival, due to incorrect tagging by the staff in San Francisco - a surly check-in member who did not smile once. They broke a suitcase on top of all that, which they refuse to fix. Avoid this disaster of an airline. They do not care about passengers.

I made an online reservation in March 2024 for a family of 4 and 10 mins after canceling the reservation due to nondisclosure of ticket restriction on the site at the time of booking. The company assured me that the entire reservation was canceled and provided a cancellation email. After realizing no refund was received I dispute my credit card which United fought back stating it as a valid charge. I called to speak to United in May. I found out that they only canceled 1 person off and currently 3 people are still active on their end. After understanding the error that occurred the agent said to go on their dispute site and submit refund and documents, which were submitted on 5/27, Jun 3, and Jul 17 with no answer. Today I spoke with the agent to understand the issue, only to find out that they are refusing the refund. I spoke with the refund department and she said “sorry, unfortunately there is nothing that can be done for this reservation. I asked her, how did my daughter disappear off the reservation? And if her cancellation was valid why did United never refunded the charge for her and kept the full amount and applied to the remaining 3 tickets? I told her the entire reservation was canceled and for some reason 1 person got canceled so please issue a refund as this is large amount and in today's economy every dollar is important. The initial reservation was for 4 people in excess of $4000+.

commentHeader: worst airline I have ever flown
reviewContent: This is the worst airline I have ever flown. I usually travel via spirit due to it being inexpensive and like to save money to have a little better of stay where ever I am going. Unfortunately to fly to Grand Rapids you can not fly spirit so we chose united thinking well it cannot be worse (we were wrong). I don't expect luxury when I fly I expect to make it to my destination and if it is weather delayed that is okay but when 3 planes aren't working that's a huge issue. My girlfriend and I were stuck in Denver forever away from home (Indiana) for almost 9 hours and we knew we would be there for at least an hour cause Denver was a connecting flight so i couldn't imagine what getting there early would have been. Our flight was after 7 hours cancelled and we were there another 2 hours trying to get things figured out. By the time we made it to our hotel it was 5am our home time. We were told by someone at the Denver airport he has been there "30 years" we could get a flight two days later from our original flight date. So we had to get a rental to get to our destination and has been the most insane time trying to get our rental reimbursed. Everyone on customer support speaks minimal English and can't help us well. The airport workers are no help they all just pass out cards with a QR card and I had to use a phone to translate information to a Chinese speaker. This is unacceptable from an airline who claims to be one of the better airlines.

Very pleasant flight on this A320 with large overhead bins with plenty of storage space. There was ample leg room in Economy Plus. Departure was on time. The flight overall was smooth except for bumpy patches which the pilot advised the passengers of before takeoff. ICE and messaging worked fine with no buffering watching a movie. Flight crew was very friendly and provided the usual service that all domestic airlines do (beverages and snacks) with food available for purchase.

commentHeader: Never flying this airline ever again
reviewContent: The staff is great don’t get me wrong, but if any of you ever decide to fly United just add an hour and a half to whatever they tell you the arrival time, is because inevitably always happens. Never flying with this airline ever again, could be compared to Southwest at this point, maybe worse

This review concerns UA 918 from IAD on 11 July 2024 to LHR. The aircraft departed IAD with a closed lavatory near seat 9A in the fully occupied Polaris section of the cabin. This left one lavatory available near seat 9B and one near the cockpit. By mid-flight several passengers lined up to use the lavatory near 9B resulting in a very crowded situation. I decided to try to use the lavatory near the cockpit. As I approached the latter, I was stopped by a flight attendant and informed that it was unavailable because a pilot was about to use it. The FA told me to use the other lavatory in business. I explained that it was very crowded there and asked politely if I could wait in the aisle until the lavatory near the cockpit became available. At that point the FA became very hostile and angry and ordered me to leave that area of the cabin. I was stunned and appalled by his behavior. I am well aware of the security measures that have been in place since 9/11. The FA had only to tell me in a civil manner that I couldn’t wait in the aisle, and I would have complied without a problem. But his treatment of me was completely out of line. I understand that flight attendants are under a great deal of pressure and stress. Yet what I was subjected to was completely unacceptable. As a very loyal 1K customer of United, I am more than a little disappointed.

United Airlines is a dependable and reliable airline that meets expectations and stands out with its competitive pricing. The airline's commitment to on-time performance and minimizing delays and cancellations. With a strong fleet and a focus on customer service, United Airlines has established itself as a trusted and reliable choice, making it difficult to find any hesitation in its overall performance.

Unfortunately, even after paying for the seats online and selecting them well in advance, they switched the seats without any prior notice and gave 1 seat far away from the other 2 seats while traveling with a baby. When requested it to be fixed at the main counter, they referred us to get that done at the gate. When went to the gate and requested, the lady there was so obnoxious that ruined the whole experience. She just kept talking rudely stating “you had to get that done at the main desk”, “ you guys buy these non-refundable tickets and expect changes”, “why did you not call United in advance”, “rolled her eyes” etc. these all unnecessary, useless statements without giving me a chance to respond and kept talking over me. I guess they just find some these worst human beings on the planet to work of them or train them to be the worst when it comes down to the “customer services”. With this sort of attitude towards customer, the airline is doomed for failure. This was my first United flight experience and will never in my life fly or recommend United to anyone.

Worst customer service I've received from any airline. We cancelled a ticket and received residual flight credit. Several months later before we were planning to use the credit to book another trip, United's system magically deletes the credit. We've tried for months to contact someone in support but only getting redirected from department to department even after they ran a trace and verified what happened. I now know what it must have felt like to try to get something done in a soviet bureaucracy.

Terrible Customer Service. I had an extremely disappointing experience with this airline. Their customer service is terrible. They do not assist customers, provide solutions, or show any care for their passengers. Instead, they leave them stranded in airports without any help. I would never recommend this airline to anyone and will avoid flying with them in the future. Their behavior is unacceptable and they need to make serious improvements to how they treat their customers.

commentHeader: would never fly this airline again
reviewContent: I would never fly this airline again, especially if it is not a direct flight. If a flight is delayed, they will not help you figure out how to reroute your connecting flight. I was returning to DEN and then on to another city. We were told the flight was delayed 1 hour then it was delayed 5 hours. I understand airlines have to do this and was not upset by the delay. But a 5 hour delay means a lot of people are going to miss connecting flights. As people began to line up at the counter to get help, the United staff announced that they are no longer able to access anything that would help us, but that there is an "app" that we all could use to reroute our connecting flights for ourselves. This shows United is trying to skimp and not train its people to be helpful, hoping that an automatized "app" can replace a real human being. It is the definition of an inhuman company. I tried the app, logging in on over 5 times. It asked if I wanted a phone call or message, I tried the options and every time it said that wait times were long, but then would log me out of the app before I could even see my options for re-routing my flight. I selected the option to have an agent call me. Then I received a text that an agent was ready to talk and I needed to return to the app. When I returned, it asked me to sign back in. Sure enough, when I signed back in, I was booted back to the last position in queue. There was no way to submit feedback, no contact number for United. United was basically telling me it did not care that I would miss my connecting flight. I spent a couple hours on this app, actually went to lunch while waiting for a callback, but never got a callback from United. So I went back to the counter and asked the United staff, the app is not working for me, how can I see my options so that I know which later connecting flight I can book? I suppose I made a big mistake, because I also took time to be kind to the United agent and told her that I understood this was stressful for her too and thanked her for her help. She said that she did have a seat on the 3:30 flight and could book me on that flight, but that I would get into Denver about 15 minutes before the connecting flight left and might miss that connection. I accepted that, because I would have to wait for a flight out of Denver either way. So I accepted the boarding pass she gave me and walked to the other terminal to wait for the 3:30 flight. Then as the flight was boarding, I looked down at the boarding pass and saw it was marked SBY, which means standby. Of course a bunch of others had been put on Standby as well, so there was no chance of getting a seat. The United staff at the other terminal was sub-professional and never made any kind of announcement of what we should do if we had a SBY ticket. People kept wandering up to the boarding line and asking if they should board, then the United boarding staff would rush over to the counter and the person at the counter would tell them they could not board. I don't understand why they could not make a single announcement for everyone, "go back, you should not have been sent here." I went back to the original terminal and told them I had not been told I was being put on standby, and had never even asked to be put on another flight, I just wanted to see how to get another connection. I could keep going, but the message from United is don't ever use them for a non direct flight. They will not help, you are literally on your own.

Online bait and switch for $50 more. I didn't slelct a seat when I purchased the ticket. When it was time to check in on line none of the available seats were economy and all I could do was select 9a and pay more money to complete the check in. I chatted with customer service and demanded a credit. They said I could full out a form for refund review. Illegal and certainly not fair!

It was just about the shabbiest treatment I've ever gotten from an airline. Flight was scheduled for 10:25am. 4 flight delays and finally they cancelled the flight at 3pm. The staff was clueless and could not give us any information. They were just there to quell the rising aggravation. They would not even announce the delays. Some of us got the info on our phones with text message but some of us didn't because the wi-fi at the Lisbon airport is spotty so we just shared the info with each other. When they finally cancelled the flight they instructed us to go to baggage claim to collect our checked bags but did not specify a carousel. I hoofed it over there, got to baggage claim, asked where my bags might show up, was told to go to the Lost and Found area to pull a ticket, wait for my number, claim my bag lost, collect it in carousel 9. Others showed up, confused, then we were told our bags would show up at carousel 11. So now I'm watching 2 carousels for my bag. After a nail-biting 20 minutes my bag shows up at carousel 11. What they could have done is have us wait at the gate for the carousel #, in the meantime pass out meal vouchers, hotel vouchers. Instead they gave us useless cards with the scan code for a website that's akin to robot customer service making you wait on hold to tell you they can't help you. I got a text for a flight the next day at 2pm. It quickly changed to 10:25am, delayed to 10:35. The next day it was delayed again to 11:35am. But finally we got on the plane. I'll give a star to the service on the flight and what was on offer there. But just the one. Never again United. Except for the travel voucher I was sent as a mea culpa for a measly $150.

commentHeader: had to switch to a different airline
reviewContent: I put a date for this review (when I last flew United), however, due to a flight that was cancelled 5 hours before departure, I had to switch to a different airline. I was set to fly out at 6:30 am and land in Newark for a connection around 11. I got the dreaded email that the flight was cancelled and it was rescheduled. They decided to rebook me for a flight at 6:30 pm, with an ELEVEN HOUR OVERNIGHT LAYOVER. With such short notice, there was no way of getting a hotel. I had to wait on hold between two airlines for over 3 hours to get this fixed. What was supposed to be a flight with one connection to Orlando has now turned into a 2 layover flight with a different airline. I’m genuinely baffled how it’s reasonable to schedule a 1-day travel to an 11 hour overnight layover with 5 hours notice? Never flying United again.

route: San Juan to Edinburgh via Newark
reviewContent: Hands down the worst airline on earth, a 13 hour journey took 3 days, absolute joke company I have so much more to say however I am so exhausted from this journey that I just can't.

commentHeader: Worst food I have ever seen
reviewContent: Worst food I have ever seen. It was not eatable at all. Who eats boiled lentils and veggies for breakfast. I would not even serve this kind of food to my dog. It was slimy, wet, and so unappetizing. Better off bring my own food rather than eating this nonsense.

route: Naples to Cleveland via Munich / Newark
reviewContent: The flight out of Naples was cancelled so we needed to get a room in Naples. They rebooked us but when we got to airport our info on our app was not in their computer. The flight out of Munich was delayed so we missed flight to Cleveland. Had to get a room in Newark. I'm on a plane right now to Cleveland that was supposed to depart at 6:19 and it’s now 7:22 and still waiting. Maintenance issues. Maybe check for maintenance issues before you schedule a flight. Our awesome vacation in Italy is ending miserably due to united airlines. You’re a huge airline that used to be much better. Figure it out!

I go to Guatemala several times a year. If United in Houston takes off only an hour late, you will be fortunate We have been sitting on the plane for an hour after being initially delayed for an hour and forty minutes. And the captain just anounced that the paperwork would take another 20 minutes or so. United sucks- it absolutely is a miserable experience. This is the last time.

United Airlines is terrible in picking seats when you book by group. We were 3 who traveled but one of us was separated on a different row which kind of sucks. United should put people in groups together. I would not fly with you again.
This airline is a complete mess, they changed my paid seat two times at the last minute. I had window seat snd they put me in the center. Worst service ever.

commentHeader: won’t be booking United Airlines again
reviewContent: Flight attendants were very friendly but the service was let down by 3 things all at the airports.  As an international business traveller it is unusual to not receive premium check in, security and boarding. They let the families, veterans, and members of the United frequent flyer programme board before first class Star alliance gold passengers. The Polaris lounge did not let me in despite my flight originating in Auckland. It’s unusual to fly business class or higher and not be entitled to lounge access. I had to rely on my frequent flyer status for entry into the less exclusive United club lounge which was pointless as I was hoping to access showers (only in Polaris) after a 12 hour business class flight on a Star alliance partner airline. My baggage at ORD was one of the last on the conveyor despite having clear tags identifying it as Star Alliance Priority Baggage. I wasn’t alone, other first class passengers commented to say “so much for priority baggage” While the plane was dirty, the food selection disappointing and the lack of entertainment provided on the flight, and still requiring first class passengers to pay additional for access to wifi (with no entertainment alternative) is bad. The above 3 points made me decide that beyond my return leg I won’t be booking United Airlines again, especially in higher cabin classes as the benefits really aren’t there at all.

commentHeader: “force you to check carry on at gate”
reviewContent: Every time I fly United I get zone 5. The issue with this is that they force you to tag and checkin your carry on at the gate regardless of whether there is space on the plan. They are also very rude about this and don't listen to anything you say. They would not allow me carry it on the plane and leave it incase it was full. I have back to back meeting in SFO and cannot afford the delay of waiting for luggage. So as expected there was a lot available on the plane and I was forced to check in my carry on.

commentHeader: let down by the back-office functions
reviewContent: What a complicated airline this is! I just completed a trip of 5 flights within 3 weeks. I have to say that the experiences actually on board the flights, were wonderful. Some of the best flights I’ve had in 50 years of international travel; last night from SFO to SYD, especially so. I variously flew in Premium Plus, First and last night, Polaris Business. Great crews; great service, friendly, happy, with senses of humour. Even the food was very tasty! So far, so good. But the trip home from Anchorage to Sydney, was a nightmare. A tight connection in SFO, made it necessary to re-book onto the flight the following night. Counting from the time I arrived at ANC to check in for the flights to SYD, it took 25 hours just to get as far as SFO. In dealing with the phone Reservations staff, I got what I needed. I wasn’t freely offered a hotel in SFO, but when I asked nicely about it, it - along with several meal vouchers - was given. The first sector ANC/SFO was delayed 3 times, before it got cancelled entirely, with the operating crew having run out of legal duty hours. I was re-routed via Denver. The DEN/SFO flight was delayed once, and I was downgraded to Economy, having paid for First. In the Club lounge at Denver, I got myself put on a flight leaving only 30 min after the delayed flight. It still had First seats available, so I got bumped back up again. Happy days! Then my checked bag was only checked through to SFO. The lady at the desk said she’d now check it through to Sydney. Tapped away on her computer; DONE! Wonderful! But during the flight to SFO, I thought maybe I’d better Exit on arrival, and go down to the baggage carousels, just to make sure my bag wasn't there. Just as well I did, because there it was, tagged only to SFO. If I’d been trusting, I’d have arrived in Sydney, to find that my bag was still in San Francisco! So. United was both very good, and very bad. The flight crews are let down by the back-office functions. A great pity.

commentHeader: I will never fly United again
reviewContent: I have been sitting in an unconditioned airplane for over an hour, possibly over an hour and a half. I am overheating and my heart rate is over 100. It is normally in the 50s. The reason we are being held in this inhumane way is because the catering truck has not arrived. Seriously. The flight is only 46 minutes. This is unconscionable and unjustifiable in my opinion. I want to be let off this plane. I will never fly United again.

commentHeader: United needs to make this right"
reviewContent: Our family of 5 had a return flight with United Airlines from Maui to Boston scheduled for August 10, 2023. On August 8th, wildfires destroyed Lahaina and the State of Hawaii asked tourists to go home. At 12:30am on August 10th, United canceled our flight and rebooked us for a flight on August 11th. Later on August 10th, United again cancelled our rescheduled flight. Now on the 3rd day at the hotel with no power, lights or internet, the area was running out of food and looting was starting at nearby markets. Standing on the beach, using one bar of cell service from neighboring Molokai, United told me that best they can do for getting my family home is August 15th. Our options were to wait until the power came back to find other airlines, or go to the airport to find a flight knowing that once we left the hotel, there would be no hotels left on the island to stay (because we weren’t allowed back into the affected zone). At the airport, we were able to find a flight on Hawaiian Airlines for the next day. The 5 of us slept in the car that night. We spent an additional $2,457.30 in order to get home. Once home, I submitted a complaint through United’s website and waited the full 8 weeks with no response. When I followed up, they claimed they emailed me to send in receipts, but (1) I never received an email and United could not re-provide such email when requested and (2) I had already provided the receipts. As requested, I resubmitted my complaint, and again had to wait the full 8 weeks. When I followed up, they ultimately said they would only provide $100 credits per person, which I specifically said would not be sufficient. I then mailed a letter directly to the CEO. I never heard back. United Airlines put my family in danger by deserting us on Maui when people needed them the most. Alaskan, Hawaiian and Southwest should be commended for sending extra planes that week. Unfortunately, it wasn’t enough – and United was canceling their flights. All this time, I’ve never asked for anything more than my money back. The credits are an insult. United needs to make this right and compensate me in cash for what we had to spend because of their neglect.

United is very unhelpful if your flight is delayed or canceled. Our flight out of Chicago was delayed by three hours causing us to miss our international flight and causing us to lose a day of our vacation. United offered us absolutely nothing. No hotel compensation, no meal vouchers, no free drinks.

I had an exceptional flying experience from Las Vegas (LAS) to Newark (EWR) with United Airlines, thanks to the outstanding service provided by Rosa. Rosa went above and beyond to ensure my journey was smooth and stress-free. She was warm, friendly, and accommodating. The flight was comfortable and enjoyable, with a clean and well-maintained aircraft, a great selection of in-flight entertainment, and complimentary snacks and drinks. Rosa is a credit to United Airlines, and I can't recommend her enough! If you're lucky enough to have Rosa  on your flight, you're in great hands!

commentHeader: experience the worst I’ve ever had
reviewContent: My experience with United Airlines was the worst I’ve ever had. First, they canceled my flight on June 3rd without offering any reimbursement. I had to pay for a hotel and rent a car out of my own pocket. Then, they made me pay for another flight because I was stranded in Houston, needing to travel from Houston to Roatan and then back to Orlando. I ended up spending a total of $7,000 on the entire trip. United is one of the worst airlines I've ever used. They even changed my family’s seats, placing my 3-year-old daughter by herself. A child that young can't sit alone! To top it off, they misplaced my wife's suitcase, which we didn’t get until the next day. What made it even more disappointing was that they could have canceled the flight while we were still in Orlando, but instead, they waited until we were in Houston, leaving us with no choice but to pay for the additional costs since we were stuck.

Our family got the worst experience with United Airlines. We were traveling from Denver to Los Angeles, 6/15-6/19. My husband and I both have United credit cards. We were using our mileage for the tickets. My son (3 year old), my daughter (6 month old), and I were on the same reservation, round trip from DEN to LAX. My husband was on the different one. The departure date from Denver went smoothly, we had no issues or problems. We checked in and flew out. All happy! Then on June 18th, I was checking in our flight and found out that the reservation only showed me and my daughter as passengers. I couldn't pull up info for my son (3 year old boy) and my husband reservation was no where to be found. I called the United's help desk to figure out what happened. On the phone with them for at least 1 hour and got transferred twice, the agent told me that United's Denver canceled their reservations without any communication. He told me that United said there was no show that my husand and our son did not take the plane. WE ALL TOOK THE FLIGHT. I kept telling them that over and over again. They seemed to not get it. They were basically blaming us. How the heck did we know if there was no communication, NOTHING. There were back and forth and the agent told me that he could reissue the ticket for my husband but not our son because they need to see him physically. Told me that don't worry, people at the check in counter can reissue the ticket for my son when they pulled up the reservation with all the notes that he made. Just need to go to the airport tomorrow and everything will be fine. We went to airport 3 hours before our departure time. Waited in line at checked in counter. And, was told that SHE CAN'T HELP US. We had to call the mileage plus to sort it out. Called the mileage plus and had to explain to them again that IT'S UNITED AIRLINES FAULT NOT OURS, but they kept repeating that my son did not take the flight. HE DID. HE WAS WITH US THE WHOLE TIME. There was no announcement, no communication, nothing to let's us be aware of the situation. United has our phone numbers, our email addresses. NOTHING FROM THEM. It took again more than an hour on the phone to get ticket for my son. We were able to make the flight because the gate was next to the security check-in. For the whole experience, United was blaming us and kept saying that my son was A NO SHOW. There was NO APOLOGY, NO SYMPATHY for our situation coming from them. I do blame myself to book our flights with United. Can't wait to cancel our credit cards and never have to flight with them again. If you fly with United, do check your reservation often. You won't know when they decide to cancel your reservation and not letting you know. I called the United to complain and they seem to not care if they are losing us as customers. If you can, stay away from United Airlines. If you can't, goodluck!

Worst airline I have ever flown with! Staff rude and unprofessional. My food was disgusting, couldn’t even eat the bread roll. Seats didn’t recline more than about an inch! Would never fly with them again even if the ticket was free. Avoid at all cost!

commentHeader: not going to proceed with my refund
reviewContent: Awful airline, I call to cancel my flight and ask if I was going to get a refund, after sending my credential the customer service representative assure me I was going to get my money back on my card. Nothing happened, When I follow up with customer service they told me they were not going to proceed with my refund. Such unprofessionalism is unheard off.

Absolutely amazing staff, they were all very polite and professional. On my way back from Denver the captain let me see the cockpit and even sit in the captain's seat (after we landed). United is and has always been my favorite airline.

The staff was really rude and dismissive to any concerns or questions during the flight, at the moment of recovering my ticket I was not provided with a gate number, these were all pretty minor inconveniences except for the fact that my flight got delayed so much. To the point I was supposed to get home at 7 and ended up getting home past 11 pm, terrible service, horrible plane maintenance.

Terrible experience with United Airlines! Please choose a different airline other than United Airlines! They will cancel your flight and not help with anything causing you to spend a lot of money and creating a ton stress and issues. Please don’t ever fly with United Airlines again!

route: San Diego to Jacksonvillle via Houston
reviewContent: Flight out of San Diego was delayed causing my family and I to miss our connecting flight in Houston. While on the flight I was able to book a new flight out of Houston leaving the following morning, giving us a 12hr overnight layover in Houston. My immediate concerns were our luggage, which we would need because were staying overnight, lodging accommodations, and if United would help us with that. I used their app and talked to an agent online who said to talk with an employee at the airport after landing to coordinate lodging. I'll summarize the rest to the best of my ability, every employee I talked to was rude, disrespectful, and either refused or was reluctant to help, and always just handed out cards with a QR code. United didn't help with accommodations because the delay wasn't aircraft mechanical related and wasn't there fault so I paid out of pocket and had to use another day of PTO for work. Also they couldn't find our bags and those showed up at our house after a couple days. By far this was the worst customer service experience I have ever had and will avoid United unless there are literally no other options, I will pay more money happily.

I have been contacted yesterday with fly cancellation and immediate rescheduled at the same time, I woke up. At 3am to get my 5am flight and they canceled again and put me on a crazy flight which would arrive to late to meet my business appointment. So sad because in 1 years I got cancellation on my way back to a Europe and now will lose a business meeting that I scheduled from Europe. I don’t think I will fly anymore with this unreliable company.

United fails and misleads its customers every time it can. Here are some examples. -Flights are systematically late. United fails to communicate information when this happens and posts impossible times for a new departure. -The lounges are terrible. If you've ever been in a lounge from e.g. Lufthansa, Swiss or AirFrance, Emirates, it will become clear that United is putting no effort in its lounges and the comfort of its customers. -Benefits are not delivered. Benefits promised to travellers with high status are regularly not delivered. -The customer service is terrible. When not communicating with a chatbot, the person respond will be slow, unhelpful and unable to provide any substantial information. -The aircraft itself often has defects.
