Before my latest flight, water leaked in the whole back of the plane. Going into the all the consequences would be too lengthy to describe here. -They make you pay for wifi when don't have to. E.g. Delta doesn't.

These people are terrible. The flight was supposed to start boarding at 10:15am, we ended up boarding at 11:20 and now we’re two hours behind. Then a lady at the gate got mad at me because I told my sister in front of me to hurry up and scan her ticket. The lady then began to rip my ticket up.

I am writing about the terrible experience I have been having with the United Airlines customer support team.  I recently booked our honeymoon trip through a travel agency. This trip has a total of 5 flights, 3 with United Airlines and 2 with Swiss Air. When going to Swiss Air's website I was able to upgrade my two flights from economy to premium economy on one and business class on the other. When going to United's website I could only upgrade 2 out of 3. Upon calling your tech support now over 6+ times and also getting my service request escalated, I have received 6 different reasons and solutions. All their reasoning made no sense and their solutions did not work. They even suggested I contact my travel agent and upgrade the class of seat for each flight. But that is insane since I already paid to upgrade 4 of the flights directly and I would essentially be charged double. When I was told I could upgrade the final flight it was with United airline miles, but not cash ? This is where I draw the line. I would have to purchase 40,000 United miles plus $1000 in cash (which I find humorous that they can take cash in this sense but not the other) all to be on a seat waitlist. But I have confirmed with customer support that the premium economy section has plenty of open seating right now and that was the section I wanted to upgrade to. It seems like United Airline’s wants cash customers to pay to upgrade but in my situation I cannot? The other issue is if I purchase United airline miles + cash, all I can get now is put on a waitlist even though there is abundant open seating ? Would you spend your money on miles and hope all the good seats are not purchased by the time they release these seats? I wouldn't! Because if the seats are sold out by that time then I would be screwed twice. If United does not appreciate customers who book their airline through a travel agent, and worse place restrictions on purchasing upgrades directly on United to the customers that do use a travel agent, then may I suggest you remove United Airlines from allowing travel agents to book your flights ! After my July/august booked flights I will never fly United Airlines !
Cramped seats, poor beverage/snack options, expensive bag fees. Employees are helpful, but United is not properly managed. Choose a different airline.

I was rebooked on this flight to SFO because I had missed my connecting flight on SQ in Singapore. I flew CI to TPE to catch this flight. United Polaris class is the flagship product of UA. Seats are full flat seats with blanket and duvet from Saks Fifth Avenue. Unlike SQ where the cabin crew comes around to set up your bed, you have to do this yourself on UA. The amenity kit provided is a fabric waist pouch that contains the usual items. Some may like it, some may not. Personally I would prefer a proper zippered toiletries pouch which can be reused for personal toiletries and medications. Lunch service was served on a single tray. I had the beef short ribs and it was surprisingly good considering that steaks served on flights are touch and go. Before landing crepes was served for breakfast. Wifi was available for a fee. The service was efficient - not overly rushed and not overly pampering. There was a mixture of American and Taiwanese crew on board. In summary, despite what has been said about UA in the media and on social media, it was a pleasant experience.

I have never experienced so many delays with any airline ever. Flight delayed on the way out and flight delayed on the way back. This is highly unacceptable as they have a whole wing of the airport and they can’t move to a different gate. Disgusting, disgraceful and disappointing. Now I won’t be home in my own bed until 4am.

We arrived to the airport at LAX with plenty of time as it is typically very busy there. We expected to fly out on time and get to our destination by 5:30 P.M. local time in Hawaii. That however, did not happen. We got delayed for 6 hours with no explanation other than there was a problem with our plane and we needed to wait for a new one to come in. That also, did not happen! We were told to board our plane at 6:15 P.M. and then told to get back off the plane as there was some issues. We then got delayed some more. They offered a $15.00 coupon to use, but we all know that does not get you anything in an airport. We finally boarded our flight at 7:45 P.M. and left into the air at 8:30 P.M. We should have already been sitting on a beach or checking into our room, but that did not go as planned. We landed in Hawaii at 12:30 A.M. local time. United offered nothing in return. I have called now 3 times and was referred to a website to submit a claim that takes 14 days to process. The air in the flight did not work! The WIFI on the flight did not work! The seats were packed full and it was SO hot! One of the most uncomfortable flights I have taken to date. I will avoid using United anytime I can as this seems to always be the issue. Multiple delays and no explanation to the customer. The rep at the counter was rude to any one who had a question. We had waited ALL day in an airport and were obviously frustrated and instead of helping she basically had no care for the amount of time United had wasted of our trip. When you pay as much money as I did I expect to be able to use my hotel room for the full amount of time that it was booked. I technically did not even need a room for the day of flying there as we did not get there until after midnight. I really hope that in the next 14 days United will step up and return at least the money I spent on the flight there as my husband and I both took off work to just sit in airport instead of being on our vacation.

I experienced the worst flight on United airlines this week. I avoid budget or discount airlines but after flying United, I think they may be a superior experience. The flight from Baltimore to Denver is 4 hours. We checked in for both flights exactly 24 hours in advance. Both times we were seated in the last row of the plane. The seats are more upright than any other seat. The lines for the bathroom were continuous. All six rows ahead of us had young children or lap babies, which on a long flight led to lots of crying, as one would expect. We were aware that booking economy meant no carry on luggage, only a personal item. But being in the last row of the plane, the outer wall curves inward and did not even allow for a small piece of luggage. They announced that they had limited food for purchase and it we wanted something we should let the flight attendant know. I did so (as the galley was right behind us). She said we would have to wait. As we were last served, there was no food left. We were traveling with my 86 year old mother. She could not get a boarding pass online, she had to check in at the gate for some reason. She got the last row of the plane on the outgoing flight also. On the return, even the ticket agent could not get her a seat and we had to wait in line at the gate to get her a seat. We are members of their frequent flier program, though they do not fly many nonstop routes from Baltimore, we do not fly with them often.After this trip, it will be my last choice of airlines.

This was the worst flying experience I have ever had! I booked business class directly through United airlines because I have a medical condition that requires I sit as close to the front of the plane as possible. My ticket one way was $3888. When I arrived at the airport, it seemed like there was some confusion they thought I was supposed to be there at 7am but I had my itinerary and it said 10:35am, the agent said everything was fine and said they couldn’t print my ticket until my next leg. When I got to the international airport they printed my ticket - I again was assured I was in business class, she even put a sticker on my boarding pass saying express lane. It was a 30 min walk through the airport, during the walk I realized I was in row 35 - which is clearly not business class ! The agents at the desk were extremely rude - I ended up in the last seat with 3 toilets behind me and the seat did not recline. To add insult to injury to girl next to me said her ticket was $800, United refuses to refund my money or even let me speak anyone in their customer care department- and they had the nerve to give me 12500 points which is equivalent to $130 dollars.

route: Halifax to New York JFK via Toronto
reviewContent: Booked my roundtrip flight, got my confirmation number, receipt and itinerary and called them a few days later because I noticed my first and middle name showed as one name on the reservation. They told me that just how their system displays the name. Got my credit card statement about a month and a half later, no charge from UA. Called them again. They say I don't have a ticket. At this point, I'm supposed to be travelling in 2 weeks and at no point was there an indicator that I did not have a ticket. I had the reservation number plugged into the UA app on my phone and all of my reservation info was there with a countdown for departure. If I didn't check my credit card statement, I would have never known that I didn't have a ticket and would have showed up to the airport with no ticket/boarding pass. Customer service rep tries to help me book a new ticket but only books me a one way, when I had a roundtrip reservation and I ended up paying more for the new flight than I was going to for the original; Original was about $650 and I ended up paying around $820 for the new reservation. And the reason they gave me for the error with ticketing was that it didn't take my credit card because the charge was in US dollars and I had to explain to their rep that I was shown the price in USD and was paying with my USD amex and the website told me that the transaction was successful. I only accepted the re-booking because of where I lived there wasn't another option for a flight to JFK on the same day around that time. The other flights were much too early and I had to go to work earlier that day. Filed a complaint and was told that someone would get back to me within 30 days which they did NOT. And when I was rebooked, my confirmation number was not changed so I had ZERO confidence that I had a ticket because I had already been sent all of this exact information previously! Called them back a few times to confirm that I had a ticket of course because the airport is one of the few places where showing up when you're not supposed to be there is a problem! All they've offered me to date is a $50 voucher toward an "eligible flight" with them when I had to spend over $100 of the cost of the initial flight to make up for their mistake. I will also say getting to their customer service team was also a pain and I felt like they were purposefully misunderstanding me when I wanted to file a complaint. They kept telling me that if it had gone through, I would have gotten a receipt and itinerary which I did get. I kept trying to explain that even if there was an issue with the ticketing system, because, as they say, I do NOT have a ticket, my confirmation number should not be valid and working on their website and their App. My major complaint was that at no point did anything in their system that is accessible to me indicate that I did not have a ticket for my flights. They kept giving me long winded customer service apologies, interrupting me as I explained my issue. And I was even more frustrated because I had already called them and spoken to them about this booking and they didn't tell me "by the way, you don't have a ticket". What made it finally make sense to someone was me explaining that I would have gone to the airport and would have ended up making a fuss for a boarding pass for a flight that I had a receipt and itinerary for, but I hadn't been paid for because I wasn't charged and would therefore have no right to a ticket.

Flight delayed multiple times, until over 2 hours. We missed our connecting flight, despite it was also on United. They told they would get us a hotel room, but they made for the departing city. Then after another hour in line, they then stated too close to boarding and we would have to address when we get to destination. When we finally get on the plane, the steward seems more interested in talking to other steward than helping us. From now on, even if i have to pay more, I won't fly United again.

When I tried to check in online, I received a message that it was not possible to do so and to see an agent at the airport. At the Cancun airport large signs tell you to use the check-in kiosks, so I did what I was told, even though I knew I had to see an agent and that check-in at the kiosks would not work either. When I tried to reach the counter, I was stopped by a United employee (the "INTERVIEWER" as it said on the back of his T-shirt) who asked me what was wrong. I told him my story, but he obviously thought I was too stupid to use the machine. Then he tried to check me in at the machine and was told it was not possible. His immediate response was: "Your ESTA was cancelled!" He scared me and put me in a lot of distress and did not listen to me when I told him that my ESTA had worked on my inbound flight. He was clearly on a major power trip. After what felt like 15 minutes he finally let me go to the counter where my boarding passes came out of the printer as soon as the lady working there had entered my details. The flight from Cancun to Newark was okay, they gave us a soft drink and a snack and the flight attendants were friendly. The international flight to Frankfurt however was a completely different story. I have never experienced a more disorganized and poor inflight service. After 2 hours in the air, food service started, which was of an incredibly bad quality. The drinks cart started after the meal service, which in my case (seat 59B) meant that I was served the first drop of liquid 2:45 hours after taker off. After a rushed transfer through Newark I was thirsty and exhausted, but the two flight attendants I talked to refused to give me anything to drink since they were "doing meals". During the entire 7-hour flight the drinks cart came around exactly once. In the morning they started the service too late, so that the drinks cart did not reach the rear section of the cabin. Why did the crew start distributing meals before serving drinks? The two ladies serving my section clearly hated their jobs and they hated their customers. One of them literally threw the sandwich in my direction. The ticket was cheap, but I'd rather pay more in order to avoid that joke of an airline.

route: Las Vega to San Antonio via Houston
reviewContent: I unfortunately missed my initial flight yesterday with another airline due to not being able to check in my bags, and after rebooking with United for a 6am flight it was missed again. I called the customer service line and I was patched through to a supervisor who helped me tremendously to find a flight leaving on the same day with an economical payout that would not hurt my wallet or have to spend a day and a half at the airport. They are amazing and it is the last time I decide to fly out with an alternate airline. I’m sticking to United for most if not all flights.

One of the worst airlines, old aircraft. Boarding experience is third class at Houston airport.  Who gives 110V power socket on the seats. USB C and USB are standard these days even in smaller aircrafts. Food is nothing to write back home. Service sucks, help by hostesses is offered as obligation. Ticket booking staff is horrible. Yet to see anything positive about these guys and Houston airport.

commentHeader: United Airlines support gets a zero
reviewContent: United Airlines support gets a zero. 5 airports, 6 Uber rides, 3 airlines, 2 lost bags, 11 support calls. On a recent flight from Columbus CMH to Cozumel CZM, we landed in Houston IAH to make our connection. Lightning prevented landings and departures for several hours, and our connection was one of the flights that got cancelled. United didn’t give us any help getting a flight rebooked – the line at the gate wrapped around the corner and phone support put us on hold indefinitely. We finally found out all United flights were full for the next 2 days, so we booked through Delta. We tried to retrieve our carry-on bags that got checked in CMH, but the baggage claim area was in chaos – no signs, no announcements, multiple lines, people shouting. We waited 3 hours to speak to a representative, who told us to return in 2-3 hours to claim our bags. When we returned, the 300+ people wanting their bags had become an angry mob. At 11pm (15 hours after we’d arrived), they closed the baggage area without anyone getting their bags. We never once saw any security in this area, even though people were coming very close to getting into fights. It was extremely unsafe. We arrived at our destination 30 hours later than planned, with no clothes or medications. We placed more than 10 calls to support during our stay and received different instructions every single time. United finally delivered our bags to our hotel - 12 hours before we checked out to return home.

Horrible experience with this flight UA1738! The flight attendant kept bumping into me while I was sitting in the aisle seat and not just that, she was denying my fiancé water. This is terrible service and unacceptable.

route: Newark, NJ to Fort Lauderdale, FL
reviewContent: My flight to Rome in June 2023 was cancelled and I received a credit of about $3200. I had to use the credit by June 7, 2024. I booked a flight for 2 people from Newark, NJ to Florida and their website it would cost about $800 per person. I went back to use the rest of the credit and find out they used $2848 of my credit and the rest is no where to be found! I cannot justify and would never agree to spending $1400 for a ticket to Florida - I wouldn't gone back to Rome! Customer service told me that could not see any info on their end and I had to file a complaint and wait 15-30 for the 'back office'. By that time my credit will be expired. I feel robbed and this is absolute trickery.

Absolutely Horrible Customer Service at LAX Departure checkin. Rude Staff. They don’t greet customers with a smile on their faces. If asked for help they pretend to ignore you. LAX United ground staff is horrible to deal with.

This airline is constantly getting worse!! I have taken 8 flights since 1st of the year and I Don't think a single 1 has been on time! Half the time the crew is late the other half is problems with the plane. So here I am today sitting on the runway in Chicago with plane trouble. It is really getting aggravating. But they will never give you a rebate. And if you don't live in the sky don't waste your time getting a united card. You need to make 2 trips a month or you lose your perks like free seat upgrade.

After arriving at the airport my and my husband's flight from Zurich to Newark, NJ was delayed for 2 hours and 50 minutes (the airlines out of Europe must reimburse you if they are delayed for 3 or more hours, hence 2 hours 50 minutes). We were supposed to leave at 10:10 and were delayed until 1:00. We got a text that the plane was boarding so we went and stood on line for almost 1 1/2 hours until they finally told us that our flight was cancelled. Long story short, we were not able to book another flight for 2 days and we were told that United would reimburse us for meals, lodging and taxis to and from the airport. They told us to keep our receipts and submit them for reimbursement. After spending over 9 hours in the airport we finally left (without our luggage because it couldn't be retrieved until hours later and we had to go back and get it/search for it ourselves). We kept all of our receipts and submitted them to United only to be told "United's auditors have reviewed them and will approve $580 USD for your expenses. For additional expenses to be considered, please provide receipts that show the items purchased, not just a total of the items purchased." No one told us at the Zurich airport when my flight was cancelled to keep Itemized receipts!! Instead of being reimbursed $1319.88 USD, we are getting less than half for our inconvenience. Absolutely insulting!! Shame on you United!!

commentHeader: One of the best flight attendants
reviewContent: My work team and I took a trip to New Orleans earlier this week and we had an incredible experience on our flight from Medford to Denver, made possible by a wonderful flight attendant, Anthony. He was very fun and energetic, which got us even more excited for our trip. This gentleman offered jokes and sarcasm, which we enjoyed, but was incredibly accommodating. One of the best flight attendants we've encountered!

Flew from Sao Paolo to Houston at 9.50 pm on April 28th. Worst airline experience for business class. The 2 flight attendants were unfriendly, did not smile or greet or made me feel welcome. Food was unpalatable, stale and tasteless.  I am very disappointed and will think twice about travelling United again. The only redeeming factor was that they were punctual

Morning flight on United from EWR to PHX. Flight was ok'ish. Crew were there to do their job. Nothing much to write home about except that flight was on-time. Ticket was on expensive side. Flight wasn't that full so I had the whole row to myself.

route: Montreal to Myrtle Beach via Newark
commentHeader: must check in your carry on
reviewContent: I have been using airway as almost only way for travel for business and scientific trips for almost 27 years and my experience today was the only experience that I felt an unbelievable intimidated behaviour from any flight related staff. In general, my trips goes nearly 100% smoothly. In my plan , usually flight time is an ideal time to work on the presentation or lecture I am going to present in destination. I hardly remember I have faced very few difficulties in the past 30 years but those were mostly due to a brief chaos in organizing the flight but never ever intimidation or bullying. Today I had an experience that was shocking. During the boarding at 10:30 am April 28 in gate 80 of YUL Montréal airport when it reached to my turn, a boarding agent slightly rudely told me “ you must check in your carry on (this has happened at past for small airplane and even large airplane will full capacity, was fully understandable). I told the guy with smile ”oh no please can I just put under my seat? .look It is perfectly fit “ while I was waiting a kind of friendly explanation. I noted he in very firm and serious attitude and rudely told me “no you must check in“ I said still with smile begging “it is not fair I need to work on my lecture please. Then he turn totally different attitude and told me “either you check in or I will put you out of flight”. I was completely shocked. I told seriously , how come ? Ok well if I have no choice put the tag but there is no need for demonstration of power and I took the bag to board . while I was entering he said “actually I will not allow you to board. I was honestly scared I said ok sorry and continued. He said stop even if you get in we will take you out. Put the bag in check in place and took the seat. Later when a female staff of boarding team came on board “I told her with smile see ma’am there are many empty places in overhead “ ironically the portion on my over head was empty. To my surprise I realized she had came after me she said : you shouldn’t have talked to him like that and I am going to ask you get off the plane. I said “ I am sorry I did not mean to be rude to him “ she said no you need to get off. I said you can tell him to come I personally apologize but she said he can not come and she took a photo of my seat number and left.  I can understand if a person pose aggressive behaviour, or threaten others to be treated this way but a harmless passenger that indicates a different story about the culture in your company about treating a customer. Interestingly, they lost a security belt on my bag but I did not care as my trip was ruined.

route: Fort Lauderdale to Las Vegas via New York
reviewContent: New Years Eve 2023/2024 our flight last minute choice and decision to get married in Las Vegas instead of going to Bahamas Atlantis for the New Years Eve on December 31st, 2023 at 5AM ET my future husband decided to change the plans and get a last minute flight which really took us 8 hours from Miami to Las Vegas. Since our destination changed and we had to make it to Las Vegas before Midnight! With all previous flights with different airlines the delays constantly we weren't sure and very nervous if our plan will work out. We had 50 different flights during the year with all different airlines and mostly international and Business Class. So far United even so we flew economy (partially with upgraded seats on the way back to Miami) was so far the best experience, no issues, no delays, inoperable lavatory, engine failure, aircraft removed from service, no oil leak, aircraft to hot and more during our past flights with other airlines. But United Airplane was very clean on time spacious very comfortable seats. The Staff very professional and neat. Our Flight Attendants, David and James, were very professional and friendly. They had a small talk with us while serving drinks and heard from my husband bragging that we are getting married this very same day in Las Vegas. We got congratulated and received a bottle of sparkling wine as a gift from and in the name of United Airlines. Our best Experience and we loved the special Attention and wanted to say again. Thank you for the special treatment it was very special for us and very kind from David and James and United Airlines very special gesture.

route: Chicago to Punta Cana via Houston
reviewContent: The airline double sold my seats and arbitrarily put us on a flight the next day. This action removed 25% of my birthday vacation. Instead of flying direct, he switched me to a layover flight, 2 hours further west of my destination. He put my wife and I on opposite ends of the plane. This 1 action set me back over 650$USD. They then screwed up the plane in Houston, causing an extra cpl hour delay. I cannot express my dissatisfaction enough. Do not ever fly with UA, or let anyone you love fly with United Airlines. They are going to swindle you, and then send you halfway across the country because the English guy at guest services "didn't get a break yet". I have filed complaints with the better business bureau and will never be flying UA again. I learned the hard way why you cannot fly with just any old airline. I strongly fly encourage you to shop around if deciding whether to fly with united.

commentHeader: degenerate both in quality and service
reviewContent: United continues to degenerate both in quality and service. There seems to be aircraft mechanical problems every TIME i fly and they cannot seem to fix them. They continuously do multiple delays and cancel, or my personal favorite the pilot takes the plane out 5 hours late and then times out on the runway because they are “overtime “ and in violation of FAA regulations. You haven’t even been in the air and could have been sleeping for hours but you are “overtime “. I will make every effort to avoid United from now on as this is the 5th time in a row it’s happened I will also cancel my Explorer card.

I am a senior citizen and not tech savvy. I also don't fly much. I was gifted a ticket. Once seated I learned I needed to download the United app to purchase food & drink. I downloaded but was unable to provide my frequent flyer # so I couldn't complete the registration before being told to turn off my phone. When the steward came by I asked for a cocktail & showed my credit card. When the steward declined, I told her I had cash. With a smirk she stated United is "cashless" and I would be unable to purchase anything. One would think someone who is employed in a customer service capacity would understand "good will and ill will" and comp 1 drink and 1 food item for a customer who had cash and credit to pay but could not complete United's ridiculous requirement to register an app. I have never liked United as I have always found United to be arrogant. Proven once again.

Our routine flight happened again, this time in Premium Economy. Ground service at EWR is left to be desired, with limited support from United ground staff. The new United Club was nice, though. It was uneventful on board. Staff were pleasant, and the food was fine. Baggage claim at LAX was a complete chaos.

commentHeader: Ground service at LAX was nice
reviewContent: Ground service at LAX was nice. We got help and support from United staff for special request, something we took for granted with Asian airlines, but not with United at EWR. I liked the Polaris seat, as always. Meals seemed not to be different from what we got in Premium Economy, and the menu offered the same dishes that we had on the route in the past few years. How long would it take United to update their meal offerings? BTW, United offered the most attractive (knock on wood) prices for premium cabin on the route. That was a huge plus.

I flew United after a long time from LAX to Chicago O'Hare and both flights were delayed - 5hrs and 3hrs respectively. Dismissive explanations as to why this happens and no compensation makes it extra frustrating.

commentHeader: fly other airlines in the future
reviewContent: So as I boarded I ask for help putting my carry on above my seat and was told by the stewardess, to have a man help me. Not to mention, I’m handicapped and on disability. Then my WiFi wouldn’t connect, I ask three employees and couldn’t get any assistance. What it was, was I had to pay. I was never prompted to pay. I was able to text, so I had a friend search the Internet and she found out for me. This is the second time I’ve flew I United and I will never again. Hire people that want to help. Not like United wants to help their clientele. I’ll fly other airlines in the future!

United Airlines epitomizes everything wrong with modern air travel, and I wouldn't wish their services on my worst enemy. My recent ordeal with them was a masterclass in incompetence, indifference, and outright disregard for customer well-being. The saga began with a flight delay caused by a hole in their aircraft's roof, a charming surprise that made me miss a critical corporate training session. United's solution? None. Instead, I had to fork out for an American Airlines ticket to salvage my plans, an expense and inconvenience I should never have faced. On the return leg, United managed to outdo themselves with yet another delay, showcasing their consistent commitment to inefficiency. Their gate agents, a delightful bunch of unhelpful individuals, refused to let me purchase a ticket from another passenger for an earlier flight, despite available seats mocking me from afar.  The hotel United tossed me into during a layover was straight out of a horror movie. Ratty, dingy, and surrounded by characters that would make even the bravest soul uneasy, it was a testament to United's impeccable taste in hospitality. Now, let's delve into the circus of trying to get a refund. Starting with their one sided refund request form that allows for three whole sentences of why you deserve a refund with no room to have a discussion with anyone. Weeks of back-and-forth, endless bureaucratic hurdles, and what did I get in return? A laughable sum that barely scratched the surface of the inconvenience and frustration their circus of an airline caused. In conclusion, if you enjoy being treated like a disposable inconvenience, book with United Airlines. If not, do yourself a favor and choose an airline that values passengers as more than just cattle to be herded and disregarded.

route: Fort Lauderdale to Quebec City via Newark
reviewContent: My flight from Ft. Lauderdale to Newark, was scheduled to leave at 5:05pm. We boarded late(which happens) and sat on the runway for 3 hours in the plane with NO AC and no water, nothing. It was very hot and unbelievably inhumane. At one point the pilot even turned off all engines… After this sauna, we were taken back to the terminal as we were told that the pilot couldn’t fly as his time had expired or something like that. I missed my connection to Quebec city from Newark. I asked for my money back and was told I couldn’t. Then, I asked the woman at the counter if I could take the flight the next day, to which she tells me that this mess will start all over again if I do that, I should simply take the flight which at that point was supposed to leave at 9:30pm. Is this something you do every day? Are you putting people on a plane every day and let them sit in the heat for 3 hours on the runway? Anyway, I decided to take the 9:30pm flight. The flight didn’t take off until after 11pm. My connection was the next morning at 9am. I was traveling with my 13 year old daughter, we were flying to take care of my mother as she had to have emergency heart surgery. We had to stay up all night waiting for our next flight, we were exhausted. We get on the plane the next morning, started to go down towards the airport, we could see the ground, then we go back up above the clouds, because they said visibility was bad, we then flew to Vermont to get gas… People don’t believe me when I tell them the story… because it is that unbelievable! It took us 20 hours to reach our destination which on a direct flight would take 3.5 hours. I am speechless as to my experience.

Absolutely wonderful experience! Flight to Denver was smooth and easy. The crew accommodated the extra large portable oxygen concentrator I needed. On the way from Denver to Missoula the plane had mechanical issues so it took longer to get another plane. I was worried I would run out of oxygen, but Pilot Pete helped me out and all was good!

They hire staff to attend to you who get angry if they are asked any questions, they route you to the wrong location when you are trying to get your baggage that should have been on the flight to your destination, they will lose your luggage then not even attempt to locate it or reimburse you. Theyre literally worse than Spirit.

We travel pretty extensively. United is pretty consistently the worst airlines for so many reasons. I think their rude flight attendants are my biggest complaint. They scattered our family with your children throughout the plane. When we requested to move our seats they told us they were full. The flight attendant yelled at someone who tapped her to ask her something during The flight. I am kind of unsure how this airline is even in business with their truly awful customer service model . We have flown "discount " airlines with 1000 times better service. It's kind of sad that they treat customers so poorly.

route: San Francisco to Kelowna via Vancouver
reviewContent: If I could give United less than a 0 I would! Our flights were canceled multiple times due to runway closures and construction in San Francisco. We spent 25 hours in an airport because of your poor planning. Why would you book people on flights that you cannot guarantee! And when we asked for help your representatives had no clue what they were doing! From telling us you booked us on another flight that you didn't! To telling us that our bags would be going to our final destination, which they didn't! It was by pure luck that we stopped at the carousel and surprise surprise our bags were there. To the rude representative at the boarding counter. You guys are an absolute embarrassment! I am telling everyone never to fly with you.

Flights were canceled and I ended up at Washington Dulles Airport. My original flight should have gotten me to Fort Myers Florida at 11:02 AM. IT IS now7:30 PM. No flight on the horizon all due to weather. I understand the problem. I'm writing this to tell you that although I'm not happy being put in this position I congratulate every employee of United Airlines for being so patient with all of us and kind. Especially Sonja in Washington Dulles. She made everyone feel important and she never once looked tired or fed up. Hurray for Sonja taking care of flight UA2049!

United changed our flight 6 times then proceeded to delay all of our connecting flights and refund our seats for terrible seats by the toilets. When we landed we had to sit on the plane for another hour to get to the gate. My family will never be flying United again and I would never recommend it to anyone.

Absolutely the worst experience I have ever had with flight attendant. Aircraft and Product were very good all staff was a very nice except one flight attendant was rude, aggressive and totally in the wrong job. I did let him know I have a service dog with me I showed him papers but he didn’t care if this is service dog he told me I can’t have him by me. He basically was standing behind my chair every min so he can see if the dog is inside cage he was so annoying. For 10 years of flying with my dog have any experience like that.

We were traveling as a family from DC to Switzerland but my son’s inbound flight from Syracuse was delayed jeopardizing his connection flight to Geneva. To make matters worse, we had his physical passport with us in DC! The supervisor at the UNITED terminal did her very very very best so my son could catch up and make his connecting flight. They could have closed the doors, closed the gate, found him alternative delayed travel options, but this lady, went above and beyond to give my son every chance to make the International connecting flight and he did! It was the start of our Spring break vacation and she optimized our chances to travel as a family. We are so grateful! This type of service builds allegiance to the airline. In an otherwise busy world, the type of customer service we received was exceptional.

commentHeader: “sad we have to be dealt with like this”
reviewContent: United employee took carry-on bag checked it in without a tag and we’ve been going in circles to find it. Every phone call takes 20 minutes and you get different answers each time, after two months and 15 days and the letter that said that we will not be compensated today. They told us after three months, the bag gets salvaged we really feel that no one knows what they doing and no one takes a seriously it’s just so sad that we have to be dealt with like this but I guess this is the new norm.
The flight cancelled and they put us on a flight six hours later. We missed our connection flight to Europe and had stay overnight in San Francisco. It screwed our whole trip to Europe.

commentHeader: rude and didn’t provide a solution
reviewContent: My flight was delayed for 2 hours. I was going to lose my second flight so I asked for other options at the counter in SFO. The counter attendant told me that the only option could be just not to go to my destination. That was really rude and didn’t provide a solution. My flight keep being delayed even after the boarding. We were on board for an hour and 25 mins. Finally came to Denver but when I got here, I asked another United attendant to help me with my rebooked. And she didn’t even say sorry neither offer me vouchers or any type of credit for the inconvenience in my first flight. I ended up just calling on the phone and asked for them and the person told me I can only get them in the counter. So I called again and spoke to someone else on the phone and he finally helped me. He was nice. However , I couldn’t use the meal voucher in Mc Donald’s which was the only restaurant open. I ended up just eating salami and cheese from another airport store. Also, It wasn’t worth it to go to the hotel because I only had 3 hours to come back to the airport for my next flight. Honestly, this was my first time flying with United And I think would be my last time as well. I think it was just enough. I have been in the airport 3 hours. And still need to wait another 2 hour for my boarding time to the next flight to Orlando.

commentHeader: does not care about customer service
reviewContent: United lost my luggage on a recent flight to Dulles. Since I had multiple business meetings to attend, I needed to go buy clothes and toiletries the night I arrived. After chatting with multiple United agents when I arrived in DC, they told me to go buy what I needed for my trip. I had  2 agents tell me they will reimburse me what I lost. In two separate chat sessions, I specifically asked about my cologne and headphones I use for running. I have screen captures of the agents telling me United would reimburse me for those items. When I turned in my claim (which I did not even list the time it took me to go buy everything I lost which ended up to be several hours), United Baggage Claim denied paying for the cologne and headphones, saying both those items are on their "Excluded" list. I proceeded (multiple times) to send the screenshots of my chat conversation with their agents, but they did not care. I told them multiple times that since the chats were considered "binding conversations" between myself and United, but it took me almost 2 months of phone calls, chats, and emails for United to finally make it right and reimburse me for those items. To make things worse, when I sent a couple emails to United Mileage Plus and United Customer Care to complain about my entire experience, not one agent offered any type of compensation for my trouble. They simply told me it is a Baggage Claim issue. I certainly did not expect financial compensation, which I could have knowing how many hours it took me to purchase the items that United lost. But one would think the airline would offer to give me miles towards a future flight to make up for their mistake. But no, not United. United obviously does not care about customer service or the customer experience. As long as they got your money.

commentHeader: employees are loud, arrogant and bossy
reviewContent: Worst airline. This is 3rd time I fly with United via Houston: - each time I miss my connecting flight whether it is to Austin, Costa Rica or Panama - plane left late (like other times). The personnel on the airplane knows nothing and only refers to the App - wifi does not work on the flight. At Houston airport there where for 35 customers, 2 employees to help next to gate C3. All customers annoyed - most employees are loud, arrogant and bossy.

commentHeader: absolute worst airline to fly with
reviewContent: Awful airline! I spent $3k on tickets due to the weekend we were flying. Our plane was delayed 4 hours which they kept saying was due to the air traffic. Turns out it was due to the pilot walking off, it had nothing to do with air traffic. We finally get to board and my premium economy seats that I paid extra money for were given away as a free upgrade and they tried to split my seats and shove us in the back of the plane. I tried to contact customer service for a refund and they refuse saying I have no grounds for a refund and that the best they can do is a $75 United credit. As if I would ever fly United again, they are the absolute worst airline to fly with. You buy protection on your tickets and then you can’t even get your money back when the airline messes up majorly.

They have changed our flight two times, and the last time they changed it, they didn't allow us to choose our seats so our family is unable to sit with each other. We booked it through Chase, and we could not change reservations through Chase, but only through the airline. We have never had this issue as with booking through Chase Travel, we have always been able to manage it through them. When we called them, they said UA needs to be dealt with directly. We called their customer service, which was horrible. The Automated voice walkthrough is horrendous. When expressing the concern about not sitting with our family, they said "it happens". With who? Not with Delta, not with AA. I have never had this issue before. I will not be booking through UA again.

My wife and I booked our return trip with United airlines (Business class) to go to USA. On the way back, our flight from Chicago to Toronto (via United) got delayed leading to us missing our next flight from Toronto to Dubai with Air Canada. United doesn't have a desk at Toronto airport but Air Canada team went extra mile, got in touch with United on phone who re-booked us on Emirates. We were also advised to stay overnight (it was 2am) in a hotel and all reasonable expenses incurred will be reimbursed. Our luggage was not with us and we had no clothes/toiletries etc When we submitted our claim with receipts, United said they will only pay $200 per passenger which hardly covers cost of hotel and food but nothing else. This is very unfortunate and not appropriate way to treat business class travelers! wonder if I could do anything else

route: Puerto Vallarta to Medford via Central Point
commentHeader: “they weren't willing to help us out”
reviewContent: We bought two tickets on United from Mexico to our home city. When I bought the tickets it had a 2 1/2 hour connection which was enought to get thru customs and immigration. They then changed the schedule for connecting International to Domestic flight to 1:40 minutes which is less than the MCT (minimum connection time) Now we found out they changed the connecting flight with a six hour layover. I would have never bought these tickets with this kind of schedule. Called and they weren't willing to help us out...wanted to charge us for the same flight the following day if we choose to spend the night instead of sitting at the airport for six hours getting us home at 1:00 am. I have two United credit cards but will be getting rid of those and start flying Alaska or Delta.

route: Manila to Vancouver via San Francisco
reviewContent: My partner and I had a really great flight with United Airlines from Manila to Vancouver with a layover in SFO. I read many negative reviews online and was terrified the flight would be a disaster. It was a fairly uneventful and easy two flights. Both planes  were definitely newer and comfortable - as much as economy can be. The stewards were polite, welcoming, and helpful. Our bags arrived at our destination safe and sound, and so did we. I came to write this review specifically to counteract all the negative reviews I read, as I know that negative reviews tend to get posted more than positive. I would fly with United Airlines again.

I flew with United last November and experienced wonderful service such as very friendly crew, wonderful in-flight cleanliness, seat legroom/comfort wonderful, passenger who sat next to me was friendly, in-flight wi-fi was excellent, ground service great, value for money wonderful. Will defintely fly with them again!

commentHeader: been changed to a flight several hours later
reviewContent: I checked in to my flight the day before, saving a screenshot on my phone. I had an isle seat (important because I'm 6'5" tall and I like to be able to stretch my legs out in the isle occasionally throughout a long flight). The next morning I pulled up my itinerary to find that I had been changed to a flight several hours later in the day for some reason. I got to the airport and got changed back to the original flight, but lost my seat. They said they have no idea why my flight was changed, but unfortunately there was nothing they could do about getting me an isle seat anymore.

This is the most terrible airline you could imagine. My bags were approximately 12 pounds overweight, so one of the helpful, nice staff members told me I should take some things out, put them in a plastic bag given to me by the staff there, and then carry that on (and check my carry on). I emptied the ~12 pounds out of my suitcase and asked another staff member if I could have a second plastic bag so that I could double bag my things so it wouldn’t rip. She immediately started telling me that I couldn’t do that, and started rudely demanding that I put all of my things back in suitcases, which I just spent time unpacking. It took approximately 45 minutes for the United Airlines staff to help the 5 individual, or groups of 2 people in front of me, people were at the desk trying to get their tickets for 30 minutes each. And then I was there being detained for another 45 minutes while the staff member ignored me after she demanded I put everything back in my bags. She wouldn’t even look at me, or talk to me while she slowly helped everyone who was behind me. I had to ask customer service representatives working at the neighbouring desks to even let me weigh my bags. I was there almost 3 hours early, and I genuinely thought she was going to cause me to miss my flight- I got to the gate just as the second zone for my flight was boarding. My suitcases were carefully packed because I am going to two different climates, so have boots, shoes, jackets- I things for both a cold and warm climate, and I couldn’t get everything back in my suitcases. Someone from the line was trying to help me force the things back into my suitcases while I was trying to rush so as not to miss my flight while staff ignored me. The suitcase (which was previously given to me by Air Canada when they broke the wheel on my original suitcase)- so it is not the best quality, started ripping at the seams and breaking so that my things were coming out when it was zipped up. The staff was still arguing that I couldn’t get on the plane with a plastic bag as my carry on, which makes no sense because I had one personal item, and a plastic bag that fit the size requirements for a personal item- I genuinely felt like I was going to miss my flight because of her, and she didn’t care, wasn’t even looking at me, wasn’t helping me- was ignoring me. The nice staff member (I wish I had gotten her name, because the world needs more reasonable, kind, helpful people like her) told me that she would check all my bags including my original carry on, and let me take my personal item and the plastic bag as my carry on item. It was easy to carry and the same size as a regular carry on. So now I have to buy two suitcases when I get to my destination, because the staff caused my suitcase to break by forcing me to try & force everything back in it on the middle of the airport floor after another staff member had just told me to take everything out. Then they made me sign something saying that the suitcase was already broken when I got there.
Absolutely worst airline. Totally unreliable always delayed. They should put more effort into improving the quality of their service and learn how to be more reliable!

commentHeader: He was very kind and helpful
reviewContent: My wife and myself want to thank Mr Flores, who works for United Airlines. Mr Flores kindly help us in all aspects , that is obtaining the boarding pass and checking our luggage, for both of us. He was very kind and helpful And we want that United Airlines takes note of this. Our flight was from IAH Houston to Puebla. on March 5 2024.

commentHeader: the seats were way too small
reviewContent: Everything about the airline was good but the seats were way too small. The only thing I think they should improve is bigger seats especially for economy class.

I am not sure if we were just lucky or what judging from some of the other poor reviews of United but we had a good flight with them and I thought they were OK. I would fly with them again. We got a cheap ticket compared to some of the other airlines on offer. I was pleasantly surprised by the legroom in economy. It was about a 9 hour flight going and just under 8 coming back. The food was basic rice and Chicken/pasta type fare but edible and a pizza roll/breakfast bagel later on. The entertainment was a large selection of movies, TV and games. Staff were polite but kept busy. The flights were both on time and the plane in economy was about three quarters full so there was room to spread out a bit. We were delayed about 20 minutes going due to a technical fault but made the time up on route.

commentHeader: do my best to avoid United
reviewContent: Significant delays that could be avoided with expedited boarding. Took 45 minutes to board the plane, but United prioritized class differentiation over flight punctuality, even when the flight was already delayed 30 min. This caused additional delays on the tarmac, and the flight was ultimately 70 min late. On arrival, a flood of missed-transfer folks were being jammed off the plane, further delaying all others. Seat assignment: Economy now means they auto-assign your seat - after a forced airport check-in (boarding pass says "See Agent")! Extremely inefficient process: forced to check in online, then at the airport kiosk, then at the agent desk (despite having no checked bags). Plus I'm assigned a middle seat despite the window seat being open. Are these inefficiency tactics (for both passenger and airline) designed to humiliate me into paying more next time to choose a seat? Or just poor fulfillment software? What a mess. Seat: Knees jammed into front seat (although I am 6'2), all storage pouches destroyed. Service: flight attendants were nicer than my previous United flights. Verdict: Despite living in SF, I will do my best to avoid United in the future.

Unable to check in online unless we upgraded at a cost of $40 each. The upgrade on the first leg got us the last row on the plane. For the second leg which was 31/2 hours late, one of us got a center seat. How is this a upgrade? Save your money, United is not reliable!

On both our incoming and outgoing trip to Peru, United Airlines was massively delayed for hours due to some technical issue. What made it so frustrating in the Lima airport is that when we try to check in, the people on the same delayed flight were pretty much delineated from the other people with different flights and were made to wait a bit longer. It was really frustrating to arrive early and then have all the other folks who came later than you leapfrogged over. This made it very frustrating since my husband and I could have used that time to be chilling in the lounge. United should compensate for the pain and suffering that they put us thru—- not just on the delay but also for the added insult of having to wait longer than normal to check in and drop our bags. What a fiasco. I will think twice about choosing United again when we fly.

On the DFW-IAH outbound flight, there was no cabin service due to the very short duration. Flight departed on time and landed on time. Premium Economy seating on the Boeing 737-9 Max and 737-900 is very comfortable and spacious. No delays outbound to CUN and inbound to IAH. Cabin crew on both legs provided friendly service. Slight delay inbound to DFW from IAH. Again, limited cabin service was provided due to very short duration of flight. We appreciated the pilot flying at a lower level altitude to turbulent weather. ICE on all flights worked very well with the added bonus of being able to connect through T-Mobile Wireless to text, Whats App and catchup on Twitter.

commentHeader: I’d have expected it in the 80s
reviewContent: Unbelievable. Again they’re collecting your carry on items before boarding the plane which makes no sense as then they could simply say no carry on items allowed and then at least people can plan accordingly. The airplane was ridiculous in size, age, comfort. I have never seen anything like this! It’s 2024 and that was a flight like I’d have expected it in the 80s. If even. I was close to not even getting on this aircraft.

The Flight from PIT to ORD pushed back from the gate, but then the pilot said there was an issue with the brakes. So we went back to the gate and sat there for 90 minutes. The plane was in PIT all night long – why wasn’t someone checking out the plane and making it sure it was ready to go first thing in the morning.  They let us get off the plane in PIT, and we tried to book another route to HNL that day (via NWK), but then United customer service told us to get back on the plane, because we could still get to ORD and make our connection. But there were more delays once we got back on the plane. It finally took off 2 hours late, and there was some small hope that we could make the connection in ORD. But then there were air traffic delays in ORD (which United should have seen ahead of time!) 3. When we finally landed in ORD we ran to the nearby gate for the connection to HNL only to learn that the flight had departed ten minutes previously. There were 20 passengers making the connection from the PIT flight to the HNL flight. United could have easily held the flight for another 15 minutes (the flight was scheduled to land EARLY in HNL as it was!) to allow all of us passengers to make the connection. Your failure to do this demonstrates your complete lack of care regarding your customers. Your customer service options totally suck. We tried to use the kiosks in ORD to rebook a flight, but they were not working.  No one answered your customer service phone line.  The line at the customer service desk was over 50 people long.  I tried to use a Day pass to enter a United Club near the gate, but they were not accepting Day Passes.  We walked to another United Club and I used a Day pass to enter and get help from the customer service agents there. While the agent was helping, she was providing options, and I needed to discuss them with my wife who was waiting outside. I went to get her so she could help make a decision re rescheduling our route to HNL, but the women at the front of the United Club would not let her in without a day pass – even though we did not want to use the facilities, did not want to stay, and only wanted to get our flights rescheduled. I demanded to speak with the manager who took his time coming to speak with me, and then he was a corporate tool and would not let my wife in for 5 minutes to help with this rerouting, either. Such terrible customer service, for what was already a bad experience, was completely absurd and unacceptable.  We got rebooked on a flight to SFO and then on the HNL, but when we went to the gate for the flight to SFO, it was delayed by 3 hours! So we would miss the connection to HNL! (that flight was eventually delayed by 6 hours total. Can United not keep your planes in working order?! Seriously?!)  So, we got rebooked again on the flight to HNL the next day – missing an entire day of our vacation in Hawaii. Thanks a lot United!  The agents that rebooked us for the next day arranged a hotel voucher at a not very impressive hotel in a sketchy part of Chicago, and gave us some food vouchers. But they did not tell us that the food vouchers were only valid inside the airport. Even though the vouchers say they work like any prepaid credit card, they do not! They only work at airport locations. This is not helpful when we are going to a hotel at noon and need to wait until the next day at 10 AM to fly out.

What an embarrassing airline. Polaris Club (their elite lounge) is like a terrible buffet. First/business class seats do not have any video monitors and they do not even provide headphones. I would never, voluntarily pick this airline.

route: Detroit to San Antonio via Detroit
reviewContent: 4 out of 4 delays. Every time I have layover there is a delay. It’s actually kind of sad the planning of their flights never fails to cause a longer travel time. I would rather spend twice the money and fly with no stops, than every single flight that offers layover delaying hours past the actual time they provide. Or they could just put accurate departure times. I won’t fly United unless the ticket is basically free.

commentHeader: “second time United has split our family up”
reviewContent: We booked our flight many months ago, as a family of four with two small children. United didn’t give my husband a seat number, and when I called they told me he would have to get it at the gate. At the gate they gave a boarding pass and sat him in the front row even though we were are the very back of the plane. This is the second time in the past year United has split our family up and not notified us until we are at the gate. And if we wanted my husband to sit with us? $104 up charge for ONE seat change. Additionally, we had two extra small carry on kid suitcases which they made us pay $35 each to check because our ticket selection was the most basic. We took American Airlines on our way there for the same trip and it was lovely. They made an effort to sit our family together without any up charge and had a normal carry on/personal item allowance.

commentHeader: have a slight preference for Delta
reviewContent: First class on this first short 1-hour domestic flight. I’ve flown a few similar flights with United. Crew is professional. They served drinks before takeoff which is nice. Seats were comfortable, plane was well maintained. They’ve removed all in flight entertainment screens which is appealing. I’d like to use my phone for things other than watching a movie. They only served biscuits and chips which is sad. Paul on my ORD - FSD flight (8 pm) was wonderful. I’d still fly United First but I have a slight preference for Delta because of the IFE part.

Anyone reading this, if you’re flying United do not check your bags. Take it on board with you and worst case they will tag it on the jet bridge. Another trip, another opportunity for them to not have my luggage when I arrived at my final destination. Also bring some type of ear buds! I had a guy next to me snoring for three hours and the guy behind him also snoring for over 2. I said something to the flight and he said there was nothing he could do. First class means nothing with issues like this. I paid more and was subjected to this. My luggage was found and brought to me the next afternoon after checking into my hotel the previous evening. Thanks United for doing anything you could to make my trip to Vegas one I wish I could forget. I also sent in feedback to them complaining about everything. Three days now and no response. Sadly, I’m not surprised or maybe they’re extremely busy responding to others who experienced the same on other flights.

route: Melbourne to Las Vegas via Los Angeles
commentHeader: worst airline I have ever flown
reviewContent: The worst airline I have ever flown. Frozen food on the flight. I flew in a bulkhead seat and there was not enough leg room. Seat doesn’t go back far enough. Slep t 2 Hours in the flight.

Horrible customer service and policies. Bag fees charged after the receipt shows ticket bags are free. Waste of time trying to fix the issue, as it will take more of your leisure time talking to nice but grossly incompetent agents. Best to not travel with this airline.

route: Brussels to Des Moines via Chicago
reviewContent: It started on January 3rd at 10:10AM with the first flight from Brussels to Chicago with UA 973. Half an hour into the flight there was a medical emergency and we had to return to the gate. It happens and needs to be done. After an inspection for the overweight landing, we were good to go with just 3 hours delay, not a problem. And then, the flight attendants didn't want to fly, too many hours they claim? Flight Cancelled. Everybody back to the gate area where they United staff made the statement that there will be no re-booking due to the large number of passengers, everybody on hotel and with the same plane the next day, at 1PM (27 hours delay) we later heard. Next day, ready to go, boarding time passes and a shouting match starts between several United staff members, even the police had to intervene. Then, 1 hour later, hello everyone, we cancel this flight too. That is where panic starts, my business trip turned into a nightmare. Since it was past 2PM, all US flights had of course departed. Rush to the counter, proposal BRU-to London- Washington- Chicago and finally Desmoines with the statement "check in Washington for faster connection". Arrival January 5th 11AM, 37 hours delay! So, flight to London, no boarding passes yet for the next flight, rush to a United counter, got the passes and they said run, the flight is closing the doors. During the 15-minute sprint I noticed that a was downgraded from Premium Eco to ECO. At the gate I explained the situation with my original tickets, they say that they can't find my reservation? "Get on the plane now or stay behind" with free seats available. In Washington, United counter, "What are you doing here, you should be in Chicago" explained the situation, well, it ended with "Why did i fly from Chicago to Washington". Gave up, stressed without believe and major back pain, yes that is why i need a minimum of premium ECO. Next stop Chicago at close to midnight, dead tired. At yet another United counter full explanation, i was told, "there is the gate, departure in 9hours". In a closed airport, needless to say i demanded a hotel to sleep and shower. Thankfully I got at least that. For the rest no apology, no compensation, nothing from United Airlines.

commentHeader: time to review training your staff
reviewContent: United, maybe it’s time to review training your staff. Starting the day at 6:00am with an attendant who wouldn’t check me in because she couldn’t figure out my Schengen Visa. Surely this is something you learn before working at an international airport? Next, did your attendants ever learn to count at school? Everyone is ushered into the plane, only to have bins small bins, no help whatsoever, and chaos abound. We were told to then walk back out of the plane and check in our carry on luggage all the way to our final destination, a 20 hours later. The reason we have carry on bags is because we need the items in them- they nearly did not even give us half a second to remove insulin and medication from the bags.

commentHeader: so grateful for all her help
reviewContent: I had just gotten my dog certified as a service dog. I wanted to make sure that there wasn’t problem when I was flying. I called special services and spoke to Thelma on the phone. Not only did she help me fill out all the forms correctly but she also told me what I would need to fly with them next time and everything that I would have to do before I fly. She was incredibly patient and talked me through every detail. She also sent me the DOT form just so that I had the proper form for my next flight. Being that I’m not very tech savvy I really appreciated this greatly. When you’re ill having an issue while flying is draining. Thelma really made my flight a breeze. I’m so grateful for all her help.

route: Edinburgh to El Salvador via Newark
reviewContent: Awful. These cowboys are like the Ryanair of transatlantic/Americas travel. (Not so) cheap and nasty. Rude staff, poor entertainment, awful seats, weird transfer through Newark, paid for food without warning on some flights. I won't use again.

route: Sioux Falls to Spokane via Denver
reviewContent: The plane from FSD to DEN was hot and stuffy - absolutely no need for the heat to be at that level on a full flight. The flight from DEN to GEG had music blasting during boarding. Aretha Franklin, George Michael, etc. People were trying to get situated, read, etc. while obnoxiously loud and upbeat music played. Not everyone likes the same music and not everyone is coming from a time zone where they'd want music blasting. Additionally, the space under the seats was so unusually narrow that most backpacks wouldn't even fit. My personal item that had fit neatly under my seat during my first flight was now a few inches too big. Instead of the luggage bins being used for luggage, about half of the bins contained backpacks. My medicine, food, and other personal things one would want near them in their PERSONAL item had to be stowed away. All to save a buck. If you want to buy something you are forced to download the app and upload your card information. They say it's so there's contactless payment, however a chip and tap reader has been perfectly adequate up until now apparently. The cutesy safety demonstration that played on the chair screens won't help your PR when it's obvious you don't give two flying poos about your customers.

commentHeader: worst AVML on any flight so far
reviewContent: San Francisco to Tokyo Narita leg of my itinerary was operated by United. Boarding started 30 min late. The announcements of the two gates, the other being for Singapore, kept mixing creating an unprofessional start to the flight. As a vegetarian I picked AVML meal. I was served the worst AVML on any flight so far. Especially the supposedly dinner was a mushy mix of oats, with lots of cinnamon and raisin with piece of Naan bread. Then second leg from Tokyo Narita to Bangkok with ANA flight was like a dream. How come Japan could do so well and United sucks so miserably. Hey United people, please go fly a few times with ANA economy and learn how decent airlines work.

The worst airline ever! Would give a “0” if i could! All the flight attendants in our flight were so rude, no manners and very unprofessional! Our flight was from LOS ANGELES to SYDNEY on United 839, departing 18th January 2024. We encountered 3 flight attendants, and not even one of them was decent!! We have never been treated this way with any other airlines! We travelled as a group of 6. One of our 4 sons has nuts allergy. The man asked if he wanted butter chicken or pasta. And my older son told him that his brother has a nut allergy. The man said. “Well I don’t know if the food contain any nuts. You need to request it prior to the flight.” Then he just walked past and served others. My husband had to call him and said, “My son didn’t get his food. He wanted the pasta!” No apology from him! For breakfast time, he also missed my eldest son. Then my husband called him again, and the man said so rudely, “Well he didn’t respond to me so I thought he didn’t want it!” We sat behind our 3 sons, and we definitely saw that he only asked our son on the aisle seat. He went past so in hurry serving other customers on the other side. We couldn’t believe how rude he was! Second flight attendant was also very rude! My 5 year old son was sitting next to me on the window seat. He is the most well behaved 5 yo kids I know. During the entire 15 hours flight, he was quiet, sleeping well, and sitting happily playing games on his iphone and watching the in flight movies. Around 5am he was already awake, so he started playing piano on his phone. It was not loud at all, because I was sitting next to him. There was a point he put the volume to max for 2 seconds, and I told him to turn down which he immediately did. Suddenly this woman came to my husband, and said in a very rude and aggressive way, saying, “He is not supposed to play on his phone while everyone else is sleeping!” I was very angry and said, “he is not even loud!” I showed her the phone and the volume was 1. And she said, “I was there and could hear him from afar!” And just left! Unbelievable behaviour! The third attendant - we called the help button as my son needed something. She came and said, “It’s very bumpy! We can’t get out!” (She could just wait for a few more seconds and said sorry I couldn’t come right away!) Another incident, she gave my son the wrong breakfast. My 5yo were sitting on 50L. She gave him the food which labelled 50E. Luckily I checked first, it is a meal with special dietary/allergy requests. So we called the help button, it wasn’t her who came to us. She said, “Oh glad you noticed that!” My husband replied, “Of course we noticed!” It could have been a disaster that someone else’s meal was served to the wrong person! No apology at all! No saying thank you that we actually didn’t eat the meal! Such disgusting manners from all these 3 flight attendants. Our first time flying with United, and will never ever fly with them again! Our flight wasn’t cheap too. Travelling 6 of us, we paid around $2000 AUD per person! So in total, we spent a good $12K. We definitely won’t recommend United to others!

To the executive leadership of the United Airlines: You are now charging a fee for small carryon bags? What a genius idea. The size of planes didn’t change. The size of overhead compartments didn’t change. What also didn’t change is your sick greed. You’re now not allowing even a carryon? And also no water or snack or drink on flight? You’re basically decreasing service, and increasing fees to line your pockets. At least if you paid your employees more. What’s next? You’re going to charge a fee for passengers to pre-pay for their masks and flotation devices if there’s an emergency? What’s next? You’ll bring your flight staff down to minimum wage and expect passengers to tip them to compensate? You’re absolutely disgusting. Shame on you.

I would say this is one of the best flights we've had. Left Heathrow slightly late but arrived half an hour ahead of schedule. The food on board was delicious and served when we wanted. The crew I would say, without hesitation, were exceptional. I will give a special thanks to Christine who made our long flight a pleasure. Thank you United.

I bought ticket from Lufthansa and didn’t know that they were working with United Airlines. From Frankfurt to Houston and from Houston to Dallas I flew with United. From start to end it was a terrible experience. Frankfurt-Houston flight delayed 1.5 hours. Before the flight in the security check they didn’t explain that I need to take my baggage in Houston and re-check for Dallas. Cabin crew were so rude, and not helpful (except food service personnel). Houston to Dallas flight time was 8.10 pm and I was running to catch it, because the plane landed in Houston at 7 pm. When I came to the gate saw that Dallas flight postponed 2.5 hours (and gate changed three times) After long wait, I was in Dallas at 12 am, but this time I waited for my baggage and learned that they are in Houston in US customs. The person in baggage claim was very rude and not helpful, just was saying that it was my mistake. After 7 hours from the landing to Houston (Houston-Dallas takes 4 hours by car), I was at home at 2 am without my baggage and in a very tired condition. It was my first connected flight from Europe and it was terrible experience. I strongly suggest people to find direct flights even if the wait time is longer.

commentHeader: “the last time I take United Airlines”
reviewContent: My flight was delayed four times due to the weather conditions. I started traveling at 9:00am eastern time. The first flight was delayed in Cincinnati due to the weather in Chicago. At that point I should have been provided the option to travel at a later time. Instead I was put on a plane to Chicago where I was scheduled to depart at 12:40pm. The flight was not only delayed but the there was a gate change also resulting in several people needing to rush from B19 to C30 which is a good 10 - 15 minutes away. At 5:00 pm we were informed that the flight was canceled. United Airlines was unavailable by phone due to the amount of customers attempting to make contact. After standing in line for 2 hours to watch unprofessional employees get frustrated due to the weather delays. Not only did they get frustrated they walked away from customers to get dinner, texted and entertained social media why people waited for assistance. The airline refused to pay for a hotel and offered a $15 meal ticket to accommodate someone sitting 20 hours in the airport away from home. Not to mention it was -8 degrees outside and they didn’t even offer the customers a blanket. This will most definitely be the last time I take United Airlines anywhere. I hope to leave at 9:00 am as scheduled!

Flights here were okay, but flights leaving are a real pain. Their signage is terrible and they don't inform you on the app. But if you pre-check you have to still pre-check at the airport and get a copy of your driver's license before you even get in line to board.

commentHeader: no better than Spirit or Frontier
reviewContent: The seat assignments and boarding is similar to an cheapo airline. They make you pay for a seat assignment and then only give you an option for a seat in the far back of the plane. The flight is full, but there are plenty of seats available in the front of the plane for even more money. So, it appears that if you do not pay for a seat assignment, then those vacant seats must be assigned to those folks who didn’t pay for a seat assignment. United is becoming no better than Spirit or Frontier Airlines. What a joke.
It's been a good flight; my only issue is that the 757-300 has no inflight entertainment, besides Wifi. I hope United configures their 757-300 in the Signature Interior, but I'm not sure yet.

It's always a pleasure to fly United Airlines in this modern era. Flying on jets like the 787 is always good. Inflight entertainment with favorite movies, free Wi-Fi with T-Mobile, mood lighting, and larger overhead bins. It would've been better if United served free food and not food for purchase. But other than that, with an amiable cabin crew and a safe flight with a few turbulences, I can't say enough about it.

Changed my flight, selected cheaper flight for a fare credit. I was unable to check-in, called the United Customer Service, they claimed I owed money even though my new flight offered a credit for which I received an email confirming the credit. Told me it was a mistake, I have no credit, and that they can do an even exchange eliminating what I now "owed" for the ticket. Unbelievably sketchy business practice to not re-issue a ticket after confirming the new flight and then claiming customers owe more money when asking to check-in.

I would give 0 stars if I could. I had a flight from AVP (UA 1446) to ORD (UA2665) to IAH. First flight was delayed for over an hour & not a single team member even attempted to notify us. We waited & waited, receiving zero information regarding the delay. Once we were finally on the plane, we waited another 20 minutes without reason. Once we landed, we waited for 45 minutes just to get off. This left me with less than 10 minutes to make it to my next gate… and the walk was estimated to be 18 minutes. On my way off of the first plane, I told the flight attendant at the front my situation & asked if she could help me in any way possible. She ROLLED her eyes at me & was entirely dismissive. I am astonished that United would even consider hiring someone so rude. Once off, I sprinted to my next gate, which is absolutely unacceptable. I have asthma & nearly collapsed due to such heavy breathing & wheezing. Several people approached me, asking if I was okay & if I need help… yet not a single worker. Absolutely awful. I had tears falling down my face the entire run to the gate because I was so frustrated. I finally got to the gate, panting, & noticed that passengers were getting off the plane. I stopped a man & politely asked him what was going on & he told me that the plane was having “technical difficulties” and that our flight was delayed. That being said, I sprinted (and nearly passed out) all for nothing. I checked the app several times & nothing was changed so I had no idea.
