I have flown United since I was a child & am extremely disappointed. The last 2-3 years, this airline has become completely awful. I used to love traveling & now dread it when I fly with United. I much rather fly with Delta or Southwest. Save your time, money, & energy and fly with someone else.

commentHeader: I will not fly United in future
reviewContent: I paid $280 for a package to get upgrade to Premium Economy. Once aboard, the seat in flight entertainment did not work or WIFI. No one seemed to care and later reported it to United to ask for a credit, was offered $50 coupon for future flight. I told them to keep it as I will not fly United in future.

route: Corpus Christi to Manila via Houston / Tokyo
reviewContent: I use to think United was one of the better airlines. Not anymore. I noticed it a couple of years ago, how the airline is getting worse. Now it is the worst one I’ve been on by far. I was traveling from Corpus Christi to Manila Philippines Saturday December 9th on the 7:20 am flight to Houston. My flight was delayed due to mechanical failure. I was stuck in Corpus airport for almost 8 hours. Watch planes come and go to Houston. While I’m being told there’s no room for me yet. As if I already don’t have a 24 hour flight ahead of me with no problems. The staff was very rude, and unprofessional. By the time I got to Houston, I had another 4 hour layover. Checked in to one of their Club Lounges at my expense. Long story short, I arrived to my destination a day later. After I returned home, I filled a complaint telling my experience, and looking for some sort of reimbursement for my time and expenses for the trip there. I received an immediate email in return stating someone would reach out to me in 21 - 28 days. No later than 6 weeks. I got a response in less than 24 hours saying all they can do is give me a $100 voucher/certificate that expires in 1 year to go towards my next flight. I was blown away. My ticket was $2,900. I felt like they intentionally insulted me to get under my skin. I won’t lie. I will fly again with them locally. Because I have a lot of air miles. But after that’s gone. I’ll never spend another penny with United in this lifetime. And that’s my advice to everyone. Don’t just take my word for it. Read the rest of the reviews. United has downgraded to the worst airline (I’ve ever been on anyway). But still charging elite prices.

Absolutely disappointed and disgusted with this airline. You make customers jump through so many hoops by needing to download your app to putting a cc on file in order to pay for WIFI and Drinks then do not offer those options when your passengers have boarded. I wasted hours on the phone with customer service in order to make sure I could be ready and then am told after were in the air that cannot purchase drink they have modified the menu. I have had a long trip driving and traveling for work I enjoy having a beer on flight it's about the only chance I have time for one. It was basically the last straw after everything.

My wife and I booked our bucket list trip to Italy through United via their Star Alliance partner, Air Canada. The nightmare started on September 25, in Montreal, when boarding started, but was never completed. 450 passengers were told that there was a delay because the Air Canada airline baggage personnel crashed the luggage lift into the cargo door. Passengers deplaned and were told there was a one-hour delay. We were then told there was a two-hour delay. Delay after delay. We were strung along until 1:30 am on 9/26/23 when the airline finally admitted the plane would not leave until noon the next day. Vouchers were offered for hotels and food. We were made to pick up luggage and go through customs again and then check our bags again, all 450 people! Then we had to get in line for the vouchers. This took a lot of time and we were exhausted. The line moved slowly and when the service desk was in site there was one Air Canada attendant working. Meanwhile there were 6 or 7 other attendants at the service desk helping passengers for flights the next day and none stepped in to help the passengers that had been up all night! When we finally reached the front of the line (at 4:30 in the morning!), we were told there were no vouchers left! We returned to the gate and slept on very uncomfortable benches as airline transport vehicles beeped and announcements rang out all night. We received $30 for food. We spent $12 of that on toothbrush kits and had to spend $64 for a meal out of our own money. The flight left at noon the next day and arrived at 2 AM in Rome. The original flight was to arrive at 9:30 AM in daylight when the trains were running in Rome. We were supposed to catch a train to Florence but trains do not operate at 2:00 am. We spent our second night trying to sleep at the train station in the company of pigeons and other passengers in the same boat. We took the first available train in the morning to Florence but arrived 30 minutes too late for our first scheduled tour of “David and Accademia”. We had already paid $73.88 for this in advance so not only did we lose our chance to see “David and Accademia”, we lost our money We ended up missing our first two nights stay in the hotel we booked in Rome. We were told the rooms were canceled because we were a “no show” but yet we still had to pay for them even though we called our hotel several times to report our delays. It was a very stressful time! I reached out to both Air Canada and United.  They claim the flight was cancelled due to a safety-related reason and it is ineligible for compensation. It was a safety related issue but the issue it was caused by United/Air Canada’s negligence. An employee ran his luggage loading forklift into the airplane and caused the door not to be airtight. Since the airline caused the problem due to their incompetence, I should be compensated for the misery we were put through.

When we arrived at the bag drop at Los Angeles we were greeted with United Airlines rudest employee. She had a face mask on and simply pointed at our bags. I then initiated communication with her and she managed to communicate back that our bags did not have tags. I then agreed with her and explained that is why we were attempting to reach the the counters. We were then ordered to do self check in, which we worked out to do. When we finally reached the counter the girls there were chatting but turned their attention to us immediately and were very welcoming. I heard an altercation between United’s employee and another customer and then spoke to a supervisor about her who explained that she was feeling under the weather. Moving on Boarding was efficient, cabin crew looked very smartly dressed & were very welcoming. We were late leaving but arrived 20 mins early. We weren’t given any food as this was not part of our fare and we had dinner in the lounge earlier anyway. The seats were adequate for a 3.5 hour flight but I would dread sitting in these for a flight to Asia, Europe or Australia - the same type of seat for a domestic shorthaul. No headphones were provided & we didn’t have our own so unfortunately we had no inflight entertainment for this flight. Our bags arrived at the belt before us & were taken to a storage area for us until we were ready. (We had breakfast in the lounge) I didn’t ask for them to do this but appreciated it. Overall, I would recommend United.

Worst service I’ve ever received on any flight, let alone a 14.5 hour international flight. Flight staff was clueless, WiFi was out, plane was filthy and customer service director offered a measly $150 in flight credit, like I’d ever want to fly with this company again. Run away from United, any other option is better.

I was still early for scheduled flight but they were done boarding and would not let me on the plane stating I missed it by 4 minutes. The next flights were all day flights in uncomfortable and very small planes. Then on the way home they delayed my flight 30 minutes waiting for other passengers. Do Not Fly United. Horrible!

route: Las Vegas to Syracuse via Newark
reviewContent: Was flying on United on September 2nd, with a departure time of 11:59PM we were flying from Las Vegas to Syracuse with a connection via Newark, got to the airport in Las Vegas and next thing you know, the flight to Newark got delayed an hour 12:59AM, then next thing you know, delayed again to 1:59AM, and THEN delayed again till 2:59AM. We boarded around 3AM, didn’t take off till almost 4AM, United said it was due to “Air traffic Controller problems” we got no meal vouchers, no compensation, and barely an explanation. When we landed, I had about 5 minutes to make my connection to Syracuse, I didn’t make it and the door was closed by the time I ran to the gate, went to the customer service desk and they were extremely rude, couldn’t get on another flight for hours, (again no compensation) and keep in mind I’m a highschooler kid just trying to see my cousins in Las Vegas.

This review related to my mother’s flight experience with United 2268, IAD-MCO, 12/09/23. I simply want to recognize the outstanding professional assistance delivered by two kind flight attendants Lyndsey & Leanne to my mother with special needs. Both wonderful ladies have provided admirable comfort to my mother who needed to use on board bathroom quite frequently due to prescribed medication. My family cannot thank both fine ladies enough for putting forth the compassionate efforts they have virtually demonstrated. Thank you United. You guys are lifesavers!

route: Cancun to Los Angeles via Houston
commentHeader: best attitude of any flight attendant
reviewContent: Although I am very disappointed with United Airlines in general, I have to pass on my the positive feedback as I was overwhelmingly surprised by one of your flight attendants by the name of Becky. She was wonderful, cheery and had the best attitude of any flight attendant I had over a long period of time. She is great and deserves a pay rise. We even talked about our dogs, hope hers is his ok. Please pass on my regards to Becky and make sure gets that raise please. She is Wonderful and you should be proud to have her as one of your Staff Members.
Terrible service and as always late. The workers are rude, and every time I fly United there are delays. I hope is my last time with this airline.

route: Kuala Lumpur to Port of Spain via Houston
reviewContent: United Airlines staff was extremely helpful during my transit at Houston International Airport...I mistakenly left the departure hall for a quick smoke at the smoking area outside airport area...unable to check in back at TSA because of boarding pass problem...they extended their help to reprint my boarding pass and ushered me through TSA security checks amidst my confusion of various counter to Terminal C and managed to board my flight on time within less than half an hour. Thank you to United Airlines, TSA, Homeland Security, Immigration and all parties who involved.

I had a medical condition and the flight stewardness (Janet) was extremely helpful. She found a doctor on board, provided me with all the help I needed and arranged for me to be seen when I got off the plane. In the airport, everyone who helped me was wonderful. The airlines helped me get a LYFT ride to the hospital and arranged for me to stay overnight and scheduled a new flight the next day. I was totally pleased and felt well taken care of the entire time.

route: Salt Lake City to Baton Rouge
reviewContent: Absolutely horrible experience. First time flying United Airlines and definitely the last, we payed extra to fly out for a funeral, first class for the elderly family members to be comfortable in flight. We waited all day on the plane for them to finally to cancel the flight on us, if we had known we would have scheduled another flight out. They re-routed us, dropped the first class off entirely.

This airline will leave you stranded. Flew out of Seattle, the pilot chilled on the runway for an hour. Just sat due to fog and “low visibility”. Once the plane finally got to flying, we landed, majority of folks missed their connecting flights. But by the way United Airlines doesn’t care because they don’t cover delays due to the weather. So then I try to get on the next flight to GPT. They take my luggage but tell me they have no room for me on the plane so now I no longer have my luggage. Then I try to wait for another plane, it won’t take me home but it will take me to the neighboring state. They wouldn’t cover a hotel for me. Again because they could care less about their little weather delays. Three flights later, I end up in the neighboring state from where I live. I’ve been traveling since 3 am and now it’s 1 am. Some stranger gave me a ride to GPT so I can finally get my car from the airport. United Airlines is rough in these streets. Highly don’t recommend. Do not fly with them. People love United because they “offer free wifi inflight”. The WiFi hardly works and it’s not worth the trouble this airline will cause you and your traveling families.

route: Ottawa to Sao Paulo via Washington
reviewContent: I purchased tickets for my family directly from the United website. We were travelling from Ottawa to Sao Paulo with a stop in Washington. Everything was going smoothly until we took off from Washington. After flying for about an hour, the pilot informed us that the airplane was leaking oil, and we had to return to Washington. While I understand it was a safety measure, the nightmare began when we landed after flying for another two hours to reduce fuel. The passengers formed a long line in front of customer service, and the attendants tried to rebook each passenger on another flight to Sao Paulo one by one. No supervisor was present to give us more information, and each passenger took at least an hour to be rebooked. I waited in line for over 3 hours with my two kids. They were stressed and tired and had to sleep on the airport floor while I was waiting in line. When my turn finally arrived, the attendant found three other flights to Sao Paulo. We had to rush to get to the first flight to Cleveland, then to Chicago, and after waiting another 10 hours in the Chicago airport, we finally flew to Sao Paulo. My kids and I spent two days without a shower and proper sleep. United gave us a voucher of $15 each, but it was not enough to buy appropriate food. I had to spend a lot of money to buy food for me and my kids. I felt humiliated, and we travelled for a short vacation in Brazil. My kids were excited to spend one week with their grandparents, but United made our vacation a nightmare. After a few complaint emails, they offered me a $200 voucher, but I don't want it because I will never travel with this airline company again. Despite this, they seemed not to care, so I opened a claim with the Canadian Transportation Agency.

I booked my flight through United Airlines to Winnipeg. United booked the ticket with wheel chair services and a personal oxygen concentrator (POC) requirement. United specified using Air Canada as the carrier. This is where the interruption of service occurred. I checked in at 0600 for a 0930 Departure. The gate agent had no indication of the wheelchair requirement and I was utilizing my POC. I was boarded and took my seat approximately 15 minutes prior to closing the door a ground agent came aboard and removed me from the aircraft. The reason was all though the POC was authorized the pilot said it wasn't on his manifest and wanted me removed from the flight. The ground agent showed him where it had been manifested on the original reservation, to which the pilot decided because it wasn't on the Air Canada manifest he would not permit it on his aircraft, even though he stated he new it was an authorized piece of medical equipment. The gate agent, who were helpful, could book me on the next flight, which was at 1705. Unfortunately this did not allow me to meet the reason the flight was booked so I had to cancel the travel. If United is going to utilize Air Canada as a partner they need to better communicate and honor each others request for services instead of removing people from flights based on pilot inputs strictly based on personnel desires when it was shown to them that the POC was in fact part of the initial reservation.

I booked a business class round trip at the United website but when I saw that I couldn’t check in, I called the customer service number twice. Both times, they stated that my reservation did not go through even though I had a confirmation number. Then they asked how much I paid, claimed the value was too low, they can rebook me - asked why I couldn’t fly premium economy instead and quoted a price that was more than what I booked the flight for and said the price for business class went up double. The customer service representative was rude and kept telling me I paid too little even though I had picked the price that was on the website. Their explanation was that there are other passengers who may have selected the seats at the same time. It felt like they did it purposely to get me to pay double or fly premium economy at $9500.00. I ended up canceling the booking.

I would like to express my appreciation for United Airlines and a certain flight attendant. Right before I boarded, my phone screen broke. Since United is contactless, I was unable to purchase food or drink on the flight. The flight attendant brought me a few extra snacks, which held me over on the 4 hr flight until I got home. Thanks so much.

commentHeader: Took away my carry on bag
reviewContent: Took away my carry on bag that I was told I was allowed. These people are the worst carriers, will not be back. How is it that you tell your customers to be allowed something then tell them "we are sorry we don't have enough space" before departure

Boarding started for UA991 BA283B on time Sunday November 19th 2023 at 10:55am and ended on time at 11:30am from Barcelona. Flight ended and take off went on time without any issues on time around 11:45am. My wife and I were sitting in 54L and 54K. Flight security demonstration had to be done live because all of the economy class seat TVs were nonfunctional. This was an inconvenience to not have function tv but at least the flight departed on time. About an hour into the flight the captain came over the system to say they had attempted all their trouble shooting suggestions but had a malfunction that was not resolving so they were going to turn around. This was not ideal but hope was to get back to fix concern or reschedule the passengers. About an hour later it was said that we were unable to land because the plane had too much fuel so we had to continue to fly until it was safe to land. Eventually we landed but it was as if there was no true communication with the airport as they didn’t know where to put us when we finally landed. They ended up taking us to a cargo area and because of this it took about an hour from landing until the maintenance crew could get to that side of the airport. Eventually which seemed obvious to me they eventually made us aware the repair would take so long that the flight crew would not have hours to fly even it it was fixed. This seems very obvious to me considering it was a 9 hour flight time and over 3 hours were wasted before maintenance even arrived to look at it. At this point they had no idea how to get us off the plane because we were not at a gate and they did not have authorized drivers to drive a bus to the cargo area. Eventually they stated they had 1 driver with the certifications to cross all those areas to get to us. They then kept acting as though the entire plane would get on bus 1, then on bus two when it returned, then with bus 3, and eventually I was offboarded on bus 5 over an hour since the first bus took the front of the plane. Concerning part is we did not pass over any run ways and several emergency personnel were driving the same route as us with out plane sitting next to empty passenger buses. The flight crew did not offer anyone water or food during this entire process 5 hours between boarding and offboarding with mainly elderly from many returning cruise liners. Even though the staff stated we had been rebooked on the flight for the same plane the following day with them we had no confirmations. When they pointed us to the person who had those answers they shrugged their shoulders and stated no idea but bags should be at #6 baggage claim. When we got there the entire plane was still there because no one had their luggage yet. The same barriers to get us offboarded also had them stumped on how to get our bags back to the main terminal. We waited another hour for bags to begin to come. The staff near the baggage claim kept saying everyone would be shuttled to a hotel and brought back in the AM for the rescheduled 9am flight but had no details of how any of it would happen. We had to ease drop to realize some passengers were told to stand in line to put their name in for a hotel but no one had announced this.

commentHeader: 5 months since I applied for reimbursement"
reviewContent: Last summer, my flight from Belgrade to Pittsburgh was overbooked and I had to stay in Vienna one day. Austrian was happy to reimburse me immediately for my inconvenience to solve their problem and that worked out OK. However, for my connection from Newark to Pittsburgh I had to rent a car. Service desk told me that I'd be reimbursed and gave me Lufthansa phone number to ask for it. After endless delays and documents requests, Lufthansa agreed that I am owed reimbursement and asked me to provide my bank info to deposit it. After additional confusion I provided my bank info and never heard from them again. They do not respond to my e-mails anymore, on the phone they refuse to provide any solution or let me talk to anybody who could address my problem. I understand that summer travelling can get complicated and I patiently worked with them to complete my trip. However, I do not understand how they can promise to reimburse me, take my bank account info and completely ignore me after that. I think they delay what they are supposed to do hoping that the customer would forget or give up. Shameful! It has been 5 months since I applied for reimbursement. This is not acceptable from a reputable or any company. MilagePlus partners are definitely to be avoided.

commentHeader: some of staff have bad attitudes
reviewContent: This is the first time we fly with United Airlines, this is a bad experience about the check-in service. At first, we didn’t know how to check-in and we asked the staffs at the check-in station downstairs, the lady yelled at my husband that “ what?”. I’m sorry but I have to say that was uneducated. Was that the attitude you guys trained to serve the customers? At least you say “excuse me”, but she didn’t. And secondly, the guy at baggage claim was so rude, he took our luggage and he used his index finger to call my husband, and he said “your ID?”. Hey, we are not criminals, why did you talk to us like that? This is a big airline, but some of staff have bad attitudes, I think they need to training again. But finally, we got help from a lady upstairs, she was so nice and really helpful, we were appreciated that. And I think this is the first as last time with United Airlines.

commentHeader: flight attendant kicked us off the plane
reviewContent: A flight attendant kicked us off the plane yesterday because we asked where our seat is! Yesterday (11/13) we were supposed to fly back home from MCO to IAD, the flight was supposed to depart at 4:25 PM (flight UA 2065) but due to an unfair and humiliating harassment caused by a flight attendant name Nathalie Gravenstij, we got kicked out off the plane. Here is what happened: They announced that the plane is experiencing some cargo issues so the luggage will be on a different flight, we said sure. Time comes for boarding the passengers, my husband, two young children and myself went on the plane and found out they have changed the seat numbers for several people. My husband politely asked the flight attendant where he should sit. We immediately heard the flight attendant screaming at him saying you do not talk to me like that, I will throw you off the plane. We were shocked and several other passengers asked that flight attendant why she would behave like that and she grabbed the boarding pass out of that other lady who was confronting her! Then the flight attendant asked my husband (rudely) to just sit down on that empty seat. He did and asked where my little daughter should sit. The flight attendant raised her voice and started screaming at my husband in front of our kids. She said "That's it! I am kicking you all off of this plane" then immediately went and grabbed the phone and called the Captain, security person or the ticketing manager (couldn't tell whom she is calling), they came and asked what happened. Another passenger (whom her boarding pass was pulled from her hand by the same flight attendant) testified and said how rude that person was. The security guy asked the Captain and then came back and told us the Captain wants no trouble so you guys should all leave the plane! When we got off, the manager came and apologies, found out the name for that flight attendant and sent us home on the next flight which departed 3 hours later. My kids were traumatized and started crying. The management insisted that we file an official complaint.

Yesterday (11/13) we were supposed to fly back home from MCO to IAD, the flight was supposed to depart at 4:25 PM (flight UA 2065) but due to an unfair and humiliating harassment caused by a flight attendant we got kicked out off the plane.  They announced that the plane is experiencing some cargo issues so the luggage will be on a different flight, we said sure. Time comes for boarding the passengers, my husband, two young children and myself went on the plane and found out they have changed the seat numbers for several people. My husband politely asked the flight attendant where he should sit. We immediately heard the flight attendant screaming at him saying you do not talk to me like that, I will throw you off the plane. We were shocked and several other passengers asked that flight attendant why she would behave like that and she grabbed the boarding pass out of that other lady who was confronting her! Then the flight attendant asked my husband rudely to just sit down on that empty seat. He did and asked where my little daughter should sit. The flight attendant raised her voice and started screaming at my husband in front of our kids. She said “That’s it! I am kicking you all off of this plane” then immediately went and grabbed the phone and called the Capta9n, security person or the ticketing manager (couldn’t tell whom she is calling), they came and asked what happened. Another passenger (whom her boarding pass was pulled from her hand by the same flight attendant) testified and said how rude that person was. The security guy asked the Captain and then came back and told us the Captain wants no trouble so you guys should all leave the plane.  When we got off, the manager came and apologies, found out the name for that flight attendant and sent us home on the next flight which departed 3 hours later. My kids were traumatized and started crying. The management insisted that we file an official complaint. I am requesting a full refund for our tickets and the luggage fee I paid.

I would love to commend on Pam Beck, United Club, Portland Airport. She noticed my ticket that I was boarded on the back of the plane with a middle seat. She did not manage to change at the first glance of a full flight but she kept a reminder to change whenever a better seat is available. In the end, a better seat in front was available and she immediately changed for me. That's top class service.

I had mistakenly pressed the call button in the toilet when I was searching for the flush button. The flight attendant, an Indian male (I'm too) rushed and knocked on the door to assure that I was okay. I told him that it was my mistake and apologized for it. He gave me the look and went back without saying anything. However, when it was time to serve beverages, he came to the economy aisle with the cart and served row by row, but specifically skipped mine and served the rows in the front and back of my row. I had the aisle seat and the two passengers next to me were asleep. I was making movements, had the tray table open and there was no way that he could have assumed that I was asleep. I'm sure that he penalized me for that mistake. I later asked for a flight attendant through the touchscreen and a female attendant showed up after half an hour. She told me it was her break and couldn't come sooner and served me tea. This kind of behavior by that flight attendant is unacceptable and unprofessional as although I made a genuine mistake, his action was deliberate. Other than that everything was normal in the economy class. My screen was slightly damaged and had flickering lines but it wasn't a hindrance to the operation of the touchscreen or the watching experience. Movie, TV and documentary options were decent. The seats were comfortable and flight only took only 14 hours, despite the 15 hours listed time. UA816 from Newark departed on time and reached Delhi around 10 AM the next morning. The morning arrival time is very convenient and makes it much easier on the person who is coming to pick you up, rather than a late night arrival time. There were several immigration counters and it took only a minute or two to get the stamping done for Indian passport holders. The baggage belt already had bags from my flight and it was surprising to see that checked bags were already moving on the conveyor. I had to wait less than 10 minutes till my bag arrived on the belt. I have generally found that the quality of in-cabin service is better for Delta and American than United and such behavior makes me avoid United if there are other options.

commentHeader: United has really started to go downhill
reviewContent: On average I fly between 60,000 to 80,000 flight miles per year for business. Normally I would give a good review but United has really started to go downhill. I have never seen a company have so many issues. Over the last year every other flight is delayed at a minimum of an hour. It's absolutely ridiculous to have that many issues. The flight teams are constantly late and it seems that the maintenance problems are constant. Today, i have been delayed for eight hours. United had a earlier flight but they wanted additional money to be moved to an earlier flight and when i decided to spend extra money the person i was talking to on the "help line" hung up on me. I would think that the $10,000 dollars I spend a year would be enough. If United doesn't figure out their issues I will be moving to another carrier.

commentHeader: I will never fly with them again
reviewContent: My connecting flight (UA886) from Newark to Lima, Peru on Sept 8 was scheduled to take of at 2.40pm but was delayed due to bad weather. Once the weather improved we were given clearance for take off, but a series of further delays caused by a blocked lavatory, and the aircraft being overloaded resulting in cargo having to be downloaded, and caterers having to board to change the food due to the long delays. After eight hours on the aircraft we were informed that the flight was cancelled because the pilots would be over the allowable time. We were told to collect our bags and go home or reschedule. The next available flight was two days later on 10 Sept. I had to book two nights in a hotel at a cost of over USD500 plus additional taxi and meals costs. I also lost two nights bookings in hotels in Lima that I had already paid for (approx USD200). United Airlines refused to pay for hotels at the time and have refused to compensate me since other than offering a $150 flight voucher which I declined. My advice would be to avoid using United Airlines because they will simply wash their hands of any responsibility if your flight is cancelled. I will never fly with them again, they are incompetent and don't seem to care too much about their customers. Be warned.

Stay away from United Airlines, especially as a European, because if your flight there in the USA is cancelled, you get nothing (only the statement that European legislation does not apply and that we as Europeans have no recourse to compensation) even if they promise to refund your hotel and transfer. We experienced it: on 29/7 waiting for 3 hours and then checking in for the flight, then waiting for 1 hour without drinks or anything hostage to take off only to be told that the flight is cancelled because the crew will go into overtime. Then chaos, hours of waiting at the counter where things are not moving forward (it was already midnight!); You get a text message that you can book a hotel on your own initiative but then when you claim it via emails, forms through their website you get nothing. Then when you threaten to sue after several months, you are told they will only pay $200. Even though we booked a Quinta hotel which was not expensive, for 3 people you don't get by with $200. They also did not provide breakfast and food on 30/7 (because flight was rebooked then). We were on a domestic flight at 10:30am and got nothing to eat! The flight did not arrive until 5 pm. So all this time we got nothing! If we asked anything of the stewards we were laughed at as it were.  When we checked in on 30/7 at the desk to leave, when we checked in our suitcases they told us that we were not on the passenger list and had to go to another customer service line. There we waited for an hour, we were nope with nerves because our flight was about to leave. When it was our turn at customer service, I asked us deadpan why we had queued, that we should go through security immediately and check in at the gate. And the story doesn't end there either. We asked in both SFO and Chicago if our valises (which we had to leave behind at the airport on 29/7) would follow us: no problem they all said. You guessed it, on arrival in Brussels, no suitcases and so again we had to queue for an hour to make a claim. We were mentally and physically exhausted! And you have to know that our son has a disability (we gave the disability card as an evidence but no understanding whatsoever during our trip. Only after 10 days finally had our suitcases back.

Flight was supposed to leave at 8am from Vegas to LA, flight continued to be delayed throughout the day. When I spoke with customer service they advised they could not put me up in accommodation or find me another flight should to flight be canceled. Very frustrated with them as they were not very helpful and no one seemed to care. Not knowing if I could actually fly I had to go rent a car to get to LA.

Absolutely awful! My flight was pushed back 2:45 hours as of right now and the rental cars at Cleveland airport close at 12 am so I won't be able to pick up my car. I'll need to spend 70-8 $ to Uber to the hotel and back to the airport tomorrow to pick up the car. This us at least 150 $ loss cause of United. My last flight was delayed 1 hr. Terrible service

commentHeader: United is still a terrible airline
reviewContent: I had not flown on a United flight for about six years due to several flights that were horrible, and where some United personnel were very rude. A family member bought me a ticket on United for October 23, 2023, and I was hoping United had gotten better; unfortunately United is still a terrible airline. I upgraded and paid additional for premium seating which means nothing; no complimentary drink or early boarding. I normally fly Alaska and Delta which treat persons paying additional for premium class much better. Then to top it off, I almost missed my connecting flight because the first flight left late (OK, I understand that happens & is at times unavoidable) but after running to catch the connecting flight, I was looking forward to relaxing with a glass of wine. Shortly after take off, the pilot announces there would be no service due to a possible bumpy ride. I am in the row right behind first class, and the flight attendant serving first class never sat down, until the plane was descending to land. So, what the pilot said was a crock and then I noticed that there was only one flight attendant for economy and premier class seats which obviously was not enough to service a plane that size. Glad I can fly Delta and Alaska and never again United!

The worst airline I've flown and the worst ever customer service. I had to change my return flight date for various reasons and I talked to some customer representatives. The first guy was very helpful and I could tell that he really did want to help me. He sounded empathetic and also tried to talk to his supervisor to give me a discount on the fare difference or not charge a difference at all. However, this supervisor was a stupid person who offered to change my flight to an earlier date for a price difference of a thousand dollars. I mean the original round trip cost me $320 with two bags checked in and they wanted me to pay $1036 to change my flight by two days. Anyways I am very dissatisfied and won't be travelling in United Airlines anytime in the future. Other attempts didn't help either. What a waste of money.

This was the first flight of the day out of Philadelphia, we left on time and arrived a few minutes ahead of schedule. Once in the air, the inflight crew provided friendly and efficient service. I really love United’s premium economy seats as they give you extra legroom and on my flight the middle seat in my row was empty and that made for a much more comfortable flying experience. Since the flight was early in the morning I purchased the blueberry with oats which is my favorite. United has gone cashless so don’t forget to add your credit card to their app prior to boarding. The plane was over 20 years old however it had been refitted with United‘s new cabin and it was very well kept. This airplane offered Wi-Fi from the time we boarded to the time we deplaned and it was free as part of my cell phone provider’s plan. United delivers a consistent product with safety, dependability and efficiency. Fan for life!

I have never had a good experience with United and this was the absolute bottom of the barrel of flights. Taking a redeye from SFO to IND, I fell asleep during the flight. Being on the aisle, my left leg crept into the aisle a little bit. The grouchy lady slams the cart into my leg and was in my face yelling at me for having my leg in the aisle. I obviously exclaimed when it happened due to the pain and surprise of the whole thing. I explained to her that I was not leaving my leg out there on purpose and she gets in my face and tells me that it is not her responsibility to make sure that my leg is not in the way. I put my headphones back in and she keeps going at me. I told her that I did not want to talk about it anymore and she calls for another employee to tell her that I am getting in her face and she wants to call the captain to have the plane landed and have me thrown off. She further claims that I am "up in her face" mind you, I am in my seat this whole time with my earbud back in with my seatbelt on and not saying a word. The people that witnessed this next to me were watching the whole thing and, once we were safe from this tyrant's earshot, were stating how she blew it way out of proportion.  Absolutely pathetic that this is acceptable behavior and United has never provided a good flight. Overpriced and totally not worth it.

I purchased a fully refundable flight and I had to cancel it. I was entitled to a refund of 1.2k USD. At the moment of the cancellation, a bug in United's system caused my refund to be issued in form of travel voucher, rather than being credited back on my card. The issue has not been fixed yet after - Three months of discussions - More than 5 hours of calls on skype (I summed them manually, it's precisely 5 hours and 26 minutes) - Countless confusing / contradicting emails from United's customer service I ruined so many of my working days at the phone, I ruined my mood, and I think I won't see my money back. The amount is not small, and I am not going to use their travel voucher because I don't live in the US. The worst company I had to deal with, and I fly a lot. Terrible customer service, and their system is full of bugs, even the online check in did not work.

This was a perfect flight on a brand new Boeing 737 Max 800, still smelled like new. We left on time and arrived 20mins ahead of schedule. Good weather contributed for a smooth ride with no turbulence at all. The inflight crew was polite and efficient during boarding, service and deplaning. United’s app is solid as it keeps you informed every step of the way, the economy plus seats offer extra legroom and since the aircraft was not full, the middle seat in my row was empty and it made for a much more comfortable experience. Loved the continuous WiFi onboard, free thru my cellphone carrier. Since this was a morning flight I ordered the oats with blueberries (served cold) loved it, since United has gone cashless don’t forget to upload a credit card to the United app for purchasing snacks onboard. I also love the Bluetooth screens on every seat, they offered earbuds but you can just pair your own. Caring, safe and efficient! Thank you United! Fan for life!

Flew round trip with United in the Polaris Class. The crew, food and entertainment were excellent throughout both sectors. Nothing was too much trouble for the crew. They were attentive and courteous at all times. The seat and bedding is very good too. Check in and security at both airports was a breeze and the Polaris lounge at SFO was a very good experience.

Smelled like used diapers. Extremely hot until cruising altitude. No in flight entertainment. No seat back tv screens. Wifi was $8 + unexpected charges. Boarding order by section was ignored so no one got to put their luggage above their rows except people that were allowed to board 4 sections early. I felt the passenger's behind me knees in my back the entire journey. Honestly, never choose United over Delta. I am paying $600 for a greyhound bus experience.

The team together were exceptional and patient with everyone on the flight. First off, the guy next to me wanted to move to another seat since he and I were both wide shouldered and there was an open seat with an empty center. When they came back, once door was closed, they had looked him up and his status and offered an upgrade for a fee that he happily took. Then Dustin was so patient with this couple behind me. I’m not sure what was wrong but you could tell that they were exceptionally needy and I personally wouldn’t have had the patience. This was the motivation for writing the review as Dustin and the other gentleman working out section were going above and beyond and there was no way this couple would leave a good review. Well done gents!

commentHeader: We do not want to fly United again
reviewContent: The original flight was changed, and we were not notified until we arrived at the airport at 5:00 a.m. The agent at the airport and on the phone verified that no notification was sent to us from the United system. I was told it was a system glitch. Not acceptable! Then we had to come back for the next flight, and the plane had a mechanical error and had to turn around. Then we were told the plane was in the air and was lied to as it was not! Due to this, we missed our connecting flight. We lost an entire day of our vacation that we paid for and lost time with our family, who took off work to see us! We were originally supposed to be in Tampa around 11 a.m. but did not arrive until midnight! We do not want to fly United again. It has been a horrible process, and getting in contact with customer service has been worse. On top of that, when we sat down, I pulled my seat tray, and there was old gum on it!

My flight was delayed seven hours going out of O’Hare. They are saying they don’t provide compensation, but the first 45 minutes was because the stewardess was late. Had the stewardess not been late we would not have been affected by weather. The customer service line was very very long probably about three hours long. They did not rebook me, I stayed on the line all night long with customer service. I had to pay for hotel. I had to rebook myself on Ethiopian airlines. When Ethiopian flight flight was delayed, they provided me with three meals, a boarding pass for an alternate flight and a hotel room. When I arrived in DC, I spent two hours waiting for my bag, which never appeared, I went back the next morning. It was still not there, and they said it was behind security with 5000 other bags. They told me I would have to wait till Cape Town. It was not in Cape Town and I did not receive the bag until six days after I left Chicago. I am asked for some compensation for my inconvenience and expense and they refused. Their international division is horrible.

commentHeader: horrible any time I have had to fly with them
reviewContent: We sat on the tarmac for 50 minutes. Were were twice told it would be 10 to 15 minutes, then no further communication for another 20 minutes. There was supposedly a plane at our gate. They need to have an alternative, such as stairs. To unload passengers in such circumstances. Holding passengers captive with no communication is unacceptable. United Airlines has done this to me the last 2 times I flew with them and are generally horrible any time I have had to fly with them.

route: Palm Springs to Savannah via Denver
commentHeader: expect and am entitled to polite service
reviewContent: This was only our second trip with United, the first being a short LAX-PSP flight home after a European trip. All of our flights were on time, and I appreciated the text updates regarding our flight times, gate and boarding prompts. What I did NOT appreciate was a very simple thing. In order to buy a drink or food during a flight, it is required to input a credit card during online checkin. Which we did, and worked fine for 3 legs of our trip. Apparently, we fell off the system, and the flight attendant on the last leg was simply nasty about helping us with input. We finally gave up, and she literally threw the drinks at us, while saying “I’ll give you these, but you should know how to do this”. When I am spending $1200.00 dollars for a flight in Economy Plus just to obtain a decent seat, I expect and am entitled to polite service.

My worst flight experience was with United Airlines on July 21st. I had booked a flight from Ottawa to New Jersey because I had a business meeting scheduled for 12 noon. The flight was scheduled for 6 a.m., and I expected to arrive at 7 a.m., thinking I had enough time in case of any flight delays. However, my flight was delayed for 7 hours, and it didn't take off until 1:15 p.m. and the airport attendants informed us this was due to a fire extinguisher functionality. By the time I arrived at my destination, my business meeting had already concluded, rendering the entire trip pointless. Upon returning home, I promptly filed a compensation complaint. The response time to my complaint was disappointingly slow. I eventually received an email offering two options: a cash compensation of $600 or a travel voucher worth $1000, valid for 12 months. Since I had no immediate travel plans for the next year and the voucher would expire within 12 months, I opted for the cash compensation. I provided my address as requested for a check to be mailed out. To my surprise, I received a response from United Airlines stating that I did not qualify for the compensation option I had chosen. Instead, they offered a travel voucher worth $200. United Airlines claimed the flight was disrupted due to safety reasons, hence I do not qualify for compensation. This experience was incredibly frustrating and disappointing and I will not advise anyone to travel with United Airlines if you have an important appointment the same day.
This was the absolute most miserable flight. The seats were the smallest i have ever sat in and there was absolutely no leg room. The staff was very standoffish, not helpful at all.

commentHeader: impressed at the agents in Jamaica
reviewContent: At first I was really skeptical about this airline, but overall the cabin crew was okay. Not so much of the agents in Newark who were terrible and rude, no professionalism and customer service was shown. I was impressed at the agents in Jamaica especially one employee, Sashauna, super professional. She remained professional and calm and had the patience with me. I definitely recommend anybody to go to her for help she can multitask and super helpful. That’s the type of customer service we need in Newark we need more people like her.

commentHeader: tell you your bag is on another flight
reviewContent: Long travel day, they can't even be on time. Then you get to baggage claim just to have them tell you your bag is on another flight. Then you talk to a representative and they are rude to you.

Get any other airline, they'll delay you a few times then cancel and end up giving you a 15$ voucher for food as if that covers for a 5 hours of a delay. Every time I got on the plane they had mechanical issues and we had to wait for maintenance. It's a predatory airline that has no issue with taking your money and leaving you stranded. For your safety choose anyone else.

commentHeader: I just feel like I got robbed by them
reviewContent: They canceled my flight on June 18, 2023, due to their mechanical problem, and they asked us to pay for the hotel and meals ourselves first without any arrangements for that night. They gave us a paper and promised to pay for your hotel a maximum of USD$200 and plus $30 for 2 meals. My flight was delayed for 30 hours, so it should be 4 meals. (200+60) . After a couple of months of complaints and a lot of submissions. They replied they would credit me back $200 for my next flight. It's absolutely ridiculous! I just feel like I got robbed by them. They promised to reimburse me for the USD check instead of the certificate. They just keep telling lies to customers and I will never trust this airline. They feel they are so powerful, they do not refund you, and nothing you can do. Just bullying and lying to customers again and again. Taking this airline will make you spend a lot of extra time and money. I don't want their certificate, I just want my money back and never want to take this airline again!

A premium economy ticket comes with priority check in/bag drop and in Chicago priority access to security which saves time Especially when O’Hare is so busy. Boarding is organised and the staff are friendly and helpful. I am on the larger side so the premium economy seat is very comfortable, behind wider and with more leg room and the seat belt is longer so is more comfortable, however the fold out tray table could extend out a little further as it was just a little tight. The tv screen is of a good size and was easy to use and the supplied headphones were of good quality. The main fault with the seat is access to the power sockets and the headphone socket as they are under a flap in the armrest and behind you making it very hard to plug something in whilst seated. The seat is very comfortable and although limited the recline made it easy to sleep.The amenity set is pretty standard and you get a nice soft pillow and blanket. Being an early flight we were first served breakfast, later a snack and finally a hot lunch which were all pretty tasty, there were also hot and cold drinks at various intervals as well as water handed out. The cabin crew were friendly and efficient (although mainly older than usual). The flight was on time and all in all most enjoyable.

I'd never recommend flying with United. My most recent experience includes working with a United Agent to cancel a leg of my flight itinerary where I received explicit confirmation from them that I would receive a full refund on that leg of the flight. The disclaimer is that I would have to submit the official refund after I finished the return leg of my flight 10 days later. That's fine and I went forward with things. Fast forward to today where it has been 3 weeks since submitting the official refund request with screenshots of my previous conversation with the United agent, they denied my refund request and instead gave me a $150 credit, which is 25% of the value that I was promised. So highly disappointed knowing that United is okay with lying to customers. I would never have cancelled my flight had I known that I wasn't going to get reimbursed.

commentHeader: main meal was vegetarian or halal meat
reviewContent: I was flying from Houston to Munich on September 4th, 2023 Flight UA102 to Munich at 4:40 pm. The choice of the main meal was either vegetarian or halal meat. The passengers on the flight seemed to be regular Americans/Europeans who are used to eating regular meals. The mystery is why United Airlines caters to minorities of passengers who may not be even on the plane? Added deception: halal meal was not offered as halal but as regular chicken meal, "halal" was written on the label. I ended up choosing vegetarian.

commentHeader: No idea how to provide customer service
reviewContent: Ground staff in Denver are rude and abrupt. No idea how to provide customer service in this position. I found the staff in Calgary just as bad. Having worked for a major Australian airline I would highly recommend retraining the staff that are the face of your organisation. Having read previous reviews it would appear this is long overdue. Hope never having to be in a position where my family and I have to use this airline again.

route: Sydney to Toronto via San Francisco
reviewContent: I must confess after reading many of the comments here I thought concerned for buying a ticket on United to fly to SYD Australia from YYZ (Toronto) via SFO (San Francisco) to attend a conference. But the experience on United ended up being extremely good. From the moment I checked in online I was kept informed of my flights, luggage updates through automatic SMS service. My flight was combined between Air Canada from Toronto to San Francisco on Boeing 737 Max and Airbus A321 Neo from San Francisco to Toronto and United on B777-300 from San Francisco to Sydney and back. In Toronto at the beginning of my trip, I was not able to choose seats on United for some reason which was a bit disappointing. I approached United staff at Toronto as well, and they said they cannot help me but the staff in San Francisco can once I arrive there. This was correct, as upon landing in SFO I found United customer service counter and they assisted me with changing my seat which was my desired option. I was very happy with that. Upon boarding, headsets were given, and we pushed back slightly before schedule. The flight was simply perfect. The food was very tasty (unlike many negative comments I saw here) and on SFO- SYD flight we got drinks with a dinner (butter chicken and some delicious red wine), snack in the middle of the flight and a hot breakfast (I took a waffle) which was also delicious. The crew offered water and drinks numerous times during the flight, they also cleared the cabin again and again, so I never had any issues with garbage being not collected. The drinks were also available in the galley and pretzel snacks. The crew (two very sweet guys) were very chatty, friendly, and kind. Toilets were clean throughout the flight as well. Upon landing in Sydney, we reached the gate without issues, disembarked and the luggage was there shortly after. On the way back, it was a daily flight, the flight left the gate ahead of time as well, the crew were super friendly during boarding and gave alcoholic wipes for hand hygiene and headsets. Upon take-off, snacks and drinks were offered first, followed by lunch (creamy chicken with rice) and upon clearance they offered water bottles to all passengers. During the flight the crew were often seen in the cabin helping out and chatting with passengers. The rest of flight went really well as well. Entertainment was great both ways and free Whatsapp service was very much appreciated by me. All together, no complaints at all, United was extremely good for what I was expected and treated me very very well on my way to Australia and back. And the crew were stunning. I will 100% fly United again. Thank you United Airlines for such an amazing experience. (BS)

I recently had a flight with United Airlines departing from IAH to Newark, and I wanted to share my experience regarding one of the flight attendants. The flight attendant who was responsible for distributing cookies and snack boxes shortly after takeoff, left a lot to be desired in terms of customer service. Her demeanor throughout the interaction was quite unpleasant. When offering passengers the choice between a cookie or a snack box, including myself, she came across as curt and impatient. It became even more problematic when passengers had additional questions or hesitated in making their choice; she responded with visible annoyance, leaving passengers feeling embarrassed and disrespected. I understand that everyone has off days, and I am generally forgiving, but this incident crossed the line in terms of acceptable customer service. Flight attendants play a crucial role in ensuring a comfortable and safe flight experience for passengers, and their demeanor should reflect the airline's commitment to service excellence. Her attitude felt dismissive and, at times, borderline hostile. It raises the question of whether the airline thoroughly screens and trains its staff. I hope that United Airlines takes this feedback seriously and considers addressing this issue. It is instances like this that could make passengers like me hesitate to choose United Airlines in the future. I believe that some form of improvement plan or training would be beneficial for this flight attendant, ensuring a more positive experience for all passengers.
Pittsburgh to San Francisco. The seats promised a screen for entertainment and a place to charge electronic devices. Neither of those were provided. Very disappointing.

What is the deal with flight attendants? They have numerous staff seats however they decided to block off 6 passenger seats on a full capacity flight for their own use. I didn't realise that my $1300 ticket paid for their seats. One of the crew members decided to use those seats to take a nap on our 9 hour flight. They say you can't move seat because it's calculated on your weight and that's how the plane is balanced. They have no idea what customer service is.  Makes me never want to fly again. Dreadful experience!

commentHeader: I was wet and cold for over 10 hours
reviewContent: Service inflight was terrible. At the first meal they served I asked for a hot tea. While I was putting a cup in cup holder I bumped a cup on the table and spilt all over the blanket and into my lap, my pants and seat. Immediately I asked a flight attendant for something to wipe and another blanket. She said I'll be back to assist me after she put the cart back. I waited a while, I saw her take a cart away. She never came back to me, so I rang for help then waited, light went off but still no one came, I rang again, still no one came to assist me. I finally stopped one of the flight attendants and asked her for help. I explained what happened and need a another blanket. She told me that they don't carry any spare blanket but she will see if she can find something to help me but that was it. No one ever came back to help me. I was wet and cold for over 10 hours. I've been flying every year for about 20 years using ANA and United. This was worst experience ever.

On 9-25-2023 I was supposed to board flight 1186 from Dallas Texas to Chicago at 5:50pm it got delayed and every hour the employees will tell us another a hour and we will have a flight from 5:50 - til 11:30pm we were waiting with lies after lies telling us we have a flight coming they offered to change flight but had to be next day and a connecting flight which my flight was non stop. United is bad customer service at airport are mean and not very helpful.

route: San Diego to Berlin via Munich
reviewContent: 2 hours to get our reservation and another 2 hours to reserve our seats. So much confusion between United vs Lufthansa access to data, who to talk to for what, and fees paid to one airline do not cover the same services on the other airline. After paying for our reservation i received a call saying we need to pay to get seats on our flight even though I had paid for seats. By the time we are done we pay an additional $500 to get seats on the plane. They next want another $250 to allow our baggage to go straight through to our final destination. I paid the $500 and said I would carry my checked bags between segments of the flight and concluded that call. A few moments later, I got a second call saying we got disconnected and was told there was no record of the $500 payment I just made and had a verified email showing my payment. Next thing I know they have wheelchairs reserved for me and my wife which I cancelled. Seats that were reserved and paid for my me were repeatedly being taken away from us even though I had documentation showing they were assigned to us. Finally I got the seats assignments back and now I am told that airline policy is to send bags straight throw to the final destination.  Never will I fly United or segments of a trip supported by United. Its not worth the effort to fly.

commentHeader: They never respond to your request
reviewContent: They canceled my flight on June 18, 2023, due to their mechanical problem, and they asked us to pay for the hotel and meals ourselves first without any arrangements for that night. They said passengers can submit it to their website and be reimbursed it later. They never respond to your request. When you contact them, they will ask you to submit to many different departments and say your money can not be refunded. Hate this airline so much, just feel like they are a thief and have stolen money. It is the worst experience I had with an airline!

route: Vancouver to Tokyo via Los Angeles
reviewContent: They stole my money and ticket! This may happen to you as well! Avoid buying tickets from them if you want to avoid disasters. They canceled our return flight without even asking us! I booked my flight to Japan (Tokyo) with the United Airlines website. Their website offers a feature where you can "check" to see if there are any passport needs (Visas, approvals, etc.). We checked this for both me and my girlfriend and the website gave us the thumbs up to our trip which was supposed to be the next day. On the day of the flight, the person at the check-in refused to let my South Korean girlfriend in because she did not have an ESTA for entering the United States for our connecting flight. So we quickly sit somewhere and apply for the ESTA. But it gets approved after the gate has been closed. I called United to see if we could move our ticket and they replied saying that I had a "special" ticket. Meaning they could not move me to a later flight or offer me a refund. Even then I said fine, my fault, I should have checked. I paid an additional $2.6k for new tickets for a same-day flight with ANA (which were amazing by the way). However, ANA informed me that United may cancel our return flight. So I called them right away (about 1-2hrs after our original flight had taken off) and they said it's too late and they have already canceled the whole trip including our return tickets. I asked why and they said it's "just an automated system". I asked for our return tickets to be re-instated and they said I would have to pay them another $2.5k. Absolutely absurd. They basically took my money, their passport check service on their site is not reliable at all, and they canceled my entire trip without anything in return. I stayed on the call with the customer service trying to negotiate something but they did not offer me anything however the supervisor said to try asking for a refund through the site. Which I did and was refused right away. This is totally unacceptable procedure. You need to at least check in with me before canceling my return trip! In total I ended up paying $7k for tickets to Japan and back because of a stupid procedure and the incompetence of their web passport requirements check. Avoid at all costs. You may think this can't happen to you but I thought the same.

route: Rochester, NY to Green Bay, WI via Rochester
commentHeader: no one deserves to be treated the way we were
reviewContent: I took my sister to check in. She flies frequently on United and always gets a connecting boarding pass. The lady was very unfriendly and rude, refused to give her one, said the line was too long and turned her away, telling her she can get it herself when she gets off the plane in Chicago. There was 4 booths open and only 1 person behind her in line. We went to the next booth and was greeted by a very nice young man named Malik, who printed her pass for her, which took about 2 minutes. We will continue to use United because of Malik and other friendly customer service we've experienced, but no one deserves to be treated the way we were from the other lady, and if I see her there again, I will wait for the next person to check in.

The worst possible service. Flying from Philadelphia to Chicago. Plane kept delaying and delaying for 9 hours. No compensation or even apologies were given. Just voucher to buy snack ($15.00). Then on the way back I needed to change the dates - what I was offered was almost double the price of new ticket. As I was explained by supervisor named Gwen, United don't change Basic Economy ticket to the same. Only for Economy. Ended with buying new ticket for the half price of offered by United - funny, but also United flight. Will definitely try to avoid this company by any means. No wonder they have so many bad reviews.

The flight attendants were so rude, disrespectful, poor behaviour, unprofessional. The provided food were not even worse for the packaging and had been delivered in horrible manner. I asked for painkiller for headache and flight attendants repeated 3 times we do not have such a thing in this flight. The seat was uncomfortable and the back just moved 3cm. 5- I was the first one using the lavatory and smells like hell. Does not even have air refreshener.

Do not ever fly this corrupt airline! Me and my husband recently flew with them and due to delays, nothing which was our faults, we missed our connecting flight. They told us they could not get us on another flight so we were told to rent a car and they would reimburse us. We tripled checked with their customer service as we do not have the extra money for that. Well guess what they told us too bad, not their policy and they will not reimburse us so we are out over $200.  Worst customer service and airline I have ever dealt with! They should be ashamed

This is by far the most uncomfortable flight I've been on. The seats are made for skinny people and I'm not a big person but nor am I skinny. The snacks were horrible as well. Hopefully the last time I ever fly with United.

I have flown with Untied for years, I even have a United credit card, Hundreds of thousands of miles. I am canceling my card and if possible, never flying United again. They do not care about the customer; the miles have decreased so much they are basically worthless. 100,000 + miles and cash for a domestic flight. $1000 ticket and still want 50,000 miles and $150.00 to upgrade only half the flight. Save you time and money and fly with anyone else.

route: Denver, CO to Traverse city, MI
reviewContent: Awful experience. $400+ one way ticket from Denver to Traverse City. Flight was cancelled due to staffing issues (multiple texts and emails that said due to issues with staff). Waited on hold for over two hours before call dropped and in line at airport for over 3 hours before getting “help.” They didn’t offer a refund and if they had I’d have had no way to book at a reasonable price same day since they’d created an artificially inflated market for tickets by cancelling so many flights and leaving so many people stranded. They ended up putting me on a flight to Detroit which was 4+ hours away from where I paid them to get me without any reimbursement for lodging, rental car etc. That flight was then delayed multiple times. Spent an entire day at the airport waiting to get out and finally made it to Detroit at 3am when I was supposed to be in Traverse City at 2pm the day before. When I asked for a refund they told me my reservation had been fully used because they put me on a flight that was 1/4 the price of the one I booked when I was booking it. Eventually I got a whopping $150 credit that I have no intention of ever using. This all happened on the same day their CEO was flying in his private jet from between airports that they had hundreds of cancelled flights in that day alone (Newark to Denver). Stealing from your customers isn’t ok. If you take their money you need to provide what was paid for, if you can’t you owe them their money back.

commentHeader: only opening a couple of the available lanes
reviewContent: We always fly United and don't usually have any issues except with baggage. Getting through baggage drop off took 3 times longer than getting through security. It seems they are using the Walmart business model and only opening a couple of the available lanes. We chose the bag drop "short cut" thinking it would save time but guess again.

commentHeader: the most disgusting breakfast I have ever seen
reviewContent: First flight out of Orange County to connect with Heathrow flight from ORD. I paid for a first class full fare domestic one-way on United. First Class was full, as usual, with the upgraded Mileage Plus passengers, which I don't object to. However, the stewardess serving in First Class was rude, attired in a dirty, rumpled uniform, and served the most disgusting breakfast I have ever seen. It was described as some kind of omelette, but was in fact some kind of yellow slop. The stewardess acted if she was doing us a favour by serving coffee. This is precisely what happens when there is so little competition amongst airlines in the USA. Long gone are the days of the "Friendly Skies". This particular class of service on UAL should be described as "No Class", and was most certainly not even close to a First Class Service. I would recommend avoiding United Airlines if you can possibly do so; however, don't expect domestic US airlines to be much better. What happened to enthusiastic, courteous, American hospitality? Simply the worst!

route: Auckland to Cancun via San Francisco
reviewContent: What a shambles of an airline. Flight was delayed due to a problem on the airlines end. We ended up missing our connecting flight to our final destination, resulting in a complete loss (and rebooking of much more expensive options) of our booked transport and accommodation costing us a whole lot of money and one whole day of our holiday. When contacted was met with resistance followed by a mere 150 dollar credit offer, which would have barely covered a one way trip of the booked transport. This gesture although something, barely constitutes a sorry and feels like a pat on the back I. The scheme of things. Avoid United at all costs!

We paid for the seats 3 months before the flight. So that we had them and not get assigned for free in the airport. On Zurich to SFO United agents had us check in our carry ons because our paid for seats had no overhead storage. Because that box was locked and assigned for the crew only! Shame on you UA, selling seats knowing they do not have an overhead storage! And charging extra for that “privilege”. You did not sell them cheaper, we had no idea there will be no storage. During the flight, the passenger ahead of me reclined fast and spilled the water the attendant just provided in a cup, not a bottle! All on my lap. I had to stay soaking wet. UA had no solution to this problem. They shrugged their shoulders and stated exactly that: “not my problem”. On top of everything, all 3 checked in luggage we had with us was lost. UA had clue where they were for days. Athens? Zurich? It was an absolute nightmare to try to contact any of their agents, I was in queue to get a call from them for 4 hours and when they were “connecting” me, they disconnected … and nobody called back. It was the worse experience ever, they were doing a horrible job in all aspects. I suggest they start carrying more about their customers than other… PC issues. As far as it is right now, we will never use UA again and we advise anyone to find alternatives!

commentHeader: all the airline is offering me is a $50 credit
reviewContent: I paid for a direct flight both ways and on my return flight it was delayed by hours and then we were rerouted to Houston. I was scheduled to get to Newark around 7pm and didn't arrive till 3am. I missed work and my ride home and all the airline is offering me is a $50 credit.

route: Newark to Kansas City via Houston
reviewContent: United wrecked 2 days' of business productivity, because United didn't have a high enough capacity utilization for the flight, and canceled it hours before I appeared at the airport. And canceled 4 other flights that I know of at the same time.  Hundreds of other United customers were left waiting for hours, and stranded, I was in line with them.  United didn't even book other available flights on other airlines to replace their canceled flight, they refused to bear that expense, because I was a "Basic Economy" flyer.   That has ruined my confidence in being able to use  United again.  Really bad decision, to sacrifice customer's confidence in the airline to satisfy their commitments to paid customers, all for cost cutting.  No other airline was canceling flights at EWR that evening. United is finished, in my eyes. I flew on Delta, and back on United, and had to endure long stops back, originally was a direct flight. United was a really poor experience.

route: Salt Lake City to Traverse City
commentHeader: Never have I had such little information
reviewContent: I got an updated email saying my gate had been changed and to be there at 9:57am. I was there at 9:48 only to find out boarding stopped. No boarding time as in my email, no arrival time was in my email, only 9:57 which was 10 minutes after they closed the doors. Never have I had such little information given in an email, never have I been expected to know information regarding travel that wasn’t readily available in the email, never have I been treated like a fool for misunderstanding departure time vs boarding time, even though boarding time was not updated in the email, I will not book a flight with United knowing what I know now. Delta has always taken great care of me and made all travel times very clear in every email or update.

Aside from United Airlines being the most uncomfortable airline to fly, they have staff that are disrespectful, rude, loud, unhelpful and unprofessional. I flew from Houston to Toronto flight # UA313, my seat number was 22C. Since my seat row did not have a charging connection and the seat 21D was vacant, I decided to use my phone charger to charge my phone. Cabin crew Kim passed by and saw me sitting on the seat charging my phone and she said loudly and rudely that I was not supposed to sit on seat 21D and that I should get back to my seat. I told her I was just charging my phone and it was empty, she walked away, and sent another flight attendant Jim, the flight attendant was equally disrespectful, rude, loud and unprofessional, told me to get up go to my seat. He said if I wanted to continue to sit on the seat that I should pay the upgraded charge. I requested him to let me at least use the phone charger so I could charge my phone and he rudely said no. He said I pay the upgraded fee and only then I could use the charging socket to charge my phone. It was not what they said that was upsetting, but how disrespectfully, rudely and loudly they said it that really was very upsetting. Very disappointed with United Airlines.

Worst experience in the last three DECADES, will never fly United airlines again, terrible service, terrible flight, over 30 people couldn't eat for 6 hours because they didn't download the APP, landed and UNITED employees could not provide services for transportation to a terminal that is over a mile away, I broke both legs in the army, and had to walk 45 minutes to my gate, because they said "The cart can't go to that terminal, there's a tunnel, so you have to walk." This airline is a disgrace to the industry.

I bought a round way ticket from Denver to Las Vegas. I missed my outbound flight to Las Vegas. After speaking to an agent by phone, while still at the airport, I was able to get on the following flight. A few days later, as my return flight was approaching, I hadn't received a notification to check in. After holding for about 45 minutes with United customer service, I was told my return flight had been canceled. United did not have any explanation for canceling my return flight. I certainly didn't cancel my return flight. United said my only option to fly to Denver that day was to purchase a $1500 first class ticket. I could not afford a $1500 ticket. I had to purchase a new ticket to Denver for the next day. This caused me to spend nearly $600 for the new ticket and hotel for one more night. After several emails to United, all they offered me was 300 in credits that would expire in one year. My total expenses were nearly $1000. I explained I don't travel often and the credits have no value to me. They said there was nothing more they could offer. My original round trip flight was $400. Because United mistakenly canceled my flight I ended paying $600 to get back to Denver. They obviously don't care about retaining customers. They are the worst airline.

I flew with United over Christmas of 2022. They forced me to gate check my carry on bag. The flight ended up getting cancelled and they refused to give back the gate checked bags. They ultimately lost my bag and I filed a claim for it. I have had to chase and follow up for months since. First, they tried to lie and say that the bag was found and returned to me, which it had not. Once that was clarified, they confirmed that they will refund the money for what was in the bag. This was meant to have been paid out in May. I have been chasing since. I got off a call with them now and they again have lied saying that the refund claim should have been in my account in July, which it has not. United is known for losing bags, but their support to claim back their lost luggage is atrocious. Do not fly with them.

Departure from EWR on 09/09/2023 @ 7:45AM (UA1126)  Return from RDU on 09/10/2023 @ 6:03Pm (UA1393) We were supposed to fly from EWR to RDU to attend a family wedding in NC. Couple of days before the flight, we got an email stating that we could change to a different flight and get seats for free. We declined it because we had to leave that morning since the wedding was that afternoon.
