When we reached the airport and tried to check-in, we shockingly discovered that United cancelled our ticket without notifying us and put us in the next day morning flight. A customer service lady checked my email confirmation but then said that we had changed the dates. We refused that outright saying it was just not possible! At the end we missed our flight and the wedding. We drove almost 25 miles to the airport, paid for daily parking and rental car at RDU, all which were not refunded. Very disappointed! Shame on United Airlines! They deserve a 0 rating!

Paid for a preferred seat but they totally ignored my seat preference. When I spoke to the lady at the counter she just said "too bad, full flight, just go online and get a refund". Only saving grace was they had a nice lady in united club at SFO named Melissa who helped me get my original seat back.

commentHeader: They do not honor their word
reviewContent: I paid for round trip first class tickets. They put me in economy for most the trip. Said there were other people ahead of me. How is that when I paid 6 weeks in advance for my ticket? Then when I asked them to reimburse the difference between economy and first class (not the whole trip) they refused. They do not honor their word when you purchase a ticket and will not make the mistake right. Do not fly this airline. This was my first time traveling by myself and it was a special present for myself and that absolutely ruined it.

This was absolutely the worst airline experience I've ever had. Followed by the previous United flight. Each time I flown with this Airline they have left the terminal late and have always had some lame excuse as to why. Ranging from insufficient workers at the baggage system to unproperly loaded planes with too much weight on one end or the other. I am done spending my money with these people, why wouldn't I just pay for a no problems and on time Delta ticket?

The worst experience of my life. The staff are tremendously helpful, however after canceling my flight I've been trying to reach out to customer service with no luck. The phone call is currently at 35:02. It is funny after trying not to use United, they were forced upon me because of technical issues with Air Canada. This has been the worst experience of my life I'm stuck in New Jersey and cannot get any assistance.  But the staff in the airport do a great job this is clearly management issue and most likely just a greedy company that doesn't care about it consumers.

commentHeader: asked me to check in my carryon
reviewContent: I was boarding my flight from Santa Ana to Denver. I have a connecting flight from there with a transit time of 2 hrs. I was carrying 1 carryon suitcase for 3 people and the people checking by tickets for boarding asked me to check in my carryon suitcase. I refused because I have medicines and valuable stuff. They said I won't be able to board my flight if I don't checkin my suitcase. Luckily some staff came to my help and asked me to carry my suitcase into the flight. Worst staff and I will never fly United airlines again.

commentHeader: they cannot refund my hotel and meals
reviewContent: My original flight was on June 18, 2023, at 3:45 pm. United Airlines canceled the flight due to mechanical issues. All the passengers were in the aircraft without food or drink for more than 5 hours. After that, they asked us to pay for the hotel and meals. They mentioned that we can reimburse it through united.com/feedback. My flight was delayed for 30 hours, and they rescheduled it for June 19, 2023, at 9:45 p.m. I submitted all the receipts once I came back to Canada, but I never received any refund. I contacted them many times, but they will ask you to submit in different areas on the website again and again. I called them again, and they emailed me and said my ticket is non-refundable so they cannot refund my hotel and meals fees. It is absolutely a dishonest airline! They have no responsibility and telling lies to customers. I will never want to retake this airline.
Boarded plane on time. Then told we cannot take off on time because we do not have a pilot. Wait for a pilot for two hours. Will never again fly United.

Tried to use rewards. I got screwed out of 75,000 rewards. That was my original sign up bonus. Somehow it got lost. Good luck trying to get somebody you can talk to. I will not fly United again unless I have no choice and getting rid of their credit card as soon as possible

On September 5, United Airlines, experienced a systemwide technology issue, and that prompted them to request the FAA for a Nationwide ground stop out of an abundance of caution. Onboard my flight to Houston we were affected by this, United handled it the best possible way. From the moment it happened, the pilot kept us informed, the flight attendants immediately started serving cold iced water, and within 35 minutes we were given the option to deplane and stay inside the concourse where it was cooler. The entire incident only made us arrive 48 minutes later than scheduled to Houston. Kudos to United for the professional and humane way everyone was treated, no one onboard complained or created an scene as United was on top of everything. Once up in the air, I have to say that the flight and the service was friendly, fast, and efficient. I would like to continue to share how much I enjoyed this flight onboard a two-year-old 737MAX. It truly is a fabulous airplane. Thank you United for doing the right thing for all of us onboard but most importantly, for taking us safely from Philadelphia to Houston.

Worst experience in my life. First the luggage space was not arranged good, most of the people couldn't fit their bags in. The screens were not working, it was a 7-8 hour flight? Come on you could've checked if it was working. The whole plane froze to death they let the ac on the whole flight.

commentHeader: delayed and cancelled 3 times in a row
reviewContent: I was delayed and cancelled 3 times in a row in less than 24 hours. I missed 2 whole days of work. I flew to LA on a family emergency. But on the way home the delayed my flight 3 times.

Horrible airline, the worst customer service of any airline I’ve ever flown. I’m on a empty flight and the arrogant attendee would not let anyone sit on the emergency row just because they feel the power to decline a request.

commentHeader: last time flying with this airline
reviewContent: We booked flights with United airlines via Expedia for our vacation for the first time. I won’t recommend this airline to anyone at all. On our way to Cancun the plane took off late doing late boarding and delaying for “cool off”. Also, there is no need for me to talk about providing no service, food, etc. The worst part was on our way back we had a connection flight from Houston to Vancouver with a layover of 1:40. Our plane landed on time but we couldn’t get off since “another plane was parked at our gate!” We got stuck in the plane for 20 minutes and considering clearing customs and security we missed our flight. The next flight for us was departing in 14 hours and guess what, they provided us water bottles and toothpaste after that we complained about an hour. The flight that we missed took off 6 minutes early. We were having a blast during this vacation until United ruined it all. I’m writing this from airport 3:09 a.m. and this definitely will be our last time flying with this airline.

commentHeader: Check in and flight staff- just horrible
reviewContent: I will NEVER use this airline again! The attitudes of the Check in and flight staff- just horrible! When I purchased tickets, they switched first and last names. When I tried to check in, I’ve got a pile of criticism for that and the agent blamed me for some body’s mistakes. I’ve tried to explain but she didn’t want to hear it. I said I don’t like her attitude, then she said - well, don’t use this airline then. Moreover, when I’ve got on the plane a flight attendant showed her terrible attitudes towards me when I’ve asked if I can sit on the row next to me (the plane was half empty). People, what’s wrong with this airline? If you don’t want to be harassed, choose a different airline!

route: Berlin to New York LaGuardia via Dulles
commentHeader: the worst flying experience of my life
reviewContent: I feel like I was just robbed of 400€. This is the worst flying experience of my life. United canceled my flight. My entire flight. All of my return flights in 2 weeks. I called them within minutes of the cancelation email begging to either get a refund for their cancellation or for them to put me back onto the return flights. The manager Joseph refused to help me. He refused to put me back onto the return flight and he refused to offer me a refund.

Both myself and my 4 year old daughter have been at the airport for 12 plus hours by now only to get on the airplane and then be told to get off again! This is unacceptable, we were just told they were supposed to provide food voucher and nothing was provided. No one answers the phone and no one has come out to speak to any of the passengers. Our flight was 3146 to Greenville, SC and what was supposed to be a 2 hour flight turned into 12 hours of hell. Never again with this airline!

I flew alone with 3 small children and the entire crew including the pilots were fantastic and incredibly attentive to any needs we had. My kiddos are so excited they got to meet the pilots! It was the highlight of their trip so far. I was very impressed with this flight. Keep up the good work!

After some technical issues to be solved resulting in a two hours delay (we were kept well informed and though I wasn’t happy, these things might happen, so no complaints on this), I had an excellent flight. The seating in a 1-1-1 configuration is outstanding, the distance to the screen and what was offered on show was good and the catering and its quality was definitely appropriate to the duration of the flight. Had a good sleep of about four hours on this short transatlantic hop.

Boarding was efficient. Onboard a comfortable seat but that was it. I understand that on a flight of just over one hour a full meal service isn’t possible (well some time ago it was, guess this is a complete different chapter) but at least you would expect to get your drinks in a proper glass and not plastic cups. Flight was not at all turbulent, so it seems to be a standard rather than a safety precaution. I like flying with United but this really was a disappointment.

On July 10th my fiancé booked my flight and paid an additional $150 to put my seats next to her and my in-laws after already paying $350 for the ticket itself. I had to book my flight to match hers at a later date due to the uncertainty I would have the time off. When approved we booked and prepaid instantly. Here we are on August 29th having extreme difficulties getting the seat we prepaid for. Unprofessional and unacceptable they would change my seating to a different seat to prioritize another party, they assumed I was a solo ticket due to not purchasing mine in a group at the time my fiance made her purchase with my in-laws. When all 7 of us arrived at the Eugene airport for booking they printed my tickets and it showed the seats I had prepaid for. After going through the boarding and weighing/loading my luggage I received an email stating they changed my seat. I tried to correct it there but was told there is nothing they could do and to talk to the attendant at the gate, at the gate I was told I needed to speak to the attendants at the SFO airport. Upon arrival I had to wait until 9:33pm before I could try to correct my abrupt and unapproved seat change for my flight that boards at 10:55pm. When I was finally able to speak to Mark I was told it was too late to change my seat due to the flight being overcrowded. Again unprofessional they would change my prepaid seat on my flight to prioritize another party. United Airlines are uncooperative unwilling to assist in correcting their own mistakes and would rather direct me to call United Airlines for a refund. I can't tell anyone what to do but I can say this is not the flight company to fly with. They do not care about customer service, the people paying their bills by booking these flights and paying extra for specific seats. Overall dissatisfied with the airline, the attendants and the disrespect I received. For this specific air trip I prepaid for seat 29B and was moved to seat 31E. Fiancé, uncle and mother in laws seats were 28 A,B and C.

Poor experience with what had been a favorite. I have not flown in years & it seems United Airlines is far worse than any other airlines I have flown with. Before my flight, I had issues as they erased all of my frequent flier miles from the past. Flight date came around & I purchased roundtrip flight from PHL to KOA, with a stop in Chicago. On the date of my flight, all flights from Philadelphia to Chicago was canceled due to weather. I understand weather is out of their control, however the ticket clause & when purchased these tickets, I was guaranteed a partial or full refund. No flight had been rebooked when I logged into my app at 404am. My flight was set for 6:25am. The only option I was given was for "full price" of both of my tickets. I was on my way to the airport to catch the only connecting flight to Kona on 7/29, which was an American flight. During this duration I attempted to speak with an agent & after sitting on hold 15+ min, I hung up. I ended up selecting the full refund option around 550am, as the ticket clause reflects options may be removed after the time of departure of original flight. Decided I would just call in after my trip & repurchase tickets, since their flight clause clearly outlines this may occur at no additional cost or fees. After my flight home I immediately contacted support. I record all phone calls with all support centers, as I work in a call center/understand ins & outs. I was told to put in a request thru their system, as this is the only way. Since initial flight was canceled the system said "error." I used my new flight details & I was denied.

Just curious if anyone else has booked tickets, confirmed their seating assignments for all tickets to keep them together at the time of booking. Then reconfirmed them at check-in then reconfirmed them again upon checking luggage to only have some “genius” at United to prioritize someone else being together over your confirmed ticketed seats? Well just happened and I can’t say that United hasn’t steadily gone down hill well really since the old Continental days. Something N.E. who was obviously too lazy to book their tickets and confirm seating with them obviously went to a gate agent that felt it was more important for these parties to be seated together than me and my party. Not that I wouldn’t have considered moving if it was warranted but to have a gate agent just arbitrarily make the decision to split my ticketed seats up so that someone else could sit together is well ridiculous. But then again we are in the world of everyone gets a trophy and there is obviously no reason to incentivize booking and confirming seating. Maybe next time I will just see if I can get some gate agent to kick someone from first class because we’ll I deserve it more than they do or at least in my honest opinion I do.

route: Delhi to Dallas via New York
reviewContent: Pathetic customer service and they even don't listen customer complaint correctly. I requested multiple times to get recorded conversation i had with customer care. But they are not providing it.

Completely over United. Customer service is trash. Got told in Denver I couldn't change my flight directly to Alaska even though they had room I had to go land in Denver, fly to Chicago, then to Alaska. All together 15hrs from the time I left home. No other airline has ever had an issue with me doing this. Not to mention you have to fight to get your travel points, app is so trash you can't even use your points on the app you literally have to go on a laptop. God forbid you attempt to contact customer service and need help because that an entirely different issue. All around worst airline. And no it's not like I have flown with them once or twice - every single time I fly with united some issues arise.  If you book with United do expect anything other than going from one point on the map to the next. And pray everything goes perfectly because people don't do their jobs here clearly.

commentHeader: An absolute disaster of an airline
reviewContent: An absolute disaster of an airline. Original flight at 11pm from Newark to London canceled after keeping us on the plane for an hour, then deplaning for an hour, then reboarding for an hour and finally cancelling us at 2.35 am! Chaos at the terminal after. Rebooked onto a flight at 6am to Washington and then a 8.25 am to Heathrow. Still waiting to push back from Washington and the crew just told us the entertainment is broken on the entire plane. Nightmare. No compensation. No free wifi to apologize for the lack of entertainment. Awful.

I am pleased with United Airlines. On our return home, we were delayed because of storms in Chicago. The agents were very helpful and polite. They were kind to everyone. It was pretty stressful and they offered to assist in getting hotel rooms etc. While I was waiting in line to get my connecting flight figured out, I signed onto the website and was able to complete everything using the chat agent. It was so helpful. I also got online and booked a hotel room that had a shuttle service and we didn't have to wait for the personal agent. Yes, it was very inconvenient but they did their best to help us and they gave free snacks while we waited to see if the flight was going to be canceled. I am very pleased it all worked out and the next day it all went smoothly. The plane also had free movies for my kiddo which kept him entertained.

commentHeader: not humane and did not help
reviewContent: I have a severe and deadly tree nut allergy, and on the flight to Kauai from Denver they served a cashew bar with their lunch to everyone on the plane. I started to feel itchy on my skin and throat from the cashew particles after people opened them, so I stood at the back of the plane for 2 hours to let it subside. Luckily, I wasn’t exposed to enough particles to initiate an anaphylactic reaction. During my vacation, I called United and requested tree nut bars to not be on my flight back, but the agent kept robotically repeating that they can not guarantee nuts won’t be on the plane. The response was not humane and did not help whatsoever, which was very frustrating and disheartening to hear as I could die if the anaphylactic reaction is severe enough that even epinephrine or Benadryl could not stop the reaction while in the air over the Pacific Ocean. When I got to the airport to get on the flight back, I talked to the flight attendants and they told me a macadamia nut bar was being served and that it was part of the catering and could not be removed. They told me that all they could do was ask people around me to not open them, but still had to serve them to everyone due to policy, and that I would have to fly at my own risk and there was nothing else they could do. I could not cancel as I had to return home at that time and probably could not get a refund anyway. I wore a mask during the flight, did not eat anything, and was nervous and anxious the entirety of the flight. This experience was very surprising as tree nut allergies are becoming increasingly common. If you have a tree nut allergy, I would advise you to fly other airlines with better policies and more humanity, such as Delta.

At Chicago, I was offered to have my hand luggage checked-in free-of-charge since the flight was full. I flew from Chicago to Dublin. But at Dublin airport, they have charged for an extra luggage for my Icelandair flight using the credit card that I used to book my air ticket. This was without my knowledge or authorization. So, never trust these people and try to get a written note with their name and ID to file a claim.

Terrible flight experience. The aircraft remained at the gate with no air conditioning for 45 minute after the scheduled departure time. The flight crew gave no PA communication as to what the reason was, they kept repeating the same standard lines of fastening your seat belts which just further aggravated passengers.

Flight was delayed for no reason. No communication given to passengers. Gate changed with no notification from the airlines. No customer service to speak of. No actual details to speak of nor context as to why we are waiting. No support from United nor affiliates. No communication from gate attendants or flight staff at the gate. Passengers are continually being ignored and dismissed by gate and flight representatives. If it wasn't required I would drive.

On a 777-200 they should provide you with TVs and there were no TVs, except for those who flew in first class or business class had a whole bunch of TV shows to watch and they got WIFI for free. But sitting in the back of the plane had nothing to watch. They also, said my dad did not pre order food for us, so we had to wait 3 hours before we got any sort of water or food, this is rude because people in economy class have to wait forever. This is rude and not ok for a major airline to do this on a 5 hour flight. It was nice having 1 person who cared for our whole family and I am thankful for this.

Everything went wrong with the flight, my son & I were waiting in Paris CDG for our flight UA55 that takes off at 01:10 pm to Newark NJ, I received a text message that it would be delayed & would get an update by 02:30 pm, at 02:40 pm they announced that the flight was cancelled & to go get the luggage and head to hall 3, that's when the nightmare started. I went to the UA desk two ladies said there was no need to take the luggage it would be put in the next flight. In hall 3 it was chaos, We waited in the line to 07:00 pm then we got on the bus to the hotel, there we were told that the driver took us to the wrong hotel that has the same name, so we had to go on our own to the other hotel. At the hotel, the WIFI was down and I found out that the phone number they provided us with to call for a reservation was wrong We didn't have a sim card because we were transiting through Paris. The next day the bus took us to the wrong terminal. When we finally got to Newark, there was no luggage, I waited to Friday from Saturday I still haven't received anything, One suitcase arrived damaged and no refund. UA partners with Air Algerie, witch is notorious for delays, as were delay on our departure flight from Rome to Algiers, one luggage didn't arrive and it turned out it was sent from Newark to London instead of Rome by UA crew, I went back 04 times to the airport to get the luggage witch killed my vacation plan Conclusion: I will never travel again with United Airlines

Will never fly United again. Flight was delayed 2 hours from Seattle to Chicago which caused us to miss our connecting flight to Cedar Rapids. I had to work the next day so we had to rent a car for over $500 to drive home 3+ hours to the airport. Then when we tried to get our money back for it, they only credited us a $100 on each of our tickets and refused to pay for the car rental. Ended up getting home at 2:30am and had to be up for work at 5. You lost 3 customers that travel dozens of times a year.

2nd leg of a trip back to Chicago from Athens, stopover in Montreal, then flight to Chicago. 7 of us (family) were traveling. Boarded the plane headed to Chicago (Thursday night), sat for 30+ minutes at gate, then pilot announced a 'mechanical problem' and then said even if we got another flight he and his crew would not be flying us (over his allotment?). we de-planed and queued up at gate to find out how United (and Air Canada as United proxy) were going to get us home. after an hour wait, we got to gate attendant who said they do not re-book at the gate (weird, because every other airline I've had to make alternative arrangements through, does it at the gate), she gave us a hotel voucher (for one night) and told us to call the number on the business cards they had at the desk. United was ZERO help in getting us home, much less quickly. we were stranded in Montreal until Sunday morning, United has refused to reimburse us for the extra $1500 in expenses we were forced to pay for hotels (Friday/Saturday) and food for 7 for 3 days. Will obvioulsy nevwr fly United again, they are by far the worst airline for actually having planes fly to their designated destination. Horrible experience as it happened and then again when United refused to do the right thing and fully reimburse us

0/10 I would NOT recommend flying with United Airlines. My flight supposed to be NONSTOP to RDU airport. First of all my flight was delayed for an hour. When we boarded the plane we didn’t take off until 30 mins later. I received a notification stating my flight has been modified meaning we had to make a stop at Washington IAD. When we get there I was notified that my flight came in late which made me miss my flight to RDU airport. I’m highly disappointed with United Airlines for their lack of communication and sense of urgency. But I thank they lady at customer for service for booking me a flight back home nonstop. Next time I’m flying with DELTA one of the best.

This flight was cancelled and we were out on the next day. We were to have only 2 nights in San Fran and ended up with only one but still had to pay 2 nights hotel. A week later we flew to New York from Vegas. Flight was supposed to depart at 1050pm ended up departing next day at 8am. This airline also over sold tickets by 19 seats and threatened that they would not leave unless 19 volunteered to go on another date. I’m doubtful that our flight on Thursday will actually depart

commentHeader: service as terrible as this experience was
reviewContent: The flight was delayed a total of 6-hours, and though there was decent communication about the delay, the timeliness as well as reasons for the delay remain unknown. The delay first started as a 30-min delay from 12:45pm to 1:15pm, then it delayed further to 2pm, 3pm, 5::15, and finally to 6:15pm. During this entire ordeal no reasons were provided and the gate attendants were all but useless. Speaking of the gate area - the seats at OIA used by United are quite possibly the most uncomfortable seats ever created. I find it unbelievable that they would choose such uncomfortable seating - truly a disservice to their paying customers. Once were were able to begin boarding, the gate attendants provided very little in the form of communication - the did the minimum necessary which was announce the group numbers and nothing else. It was as if they were simply trying to take all the irate passengers in the concourse and pawn them off to the flight attendant staff. That they did very well. On the plane, it became evident that both the flight crew and attendant staff were frustrated as well. They did not put their best face forward as the pilot sounded very terse in the few announcement he made, and the flight attendants only handed out the complimentary snacks to less than half of coach. This occurred because of mild turbulence they sat through for what was honestly only 10-minutes. Once we were riding on clean air, they resumed only to hand out small cups of water - a disservice to the paying customers on the flight. Furthermore, it was this same flight attendant staff that confidently proclaimed the baggage claim area to go to after disembarking. Only to find out they sent us to the wrong baggage claim area. This of course added to the frustration of the entire experience with United. Moving forward, I will make every effort to never flight United again - I can certainly make that choice for my personal trips and will lobby at my place of employment to seek other airlines for future travel on work-related business. Given all the choices that exist, there should be no room for such service as terrible as this experience was.

route: Las Vegas to Nice via Newark
commentHeader: makes it tough to make a claim
reviewContent: I recently took a family vacation in Italy and United Airlines lost my bags! Its an all too familiar story of the same situation, but with a different passenger. As my son and I got to the airport in Las Vegas, we were headed to Newark, Nice, France then Venice, Italy to start our trip. As we checked our bags at the United counter in Las Vegas, we saw our bags tagged by the agent, then placed on the luggage belt to our destination (Las Vegas to Newark, Newark to Nice), where we would collect our bags and stay a night before our month long vacation and journey to Italy the next day. When we arrived in Nice, we uncomfortably had to file an airport reference claim when none of our bags showed up. After our night in Nice, we were starting our family vacation to Venice, which was supposed to be our first destination. Our luggage never made it. We had no clothes, or items that we packed for our trip. We trusted United Airlines. We were told our bags were stuck in Newark and they would be on the next flight to Nice. However, we were now supposed to be in Venice! We changed our flights, changed our cities and called many times just to be misdirected by the airlines. They gave us the run around. United lied and told us our bags were now going to catch up with us in Nice, then Naples. This literally went on for 4 weeks. Everything we did to call United, email, and text them, was a waste of time & a whole lot of money. They misled us because in reality the airline never really knew where our bags were. We incurred thousands of dollars in expenses, we lost thousands of dollars of our personal belongings, all to come home at the end of the month in June to bags that remain gone. We called everyday and United told us a different city, country, & state each time. We still have no bags now its two months later. The aggravation, energy, and money spent by us outweighs the mistake. Its unbelievable that in this day and age United (or any airline) still doesn't have a better system. Now, two months later, they told us to file a claim. We've had to deal with the major inconvenience of losing money with extra changes, travel expenses, replacing whatever items were most important, and time spent that we lost while dealing with the airline. The hold times we spent on the phone overseas and after our vacation to the dysfunctional people who misled us at United Airlines, etc. When we were told to make a claim I have to say, United Airlines makes it tough to make a claim easily. The website is flawed, there isn't enough room for our information and/or receipts (they allow you to upload 10 receipts for reimbursement only). United makes it so tough to make a proper claim which is a tactic to deter travelers from even making one. They do this to frustrate an already extremely frustrated passenger so they can cover their own asses. Its inconvenience at its best. Then, they tell you you'll need to wait up to 10 weeks for your claim to be answered. By then, your loss is already in the thousands. After all of the drama, lies, misleading information, you'll get exhausted and the trip basically (no matter how beautiful) is tainted and thats all you really remembered in the end. Its unfair! Its violating. It is inconvenient and not worth it. United Airlines is totally at fault. We were even told at one time that our bags were in Minnesota, then Houston. Come on! Brand new cities that we never even traveled to on a daily basis. United get it together!

commentHeader: charged me full flight change fee
reviewContent: I had to change flight due to visa issue. I had a return trip from Chicago with multiple airlines. American gladly change its leg of trip without any extra cost. But United Airlines did not give any consideration and charged me full flight change fee plus price difference. If you have a choice, one is better with American airline.

commentHeader: cancelled my flight an hour before take off
reviewContent: United cancelled my flight an hour before take off. They gave me another flight the next day with one stop at Denver. I arrive at Denver when I was informed my send leg of the flight is cancelled. They gave a third booking for the next day that was also cancelled. I finally was able to get on a plane on standby. Basically a 5 hours flight turned in to 74 hours. If this is not enough I learned that my return flight was canceled as part of the first cancellation without letting me know. Very frustrating. I will NEVER fly with United Airline again, regardless of how much discounted their prices will be.

commentHeader: canceled both flights that we had planned
reviewContent: This trip was our first time flying with United Airlines, and they canceled both flights that we had planned. This had not only happened when we were going on our vacation but also when we were returning back to our home. This had been the worst experience flying we have ever had, we never had this problem with any other airline. We won't ever again fly with United Airlines.

commentHeader: credit instead of my money back
reviewContent: I was on my way to the Airport when I got a call from my husband saying he had a heart attack and I had to go to the hospital. I miss my plane and then I call the plane people to say that I wanted to refund. And they told me that they would give me flat credit instead of my money back and I told them that I didn't won't fly credit because I wouldn't be flying out again because I have to take care of my husband. They said that doesn't matter, that's the only thing they can do. Good luck if you ever fly United Airlines getting a refund from them if you have a very bad emergency.

Never again. We booked first class on a 530 am flight. We got a text after we woke up at 230 saying the flight was cancelled. They rebooked on an afternoon flight which was then delayed. We originally had a direct flight to Denver but had to connect through San Francisco. The second delay caused us to miss our connection in San Francisco. The United staff were deliberately obtuse when we called and acted like it was no big deal. United then had the nerve to book us in coach but refused to refund the difference between coach and first class.

Worst experience ever with the ground staff. We landed from Delhi to Toronto at 5:36 am and had our connecting flights with United airlines. We were at the gate since morning and they did not allow us to board. They said unable to find your seat, I showed them our boarding pass and had web checked in. They said they have internal issues. Then said flight is full. My child was with me and he said how come you are still allowing boarding. Then they closed the gate and said you were not here in time. How come others were still allowed to board the flight.  We were not given any flight and stuck in Toronto for 2 days with child. It is the worst nightmare ever .

commentHeader: obviously don’t put their customers first
reviewContent: United Airlines caused our trip disruption a few weeks ago and talked us into flying into another airport in another state. They then said we could rent a car to get us back to our destination airport and that they would reimburse us for the rental and gas. I filed all the forms with United Airlines and submitted receipts which were just below $600. What did they do? They gave us a $200 flight credit. Are you kidding me? We will no longer fly United Airlines and cancel our credit cards and anything else associated with United Airlines. My friends, if you must fly, avoid United Airlines as they obviously don’t put their customers first. Feel free to share this to help others avoid the same problem. #unitedairlines

I booked United Airline flight for my mother because it was direct flight from India to USA & certainly most costly. She doesn't understand English & she is 70 year old so requested for wheelchair assistance & united airline assured me that she will get wheelchair. I stay in Dallas, she was flying back to Delhi via New York on July 28. When she was about to land in New York at 7 pm EST we got message that her next flight from New York to Delhi is cancelled. After coming out of flight she didn't even get wheelchair assistance. Some other passenger helped her to change the terminal, after reaching on terminal C she was all alone. She called me & I told her to give phone to some Airline person so that I can talk. She requested many airline/airport people to talk on phone but no one was willing to help. Some other passenger helped her to get hotel stay voucher (she got this voucher in midnight) but they didn't provide cab & wheelchair assistance so she was not able to go to hotel. I don't know anyone in New York so I had to ask her to stay at airport full night. Next morning I booked flight to New York & met her at 2 pm. United arranged another flight on July 29 so she fled back in night & I came back to Dallas by catching early morning flight which costed me $658. My mother reached India but her luggage didn't reach. It took another 2 day to get the luggage. I understand flight cancellation can happen because of one or another reason but frustration is Airline didn't give her wheelchair assistance though I had mentioned it to Airline that she need full support as she doesn't understand English. She was all alone at Airport for full night and next half day. Due to Airline mistake she suffered, scared, cried & I had to spent overall $1000 to go to New York and come back again.

Worst airline and super rude staff. My flight was delayed due to bad weather conditions at Denver. I was at the airport for more than 6 hours but the staff was not cooperative at all. I requested food vouchers so that I can eat but the rude supervisor refused. No one should fly with them especially from Fresno Airport

commentHeader: every flight in the last 4 months delayed
reviewContent: After several attempts to give United the benefit of the doubt, I officially have to call it. My husband and I have had perpetually horrible flight experiences with almost every flight in the last 4 months being delayed. Our most recent flight experience was horrendous from MSP to DEN (we live in Denver and are held hostage many times by having a United Hub there). With our boarding starting at 4:15 pm, we started receiving 15 minute updates with delay notifications , which eventually turned into 30 minute delay notifications only to have our flight fully cancelled at around 8:30pm. I empathize with the desk staff as they had no control and were clearly being kept in the dark as well. We were missing flight crew. That's it. Our pilots were onsite along with one stewardess but we needed two additional flight crew in order to get in the air and United couldn't make it happen. After speaking with a member of the United staff, I was told to book the 5am flight, but was later informed by another United insider that it was a huge risk because we may very likely be in the same situation. We ended up canceling completely and moving to Delta - Bear in mind I will need to spend all day on the phone fighting for a full refund as that is not their first course of remediation. All in all, they aren't worth it; fly with another airline. My husband who travels occasionally for work had two other flights in the past three months fully cancelled on him, while I (who also travels for work) mostly experience long delays. I don't care about the points I have accumulated thus far, they are too awful to stay with and I recommend choosing any other airline. Their seats aren't comfortable and are very closely packed together with little space (unlike Delta), their flight schedule appears to rarely run on time, and their customer support is painful to work with. Save yourself the hassle.

Worst airline in the world. Can’t keep up with their own time schedule and change the timing quite often. Worst customer service. I will not recommend this airline. They have already changed the timing of take off 4 times and they are still changing. They can’t give a proper reason why the change. As soon as I get to my destination, I need to change my return ticket to some other airline.
Worst airline on the planet. They delay the flight 3 hours then make you wait for 2 hours on the plane to take off and then you wait another hour when you land just to get off.

commentHeader: refused to give us another flight
reviewContent: They canceled our 1200pm flight at 4.38 am. We showed up to the airport and they refused to give us another flight The worse service I’ve ever seen. They were unhelpful and uncaring. We have a party of seven people. We are physicians and we have patients to see.

commentHeader: I might as well walk to Canada
reviewContent: First got delayed for 3 hours then cancelled 30mins before boarding 11pm at night. Literally no hotel but the one in the airport available. Then now, same time the next day, delayed again. I might as well walk to Canada because I would be at least making progress. I would give them 0/10 if I could.

commentHeader: only had standby for two days
reviewContent: They cancelled the day of and only had standby for two days. My trip has been shortened due to this and I can only imagine the nightmare this would be if I had a connecting flight. In the past I've had "weather" warnings for it to them become mechanical issues. No flight is ever promised with this airline and if you choose to take United during this time I'd advise against that. Me and many other individuals are on standby flights for a day +. United, the flights are NEVER certain, checking in your bags is a gamble and staff is rarely helpful.

Actually “Not Good” is too kind for United Airlines. They are just pathetic! Why? For the last 7 tickets we booked, they CANCELLED 6 of them. They even cancelled the replacement tickets on three of them and then proceeded to place those on a standby flight. The disruption this causes and the money that is lost from their incompetence is flabbergasting. AirBnB bookings that is too late to cancel has to be paid for regardless of the fact that we sit 12 hours at Newark, bleary eyed, hungry and frustrated. Rental cars paid for and then new arrival times at the destination airport forces more time wasted because we have to wait for the rental car places to open. United just pulls their shoulders up and essentially goes “megh!” when we call. We have spent countless hours on the phone to rebook flights, not to mention the time we have spent writing in customer complaints. They don’t even send a automated response to the written complaints, it is just silent. They gave us $20 for meals on the 12 hour delay at Newark, you can purchase a dry sandwich at a vending machine for that. They partially refund hotel fairs that are lost. Don’t fly United Airlines!

commentHeader: never fly with these people again
reviewContent: Our flight from Chicago to Denver was delayed they didn't bother to wait for us to catch our connecting flight they gave us no information except to stand in an outrageous long line to rebook our flight cuz they canceled ours. I am currently in line still my luggage is missing their app has a bug and every single one of the people who work here don't care and is very rude. I will never fly with these people again. I'm assuming I'll be waiting hours to get home.

United is the dollar general of air lines. You would be better taking a train across the country than dealing with or flying within a United plane. A complete lack of customer / passenger communication when stuck in a taxi hood for 1 hour! The pilot nor the attendant has said a word. Is this likely a combined air traffic control issue as well, sure - but to provide zero communication to customers is unacceptable. In fact the attendant actually told a women to sit down that needed to go the bathroom because she was waiting for a hour on the tarmac! United’s 2 of 5 ratings are an over estimation. Trash!

route: Houston to Kahului via Los Angeles
reviewContent: This flight was a very good flight and the cabin crew and ground crew were really nice. The seats were fairly comfortable and they had tvs on them with movies, tv shows, and games. The snack boxes on the flight were good and they had little snacks in them. The bathrooms were very small though so you can’t really move around in them. Overall I think United airlines is one of the best airlines in the U.S.

commentHeader: requesting them to refund but keeps getting denied
reviewContent: I really do not appreciate the service offered by United Airlines. I purchased a ticket in Economy class along with another ticket for 2 just extra seats as my wife has some issues traveling in economy class. Later I found a cheap Business class ticket on United website which I then asked United to upgrade one of the tickets by combining both tickets. Unfortunately, I had to cancel my flight due to medical reasons so I requested to get refund which they approved. Still they returned only a portion in me and rest they gave as ETC. I mean what kind of logic is this, if a ticket gets cancelled it always gives a ETC for future use. When I ask them to refund the rest they asked to create ticket from Customer service. Now the customer service is even not responding as they keep forwarding the request to Refunds. This is insane, I submitted request to get refund due to medical reasons. There should always be room for some exceptions, I do not travel much and this money will go to waste if they give me as ETC. That is why I keep requesting them to refund but keeps getting denied. What kind of customer service is this, is this a way to treat a customer and this refunds Department seems very rude and not at all helping.  This is the worst customer experience I received in my whole life. I have been a customer support before, I thought treating customer is the first preference. This concept seems to have stopped when it comes to United Airlines. This is not acceptable at any circumstances.

route: Los Angeles to Columbus via Las Vegas
commentHeader: We bought 2 tickets on another airline
reviewContent: Our original flight was delayed 4 hours which meant we had missed our connecting flight to Houston which was later canceled all together. We got a hotel in Vegas and we’re told that there were no flights available to Ohio that day so we were rebooked to Houston the following day. We were on hold with the airline for 3 1/2 hours but no one answered. That evening we received a text that the flight was canceled to Houston and they would try to rebook us. It never happened. We got online to try to chat but again no response. We bought 2 tickets on another airline. Tried to get reimbursed for the flights but was told it didn’t meet their criteria for a refund!!

United Airlines canceled our flight the same day of travel. Our Luggage was missing and came home more than a week later. United will almost never give you a refund or listen to you. Not the best Airline. If you have a choice and you want to avoid the stress, choose something else.

This airline is the worst airline ever. I got on 3 planes and still in the same place. This airline is unprofessional and need to be shut completely down. Customer service sucks the one employee literally took a nap in front of me while I was waiting on a delay flight that never left because the pilots say they had already did their time after coming off a 5 hour break from my first delay. I will rather fly Frontier then this raggedy airline.

commentHeader: very worst experience with this airline
reviewContent: I had a very worst experience with this airline. we boarded flight on time around 9 pm est. After boarding the flight was delayed with no proper update. After waiting an hour in the flight, got an update a passenger being sick and waiting for the crew to offboard their check in luggage and the expected take off time is 11.40. Waited with 2 kids in the flight till 11.40. got one small badam packet, water and a burger as dinner. Again around 11.40 received an update the crew just reached and still searching for bag. After an hour , received update need to change flight crew and they are going to another gate 126 and board again at 1.15 am est. Waited till 1.15 am in flight, again received an announcement that flight is cancelled. We were asked to get down and many didnt even realize the flight is cancelled. Got announcement that collect luggage in drop 5 and the bags were being sent slowly almost taking 1.5 hrs even to get the luggage. Also they asked one counter will be open till 3 am and we have to rebook if required before 3 am. The one counter which was open till 3 am, there was a huge line and almost till 7.30 we were just standing on line. Finally fed up and booked a hotel by ourself and many hotels didnt allow check in during that time. finally we got one for paying 300$ for 4 hours, booked cab by ourself. at 1.30 qe received a message that we got meal vouchers value 15$, 2 per passenger. the worst airline and the pain we had on that night with 2 kids are unbearable. after long struggle we booked air India from JFK, initial trip was from newark. Unexpected delays or cancelations are understandable, but airlines should be able to handle the passengers during the situation.

I usually only see negative reviews for airlines specifically when people are furious. I am providing a good review in hopes that airlines will really start to consider customer service and the reliability of the flights that the consumers are purchasing. The United employee the morning of my flight was extremely helpful, organized, and clear. She arrived 30 min before everyone else (3 AM) and still helped everyone get in the proper place before TSA or check-in opened. I promptly made it through security and the flight took off on time and as planned. The flight attendants were spectacular and the pilot clearly communicated with updates throughout the flight. Extremely happy with my experience, thank you.

We waited over an hour because the baggage loader broke. It’s seriously unprofessional how the flight was handled. Why the hell did I pay for carry on bags to avoid issues with the airport managing luggage only to wait hours for luggage! Also, the crew being unable to receive answers from their management is unfair to them. They’re out in front of angry customers who just want to go home. On top of that, the floor of the airplane was filthy. You’d think in the extra hour and change they had to prepare they’d get it a bit clean.

Paid to upgrade our seats and felt like we got a downgrade because our seats did NOT recline. Supposed to have been electronic device charging stations between the seats and there weren't any on the plane at all. One of your flight attendants was very rude! Will NEVER fly this airline again. There was also supposed to be onboard WiFi and it wouldn't work either.

The worst experience I’ve ever had. If you can, try to avoid united. Their system was down the more I got to the airport. They were unable to print out my boarding pass which made me miss my flight. They found and alternative route to get to my destination but, manage to leave my check-In luggage back home. Horrible communication skills, got to my destinations with absolutely no clothes and still wanting for some sort of compensation. Please look for alternative options before flying with United. They truly do not care.

route: Raleigh Durham to Seattle via Chicago
commentHeader: I have a major complaint with United
reviewContent: Baggage handler broke off key in ignition to my electric scooter upon arrival in Seattle. Was unable to help get it out and not useable in Seattle during my vacation. Very inconvenient as a disabled person who relies on my scooter for traveling. Local repair shop got it out for me but had to order new key which I won't get until my return home. First time I have a major complaint with United and intend on filing a claim for new keys.

route: Grand Rapids to Kansas city via Chicago
commentHeader: I will never prefer United airlines
reviewContent: Worst airline I ever travelled they delayed connecting flight in Chicago which messed up my plans in Kansas City I planned earlier and they are not interested to give refund or modify the ticket. Here after I will never prefer United airlines. They should maintain time sense to reach on time. Useless airline in USA.

Polaris class SFO-PPT and back. Never again. First, check-in for Polaris at SFO was surreal, with 50+ people on line and only one agent actively checking Polaris-class passengers in. I found myself longing for the business-class check-in desks at the other, non-U.S. carriers in the International Terminal, carriers that actually seem to offer a premium service to people who have paid for it. I arrived at the terminal two hours before my United flight but got only 20 minutes in the lounge as a result of this mess. Second, United's boarding process is a slap in the face to passengers who pay upwards of $7000 for a seat in Polaris. If you're not a member of one of their frequent-flyer levels, you're forced to board with economy-class passengers. Every other airline in existence lets passengers in the premium cabin board first, before the coach stampede starts with people pushing and shoving to board so they can get first claim to overhead space. This is one reason why I will never fly United again. Third, my berth in Polaris was filthy, with lint and crumbs littering the air vent along the bulkhead. Fourth, the food in Polaris was virtually inedible. Again, when you're paying upwards of $7000 for a ticket, you expect something that isn't going to make you gag. Unfortunately, United is the only airline apart from budget carrier French Bee that flies from SFO to Tahiti nonstop. For any other international route where there's competition, however, I wouldn't conceive of ever flying United Polaris again.

Horrible customer service. Was stranded in Italy with my daughter because of an error on the first leg of the trip using Lufthansa. The UA booking agent wrote my daughters name incorrectly for that leg of the trip (which had a different confirmation number), so we were unable to return. When I called long distance from Italy to try to get another flight (there is no UA office at the airport), the customer service rep didn’t fix the error, didn’t book us a new flight since we missed the first one by trying to get the name corrected, and hung up on me. This left us stranded in a foreign country with NO ticket home as a result of their error. I called back again and finally got tickets back to a different airport and my daughter and I had to find our own way back from New Jersey to CT, taking four different trains with our large suitcases in tow. I’m completely dissatisfied with this airline and the whole customer service experience. The flight and attendants were excellent, but the customer service was abysmal.

commentHeader: seats 4A and 4B in first class don't recline
reviewContent: Horrible! Paid for 1st class and barely got any service in outbound flight. Return flight even worse, seats 4A and 4B in first class don't recline, seats and center were covered in something? Smashed food? Who knows. Snacks taste old and stale. Didn't get a headset so couldn't even use TV.

I booked this flight anticipating to fly on United 787-10. However, it was swapped to a 777-200. As it was a retrofitted 777 with proper Premium Plus seats, it was not bad. LAX is certainly not the best airport, as the boarding area was tiny, thus very crowded. The Premium Plus seat was comfortable. We had the first row with huge legroom, more like 55-in rather than the normal 38-in pitch. In-flight meals were fine, and they served a full meal plus a light meal (by choice). That was quite good for a 4.5 hour domestic flight in premium economy. The fight departed on time and arrived early, which was good.

Ground service at EWR was mediocre, as expected. That was probably more about the airport than the airline. However, the new United Club was nice. It was spacious with many food choices (by American carriers' standard). The flight departed on time and arrived early. The 787-10 was the highlight. I purposely booked this flight because of it, and it was perhaps the best domestic transcontinental equipment available today. Service was fine, not over the top but was enough. In-flight meals were quite a step up from my previous UA flights.

route: Los Angeles to Houston via Lafayette
reviewContent: If United Airlines was the last airline on earth, I would never fly again! These guys are terrible! Coming and going, delay, delay, delay...except for the very last leg of our trip. But since the previous flight was delayed, the door to our plane was closed when we got to the gate and they wouldn't let us on. We ran all across the airport to board the plane and that was the one that departed on time?! They couldn't delay that one two minutes to make up for their error? Needless to say, the boarding agent couldn't care less about what their mistakes cost me in time (another 5 1/2 hour delay) and frustration. Will never...ever fly with them again!

commentHeader: will not be flying United ever again
reviewContent: I do not usually write reviews, but this was the most horrific flying experience I have ever had in my life. I get to the Jacksonville airport at 5:00 am for a 6:30 flight. At the boarding and luggage check booth, where there were nearly 100 people waiting, there was one attendant on duty - it took a solid hour just to print my boarding pass and check my luggage. All other airlines had several attendants working. After sprinting to my gate, I found out that the flight had been delayed for 3 full hours. When we finally boarded, I got a message saying that my connecting flight to Rochester had been cancelled. After standing not one, but two customer service lines, I was able to book a flight to Syracuse. Originally leaving at 9:30, the flight was again delayed by an hour. We landed at 12:00 am, but taxied for another 40 minutes because the airline had sent an unscheduled flight to our departure gate for cleaning. Never in my life have I experienced this level of negligence at an airline. On transferring to Syracuse I asked the customer service representative if I had to re-check my baggage. She told me "no", and that I was "in the system". I asked the concierge at the gate for Syracuse the same thing - he said "no". After deplaning, I discovered that my luggage had been left in Newark. It is now 11:00 pm the next day, and the luggage has just now been delivered to my hotel. I will not be flying United ever again, and I will be dissuading everyone I can to use it in the future.

route: Great Falls to Colorado Springs via Denver
reviewContent: Delays both coming and going. Missed my connection by over three hours. To make matters worst, the customer service was incompetent and rude. They cancelled my flight unannounced to me, and treated me like I was the problem. Do whatever possible to take any other airline!

The lines to this plane at SFO were unreasonable. Not smooth. THEN, on the return flight, the plane acted like a Ford on the runway. That is, it broke down. Now things are up in the air. Southwest may not offer direct flights, but their planes do get off the ground

commentHeader: should be ashamed of the service
reviewContent: I wouldn’t waste my time going on a United flight. They are horrible at doing their jobs. I had a toddler with me who was supposed to sit on my lap. We were traveling with my spouse and the kiosk wouldn’t allow check in. We came in two hours before our flight and got tossed around. We were advised to see a kiosk with an attendant on it waited 30 minutes and we still couldn’t get checked in. At this point we had a little under an hour to get everything done yet no one knows how to get my boarding pass printed with my lap baby. My husband was able to board but I missed my flight. They told me to wait on a line that took over 2.5 hours to get to a rep and that as far as they are concerned I missed my flight even though there was still time. I had two employees bicker in front of my family because the employee asked another employee to assist and she didn’t like that we were thrown on her. After I waited for 2.5 hours to get this situation rectified the rep told me there was nothing he can do because the confirmation was split once my husband got his pass and I essentially lost my reservation and had to wait 1.5 hours to get ahold of a reservation specialist on the phone. FYI they don’t have reservation specialists in the airport. United employees doesn’t take responsibility or try to correct the situation. I was left to make other plans with another airline company as being stranded in an airport with a toddler wasn’t going to work. I went to JetBlue and they had zero issues with processing my lap baby’s pass. United doesn’t care about their customers, if they had it there way I would have been stranded for two days. Also they are unbelievably understaffed and we’re cancelling a lot of flights. There was a mob of angry people. Save your money, they may be worse than southwest and spirit at this point. I will never purchase from them again & they should honestly be ashamed of the “service” they provide.

Worst, most uncomfortable seats I’ve been in in 4 decades of flying. Boarding took longer than the 2 flights we took with Southwest during the same trip. Crew tried to makes things better. No internet. No TV plugs. Like flying in 1968. I was working and my husband let a friend who is a travel agent book our trip. At a family gathering we had no one there who flies United (and half our family is from Britain) . Now I know why. We are taking return flight tomorrow. Row 33 seats C and D. Pull up your United plane pics. There is no row 33.

commentHeader: refuse to make any sort of compensation
reviewContent: I had a trip from New York to Washington this weekend from Friday to Saturday and everything booked. They had first delayed then cancelled the flight on Friday which caused me to arrive on Saturday night leaving me with only 4h in Washington. Then the departure flight from Washington to New York is delayed for a total of 8 times. And the company refuse to make any sort of compensation.

commentHeader: given my seat to someone else
reviewContent: Was scheduled for a 2pm flight on Monday. Flight was canceled and I was rebooked for a 7pm flight. After several delays that flight was canceled and I was rebooked for a 9pm flight the next day or 26 hours later. After talking to an agent he got me a standby ticket for a 7am flight the next morning. After spending the night at airport, it looked like I would get a seat on the 7am flight. Even received a text from United saying "Good news" I had seat on that flight. Then after all the groups had boarded I approached agent desk and handed them my ticket and the agent announced they would be calling the standbys by name. So I sat back down, fully expecting my name to be called. She then pointed to a gentleman and he was allowed to board. She the pointed to another gentleman and asked him for his name. He answered an she said he could board. But he was with his wife. Agent said there was only one seat available and the agent let wife board and they were done boarding. I approached agent and showed her messaged from United that I had a seat on that flight. She said she had no idea what that message meant. I knew what it meant. It meant she had given my seat to someone else. instead of reading from the list of standbys like she said she would she handpicked her standbys. The only reason. I didn't raise a fuss then is I wanted to get home not on the "No fly list".

route: San Diego to Munich via San Francisco
commentHeader: flight was an all around disappointment
reviewContent: This flight was an all around disappointment.  While the flight attendants were friendly and were doing the best they could, it was clear they were short-staffed.  We sat at the back and at every meal they had run out of at least one of the offerings. We had an unpleasant tasting vegetarian pasta for dinner and a very pathetic, dry wrapped sandwich for lunch.  At SFO, despite having a voucher offered by United for United Club access, the staff at the counter denied us entry because it was "high season."

Absolute incompetence on the highest levels. Persistently delayed. Complete lack of organization or oversight. I got food poisoning from the food served on the aircraft. ORD-customs is a complete joke and when I couldn’t find my bag to clear customs I was told by a United worker to “go the hell over there”. Lost bag caused missed connection which caused 3 hours standing in line to get re-booked. Customer service? Is there such a thing or a bunch of people standing around laughing and joking at the amount of people standing in line to be rebooked. If you own stock in the company, do yourself a favor and sell it. The app doesn’t work. The website is intermittent at best. The baggage service is anything but serviceable. The “management”…my sons 3rd grade class could do a better job.  From my standpoint, I will do everything within my power to convince anyone to avoid any contact, future business or even possible employment with this airline.

This was absolutely horrible. Our flight was delayed several times. They put us on a standby flight which got us to Mexico but then after we landed canceled my wife’s flight back stating she missed her flight, although she flew with me. They broke our suitcase.

route: San Diego to Atlanta via Denver
reviewContent: United is the worst airline. I am super positive person and from the moment I was getting my bag tags the customer service (not for myself but for others) was noticeably bad. Imagine flying an airline like Southwest. It’s cheap. You expect it to suck to an extent. United is a little more expensive but not by much. Now the difference is the people working at United answer all your questions with a “matter of fact tone” to it. That’s the only difference. United’s seats all look like hot trash, nothing is new. They don’t have anything special. They got a 2 because they had buffalo trace whiskey nothing more.

Original flight was changed due to cancelation of flight from Tampa to Washington (IAD). United put us (me and my 2 daughters) in a new reservation that added one leg and three hours to the flight (to New York then to Washington). When we got to the airport, the new flight to New York was delayed several hours and we missed our connection, so they put us on a new flight through American Airlines, but the flight was to Reagan Airport instead. We had to take a Taxi from Regan to IAD while carrying our luggage: $75. After we boarded our 10 PM flight from IAD to Amman, it circled around for 2 hours then it was cancelled. We stood in line waiting for a representative to serve us from 12 (Midnight) tell 10 AM (10 hours waiting, not kidding, while standing, in the airport). They put us on a new flight to Dubai, and then to Amman, the next day. We stayed in Dubai for 11 hours (took a hotel in the airport, at my own expense). We added 2.5 days extra to the trip. These 2.5 days were lost from my vacation with my two daughters. And at the end, the customer care team insults me with giving me a credit of $125 towards my next flight to cover for the horror story they put us through.

Worst experience ever, I was stuck in Newark NJ for over 26 hours, they say the was due to bad weather which was a lie. They canceled my flight 3 times on top of this they lost my baggage. I flew from NJ to WI In my way back to NJ my flight was delayed 7 hours, I was flying with my 8 years old daughter and my sister and they didn’t care the I was flying with a child.
Ridiculous Policy and worse airline that I've been ever experienced. Food was very bad. Onboarding was very unorganized and late. Delay on both departures

commentHeader: the worst experience I’ve ever had flying
reviewContent: Hands down the worst experience I’ve ever had flying. Crew members were late, delaying our entirely booked flight. Then we were stuck on the plane waiting for maintenance to look at a broken electrical panel cover. Perhaps checking the safety of the plane before filling it with people would have been a good idea. This airline is run by clowns and incompetent imbeciles. If I could give a 0/10 I would.

I grew up when airline travel was far more sophisticated and enjoyable, not to mention affordable. Unfortunately, united is now on the do not fly list that I created today. I am newly married, and on both legs of our trip, even though I booked the airline tickets at the same time, my wife and I had to sit in separate rows. apparently, their policy is that unless you pay to buy your tickets, the computer will just put you wherever it can even though you’re married and flying together. This is such a ridiculous policy and one that has cost them two new customers. The lady in Denver at the United counter was so rude to us when we asked her if she could accommodate placing us together. She looked at my wife and said well it’s a short flight and you’re only one row apart and I think you can handle it.

We arrived to Newark airport on June 25 from Stockholm and were going to switch to another plane to Florida. We checked the board and it shold depart from Terminal A. After about 1 hour it said delayed, and should depart from Terminal C… When we had been on Terminal C a while, the board said we were going back to Terminal A! And so on, we took the bus about 6 times back and forth, it was crazy! And during this time, NO ONE INFORMED US! During the evening the board kept changing terminals, gates etc. I went to ask a representative from United. The dialogue went like this: Me: I would like some information about Flight 1482 please Rep: It is cancelled Me: ?? But it is on the board? Rep: Yeah, the plane is here on the airport. Then she gave me a card, informing me that I shouid call their support. I waited in the telephone for 70 minutes, then I was disconnected. We also tried to go to customer center, the queue was about 1000 meters! We were at the airport 7 hours, no information, unpleasant staff, and no help. Finally, at 11:30 pm, we rented a car and drove all the way to Florida. Our trip home was better, we were allowed to go to Newark by airplane this time, but there were delays, staff were missing and unpleasant flight hostesses. I will never travel with United again!

Very very disappointed. A nonstop flight was cancelled and tried to rebook me on a lengthy connecting flight. Took much time to call and rebook on a direct flight like I had. Paid for an upgrade to bring my carryon. The new flight was delayed 2.5 hours, then delayed again 2-3 hours with gate change, new plane and wait for new crew , and our place in take off line another 1 hours. One update as to our delay was explained as our plane was sitting in Mississippi getting a new paint job.

Worst experience ever! Our flight got cancelled due to bad weather and then we couldn’t get another flight out for 3 days! Then, when they offered to make up for it by letting us chose another flight, they ended up sticking us on a bus for half of our trip but didn’t let us know it was a bus ticket until we checked in. Staff at the airport were super rude as well, so overall an upsetting experience.

I think, it would be a very beneficial eye opening experience for Scott Kirby to fly as a regular customer during bad weather conditions. Spend time in a long line for the travel assistance for rebooking the flight, and then trying to figure out where to spend a night or few nights before the next flight. I was coming from a wonderful European vacation on July 9th. As soon as I arrived to the Newark airport, I received a very unwelcome message that my connecting flight was canceled. The next 4 hours were extremely frustrating. The United App was not working. Long line to the travel assistance full of frustrated customers, elderly people, and parents with young crying children kept growing. A travel agent informed me that a seat for me is available no earlier than July 12th. I registered for the standby for the earliest flight the next day as well. I, as every other person in that line, needed to find a place to spend a night, possibly 3 nights. The agent was kind enough to give me 3 vouchers $15 each. I am a full time employee and have responsibilities. So, I had to inform my manager about my encounter. The next day I spent “camping out” at the Newark airport on a standby list. The overbooking practices help maximize the profits and brings hefty bonuses to the top management of the airline at the expense of their customers. In Europe airlines are penalized with high fines for overbooking. The airline should be able to develop a backup plans for bad weather, and not use it (bad weather) as an excuse for inconvenience, keeping travelers stranded for days, passing down the operating cost to customers. Seems like customer experience is not important for United airlines.

commentHeader: stuck in Newark Airport for over 40 hours
reviewContent: I was stuck in Newark Airport for over 40 hours, due to a flight cancellation. Rebooked in for a new flight, 40+ hours was the wait. Newark was my connecting flight location. Toronto was my final destination. Before finding out about my cancelled connected flight, my check in baggage was rechecked in. Since I was spending over 40 hours in the airport, I spoke to United Baggage Counter Service 3 TIMES! To know the whereabouts of my bag, and I wanted it with me during my wait in the Airport. The 1st time, I was told that even though my bag was rerouted, I could collect it and have it with me, then I could recheck it in before boarding my new flight to Toronto. I was told to do this by visiting baggage service the next day. The next day is here, it is my 2nd time. I was told it'll take 12 hours for me to retrieve it, "look out for it at carousel 9" I was told. And I could recheck it in. The 3rd and final time I spoke to Baggage Counter Service, this person behind the counter told me something completely different, he said that since my bag has been rerouted, I no longer have access to it until my final destination. And I was PROMISED that it will be with me on my new Toronto flight. 3 times, with 3 different answers. Saying that, luckily I saw my bag on carousel belt 9, attached with the reroute label and all. I picked it up to get my phone charger which I really needed. I asked one of the baggage workers if I could keep my bag with me and I will recheck it in myself. They said NO. It's in the system, and it's guaranteed to be with you. I finally landed in Toronto and not only did my bag not show up, but I found out that it's still in Newark Airport! I know this because United Baggage service in Toronto tracked it for me. Having been already frustrated waiting around for 40+ hours, now I have to deal with another problem. Again, I was guaranteed that it will be with me. I've already made arrangements to get it delivered to an address, it'll take 2-3 days for me to receive it.
Only flown with United twice, first time they lost my luggage and the second time my first flight was delayed over an hour causing me to miss my second flight and leaving me in Houston.

commentHeader: Every time there are delay issues
reviewContent: My first reservation was delayed causing me to miss my connecting flight. I had to reroute to a different destination airport in order to attend the meeting I was flying to attend. Note my ticket cost over $1,900. I am 6’2 and can tell from sitting up in the plane that I am the tallest person on the flight. I asked the counter if they needed anyone for an exit row she lied and said they were completely full. On the plane they asked costumers to move to the exit seat as it was not full. I asked if I could and was dismissed. Every time I fly United there are delay issues. I do not recommend united!

United is the worst airline in the world I’ve spent 36 hours on the phone with them over the last 2 days. I will never fly with this company ever again! Maybe instead of paying people $5/hr in another country that can’t help anyone or has no permission to do anything you should invest in actual US customer service that you pay $30+/hr

Because of the threat of severe weather, UA allowed me to change flights and upgraded me to first class to boot. Everything about the flight was excellent. Cabin service was very friendly and efficient. The meal was surprisingly tasty, given past experiences on United, especially. Although we took off a bit late, we landed in DC early. I liked the service oriented attitude of the crew. Even the pilot's announcements were timely and informative. All in all, a very good experience.

commentHeader: worst costumer service I’ve ever experienced
reviewContent: This was the worst experience I have ever had. My family and I purchased tickets for first class meaning we paid an extra $800 just for the airline to refuse our seats and sit us in economy because they “don’t have availability”. If they didn’t have any available seats then why was I charged and the worst part of all of it was they gave a free upgrade to a couple to sit in first class the day of the flight! It’s free for them because I paid for it! The customer service phone line was a complete waste of time seeing as they did nothing for us. On our return flight home it took us almost two hours trying to get our bags checked because of the ticket situation even after calling the “help” line. Every single person we have talked to has been nothing but rude. Please save your money and sanity by never flying with United! The absolute worst costumer service I’ve ever experienced anywhere!

The online system reserves the ticket but needs me to talk to customer service for confirmation. I have been trying to talk to customer service from last 5 days via phone and chat but the employees are incompetent and unable to process my refund or change my flight with available flight credits. I am so fed up and just want a full refund if they can't rebook our flights.

commentHeader: Couldn't check in on the app
reviewContent: Couldn't check in on the app to get my boarding pass as it kept looping me and telling me I needed to get it at the airport, get to the airport and the machine won't let me check in, reps won't assists, 90 minute hold time, the additional services line has 5 kiosks but only one rep is working even though a bunch are standing around doing nothing, and the line is backed up to the door. No supervisors/ managers available, try to call customer service and there's a 90 minute hold time. Missed the flight and now I'm going to have to wait 7 hours for the next one and my cat is going hungry tonight because of it.

route: Phoenix to Tel Aviv via Newark
commentHeader: One of the worst flying experiences
reviewContent: One of the worst flying experiences ever. Over 4 days of wasted vacation time, 2 flight cancellations, zero help from costumer service. Upon our arrival from TLV to Phoenix via Newark the flight from Newark airport was cancelled, and then cancelled again and again.  Leading to 4 whole days of waiting, missing out on precious family vacation time. Upon our arrival from Phoenix via Chicago to TLV our flight from Chicago got cancelled, no other flights for 2 days.
