Joined thinking I could earn miles when purchasing tickets for family, but just flings out that even though I purchased the tickets for people who are elderly and don't travel, I have to lose the miles because I'm not actually the one flying. Tickets were purchased under my account and they can obviously tell. Then try to get me to apply for a credit card that still won't allow me to earn miles when I purchase for sometime else. So many other airlines with cheaper flights that I could've, and will in the future, opted for than this. I only flew with them for business, but I'll happily be taking the companies and my money somewhere else where I can earn when I spend money.

Last leg of return trip from SE Asia with Hubby. UA1536, LAX-IAH used a 753 on 05/10, leaving at around 1am local time, just a few minutes behind schedule. Boarding was done by zone and very orderly. Even though it was a full flight, thankfully not that many people were carrying multiple bags that will have to be checked in if there is no room in the overhead bins and might cause delay to the departure. The FAs were polite and efficient but they were not as personable and communicative as the ones we just met in our flights throughout Asia. They made one drink round and offered pretzels with the drinks, and then they were back to collect the trash. Very different experience in this 2.5 hours flight with this so-called full-service airline, compared to another 2.5 hours flight in Asia with another, real, full-service airline which served hot food and alcoholic drinks for free. Overall the flight was uneventful, and we land in IAH around 10 minutes early.

commentHeader: attendants are quite nice and cheerful"
reviewContent: First leg of a SE Asia trip with Hubby, IAH-LAX on 04/26, UA 1611 at 6:30 PM. Boarding was quite organized, the plane left on time, there were no entertainment but for a short flight this is fine. The flight attendants are quite nice and cheerful, they even made a second round of drinks during the flight.

I would seriously suggest you pick a different airline. Not much of an improvement from spirit or frontier. Constant delays, terrible seats, old outdated planes, and not the nicest employees through the gate till the end. Look at other options
So many delays and customer service is terrible. Always an attitude with everyone working there even if YOUR flight is cancelled and you are just asking what to do next.

My husband and I boarded Group 4 today on flight UA1927. In the middle of boarding Group 3, the gate staff started telling people that the overhead bins were full and that we had to check our bags and pick them up at the gate. I could see the frustration on the faces of many ahead of us as they asked questions and were told that checking their bags was mandatory. And this was, of course, an inconvenience to my husband and me as we had a tight deadline once our flight landed to get our rental car and head to a business meeting. However, we were patient and complied. As we walked down the hallway to drop off our carryons, a fellow passenger came out of the plane and asked the worker for his bag back because he was told by a flight attendant that there was space in the overhead bins for his bag. Puzzled, we continued to drop off our bags and board the plane. Long story short, we boarded the plane to find an abundance of space in the overhead bins, which showed that we were essentially lied to by flight staff. For what reason I have no clue. Maybe to inconvenience passengers in the hope that next time they will upgrade their ticket? It couldn't be because of weight because the bags go to the bottom of the plane when being checked. Whatever the reason, my husband and I were incredibly inconvenienced. Once we landed and walked to baggage claim, we waited 30 minutes for our bags to arrive. Thirty minutes that we did not have and could have been saved if we were not lied to and were allowed to place our carryons in two of the abundance of spaces available on the plane. This kind of treatment and purposeful inconveniencing of passengers is unacceptable.

route: State College to Denver via Chicago
reviewContent: Horrible airline. My 10:40AM flight was delayed "10 or 20 minutes" for a "minor mechanical issue". Two hours later, we were told that they were flying in a new plane rather than fixing hours. Then the second plane was delayed for *another* mechanical issue. It was delayed again and again and has been pushed back to 6:45PM, and even the ticketing agents are saying that they doubt it'll show up anytime today.

United Airlines is extremely unprofessional and a waste of time. I enjoyed the flight attendants however the workers at the airport ruined my vacation experience. No one speaks English, they're extremely unprofessional and the flight was delayed for 9 hours at the last minute. There's absolutely no structure with the check in process and it was pure chaos. I will never use this airline again in a million lifetimes.

commentHeader: First class is not worth it
reviewContent: I have to say spending all the extra money to fly First class is not worth it. No drinks while boarding, not even water. You spend the money for upgraded service and it's not better than coach! Very disappointed in united. Looks like delta for me. At least I get treated like I spent an extra 500 for first class.

commentHeader: told that there could be no compensation
reviewContent: To place this review in perspective, we arrived safely. UA had a mechanical delay with the plane that forced us to arrive 4 hours later than planned. Traveling with children, we arrived at approximately 2 am to our destination (2 hrs from our final house-destination). Due to our late arrival, our rental car company (newark airport) was closed. Told we could not sleep in the airport, we found the cheapest newark hotel we could ($155), arriving about 3am. The next morning, we returned to the car rental to a 2-hour line. By the time we were served, they had only one car left (the lot was empty) with pax behind us; I guess, out of luck. The only rental option was an upgrade (for the week rental) that would eventually cost us about $180 additional to the pre-arranged economy car fare we had booked weeks in advance. I talked them down to $190 or it would have been more. All told, we incurred about $350 in expenses, some of which we requested refunded by UA. Now, five months later, I am still trying to get the compensation (any compensation). Had this been a weather-related or similar issue, I'd accept the loss. But it was mechanical (the Pilot and the support staff at the gate had both announced to the cabin the reasons for the delay). Eventually, they promised $200 citing that as their maximum. Then I was told that there could be no compensation for us since we incurred the expenses at our point of arrival (destination) .. which is bizarre since that would often be (almost always) the site of incurring expenses for a delayed flight,  especially because our destination was not our home. I do not fault the airline and I am happy that they fixed the plane before flying but one should not have to work so hard over five months to get partial compensation.

route: New Orleans to Louisville via Houston
reviewContent: United has failed miserably at trying to be more efficient. I booked a flight for 2.30pm out of New Orleans to Louisville with a layover in Houston. My original flight was delayed for a total of an hour. Told twice it was only 20 more min. Due to a "technical" issue. Then when we finally took off, we landed as the connecting flight was leaving. We landed at 4.30 and was told the next available was 8.10. It is now 9.10 pm as I type this. Delayed 2 more times on the 8.10 flight...due to "Technical" issues then told to deplane and the next flight is 10.30 if they can find a plane. I knew I should have booked Southwest, but trying to save a few bucks and got this. United is terrible....I also have flight credit, I have tried to use 10 times and am told it's not valid for those dates...10 different dates and all are not valid? United will no longer get my business and you should avoid them as well.

commentHeader: They do not keep you updated at all
reviewContent: I have had the worst experience with United Airlines. I have been stuck at Houston airport for over 28 hours due to flight delays and cancellations. If you are looking to fly choose anything but this airline. They do not keep you updated at all. They keep you waiting till the last minute then will cancel your flight. When we arrived in Houston the first time the plane landed we were pulling into the airport and the wing of our plane hit the back of a transit van. Save your money and do not fly United airlines.

I took a flight from USA to Israel, my carry on with perfect measurements was taken away from me and sent to the luggage where it was damaged. Food was terrible, attendants were rude. Coming back home to USA from Tel-Aviv: 2 hours delay, food is bad and no choice, no one cleaned bathrooms, extra money for regular end seats.

From Norfolk to Newark the pilot tells us he needs to land in Philadelphia because they were low on fuel. Are you serious! So we fill up and finally make it to Newark 2 hours late but cannot park because another plane is using our terminal. We sit an additional hour in the plane. I obviously missed my connecting flight and was sent to customer service gate 91. I get there and the line is 50 people deep with only one representative. They rebook me to 0700 and put me in a hotel. I basically sleep one hour to be back to make this flight. Now my 0700 flight is cancelled too! I am currently sitting here praying I can make it to Boston. I’m rebooked again to leave at 2:38pm. Customer service is severely poor, they do not care and this is normal to them. They will get nasty with you if you are frustrated and bark back at you. I’ve flown with other airlines and at least they try to make you happy. We received $15 vouchers for food but airport food is expensive. I will never fly on this airline.

I typically fly economy plus or first. I had a leg from Boston to Newark. Boarding was terrible, seat very uncomfortable. I have recently flown Delta and Jet Blue and they're so much better. WiFi works and is free on other airlines. Seats are better and flight attendants much friendlier! If I was young and committing to airline for status United would be last on my list. I am 1K million miler and completely disgusted with this airline!

I’m on my third flight delay and a gate change just trying to get home. I could not be most disappointed in United Airlines. I have no idea when my flight will finally take off but my trust in this airline has greatly diminished.

commentHeader: I will never fly United again
reviewContent: Probably one of the worst experiences with an airline I've ever had. Not only did their website overcharge me for the seats, sending multiple credit card authorizations to my bank, resulting in over $500 being tied up in authorizations for days, they then switched our seats last minute, pulling us from Economy Plus in the front of the plane and shoving us in the back of the plane. The flight itself was delayed over 12 hours, as they had mechanical troubles. Instead of re-routing us, they strung us along for hours with the promise of a fix. It was only 8 hours into the ordeal they admitted they were bringing in another plane to take us home. On top of everything else, I've now spent over an hour on the phone with their support trying to get our money back for the changed seats, inconvenience. I will never fly United again.

commentHeader: lies about this whole frustrating deal
reviewContent: Purchased a ticket and flights were cancelled due to weather. Was asked if wanted to rebook or get a refund. Asked for refund. Have spent 5 months trying to get over $1300 returned! I have heard pure lies about this whole frustrating deal. I and my family will never book United or any partners ever again. Disgusting way to do business. I’ve have contacted my credit card company and United says I have to prove the flight was cancelled. They have the info of that day and I can not get it!

commentHeader: spend over 15 hours at Denver Airport
reviewContent: From the first flight with Delay #1 flight crew needed to rest for an hour or so. Delay #2 mechanical issues another 1/2 an hour or so. Delay #3 claims of bad weather in Houston. Which all these delays put my flight to Houston 3+ hours late for my connection to Denver. Which they put on standby for the next 3 available flights, was able to get the 3rd one. In which put me in in 2 hours late for my final flight to Salinas and Hays. Refused to offer me a hotel voucher. Then booked me for the 2:30 pm flight to Salinas, so I had no choice but to spend over 15 hours at Denver Airport.

The flight attendants were terrible, and they were very rude. The customer service rep at the gate told me I could carry on the bags I had, before I board the plane I was charged $150. I will never fly United Airlines again.

Customer service is horrible! I flew into Raleigh with American I was able to bring a carry on which was a small suit case and I checked a bag! Coming back home I was put on United. When checking my bag, I was told my carry on can’t go above me it must go on the floor under my seat, which I was okay with. I get to the gate to check in and the guy immediately has an attitude! I literally told him to talk the attitude out of his voice because the way he was talking he was so rude! Immediately “I don’t know how you guys made it this far with these bags, they need to be checked and that’s going to be $65” so I try to explain to him that upstairs let us through and told me where my bag had to go! This guy had no patience. The staff do not communicate when I asked him to speak to the guy who let me in who caught an argument saying that guy wasn’t in charge! My friend had no problem, her bag was a duffel bag as mine was a smaller suitcase, her bag heals shoes and some of everything hanging out of it! He said absolutely nothing about her bag which was funny because they were the same size just different shaped. I will never fly through United again. This airline is a joke.  Communication is the key, customer skills is something you should have working with guest, and not surprising at all they lacked both.

My flight was supposed to be on Saturday the 29th at 10 pm then it kept getting delayed we got on the plane around 9:45 pm and didn’t get off the plane till 2 in the morning they said we had to go to another gate there was another flight for us at 2:40 am. We then waited there for two hours just for that flight to get canceled then they sent us to a hotel which they did pay for but we didn’t get there till 5 in the morning and had to pay for a 60$ Uber back to the airport the next day. I am not from this area so this was very inconvenient also the next day my flight to Minnesota got canceled again due to air traffic. So this then delayed me arriving to Minnesota two days late and resulted me into missing a day of work witch I had to lose money and spend another day wasting money in another state. I am very disappointed in United Airlines.

I intentionally paid extra for first class and intentionally packed a small bag that would fit in the overhead because I knew I had a very tight connection in Chicago thanks to UA changing flight times. When I boarded with the first class group all of the overheads were already filled I presume either with people who boarded before I did or airline personnel. I feel that the personnel should make sure at least one spot is open for luggage for the first class customers. What is the point of paying twice the fare? Staff was not helpful in correcting the problem.

commentHeader: Almost like what travel used to be like
reviewContent: Very nice flight. On time. With very attentive flight attendants. The lunch meal was the best economy meal I’ve had on United in years. Almost like what travel used to be like.

commentHeader: I would fly United again for sure
reviewContent: I want to commend United for the way in which they handled a number of problems we had while flying last week. Our return flight was canceled. There were people readily available to assist in where to go and who to talk to. They were staff just walkng around the gate area waiting to lend help. I was given a card to scan to speak to a live person via chat. That person was on the line very quickly. They were not able to get me a direct flight that same day but directed me to the Customer Service gate area where I could see an agent in person. With about 10 people in line, I only waited abouit 10 minutes. They had 6 agents working to help. The agent I spoke to worked very quickly to find me a next day flight. (The flight cancellation was due to weather and affected other flights as well). My husband has cancer, is very weak, has PAD in his legs and can't fly multiple stop flights. Due to the medical problems as well as the fact we were flying first class due to my husband's health, the agent issued me a hotel voucher as well as food vouchers. The next day, we were told that the seat I was assigned to, had a loose and wobbly armrest and the seat could not be used. There was no other available seat in first class so I would have to fly economy. I let them know that I am my husband's caregiver and that is was necessary for me to be with him. The gate attendant assured me they would resolve the matter. They offered a generous travel voucher via the loudspeaker to any volunteer that would give up their seat to someone needing a seat due to medical reasons. Someone gave up their seat and we were able to sit together in first class for the flight. My husband had wheelchair service to the door of the plane and we were boarded first. When we got him into his seat, the rest of the passengers were allowed to board. The service from Vegas to Houston and back was great. The flight attendants were all friendly and helpful. Drink and food service was fast. The food was good ! The free direct TV in flight as well as the complimentary earbuds were great. The flights were on time and smooth. I would fly United again for sure. The response from all involved was fast and friendly.

route: Idaho Falls to Denver to Denver to Newark via Newark to Albany
commentHeader: my first, and last, flying United
reviewContent: Worst airline ever! Rude staff, unorganized. They tell you there is enough room for bags and then make you check it as you’re boarding. Phone chargers in the seats don’t work. Moved to another seat and it was also broken. Customer service is pathetic and non existent. United says service is its priority behind safety which tells me I should be afraid on this flight. I will never, ever fly United again. Also, it’s my first, and last, flying United.

commentHeader: Flying with United was a mistake
reviewContent: To initiate this review, I was greeted at the c5 gate at 6.45 (RSW) with a face of disgust and a “who are you”? I’ve never had an airline great me this terribly. Secondly, I was told I wasn’t checked in, the lady was incorrect in stating this, I had checked in the morning of (online) and of course went to the podium to check in a bag. I went back to the main United Airlines Podium after denial to my flight and the agent mentioned I was indeed checked in for the flight, she didn’t understand why I was rejected entry. All of this caused a missed flight for a business related trip. Flying with United was a mistake, I will continue to fly with Delta moving forward to receive fair treatment, I don’t expect much but I won’t settle for the service I received with United.

Worst experience of my life just constantly delaying our flight, lying about it, being rude about it. They won’t help with anything, just tell you to go to their website. They put me and my family through hell. They are a disgrace to humanity. If United airlines went out of business tomorrow it would be a blessing. Let’s all hope they can somehow be put of business.

route: Reno–Tahoe to Barcelona via San Francisco / Munich
commentHeader: I hope to never be forced to fly with United again
reviewContent: After a 2 and a half hour delay on a 45 minute flight, we missed our connecting flight. We waited on the Customer Service line for 2 hours. During this time, I asked multiple agents at gates for help, and was told that I needed to wait in the understaffed customer service line. I was told by agents who were too busy on their personal cell phones that they couldn’t help me establish a connection. When I asked the second agent to ask a supervisor to send additional staff to customer service, she ignored me. I continued to ask what to do next and she just looked through me and resumed using her phone as if I didn’t exist. Most other airlines will offer assistance at the gate or counter. This would not us ever happened with an airline like Alaska. I hope to never be forced to fly with United again.

Trying to get any sort of customer service with this airline is impossible; they genuinely don't care about their client, and their online services are the worst you could spend hours, and they would give you excuses instead of a solution

Never over 15 years have I ever been denied a standard carry on! Couldn’t get a boarding pass until I paid $35 each and checked the carry on bags! The best any United rep had to say is I should have read the fine print. No waiver. No recourse. Pay or miss your flight. Insult to injury, they asked multiple time for volunteers to check bags free at the gate  Definitely get the top-down-corporate-vibe from employees they could care less about your business. I will never fly United again.

I was very impressed with the service I received. The attendants on both the outgoing and returning flight provided excellent service. I have not flown with United in years but this experience has made me want to book with United going forward.

On my first business trip with United, they promptly lost my luggage at LAX. Ok, it happens. I submitted a claim and United sent me a form to fill out, where I listed every little thing in the bags and painstakingly tracked down the required receipts. It came to just under $1000. After waiting about six weeks, I was informed by their agent that their “policy” does not cover reimbursement for many of the things in my bag, such as prescription glasses and computer hard drives (brand new, with receipts). They declared that they will pay me $314 for my $1000 worth of lost luggage as “full and final settlement”. I wrote back to let them know this was unacceptable, and was ignored. To sum up, I handed them a bag with $1000 worth of stuff, they lost it, and are now nickle-and-diming me for their mistake by hiding behind some asinine policy.

commentHeader: connecting flight was a bus ride
reviewContent: I know this my fault, but I can’t be the only one who’s never had “flight” that was a bus ride to another airport. I didn’t even realize that was a scammy thing I had to watch out for when booking. I flew from Louisville to Newark and my connecting “flight” was a bus ride to Allentown. I’m already upset because the lady at the boarding counter was clearly not happy to be there and was reflecting that in everything she did. Now I’m stuck on this highway in traffic getting in 30 mins late because I am on a bus.

commentHeader: always seem to have a problem with connection flights
reviewContent: It’s my second time flying with this airline and they always seem to have a problem with connection flights. One excuse they have to stop for gas another excuse bad weather I am pleading with you people if you have to fly with United Airlines with a connecting flight, please do not do so. You will never make it on time.

United hasn’t been on time since I started using them post pandemic. The current plane has been here since yesterday and now, at 7 am, they find out that a maintenance of the plane is deemed to be the right thing to do. Never mind that over a 100 people paid to be at work by 9am. But boarding wouldn’t happen before 10:30am. In any other business this would be unacceptably unprofessional. It would also be more than enough reason to compensate the involved parties, but United keeps piling it on. “Safety is their priority and excuse to do whatever they do” Certainly, that was my last lesson to avoid them (United Airlines) at any rate in the future.

Worst airline I’ve flown with. This airline needs to go out of business. I flew out of lax to Denver, once we got to Denver airport we circled it a few times and decided to go to grand junction for fuel instead of landing because of “weather”. The weather was nice and then the flight got canceled so we had to stay at grand junction, they got us a hotel and food vouchers witch was the only positive thing about this horrible trip, we had to get up and be on a shuttle by 6am, we go to the airport to fly, plane gets delayed. We get on the flight, plane is delayed from taking off, we finally start flying after a while and everything goes as normal, we get to Denver and me and my family wait for 9 hours, we get to our next flights gate, after those 9 hours sacrificed the flight gets canceled once again, no surprise this time. Now we are at customer support and writing this review.

An absolutely horrid experience. Never again will I fly on this airline. I will make multiple stops elsewhere on another airline, even if United flies direct to our destination. We left Tahiti on United Airlines bound for San Francisco and then on to Baltimore Washington International. Departure from Tahiti was just shy of 90 minutes late while they waited for “late passengers.” Really? This our arrival to San Francisco as significantly late and when we arrived, there was no attendant for the Jetbridge, so we sat at the gate for somewhere between 10-15 minutes. Next was Customs which was awesome and then onto our connecting flight to Baltimore. Except we missed the 45 minute check-in requirement by 12 minutes! Therefore, we “missed” our flight to Baltimore. So then, we worked with a ticketing agent (very nice and helpful) who booked us on the next available flight, 15 hours later! We were originally booked in First Class which was not available on the re-booked flight. No problem, we just needed a ride home. So we were booked into Economy Coach at the same price we paid for First Class (same day bookings are much more expensive!). We were told at booking that we were in Emergency Exit row seats and would have to keep any onboard items stowed above (i.e. NOT under the seat in front of us). After placing a near empty backpack into the overhead bin, I was told it needed to stay under my seat until after take off. A conversation ensued about the discrepancy and I was told it was “that way for this flight.” When I challenged the Flight Attendant, I was informed that I was “a disruptive passenger and she outdated have to talk with the Captain.” Just for challenging safety regulations bout which I was informed prior to boarding? Next, the Ground Agent came to our seat to tell me that he was considering “having me removed from the flight because the Flight Crew feared for their safety.”  Just because I challenged the safety regulations which the ticketing agent stated? Ultimately, I was informed that I was “allowed to remain on the flight”, albeit with great embarrassment. The Flight Attendant responsible for this debacle was absolutely the rudest I have encountered on any flight to multiple destinations around the world. Our “consideration” for all of this was a $150 voucher each, which I ask the airline to donate to the charity of their choice. Finally, a side note. We had flown United to Hawaii a year earlier and encountered the very same “snarkiness” of the Flight Crew. Never, ever, will we fly on United Airlines again. At best, their culture is is really bad, and at worst, they just don’t care.

This flight was good. On time even early and no hick ups and early arrival. The boarding in Key West was OK even with the construction going on. Boarding, Flight and Crew just great, if only construction in Houston would have been better planned .. but that is not United

commentHeader: you do not trust your passengers
reviewContent: Dear UAL Marketing Team, I am writing to express my concerns about the flawed marketing concept that you have recently implemented with respect to carry-on baggage requirements for passengers traveling without carry-on bags. I strongly believe that restricting a boarding pass for those passengers without carry-on bags is not only unnecessary, but also punitive to those who choose to check-in at the kiosk instead of online. As someone who often travels on basic economy class, I already experience the lowest possible service that you offer. However, the added layers of unnecessary steps only make the experience even worse. It is disappointing to see that you are needlessly adding extra steps that make me think twice about choosing UAL whenever possible. The needless step of checking with your staff for examination because of your lack of trust shows that you do not care about your economy class customers. It is unfair to assume that just because a passenger chooses not to bring a carry-on bag, they must be scrutinized more. This sends a message that you do not trust your passengers, which is not the best way to build a strong relationship with them. I suggest that you figure out a better, less punitive way to treat your good basic economy class passengers. This will not only improve the overall customer experience, but it will also demonstrate that you value all of your passengers equally. Thank you for taking the time to read my concerns. I hope that you will take them into consideration and make the necessary changes to improve the customer experience for all passengers.

Did not honor seating request (purchased additionally) from Expedia SG. Did not think it was their problem to solve and there was broken linkage between Expedia and United. Aside from Air crew cabin tried to help but everyone else at the airport terminal was extremely rude and not helpful in any way. Refused to acknowledge that there is an operational gap. A brief Google shows that unless seat selection is done on United site, it will not get honored and you will not be notified. Staff refused to acknowledge that Expedia is a booking partner. It's known that United falls behind with service rating, but paid for seat selections that are not honored is pretty bad. Choose another airline with better rating if possible.

I have always been a United Airline customer and have met amazing customer service representatives until I unfortunately met with an agent at Pittsburgh international airport today. She was very rude and unprofessional. She didn’t go above and beyond to explain policies and procedures to customers.  I addressed her about the behavior and she didn’t care to listen to me and told me to do whatever I wanna do. Such people make me lose the love I have for United Airlines

Terrible service. Our flight was double booked and we called to cancel one. We got the confirmation for the flight we canceled but apparently the one we wanted was cancelled as well. We didn’t realize until we were looking for the return flight check in. We checked all emails we got the email confirmation for the cancellation for the one we wanted to to cancel for the double booking but no email about cancelling the second flight that we wanted. We also were able to fly on the incoming flight to our trip but not able to fly back and they try to say it wasn’t their fault but we never cancelled and they wouldn’t honor anything and wasn’t accommodating with anything. If I were able to give them 0 I would. Their solution was to pay 3k for new tickets. Originally was giving us a price 300 per person after going back and forth changed to thousands of dollars.

I find it very disappointing that an airline can allow you to purchase a ticket but cant provide the service. This is the second time I've encountered severely poor service from United airlines not only did I not make it to my destination today they tried to accommodate me to stay in a state that was not part of my itinerary nor my destination. I will never use this airline again and hopefully if anyone's reading this review you won't either.

Absolutely no one should use United Airlines anymore. Somehow between five years, the only times I utilized United to fly from Missouri to Palm Springs, my flights were delayed both times and the connecting flights were missed. The reason for this was “technical issues with the phones” and maintenance didn’t show up for 2 hours when we were originally told it would be 20 minutes. Absolutely horrible airline, never use this airline if you want to make your connecting flight.

What a poor performance, unprofessional rude and unexacting customer service! First we have been dispersed all over the plane as family with 2 minors. We approached the desk and a “nice” lady greeted us with almost a slap in the face rather than a Hello. Things get worse, my son was thirsty and I ask for cup of water they sad we are about to take off no water. Ok I understand. No seatbelt sign went off and I waited 5 min for them to go in the back when I buzzed the bell they saw and ignore for 10min. After I start buzzing 15 time lady came with half glass and handed over like we were animals. She promptly ignored us all the trip skipped giving us drinks by turning her head around. Food was yelled at us instead of explaining. Unfortunately United was the only available option for this trip but for sure this will be my last time flying with this poor company. Oh by the way don’t try contacting their customer service ! It does not exist! Or at least after 1,5h that I was on the wait I decided to just give up! What a disgrace for an airline.

I fly on average 2-3 times per week. Usually on Delta but sometimes other airlines. Sometimes even in budget airlines. My HNL-ORD-BWI round trip was approximately a $1500 flight. On the long leg of this flight (over 9 hours) the outbound plane was likely over 20 years old. The seats were old and run down. The entertainment screen was not even nice enough to call mediocre. The return flight was worse. No screen. This plane was so old that it had no screen. On a long haul flight this has now become a necessity. On each of these flight we were served one meal. If you can call it that. My outbound meal was bread and butter, yogurt, and a fruit cup. Furthermore, on a flight that long drinks should be included. They were charging $10 per airline bottle for liquor and you could only purchase one at a time per airline policy. I paid for wifi to keep in contact. This service never worked. I recently had a 6 hour flight on Emirates that was under $700 round trip. We were served 2 amazing meals and a snack as well as free liquor and constant service from amazing flight attendants. I know Emirates is an amazing airline but the contrast is necessary to show how awful this experience was. I will never fly United again. They weren’t even the cheapest for this route. They were the most convenient as far as available times. Next time I will save the money and fly a better airline at the same time.

commentHeader: allowed passengers to cut the line
reviewContent: Went to check in and showed up early, they allowed passengers to cut the line for another flight that didn't want to show up early like everyone else. If you can't show up on time you shouldn't be allowed to cut the people that did.

commentHeader: worst airline food in my 60 years
reviewContent: This was truly the worst airline food in my 60 years of flying. Almost everything (main noodles, side grain salad, bread, cookie) was starch with only a few sad limp vegetables and literally 5 tiny pieces of lettuce. Bread was old and dry. Sauce was salty/sweet with no other flavor. It was inedible. Later turkey and cheese sandwich with squashed flat bread and no condiments. I would switch airlines to avoid that again.

This airline is absolutely horrible! I flew to Kalispell MT on April 7th barely made two of my connecting flights because they were booked so close together. On the day of my return flight which is today it really just got worse April 9th Easter. We arrive at the airport and stood there for 20 min waiting for someone to print out boarding passes and check our luggage in. The lady was just standing in front of us pretending to do something on her computer before finally another employee said something. Got on the flight first flight was fine then we arrived in Denver. We had about 45 min until our next flight to Chicago and when it was time to board we get on the plane and we sit and sit and finally the pilot comes on the intercom and says they were having a fuel issue. The people who were supposed to come fill up the plane were taking longer than expected it was 40 min at this point. But he assured we would make the time up and be ok after 45 min he says we are getting ready to take off and will be 20 min behind. My next flight was at 1:55 we wouldn’t be arriving at the gate until 1:40. So I’m already freaking out because our connecting gate was far! We had to go from C26 to C1. So I got my bf to contact the terminal and let them know to wait on us we wouldn’t be to late. They agreed. And said we will wait. We finally hear the pilot say flight attendants prepare for landing. Next thing you know we start going back up in the air again! We’re all like what is going on? The pilot comes on the intercom and says unfortunately we can’t land yet because there’s another plane on the runway so we have to make a couple circles. I knew at this point we were doomed. They took there time making there way to the gate when we landed and had us sit on the plan for another 15-20 min before then let us off. We ran so far and fast I almost passed out and I had my 11 year old kid with me. We get there and they are gone! No one’s there to help rebook my flight I go to the one beside c1 and they keep pointing me to a barcode that wouldn’t work. I go up to another desk and they say go to c7 I go to c7 they point me to b19 finally get to the desk they didn’t have any available flights until tomorrow so we had to get a hotel and stay in Chicago. Don’t have Any of our luggage and have no clue where it is. This airline is awful and do not care about their passengers.

Upon landing in Denver we needed to make a connecting flight. The airline had us sitting on the taxi runway for over 30 min while they tried to clear one of their other planes from the terminal. Numerous ppl were going to miss their connecting flights and they knew that. Rather than either hold those planes for a short while so customers could make their flights or immediately rebook them at the landing terminal, they just told ppl to hurry. So I and others ran like crazy just to find out we missed our flights anyways. We get, a much later flight and 15 dollar lunch voucher. No apologies. No explanation. No acknowledgment of the need to improve. No real compensation for the trouble. Very poor airline. Won’t fly them for awhile.

commentHeader: no screen on this flight of 5 hours
reviewContent: Using United many times due to my residence near Newark airport. My recent boarding was from Las Vegas to EWR. Disappointed to see no screen on this flight of 5 hours. The same was from LA to Hawaii before. No food, no service, no entertainment. United is not a low cost airline. I'd like to use others like Delta, Jetblue as possible, but no choice.

Terrible, terrible, terrible! They are all rude and unhelpful. Also slow and not good at communicating for instance they didn't tell me till I boarded that for some odd reason they would have my seat blocked off so I have to sit away from my 3 year old! And let's not forget the people in front of me, 2 different people where given the same seat!

Flight was delayed several times. No information was provided, staff incompetent and lied about passenger rights in case of delay. Only flew with UA because Star Alliance partner Lufthansa transferred us. If I could give less than on star I would...

route: Los Angeles to Denver via Minneapolis
reviewContent: No appreciation for long time customer. Exit row empty yet wanted me to pay $78 to move despite allowing a minimum 400 pound person to buy a single middle seat. All they could say is that they are not allowed to make people comfortable unless we charge them, we have no authority. Pretty sad that employees can not access a situation and use an easy solution to make people happy. I fly over 100 flights a year. None will be with United again.

commentHeader: absolute and complete failure as a business
reviewContent: On April,1 2023, I had a return trip from Panama that landed in DC. From the point of entering these the United States, my experience with United Airlines was terrible. For some reason, customer service is not a value of this company, and I can actually say that it seems like this company values discourteous behavior. Once I arrived at the Dulles airport, I went to several United counters and each worker was rude and condescending. There were many workers at each station, but they were not helpful and I ended up going back and forth from various counters without getting any resolution to my problem. After about an hour, I was able to get a boarding pass. When it was time to board the plane, the lack of good customer service continued. The flight took off late. I was told this cannot be done and that cannot be done. I missed a connecting flight in Chicago. Finally, when I arrived in Milwaukee, my luggage was lost. The lady at the counter said that since it was 12:00 midnight her shift had ended and she walked away. I called the 1-800 number to report that my luggage was missing. Finally, on Monday, I received a call that my luggage was found. The guy on the phone wanted me to come to the airport to pick up my luggage. I have to say that this man was rude, too. Finally, United Airlines is an absolute and complete failure as a business, and the workers are useless.

Absolute and complete failure as a business. Flight took off late, missed connection flight in Chicago, then UA after 2 hrs of a ca'nt do that and can't do this, they didn't get me to my destination. Then the refund process was even worse than the trip and then the just denied the refund. Apparently it wasn't their fault that they didn't get me to my destination. One of the worst experiences ever.

route: Los Angeles to Barcelona via Newark
reviewContent: Two flights in the last ten days. LA to Newark - checking in was very difficult and not helped by the extremely rude staff at the check in kiosks. This was however countered by the very bag drop staff member who was helpful and friendly. This was also the case in Newark when we reboarded for Barcelona. Check in was far more pleasant but boarding was delayed for over an hour while cleaners finished up. Also, at boarding some of the rudest service I have encountered. Told we couldn’t take carry on and then told ‘an announcement was made’ like it was our fault that we had carry on!  On both flights the staff were efficient but not overly friendly, except when you left the plane! The food is mediocre at best but then most airline’s economy fare is much the same - except for the middle eastern and Asian international carriers - they are often exceptional. Maybe United could do some exchange programs so their staff can see how it should be done! On the plus side, the aircraft are new and modern they are a bit cramped, which surprised me as the US is famously full of porky folks! The real plus is the entertainment - if you are a movie fan there is a fairly large choice of new and recent releases and classics in every genre! I was not bored. I would have a far better review if it wasn’t for such poor interactions we had a couple of staff. It’s amazing how a fairly decent experience can be so totally spoiled by a couple of rotten apples in the team. I remember a fairly important lesson I learned in my younger hospitality days based on research. It was shown that those that have a nice or great experience will share that experience with a few people, when a bad experience is had it will be shared with many many more. This was my bad experience and it is now being shared with many.

United is a truly second-rate airline, and it is fast on its way to become third-rate. This business class cabin was particularly poorly served. Slovenly boarding was followed by nobody to great and guide to the seat. The cabin was full of burnt smoke. Passengers were still boarding when a flight attendant obstructed the isles with taking meal orders. I was immediately informed that my first choice meal may not be available in the 5th row. Certainly, no welcome drink or a hot towel were served before this 13-hour flight. Flight attendants appeared disorderly, indifferent and disorganized. Polaris business class passengers were the 4th group to board, following disabled, children (teenagers), uniformed military and other 1K passengers. What kind of premium services are we paying for? Stay away from this airline and do not even think of paying a penny for their anything “premium”.

route: Pasco to Memphis via Denver / Houston
commentHeader: Used to be a loyal United customer
reviewContent: Pasco flight delayed over an hour waiting on Contract maintenance to reset a breaker. Missed connection by 12 hours after scheduled arrival time. United still has not gotten bag back to me 2 days later. I used all online forms, texts and attempted to call: “bag is out for delivery” is the response to a Track. Used to be a loyal United customer. Will never fly United again. Evidently, they have systemic issues & problems with lack of maintenance, lack of United maintenance and horrible customer service. Let’s try a human please?

Worst onboard customer service. Not only were they rude, they only cared to talk amongst themselves and not care for their passengers. I had a toddler napping and all they did was chit chat and laugh loudly, and wake up my toddler on a trans pacific flight. Great job guys! Food choices and quality was terrible. I understand we booked economy, but the food was beyond bad. Choices were Chicken or Pasta. Then they ran out of chicken when they got to my row, so we had pasta. The pasta was bland and soggy. The "snacks" they had were turkey and cheese sandwiches which were dry and cold. Worst is they do not compensate anything for their fault. My flight was cancelled due to some mechanical error so they rebooked me for an outbound flight 2 days later. I had to stay an extra 2 days, and pay all my meals without any compensation when it's not my fault. Never will I fly with them again and I will advise anyone I know to not fly with them.

Regret flying with this company and won’t make that mistake again!! Rude from start to end, they try to find a way to charge you for a small purse I was able to fit inside my carryon bag but it’s ridiculous how they want you to pay for everything when you are entitled to carry a bag in plane! They are not clear with instructions when I’m telling them I couldn’t get ticket online because it said I wasn’t checking in any bags so I had to go to check in desk and get boarding ticket. There I tried telling them I wasn’t paying for baggage and they kept insisting that my bag had to be paid, I know it’s a small bag permitted and fit in your box “allowed carry on without charge “ but they kept wanting to charge me. Finally got the clear and was able to board plane but not a good experience having your employees treat you disrespectfully and taking advantage of customers by lying and trying to get away with overcharging.

The absolute WORST experience ever, and this includes being delayed in Kandahar for days on our way home from a deployment in Afghanistan. Due to an hour of avoidable delays on the tarmac after landing, and then sprinting through the terminal to arrive 2 minutes prior to scheduled take-off we were told rudely that the plane had already left and “there was nothing to do about it now” with an eye roll from the attendant. We were then told we could have a next-day flight to Norfolk leaving at 10:30, 3 hours AFTER my son’s graduation from A-school would happen. They didn’t care. They didn’t apologize. We were told by multiple passenger bystanders that Newark is always this bad with connections. United held us on the plane while other “more pressing connections” were prioritized over us. United didn’t offer a refund, a voucher, or anything else at ALL! We DROVE to Norfolk overnight in a rental. I ended up paying full price for driving 6.5 hours! United is horrible. Never EVER again!

route: Milwaukee to Orange County via Denver
reviewContent: I am responsible for travel for a group on 9 including one handicap person. I intentionally paid a premium price for an adequate layover time to transfer my handicapped elderly parent through the Denver airport. United months before the flight changed the timing to only allow only 40 minutes for a layover which is not enough time for my immobile parent. Mind you this was a booking for 9 people over $10,000. (Two seats were first class, one was for my mother) I spend 2 hours on the phone with them and there is nothing they can do for me and my group. So frustrated!

Oh my, it would be easier to rent a car and drive across the country than it is to get portable oxygen concentrator on a flight. Customer service is a joke. I missed a flight on the way out, now I can't pre-check because they need to verify documents. No where to send these documents, I asked that yesterday. Seriously dissatisfied. The only thing I want to do is reserve a seat next to my son. Nope we don't have that option. Thumbs down.

route: Salt Lake City to Puerto Villarta
reviewContent: My wife and I flew out early on 1 March from SLC to Puerto Vallarta. This trip was to celebrate my birthday, on the 4th, and our 30th wedding anniversary, on the 6th. We were scheduled on a flight that left at 6:45AM and arrived pretty close to the time we needed to check our bags. Since there is a hard cut-off 45 minutes before the flight, we tried to go straight to the counter but a United employee insisted that we go to the kiosk first. She had trouble at the first kiosk and after a few minutes, went to a second kiosk, where she didn't seem to know what she was doing. We finally just ignored her and walked up to the counter. The gate agent helped us but because of the 5-10 delay minute caused by the first employee, we were TWO minutes past the hard cut-off to get our bags on the plane. That meant that we couldn't get on our original flight. She was able to book us on different flights but we ended up getting to Puerto Vallarta hours later than originally planned. We were scheduled to go to a highly recommended dinner/show cruise that evening but because of our late arrival we missed the show ($140.00 per person). Despite that initial mishap, the rest of our trip was great and we were looking forward to returning to Salt Lake on Saturday evening, the 4th, and then on Sunday, enjoying a 30th anniversary brunch planned by our four children and about twenty of our friends, neighbors & extended family. Unfortunately, our Saturday afternoon flight from Puerto Vallarta was delayed (no reason given) for several hours, causing us to miss our connecting flight in Denver. We arrived so late that there were no more flights on Saturday night but got booked us on a flight the next morning. The earliest we could leave was sometime around noon and we didn't arrive in Salt Lake until about 2:00, meaning we missed the 30th anniversary brunch our family had scheduled for us. We always try to be positive and make the best of bad situations. The incompetence of United Airlines caused us some major stress and grief, but we are focusing on the positive aspects of our trip and had a delayed celebration of our anniversary last weekend at our home with our kids and a few others. I prefer to put this whole incident behind us and chalk it up to experience, but for us and most of our family and friends, United is now on the same do not fly list with the other bottom feeders like Frontier. I reached out to United and got one of those 'thank you for your input, we won't do anything' form letters. What a joke this airline has become. No wonder they're rated at the bottom for almost everything.

Every time major delay. They charge a lot but the service is unacceptable. This time London Heathrow to Denver. Expected delay 2,5 hours. New departure time 1:30pm instead 11:00AM. In addition a stop is planned in Boston for a crew change. Unbelievable, total amateurs. The absolute best joke is the self service machine you have to use to check in as Business guest.

commentHeader: sat on the runway for 5 hours
reviewContent: They first checked us in and sat us on the runway for 5 hours before they canceled the flight because that the aircraft was overweight. But the company provided us the hotel, food voucher and the next day's flight. The next day, we checked in. And guess what? Still the over-weight issue. The plane is sitting at the gate now. Who exactly knows why the company cannot fix the same problem?

We made reservations a month ahead of our family trip to DC. One day before the trip we tried to check in on line and learned that the flights were cancelled due to overbooking without any notification to us. We already paid for no-refundable fee for a week for a hotel in DC, which we lost, not to mention the fact that our family trip was completely ruined. The worst part was when I contacted the United Air customer service they simply refused to make any compensation for their wrongdoings. This is the true danger of M&A among airlines and the few surviving airlines no longer respect their customers. Nonetheless we would NEVER use this terrible airline.

commentHeader: Worse experience I have ever had
reviewContent: Worse experience I have ever had. First I booked me and my sons flight through Expedia and then on our return flight home they first said that I had to pay $511 for baggage and airfare (but I purchased round trip Tickets with Expedia) then after our flight was delayed an hour we got on a plane finally only to be stuck for another hour plus with a broken part!!! Never again will I use Expedia or United airline ever!

0/10 United is the worst airline of them all. Employed are some of the rudest people I’ve ever met. Flights are always delayed. Our flight was delayed 4 hours, we missed our connecting flight then they booked us on a full flight. Will never fly United again.

commentHeader: has become as cheap and low scale as Spirit Airlines
reviewContent: United Airlines has become as cheap and low scale as Spirit Airlines. Prepare to be inconvenienced and lots of angry passengers. They will charge for bags, charge if you have to check at the gate even if their overheads are full, charge for seats and explain nothing. They are now at the bottom of the list of airlines I would fly. United used to be equal to a Delta, American or Alaska, they are now several levels lowers.

commentHeader: Complete incompetence from start to finish
reviewContent: Complete incompetence from start to finish. 1 hour flight from Manchester to Newark took 2.5 hours with 40 minutes sitting on tarmac with rude flight attendants barking that no one could get up to use the restroom or we would not proceed to the gate. Missed connection, waited an hour to reschedule flight, waited 4 hrs for flight then boarding was delayed again for an hour to wait for a team of clowns with a trash bag and a dirt devil to clean the plane for all of 5 minutes. What a joke, will never use this airline again. All in all a two hour trip took 9 hours.

Flying has become an unpleasant joke and United and Swiss Air are the worst. The United site for check in is slow and disconnects, so re-entering flight information must be done several times. You struggle to get the seat map to display. This also takes several tries. I finally get a seat and try to get a seat for the Swiss flight to Zurich. That option is not available. Check in at the airport goes smoothly until the machine prints the boarding passes and I am assigned a Swiss seat but I did not get to pick it. I have no idea if I am window aisle or in the middle. Going to the United gate person is no help. He can only change the United flight seat and can do nothing with the Swiss seat. And these two airlines are supposed to partners? Partners in idiocy only.

We were 10 minutes away from our destination in Great Falls m when we were told that we were turning back around to Denver because of snow. There was no snow though when we got here, poor directions on where our bus would be, sowe spent 40 minutes trying to find it due to the fact the gave no directions and when we asked they kept pointing in different directions.
Avoid at all costs. Extremely unreliable: cancellations and delays, I don't remember a single United airlines flight when I would not have a problem.

My return flight from Tampa to Newark was smooth and went without a hitch. The interior on the 757-200 was new and very comfortable. The cabin crew was great, the only downside would be the noise on the inside of the aircraft above the wing, but being that my 757 was 28 years old, it was perfectly bearable for a short flight.

route: Sydney to Edinburgh via Los Angeles / Newark
commentHeader: showed us kindness on our flight
reviewContent: Thank you to Rajneeta Smith of United Airlines who showed us kindness on our flight, when she learned of our long journey and short connection times she arranged for us to have some food and a blanket for the rest of the connections. She was genuinely concerned for our wellbeing and ensured we had plenty of water to drink: Very professional and an asset to the company, thank you for making our long journey a little easier!

I paid a tidy sum for my ticket only to be told I'm only entitled to board with one personal item, so my carry on was checked at a cost of US150. I'm an A.A. customer but was not getting the usual flights I desired, hence the reason for using UA. Huge mistake, I will never use United Airlines again. What was even worse they announced that complimentary check in would be given because of overhead space issue but because I hold a basic economy ticket I was made to pay - worst airline ever! Not to mention no beverage offered from Atlanta to Houston

Suzette Porter is an extremely professional and passionate employee. I wish she was available when I arrived to SAT, maybe things would’ve turned out differently. She is exactly what all United ticket counter employees sure try and emulate. Attentive and in front of their computers instead of talking to employees away from the counter and avoiding eye contact with customers checking in. I would like to start this post by stating “I missed my flight”, no one else’s fault but mine. When I arrived 30 minutes prior to my flight the first ticket counter staff there was not helpful or empathetic to the start of my debacle. Stating I will not be able to fly out until tomorrow morning with many flights available which was not a possibility and needed to be at a work function in D.C area. After 2hrs and 30 minutes on the phone with my travel coordinator, I was able to get an earlier arrival flight with American Airlines and my United ticket was fully refundable. Thank you all for your help getting me to my destination.

Embarrassed for United. I booked a direct Ft Myers to San Francisco flight on one of the newer routes is developing. I paid extra for this flight. However, due to mechanical issues after a five hour delay the flight was cancelled. Ultimately I arrived in San Francisco after a 12 hour inconvenience. Then on the flight home I opted to stay a day later to make up the lost day. As a result I had to be routed SFO-DEN-RSW. The SFO-DEN flight was delayed at the gate twenty minutes, but the flight crew was able to make up the time and we arrived the airport on time. Unfortunately, both of the 777 capable gates were occupied and so we got to wait on the taxiway for long enough time for me to miss my connection home. The next flight is tomorrow on standby at 935 or confirmed at 5:45pm. On the bright side I got a free room and night in Denver. I also was given a $150 travel credit. I wonder if it would just be cheaper to have flight operations and mechanics better paid and better managed? Also, the seats are miserable in coach. No elbow room and the seat pitch is murderous. Flight attendant staff were pleasant and professional on the triple seven. United can do better than this.

commentHeader: This whole trip was a nightmare
reviewContent: This whole trip was a nightmare from start to finish. When I got to BWI for UA730 leaving 6:10am for SFO on March 5th, the usually deserted United desk was a teeming mass of panicked passengers. When I looked for the self-serve boarding pass kiosks (I only had carry-on), I was dismayed to find that they were all gone. After the experience of a colleague with making a confirmation and then missing the flight due to car trouble, I make a point of only confirming at the terminal. Nonetheless, I tried the link on the text from United and it directed me to download the United app. I then had to wrack my brain to remember my United password, but was able to provide it. Once it downloaded and I confirmed, after some effort I was able to find the tiny "boarding pass" link. My phone was only 10% charged and I then had a race against time to reach the gate before I lost my digital boarding pass. I did make the flight, but barely. Too bad United didn't tell us in advance that they were making these changes. On my return flight the crew just stood there smiling while all the overhead bins filled up and the passengers, including me, were standing around helpless. They finally informed us that we would be allowed to put our rolling luggage in the first class bins. At my DIA connection the crew were again all smiles. Only after I was in the terminal did I realize that my hour layover was suddenly much shorter. The crew had failed to mention that the plane was thirty minutes late and maybe people with connecting flights should run? I further didn't realize at first because it seems that United has eliminated the arrival boards at DIA . I staggered to the gate as quickly as I could, only to arrive one minute too late (by the clock) and the gate attendant stonily informed me I could not board. My dismay was dispelled when a uniformed stewardess stopped next to me and she told him that she also needed to be on the plane (I think she said she had been on the same flight from SFO) and that she was "dead-headed", which apparently meant that although she wasn't scheduled to be crew on the missed flight, she would end up missing another flight where she was needed. The gate attendant told both of us he would see what he could do and called up his superior. He then told the stewardess that she could board but that I was still out of luck. I then asked for help rebooking. He informed us there was another flight to Baltimore but that it was too late to make the gate, so we would best go to the customer service desk in the other terminal. About maybe one hundred yards along (seven gates) I was shocked to see "Baltimore" on the gate! I rushed to it, but the gate was literally closed in my face and was again told I was too late. Apparently this was the flight the other gate attendant was referring to was this one! We could easily have made it if we had known! The flight was marked as being 10-15 minutes late so perhaps he was not aware of this? Nonetheless, it would have been easy to just call ahead and check or to tell us to run and hope. I ended up having to take a flight back to California to LAX and from there a red-eye to finally arrive at BWI. At least this part of the journey went without a hitch. I will never fly United again.

I was boarding the plane from Columbus Airport on my way to travel to Israel for a 10 day pilgrimage. After I took my seat, my smart watch verified me that my cell phone was not on the plane with me. The crew and attendants were already boarded and the cabin was shut. I was 6 months pregnant at the time of traveling with a husband and 2 children under the ages of 5 who were back at home that I wished to keep in contact with during my travels. I spoke with a flight attendant regarding my missing merchandise and she went above and beyond to ensure I had my cell phone before the plane departed. I am forever grateful for the generosity and stewardship shown by this flight attendant to ensure I was able to keep in contact with my family during my travels.

commentHeader: claimed it was due to weather
reviewContent: Flight was cancelled, they claimed it was due to weather. Other airlines were flying into Rochester, not sure why United couldn't fly. We ended up flying into Buffalo, however, we needed transportation to Rochester.

By Aspen standards, February 16, 2023, can only be described as a perfect day to fly. We arrived in Aspen airport at about 12 noon. Our flight United Express UA4720 was scheduled to depart at 1:52pm. Our boarding passes stated we would commence boarding at 1:27pm. The following Texts received from United: Flight UA4720 is delayed because an earlier impacted your plane’s arrival. It now departs at 2:06pm. Flight UA4720 is further delayed because we are waiting for a gate to become available. It now departs at 3:00. -Flight UA4720 from Aspen is further delayed because we are waiting for gate to become available. It now departs at 3:35. You can rebook your flight to a different day. Flight UA472O from Aspen to Denver is delayed further because it is taking longer than expected to load baggage. It now departs at 4:05. You can rebook your flight to a different day. Flight 4720 did not pull away from the gate until 4:30pm. Due to incoming flights, and being in queue behind a caravan of about a half dozen private jets, we were not cleared for takeoff until shortly after 5:00pm. Due to incoming flights, and being in queue behind a caravan of about a half dozen private jets, we were not cleared for takeoff until shortly after 5:00pm. We missed our outgoing flight and the last flight for the night to Washington DC by approximately 20 minutes. After waiting in line at customer service for almost an hour, the final indignity from United Airlines was the complete lack in compassion from customer service. It was now after 7:00pm. Not allowing my frustration to get in the way, “can you offer us hotel compensation as our departure from Aspen was not a weather related delay”, I calmly asked the agent. “No, I’m very sorry, we can’t offer you a voucher because our computer indicates your flight was held back by the control tower at Aspen Airport”, she responded. I showed her the series of texts we received indicating the contrary and she would not budge. “We have to go by what is indicated in our system; you should address your complaint to Aspen airport” “We have to go by what is indicated in our system; you should address your complaint to Aspen airport”. “As a courtesy, can you at least provide us meal vouchers for dinner?” “No, I’m really sorry, it’s against United Airlines policy”, she countered. With an imperative demeanor, she handed us two water bottles each containing toiletry kits. We have been traveling to Aspen for holiday more than 20 years to enjoy skiing on world class ski slopes, as well as indulging in the many other diversions Aspen offers. In conclusion, we can no longer depend on using United Express as a reliable airline for our future travel needs and will choose a method of conveyance which is more amenable to reach our destination.

Discount airline in disguise. Discount airlines boast low fares with the clear understanding that everything including seats selection will be an add on. United operates as a discount airline without the low fares. No electronic boarding pass as you can with any other airline including discount. Economy legroom is less than jet blue! Paid for wifi Not working. Paid for airport lounge So crowded and hot that we left the lounge, people sleeping everywhere and we couldn’t find a seat … to go back into the terminal where the sit down French brasserie had better food (only subs in the lounge) at the same cost per person as the lounge. We checked in one terminal but our gate was 3 terminals buildings away. $700 per person for inconvenient uncomfortable experience for a 2.5 hour flight. When I buy discount airline tickets, I’m not upset because of the trade off with the fare.

Flying in United's Polaris is generally a pleasant experience. On this particular trip, the chief steward was really excellent and most of his staff were good, as well. The meals are still pretty basic for business class. Basically a two plate meal and dessert. Quite a downgrade from pre-Covid times. No longer do they offer any type of Japanese cuisine for the main meal which doesn't make good sense to me. That said, the flight, while not extraordinary, was just fine. Entertainment options were plentiful. Everything went smoothly. My only disappointment would be in the meals, neither which can compare to those offered by Japanese airlines on the same route. I also found the staff to be courteous and attentive throughout. Announcements, though infrequent, were helpful and friendly.

Terrible. I used to fly United a lot. But having been using Delta. Thought I’d try them out of Newark in Polaris because they were a lot less expensive than Delta/KLM. You get what you pay for. Old tired cabin lousy selection of movies, meal was yuk. They didn’t even ask if I wanted a glass of wine with my meal. USB did not work. Awful experience. Will never fly them again. No wonder they get three stars

I purchased 2 tickets 60 days in advance for a flight. I was flying with an elderly person that has hearing difficulties. I needed to be on the same flight. When we checked in for the flight 24 hours in advance. We were both given a seat assignment. About 14 hours before the flight I received a text that I needed to recheck in. When I rechecked in I found that they had moved me to a different flight that was 3 hours earlier. After 4 hours on the phone/computer trying to get back on original flight. I was informed that the flight was oversold. I later found out from the other traveler that there was several lady golfers going to a tournament. They were last minute ticket purchases due to a date mix up. It’s a guess but I bet United sold my economy ticket for a premium. I ask if the fee’s I paid for a checked bag had been transferred to my new check in conformation code. I was assured it had been. Now I need to find a 3 am ride to the airport. After arriving in Houston airport I had to find the elderly traveler. Got on the next leg of flight and made it to final destination. Went to check in for return flight. Found out United didn’t transfer fees I paid for luggage. I had receipts where I had paid. Was told if I wanted bags on plane that I would have to pay fees again. So I did. Once I got home I spent another hour on phone getting a refund for baggage fees. It’s funny how when they charged me it was instant. But my refund will take 14 days. Never again United Airlines.

route: Merida to Calgary via Houston / Denver
commentHeader: Thank you for getting me home safely
reviewContent: I had a major surgery in Mexico due to an accident, and had to fly home while unable to ambulate effectively. My husband requested wheelchair service for all flights for our trip home on Feb. 28th. From Merida Mexico, through to Calgary, the service was definitely better than I had hoped for. Only at 1 gate did I have to wait for a wheelchair (even though they had one ready for me, someone else must have taken it by the time I was the last one off the plane). The stewardesses were very apologetic, and they all waited with me until a wheelchair arrived (which took about 15 minutes). They recognized that my use of crutches down the aisle was an extreme difficulty, and there wasn't any way I could deboard the plane into the airport without the wheelchair. My porters in each airport were friendly and courteous. The airline staff were very patient with my slow mobility, and offered assistance etc. Planes were on time except our departing one out of Denver was delayed by 1.5 hrs, which worked out ok as we had originally only had 45 minutes in between, which would have been very tight with me being the last one off the plane, and waiting another 15 minutes for the wheelchair. We go to Mexico every year, and have flown with United several times, and we will continue to fly United as we feel the service overall is very good. Our delays have always been minor, and we understand many things are simply out of a companies' control when it comes to weather etc. Thank you for getting me home safely after my surgery!

commentHeader: United somehow manages to be worse than most
reviewContent: Even by the very low standards of US Airlines, United somehow manages to be worse than most. At this particular time, my SFO-EWR flight was delayed first by 2 hours due to technical issues, which they apparently didn't even solve, as the plane had to return to SFO after half an hour. Their meal voucher didn't work at two airport vendors (then I gave up trying). Ultimately, the flight had been delayed by 5+ hours before they realized that they had to change the cabin crew who had a very long day already. I would've cancelled the flight but the website (as always) didn't cooperate. The United customer service representative - who was very helpful, but of course couldn't compensate for the overall bad experience - ended up sending me a flight voucher. Sadly it's only available for United flights, rendering it basically worthless.

route: Brussels to Fort Lauderdale via Washington
reviewContent: In August we flew with United Airlines from Brussels to Fort Lauderdale. Our suitcase got lost on the way there. After many emails and phone calls and having provided all the necessary documents, United confirmed on November 27 that they would compensate us with $1500. They also promised to give us a flight voucher valued at $150 per person. We have yet to receive any compensation. Every week, I contact United by phone or email, and I'm told to be patient, because it can take up to 30 business days to transfer the money. Clearly, it has been far more than 30 business days since the initial confirmation on November 27 from United, regarding the compensation. Every week I call about our case, and yet there's no progress whatsoever. I expect better customer service from an American company. I don't know what to do anymore.

Spent 55 minutes 12 hours before online checking in. Unable to check in or print boarding passes. Waste of time. Partner Air Canada on flight to Ireland had no problem with online checking in and printing boarding passes

commentHeader: basic economy I got for a 1st class ticket price
reviewContent: It was my 35th wedding anniversary and we went to St Thomas as that was where we honeymooned. We splurged and got 1st class. Worst decision ever - well the 1st was picking United. Anyway attendant never offered 1 drink - hey we were on vaca and I wanted a mimosa - 35 yes is a big deal! She disappeared after our breakfast which was not as we ordered - so who could ask? My husbands seat didn’t recline - broken, my tray table was stuck in up position - basic economy I got for a 1st class ticket price - no TV screen, nothing really zero amenities - I fly 1st class with Delta and American - and they sure give you what you paid for - might as well have been in Frontier, oh I forgot seat pocket in front filled with crayons and someone else’s boarding pass - yeah they cleaned alright!

United took me from New Jersey to St. Maarten safely in the middle of about two hours worth of severe turbulence. Our entire flight lasted a bit over 4 hours total. The plane arrived from its previous destination, Cleveland, 35 minutes ahead of schedule, but left 40 minutes after our scheduled departure time due to severe weather. The plane was 23 years old, but very well-kept. While we were over the continental US the Internet worked great and United now allows you to text for free on multiple platforms. The only thing is that when we lost Internet, I was not able to make a food purchase midair because now you have to register your credit card on the app in order to buy onboard and I failed to do that before take off even tho I was prompted to do so multiple times before my flight. The crew was fast and efficient, once the Captain allowed service in the cabin after the 2 hours of turbulence. The seat was much better than pre reclined ultra low cost carriers, if it wasn’t for the two hours that we buckled like a wild horse, it would’ve been pretty good overall. At the end of the day I’m grateful to United for making the best out of a pretty bad weather situation in the end I arrived safely at my destination and that’s all that really matters.

The entire duration of the 13 hour flight, I had a defunct television screen that was broken and stuck in the full brightness setting. Everyone else got rest. I got a blaring blue LED light in my face for straight 13 hours. Slept through 85% of my brothers wedding, which was the entire reason for the trip. I’m told by staff to call and explain my horrid situation. It took almost an entire month for United to offer me a $100 in vouchers (1 for $75 and one for $25). That’s not even 1/8th of an upgrade for the flight I was on. United does NOT care about travelers. They care about bottom dollars.

route: Saskatoon to El Salvador via Toronto / Washington
reviewContent: Worst experience flying ever. I booked my flight several months ago, traveling with my little one under a year I made sure to book my trip with the least connections. I had troubles adding her on the reservation so I called the airline to get this done. They took quite a bit to help me but was told it was done, there was no added charge and I was going to receive a confirmation in a couple of days. I received an email with a link to the reservation details, when following the link I could see the 3 of us were booked and everything looked good. When check in time came I went to the website and it said I needed to check in at the airport because they first flight was thru air Canada. I showed up to the airport 2 hours ahead even though you only need about an hour for domestic flights. When I get there Air Canada can not find a ticket for my daughter they took a while trying to solve it but in the end they told me to contact United that it should be an easy fix as she was sitting on my lap. When I contacted United the agent treated us as if we were lying and we didn’t register our daughter, he said there was nothing we could do and it needed to be done by air Canada, mind we told him we were at the airport with all our our bags and our little one and have about and hour and a half before the flight leaves. He said I needed to purchase an infant ticket for her and I said that I wasn’t informed when I called to add her but we could pay her ticket if necessary. United kept telling me I should do that with the airport staff and air Canada kept telling me they can’t do that… this took a while.
