When I saw the time was getting close and we were not getting anywhere, I asked if I could just buy an adult ticket for my daughter for this flight and just continue with the rest of the trip as paid, he said they didn’t have my daughter at all, when I said I had proof that I had called to add her to the flight and her name in the reservation details he went again to talk to his manager (3rd time).. it seemed so unreasonable that they couldn’t do anything when she was traveling on my lap. He came back and said they see her name but because it’s international and we didn’t pay for a ticket they couldn’t help me. By this time we already missed our flight, we asked to be transferred to the manager after about another hour talking she said they could get us on another flight arriving to our destination 3 days later and with an overnight layover and magically, now she was able to get payment for a ticket for her? Both agents kept an unapologetic attitude even though we were not at fault. You would think that if you call the airline to let them know you are traveling with a kid and they take her name and info, they would tell you you need to pay a ticket. I reminded the manager how hard traveling with kids is, and that an overnight layover was not ideal, also that I had book those dates for a specific event that I was now going to miss. I told her that it was a major inconvenience on top of getting stuck at the airport with a little one and all our luggage for hours without them getting anywhere to now have to come back the following day. She basically said that all she could do to help me. I was so frustrated, tired, sleep deprived that honestly could not take anymore from United I asked for a refund and purchased a way more expensive ticket thru another airline - they really screwed me over and not once took ownership for their mistake.

route: Edmonton to El Salvador via Denver / Houston
reviewContent: We flew United Airlines from Edmonton to El Salvador Feb 8 with connections in Denver & Washington DC on the way there. LAX to Denver Feb 23 on the way home.  Each flight on the way there was on time, respectful and friendly. All our luggage's made it on time (We were a group of 9 passengers) On our way home we were delayed in LAX to Denver, the workers there were very nice and respectful to everyone. Our connection in Denver to Edmonton was only 40 minutes. We let them know and they ensured when we landed to ask everyone to remain seated that didn't need to run and allow us off first. We ran to our connecting flight to find out they held the plane back for us. I want to say thank you for the very smooth, reliable, friendly and outstanding services we received.

I had a great experience in Denver. While I hate to admit it I lost my phone on the plane. They continued to search while boarding two planes and managing all of the chaos. The remained calm and gather my information, I will be forever thankful and I am very pleased with the kind and caring customer service they provided. Thanks so much. And yes they found my phone after 20 minutes of searching.

route: Raleigh Durham to Frankfurt via Washington
reviewContent: I flew Premium Economy class from Washington DC to Frankfurt, and it was my best flying experience. Firstly, the flight was on time. The flight crew were very professional, laid back, and willing to help. I had the best time chatting with the crew in between food and drink services. The flight itself was very smooth (I know they don't control that) and my seat was comfortable. I would fly United Airlines internationally again.

route: Mexico City to Cleveland via Houston
reviewContent: United is off my list for next trip. I like to be comfortable and being served well as I pay for. Food and even snacks are unacceptable, seriously horrendous. Bad menu choices. Staff do not serve first nor Business correctly. They never ask for my jacket to be hanged on a hanger. They serve in plastic cups in 1st class?. Every time, in every United flight (just got back yesterday from Mexico City through Houston to Cleveland, OH) the staff converse with each other very loud. After Covid (who said it is over?) there is no need to wear a mask, yet so many people were coughing and sneezing constantly, as if someone was very sick. Isn't a duty of the stewards to say something such as: "Could you please cover your mouth when you sneeze or cough?". Very mediocre service. It is a shame how disquieting is to pay first class to get such poor service.

United airlines Economy Plus is a waste. I upgraded from Economy to Economy Plus for $109. My ticket was purchased 4 months before the flight. I purchased this upgraded seat because of a back problem that I have. I picked an aisle seat so that I could sit sideways and allieve the back pain that I was expecting. Two days before my flight, my seat and row was changed, giving me a center seat. I complained to 6 different people and they all said this happens all the time. For $109 upgrade this should never happen. I will not be flying United again.

commentHeader: I will never fly United again
reviewContent: My flight was scheduled to leave Springfield at 6:15 am with a connecting flight out of Houston to Sarasota, FL after a 1 hour 14 minute layover. At 6:30am the counter announced they had overbooked and needed 4 people to volunteer for a later flight and $1000 coupon. At 7am it was announced that no one could board until 4 people volunteered to give up their seats--most of us had connecting flights out of Houston, so connections would be missed.Next it was announced all carryons with wheels needed to be checked in on the loading bridge. I asked the agent if it was mandatory to checkin carryons if it was a connecting flight--she replied yes. I said I hoped I didn't miss my connecting flight (also United). We were finally allowed to board, yet sat on the tarmac to be de-iced for a considerable amount of time. We finally landed in Houston at 9:32--My connecting United flight was to depart at 9:44am. I waited to pick up my carry-on, flew through the terminal and arrived at the United counter minutes after the scheduled departure, only to be informed that the door had been closed. No more flights out to Sarasota until the next morning, but one to Tampa at 2:30 pm. My friends had to drive 2.5 hours to get to the Tampa airport (the traffic was crazy that evening) and I had to wait at the airport almost 4 hours. It is unbelievable to me that the flight didn't wait for the people who missed the flight by minutes at United's failures. I will never fly United again.

commentHeader: worst experience I have ever had"
reviewContent: Beware, if United cancels your flight you are on your own if you go with another airline, even if the agent tells you they will refund the cost of the other airline. My flight was cancelled and the earliest they could get me out was 42 hours later. I was able to catch a flight with Southwest the next morning. That United agent said they would reimburse me for the Southwest flight. When I reached out to United to get the reimbursement they indicated they would only refund the portion of my ticket that was cancelled. They were very apologetic and sorry for the inconvenience cancelling my flight, me having to sleep in the Denver airport, but too bad for me. As many miles as I have flown over the years, this was the worst experience I have ever had. Being told one thing and then not honoring their agreement.

I have been flying for years. This is one of the first times I have chosen to fly with United airlines. Worst experience I have ever had with an airline. Our flight was delayed in Honolulu to san Francisco so we missed our connecting flight. Then they booked us 24 hrs later. That was a problem we both had to work on Monday. So they had another flight that was earlier but to new jersey still put us late on Sunday to arrive in Cleveland. We ended up staying at the airport so we didn't miss our next flight.

Pure incompetence. Hour and counting delay on flight due to lack a preparation. I have only flown with United one other time in recent memory and the experience was also terrible. Horrible company. Don’t give them a dime. Fly Delta!

commentHeader: quality of service is below overage
reviewContent: Lisbon to Tampa via Newark. Awful airline, the ticket wasn’t cheap, but quality of service is below overage. The flight was delayed and then they forced me to check in my carry on, rude flight attendants, disgusting restrooms.

route: San Antonio to Knoxville via Houston
commentHeader: do not plan to fly United again
reviewContent: My daughter and I flew to San Antonio from Knoxville for my grandson's graduation from Navy A school at Joint Base Fort Sam Houston. The day we were scheduled to leave San Antonio to fly back to Knoxville via Houston, there was a weather event in Houston, which initially delayed our flight. Unasked, we were put on another flight into Houston. After sitting on the tarmac on that flight for around 2 hours, the pilot stated that the plane was overweight due to fuel, passengers, and baggage, and that they needed volunteers to deplane. The pilot also stated that he had never experienced such a situation in his 25 years of flying. Eventually, enough passengers volunteered to deplane and the flight departed for Houston. Once in Houston, we were informed that our flight to Knoxville had been canceled and rescheduled for the next day. By then, it was around 10 PM. I contacted United customer service via phone while my daughter stood in line at the customer service desk, which eventually closed before she reached the front of the line (there were 85-100 people in line.) The customer service rep I spoke with was hateful and rude, and informed me that, because our flight was canceled "due to weather", we could request cots to sleep in the airport or we could get our own hotel. We got an Uber to a hotel and spent the night, and arrived back at the airport the next day. The new flight went from Houston to Dulles. At Dulles, we boarded a very small Embraer via stairs from the tarmac. It was raining and the metal stairs were very slippery. To top it off, when I got to the top of the stairs, the flight attendant told me, very rudely, to go back down the stairs and gate check my backpack, which was the size of a purse. I was wearing two leg braces and barely made it up the steps to begin with because of severe osteoarthritis. The gate agent could have asked me to gate check the backpack. Someone on the ground could have asked me to gate check the backpack. No one did. Just the rude flight attendant. Luckily, my daughter was a few people behind me and could take the backpack back down the stairs. Again, in the rain. After all this, United sent us each a $150 travel voucher. That is the last thing we want. We do not plan to fly United again, under any circumstances.

route: San Francisco to Toronto via Denver
reviewContent: Honestly, the worst airline and worst experience. I got on the flight in San Francisco with my hand luggage and the crew member said they need to check it in due to the aircraft being full. I said okay, will it come straight to Toronto. He answered yes. Guess what? I had to ask him for my bag tag, he put someone else’s bag tag on my bag and sent it to Denver. I lost very personal items because of some careless mistake of the crew member. They need to understand that they are dealing with peoples belongings and actually do their job properly. Anyways, the bag was not found. It was said it reached the head office, but nothing after that.  Worst airline ever.

route: London to El Paso via Houston
reviewContent: My worse experience by far. Travelling for 3 days from Germany - Munchen to El Paso Texas. I lost all the connections due to delays, I arrived at my destination with both check in luggage lost. United team from El Paso was promising me that my luggage is located and I will have my luggage before Christmas. they never offer me with any voucher as I arrived with zero clothes and personal items to my final destination. It was before Christmas. I needed to go every second day to airport to check if my luggage was found because on the phone that they gave me they never answered. United team told me that my expenses (for my survival days in my vacation)will be reimbursed and Until today I did not receive any money. I spend a lot of money, lost my luggage and they offered me zero support. One of my luggage ( 10kg) was found after 10 days but the big one (23kg) was never found. And I called so many times, filled claims and I received zero compensation from United. Every time I am calling them they give me a different story of my claim.

I can honestly say the experience was just as good, if not better, than any 5 star airline I have flown. Check in/Bag drop was the most efficient experience I've had with any airline for each part of the journey. No waiting in long lines to get bag tags, it's via self-serve. Each time, staff offered to help us stick on the tags - travelling with 2 young kids, this little gesture was greatly appreciated. It was also very impressive that bags could then be tracked via the United App. We had no issues at all with our luggage. As far as the aircrafts themselves, we had 3x 787s and a 777 over the journey. Planes were clean, and on par to other airlines 787 and 777. No issues at all with our special meals, and staff were friendly, attentive, and very professional - the kids each got a small activity pack as well. Free Wifi for messaging apps (Text only WhatsApp, Messenger etc) on every flight. Pricing for full internet use was very fair. Entertainment was as good as other airlines, with the ability to also play content on our own devices. Staff had headphones for the kids (as opposed to wired earbuds that everyone else got).  I hope your next trip is as good as ours. I'm not one to leave reviews normally, but this was a truly fantastic experience.

Checkin staff were very friendly and the process was quick and painless. Flight departed on time and arrived an hour early, crew were efficient and came around often with drinks throughout the flight. Food is below average when compared to other PE products but IFE is among the best if not always easy to use the choice us huge. Had the bulk head seat so there was plenty of room and the seat was comfortable, downside is the location of the headphone jack. Overall a good but not fantastic experience and I would fly them again.

Made it to my gate right before they closed the door to the plane. I still had my suitcase because we were late getting to the airport. Went through TSA and was told that I could gate check my suitcase. One of the people checking the tickets was about to let me board, but the other lady was belligerent and was complaining about my suitcase being too heavy. She gave me a hard time and rebooked my flight to where I won’t be arriving until super late. On a scale of 1-5 stars, United gets a -2.

commentHeader: Use would depend on the price
reviewContent: First time flying United and after reading the reviews I was expecting the worst. Flight was uneventful, departure and arrival were on time, I got lucky in that the seat next to me was empty meaning I had some space, but could have been very cramped otherwise especially for a 12 hr flight. Staff were efficient and came around often with water and several drinks services. Toilets were kept reasonable clean and the entertainment selection was top notch. Let down has to be the food which was average at best and parsimonious in size. Also repeatedly got bumped by the flight attendant when they walked past, not once or twice but the whole flight long. They got me there but have to say that others do it better and had the seat next to me not been empty the rating would be lower. Use would depend on the price.

Made me check the same bag they allowed me to fly to Fort Lauderdale Florida just a few days prior. We checked to bags so they also charged us a second checked bag fee which was ridiculous as well because my son didn’t check a bag so it should have been first checked bag which would have been 15 dollars cheaper! They charged us 75$ for a bag that was within there dimensions specified and we didn’t have to check prior! My fiancé called support and that told here all these hopes we had to jump through for them to make it right! Worst customer service ever and now pretty much told us they won’t refund it! While the staff on the actual plane were amazing! This just put a super bad taste in our mouth the lady at the desk for where we boarded could easily see all the information that we didn’t have a first bag check for my son and was super rude and was just trying to stick it to use. Everything in the bag including the bag wasn’t worth 75$ it was a ridiculous unnecessary up charge for now reason when it fit under the seat! Complete scam and trying to make money off people. Do the people at the desk get bonuses for making people check a bag because that’s what it felt like.
Good premium economy seat, good staff, good food. This was our first time again to fly United again, the Flight from DTW to EWR was great and not too crowded. This flight was a code share with ANA.

Flight was fine. Completely full flight. My tray table was defective and slanted downward so food and drink would slide off toward me. I brought it to my FAs attention and her solution was lifting my leg up to hold the tray in place. Food was terrible. Flight entertainment was good.
The seats on United Airlines have a little more leg room than competition. The crew of stewards and stewardesses are very helpful and pleasant. Overall a decent and safe travel experience.

commentHeader: United won't be a choice now
reviewContent: United had my flight arrive in Reno 7 hrs late, had a bird strike on arrival (another 2 hrs). Missed my connection in Denver. United would not pay for a room. Then they have a system of sending you to a non-working web page to fill out complaints. I travel a lot, but United won't be a choice now.
Paid for a nonstop flight. Flight had fuel issues and had to divert to CLT. Fuel at IAD was over filled and first we had to wait for a special truck to refuel the overfill. A fiasco!

Flew from Bonaire to Houston to change aircraft from Houston to Detroit. We'll to make it short, flying into Houston they announced they had to go around Houston until a severe weather storm was at Houston Airport had passed. Going around not a cloud in the sky and landing everything was dry a calm. Due to United's incompetent running of an airline they had an aircraft at our gate that was the real reason for flying around. We missed our connecting flight and we had to fly Delta to Detroit no thanks from United. They still haven't a clue where our bags are and couldn't care less. Never again will we fly United.

Worst experience ever. Seats I paid extra for where not given to me and when I went to the United service counter I was told they could do nothing for me. (I was also traveling with a 3 year old and a 7 month old) My party of 6 was spread throughout the plane, even my 3 year old, and United said there was nothing they could do. I purchased a padded stroller bag and when I received my stroller off the luggage belt, the handle was broke in half. I went directly to the United desk again and was told there was nothing they could do. They have zero customer help and don’t stand behind there mistakes. Will never fly this airline again.

What was annoying is that 2 hours after we took off we had a small lunch, then 5 hours later we got small tiny sandwich and small chocolate bar. Then 1 hour before landing an omlet and some fruits. So terrible for a 14 hour flight.

route: Quad Cities to Cancun via Chicago
commentHeader: Economy Plus a big waste of money
reviewContent: I selected Economy Plus which was a big waste of money. The flight from MLI to ORD there was no beverage service. Cramped seating. No plug in for electronics. Actual flight was uneventful. The flight from ORD to CUN. Again the flight was cramped and seat wouldn't recline. There was a beverage service. No plug in for electronics. I will never pay for premium seats on United. And most likely never fly with them again.

United Airlines is the new Spirit Airlines. There is an additional charge for every little thing to include carry on. There is also an additional charge for seating regardless of your child's age. When I asked about sitting next to my sons she replied, "we dont move seats with your type of ticket." Like I'm some kind of 3rd class citizen. Customer service is absolutely horrible. They lost my luggage tag, threatened to call the police, required my kids and I to leaving the boarding area, go back through security, which made us minutes from missing our flight. I was told that "if we missed the flight it would be my problem" even though they were the ones who lost the tag. I had my copy of the tag. We fly 6 or 7 times per year and typically I'll look for a reasonably priced ticket. From now on, I'll pay extra to fly on AA or Delta. Never again with United. Be warned!

Upgraded my seats to find out they changed planes prior to take off. I am now sitting in the last row with no refund on my upgrade. United has always been the worst airline option and their commitment to that continues. Staff is always friendly however the airline itself is always a significant disappointment.

Worst experience ever. I had booking from Reno to Saskatoon and day of flight they had some technical issues with the airplane so they cancel our flight for the whole day, and gave me a ticket for next day, and from Vancouver to Saskatoon day after that. They waste my three days and didn't gave me any compensation for that. Not recommend and will never travel with United again.

commentHeader: I forget how bad they are
reviewContent: When it's been a few years since I flew with United, I forget how bad they are and I give them another try to see if things have changed. We missed our flight with Hawaiian and needed to get to Hawaii the same day so we booked the next flight out with United, and my partner paid for Premium economy/economy plus or whatever they call the step above economy. He then got a notification that he was refunded due to an error and so he tried again and again with he same problem each time. We go to check in for our flight and the person checking us in says that there are multiple premium/plus seats available but that he can't upgrade us and our best bet is to ask the reps at the gate. We get there and I explain that I'm looking to upgrade to premium economy and the woman working the gate looks at me and scoffs and says we don't have that on this flight. I asked if she was sure because I was told something different downstairs and she said, "yeah" as if I was a moron. I left and the whole interaction didn't sit well with me so I went back to ask a different rep to upgrade and I told her that I looked online and saw that this particular aircraft does have a step above economy and that it's called economy plus and not premium economy which I had said before because I normally fly with Eva, Hawaiian, etc. And those airlines call those seats by a different name than United does. I explained that I had called it a different name so maybe she didn't understand what I was asking for before (trying to give her the benefit of the doubt) and the same woman as before interjects and laughs at me saying," yeah it's called economy plus, we don't have that other thing you asked for". Unbelievably and unnecessarily rude. What is the point of nit picking about what name I'm using when you obviously know I'm trying to pay for an upgrade? Right after this stupid and mind-numbing interaction, they announce the flight is delayed. They then get back on the speaker and say actually your gate was moved. Then we get to the gate and learn that our flight was delayed again for maintenance and to get a new plane I never fly any other airlines that delay flights like this, but every time I fly with united, without fail, our flight is delayed. I hate them and don't know how they're still in business. We got on our flight and the staff was rude and short with us until they realized that we had given the whole crew some chocolates to share, and then they changed their tune.

I have flown by United before but this time was awful. Just because you want to save money and fly economy doesn't mean we should be stuck in seats that are sized for a scrawny 10 year old. No leg room at all. I'm 5'4 and weigh approximately 140lbs. My knees were all the way to the seat in front of me. They expect you to put personal items under the seat in front of you but you can't bend down to pick anything up. The thing I hated the most was trying to charge my phone. It's under your seat and not a single one worked. Where it's located I'm sure has been kicked a million times. Overall worst flights. If you are a bigger person skip United or fork out for 1st class. The only nice part was getting off the planes and the crew were nice.

I'm speechless. This flight was supposed to be 2 stops, and 23 hour flight. It is now 3 stops, 3 delays and 60 hours so far and I'm still sitting waiting. And all the weather is good. I though to give them a second chance since they fail me before, I was stupid. You had been warned. No more United Airlines.
Thanks to the United Airlines staff, you were fantastic at a difficult time. Haven’t seen this type of compassion, professionalism and service at a check in desk. Well handled. Thanks

One of the horrible experience in my life I’ve had. Had 40 hours at the airports, online agents are very incompetent. Customer service agent didn’t even bother to help us, after so many complains and emails no help was given. Basically thanks to incompetence of the workers of United airlines I took a hit for extra $3500. Not anymore booking with this company, horrible customer service and horrible experience.

I had to fly United to get back home and while checking in I found my flight canceled. When I called to rebook, I was given no customer service. Then was told I had to wait 48 hours to get a flight out. I paid my fair like everyone else and should have been on the next flight out. Instead I was further inconvenienced twice: first when I told the agent I needed to get back and my job was on the line and he dismissed it. Secondly when I had to book another airline (at twice as much) that took me 14 hours to get home (Great Falls to Seattle to Denver RED EYE (was canceled) then trying Dallas RED EYE (was canceled) then Chicago then to Indianapolis. I work in customer Service for Hilton and work full time in IT. That is not how you do business or customer service. I will be telling others about this experience. It was horrible.

commentHeader: annoyed by the rudeness of the pilot
reviewContent: I was not able to check in 24 hours in advance as my e-mail requested so I arrived at the airport early. I was asked several security questions and when I received my boarding pass it had at the top, SSSS, which means give him enhanced security at the gate. Going through security I received the normal security which means a body scanner, and many pat downs. I went to the lounge and the only hot food was tater tots and mushrooms. They did have wine. I would recommend the Lufthansa Lounge. Make sure you do not go through Passport Control, or it will be too late to get to the lounge. I went to the gate early and United uses the only gate in Terminal B that has Body Scanners. When they saw my boarding pass, I had to go through the Body Scanner, many pat downs and all of my carry-ons were checked. Make sure you do not purchase any liquids at Duty Free if you have SSSS on your boarding pass. The entire process took about five minutes. I was on the plane almost an hour early. When it was time to depart, the fasten seatbelt sign came on and we waited another hour as every five minutes another frustrated person arrived on the plane. The fasten seatbelt sign went off after 90 minutes and lunch was served. I had the braised beef. Service and food were excellent as I was in Business Class. When I asked the flight attendant why the flight was delayed an hour his response was, I don't know. After the dishes were collected, the fasten seatbelt sign came on not once but twice, not because of turbulence but because too many people were trying to use the toilet. Note to United, turning on the fasten seatbelt sign doesn't empty my bladder. The plane was full, no empty seats. One hour before landing, the pilot said, we are expecting turbulence in Newark so we will be preparing the plain for landing early. Toilets were locked, seats had to be upright and tray tables needed to be up. There was no turbulence arriving in Newark and I have flown with this pilot before. Five feet before arriving at the gate, the pilot made the announcement that we are five feet from the gate and already 28 people have their seat belt unfastened. I took this flight three months ago and I'm still annoyed by the rudeness of the pilot. Most airlines say thank you for flying with us.

commentHeader: This time definitely hit a new low
reviewContent: We took a two week trip to Tokyo in Dec 2022 and Jan 2023. Flying with United was the worst part of the trip. First, our flight to Japan was delayed due to "mechanical issues" with the aircraft. What was supposed to leave at 10:35am left at 7pm. Second, on our flight back to SFO, they damaged our checked bag. Our luggage (large, hard outer-case suitcase weighing less than 50lb) came out of the carousel about 70 minutes after arrival (along with everyone else's), and it had severe cracks that rendered the suitcase completely unusable in the future (the inner padding was exposed). I tried to tell an agent about this, but no one was present at the United counter at baggage claim. I chatted with an agent on United website about this, but without any apology, she told me to go to a different terminal to see an agent. Who wants to drag a broken luggage across a sprawling airport after a 10-hour flight? In comparison, when a similar thing happened to me on an American Air flight, I was quickly reimbursed for the damage. United has great entertainment onboard and their planes are state-of-the-art, but I have never had a pleasant experience with United as a customer. This time definitely hit a new low.

route: Chicago to Rio de Janeiro via Houston
reviewContent: Our plane was delayed in arriving in Chicago, and so our flight to Houston was delayed. However, if the Chicago gate crew had given a crap at all, they would have gotten us to Houston in time for our connecting flight to Rio. However, they had one guy retrieving 17 different wheel chairs, one at a time from the cargo area. But worse than that, the gate crew couldn't not have moved slower without backing up. It was painful to watch them eventually start to scan 300+ passengers with one hand-held scanning device that required two or three attempts to get it to work on each and every passenger. They so clearly didn't care! When I got to Houston I raced across the airport only to find that they had held our plane for us for 1 1/2 hours, but left 20 minutes before we got there. They just couldn't wait any longer. But we could have made it with even the slightest concern from the slackers in Chicago. The Chicago crew cares nothing about good service. Clearly there are no consequences to the staff for horrible service. This is a management problem!

commentHeader: don’t want to give us compensation
reviewContent: Cancel our flight after waiting hours at the gate because of a supposed problem with the plane. Have to cancel our 2 week trip. Can’t be refund by the two Airbnb we rented and we have to persist with United airlines for a refund. They don’t want to give us compensation either.

I had a problem with the employees working on baggage transfer at Chicago airport. I had a connection flight from Istanbul airport to Chicago airport and then San Diego, and the employee at Chicago airport told us that we should carry our bags and then check it in again, I didn't know what is the reason to transfer baggage where i had a final destination at San Diego airport, but when I carried my bags and brought them to the employee in order to get the receipt and gave them to the employee who works on the tracks to push the bags in, I told him to be careful when throwing them on the tracks, but the employee looked at me in the eye and threw the bag upside down, and I asked him "why did you do that?" He did not answer at all! These negative behaviors must be dealt with because they reflect the name and reputation of the airline.

I was on a flight from Columbus Ohio connecting via Chicago to London. Not only did I experience delay after delay - 3.5 hours delay, they have also had to rebook my tickets twice because of this. I’ve had to fly visa Newark to get back to London. And after a long and painful flight, having returned to London Heathrow, they have lost my two checked luggages! United Airlines baggage enquiry staff told me that one of my luggages was in London and made me wait for four hours looking at carousels from other flights, in the end, I went home with zero luggage. They said my luggage will be delivered the day after, but the contact number they have provided to track your lost luggage does not work, very hard to get ahold of United Airlines customer service. What an absolute nightmare of an experience I have had. Very poor service. I will never fly with United again.

commentHeader: This has inconvenienced us very much
reviewContent: I booked my flights (non-stop which is very important to us) August 2022 and received an email a couple of days ago telling me my flight now has stops. I called to see what they could do to switch us to another flight, give us a discount or upgrade us. All they offered was a refund. This has inconvenienced us very much because now we are having to pay at least $1000 more in tickets.

commentHeader: we are in a city we didn’t plan to be in
reviewContent: Utter garbage experience from start to finish. On the way to the airport our last connecting flight gets cancelled, booked the “Plan B” they had available. Get to our first stop in Denver then from Denver over to LA. The boarding pass stated from Denver to San Francisco, 6 hr destination error. I am not supposed to be in LAX to begin with. I claim my baggage only to check it back in to send it to Melbourne & I notice a huge slit in my luggage, completely torn apart, I will not be surprised if I’m not reimbursed even partially for this damage. Finally here at my gate that was initially supposed to take off at 4pm, then got delayed to 6.45pm then to 7.30pm. It’s a connecting flight to San Fran to get us to Melbourne, which takes off at 11pm, so another delay is going to cut it very close. Lo and behold, a 3rd delay to 1am! Awesome experience. Not to mention, all the delays came with gate changes. Cancelled flights, delayed flights, damaged personal belongings, & we are in a city we didn’t plan to be in. Any reimbursement? Of course, not to worry, we got an offer of $75 credit towards United Airlines, very generous.

commentHeader: I won’t use this airline again
reviewContent: Never use this airline, this is my 3rd time using and is always ALWAYS with problems. They are ALWAYS departure one hour later for technical problems! The 3 times was one hour late the departure! I won’t use this airline again!

I’m reviewing because my flight was canceled. After the flight time kept being pushed back several times due to delay, finally 6 hours later it was canceled. I contacted customer service via text from the airport but never got a response. Eventually I dealt with customer service at the airport and the young lady at San Francisco airport helped me to book a new flight and provided me with a hotel voucher. It was interesting to watch how some customers were being helped and others were simply not. Shame on you United Airlines.

Boarding was uneventful and the seat was very comfortable and spacious, probably the best premium economy seat I've been in. It had good back support, a storage area in the armrest and good storage under the IFE screen, which was quite large. We were given a nice large blanket and a good sized pillow. The food service was excellent, served on china with a cloth napkin and wine. We had dinner and breakfast and both meals were very good. IFE was okay, with enough to watch. We were supplied regularly with water and drinks throughout the 11 hour journey. Staff weren't the most interactive but were friendly and accomodating. We took off on time and arrived early into Houston. The toilets were shared with economy and were spotless. I had a look at the economy seats and they were very cramped in a  
3-4-3 arrangement. All in all, United did not disappoint in PE

route: Fort Lauderdale to Brussels via Washington
commentHeader: stop using Covid as an excuse
reviewContent: Very disappointed. Especially traveling after Covid. This airline has been reducing customer service, the staff are rude, I had an awful sleep in Business Class. Traveling after Covid has been a disaster. At Fort Lauderdale, the United Club lounge was disgusting, limited food, using plastic cutlery instead of metal, not enough drinks, cramped and noisy space. United ruined the start of 2023, after 3 bad years due to Covid. It seems like Air Canada and United Airlines have been downgrading their services during Covid and using "Covid" as an excuse for poor customer service. I am so upset with all of the airlines I flew during the Christmas holidays. I am going to avoid Etihad Airways, Air Canada and United Airlines because they were the reason for creating a bad start to 2023. I wish the United Airlines team can learn from Singapore Airlines, when you fly with Singapore Airlines, the service is outstanding and relaxing, also the planes are clean on SIA. This is a bad example of travel after 3 years of Covid. This is not good enough and a horrible start to 2023. These airlines need to buck up and stop using Covid as an excuse.

I recently flew with United Airlines and it was the worst airline experience I’ve ever had. I was flying out of XNA in Bentonville, AR, and connecting through Denver to then fly to Bozeman, MT. Our flight out of XNA was delayed 30 minutes (which wasn’t a huge deal), and as we got closer to Denver, the flight attendant informed us that they were not going to land in Denver, we were being redirected to Montrose, CO, due to low visibility. We were told we were going to land and be back up in the air shortly and that we were just waiting for the weather to clear. We then had to de-board the plane and wait inside a very small airport that had 5 total gates and 1 terminal. More and more flights being redirected from Denver were landing there and caused the terminal to be so crowded that it was difficult to walk around without getting stuck in a crowd of people. We waited for 3 1/2 hours while only being told to not book a hotel room, and that United was going to get us back to Denver soon. This entire time, we were tracking other United planes that were landing in Denver hours before we were able to fly back. Finally, we re-boarded the plane and flew back to Denver, where the conditions were worse than when we originally attempted to land there. Once we landed in Denver, we spoke to a United Airlines agent because we had just found out that instead of rebooking us on a new flight, they just decided to cancel our boarding passes for the connecting flight to Bozeman without notifying us, that we missed due to the wait in Montrose. We were told we could not be put on another flight until January 4th (it was January 2nd when this all happened) and that the 2 checked bags we had on the plane could either be claimed at the baggage claim, or shipped to Bozeman after we arrive, but would not get there for 2-3 days after we arrived. We decided we would schedule a flight with a different airline for that night, and go down to the baggage claim to get our bags. We were told that United had submitted the request for our bags to be pulled and it would be 1-2 hours before they would end up on the baggage claim carousel. We sat and waited for 4 hours and still did not receive our bags. By the time we reached Bozeman, United had cost us over half a day of travel that cut into our vacation time, and large amounts of stress and annoyance. I will never fly with United again, and hope that anyone who flys with them does not have the same experience I had.

commentHeader: I will never use United again
reviewContent: The whole story started when I booked a flight from NY to Vegas, checked in, got my boarding pass, the airplane delayed for 2HRS and then when i went to the aircraft they told me that I have no reservations. I called them and they told my that my ticket is cancelled without any notice! They told me I should get a new one and i did and purchased a 5 new tickets. Everytime same thing happens! This is the worst experience in my whole life and I will never use United again.

After some really nasty flight changes and service downgrades, I gave up on Delta and decided to give United a shake. I can't give enough praise to United for the wonderful service we experienced flying out to Denver and back to Eugene, Oregon. The flight out was slightly delayed, but it did not affect our trip. The flight attendants were friendly and personable and certainly made me pause and try to remember when I last had this kind of attention. They were very sorry for the delay and were sincere in the service they provided as a result. A special call-out to flight attendant on the return flight UA318 from Denver to Eugene. He engaged with everyone on the flight in a way that will certainly bring me back for future flights. You need to know when you get it right. You most definitely did for my family and me for this trip. Keep it up!

Terrible, plane delayed 5 hours, nothing offered for forgiveness. Plane finally gets boarded, been here for an hour still haven’t even left the terminal. Ruined my ride for when I get home, ruined everything.

Being a frequent flier, I have used all US airlines and many International airlines - to name few - United, Continental, American, Delta, Southwest, West Jet, Spirit, Air Canada, Qatar, Emirates, Gulf, ANA, JAL, Turkish, Mexican, China Southern, Air India, Indian Airlines, Jet Airways, Kingfisher, Sahara, Indigo, Thai, Air Asia, Singapore, British Airways, Swiss, etc. Like everything else, no airline is perfect, however the way United manages its resources and keeps 'on-time performance' is phenomenal and commendable. Another big differentiator for United is its automation - United is several step ahead in automation. This made a clear distinction during December 2022 Arctic freeze in North American continent - when airlines like Southwest could not schedule its pilots and dumped customers' luggage wherever they could. United kept most of its services intact with minimum disruption and maximum on-time performance; also United system is able to tell every customer where his luggage is at any point in his trip. The way and with speed at which United came out of COVID-19 was also seamless and shows its resilience. United's cleanliness during pandemic was way superior than others. Its safety video has always been worth watching. Its pricing is mostly very competitive even on routes not originating at its hubs. And usually its customer service responds on feedbacks which they ask for every trip. Overall the best choice for frequent fliers who value their time.

commentHeader: big thank you to United Airlines
reviewContent: I just like to say big thank you to United Airlines, for taking care for me and my sister to rebook new flight after we got late to our flight because flight from Germany got delayed over 1 hr. We got free hotel room, free lift to drive us to hotel, and pickup us back to airport + $30 each for dinner and breakfast .Thank you so much, great people, look forward to go back again with United Airlines.

commentHeader: another flight that has been delayed 3 hours
reviewContent: I was to leave 9.35pm Christmas Day. After a 5 hour delay boarding the place and several people taken off because people who paid more for their ticket took their place, the flight was cancelled and we had to get off. Then we stood in line with people from other United flights including an international flight for 3 hours to get rebooked. Now after a week of getting new flights booked and flights canceled not to mention the cost of hotels etc, I am sitting at the airport again waiting for another flight that has been delayed 3 hours. At what point, is United responsible for finally getting me home!!

route: Casper Wyoming to Las Vegas via Denver
commentHeader: Slept on the airport with kids
reviewContent: First flight was delayed 12 hours. Connecting flight was delayed 20 hours. Been tossed around from one end of the terminal to another 6 times. Slept on the airport with kids, no assistance given. On our trip back, our flight was canceled because apparently we were a ‘no show’ in our connecting flight to our final destination! Since we were a no-show, and flight being canceled, there were no available flights anymore until after 3 days!

Long story short, they were delayed the flight for a few hours, giving us some weird “hopes” and sharing some “progress” they are making in order to make our flight, and then just cancelled it. They did exactly the same when I was flying from Munich to San Francisco. It is terrible, completely disrespectful. I completely do not recommend United Airlines.

commentHeader: has to be some type of accountability
reviewContent: I never got on my flight on Christmas Eve because I wouldn’t have been able to make my connecting flight. I have been on the phone with the United Airlines call center multiple times with 3-4 hour wait times and meanwhile one of my bags has been on 5 flights and the other bag has been on 4. I also went to Newark airport to collect my bags and they told me to go home because the wait time would be too long and that the call center in India has no clue as to what’s going on in the United States. It’s now 4 days later and one of my bags is in Newark airport and the other bag is sitting in Houston. I have my medication in my bags and the call center told me to take myself to the emergency room to get medication. There has to be some type of accountability. I will never fly United Airlines and if you can’t trust them with your luggage, how could you trust them with your life.

I just wanted everyone to know that United and their ticket agents have gone above and beyond out of their way to accommodate me and make me feel extremely treated well I’m very happy with United and will continue to fly them because of this care that they’ve handled for me

United use to be a premium airline when you book united you felt this is going to be great. NOT ANY LONGER! Both planes were dirty and the seats were like flying on a discount carrier which I will not fly because of comfort. Flight crew was very unput together clothes look dishevelled hair unkept, Not customer oriented (they acted as this is the worst job ever). Just paid 700 for 800 mile flight. Asked for a Diet Coke only allowed one glass not even the can and no stupid snack really. I fly once every other week this was my first flight with United in a year they can not even compare to Delta or American. I will no longer book with united delta and American has my business or I could use another airport and fly a discount carrier which would match the service and uncomfortable plane literally felt like I was sitting in a plywood bench. I was unable to load my payment info on the app so was unable to use my credit card to even purchase a drink. Then the connection from Chicago they did not provide a beverage service, both other carriers on this route do offer. Very very unhappy with the price and the lack of service provided. I have instructed my husband who owns a travel company based in Philly not avoid booking me on the carrier.

commentHeader: needs to get its staff scheduling right
reviewContent: United needs to get its staff scheduling right. Both routes from Newark and Tampa, the flight attendant went missing for hours! This is the first time flying for over 30 yrs I have had this situation where the airline unable to even find backup! Anyway, from Tampa to Newark the flight was delayed by 4 hrs. The plane sat at the gate for at least 3 hrs so one would expect the cleaning service done properly right. Not in the case of United. I found filthy face mask inside the seat pouch and all over the seat and hand rest - crumbs of pretzels and cookies! There is no quality check and I don’t know how people still able to keep their job stating form the management of United. I thought Air India was worst but this airlines take the top spot of being worst. Only way it’s surviving is due to the sheer volume of demand from people in the US traveling.

route: Las Vegas to Auckland via San Francisco
reviewContent: Topped the list of worst airline. 4 delayed flights, one cancelled, said they rebooked us onto a new flight the next day (turns out they didn’t). New flight, delayed again, customer service is shocking. Didn’t know where our bags were. The common sense of these people turns out to be not that common. Do not fly with them.

Flight from Boston to Newark cancelled xmas night when we were to fly out at 6 am the next day. Drove to Newark Christmas night, bought rooms in the Hilton hotel across from airport, just to find out that we had been kicked off the second leg of our flight (Newark to San Juan) at 6 am the next morning. We had called United when driving down to Newark to say that we would make our flight and were assured that we were still on it, but clearly this was not the case. Staff was incredibly calm and helpful, got us on a flight at 8 PM (12 hours later) - however, this flight was just pushed back 2 hours (as of now, hopefully not even more) and we are now arriving at 3 am. The amount of money that has been thrown away so far is absolutely ridiculous, and for it to take 1.5 days to get somewhere that is a 6 hour flight away is just unacceptable. I understand the bad weather and the delays, but I am just shocked at the incompetence of a well-known airline. Newark staff and United Club attendants have been very helpful, but United Airlines itself is bottom level and I will not be flying again. To spend over 14 hours in an airport from Christmas to Monday night is horrible, especially with the money being spent on flights alone.

route: Corpus Christi to New York via Houston
reviewContent: Poor customer service. Delayed luggage. The employees at the claim office closed at midnight and left customers standing there. The only employee left there told everyone to leave and return the following day at 4 am. Called the claim center the following day (Christmas Day) 4 times to be put on hold for 1-2 hour each time. Spent Christmas without my luggage. Will never fly United again

commentHeader: Delays presented every 15 minutes for 10 hours
reviewContent: We were on an 11:03 flight arriving around 2:00 in West Palm Beach. The flight was delayed for mechanical reasons by increments announcing delays virtually every 15 minutes - this caused my daughter, son in law, $ toddler to finally leave the airport at 7: 00pm having waited at EWR ten hours hours not knowing if the flight would be ultimately canceled. So I’m missing my family after being through United Hell. We were so sick & exhausted when we arrived at PBI & had to wait for luggage at 12:30 am. We need a REFUND or vouchers.. & the poor abused gate people got no updated info ever! Delays presented every 15 minutes for 10 hours!

Kudos to United for their thoughtfulness. They waived change fees in advance of expected bad weather during Christmas travel. Changes were not dependent on their cancellations but based on traveller needs. Changes were also easy to make, they took less than ten minutes on line. United delayed the flight from Houston to Austin by 20 minutes to allow late arrivals to board the Christmas Eve flight. On the Austin side the flight was only 10 minutes late. The Houston to Austin seats were large and comfortable.

commentHeader: They say our luggage will follow
reviewContent: Flying on Dec 24 at 12.15 pm they announce that they rebook passengers to the next flight (1.30 pm) because of a technical problem but in fact the second flight is empty so we suspect that this was in fact the reason. I had paid 200€ to have more space for the legs but I am relocated in a normal seat. They say our luggage will follow but arriving at Newark they say the luggage will arrive later, that we need to file a claim at the office. A 200 m queue is already formed. The app say we can place a claim online. We leave the airport to be on time for the family Christmas diner. The way to place the claim cannot be found online. Indeed the app says we must return to the airport. Customer care announces 60 minutes wait. We return to the airport at 6 am on the 25th. The line is still long. We are in the queue.

United Airlines has always been my preferred airlines until what happened today. The plane was not flown out to San Diego because they had no pilot to bring it there, and they then lied saying it was an earlier flight delay. Luckily, our pilot on our flight told us all the truth. I cannot stand United Airlines as I missed my next flight afterwards because the first flight was delayed around 3.5 hours.

Technical problem on an old 757 on LAX-DEN on 12/22 which was delayed then cancelled extending my trip by 22 hours via red eye LAX-ORD and then ORD-LNK on 12/23 afternoon. Had to rebook twice (first rerouting was also cancelled via Houston). 44 hours trip. Did not offer any compensation (club access or hotel night). So so airline!

Worst flight of my life. They overbooked the flight, then blamed the passengers for not giving up their seats. The gate attendant kept telling us we were passing up a great deal completely tone deaf to the consequences of what they were asking. She then started singing Christmas songs over the intercom. We were then stranded on the plane for over an hour because they couldn't figure how to fix a "minor" issue. The cabin was sweltering too. I hope United gets a bag of coal for Christmas.

Flight was nice and comfortable. Pilots were informative about flying conditions and excelled in their professionalism. FAs were attentive to needs in cabin. I was given a seat upgrade owing to me being the first to gate check my carryon. Wifi and entertainment were operative with top notch catalog. Gate agents were nice and professional.

route: Norfolk to Los Angeles via Denver
commentHeader: declined substantially over the last year
reviewContent: I have flown United twice in the last year, the most recent being yesterday, December 16, 2022. It seems that the quality of both service and equipment declined substantially over the last year. Yesterday I was moved almost to tears when we were kept in the plane for 2 hours while preflight checks revealed an equipment problem, diagnostics were run, and it was determined that a part needed to be located locally (supposedly someone was going to run to the local airline parts store!). Thank heaven we had not left the gate. Instructions to passengers were that we could leave the plane, but all possessions had to be taken off as well. Those of us who chose to forego this opportunity in the hope that this was going to be a short event spent two hours waiting, only to be told that we were then required to leave the plane and had to take our possessions off. In the terminal chips, water and soda were handed out -- no vouchers for a decent sandwich or salad -- nothing healthy. We were one hour in the terminal, then another 45 minutes in the re-loading process. The seat width and legroom were atrocious. With almost no legroom, some seats still had the reclining capability and the lady in front of me was reclined almost in my lap. The seat pocket was tiny and held almost nothing. I never did find any charging capability for my devices and the attendant was not even sure where the ports were; luckily I brought an old fashioned book. All told, all of the legs of my Norfolk to LA round-trip were miserable because of the quality of the plane and service, but the last leg was extra-ordinarily hellish. I got home at 3:15 this morning. While I complain here about United, I used American Airlines in September and experienced similar treatment (an unapologetic 3-hour delay with no food after all services in the airport were closed, unconscionably tight seats and few amenities). We are treated like unloved dogs by the airlines while paying high prices (my cross-country trip cost over $600 for economy -- more when counting payment for the privilege of selecting my seat, for checking a bag -- because I knew there would be little to no overhead space for even a small bag, and for using the plane's WIFI). Meanwhile, the airlines make record profits by packing passengers in, cutting the numbers of available flights, and providing no real amenities. God help us!

route: Salt lake city to Frankfurt via Chicago / Amsterdam
reviewContent: Horrible. I was traveling to Germany to see my two sons and in Amsterdam watched as I was moved over two days to one cancelled flight to another. The flight in was horrible, worst staff and food I ever experienced. In Chicago they made us stay on our plane 5 hours on the tarmac. When we got to Amsterdam the crew vanished. There was no support, no help, no representatives. I had to take trains and finally pay a driver to take me into Dusseldorf to ensure I made my visit with my children. Sure enough even the flights the following two days were cancelled. The worst was they never provided any food or lodging.

Two weeks ago wrote a review about the pilot saying on time departure before taking off two hours late due to improper loading of luggage and weight issues. Here we are today, pilot just said they forgot to fuel the plane. This airline is a joke. One of these days they will be on time. Right?

My first time flying with them and it will be my last. When we checked in my boyfriend was not required to pay for the bag. When we start boarding the lady I’m the front stated we had to pay. I was letting her know that the first ticket we received and when we checked In we were told we didn’t have to pay. Please keep in my mind I was very polite. This lady was so rude telling me she will not let me board and making threats. I have never experienced such anger or unprofessional conduct in my years of flying.

commentHeader: one hour delay in LA at starting point
reviewContent: I have traveled from LA to Melbourne. They are always slow. It was one hour delay in LA at starting point and one hour delay in Landing (finding gates) We were just waiting on the flight for checkout. I feel they don't plan the trips properly ahead of schedule.

Points to improve cleanliness: I found a piece of bread in a box with butter all green of mold under my seat. I don't know how long was sitting there but it was really disgusting. The restrooms were not cleaned during the trip. I saw a spot of toothpaste in the sink first time I went to the restroom, at the end of the trip I went to the restroom and the spot was still there. Breakfast was terrible, I'm lactose intolerant and there was only a yogurt and a piece of sweet hard bread. No fruit, no bread. During the trip the glasses of water in the bar at the back of the plane turned over because of the turbulence and it was a mess. I wonder why don't they offer bottle of water. Unfortunately the space for carry on luggage in this airplane is smaller, there was a lot of confusion because there was no space everyone to place their carry on luggage. We took longer to depart due to the confusion of people trying to place their carry on luggage. One good point was the wifi, it worked very well.

commentHeader: catering United Airlines Offers is terrible
reviewContent: Boarding and seat was fine. The catering that United Airlines Offers is terrible - most dishes are vegetarian. The meat dishes are the worst. Bistro Burger with cheese and ham, no condiments (ketchup/mustard). UAL Management, the pandemic is not an excuse for everything. Hire a new Chief Chef please, and this was another UAL flight with no Wi-Fi

Airline management was terrible, Boarding was a disaster, as a Star Alliance Gold member arrived at the gate as posted time. The cleaning crew had not even started, waited in line 45+ minutes. On taxi, mechanical issue, aircraft had mechanical problem on taxi, returned to the gate. New 777-200 located, delayed 2 hours, arrived at the gate and again at the boarding time, the cleaning crew had not even boarded the plane. In boarding line again 1hours. Wi-Fi not operable for entire flight

I guess it wasn't all bad as we landed safely, but generally not a good experience on our UA2083 flight at 1.35am on 4th Dec 22. My partner's TV controls didn't work, so we shared earphones on my screen, but the earphone port was faulty so we had to jiggle it and hold it at a certain angle for it to work. The shows were on a cable television basis, so we had to watch some shows halfway through. Despite the seat sticker saying charging ports were available, we learnt that there were none. I tried to check in online to book a vegetarian meal, but read that it was not necessary as all UA flights come with vegetarian meal options. That was a lie. Was told there was only chicken, nothing else. They gave me crisps. Upset and hungry, I changed my order of a water to a glass of wine, and the lady with short curly hair smirked, pointed at my partner and I, and said to the other steward, "we got one of those over here". One of those? People who drink wine? Asians who drink wine? Well, if I had my vegetarian meal, as promised by UA, I wouldn't be frustrated enough to ask for a wine, lady. Not much baggage space too, had to place our carry ons very far down the plane, so it took us forever to disembark. I really hope my next flight is better, but I'm not banking much hope on it.

Boarded early. Pilot said we would have an on time departure. Now we are 55 min delayed due to some problem in the cargo area. Travel often and it seems United is the only airline that doesn't maintain their planes properly, so after multiple delayed trips due to maintenance/repairs I'm leaving a review. Previously had a flight delayed so bad due to malfunctioning overhead panel that we had to deplane and board a different aircraft I don't know how you avoid this other than pick a different airline.

commentHeader: trying to split up my party
reviewContent: I understand with basic economy there's no guarantee we'll be seated together but they are actively trying to split up my party for no reason other than to nickel and dime their customers. We have 3 travelers and they put one traveler in a row by themselves and 2 travelers in a row where only two seats are being used. This coupled with no ability to check in unless we arrive to confirm our bags. Don't sell basic economy if you don't want people to actually buy it. So I can pay $31 or simply ask the solo person you if you put in that spot to switch with me as it's the same spot 3 rows up and they'll get a row by themselves if you don't put anyone in it.

commentHeader: Save your money and book Spirit instead
reviewContent: Save your money and book Spirit instead. These planes are so old I can’t believe their legal to fly, staff is somewhat unintelligent and seem to lack in self care. For example untucked shirts and body odor. I usually try to keep a positive outlook on life, I’m sorry but I have to say it. I hate United Airlines - do not book with them.

To London from Washington DC and back. Totally fine. I didn't find the seat uncomfortable, good selection of entertainment, free wine, friendly flight attendants, flights on time, I even the food was acceptable though certainly not luxurious. This was quite a relief after hearing many horror stories about air travel at the moment. I didn't check luggage.

commentHeader: indifferent staff who needed to be pushed
reviewContent: What a mixed bag! First the good. After a delayed flight from LGA to ORD we had a very short connection to this flight. I was nervous enough about us making the connection, let alone our suitcase. But we were met at the door of the incoming flight, taken to a car and driven across the airport to our connecting gate giving us breathing room. And - using the really excellent bag-tracking app - I was able to see our suitcase made it from one flight to the other in just 20 minutes! Really excellent service. As opposed to what we experienced in the (crowded) business-class cabin: indifferent staff who needed to be pushed (e.g. nobody offered my wife a dessert!), really surprisingly bad quality food, little choice in wine, and narrow seats - yes they were lie-flat which is really necessary, but they were more like a mummification ritual than a bed! Ten stars for efficiency, 4 stars for in-flight amenities and service averages out at 7 stars overall

commentHeader: be wary of flying with United Airlines
reviewContent: My flying experience with United Airlines has been by far my worst travel experience ever!! Not only did my flight to Ghana get diverted to another African country but we were not allowed to depart until the following day, forcing many passengers to sleep in the airport! When I complained and asked for compensation for the night charge I incurred for being a no show at my scheduled hotel in Ghana, United Airlines has yet to contact me regarding my concerns nearly 10 business days later. On my return flight I missed my flight due to customs and I was again forced to pay another $1,700 for an economy seat after being told I could not board my original flight because it was now full and departing in 2 mins. Unless I have no other options I will never fly United Airlines again and I will make my concerns and displeasure known, so other potential passengers can be wary of flying with United Airlines.

commentHeader: United is impossible to communicate with
reviewContent: It started with a 12 hour layover in O’Hare. The plane I flew on seemed like it was designed to prevent comfort. United is impossible to communicate with. After a 12 hour layover, my flight was then delayed. On my way back, I managed to avoid a 14 hour layover by getting on a standby flight. My bag did not come with me. When I arrived in Norfolk, the woman at baggage services was very rude and unhelpful. I chatted with a United agent who said my bag was coming on my original flight. I came by the next morning to pick it up and my bag is not there. It was marked incorrectly for an address I do not live at so I had to wait most of the day for it. I hope United goes into bankruptcy so they can stop messing people around. I’ve never paid so much money for a worse experience.

Very rude flight attendant. Meals were Mexican casserole or oriental noodles. I asked flight attendant if either meal had cilantro in it and the flight attendant gave me a dirty look and rudely said “I don’t know” with a mean face. So I took the Mexican casserole that she had in her hand , and sure enough it had cilantro in it. So I pushed the attendant button and waited for over 30 minutes and she never came back so I could exchange my meal for the noodle one. So on a 10 hour flight I only had bread for my dinner meal. I bet if I were in first class she would not have spoken to me like that or ignored me, we all are not fortunate enough to fly first class, but I would hope they treat economy customers with respect and dignity.

commentHeader: thankful we are to United staff
reviewContent: Can't express how thankful we are to United staff with transporting my husband with his broken ankle in a wheelchair to get us through the airport to our gate, on the plane and through customs. It certainly took off a lot of stress from me in having to deal with transporting him to needed areas. Thank You.

I had a horrible experience flying with United. My Flight was delayed 19 hours total. I had to drive back home to sleep the night as my flight was rescheduled the next morning. I also missed two connecting flights that I had to reschedule due to United. I stayed at the airport for nine hours as they pushed back the departure time every half hour. I truly regret flying with United. I make sure to never make this mistake ever again.

commentHeader: Business Class had nothing to eat
reviewContent: No meals on Business Class! Flew from Chicago to Burlington VT, flight was late an hour but the real surprise was that the Business Class had nothing to eat. I did not eat at the airport expecting that a 2 hour flight business class would offer food on board but no, nothing. First time experience.

commentHeader: bag was delayed in SFO by United
reviewContent: My bag was delayed in SFO by United and I have submitted multiple claims and have not received any reimbursement. It has been 2 months and I have not even received an email reply. I am never flying United again. I am never checking a bag again. My bag arrived on the last day and I had 6 days of no clothes, no toiletries, nothing.

What a terrible experience. I always knew how rude, quick tempered and arrogant United Airlines cabin crew are. These ladies may know their job so well but that doesn’t give them right to be so aggressive to their guests. They don’t care about hospitality and guest satisfaction. Also, very gnarly food.

Work airline that anyone could deal with. They made our move from the east coast to Guam extremely difficult. Because of them we kept getting stuck on Honolulu day after day with no money, no where to stay, no car, our luggage made it to Guam before we did, so of course we didn’t have any clothes either. My husband is active duty military and united has prevented him and his crew from going underway on schedule. Save your time, tears and money and go to a different airline. You’re better off with spirit.

After 25 years of flying I avoid United like the plague. I had a trip and they had a good route, so I thought maybe they got better after specifically not flying them for a decade. No, they still suck. The people that work for them are awesome. The delivery of their product/service is the worst. Old planes, delays and cancellations .. they cost me so much time and $ by simply not delivering. So much money and experience they have, you'd think they could deliver, but No. I'll never fly them again.

route: Miami to San Antonio via Houston
reviewContent: United is hands off the worst airline. I was traveling to visit my fiancé for thanksgiving. And I had just finished my last final in medical school so I was really happy but United ruined it. It all started when I tried checking in my bag. I am a United credit card holder so logically my first bag is supposed to be free. I tried adding the bag through the app but it kept charging me. So I contacted the customer service who requested me to seek help at the airport kiosk or the staff and reassured that it should be an easy fix. I agreed to it. When I sought help at the airport, the staff including the supervisor proceeds to tell me that I bought my flight with my miles so I am not eligible to check in my bag for free even though I am a card member. I tell them that the customer service rep confirmed that none of that should be a problem. They tell me to bring an email stating that. Now where am I supposed to find an email? I call the customer service again. Again, this is happening an hour and a half prior to my flight. The customer service rep tells me it shouldn’t be a problem. Miles are considered rewards not punishment. I try to hand over the phone to the United staff at MIA and they refuse to talk to him. They keep saying they want to see an email. The customer service rep tells me he can’t send any email other than a generic one per the airline policy. So the United staff at MIA leaves me at that without any help. The customer service rep tells me that I should just pay for the bag and request a refund later. As much as I didn’t want to go through the whole process of requesting a refund and all that, I agreed to it it because I didn’t want to let this ruin my day. Then, I head over to TSA, the nice lady checks my boarding pass and points me to the general line. But this man comes in and asks me to get my ID out before I even enter the line. Note that, there is a huge line at TSA (I am no where close to the TSA guy). I tell him that I have it right here in my hand’s reach but he won’t let me enter the line unless he sees it in my hand. I tell him the line is so long and I don’t want to drop it. Still, he won’t let me go in until he sees my ID in my hand. I have flown so many times in my entire life and I never had anyone stop me at the beginning of line and manhandled me like this. Then at TSA screen, their machine breaks and they lose my mac. I end up finding it in another lane. oh also, my flight gets delayed. I am not exaggerating. This is all happening in the same day. Once I get in the flight, the flight goes smoothly. But now I am worried because the arrival time is too close to the departure time of my connecting flight. Even after everything happened, I was hopeful that United will do its due diligence like every other airline, and hold the flight for at least 10min because that should be enough to get the passengers in from the delayed flight. Also, perhaps that the crew members would help these passengers out first to accommodate the delay. I am sorry but that just has been my experience with American and southwest. They just understood and helped. Little things but made a huge difference. But United did not do any of those. They had zero communications and did not make accommodations. Couple other passengers and I ran 30 gate gates over in 10min just do find that they closed the gate even though there is 10min left, means there was no communication about the delayed flight. (Text limit)

Of the six flights I took with United, this was the best. No seriously, hands down the best flight. Although we had a really old 737-800 with super old IFE systems and no wi-fi the crew is what made the flight really memorable - the two who were in my section had a great personality, They were interacting with passengers and were really genuine about both service and safety. I really wish more United crew would learn from these two role models. The catering was a chicken sandwich which to be honest was the best and the cheesiest chicken sandwich I had ever had, I really wish United would offer these on HNL-GUM routes too instead of those cold pastas.

I flew this airline not by choice. I flew from LAX to Honolulu to Guam to Pohnpei and back the same way. The terminal was old and really run down. The terminal post TSA is dull and has absolutely 0 personality pretty much like staff this airline has employed. The aircraft a super old 777-200 took us from LA to Honolulu, the most embarrassing 777-200 I have ever seen in my life, it had no IFE, you had to stream it to your device. The cabin crew were laughable at best, they were all "aloha" and "mahalo" trying to create a "vibe" with flower in their hair etc and it is the most cringe thing I have seen in my life. No matter how hard they try to show they have a personality or try to be friendly it is just evident they are faking it and this is visible in the way they work. They don't come around the cabin with rounds of water, snacks etc, they don't interact with passengers stretching out in the galley etc. Even if you are carrying trash in your hand they will continue talking to each other totally ignoring you until you disturb them and ask. I am not saying the airline is bad, but it is not good either, it is just mediocre, literally buses with wings.

Needed WiFi to review a Google issue. Attendants stated I had to go to their website and enter credit card numbers to pay to get WiFi. Ridiculous and can’t believe I had to pay in the first place and then put credit card numbers on line. What happened to the tickets we paid for? Doesn’t that count? It’s not the cost but the principal. Attendants would not help to download the app. I am 77 yrs old and not computer literate and could have used assistance. They were abrupt and not respectful to a customer who paid for tickets. Last time I use United. Have trip coming up and will definitely use another airline. What an insult this was to a senior.

commentHeader: said I need to rebook as I was late
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Honolulu, to Guam and then Manila. I missed my flight on nov 2 since online check in was not allowed. You go through Kiosks where you enter info but you need to wait for an agent to assist you. I was there. Twice I had to wait for an agent. There were so many people who needed assistance. I was running out of time then my final message was to line up to ‘additional services’. It was a super long line. Only 3 counters open. By the time it was my turn, they said I need to rebook as I was late. So they booked me next day. No charge. LAX to Honolulu  5 hours no food but a small cookie. Honolulu  to Guam- 8 hours they offered some cold pasta that is not edible. Terrible presentation. Guam-Manila, 3 hour flight. They gave dinner. Warm good food, finally!

I've had nothing but issues the last 5 times I've flown with United. This time my flight has been delayed 5 times in 5 hours and had it's gate moved. If I'm paying close to $1000 for tickets I expect things to run smooth, not spend an entire work shift amount of time waiting at an airport.

We flew in September 6th from FLL to Newark to Johannesburg, our flight was 14hours and 35 Minutes EWR TO JHN. The attendant in the first 8 hours was horrible bad manner, rude, unfriendly, she made the flight very unpleasant, we traveled in Business class, a flight of 14 hours and 30 minutes. It is unfortunate that an airline that has these types of people as flight attendants.

Flight 706 (Maui to LAX) is now 3 hours delayed with both a plane and gate change. However, if we had gotten on that plane, there would be no connecting flight to our final destination. So, we have been rerouted to Chicago (Flight 348) in the hopes that we can leave here by 6p, arrive in Chicago around 6a, and board our next plane around 630a. We do have our row to ourselves on this flight. We ate at Sammy's Bar and Grill with our vouchers, and it was tasty.

11/2/2022: Flight 1736 Denver to Maui was a horrible experience. We boarded plane. Plane began to leave the gate but returned. Maintenance issue. Updated every ten minutes. After No update Need a part. Trying to get the part. There's another plane waiting for us at a new gate. We deplane and head over to the the 2nd Gate. Receive airport food vouchers ($40/person). Waited in the new holding area for an hour. 2nd plane also had mechanical issues (reversers??). More vouchers. Got sent to a 3rd Gate for another plane. With $160 in vouchers that expire in 24 hours, we finally took off, arriving in Maui almost 4 hours behind schedule. We lost a day in Maui. Now, we're flying out of Maui to LAX, and this--possibly our new 1st plane is delayed for 2 hours and counting.

commentHeader: it’s really not worth your money
