The flight was not even full so don't see the reason why me upgrading was such an issue. I was willing to pay but not 100$ on top of the upgrade fee so I could at least have my bag with me. Partly my fault for not going with my normal airline and not getting the ticket myself. Live and learn! United Airlines does not seem to be disabled veteran friendly.

commentHeader: never fails to be absolutely awful
reviewContent: United never fails to be absolutely awful. Several years ago, I flew United from Columbus, OH to London. I flew out of Columbus to Chicago. Right as I was about to board the plane to Chicago, we got delayed.... four hours because of a problem with engine. By the time I got to Chicago, I missed my connection to London. United put me in a hotel for the night in a hotel where the AC was broke and it was the end of June. The next morning I had to fly from Chicago to DC to take another connection. That flight went fine. But my flight from DC to London got delayed because of an issue with navigation. Navigation! We’re flying across the Atlantic Ocean and there’s a navigation problem?! By the time I got in to London all transportation had shut down and I had to take a night bus to a stop near my hotel and then walk three miles to my hotel in the middle of the night in London. Good news! United forgot my bags in the United States! So at least if I had been robbed I would have had nothing to give them. The next day our bags were supposed to arrive. We waited and waited until we finally figured out they had been delivered to the wrong hotel. I mean can it get an worse?? I emailed United and did I get any voucher or anything from them for all of this? Nope! Just a quick “sorry”. I swore I would never fly United again. Now flash forward to 2019. My mom did not know if my boycott of United and she booked a flight for a family vacation from Columbus, OH to Vancouver, CA. I did not know she booked United until after she booked it. I get on the plane and I was surprised how nice everyone was. I’m thinking, “ok maybe I was wrong all along”. Leave the gate, and as I’m writing this review I will miss my connection from Chicago to Vancouver bc I have been sitting on this airplane on the tarmac because it is delayed! Literally amazing. This is such a terrible airline! In addition to all the plane issues I have had, this week a United passenger took a video of an engine violently vibrating on the wing of one of the planes makes me Columbus to Vancouver via Chicago. Most inept airline in the world and I will never fly United.

route: South Bend to Winnipeg via Chicago
reviewContent: South Bend to Winnipeg via Chicago. Here’s my complaint: Was booked for a flight out of South Bend at 0600 (UA5330) and Chicago at 0753 (UA4289) as per confirmation. No info for pre-check-in sent. Upon arrival at SB airport, learned there was no record of me on 0600 flight (which they switched me to) and UA4289 out of Chicago didn’t even exist. Customer service agent at United customer service booth was rude and unhelpful, not allowing me to finish a single sentence and then telling me I haven’t given him proper information. I now have over 6 hours to wait in Chicago, departing 2 hours after I was supposed to land in Winnipeg, no longer have a ride home and will need to work on making other arrangements from long distance, and will be missing an important specialist appointment this afternoon. 1. I want to know how I can be given a confirmation for a flight that doesn’t even exist? 2. Customer service experience in South Bend and Chicago were horrible, your staff need retraining on how to listen and speak to customers. Make sure not to count on the information on your confirmation with this airline - it doesn’t mean boo. Don’t make plans around flights with this company as you may not even be in the same country when you’re due. If you do, make sure to contact them to make sure the flights you’re confirmed for actually exist, and that you’re actually booked on them. Feel free to share with others who fly with United so they don’t get screwed over the way I have. Horrible company, horrible experience.

route: Ottawa to Melbourne via Washington and Los Angeles
commentHeader: wasted two days in transit on this trip
reviewContent: I flew my parents from Canada to Australia for the birth of my child. Their flight from Washington to LA was delayed and due to land when their flight to Melbourne, Australia was meant to depart. Staff assured my parents that they were going to delay the Australia flight briefly to get the delayed passengers on. My parents explained their situation and were assured they would be let off first and brought to their flight. None of this happened. They were booked on the flight the following day which got them to Australia at the same time as my scheduled c-section. Needless to say, my OB had to push back the birth of my child due to United Airlines. To make matters worse, UA has now cancelled my parents flight from Washington to Ottawa and rebooked them for almost 24 hours later. They have now wasted two days in transit on this trip when the flights are already 27 hours. Ridiculous.

London to Newark. We had to stop in Boston for 3 hours to pick up an employee of United Airlines. So the flight from London to New York was almost 10 hours. United is unreliable. Good food but bad service from the staff. Definitely not flying again with United.

commentHeader: plenty of legroom and seat space
reviewContent: The flight from Newark to Punta Cana was the best out of the two-way trip. The Economy Plus seating on United was new, clean, and very comfortable with plenty of legroom and seat space. There was room under the seat for a bag. Snacks and drinks were good and complimentary

Red eye from San Francisco to Newark. Was dreading the flight after reading all the terrible reviews. My flight was very good, however. Check in swift and easy, lounge spacious and comfortable, boarding on time and take off early. Yes, 8 abreast in "First" is a squeeze, but my window seat was very comfortable and slept well for almost the whole flight. If traveling with a partner then the relative lack of privacy isn‘t an issue (no privacy screen between seats). Flight attendants were friendly and attentive. Entertainment offering was fine. can‘t comment on the catering as I slept through it all. Would definitely fly again, especially considering the reasonable fare.

Sept. 10, 2019, 9am was our scheduled flight from Nashville to San Francisco. We had been told prior that there were runway repairs scheduled in San Francisco that could lead to delays of 45 minutes to 2 hours. Since we were driving to Nashville from Knoxville because we got a non-stop flight, we figured any delay wouldn't exceed the time lost if we switched to another flight that required making connections. The delay turned out to be 5 hours though. One hour at a time they over and over. There was not a weather issue, yet this is the text I received "Delay update: Your 9:00am flight from Nashville to San Francisco is delayed further because air traffic control reduced the number of planes allowed to land each hour until weather conditions and/or air traffic improves. UA2167 now departs at 1:40pm on September 10." We hoped that our return flight would go better - it was worse! Return flight on 9/16/19 was "Canceled: Your flight UA2060 from San Francisco to Nashville is canceled because your plane needs repairs". They then put us on another flight, going to Chicago and a connection to get to Nashville. We had 10 minutes to get to our connection in a separate building in Chicago, if that flight had closed the doors on schedule we would have missed it. Instead of arriving in Nashville at 5:15am as scheduled, with the changes we arrived nearly 5 hours later than planned, resulting in issues for us for our transport back to Knoxville. We had booked with United against our better judgment, but the direct flight idea won, and as it turned out that isn't even what we got! All 3 flights had issues with something, one where the computer was down, two where the wifi did not work, a bathroom door that was sticking. We met others who were enduring delays and cancellations on other flights. When we arrived in Nashville and were walking through the gate, there were folks at two other gates who were enduring delays, the same flight we had taken exactly a week before was already delayed 4 hours. While waiting in the airport on our return, we met a gentleman who had booked a direct flight from Newark to Oakland, only to end up with 2 connections that he missed and after 15 hours of trying to get to his destination, he was stuck in the San Francisco airport waiting for another connection to get him to Oakland. "Direct flight" = bait and switch. We will never fly United again!

Los Angeles to San Francisco. Worst airline I have ever flown. Literally had to turn the flight around halfway through a night flight because of a fuel leak. Flight went from a 10:40pm flight to a 1am getting people into SFO at 2:22am on a Monday. Absolutely unacceptable.

San Francisco to Nashville. Sitting on a flight right now for San Fran to Nashville. I have tickets on this flight I paid for. Sitting in row 11 and went forward to use the lavatory since there were people waiting to get in the one in the rear of the plane. And no one using the forward one. I was very rudely told I could not do so by one of the male flight attendants. Reason # 1001 why I do everything I can not to fly this airline - ever! Never again!

I never like writing reviews but this time around the customer service for United has been horrible. I understand when flying basic economy that you can not have a carry on but for the customer service representative to allow us to take it with us and then call us out and tell us we have to pay $55 dollars to check it in was very unprofessional. To check in a bag is $30 and he told us he was waiving $20. That’s not the right way for a company so big to have their employees treat customers that way and tell them they are in the wrong.

Honolulu to Houston. United Airlines has the worst customer service and cabin quality in the industry. First of all, we find it completely unacceptable that on a 7h flight from Hawaii to Houston there were no seatback entertainment and power outlets. Moreover, the temperature in the cabin was like in Alaska. After asking the cabin crew several times for adjusting the temperature they did nothing.

route: Phoenix to Cedar Rapids via Denver
reviewContent: Phoenix to Cedar Rapids via Denver. Staff at Denver airport extremely helpful and friendly. My partner and I were concerned at first because we were flying basic economy and did not have a seat number assigned to us on our United app boarding pass. We asked if we indeed had seats and she confirmed that we did though they were on separate ends of the plane. We were just thrilled to have seats and to be getting home on time. After a while, she came up to us with two new boarding passes that seated us side by side. Staff truly went the extra mile.

route: Los Angeles to Amsterdam via Chicago
commentHeader: never fly again with United Airlines
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Amsterdam via Chicago.  We started our outbound flight with a delay of 1 hour on the 30th August and had return flight on the 14th september from LAX to Amsterdam with a transfer in Chicago. The morning of our flight on the 14th we got a text because there was a delay. We went to the airport and UA rescheduled our flight from LAX to Amsterdam with a transfer in San Francisco. But both flights had a delay, the first one from Lax to San Francisco was 40 minutes delayed and the one from San Francisco to Amsterdam 3,5 hours delayed! We are working on a refund but United Airlines are not responding on any of my e-mail! I will never fly again with United Airlines.

I have been a United Mileage Plus member for several years, and was even a Platinum member last year, and Gold this year, but last night I almost tore up my membership card. I booked a couple tickets for my wife and I to Belize and I did my search and pricing for this trip in USD and the total came to $1020.32, but when I went to purchase it with my Canadian credit card it converted it to $1,617.02 CDN. That is a 1.58% exchange rate. That is totally outrageous considering the official exchange rate today is 1.36%. The cost should have been closer to $1,388CDN. I need to know how they can justify a $229 uplift on the exchange rate! I can't. I am extremely unhappy with this. I have cancelled my flights and rebooked with Expedia.com as they actually invoiced me in USD and my final cost in CDN was $1,354. Exactly where it should have been when I booked with United. It's time they revisited their policies and either allow their clients to book in the currency of their choice, or charge an acceptable exchange rate. This is flat out greed on their part. I am glad I was able to work around their insane system and get the price I was quoted.

San Francisco to Honolulu. The brickbat is that we were denied entry to the Business Class Lounge at SFO because we were not members of its Lounge group. Ridiculous. We have always had access to Business class lounges as long as we have spent the money with that airline. The departure time was then delayed because of a flat tire. Another brickbat. The plane had been sitting there for two hours and nobody noticed it before? One we took off, the cabin crew on flight UA300 in Business class were fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble and they were really engaging with the passengers. Brilliant crew but I doubt if United management will ever thank them for their service. I tried on United’s website but it is so difficult to get through with all the squares that have to be filled in. However, well-done to the entire crew of UA300.

Tokyo to Guam. Flights are constantly delayed. From 1 Hour to 2 Hours, then 3 hours. Customer Service is practically non existence. United is even worse than the worst budget airline in the market. Ridiculous in every way you can ever imagine. Bad food. Bad inflight entertainment, rude crew, bad time management. I would only recommend United if you want to experience what it is like to feel and be treated like garbage. Yes, like trash and garbage. That's how they treat you. If you have always been travelling on good airlines and want to try the worst look no more. United Airlines fits the bill. Totally junk airline.

commentHeader: flight cost me twice the original cost
reviewContent: Houston to Pittsburgh with United Airlines. Awful customer service and illogical policies. They bury a lot of rules in the fine print, such as not being able to make any changes and only allowing one bag, which are typical changes that anyone would make. Since I had to make changes, and had two normal size bags, this flight cost me twice the original cost, which wasn’t cheap to begin with. Gate agent was also a very unpleasant woman. I’m a frequent traveler and will never choose United again. Just very, very disappointed in this major carrier.

San Francisco to Shanghai. Well today reached an all time high. I am a premier 1K, have flown over 3 Million miles collectively, and I support United even with bad food, low quality service and today United is above the law, let me explain; the electrical outlet on the USB ports where not working and I needed to get my conventional charger from the overhead, about ten minutes to find it in my bag. The passenger from the aisle across jumps up and complains to me about the overhead bin being open, and then complains to the flight attendant. The flight attendant comes over to me in a aggressive manner and dresses me down then proceeds to tell me "it will get a lot worse for me" with a threat tone. Really flight attendant, get all your facts in order before you threaten a loyal customer on United, and for United, please address the open complaint I filed. You cannot threaten people without understanding all sides of the situation, maybe some classes on passenger rights is in order.

United is a class show, and particularly business class. However, they took it up a notch with the outstanding service of Miroslav. He was every bit as professional and focused as most United flight attendants. Still, he found a way to take great service even farther. He paid close attention to how he could make the flight better. He went out of his way to offer ice cream, drinks, and food. He had a number of guest to attend to, but he interacted with each of them and did so without seeming rushed. The food on the United flight was great and the business class seating was fantastic .. a real joy to fly for nine hours straight.

route: Newark to Melbourne via Los Angeles
commentHeader: have never seen this level of service or care
reviewContent: I am forever grateful to the ground staff, administration and overall coordination of the team at United for turning a potential disaster into a wonderful trip. I have a mild seizure disorder, which resulted in an episode during our stopover from MEL at LAX to EWR. As a result, I was hospitalized for 3 days. During this time, they offered hotel and food vouchers to my wife, assisted with summoning medical attention. After spending 3 days in hospital I naturally assumed that our onward flights would be forfeited, so we re-booked. After re-booking, we received a call from United, inquiring into my health and overall condition to fly. Not only did they refund our onward booking, but upgraded my sister in-law who had flown in from NJ to assist my wife for the return journey to Newark. I have never seen this level of service or care from an airline before, and am most appreciative of their genuine concern and care that we reached our destination. I was overwhelmed that an organization of that size even knew about it, nor cared to do something about it. I have been a frequent business traveler for 10 years, and was previously a patriotic customer of Qantas. After a few nightmarish encounters (ranging from them pretending to go bankrupt in 2011, and gross mishandling of the Ash Cloud in 2010) I decided to try another airline for travel to the US. United were a breath of fresh air, with their luxurious and friendly cabin service exceeding the standards of even Emirates or Etihad. The welcoming and warm atmosphere in the cabin, combined with a delicious restaurant quality, multi-course meal (with generous portion sizes), plus the most comfortable premium cabin flat-bed seats (that I can actually sleep in, being a taller than average guy) lead to a fantastic experience. Congratulations to the entire United Airlines team, keep up the great work. Sincere Thanks, and I look forward to our next flight with you.

I’m usually not one to complain on social media, but to say that I’m beyond annoyed is an understatement. We booked our honeymoon trip as a package deal through Costco travel and our flights were booked with United Airlines. The flight there, we had a short layover in San Francisco and the flight was delayed going there so we were literally running to the connecting flight. We made the flight (barely) but our bags did not, so we spent the first 24 hours of our honeymoon without our clothes or toiletries. Flash forward 10 days to our flight home, same situation delayed flight with a short layover, 20+ people were catching the same connecting flight to Chicago. I went up to the desk and overheard several other people ask about if the flight would be informed of the delay. The employee at the United desk in Maui told me that with so many people on the flight they would be informed and that the flight would be held for the 22 people catching it. Flight landed and they switched our arrival gate to the other side of the airport and sat on the runway for a good 20 minutes before we have to wait for the whole plane to deboard. 22 people are running from one side of the airport to the other only to find out that they were not informed of the delay and could not wait an 5 extra minutes for a good portion of their customers, and left without us. Customer service was a nightmare and did the bare minimum to help us with this situation that was completely their fault and one that could have been totally avoided. Now we are stuck in San Francisco for the night without our bags again. We will never fly United again! I have never had such poor service while traveling. Appalling customer service!
Tokyo to San Francisco. Very comfortable Business Class seat and service was great. Food also. There was some personable service which was great. Arrived 45 minutes early.

Phoenix to Amsterdam via Houston. United Airlines is unreliable! We booked preferred seats (economy just behind the economy+ rows, window seat) more than a half year before. The day before the flight the aircraft changed, so we were seated in economy+. The day we flew back, the aircraft was changed again and we were seated in regular economy in the rear of the plane, even not a window seat anymore. No refund whatsoever. Old plane, limited entertainment system, everything is worn out. Service on board (food/drinks) is far below average. Very unfriendly crew, more busy with themselves and trying to serve the dinner asap so that they had the rest of the flight off (constantly going into/out the staff quarters). Economy seats are much smaller than before: upright seats are more bend over than upright, very limited leg space.

commentHeader: never fly with this company again
reviewContent: Paris to Montreal via Washington. I noticed in Washington airport (Dulles) that my baggage was damaged (wheel completely ripped off), so I contacted the staff who told me that I needed to report the issue once I reached Montreal. So when I arrived in Montreal, I went to the United desk to report the incident. The staff there didn't bother much and told me that the company doesn't cover this damage. I contacted the customer service online, and after 5 weeks they told me that there is nothing they can do for me. So I am left with damaged baggage and the resolution to never fly with this company again.

route: Amarillo to Corpus Christi via Houston
reviewContent: Amarillo to Corpus Christi via Houston. My flight was canceled due to weather in Houston tomorrow. I needed to get back to Amarillo tomorrow. I requested a refund. And they only gave me a quarter of my money back and not half. Obviously United Airlines is not customer friendly. I thought American Airlines was bad but that’s nothing compared to United. I guess Southwest Airlines is the way to fly.

route: Cancun to to St Louis via Houston
commentHeader: I expect to receive a real refund
reviewContent: Cancun to to St Louis via Houston. When we booked our trip we paid extra not to have a long wait for our connecting flight in Houston. We were supposed to depart from Mexico at 6am. We arrived at the airport around 3 am to find out our flight was delayed till 10am. There was zero communication from United to let us know our flight was delayed by hours. We waited in Mexico for 7 hours and we missed our connection in Houston and had to wait another 6 hours. This has been a horrible traveling experience and a complete waste of time. The reason our flight was moved is because there was no flight crew. That is completely at fault of United and their lack of communication to their customers. I filed my initial complaint with United on August 31st 2019 and when I heard back from them they were only willing to give out vouchers at that point I asked for someone in charge and the employee stopped responding to my emails. I called United to express my terrible experience and they told me to file a refund request, which I did and they denied that and sent me back to the complaints saying "they handle those cases better". I called again after the email refund rejection and during that call they told me that they do not have an actual phone number or anyone for me to speak to and I would have to leave a voice mail. Today on September 18th 2019 I received an email saying they will give me a travel certificate. Not only do they have terrible communication when you travel with them, but when you try to fill out a complaint for a refund for them completely wasting your time they just keep giving you the run around from department to department and no on is willing to listen to what you want and how a travel voucher is pointless, when I spent real money on this flight and I expect to receive a real refund not some voucher that will go unused. This is a warning for those who are thinking about flying United just save yourself the time an go with ANY other airline. There customer service is terrible and at this point I think they just give customers the run around till the customer gives up and just accepts their worthless voucher.

route: Oklahoma City to Minot via Denver / Houston
reviewContent: Oklahoma City to Minot via Denver / Houston. On 2 connection flights I've had a total of 11 delays totaling in almost 5 hours of delays this is supposed to be a 4.5 hour flight. How are they still in business

Brussels to Baltimore via Chicago. They lost 2 bags of my luggage. Didn’t get them till the next day and when I got them 1 suitcase was broken and other one all my stuff was covered up in powder I had packed properly. If they didn’t mishandle my bags non of that would have happened. On another note I talked to their representative who promised to refund me a shopping gift card of $150 which would come in mail. After 2 weeks waiting nothing came I called them and a representative told me they are giving us travel credit of $150 worth. Up to now there is nothing that we’ve got from them. I can’t travel with them again in my life.

I will just relate our experience with UA today. You can judge yourself. On 15 Sep 2019 my wife and I were booked on the UA 2208 flight at 12:45 from Chicago to New Orleans. We arrived at the Chicago O'Hare airport at 10:30 only to learn at the check in kiosk that our flight had been delayed 2 hours. Ok, no big issue, it happens. We had spent about an hour at the airport when we learned our flight was delayed again, 2 more hours. This was a bit annoying. We are visitors from overseas and this is our first trip to United States. We only have 2 days in New Orleans and we expected to be in New Orleans and be checked in at our hotel early so we could have a nice and relaxed dinner on our first night in town. No such luck. Well, we waited one more hour and then we learned about the next delay. Now our flight would depart at 6PM. This was a serious setback for us. There would be no time for dinner upon arrival and actually we started to get worried if we would make it to New Orleans at all this day. We went up to the United Customer Service desk to inquire what the problem was and explore our options. We staff told us that the flight had been delayed and that there had been a change of aircraft but the flight was now in the air, somewhere. We asked why the repeated and long delay? It was because of the weather they said. This was the first I heard about a "weather problem" and only just before they had said that there had been a change of airplane? We asked if there was something they could do. It was four and a half hours until our flight would leave, maybe, and we wanted to know if there was any other option. Any other airline or route? The answer was that they checked just before and all other routes and airlines were full. We asked if they could get us into the lounge since it would be a little more comfortable for such a long wait. The answer was "Sure, for 59 dollars I can". Then we asked if there was anything at all UA could do to help us and alleviate the long wait? The answer was that because it was a weather problem it was out of the hands of UA so you will just have to wait. I asked what kind of weather. The lady in front of me said they didn't know and the lady next to her said "It was a snow storm". She said that with a smirk. (Today is Sep 15.) Now I was a little bit upset and I asked if they really wanted me to believe that weather was the cause of this delay. The answer was "Are you calling me a liar?". A bit of an escalation, quite unnecessary I thought. I said "No, but you're telling me it is a weather issue but you don't know what it is?". "Well we just don't know. It's just the air traffic control, they don't tell us anything". At this point I asked if she could just get us a pass to the lounge for $59 each. The answer was "You have to the lounge to get that". Then we went to the lounge, only to be met with a sign that said they were full and couldn't accept any more open passes. Having a background in Customer Service, I find that UA today neatly ticked every missed opportunity and made every error in the book.

Oklahoma City to Denver. Awful. Cancelled flight because no crew? They had already changed several legs of our flights on a whim for the last two weeks. The final result was a 17 hour day to HI that has been extended thanks to their incompetence. Worst airline.

Newark to Los Angeles. I live in Northern New Jersey and so have been flying United Airlines out of Newark for work and leasure for about 10 years. This was because I did not want to brave the New York City traffic to get to LaGuardia or Kennedy Airports. After my last 4 flights with United, I've decided it's time to explore other options even if it means braving NYC traffic! Schedules are not kept, planes are dirty, bathrooms are not stocked with necessities, seats are in disrepair, wifi works roughly 50% of the time. On a recent trip to Las Vegas, where I had purchased a first class seat, the cabin was filthy, the seat in front of me was broken, so that it was reclining back so far back that I could not use my tray table, and the cabin crew were genuinely unfriendly. We didn't even get the customary predeparture drink. On another flight to Los Angeles, the seat was again broken, plane was filthy, and staff were rude. There has got to be a better option, even if it means going all the way to Kennedy!

Stay away from this airline if you don't want to have headache when you are going for a vacation or travelling for any reason! My biggest mistake ever when I booked a flight from Boston to Newark on July 10th. the flight got cancelled for technical reason. I had a connection flight one hour after and nobody was available to help me - not only me but many others were nervous and angry about what happen and only 2 persons were helping hundreds of people in customer service section. It took me 22 hours from Boston to Vancouver. The worse part was the receptionist and the workers that were working to provide the customer service were very rude, and aggressive. I just wanted to get back home as I felt helpless and disrespected during all time.

Las Vegas to Los Angeles. I paid for a plane ticket and the flight was supposed to be at 6AM to LAX. This flight was not for me, it was a gift to my significant other. This flight was so important because he was suppose to meet is family he hasn’t seen in 5 years. We had a ride set up for him so he wouldn’t have to pay for transportation from the airport. We really did not have a lot of money to even pay for the flight. We are both struggling college students. I got off of work Friday night, could only sleep for 4 hours, and then drove 2 hours to Vegas, for Him to make it to his flight on time. Right when I drop him off I get call from him that his flight was 5 hours delayed. That means he’s sitting at the airport at 4:30AM for almost 7 hours. This completely destroyed our whole itinerary. His ride can’t pick him up in California, now we have to pay $60 or more for transportation. He is now hours and hours late to his event and meeting his family. I paid for a flight so early in the morning so he could be there and it was delayed for not just an hour but 5 hours, and he’s having to stay there for almost 7 hours running on 4 hours of sleep. Now we are having to pay even more money for transportation to an event he’s extremely late to.

San Francisco to Phoenix. Consistently delayed and being lied to in the process. Turns out the airplane scheduled for the trip has been in maintenance all along and not "delayed in the air" as passengers were told. United appears to be low on planes. They keep switching gates and forget the flight number let alone the fact that they are talking to people who are already waiting for nearly 4 hours.

United Airlines has gone down tremendously. If you don't have premier or plus, you are treated like garbage. You cant have a carryon and seats have no charges. 2 years ago, it was completely different - actually had movies you could watch at your seat and you were treated respectfully. Going forward, American Airlines for me, not wasting my money anymore for an airline that doesn't value customers.

commentHeader: we had to sit in coach
reviewContent: Denver to Roanoke. Here we sit on the tarmac and we are late. So we will miss our flight and pray that there is another flight to Roanoke. Not only did United overbook our flight but then they downsized the plane. We paid for a first class ticket and we had to sit in coach. The computers weren’t working and we were the first ones at the gate and were told to sit down and they would call our name. Well, that never happened. By the time we realized it the first class cabin was full and so here we are, in the claustrophobic coach cabin. I better get a refund or I will be very angry.

Do yourself a favor and avoid to fly via United airlines, very bad customer service, and very incompetent supervisors. Recently I searched on Orbitz tickets to Cancun and the economic one cost $360 I selected first class and cost double $755 each ticket so I wanted to surprised my wife and I bought two first class. Arriving at the airport they told I only upgrade one segment and put me in coach, talking with the supervisor they reviewed my purchase and gave me my first class all the way. On my return same problem So I asked to talked to their agent and he was rough telling me not deserve a first class ticket as I bought coach and only paid for upgrade one segment. I never upgraded my segment I bought first class all the way I was explaining nicely and his answer was not.  Will be the last time and please do yourself a favor and don’t use this airlines When they noticed customer doesn’t want to fly with them absolutely sure they will change their manners

La Guardia to Washington. This airline is always delayed, I never had a flight with united that left on time either its domestic or international. People that work for this airlines has attitude, making me feel like I owe them for flying united Airlines.

This was the worst flight experience I remember having - and I'm 71. I had to fly from Providence to Portland via Washington and made the reservation less than a week before the flight. The seats are not only tiny but they have left no room for your feet and legs. The chair in front was practically in my lap. The chairs don't lean back! and are so uncomfortable. When I made the reservation I asked for a window seat not over the wing and got a window seat over the wing without a window. The second leg of the flight, on the Airbus 320 (I think) was the one with the awful seat. The service was terrible. Southwest has the best in air service in my opinion. Alaska's is also good but United's was terrible - almost non-existent. On a 5 hour flight stewardesses came by only once to ask if you'd like food or drink and only one other time at the very very end offering water. Honestly, I thought I might die! I had to get up and ask since no one responded to my pressing the service help button! It all feels very cheap, minimal and impersonal. Given the choice I will never fly United again.

Newark to Los Angeles. Flight was a total pleasure. Check-in at Newark was friendly and there was zero wait at security. Gate area very spacious and I liked how the gate agents introduced themselves. Orderly boarding into what is a great biz class product, Polaris. Seat with full recline into a bed and big screen with an excellent selection of movies. Pre-flight G&T and then the drinks kept coming throughout. Flight attendant presence was spotty and there only seemed to be 2 for a biz class cabin of 44 people. Food was great and plentiful. On time arrival into another pleasant and airy terminal (7) at LAX.

commentHeader: keeps taking my miles from me
reviewContent: Charlotte to Newark. This company keeps taking my miles from me, is second time they take my miles and this time they will not give back because I haven't flown with them in 18 months. I quit flying with them because it is full of rude people every time I fly. Has lost my luggage before coming home from Dominican republic and delivered to my house days later and never gave me airline credit of $100 on my next flight as promised. Left me sitting on a plane coming home to Charlotte from thru Atlanta. sat in the plane for over an hour at charlotte waiting to get off because they had issues with the ramp that connected to the plane, no airline credit there even though they took my name and promised to contact me. Delayed flight to Dominican connecting through NY, left me stranded in the airport all night till next day morning flight, no offer of a hotel to sleep till next flight, let me sleep in the uncomfortable chairs, even though it was their fault I missed my connecting flight. Then on top of that the people at the counters and the on the airline are just rude. They wonder why I choose to fly with other airlines. I fly 10 times a year nationally and internationally. but talking to a rude customer service lady tonight, told me I lost my miles again, and nothing they will do to help me even though I am getting on one of their planes this weekend for Newark NJ this weekend, will be the last time I use this company. They are too big for their own good and deserve the steadily fall from the top line world that they are currently experiencing.

Grand Rapids to Chicago. The customer service in Grand Rapids is truly awful. Ticketing agents are miserable and it shows in surly and rude customer interactions. I seldom fly United but have over 1MM miles flown. This is the worst customer service in the 7 continents I’ve visited — a shame it’s in my own home town! United should investigate this. Deplorable service at check in.

commentHeader: have yet to see my refund
reviewContent: St. Louis to Chicago. First and last time I fly with this company. I usually chose Delta or southwest and regret not sticking with them. On Aug 25th, I had a flight to Chicago. From there I was to fly to Greece. The flight was delayed by 10 minutes, I thought “ok nothing to worry about, I have 3 hours by the time I arrive in Chicago to my next flight to Greece”. Then there was another delay and then another. Starting to panic I asked the customer service representative what was going on, worried I wouldn’t make it. They assured me to relax and that I would make it. They however didn’t have any answers at that time why it kept being delayed. Then I got another delay and then yet another saying delayed until the next day. That’s when tears started pouring down my face, I was going to miss the flight to Greece. The trip I had planned and saved for for so long. I went up to the same customer service representative trying to breathe. They said there was a flight with another airline right then and I had to run to the gate to make their flight. So I full force ran upstairs to the other airline. Sweating and wiping tears from my eyes I arrived, just for them to tell me it was too late and that they didn’t know why United would have me do that. If after the first delay anyone in the company knew what was going on with the airport and would have communicated that with me, I could have made my flight. Instead your company cost me over $3000 and more delays for the trip I worked so hard to get. Thank you and never again. I still have yet to see my refund also.

Rochester to Knoxville via Newark. It is the 4th time I travel with United because I chose a deal through Priceline (the deal was Priceline chooses the airline and time for a much cheaper price. About $150 less). And for the 4th time, my flight is delayed. This flight was delayed 4 hours 15 minutes. I won't even be able to get the rental car I requested because it will be closed at the time of arrival. And they don't even refund or help with anything else. I will pay extra from now on, just so that I don't have to travel through United Airlines.

commentHeader: sunk to the lowest level of quality
reviewContent: Anchorage to Albany. After the first leg of our flight being delayed several hours, we did not make our connecting flight and then were rudely told by the desk agent that they didn't have time to rebook us as they were too busy. Called the 800 number and was told the only option was to wait 13 hours in Newark to get a flight to Albany and that there was only one seat so either my husband or I would have to sit in the airport overnight. To add to this, our luggage was lost as well. Finally ended up renting a car and driving nearly 5 hours home. Was then told on Aug 26 that the last leg would be refunded by a supervisor in the call center. It's 9/6 and still no refund. Called today and was told by the first inept phone agent that the refund never took place and "I don't know why". Spoke to a supervisor who said due to a "system error" it never happened and that she now processed it, but we have to wait another 7-10 business days. United Airlines has really sunk down to the lowest level of quality. I've flown with them for nearly 20 years, but the last several trips have been a nightmare. The customer service agents are clueless and read from a screen repeatedly "apologizing for the inconvenience", which is not the get out of jail free card for bad service that United seems to think it is. We are done with United and will not spend another dime with them. They should take a lesson from even budget airlines such as Frontier as to how to properly provide service I suggest hiring call center employees who have a slight clue and don't simply regurgitate statements from a pre-written script. We all know you save money by sending your call centers out to other countries, but your customer service level is -5 on a scale of 1-10.

Hawaii to San Francisco. Nickled and dimed for everything. Forced to watch loud advertisements while seated in the smallest seats I've ever experienced on an aircraft. Really a one of a kind horrendous experience. My wife and I will never fly United again. You shouldn't either.

I was recently booking a first-class fair on United.com on the mobile app on my phone. I had gone through the booking been quoted a price selected seats and when I went to push the button that read agree and purchase the pop-up on my screen was there was a problem completing your reservation. I subsequently contacted United immediately and they advised that all of the fares at that price had been sold out. I am traveling with two friends we were traveling together all the same flight all in first class. The United representative proceeded to tell me that the fair had increased $518. Now mind you, I wasn't surfing the web I had locked onto the seats I was quoted the price I had put in my credit card I'd selected seats and was merely pushing agree and purchase. United has turned into an awful airline. The food in first class is a laugh. You get a basket of chips on a five hour flight. At least on American you still get a decent meal. You call the call center that can do nothing which you on hold say that I speak with a supervisor and it is always a useless call for which you will wait at times a significant amount before somebody even picks up. I assume they had given up all pretense of having any loyalty. For first-class flyers there are no reward for regular flyers because they sell first-class to anyone including bidders up until the flight itself. There are no first-class seats saved to reward people who fly all the time. I have complained to United documentation the purchase prices the screenshots for my phone and I'm awaiting a response. If I could never fly United again I would. Except when they control the route, and they often do, they should be avoided at all times the customer service is essentially nonexistent. Anyone that has a good experience with United is merely lucky. Merely read the reviews you see here. I'm hoping for a successful result in a refund but I hardly think that would result in me being happy as I must get on their beat up old plane fly to Las Vegas in first-class where they were bring by a basket of chips and suggested that his first-class service. I'm not sure what their future is but if you apply standard business tactics you treat customers like this the future can't be that bright.

Tokyo to Honolulu. At Tokyo Narita, we avoided UA lounge that did not offer any decent drink or food. We preferred NH one. The first one was empty, the second pack. We believe that UA should close their lounge and request a Star Alliance lounge in NRT. The ANA lounge offered full meal, including sushi and on demand warm meals. Boarding was smooth in a retrofitted Boeing 777 with Polaris seats (1x2x1) that offered a perfect comfort for this 6 hours night flight. Crew was extremely attentive, and as good as to NH on this line. We understand that when UA faces real competition, they are able to provide an excellent level of service. Good news.

route: Kona to Toronto via San Francisco / Chicago
reviewContent: Kona to Toronto via San Francisco / Chicago. The flight was typical but there three disappointing surprises along the way. The onboard food very very expensive - We had the hot dog for over $13 CDN. So the three of us paid about $40.00 CDNfor 3 hot dogs - This would cost $4.5 at Costco - a $35 savings.  There is no inflight entertainment. At the beginning of the first flight the said we need their APP just before they pulled away from the gate so I wasn't able to download. before the next flight, I downloaded it but it would not work properly on my LG4. Before we flew home, there was an update to the app so I was hopeful that I would be able to watch movies on my trip home (about 14 hrs) but, nope, it still didn't work.  There are extra fee for checked in bags - They really nickle and dime you. The one thing that did impress us is that after taking three flights, our luggage actually arrived with us - both to our destination and home.

commentHeader: No one should have multiple bags
reviewContent: Newark to Chicago. For as many times as an airlines clearly states to only bring on a carry on and a personal item, no one ever checks. It is very frustrating when there are enough overhead space for a small carry on, yet everyone puts everything in the bins especially when you are not sitting there in the two rows that are designated to each one of them. They are labeled for a reason. No one should have multiple bags or the whole bin to themselves. This would not only save time if they were properly check but would stop individuals who are taking advantage of this system to not hold up the line and take more then one spot. I do applaud American Airlines for taking the time to check unlike United Airlines and I have flown with them for the last 15 years.

Miami to Newark. Really impressed with the staff and overall experience. Granted, I am traveling first class, but I had everything I needed. The flight was easy to reschedule from its original day, which was necessary due to Hurricane Dorian. I was stuck on a cruise for a few extra days and it was really easy to change my flight. Onboard, the seats were comfortable and staff was helpful. Even though we boarded about 5 minutes late due to weather conditions in NJ, we were scheduled to arrive about 35 minutes early. Impressive, thanks United!

Honolulu to San Francisco. The boarding crew were disrespectful and didn't care about your seating. Very awful manner and flight would get delayed! There was a mother who wanted to seat next to her 2 year old baby, the flight attendants instead of seating them they yelled at the mother!

Orange County to Newark. Rescue me. I'm 5'5'' and 130 lbs. These planes are so small. The seats have no padding in them. Luckily I knew my seat mate as my head hovered over his knees to retrieve items from under my seat. And I do yoga! Two people can't pass in the aisles to get to the tiny bathrooms without becoming familiar. And only two privies! The direct TV is worthless if there is any turbulence. The movie choices are for 12-year-old boys. Think superhero. Gone are the hand held devices for controlling the "entertainment". Instead, money conscience engineers located the controls in the armrest. Awkward to control and easy for your neighbor to change your channel by mistake. Which happend regularly. Squeeze as many bodies in here as possible and forget about comfort. United is only interested in their bottom line. Clearly! The Greyhound bus of the skies. I do love the SNA to Newark non-stop though.

commentHeader: I try to avoid United when I can
reviewContent: Ontario to San Francisco. The service at the check in was terrible as there was a long argument on checking in a 2nd suitcase. Based on the United application, used for check in, I was allowed to check in 2 suitcases (1 from the ticket, 1 as a Star Alliance Gold). Getting to the airport the employee at the desk did not accept this as the system does not allow him to do that. Showing the details on the application didn't change anything, as he simply shrugged saying that I still have to pay for the 2nd suitcase. After insisting for a while, he called someone on the phone. No change. I asked him then, what is a customer supposed to do when one cannot trust the information on the application. His response was to call the customer service before the flight. Until today, I am not sure if he was serious or was making fun of me. The plane was small, not very comfortable and inflight service includes coffee. I try to avoid United when I can.

commentHeader: could not sit comfortably in my seat at all
reviewContent: Kansas City to San Francisco with United Airlines. As a mother, I am very appreciative of United's policy on being family friendly, however, not at the expense of other paying customers. Part of the problem I encountered on this flight maybe could have been avoided. A very adorable toddler sat directly behind me and was not a happy camper, and expressed it for the whole duration of the flight. Although, this was highly stressful for all parties involved, sometimes this can happen. However, this was excessive. In my opinion the mother was ill prepared to distract, entertain, or comfort her toddler. In this case she could have done a much better job, but sometimes children are inconsolable no matter what parents do. Given that there is such tight seating, the little guy literally kicked the back of my seat the whole 4 hour flight. It was very stressful. Having former back surgery this was very uncomfortable. I leaned forward in my seat for the majority of the flight putting strain on my back as well. I could not sit comfortably in my seat at all. In addition, I tried listening to a movie through earbuds, but having to press the earbuds into my ears just to hear. Even then, it didn't drown out the screaming. Being very tolerant and sympathetic to the little guy, I endured because it isn't his fault. I think we adults can do a better job in regards making children more comfortable during flight. I think that policy can change to help all parties involved. If United is truly family friendly and they care about their other paying customers, they can make the premier seating available to families first at no extra charge. The little ones would have more room to move around, and parents have more room to handle a wiggling uncomfortable toddler. Another option could be, for children under two years of age, the child gets a seat at no extra cost. Both of those options would truly be more friendly to all customers, but it would cut into profits. This is a real problem especially when it goes beyond a little fussiness which everyone expects. We all need more room, especially those little ones.

commentHeader: voucher isn't all it's cracked up to be
reviewContent: Charlotte to Acapulco. That particular flight was wonderful. However, we were given a flight voucher due to seating inconvenience, for $150 which is only good on a United airlines only. Even if booking through United Airlines website and the airline is operating under United Airlines you cannot use, so if you're flying out of the country it is useless.  Other than that I love United airlines we flown with them for several years on multiple trips. But I would like to make everyone aware that this voucher isn't all it's cracked up to be. Especially when most of your flying is international anyway. And they have also stopped doing a One-Stop flight from most places in the United States until the seasonal - which is generally November through Easter. So if your intentions are to fly to Mexico during any other time you will have to make two stops which is also very inconvenient.

Kahului to Denver with United Airlines. We could check our luggage the night before our flight. No lounge at OGG. Not even a voucher for some food. Anyway on-board service was fine. We really enjoyed the night flight even with weird old configuration of 1st class seats. Food and entertainment were ok.

Denver to Washington with United Airlines. As our flight was leaving very early, we slept close to airport. We went at night to previously check our luggages. That was denied to us, on an extremely polite way. "DEN do dot accept overnight luggage". We will never know the truth. Anyway, rest of process was fine. Flight too as well as breakfast. Seats are old as forecasted.

Newark to Frankfurt. I think the cherry on the top the ice cream that was my flight with United was when the baggage worker at the Newark United check-in threatened to call the police when my wife used a bad word in her complaint about how incredibly rude and universally unhelpful the united staff, in general, was being. To be clear, my wife wasn't cussing out anyone. She wasn't directing an insult at anyone. She wasn't being loud. She wasn't being obscene. She complained about really bad customer service, and used a bad word as a verbal intensifier. So we were threatened with arrest.

commentHeader: have been nothing but a long long wait
reviewContent: This airline continually is unable to schedule takeoffs, landings and taxiing to the gate without a wait of minimum 30 minutes to 4 hours. Every flight that I have flown this year - 3 or 4 on United have been nothing but a long long wait. However, other airlines, namely Southwest and Alaska (6 flights), don’t have a timing problem. I am asking you all to boycott United, until they learn to put their customers first. United could not care if we sit for hours on a runway either waiting to take off or waiting to get to a gate. Let’s give our money to the airlines that respect us and treat us well.

route: Paris to Santo Domingo via Newark
reviewContent: Paris to Santo Domingo via Newark. For me it was the worst experience of my life a real poison that managed to spoil my vacation. I only want to go home so I am exhausted with these problems. For a first time with them I'm shocked and I never had this problem with any other company. Delays of 5 hours (4 hours to wait in the plane to get us out of the plane at the 5th hour) but it's not all the excitement is that my suitcase is lost or late for now I do not know not. Everyone with their suitcases except me ... for the delay every hour I received an SMS informing me of the change and the continuity of the delay was A nightmare. As far as my suitcase is concerned, everything in medicine etc is very important because here no French pharmacy and prescription in the bag.

Worst airline I've ever flown. United used to be an average, run of the mill US Airline. Starting a few years ago they began charging for every little thing, their customer service tanked and their ability to check people in and have flights arrive on time is abysmal. After my last terrible experience with a 5 hour delay with no reason given, I swore to never fly United again. Unfortunately for this trip, the airline I booked with changed schedules that no longer accommodated my trip. I booked through Priceline and the ticket was through United. United is one of the only major airlines that skimps on meals/snacks in the air. If you want more than water, pull out your credit card. They are also one of the only major airlines that have a 9"x14" carry on size. Sure, almost all airlines charge you for checked baggage but they also allow you to bring a carry on that you can fit things in. Unless you can pack in a briefcase you'll be paying United's $60 fee for ONE bag. United has NO in flight entertainment. Unless of course you want to pay extra for that. Their leg room is ridiculous, except they did move around some seats on a few of their planes recently so that there are few rows with extra leg room. And you can pay extra for that. Did you want your flight to dependably arrive on time? Too bad you can't pay extra for that. Unless the stars align, you're SOL if you're flying United. Lesson learned, I will never book through Priceline again on the off chance that I get assigned a flight through United.

Austin to Houston. There was a male flight attendant who was working the first class section on this flight. As I boarded the plane, he asked me if I could wait while he delivered water to the first class customers. Little did he know that I was actually not feeling very well at all. I replied with, “that’s great.” He then came back and said, “oh, do you have a problem with that?” I could not believe how extremely rude he was. Such poor customer service. After the flight, he told me to “have a wonderful day” using what appeared to be a very sarcastic tone. I most definitely did not appreciate the way this flight attendant spoke to me. I understand that he could have been having a bad day. They happen to all of us. However, kindness is key. I am sure he has potential to be a great employee; I just hope he is given the opportunity to see how he treated me and made me feel.

Newark to Norfolk. This is maybe my 4th time flying with United. Today they switched the gate because the plane had “maintenance” issues (not a huge deal). This was followed by putting us on another aircraft, boarding then sitting for 1 1/2 hours because one of the crew had an problem with his iPad. While sitting on the plane for an hour and a half there was a non stop high pitched screeching coming from that plane that was concerning and irritating to everyone on board this very tiny plane. I have never had a good experience with a United and only fly with them when it is absolutely necessary for my travel plans. It is miserable every time. I would not recommend to anyone. My flight has no option for entertainment such as a tv screen.

Newark to Dublin. Another good experience with united. On time, clean comfortable factory fresh 787. Even the economy meals were decent. Baggage arrived timely. Only complaint is lack of seating at gates in newark, all available space now taken by revenue generating restaurants. I have been a long time CO and then US flyer, and have had years of overwhelmingly good experiences. I just don't get the hate.

commentHeader: employees at United are very rude!
reviewContent: My husband and I had the exact same carry on bags. No problem with them fitting in the overhead bin. The person taking carry on bags insisted on taking my bag when I assured him it would fit. My husband was allowed to keep his bag identical to mine and placed it in the overhead bin with no problem. The employees at United are very rude! I can’t stand this airline I only use it because it is one of the few airlines out of Palm Springs!

route: Newark to Melbourne via Los Angeles
reviewContent: Newark to Melbourne via Los Angeles. This is the worst experience I have had with an airline. Too begin with, Newark airport is the worst airport in America. After arriving 2 hours early for my flight I only just made my flight, there was only ONE single united employee behind the desk, it took me an hour to check in my bags. Then there is the fact that it took another hour to wait in line just to get through customs because of the horrendous system at Newark international. But this is not even my main complaint, once on the plane we waited a total of 5 hours on the tarmac before the plane took off to LA. I have never in my life heard of people waiting this long to take off. Even when we pulled back into the gate after 3 hours stuck on the plane, we were told not to leave because if we did and the plane was ready to go, they would leave without us. This experience only gets worse. Because we were not taking off the flight attendants refused to serve any food meals. Because I had planned to buy food before my flight and couldn’t because the of the agonising wait time at the airport, I had not eaten a proper meal in 12 hours. I was forced to remain in basically inhumane conditions unable to eat, starving for the longest time in my life. Once the plane finally left the airport, it was inevitable that the only hot meal they had available was a hotdog and due to the terrible service, they ran out of them very quickly (most people didn’t get a meal). Once I finally arrived in Los Angeles, United supplied those that missed their connecting flights new tickets. My new flight is now 18 hours from the time I arrived in LA. I have never waited this long for a new flight in my life. I have travelled South America and even in impoverished countries with low budget flights, I was NEVER EVER forced to wait so long for another flight. On top of this, we were given only $30 dollars for meal vouchers. That equates to 1 meal and a snack in Los Angeles, so how does united expect you to survive a full day on only 1 meal? The truth is that they don’t! They expect you to pay for your own food and drinks while you wait for a flight that they messed up. When I asked for at least more food vouchers I was told that it was “against policy” to give more and the lead manager apologised for the “embarrassing ” customer service from United. Even your own employees understand how embarrassing this excuse for an airline is. To compensate me for the fact I am now missing a family event, they offered a measly 100-dollar voucher on the next flight I decide to take with the company. The further problem with this pathetic severance for this awful experience is that it expires within a year! So you have a deadline to fly again with this tragic airline. I’m writing all this because you should know that I will not be accepting the horrible service and “apology” I have received. Nobody deserves to be forced through the conditions you put your customers in. I wouldn’t put my worst enemy through this experience. The Newark to Melbourne via Los Angeles. Worst airline in not just North America, but the worst in the entirety of the American continents.

Charlotte to Denver. How is it that the airline requires it's customers to show up at least 2 hours before their flight and there is nobody available at the ticket counter to check a bag until 4am? Every other airline has representatives available. With the amount of money you people charge for a ticket there should always be a representative available for your customers.

commentHeader: They make you go in circles
reviewContent: Denver to Columbia. Just do not fly United. Third time in the past month their plane was delayed by over 2 hours due to mechanical issues. They ended up cancelling the flight. I called customer service. They said they couldn't do anything, and to talk to the gate agent. Once we deboarded the plane, I talked to the gate agent, and once again they said they couldn't do anything and to talk to customer care. They make you go in circles. Now I am waiting at customer "care" in the airport with 14 people in front of me. United is an awful airline, only cares about money, and doesn't care about it's customers.

route: Phoenix to Kona via San Francisco
reviewContent: Phoenix to Kona via San Francisco. Hawai’i - a - no - go is all I can say about our move thanks to United Airlines. My family was originally booked to leave PHX (Phoenix AZ) to KOA (Kailua Kona HI) on Tuesday August 13th; departing at 530 AM with a connection in SFO (San Francisco) departing at 831 am. Only to receive a phone call at 300 am stating that there was an overbooked situation and that we were going to be placed on a flight departing at 1229 PM. That was not the case at all! We never received an updated confirmation and in calling to verify were told that we would be placed on standby. The next flight that we would be confirmed on was not until Monday August 19th but we would be upgraded. Unfortunately come Monday my partner was sick, he has Multiple Sclerosis, and was needed to see the doctor that day to be able to fly. (not United’s fault) United said they could rebook us on a flight leaving Thursday August 22nd with rebooking fees. Thursday came and the same scene happened again; we were alerted that our 1229 PM flight to SFO had been oversold and that we were going to have to go on a 1000 AM flight to LAX (Las Angeles), then to SFO (San Francisco) , then to OGG (Maui) spend then night in the airport and take the next day’s morning flight to KOA (Kailua Kona HI) on Hawaiian Air! Now it is Friday August 23rd and we are still in Phoenix awaiting our new flight on Hawaiian come Sunday. So in short if this were a vacation, it would have been ruined. Luckily we are able to get a refund and rebooked on another airline  and are moving and have our home until the end of August here in Phoenix! Thanks for nothing but headaches and no follow through United.

route: Minneapolis to Idaho falls via Denver
commentHeader: ended up losing a whole day
reviewContent: Minneapolis to Idaho falls via Denver. I booked my flight weeks before my departure date of 8/9/19. I woke up to a text message saying my flight was cancelled to Denver CO. No reason why. Now I was only going until the 8/14 and had limited time with my family and many plans were made for my visit in Idaho falls which was to arrive at 10:25 am. I could not get another and waited for hours on the phone. I eventually found a flight through Houston to Denver to Idaho Falls. I arrived to my destination at midnight. While in Denver I noticed nothing wrong at the airport. I ended up losing a whole day. I am very busy and I wouldn’t have taken this trip if it was a day shorter.  Everything else was fine on my trip.

Dubai to Male. Horrible check-in customer service. Our family of 6 missed our flight to The Maldives even though we were all at the terminal at least 2 hours before our departure. We informed a staff that the line was taking too long & that we were afraid of missing our flight. He literally walked away from us instead of checking us in & getting us a cart to security. We got stranded at the airport for an entire day. They even tried to charge us a no show fee of $600.00 a person. Will never fly Emirates ever again.

commentHeader: could have driven faster to my destination
reviewContent: New Jersey to Rochester. It’s honestly disgusting you can call yourself an airline company. I will never ever be taking United fights ever again. After the countless mistakes given today I could have driven faster to my destination and now instead I’m having a panic attack inside an aircraft that was updated over 30 times telling me we would depart by 1.50. Now it’s 4 o’clock. The aircraft is 4 hours late and I have no reason to be going to be going where I am because my meeting was already missed. I would like someone from United to contact me.

Rapid City to Chicago. In a word horrible. We started off the day in a small airport, Rapid City regional airport. We then learned that our flight had been delayed for an hour because of thunderstorms, no problem right? Wrong. After an hour of extra waiting we finally boarded our flight to learn we had been delayed another hour. One word: O'Hare. We sat on the tarmac to learn our flight had been delayed 30 minutes. We then deplaned. We had been hanging around the gate for 5 minutes when they decided that they wanted board the whole plane again after 5 minutes at the gate. That was a waste of time, what didn't help was the front to back boarding also known as the reaper method due to the time it takes for the flight board compared from front to back which is sadly the industry standard. So our plane finally takes off and we get a small snack and an orange juice after almost 8 hrs without food. So we finally land and that's when you think it would be over. No, because of our delay there is another plane at the gate so we taxi on the runway for a full 50 minutes. Welcome to O'Hare I guess. We finally get off the plane to realize that our connecting flight had already taken off. So we had to rebook for a flight 3 hours later which wouldn't you know was also delayed. So here I am in the gate writing about how terrible United is.

Newark to West Palm Beach. 6 hours delay so far with no reason! There is only one customer service with 2 persons and 100 customers who want to know if we finally are flying or not? I would never ever fly with United Airlines. Not only this particular flight but also most of the flights with this airline have delay! All you see on the monitors is United Airlines delayed.

commentHeader: I will never fly United after this experience
reviewContent: Austin to Newark. Basically canceled our 7.05pm Sunday evening flight for 7.05pm Monday evening flight which is ridiculous because they gave us notice at 4.14pm, about under 3 hours before boarding. Went to airport - basically the attendant stated it was snowing/raining and hence the reason for the cancellation. Completely unprofessional. Didn't even give us any discount/voucher for baggage check in. I hope $UAL stock price sinks. What a disaster of an organization where you can cancel at will. Smart move on their part to cancel due to weather related conditions. At least, book us onto an earlier flight. They also wouldn't give us a refund to use another airline which is ridiculous. I will never fly United after this experience. They do have a phenomenal tag line "United We Cancel". My cohort and I had work the next day and ended up having to call a day off.

route: Prague to New Jersey via Los Angeles
commentHeader: they couldn't care less about our dilemma
reviewContent: I am writing on behalf of my co-traveler/wife and myself regarding terrible and unbelievable experiences we had with United from Prague to LA via New Jersey EWR, on July 23, 2019. The first and second legs of our flights were with Austrian Airlines (OS 0082 and OS 0721) on July 11 and 15 which went through without a hitch and in most courteous and professional manner by Austrian. The third leg was with Czech Airlines (OK 079) on July 19 which again was also completed without a hitch. However, the fourth and fifth leg of the flight (UA 0187 and UA 2394) on July 23 were total disasters. In Prague airport, we were told that due to weather conditions the flight would be delayed approx 7 hours. Having given no other options for other United flights or otherwise, we had to wait out the delay and board the plane about 7 hours later. In New Jersey, having missed our connecting flight to LAX, again without any other options given by United, we had to stay overnight in Ramada Plaza Hotel (a virtual dump of a Hotel) for about 4 hours before returning to the airport for a 6am standby! Although vouchers were issued for the hotel (United's choice) and some food, we had to take a cab at our expense to the hotel, as no vouchers were provided, and it was very late at night. During all the interactions with United employees, customer service, supervisors, and hotel crew we were treated unprofessionally, rudely, nonchalantly, carelessly, and aggressively. At all times, the attitude of the United employees was insulting and such that they couldn't care less about our dilemma, and that they had heard these sort of complaints a million times before, that it is what it is, and basically take it or leave it. Beside suffering the aggravation and stress, the above delays, totaling a whole day, caused tremendous backlash for my wife and I, as we are both professionals with appointments and commitments to meet (which we missed), having counted on the on-time arrival in LAX. We could not even spend our food vouchers due to lack of time, and United flight crew denying our vouchers for food on the plane (EWR to LAX), and the Mexican Grill denial of vouchers in the food court of LAX arrivals. The way we see it, United has received its full payment for the tickets, but we have not received the full service promised nor have been compensated for our losses suffered. To say the least, improper actions or non-actions of United have bitterly ended a much-anticipated joyful vacation. If you have a choice, avoid United, and spare yourself lots of heartache.

route: Las Vegas to Santa Rosa via San Francisco
reviewContent: Las Vegas to Santa Rosa via San Francisco. Flight was cancelled. So frustrated I cannot even put into words the amount of levels of issues between Orbitz and United Airlines. These companies that outsource to India where people don't care or share genuine sympathy.

commentHeader: Why are we having to delay this flight
reviewContent: Denver to Honolulu. We boarded our flight on time and once we all got seated we were told there was going to be a 50 minute to an hour delay. This delay was due to us having to wait for people to first arrive to the airport via another plane and they had to get all the way over here. Why are we having to delay this flight that’s already pretty full for a flight that was delayed at another airport?

Departure delayed. This was the last flight to SFO and I had a connecting international flight that I had to board. The transit time was tight but doable if everything went on-time. My flight out of YVR was delayed by an hour which meant that I would have to literally run to the international gate at SFO. I explained this to the gate agent and he was very empathetic and made some calls. Although he could not promise, he did say that I would most likely be able to make my connection. He was also able to give me some alternatives in case I missed my connection. This was very much appreciated!

La Guardia to Denver. We arrived 1.5 hours before our flight. We spent 30 minutes in line to check in with United and the next 40 minutes getting through TSA. It was 4:45am on a Sunday morning. We barely made the gate before they closed it. The lady at the gate told us we should have arrived earlier as if it was our problem they were understaffed at checkin. They also seated our 2 kids(below 10 years old) separately to us and could not change it at checkin since they told us to try the gate and at the gate they said it was too late. I am not sure how an airline can operate so inefficiently. Lesson learned. It is worth an extra amount of money to avoid United at all costs and to fly JFK and avoid LGA no matter how good a deal it may be.

Nashville to Chicago via Duluth. Always used United because it is usually the cheapest flight. Husband flew home in early July via United (Delayed), flew home end of July (Delayed more than 4 hours) via United, and we are flying again, United, have just been told we have a 24 mins delay, so far. I sense a trend United = Delayed flights every time. We are told it is due to air traffic. Seems like they need some sort of organization. Will be testing other airlines for our future trips.

route: Seattle to Tampa via San Francisco
commentHeader: This is subpar service at best
reviewContent: Seattle to Tampa via San Francisco with United Airlines. Ridiculous. Poor communication from the on-boarding crew which began with a delay - thanks to holding a previous flight to see if any last minute passengers would surface. Then following their late departure our plane, which was not ready, took another half hour (and still waiting) to arrive to the gate. We are now an hour into this delay, the bathrooms and terminal are essentially closing and this over sold flight is waiting with virtually no clue as to what is happening or if we will be leaving. This is subpar service at best.

route: Salt Lake City to Denver via Columbus
reviewContent: Salt Lake City to Denver via Columbus. I was delayed out of Salt Lake City for an unknown reason for 2+ hours. Moved me between flights as I was told my new flight would arrive sooner, unfortunately for myself, the other flight arrived sooner and would have made my connection. We sat a hot plane in 90-degree weather for an hour and a half without the option to get off as it was "United Policy". Once I arrived and missed my connection I was rebooked to a flight to be on standby 2 hours later. Was initially 3rd in line when I booked. When boarding started I was bumped to 6th in line and finally when it came time to board I was 9th in line. 6 people on standby boarded the plane and I was not one of them. This airline could careless about the people they are flying and more about the dollar in their pocket. Worst service ever and will never fly again.

Newark to Boston. My flight got delayed 4 times. Flight UA2323 so we had to pay for an Uber from Boston Ma to over an hour to our house since the person picking us up can’t come that late since he works. I have traveled all day with my pregnant wife and 2 year old and have been treated like garbage by the employees. We greatly appreciate ending our vacation in such a horrible manner.

Seattle to Hayden via Denver. My most recent trip yet again displayed a problem that I have seen in all of my last six flights with this airline. Admittedly, the delay on this trip was short, only fifteen minutes. Small delays happen sometimes. That’s to be expected. The issue that delays are a chronic problem with this particular airline where I’ve had delays as long as four hours. Despite whatever else this airline may have done well, I score it a 1 because it consistently falls down on the one thing that travel specialist has to above all else: move passengers from place to place in a timely manner.

route: Barcelona to Houston via Frankfurt / San Francisco
reviewContent: What a nightmare. We arrived at the Airport expecting to fly to Montreal then Houston but they cancelled our flight, no reason given. Then in order to accommodate our schedule they rerouted us through Frankfurt and San Francisco. No upgrade offered even though United Airlines added 7 hours to our travel time. The seats are uncomfortable to boot.

This is the worst experience I’ve had flying. I normally fly Delta or American Airlines but I thought giving united a try would be good. I was so wrong. From the check in to boarding there has been nothing but issues. First flight was delayed then cancelled so had to get on another flight the next day, technical issues which caused boarding to be 30 mins late and not only that, the only thing the representative could help me with was the customer service number. I would recommend paying the extra $$$ to fly delta. United ruined it.
