route: London to Oklahoma City via Houston
reviewContent: We flew business class from London Heathrow to Houston then on to OKC. This has been a miserable experience. To say the staff are rude is an understatement. From checking in at Heathrow to the flight to Houston the staff were rude and careless. My husband was told he didn’t order food for both meals on the flight and he did. Then when they went to get the forgotten food they brought out the wrong thing because that’s all that was left. He was never brought a drink with his food at any point. I ask if there was any snacks because the dinner terrible and was told rudely no snacks except the leftover cookies from dinner. Then she told me to go sit because they were in the middle of a shift change. About 2 hrs later I see literally an entire row eating salty crackers and chips that their attendant brought them! One gentleman attendant was kind in the first class cabin but I can’t remember his name. The woman who worked my husbands side really needs to retire. So we land in Houston and then the plane we are suppose to take home breaks. We are delayed without any estimate or explanation except that the plane is so broken they are retiring it. They are hoping to find us a new plane. They finally have us board the plane they told us was being retired. Then we sit on the plane in Houston heat for 45 mins. No apologies so told to keep waiting in 5 min increments. The attendant was somewhat nice on the Houston flight. The issues were more with the plane and the Check in staff. I’m done spending silly amounts of money with this airline. I’m flying Delta from now on. They at least get better service and on time reviews.

Newark to Anchorage. Due to mechanical problems we had to change planes. Then due to weather we were delayed and had to change gates. Then we finally get on the plane and are the next plane to takeoff and the captain says we have to change crews. Now there are no return gates to go to and we are stuck in the plane. The pilots knew they were out of time but ran out the clock anyway, presumably so they can get their paycheck. There is no consideration for the customer. The service sucks. The captain provided little to no info. I’ve spent $3k for this flight and the experience so far is abysmal.

I booked a 5.5 hour flight from San Diego to Memphis with a 40 min layover in Denver. The day of I get an alert telling me my flight is delayed. As time progresses more alerts with different take off times. I’m confused. I see an agent because at this point my boarding pass isn’t even the same any more. I was then told they changed my flight. I had to get a seat adjustment after nearly an anxiety attack being assigned an emergency exit seat. WiFi didn’t work! Then it’s a 5 hour layover in Houston so instead of landing in Memphis at my original time of 1916 I arrived at 2312!! Unacceptable. I normally fly Delta but tried saving money using United - never again. Pay the extra couple dollars. Oh and they managed to damage my Vince Camuto luggage to put icing on the cake

San Diego to San Francisco. United’s price fixing scheme with its partners stifle competition and at consumers expense. Trying to fly from sfo to yyz cost was $694 on the 11 pm red eye one way. To take that same route but starting in SAN and connecting in SFO on the same exact flight for the 694, cost only $200. Once again proving that these so called alliances are excuses to price fix with competitors nearly as bad as the cable companies and phone companies in the USA. As for the flight well the SAN flight was easy and pleasant considering more than half the plane was empty. SFO to Toronto? 1/3 empty, meaning the scam for the direct flight certainly out to gouge at my pocket.

commentHeader: overall was great for the price
reviewContent: United shines when flying out or into a hub to/from international. Flew Business out of SFO to FRA through United with my parents. Flew Economy plus back from FRA to SFO. Business was wonderful. Polaris lounge was very professional and kind, could have been a little more attentive though. Friendly flight attendants and great food.  We got to chat with a friendly pilot for a while and got complimentary drinks. Was able to upgrade to business with my Chase miles credit card. Economy Plus was a little worse of course, but overall was great for the price. My seat was clean, no fingerprints on my entertainment system or junk on the remote, which is usual for me when I fly domestic with American or United.

Calgary to San Francisco. I do not like United! United app sucks. Didnt seem to work when checking in. Once checked in. Tickets didn't have seat row or number. Had to get new tickets printed out for my wife and me at the gate. Couldn't sit together and she is 4 months pregnant. Workers were no help and don't care about my problems. Never going with united again!

Denver to Oklahoma City. Pathetic excuse for an airline. Decided to fly with United both to our destination and back home. Both flights were cancelled, once due to a repair needed to be made on the plane which was never able to be completed and then again on the way home because their whole flight crew called in sick? It seems extremely unlikely that an entire flight crew would call in sick all at once, and they should have had a back-up plan in place ready for this ridiculous event. This airline has single-handedly influenced me to never fly anywhere again where I could just drive instead. United Airlines must be run by extremely incompetent people to allow for this to happen. 3/10 stars is giving this airline too much credit, I would rather walk than get on another United flight. Dreadful experience both ways, I beg you all to not waste your time with United.

commentHeader: the most horrid food I have ever tasted
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Melbourne. On our return flight to Australia of 16hrs we were served up with the most horrid food I have ever tasted. The main meal was small and tasted terrible. The snack some hours later consisted of a bread roll with an unknown filling. The roll was like it was a week old and I think it was a piece of cheese and was rock hard and very dry. The attendants did not ask in between if we wanted tea or coffee but only supplied water. Not the friendliest personalities. Woke me up while sleeping for a glass of water. The toilets were dirty and toilet paper was all over the floor and not cleaned during the flight. Will not fly with United again.

commentHeader: never fly with United ever again!
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Houston. I will never fly with United ever again! Yesterday, we were delayed boarding the plane, then had to get off and wait 2 hours to board back on. Then, we sat on the plane for about 30 min after they said we were going to begin moving onto the runway. We then moved onto the runway and then had to wait for something else the crew had to check, which about 15 more minutes. My TV in front of me also was inoperable, so my friend and I used their TV. Well, we tried, but the aux for the headphones was not working properly and we could not use the TV. Then once we got off the plane, apparently when we so happened to book our hotel in Houston from L.A., it never actually got booked. So we had to book it at Houston. Then we got two free meal vouchers. Which, I thank you for that, but, it was late at night and I didn't know that all of the restaurants closed at 10pm, so once I was ready, I went up to order and they were closed. Even the self serve and self pay stand was closed!  Then we went to pick up our bags at the baggage claim. We were not told which carousel to go to, so we were just wandering around the building looking for our bags, until someone finally brought them over from outside the building. Absolutely no communication with associates or to passengers. We also had to stay the night in Houston. Thankfully they gave us a free night at a hotel. We then went out to wait for the shuttle to go to the hotel, and we sat there for a good 20 minutes or so until we decided to take an Uber because they were taking way too long. In the morning, while going through security, I had already stepped through the scanner and had gotten my items that were in the tray and was just waiting for my bookbag. It was still in the scanner and then got pulled off to the side and it just sat there for a good 15 minutes when someone finally brought it over just to look through it and give it back. I had no trouble going through security with the same airline, the flight before this with the exact same objects that were in the bag. And check-out from the hotel was at 12pm and our flight wasn't until 6:30pm, so we had to wait in the airport all day when we could have stayed at the hotel for a few more hours and relaxed. Later, it was almost time to start boarding, and we are told there is a 2 hour delay because the crew/captain was not there yet. Thankfully it got moved up to 6:50 and we finally left around 7pm and arrived in Dayton around 9:30pm with no trouble. Everyone was nice, just, no one knows what they are doing and do not have any communication. Which is most likely why there are so many problems, not just with this flight but with many others. I’m even having trouble trying to send this review on their website.  We flew with Delta on our way to L.A. with absolutely no problems. Bottom line is, this airline sucks, and you will never be seeing me again.

commentHeader: United did good on this one
reviewContent: San Francisco to Singapore. Very Comfortable. I usually fly United on domestic routes. As I was now flying United on an international route for the first time, I was not sure what to expect. First, my inbound flight was late and i had to run from a domestic gate to the international terminal in SFO. The airline knew this and i was very surprised (and relieved) that they waited for us. After settling in, the flight took off and it was a very pleasant 18 hours. The aircraft was relatively new but the main positive were the flight attendants. They were all polite and basically did a good job looking after everyone. The flight served two meals and a light snack on this long flight. All three were tasty and reasonable proportions. The in-flight entertainment was also pretty good - i had no problem in choosing good movies to watch and catch up. All in all, a very nice and comfortable flight. In this age where we all report unpleasant service very fast, I am delighted to report that United did good on this one!

Chicago to Tampa. Terrible that you can buy 2 tickets and NOT sit next to your traveling partner. What is wrong with United Airlines? Just trying to get all the money you can from us. Such a disgrace. Will never fly United again.

Houston to Aruba. By far rudest flight attendant I have encountered. Yelling at customers because they put their bags in the over head compartment the wrong way, then when customer was not understanding what she meant, the attendant became louder and ruder. When she was confronted said it is not her job to help the ppl on the plane. I will never fly United again.

commentHeader: very attentive and polite to all passengers
reviewContent: London Heathrow to Houston. I have just flown with United Airlines for the first time and I found the flight to be as good as or better than any other airline I’ve flown on including Singapore Airlines and Cathay. The flight was on time, and the London based crew were very attentive and polite to all passengers. I’d definitely recommend them for Transatlantic flights.

Omaha to Denver. I was impressed with McKayla at the front desk she went above and beyond to help me and such a kind agent. Thank you for the experience she provided over here in Omaha airport at the ticket counter.

commentHeader: What a nightmare this flight was
reviewContent: Houston to Pittsburgh. 7 to 8 hour delay. We were suppose to leave at 9:30 am and left at 3:30 pm. First it was delayed in plane getting there, then the pilot was missing and then on top of it we were boarded in the plane and when the pilot showed up and did the last minute inspection and saw the tires were to be changed.. We were told to get off the plane again and as they had to change the tires so had to reboard again. The sage did not end there as when we arrived at Pittsburgh we stood at the gate for 10 to 15 minutes before the operation crew showed up. What a nightmare this flight was. United needs to work on their operations and customer service for sure.

Houston to Nashville. Four plus hour delay, no food coupons, no looking into other airlines for another flight. Nothing. I have flown with United before, and have always had delays and terrible service. United Airlines service is minimal at best, with zero interest in it's customers whatsoever. This is my last flight with United.

Detroit to Houston. All the customer service for United is horrendous. On my flight to Detroit, the plane started boarding at 7:00 and stopped boarding at 7:10. I got to the gate at 7:12. The podium attendant refused to let me through the gate and I had to sit at the airport until the next flight, three hours later. Coming back to Houston from Detroit. My ticket didn’t have a seat number on it. So I went up to the podium attendant to assign me, as my ticket stated. I have a hearing deficiency, which I was unable to hear her calling me originally. When I got up to the podium she refused to make eye contact with me and told me me that I have to move three feet back, making it to where I couldn’t hear her at all.

route: Seattle to Oklahoma City via San Francisco
reviewContent: Seattle to Oklahoma City via San Francisco. The seat assignment is messed up. They put whoever had a connection with little time to get to the gate at the back of the plane, the first plane was 20 min late and the next flight was on time. They consider a wallet / purse as a carry on. We did have a good laugh . We didn’t choose to fly with United Airlines, I had no other choice. The seats are like an animal cafe the further we go back. They are absolutely not real. We were trying to get in plane and the flight attendant made us wait at the door so she can serve orange juice to first class (first class was a joke). Never like to fly with UA

commentHeader: airline that is absolutely below par
reviewContent: Charlotte to Ottawa via Washington. My morning flight was canceled, and we were rebooked for an afternoon flight on 8/7. The two flights in the afternoon was delayed many times, then canceled. No word! I checked my App which showed we were booked for morning flights to our destination. However, I got a message from Expedia saying that United cancelled our two flights tomorrow as well. No rerouting, no calls, they don't seem to care if you get to your destination. We are back home preparing for starting the process again tomorrow until we got the message from Expedia telling us the flights are again canceled. This is an important trip and I have a very important presentation at a conference in Ottawa. We are wondering if we need to purchase another ticket through a different airline at higher prices given that we must leave tomorrow when should have left today! It is an airline that is absolutely below par.

route: Cleveland to Denver via Jackson Hole
reviewContent: Cleveland to Denver via Jackson Hole. Huge issue, United Airlines cancelled my flight, claimed it was weather (it was not, they were behind schedule, other flights continually left the airport at that time) and refused to refund me. I drove to my final destination.

Newark to Seattle. I fly United every alternate week and its a bad airline. Their quality is complete ripoff. I travel because United has better connection and other airports are way too far. Given an option, will switch to American Airlines. The seat size, seat space is like they are transporting furniture.

commentHeader: treated in such a poor manner
reviewContent: Tel Aviv to Newark. I Put out some extra dollars for “Premium plus” cabin which was touted as business class comparable. Cost just over $3000 round trip for the ticket and not with it. Firstly - I was denied access to the lavatory right in front of me, mind you I did not have to pass through or by Polaris cabin. The fact that the toilet was not available to premium plus cabin customers would have been ok if that was the policy except that everyone else in my cabin was using it and even economy class customers. On asking why I was denied the flight attendant rudely replied to use the lavatory at the back in economy where my seat was although I indicated it was in premium plus. Secondly, the meal I was served was the same as economy class although it was advertised to be the same as Polaris. The economy class packaged meal was cold as a dog’s nose, the bread was stale and crumbling apart - and when I told the flight attendant, mind you I mentioned that I knew it was not her fault and would be happy with a snack or some chips to which she said no, she went on to Insult me and said that it was my fault that the meal was cold to my amazement? I immediately thought to myself - I just be in the twilight zone! She then signals to other flight attendants and points at me in an aggressive manner. At no time was I disrespectful or raised my voice. Now this made me very embarrassed and concerned for my safety so After declining to participate in any further refreshments out of fear and sitting quietly in my seat for 10 + hours into the flight, the flight attendant comes up to me and asks why I did t eat or drink anything for the approx. 12 hour flight and if I wanted anything just when the pilot instructs to fasten seatbelts for us to land. Really? I cannot comprehend why I was treated in such a poor manner but will be sure to spread the word as far and as wide in as many forums as possible in as many languages as I could This is the Worse Customer experience I’ve ever encountered and exacerbated as I was fearful for my wellbeing and worried of being victimized by the flight attendant.

Absolutely the worst airline ever! Every time I have ever flown with them the flight is delayed and no one tells you anything! They don’t even tell you the flight is delayed if you don’t check your email. They continue to act as if everything is normal, make you wait with no answers, put you on the plane only to have you sit there for over an hour before you take off and there is little to no information coming to you! I don’t understand how these people are still in business! Flights are supposed to make traveling long distances faster and easier, if that’s true what is this?!

route: Redmond to Newark via San Francisco
commentHeader: refused to be let on my plane
reviewContent: Redmond to Newark via San Francisco. I am completely giving up on the ridiculous airline. I have yet to have one positive experience. Everything from cancelled flights, to extremely delayed flights, to sitting on the tarmac, bad service, poor planes and now I was refused to be let on my plane, when I still had 45 mins before departure on a domestic flight. The flights may be a little cheaper than some, but it’s not worth it. Especially when half the time you don’t make it to your destination at the time given. If negative 10 for a rating was available I would give them that !

Houston to Philadelphia. I do not recommend this company to anyone at least if you have a no choice. Flight was delayed 4 hours without any apology! Customer service horrible! My had my little dog with me and company treats people and animals like trash!

Los Angeles to Mammoth. I hate this airline. I will never fly with United Airlines again. Expect to be delayed 6 hours. Unbelievable. I’m very disappointed I missed a wedding rehearsal due to the delay.

route: Reno to Raleigh Durham via Denver
commentHeader: couldn't even take a carry-on bag
reviewContent: Reno to Raleigh Durham via Denver. The customer service at United is absolutely terrible. There is no help, hours on hold to talk to representatives with a disconnect at the end. No customer service at the airport either. The sold me a ticket where I couldn't even take a carry-on bag.

San Francisco to Chicago. United is the worst airline of all time. I have more on-time experiences with Spirit and Frontier than I do with this airline. If you’re flying this airline make sure you fly direct. You’ll miss your connection 50% of the time

Denver to Albuquerque. Horrible experience all around. The person at the desk switched us from gate to gate, while makeing a big deal about being at work for 5 hours. She argued with me about my seat being unsigned and it latter caused a small problem when I was trying to board. The airlines itself is just scamming people for more money when it comes to checking bags. You're only allowed one carry on bag... and forced to check the other for $30 or more. This is the worst time I've ever had with any air line and a waste of money. And the flight was delayed.

We took a flight with United Airlines on August 1 2019 from Detroit to Newark. The staff was extremely rude. They would not even make eye contact when speaking to you. I was very disappointed, no wonder they have 3/10 reviews. I wonder if anyone reads this. It looks like there is a trend.

Philadelphia to Chicago. This flight crew didn’t care if anyone made their connecting flight. We were supposed to take off at 1:30 then it’s was 1:50 then it turned into we took off at 3:59 and landed at 5 we sat on a plane for 5 plus to get no one. No flight attendants could help all they said was talk to someone there and didn’t really care. We missed our connecting flight by hours.

Chicago to Tel Aviv. This airline refunded our tickets with no notification! We arrived to our destination but as our vacation came to an end and we arrived to the airport they said our ticket home was refunded. When In fact we bought these tickets round trip and they are in fact non refundable, so it canceled our trip home and we received no money in return. Therefore my sister and I are stranded in a foreign country. We  tried to work with the airline company but they’re no help at all and will say anything to push you off the phone. I would not recommend this airline. I’m extremely dissatisfied with the way they are handling these situations.

Albany to Columbus via Newark. Horrendous. First, they failed to provide adequate tickets needed to board, which caused a slight delay. I checked my luggage in. They then ran after me and forced me to take the lock off of my bag. Now, my property is subject to theft. That does not sound right. Coming off the flight in Newark, we are pushed onto a bus. I verbally told the surrounding crew that my next flight departs in 20 minutes. They were dismissive and ordered me to simply get on the bus. I had no other choice but to comply. I'm with my 6 year old child. This whole ordeal caused a rush, resulting in an inability to feed my child. I asked several people if there were meals provided. They assured me there were. When we boarded, I inquired again, only to be laughed at.

route: New Orleans to Los Angeles via Houston
reviewContent: New Orleans to Los Angeles via Houston. So in New Orleans flight was delayed because of weather about 30 mins. Here in Houston over an hour delayed because an attendant hasn't arrived. What an irresponsibility. For 1 person whom is not the Captain we are waiting. Who knows if they delay it more. Bad bad.

commentHeader: staff is very angry and rude
reviewContent: San Francisco to Tel Aviv. The airplane is ok and the premium economy have better seats. But the staff is very angry and rude. No smile. Once they even pushed me because she wanted to pass but there was children in front of me and I almost fall on him. . Will never fly with them again.

Tampa to Seattle via Denver. Worst airline there is. Never on time, were supposed to leave 30 minutes ago and still sitting on plane waiting to leave for some strange reason. Unacceptable and wouldn't recommend them to anyone.

Honolulu to San Francisco was the worst flight of my life. I am so mad right now because i couldn't move my legs the slightest between the small and arched chairs. I mean arched as in all the economy seats were straight up (90 degrees) and with the “curve” on the seat it felt like it was leaning me forward forcing me to use my back. I couldn't sleep at all. Speaking of customer care, the least an airline can do to better the experience is offer bottles of water. We have to use our own devices to watch movies when other airlines are up to date with screens especially on a big carrier.

Buffalo to Newark. I've flown United Airlines several times now, and it is consistently a miserable experience. The flights are never on time and there is never any notice given of that. I'm on hour 6 of waiting for my flight home, after my flight here was cancelled and I was bumped to a flight 24 hours later. When I'm only taking a 2 day trip, losing a day isn't an option. And I still haven't been notified that my flight 48 hours ago was cancelled. Its amazing that such a terrible business can still exist and not change any of its practices, nor care about the impact that it is having on its customers.

San Francisco to Honolulu. This airline is overall a terrible experience. Had a 3+ hour delay with no reasoning from United whatsoever. Wasted my time and vacation. This airline is a joke of a company and everything that functions with this airline is WAY below average. Not to mention, trash entertainment and in flight experiences. Do NOT waste a penny on this sorry of an airline.  Dear united, fix everything. You guys are sorry.

Boston to Chicago. I must say I am very disappointed by United Airlines all the way around. The first thing is we where over an hour late leaving Logan with no announcement as to why the plane was there in the terminal and arrived on time then when we almost got to Chicago they said if we had gotten here earlier we wouldn’t have got stuck in this weather so now we are landing in Kentucky which resulted in us missing our flight to Dallas. Then the United staff at Ohare was very rude and wouldn’t accommodate us with a hotel for my pregnant wife and two kids saying it was due to weather which wasn’t fully the case. Then they have us 200 dollars in food vouchers and then we couldn’t use them on the plane the next day when we left the in flight staff treated us like we were welfare recipients when we asked. The overall customer service was poor and I’ll never use United again if they had compensated us I might have changed my mind but they didn’t and had a nasty attitude with me and my family about doing so.

Our flights were cancelled today as we try to fly from PWM back to PDX. The weather was bad as well as mechanical issues. United helped us tremendously. It was first and foremost through Angelika, the agent in the Portland Maine airport who was helping dozens of us re-route our flights She was excellent. I can’t say enough good about her service. She was professional, she was tremendously competent. She was trouble-shooting and putting out fires left and right. She even was patient and helpful to the other agents that had questions when a problem would come up. She found other flights for us when Newark was completely out of the question. She gave us vouchers so we could find lodging and get some food. Then she even facilitated getting a taxi to drive us to Boston since we were not going to be able to reach our destination through Newark. Angelika was incredibly helpful and competent, plus friendly at the same time, despite the tremendous amount of stress she had to deal with because of the flight cancellations. Other people noticed her competency as well. I recommend her highly. She was the agent that worked on our counter all afternoon and into the evening on Monday, July 22. Personally I think she needs to be recognized for her outstanding competency. Thank you so much for taking care of us in such an unfortunate situation.

commentHeader: they do not know where the crew is
reviewContent: Denver to Albuquerque. Absolutely awful. Our flight was delayed overnight so we had to spend the night at the airport. The flight was supposed to take off at 7:00 this morning, but they have no idea where the crew is. Another flight next to us has the same issue. Flight is late because they do not know where the crew is. Seriously, United? You can't keep track of your employees?

commentHeader: they would not let me board
reviewContent: I was told by a United Airlines employee that the plane would wait for everyone that was in the security line at that time, I got to my gate and saw the plane just sitting there but they would not let me board, because of this I am out hundreds of dollars and I might miss my Grandmothers funeral. This is the worst airline I have ever had the dissatisfaction of using - the security line was about an hour wait. They wouldn’t let me board I had to buy another ticket from Southwest and their security line in the same airport was about a 5 minute wait

route: San Diego to Oklahoma City via Denver
reviewContent: By far the worst travel experience I have ever had. I have flown with United before and everything went fine but that's because all my flights were on time and I didn't have to deal with customer service. Yesterday 7/16/19 I was flying from SAN to OKC with a layover in DEN. Due to my flight leaving SAN late and then our plane having to "do S shapes in the sky to let other planes land ahead of us" I missed my connecting flight. I get it, things happen but the way United handled it was absolutely ridiculous. They canceled the second leg of my flight and refunded me $178 (I paid $450 for my flight including bags) without my consent. Then I was told since they did that the history of my ticket was out of their system so the ONLY way for me to be able to fly out of Denver was to buy another ticket. That would have been fine if there were tickets that would get me to OKC for $178 the same amount they refunded me for but of course there wasn't, they wanted me to pay $620 for a ticket not including bags which I had two that needed checked. After standing in line for an hour and then arguing with them for 2 hours telling them that the logic literally makes no sense at all, they booked me a flight to leave today for $318. Still had to pay for it which I will be fighting it once I get to OKC. After being at customer service for 3 hours everything was closed, they did not offer a food voucher or even simply a bottle of water. I had to sleep on the floor of the DEN airport. On top of that only one out of the three employees that "helped" me was actually helpful (the fact that it took two hours for her to do anything aside). Other employees were useless and completely rude- threw his hands up and walked away in the middle of my sentence because I was questioning how their logic makes any sense at all. Needless to say I will never fly this airline again. If I could give them no stars I would.

I have never been so disappointed in an airline. Not only was our flight delayed by 7 hours, we never received any updates about anything and no one from the airline knew what was going on. We almost missed the flight that we got moved to because no one bothered to inform us about it. When we asked 5 different people about whether or not out luggage will be on the plane, we were told yes only to find out upon arrival that it was still back in our connecting city. They then promised to have it delivered within 24 hours, and once again, that was incorrect. 36 hours later, I received a soaking wet suitcase and no apology. It has been almost 2 months since the incident and we are still waiting for someone to reimburse us for the flight as well as the items that we had to buy to manage 36 hours without our stuff. Customer service has been helpless and no one cares. I will never fly United and their $200 travel certificates are a joke since we spent $700 on tickets. Their employees need to be trained in better customer service because their attitudes are unacceptable.

commentHeader: flight attendants were very welcoming and professional
reviewContent: This is the first time I have flown the new Polaris Business Class on an international route SFO/PVG, Boeing 787 Dreamliner. I have flown back and forth to Asia many times on other Asian carriers, 4 times in the last year. Check-in in San Francisco was quick and efficient. I was given a priority pass for the security line which helped bypass the long lines. The Polaris business class lounge at SFO is one of the best in the world. Boarding the flight was on time with a separate line for business class. The flight attendants were very welcoming and professional. The business class seating on the Dreamliner was 2x2x2, all with double pods. There is some degree of separation. The seats were comfortable, but in the fully flat bed configuration, my feet were touching against the end of the pod in a small opening which cramped my feet together and I am 5'10" tall. A taller person would find this very uncomfortable. I was sitting in 3B and I am a million miler flown on United. However, my first choice meal selection was not available as they had run out? The IFE selection is excellent, one of the best in the industry, but the television screen is fixed to the seat in front of you and cannot be tilted or moved. If you recline your seat and are looking at the screen at an angle, the quality of the screen diminishes and looses color and contrast. The overall trip was comfortable and ontime. I would have to say the flight was good, but not great. The Asian carriers flying the same route offer a much higher level of privacy with individual pods and larger beds and the quality and selection of food and service is outstanding.

Houston to Norfolk. Customer service with United Airlines is atrocious! They have called me 6 times since I booked my son's flight on Saturday. I have used them for his unaccompanied minor flights for summer visitation for years as they have a direct route. I have always paid the unaccompanied minor fee the week of the flight as this is easier on my budget. Apparently this policy has changed unbeknownst to me. I verified at the time of the purchase of the ticket that I could in fact pay for the fee later and the manager said this was fine. This was of course not documented as were none of my 6 conversations that followed. They repeatedly asked me the same questions and I gave them the same answers day after day with no results. They refused to send me an email receipt for the ticket that I had paid for until the unaccompanied minor fee was paid. I will be using a different airline no matter the price difference. This has eaten up hours of my time due to horrible communication and customer service. If they had communicated a policy change in the first place I would have either paid for the entire thing at once or shopped for another ticket.

I was ticketed to fly to India by Lufthansa with 2 Pieces of baggage as check-in. The first leg was from Los Angeles to Washington and United refused to allow me to check in two baggage unless I pay $100 for each baggage. After showing the ticket and the routing which clearly shows that I am allowed 2 Piece of luggage the supervisor at LAX threatened me with not allowing me to board unless I pay the extra money for the second luggage. The customer service in United Airlines is even worst and refused my refund even after providing the ticket evidence.

Newark to Cancun via Washington. Traveling from Newark to Cancun where my family of 4 and I had to take a connection Flight from Washington DC, this amazing, energetic, happy, and funny flight attendant was on our both flights. Kate made both our trips as pleasant as it can be. I would like to thank her for her amazing customer service and for a job very done. God bless

Worst experience I have even encountered on an airline. I have been at the airport for 48 hrs now and have 4 cancelled flights. I have completely lost 2 days of vacation that I cannot get back and have currently been sitting at the airport since 6.30am and the plane has been parked out front till now and what do you no they now have to change the oil! Are you kidding me? Do not book this airline as it is a waste of money and of your time! If I could give it a 0 out of 10 I would!

Omaha to Chicago. 1055 flight cancelled. We'll try and get your group of 11 on our 321 flight. Delayed several times. Boarded plane to park us on the tarmac for 45 minutes. Offered zero compensation for food, hotel, nothing. Absolutely the worst I've ever experienced. Fly Delta. The extra money is worth it.

Newark to Presque Ile. United is by far the worst airline I have ever flown on. My trip started out being delayed out of Newark because of some mechanical issues. I am a TSA pre check member and by far United cannot get their act together. Tried printing my ticket out 3 times and it will not show my precheck. You need to work on your system. I dont ha e an issue with any other airline I fly. Your customer service was terrible in Newark. I will never fly United Airlines again.

Los Angeles to Kahului. The worst customer service, even the supervisors (after 2 hours). I am from Chicago, and United was my go to, and spent hundreds of dollars over the years. Not anymore since they would not simply give me my $125 voucher, which they promised me. I will spend more money not to use their service.

commentHeader: first class is at best second class
reviewContent: Washington Dulles to Honolulu. Never again will I fly United first class if I can help it. United's first class service is, at best, second class. We flew non stop from Washington, DC to Honolulu, HI. DC's lounge didn't open until late morning so there were no benefits on the ground. On board the seats were what you'd expect; service was mixed. One flight attendant was pleasant and one was rude. The on-board amenities are minimal - a pillow & blanket. Food options were available to some but several entrees were quickly, "no longer available". On our afternoon return we got United's notice that we should arrive 3 hours early due to security delays. We did; we also got checked in & through security in about 30 minutes. Having well over 2 hours we went to the United Club lounge to wait. That's where we were told that only first class travelers on international flights were permitted access! Short flights on discount fares is all United is good for any more. For comfort or luxury, Virgin, American and each European airline we've flown has had far superior service & amenities when compared to United.

Denver to Missoula. Never flying with them again. My flight has been delayed 4 times with a possible cancellation due to weather where the plane that I'm supposed to be on is coming from. They've told me if I do get a cancelation because of weather it's not their fault so they refuse to offer accommodations because as they said, "I can just sleep at the airport." Not only could i possibly have to pay for a hotel room and travel to and from the airport, but I'll be missing work. They dont care about their customers at all.

Portland to Milwaukee via Houston with United Airlines. Absolutely the worst airline I have ever flown on. Why have schedules if you cant even come close to keeping them. Delays due to dark clouds, no rain or high winds just dark clouds. Constant delays, you would probably be better off getting there on time through Greyhound.

Weather delays ended up making us miss our flight connection to CLL. Rather than getting off of the flight and immediately getting on the flight to CLL, we ended up waiting ~4 hours (it’s only an hour and a half drive to CLL by the way). By the time we understood the entire situation, all of the restaurants were closing. I went up to the Customer Service, and told them the situation. They couldn’t refund or cancel the second flight, which makes sense. I asked if we could get any access to the club, though, since the restaurants had closed. They just told me no. There was no apologies or compassion for the delay, just no and that’s pretty much it. I don’t really feel like I’m a valued customer for sure. Also, their boarding times are so ridiculously long, endless flight delays, and their lowest economy class seems like a pretty cheap way for them to earn more money for something that doesn’t really make much of an impact.

Denver to Los Angeles. Have been sitting in the Denver airport for 6 hours because United had a faulty hydraulics and then the fuel system was leaking. No customer service reps with help or explain anything. We are left here waiting. I have to be in a wedding g party tomorrows. We are paying for a car rental and a hotel as well because they dont know how to service their planes or have a back up. Disgusting

Chicago to Anchorage. United put our luggage on a different flight so our luggage wasn’t at our destination. We asked the baggage services and they said that it was sent to a different destination but did not know how or when it would make it to where we are. The clerk told us to call back in a few hours so we did and they did not answer. I packed (and paid for) luggage because I intended to use it but I guess that was too much to ask. Thanks for ruining our vacation.

commentHeader: shall never fly with them again
reviewContent: Houston to Austin via Boston. I visited the US for a 3 week holiday June - July 2019. I flew United thrice. How many times did I experience delays? Thrice. Once upon connecting to my final destination upon arriving in the United States. There was a delay with my flight leaving Auckland. Touching down in Houston, I had 50 minutes to clear immigration, pick up and drop bags, and leg it to the gate. I didn't like my chances. I tried not to fret. I asked Border Security/United Representatives at every opportunity, 'My flight was delayed, I'm concerned I won't make my connection, can you please advise the gate staff that I'm cutting it fine." Every time met with: "Ma'am, don't worry, don't panic, you'll be fine." By some divineness, I made it to the gate with 20 minutes till departure! But United decided to close the door on myself and 20+ other travellers... such is. Had to wait 4 hours for the next flight, it was to Austin! Would have been quicker walking. Less than a week later. Austin - Boston via Houston. I was dreading going via Houston again! Once scarred. Long story short. Arrived at the airport nice and early, only for my flight to be delayed by several hours. I was extremely nervous, as I had a commute to make to Cape Cod after arriving in Boston..Needless to say, I arrived in Boston late, and had to travel by Uber (very costly) instead of the bus had United been on time! My last experience with United will remain my last, I shall never fly with them again. I am a conscientious, well-prepared, seasoned traveller, and shall not be reduced to anxiety because I know the time constraints and flying United releases me of any sense of control I feel whilst travelling whatsoever. My return flight home to Australia was a long connection of 6 flights (5 connections), guess which was my third flight and the only one with a delay?? United: Never again. I won't even elaborate on the unfriendly staff, the lack of amenities, the cost of checked in luggage, the cramped seating. Budget Airlines exist in Australia, but my delays with them lie far and few between. To experience 3 delays in a 3 week period with the same airline at the SAME airport? Beggars belief. Do yourself a favour-  United: never.

commentHeader: left me and my family stranded
reviewContent: Newark to Montego Bay. They left me and my family stranded in a foreign country at 3:30am after experiencing a 24 hour flight delay. Upon arrival, no hotel, no car - after promising to book us a room since they knew we had no means to drive 2 hrs at 3:30 am to our booked hotel. Vacation day 1 ruin; arrived a day late and no where to go - United will not accept any accountability - no reimbursement for extra expense - no partial refund - nothing!

Do not use United Airlines. I had a 6am flight from New York to Hawaii with a connecting flight from Denver. Upon arrival around 8.10am my family and I proceeded to the gate where we advised that our connecting fight which should have been leaving from Denver at 9.40 am, was delayed until 1.00pm. In addition, we were assigned another gate and had to walk all the way to that location with all of our belongings. Then at 10.13 am we were advised that our flight delay had been extended to 5.00pm. I received this text message: “Your flight is delayed because of a crew scheduling disruption this morning. We know this wasn't part of your plans for today (it wasn't part of ours either), so we appreciate you hanging in there! We're doing our best to get you on your way as soon as possible”. Departure: Delayed (7 hrs 20 mins) plane-icon UA 328 Estimated: 5.00 pm Scheduled: 9.40 am. Once again, our gate has been changed and we have to lug all of our belongings to the new gate. I am beyond annoyed. This Airline is horrible. I’m traveling with my children and we have to spend the entire day in the airport. We now have to spend extra money on food for lunch which would have been included in our resort. The customer service is beyond long with people complaining of flight delays. If you want to get to your destination without delays because of "crew scheduling disruption" or any other issues choose another airline.

Reno to Chicago. I was leaving on July 3rd from Reno Tahoe International Airport, the staff was very rude and not friendly, after she checked my luggage, she threw my luggage away. I think the company needs to train better and professional workers.no wonder United Airline has bad reputation for a while.

route: Vancouver to Washington via San Francisco
reviewContent: Vancouver to Washington via San Francisco. First flight out of Vancouver for the day, delayed because of weather and San Francisco logistics. Screwed up the entire planned event, multiple stops and layovers, getting to South America. The weather wasn't even an issue, nearly passable as light rain. Gate staff didn't say much, poor English skills too. Processing customers for alternatives was also snail-slow. Awful unqualified, useless staff. Captain was sarcastic, the icing on the cake for an awful display. Terrible experience. Left my girlfriend waiting at another airport. Imbeciles, the whole lot of them. Never flying United again. Makes sense, all the reviews here are bad. This just in, maybe because the company sucks, and is just that, bad. Not recommended, don't book United. 1-10, the initial cheapest ticket on the market, scheduling. USA border security agent had a sense of humour that day.

Richmond to San Antonio. Walk run or swim, your chances of getting there is better than flying United. They are late over 73% of the time when I have flown with them. As a result connections are missed.

Absolutely horrible check-in service. There is no point in downloading the app because you cannot use it to check it. I called the help desk and they were even more useless telling me I just had to go to the airport and that there was only one set of seats side by side... thank you United Airlines for messing up our return flight from our amazing honeymoon! Take any other airline but United!

Los Angeles to Denver with United Airlines. Families Beware! They over sold our flight, gave away our reserved seats, split up our family, then gave us nothing but empty excuses. We were eventually told just to 'go on the website, and lodge a complaint'. We saw three other families on our flight that they had done the exact same thing too, splitting them up.

commentHeader: I’d prefer to take a bus
reviewContent: Chicago to Newark. Frequent international traveller on multiple airlines, it was my first time on United, to go for a working lunch in Chicago from New York. Morning flight delayed an hour, and return flight delayed multiple times, summing to 4h. No other options, all flights booked to any NY airports. I knew United had a reputation, but they clearly exceeded all my expectations. Never again, I’d prefer to take a bus!

Washington Dulles to Chicago O’Hare with United Airlines. Flight was delayed because ground crew fueled the flight for Mexico, not O'Hare. We were delayed over an hour to take the excess fuel out of the tank. This caused my wife and I to miss our connection from O'Hare to Madison WI via Van Galder bus line. We had to wait at the Bus/Shuttle Center for 6 hours. Tired and frustrated was not a way we wanted to end our vacation.
The worst airline ever, we had multiple delays upon delays. My luggage wheels were broken upon retrieval. I will never do any service with this airline again

New York to Houston. My original flight was supposed to depart at 3:45 p.m. when we get there there is about an hour delay, that hour turns into 2, 3, 4, 5 our flight kept getting pushed back due to weather. I totally understand that the weather is not their fault but there were flights leaving that were going to the same destination so when we tried to get on those they said they were fully booked. The staff were incredibly rude and had no information and I know that weather makes things very difficult but they would tell us completely different things from what everything else was saying. We waited in the customer service line 3 times and the first 2 times they would tell us something and 5 mins later we would get an email saying something else. When our 3:45 flight got pushed to midnight we went Back up to customer service for the 3rd time and waited for 2 hours. The 3rd time we went the man who helped us was extremely helpful and since we had long missed our connecting flight he booked us a flight first class for a flight on Monday which was the best he could do and due to the circumstances was very helpful. We finally found out that our flight had been delayed to 11:30 a.m. the next day (tomorrow) but that everyone had to go to baggage claim because the gates were closing. So there were no hotels and everyone had to sleep in baggage claim. Thankfully for us our family is just a 10 min drive away but there were people there who had been there since 9 In the morning due to a layover with nowhere to stay and no food. It was very unorganized. We lucked out due to having an amazing customer service helper but if we had someone else it could've gone another way.

Flight delayed multiple times to the point I was late to my father's wedding. This was constant from purchasing tickets months prior to 30 minutes after our final given take off time. Also asked about switching seats because I'm claustrophobic and they put me in a window seat. Guy at the gate said it was full but a couple hours later (well into the most recent delay) a small family came up and requested to switch to this flight from a later one. They were able to get on and one was put in an aisle seat. Love being lied to on top of being late both for my trip and on the way home.

My direct flight from Washington DC to Atlanta was cancelled and they gave me a flight that has a connection rout through Newark, NJ for the next day. This flight is now cancelled.we have been waiting 4 hours and there is no further information. I have many things to do in Atlanta, already prepaid, hotel booked and too late to cancel. I will never fly again with United.

London to Los Angeles. Again plane was delayed from 1.40 in increments of 2 hours as the desk staff came up with excuse after excuse. Mechanical issues that created more mechanics issues. They found the part. Installed it but it just tripped the whole planes power. Really? Do you really think customers are that stupid? Clearly. Basically what they are doing is stalling for time because the flight crew work on legal turn around max times. So next they put us up in hotel - Crown Plaza - because a new plane will arrive for an unscheduled flight time of 9 am.  Manage to drag myself up for the 9am flight only to be told the plane has been delayed due to mechanical issues. Now they are flying a crew in from the US to fix the problem. You see the logic problem with this. It’s not even possible! So now they have another plane coming in - they haven’t got any brand new planes. There is no excuse for an airline to be this dreadful. The upside was one great desk worker who was so good. Professional. Calm. I just wanted to hang out with her and while away the time. So here I am again waiting for the next lie.

Vancouver to Denver. I have to wonder what United airlines in Vancouver is thinking when it comes to customer service! Upon arriving to the Vancouver airport, we went through the self-service kiosk and tagged our bags. They had the wheelchairs locked up so we had to wait on someone to unlock them for my father. Then we were expected to drag our own checked bags about 75 yards to a conveyor belt where we had to load them to be sent off to the plane. This would not have been so bad except we had a wheelchair with no assistance and there were a lot of United personnel standing around talking and doing nothing. They also had everyone wait in the same line for all concourses which took quite a while. I am amazed that such a large airline would have such little customer service especially for loyalty customers (my parents) with today’s poor customer service, they will never get me as a loyalty passenger/customer. Once we arrived to our destination, I was not at all surprised that there was no wheelchair waiting for us as requested in Vancouver. With their outrageous pricing, you think UA would be able to afford better service. I will not book on United again unless they are the absolute only airline to a destination I want and even then I may need to choose another place to visit. Shame on you UA.

route: Seattle to New Orleans via Houston
reviewContent: Seattle to New Orleans via Houston. In both my flights today I was seated separately from my five year old daughter. There were three other families on this flight who also were seated in separate aisles from their children and had to navigate being a part-time flight attendant and ask people to switch seats. Twelve people crowding the aisle trying to ask strangers to get up. It’s annoying. And the flight attendants did nothing but say “call me if you need my help.” It is outrageous that we are given the option to select seats when we book the ticket and then it might as well be southwest when we arrive on the flight. Parents, don’t fly United.

United does it again, it seems every trip I make the mistake of booking with this airline they find a way to make sure I don't arrive where I'm supposed to on time. I'm typing this as my connecting flight is leaving while I sit on the tarmac because United can't schedule their flights appropriately to save their lives. This airline is truly the worst and no matter what the reason they make you miss your flight it's never their fault and you won't get a refund no matter how bad they screw up. This airline is complete trash and has ruined a vacation for me for the last time. To hell with United, the only thing they're United in is their uncanny ability to screw over their patrons.

My husband was scheduled to leave from Seattle July 4 at 10 am and something went wrong with the plane. He was going to be delayed 2 hrs but because of change of crew it was further delayed to 6 hrs missing his connection. He got rescheduled for a 11:30pm flight. After all those hours waiting in the airport, his flight was cancelled due to crew issues and will reschedule for morning of July 5. He finally asked United to get him on an American Airline flight. My husband has been waiting in the airport for almost 24 hrs. We’re definitely done with United!

Calgary to Denver. I requested a blanket and the stewardess just said she would lower the temperature. As I was leaving, I saw a blanket still in the wrap and I tried to take it with me for my next flight but the  flight attendant said I couldn’t take it because it is only for first class?? You guys can’t give away one blanket?

route: South Bend to Sioux Falls via Chicago O’Hare
commentHeader: seat was given to another customer
reviewContent: South Bend to Sioux Falls via Chicago O’Hare. First, my flights were delayed by more than 7 hours due to “weather” (a false excuse given that there was no inclement weather at my location or destination for many hours). After my second flight was canceled, I found an agent and asked to have myself re booked to the 7am flight the following day. However, the exceedingly snippy agent was very difficult and unhelpful. When I finally got her to confirm that I would be on that flight, she then made a stink about getting my bag off of the plane. It took over 3 hours to get my bag, which only even happened because a kind baggage attendant took it on herself to help me (agents were refusing customers service and this happened to several others). Once I had left the terminal, I was informed that there would be no flights the following day, and that I would have to wait yet another day to get to my destination. I infuriatingly accepted this compromise. Yet the next day, I learned that an agent had gone into the system, and labeled me as a “no show” for a flight that was scheduled for the following day! I hadn’t shown up to a flight that hadn’t even happened yet! My seat was given to another customer, and United never gave any indication that they had canceled my reservation, kept my money, and had no intention of taking me to my destination even after costing me two extra days of my limited vacation. This is theft, plain and simple.

Zurich to Washington. Our bags were missing when we arrived at Dulles international airport. We filled out a claim. The next day we called them and checked the status of our baggage but both the page and the computer voice that we were calling couldn’t tell us the current status of our bags. They just told us that the team was working on it and that they would give us more information if they could. Our baggage didn’t arrive even after 24 hours and they couldn’t tell us were the bags were at. All my medicine was in the bag, the gifts for my host-family which I hadn’t seen for a year and so on and I had to buy all new clothes for myself. We wanted to enjoy Independence Day but because of the missing bags we couldn’t and had to shop new clothes. Worst service!
London Heathrow to Denver, 1 hour departure delay. Does this blasted airline ever fly on time? Always late, US can change anything, anytime but hit passengers with ridiculous sky high fees.

Newark to London. United's new app works really well, great for check-in, changing flights, buying internet, changing seats etc I download boarding passes and was through TSA Pre-check swiftly at EWR. Polaris Lounge excellent, reasonable food offering, quality drinks, nice shower room. Lounge was very crowded from 4pm, few seats, lines for bathroom but staff pleasant. UA boarding process was usual disorganised haphazard free-for-all with pre-board groups jostling around the gate. Plane was a retro-fitted 767-300er. Polaris business seats, comfortable, private and great to sleep on, work or watch a movie. Then you hit United's Achilles heel 'inconsistency of service' from its FA's. Some crews are professional and just know about customer service while others seem to think passengers are something to be tolerated and no-longer have a passion for their jobs. I asked the FA serving the Polaris cabin for a pre-departure drink and was told that they were not offering this service from EWR as all passengers had to board through the front left door, and thats what my seat had a bottle of water. ??? After take-off I requested the express dine so I could get to sleep quickly, when the first drinks service came I request two drinks a G&T and a glass of wine for my meal. The same FA I had requested a pre-departure drink from said 'she had her eye on me' loudly to the purser, which I found funny as I hadn't even secured a single drink at that stage. When United launched Polaris over two years ago there was a real effort to improve onboard food and beverage unfortunately any improvement hasn't lasted, and as the hard Polaris product in seats and lounges slowly arrives the on-board product has declined. The food was inedible, beef that was as hard as a rock and a wet watery mash potato, present like at a cheap diner. when desert was offered the same purser and FA asked me to identify if it was a coconut or apple pie? When I was waiting near the galley to use the bathroom I heard the purser say 'give me that brown goo. these people will eat any xxxx'. United 9-10 for improvements to your hard product but you need to focus on improving inflight customer service 3-10.

I flew from San Francisco to Cairo through Amsterdam. I arrived in Cairo to find that no baggage arrived. I filed a claim in Cairo airport and all time was thinking it is their mistake in Cairo. When United finally answered after almost 36 hours of trying to reach them and being out on ridiculous times of hold they figured that all my baggage is still in SFO and did not leave with me. United reply was simply ridiculous that it happens and it is not their mistake and that they will forward my baggage to Cairo and have no answer to why it happened. Add to this that they outsource their calls overseas to employees that don’t have answers to your questions. This is by far the worst airline I traveled on and they don’t care. Unfortunately they were only able to find 3 of our 4 bags and forward them to our locations but they were not able to find the last bag which was my 9 months old daughter bag with her medications. The customer service was really horrible and subpar compared to any other airlines and the employee was rude claiming it is not their mistake and that they get a lot of calls which is a horrible excuse.

I booked the flight from Grand Rapids to Newark (NY) on June 19th 11:30 am. While at the gate we found out that first there was a delay for 12:08. At 12:15 the gate personnel came announced that there was a technical issue and the flight was cancelled. She asked everybody to go to the front office and rebook another flight. I immediately headed to the front desk and tried to find an alternative. I was told by United airlines staff that there was no flight until the next day and that would take me to New York late afternoon. That was not good enough for me as I had a 18:00 job interview on June 19th and a meeting early morning June 20th. So, I asked for alternatives. The person at the front desk said there was no other alternative and suggested to refund the cost of the ticket. My checking with American and Delta confirmed the same. She immediately put the refund request in United’s system. I was very disappointed and immediately started calling all the necessary people and try and re-schedule the job interviews.When I arrived back home I called the hotel I had booked and asked for possible cancellation of my booking. The hotel immediately denied refund as it was last minute but finally asked for a letter of flight cancellation from United so that they can possibly consider. I called United customer service and after half an hour of waiting, they directed me to a webpage where I could ask for a full refund of the hotel cost as well aside from the flight cost. I stayed on the phone to do exactly what they directed me to do and attached the hotel bill on that form. As soon as I finished the call my wife called me (I had notified her earlier) and she told me that the flight was en route to Newark. She asked me to check the google flight status. I did and I saw that the flight was reported en-route to Newark. I tried to call the airport but to no avail. I decided to go back and find out what happened. At the airport I asked the employee who told me that the flight was cancelled and suggested the refund but she avoided me saying she never suggested a refund to me or said that the flight was cancelled. Then I asked for the supervisor, who aggressively tried to lead me to the side of the office and avoided offering any explanation He aggressively asked me to wait in an office with a young employee who knew nothing and just waited there for 10 mins without anything happening. I asked for the name of the person who refunded my ticket and the name of the supervisor but she denied offering them and called security. Needless to say I was extremely polite and respectful to all. I told her that it was not necessary as I only wanted to file a complaint with United (as I saw there was no way for me to fly and would like to have the names of the employees involved.) Security came and offered the name of the supervisor but not the name of the employee who cancelled my ticket. I left the office disenchanted. After three days of talking to UA customer service I finally managed to get a letter on June 21st which I forwarded to the Hotel in NY. After another three days of back and forth the hotel finally declined reimbursing me the money (USD 584) because “it was last minute”. UA reimbursed only the cost of the ticket.

Houston to Phoenix. One of the worst flight experience I have ever had in my life. I had to pay to check in a carry on bag due to the type of ticket I bought ( This is understandable). The problem however was when I landed and couldn’t find my bag, I waited till all the luggage’s were delivered and at this point I thought someone must have stolen my luggage until someone suggested I go talk to the United baggage office. On getting there , the attendant told me my bag didn’t come on the same flight I arrived with and is scheduled to arrive at 10:30pm . I told her i had my house and car keys in my bag and her reply was “ who checks in their house keys on a flight”. The sad part was United didn’t think it was necessary to notify passengers about the status of their luggage. How do you send a text when a flight start boarding but can’t do the same when a passengers flight is missing? I was given a file number and pretty much told to wait till the flight arrives or have them deliver it around midnight to my house. I will be stuck at a neighbors house till then.

We had our worst flying experience in the past 30 years, today with United Airline. The flight was scheduled on 6:30 from Boston to Chicago. It got delaied for 3 hours and we lost our connection flight to Lansing. The responsible United people were very rude and their only option was to provide the next flight to Lansing with 24 hours delay. All staying and delay costs are on our own. With two infants it is a horrible experience with this airline.

Pathetic experience and customer service. We booked flight from Charlotte to Newark to join 6 days east coast tour and total tour screwed up due to delays from United. We were supposed to reach Newark by 10 am est and it’s already 4.30 pm est and we are stuck in Chicago. There are no updates from United and the staff is very rude whenever we ask a question. We missed the tour which was going to start at 10 am from Newark. My son is totally devastated as he was looking forward to this trip. I’ll never ever fly with United again.

Orlando to Washington via Pittsburgh. United Airlines is the worse ever! Both flights are delayed and I have been at the airport since 2pm and won’t get home till 1am, for a three-hour flight, including layover. They also do not make any accommodations for stranded travelers!!! It’s their fault we are stranded.

Omaha to Chicago. Between United ticketing service, TSA and the gate personnel there were 20 passengers that did not make the flight to Chicago and we got no help from the person at the ramp. We were all left to scramble to rebook flights to Chicago so we could try and make our final destinations. For me and my wife. When we got to the ticket kiosk to print our boarding passes we were told there was an error so we had to go up to the ticket counter and we were left on hold for 15 minutes or more before the issue was resolved then we had to go through TSA check which was completely backed up. Consequently, we just made it to the gate when they close the door and the attendant would not even call the plane or do anything to help. We did a head count and there were 20 passengers total that had missed the flight.

commentHeader: made sure my wife and I sat separately
reviewContent: It has been a long time since we flew United. When you choose the low cost flight option, you get the clear message that you are a second class citizen. You can't check in online, because they want to verify that we don't have more than a personal item. They went as far as to ask my wife to turn around at the kiosk, so they could confirm she didn't have more than a back sack. You are the last group to board the plane and they made sure my wife and I sat separately and in middle seats in both directions. We asked at checkin about getting seats together and their personnel made it clear this was not possible with the low cost fair. If I had known this was their practice, I would have chose differently or chose another airline. Most of this frustration was due to ignorance, I will be able to make a better informed decision next time. Their staff was professional and friendly. There are other airlines targeting low cost airline services, but they provide a more positive experience.

Denver to Tulsa. This is ridiculous! We have been waiting to take off for hours! Every 30 mins there is a new excuse to why we have to wait again! I have a major fear of flying and the trip home makes me never want to fly again. Shame on you United, my flight was set for 1:45, we boarded at 1:20 they left us in the cabin with a broken AC, no water and glued to our seats for 1.5 hours and counting! Never will I ever fly nor recommend United again. What a disgrace!

Houston to Dallas. What a strange experience. Flight attendants with an inability to enunciate. Fast talking mumbling with an occasional recognisable word like ‘seat’ or ‘landing.’ Also, first class seats were covered in food, I had to wipe them before we sat down. Lift your game United, we have choices!

commentHeader: the least reputable legacy carrier in the US"
reviewContent: This a warning for those selecting Premium Economy Plus on United (not to be confused with Econ Plus). Completely Shady, but more like a scam. First, I haven’t taken the flight yet, but feel the need to share. I was selecting seats on a code share operated by United. 1) Selected seats on the window side to be more comfortable because the cabin offers 2 seats on either side with 4 in the middle 777 300er. 2) Immediately following the process a ‘special’ upgrade offer was presented for the low price of $268: click here to pay and select seats. 3) The kicker was the offer was a downgrade to Economy Plus that offers a few extra inches of leg room in the economy cabin, yes big difference from Econ Premium Plus and Econ Plus. For those that don’t know, int’l Premium Plus is basically the same seats used for Domestic first class. Econ Plus only provides a little extra legroom near the front of the Economy cabin United should be ashamed. This about tops anything I’ve dealt with on Domestic US carriers. Another reason to stay away. My fault I didn’t catch the return flight was Air New Zealand, but the least reputable legacy carrier in the US.

route: Kansas City to Newark via Athens
reviewContent: Sparing the outlandish details, at the end of the nightmare with United we’d experienced: delays, missed connection, cancelled flight, rebooked flight, no sleep for almost two days, missed day of vacation, out of pocket expenses not planned for and lost luggage (We had nothing but our carry on for five days!). Wasted Taxi an hour back to the airport to get luggage as they promised it was now there, it was not. Hours on the phone trying to rebook, trying to track luggage, and then trying to file claims. Hours on hold! Hours speaking to people who had no clue. Worst customer service ever! We will never, ever, fly with United again. You are taking a risk. We were unaware of their reputation with delayed/cancelled flights and lost luggage. We learned the hard way.

commentHeader: ground staff were rude and lazy
reviewContent: Vancouver to Los Angeles. Rudest airline ever! They have zero respect to their customers. The check in agent and ground staff were rude and lazy. We had been treated with grumpy faces and such attitude. I was asking for a senior assistance for my grandmother who doesn’t speak English and under no circumstance that I expected to receive a straight face with the rudest response ‘that is not our responsibility that your grandma doesn’t speak English’. Understanding my grandmother might not qualify for the help but they didn’t have to respond in such unprofessional and uneducated way. We did not beg for the free flight, if you are unable to provide a basic service with courtesy then just shut your business.

commentHeader: This was a very nice act
reviewContent: Houston to Dallas. I witnessed the United crew making the plane go back to pick up a passenger that arrived late to the gate due to another delayed flight. This passenger was meeting his wife and daughter in this flight who jumped in joy when the saw him walking thought. This was a very nice act that deserves to be shared as an example to other airlines who need to consider that there is always a family behind that passenger that is left out.

Newark to Washington. This airline can’t handle any change of weather or slight change of schedule without significant delay. It doesn’t help that Newark, one of the worst airports in the world, is their hub. I’m one of the elite flyers who hates United for their lack of ability to handle any problems arise. There was some rain briefly this morning but the flight delayed and we were stuck on tarmac for 3 hours without food or water. They didn't even turn on the wifi. I’m going to miss the connecting flight and was rebooked to late flight at the end of the day. By the time I will get to my destination, the rental car counter will be closed. I’ve flown United 4 times in the past few weeks (I travel for work) and it rarely ever gets anywhere or departs on time. But the worst thing is their handling of problems.

Shanghai to Newark. I had a pleasant time on my way back to the United States except for some heavy turbulence, but we made it. United has the best business class service than any other US airline. The amenity kits were cool in Spider-Man, I have never seen anything like that before.

Portland to Buffalo via Chicago. Usually, I’m not a complainer. Plus its summer travel season. But this time I’ve had enough. Flight just got cancelled and moved from Monday to Wednesday. Pretty much we were stripped down 2 vacation days and missed the occasion that we planned attending. Then, we were put on different seats (but I paid extra when made reservations). Going back from Buffalo to Portland was another hassle. Flight from BUF was delayed, we barely made it to our connection (had to run through Chicago O’Hare). Got on the plane, had to sit and wait for our turn to take off. Took us 1.5 hours. Couldn’t use the bathroom. When we were finally able to take off, we weren’t allowed to use the restroom for another 1.5 hours. Crying kids. Angry passengers. This is not OK! Never ever I will use United again.

Savannah to Newark. On a recent United flight (UA 138) that I had booked in February 2019 for a Flight on 24. June 2019, the following happened to me and other passengers, please note that several other groups of passengers experienced the same thing on this flight and have reported to have seen the same practice on other flights as well. I was traveling with my two underage children ages 13 and 15. I was placed in Row 12E while my children were both placed in Row 20, which is an Exit row. Note that my 15 year old is old enough to sit in this row and assist other passengers in an emergency but my 13 year old is most certainly not and cannot sit there per FAA regulations. When I stated that we need to moved elsewhere the flight employees told me to just switch seats with the 13 year old. Subsequently I protested and informed the flight employees that none of us want to sit in an Exit row, even though I am old enough, I do not want to sit in an Exit neither. My 13 year was subsequently moved to row 12E and I was left without a seat. Finally I was told to move to the back of the airplane Row 34 ‘somewhereʼ (no specific seat was given to me) and my 15 year old was left in the Exit row on his own. At this point I switched with another passenger at the front row 7 which was closer to my children than Row 34. The Stewardess on this Flight then informed me this is also an Exit row. (She later remarked that since I called her a ‘Stewardess’ I do not fly very often. Despite the fact I’m in the air every month. She really went out of her way to be insulting.) I repeated the fact that I donʼt want to sit in any exit rows and I want my second child also moved away from the Exit row. I repeated that I believed that itʼs FAA regulations that we must agree to sit there and agree to assist or be moved and would they please move us. At this point the Stewardess started to get very aggravated and said ‘we offered you a seat in the back‘ and you didnʼt take it and subsequently switched me again from Row 7C to 8C. She rolled her eyes an also stated that ‘here we go again, acting demeaning and rude. I didnʼt ‘buyʼ a seat that means they can put me wherever, even in an exit row- apparently even without my consent. I would like to add here that I very much liked to have bought assigned seats; however the first opportunity I got in the entire purchase / check-in process was two hours before boarding when all the seats for sitting together already were taken. In summary my 13 year old was placed into Row 12E and my 15 year old was in an exit Row 20 the entire flight although he was a minor and I did not agree for him to sit there. Finally in the last 30 minutes I approached the staff again to re-seat us. Furthermore security measures ask for parents to assist children during a flight with oxygen masks as well as ensure that seatbelts are worn between and after bathroom breaks. How can a parent assure that this happens properly when the parent is placed on the opposite side of the airplane with isles blocked by carts and other people? In my case this was not as big of a deal as my children are teenagers but there was another group of passengers where the parent was split from a 6 year old child and the child was expected to basically fly on their own? She was crying and was not allowed to be seated next to her parent.

route: San Juan to Portland via New York
commentHeader: wants to charge me for backpack
reviewContent: San Juan to Portland via New York. Always trying to take advantage of the customers by creating dumb policies. I've never had any problems passing through with my backpack but now United wants to charge me money for my backpack. The main reason that I bought a backpack is to carry it myself. United is a low class and cheap airline trying to take even the last dime from every customer and they don't even serve nothing in 4 hour flights. I'm disgusted by this airline.

Baltimore to Los Angeles. This is hands down the worst airline to ever exist! My family and I were heading to LAX for a connecting flight to Kauai, but the plane we boarded had this clunking noise under our feet.
