However, this was a 5 hour flight which resulted in a lengthy delay at 11 at night and for those who struggle to sleep in an aisle seat and very long and entertain-less flight. Not to mention food and drink only happened once that I remember and there’s really no benefits to being a mileage plus member. I worry about my next flight out there to see my partner.

Denver to Fort Lauderdale. Avoid avoid avoid. I will never fly United again. There are weirdly cryptic baggage fees, consistently late flights, and horrible customer service. If you can, I would advise steering very clear of this airline.

Tampa to Beijing via Washington. This was an award business class flight ticketed four months ago -scheduled for SAS from Washington Dulles to Copenhagen and Air China continuing on to Beijing. When the SAS pilots went out on strike a week before my departure, everything was left up in the air, so to speak. I waited until the day before my flight in the hope that the Scandanavian labor dispute would be resolved, but my luck and time ran out. United Airlines had the first segment from TPA to IAD, and the award was booked through Mileage Plus, so I called their gold elite help line to attempt some sort of rescheduling. The customer service representative was patient in guiding me through several alternative options to Beijing. Connecting through Copenhagen was not possible, but she did manage to force open a business class seat on United's non-stop IAD-PEK. In fact, both flights were eminently pleasant, although 13 hours on any flight seems interminable. Both flights departed and arrived significantly early, and service onboard met my expectations for a long haul business class flight. Although our cabin was 100% full, the attendants hustled and provided attentive service. The elaborate meal on the flight to China was delicious and filling, although the beef main-course could have been somewhat hotter. In addition, United's 2x2x2 seating on the 787 is not the equal of the 1x2x1 arrangement I was anticipating on SAS. Nevertheless, the seat was quite comfortable. Special mention should be made of the bedding United offers in Polaris. In the end, although I was disappointed to miss out on flying with SAS and Air China, this was my first experience with the new Polaris business class, and I was impressed by crew, plane, and customer service.

commentHeader: try to avoid taking United at all costs
reviewContent: Newark to Albany. I travel for work extensively. I sincerely try to avoid taking United at all costs. Unfortunately. My last 3 flights were with United. Travel with your organization is truly frustrating. Your flights are never on time, you charge ridiculous prices for services that are either free or half the cost with your competitors. Even your own employees seem frustrated working for your organization. I am writing this review to let less experienced travelers know. If you have other flight options, please use them. United will be routinely late, you will miss connections and they will nickel and dime you for everything. Their staff can be extremely unhelpful and essentially take the attitude that you are stuck with their inferior service and high fees.

I don't even know where to begin. I flew from London to Chicago with a transit in Brussels. First of all, my connecting flight was overbooked so they made me wait for a very long time before finally letting me and many others waiting know that we will have a seat on the plane. They also forced me to check in my hand luggage which contained critical documents that I needed because the flight was overbooked. The worst is yet to come. I waited for an hour in Chicago for my luggage but it never came. I went to the United counter and they told me it never left London and they told me that they will put my luggage on the next flight but guess what, it's been 24 hours and I've been on the phone with them twice and nobody can locate my luggage. Not a single person. I flew to Chicago to attend my sister's graduation so now I'm stranded with no toiletries, no clothes and all they can say is for me to keep my receipts. I am also sure that I'll be getting reimbursed 2 months later. United is the worst airline with no manners at all. Do not start their Mileage Program because they don't even have great benefits. I will go back to American Airlines who were very helpful when a similar situation happened in the past and they were able to ship my luggage the next day.

route: Frankfurt to Portland via San Francisco
reviewContent: Frankfurt to Portland via San Francisco. Generally good experience with new United Premium Plus Economy on intercontinental flight. The staff (both FA and ground) was basically polite and very active. Food was good and sophisticated. I appreciate that ice creams are still served as opposed to European carriers. The local products choice (beer, booze, desserts) is a nice accent and should be appreciated. I appreciate also handed menus, although the after take off service didn't happen on flight back to FRA. In addition there was no choice of pre landing snack although listed in menu. Unfortunately completely no pre-take off service (double focus on business class instead). Also the lavatories shared with overcrowded economy class. IFE could also be better. As M&M I am very satisfied with miles received for United flights. The domestic flights also good.

First off our flight was cancelled due to crew scheduling conflict, while booking a different flight they didn’t have a seat for my husband so put him on standby. Then wanted to send us 1/2 way back to where we arrived from, where we would lay over for almost 18hrs, which didn’t happen because it turned out my husbands stand by ticket was no good. They did give us a hotel vouched to stay and fly out the next morning. We get to gate D2 only to find out our gate had been switched to D32 without notification.  I’ll never use United again! Also the employees are very rude!

route: Guatemala City to Houston via Frankfurt
commentHeader: no space for legs at all
reviewContent: Guatemala City to Houston via Frankfurt. The company has no idea how to deal with the transfer of the luggage, someone says the customers shall pick it up and board it again during the transit, someone else says that there is no need. Result my luggage got stuck in Houston. Food is poor, air conditioning too cold, embarrassing entertainment system, no space for legs at all.

Columbus to Milwaukee via Chicago. I will do anything in my power to never fly United again including getting to my final destination late. Rude employees, late flights, changing gates several times and wait times for baggage claim over the phone of over 30 minutes. They don’t care and it shows!

Houston to Monroe. First of all, they, the United airlines have bad management in technical glitches, they simply don't know how to manage the passages or travellers. I flew from Denver after a business meeting to Houston and supposed to connect to Monroe, I landed on 2nd May 2019 at 11:00 pm and I was supposed to be landed at 8:30 pm, coz of 'so called' bad weather. They had cancelled the flight to Monroe which was expected to take off at 9:30 pm. When I checked with support staff, they asked me to stay at hotel for overnight which I need to pay from my pocket. The next day I waited all day in the airport and they gave a flight at 9:45 pm, which was again 30 mins late. Guys just avoid United for any given case, or avoid coming to Houston as connecting flight.

Houston to San Antonio. I don’t remember the last time I had a flight on time with this airline. Then again today I am trying to head home to see family and get home from working all week and my plane was delayed for two hours, we got boarded then they decide to tell us they are delaying it again for three more hours! We all had to unboard and wait around to see what they are doing. The workers at the desk are rude in any state I’m in. I’m so tired of United. I do not plan on using them again. I understand some delays. You can’t help the weather but this is getting ridiculous.

route: Hartford to Des Moines via Chicago
reviewContent: Hartford to Des Moines via Chicago. So, my daughter and I went to Iowa from Connecticut to visit my son. When we went to retrieve our luggage, my daughters never showed up. We spoke with someone at baggage claim and they filed a claim and said it must’ve gone somewhere else. We had purchased items just for this trip, now we have to not only replace the items we bought but now we have to purchase her all new clothes. We spent money we hadn’t budgeted for and when we returned home we were told that her luggage was found and it went to Albuquerque, NM. She sent in her receipts and received her luggage, finally, only to find that they had damaged the suitcase. They called and she was work so she asked me to call them back. The automated system does not make it easy to get a human being and then I finally get a human from another country who can barely speak English. He let me know that it will be 6-8 weeks for them to review the case. So United sent her luggage to another state, we had to spend money we hadn’t budgeted for and they broke her luggage and now we have to wait to get our money back. I will never use United again..

route: New Orleans to Newark via LaGuardia
reviewContent: On April 19, 2019 we were scheduled to fly from New Orleans to Newark at 1:10P.M. I received no communication from United, none at all indicating there was any change in the schedule. I printed out our boarding passes in advance, got to the airport 2 hours before flight time, went through security and to the gate with noone at any time saying the flight was cancelled. When we got to the gate, the board said the flight was cancelled. Noone from United was even there to assist us, to help us reschedule. We were left on our own. Thank God Delta personnel were in the terminal at another gate and were so helpful to us. If we left it to United, we would still be there. They didn't are at all about their customers. Because of United's horrendous customer service, we had to wait 8 hours and then fly back with Delta and fly into LaGuardia thereby incurring another $100 expense to get to Newark at 1:00A.M. in the morning of the next day. I contacted Customer Service and I requested $470.00 which is exactly one half of the total price paid for the roundtrip. All they have offered is a $75.00 travel voucher. In the future, I would rather pay more with Delta than fly with the unfriendly skies of United!

commentHeader: Paid for seat, refuse to assign
reviewContent: Nashville to San Francisco. Paid for seat, refuse to assign. I have a reservation for Oct 6, 2019. I paid for a seat months ago. I have called three times to confirm my seat assignment. Each time, I am told that I cannot get a seat assigned. During my second call, a Supervisor said that he assigned me a seat and ended the call, but I found out that he lied when I called back to confirm a third time. I have been on the phone with them an hour and a half during my third call bit am being told that others are being assigned seats but one cannot be assigned to me even though I paid for one.

The worst thing that can happen when you travel international is loosing your passport. My flight was Montreal - Newark - Myrtle Beach, I forgot mine in the magazine compartment in front of me on the flight to Myrtle Beach. I realize that 20 feet past the gate so I try to go back to the plane, I cannot it’s the law, ok I get it! The girl at the counter communicated with another one in the plane, after 3 messages I hear passport negative for seat 10f. I can’t believe it, it was just in front of the seat in the magazine compartment, the girl at the counter is 0 help and that’s it, it’s not there. It’s a passport not earphone, kind of important when you travel internationally! A couple of days later my passport is found at Chicago airport, so it was in the plane and the girl just did not check properly, I had to rebook domestic to Burlington for 300$ and have someone pick me up there and pass Canadian custom by car to enter Canada without a passport, worst customer service I can imagine, they just didn’t care! I don’t think I will ever fly United ever again. I cannot understand how someone can be so unhelpful with something as important as a passport especially since I knew exactly where it was United never again.

Los Angeles to Sydney. I had a fantastic surprise when I boarded the 787 and that was an upgrade to premium economy which was extremely appreciated as I am over six foot tall. The extra leg room, the seat position over the wing, combined with the great service and enjoyable meals, even a glass of wine, made for a wonderful trip back to Australia, thank you United.

Houston to Milwaukee. Negatives: Not comfortable seating, ticket prices are more expensive than most airlines, can only bring 1 carry on and 1 personal bag for free, must pay to check a bag, no leg room on plane, flight attendants were not friendly Positives: ...I honestly can’t think of any... Story: “The flight attendants are not here to provide you beverages and snacks, they are here for your safety” -Captain. That was how the captain, greeted everyone after everyone had been seated. If you’re looking for seats with barely any cushion to them and the most unorganized crew members, fly United. While it was only a 2 hour plane ride to and from I will definitely never be flying United ever again. The bus ride from the airport to the rental car place had WAY more comfortable seating than the plane and it’s not like you can reserve what kind of plane you want. So for my 6” 4 boyfriend he couldn’t even sit up fully or his head would hit the ceiling. Then when we landed there was no one there to open the gate for us. So we had to wait that much longer for the whoever to figure it out. Point blank don’t fly United.

The people in Newark were helpful since we were unable to book our flights in the same seats. My 4 year old daughter was moved it a seat next to my husband and that was great. When we arrived at SFO I asked for either me or my husband to be moved next to her and they refused. Said I had to wait at least an hour before boarding to move seats. When I asked about our seats boarding was set to being in just 20 min, I mentioned that and the lady at gate 77C just walked away. So yeah now I’m stuck with my 4 year old sitting next to starters because someone didn’t feel like helping.

Denver to Charleston. The flight had several delays and unlike Frontier when we finally arrived to the airport they did not allow people with close connecting flights to exit first. They also did not call ahead to the connecting flights like other airlines to allow passengers to still board. Then when I finally get to the gate five minutes late they would not allow us to board. We had to go all the way back to customer service which was not close for assistance

route: Lake Charles to Houston via Corpus Christi
reviewContent: Lake Charles to Houston via Corpus Christi. Original flight delayed over an hour. Show up an hour before the delayed time and told the plane already left. Was blamed for not showing up at the original time. Why would a system that sends an email and text saying the flight is delayed not send an alert saying the delay no longer applies? I dont know and neither did the ticket representative rather than to say it was my fault. So I here I am at the airport 4 hours later facing yet another delay with no idea of the flight is actually delayed or not.

commentHeader: they were no help at all
reviewContent: Missoula MT to LaGuardia NY with United Airlines. Extremely disappointed in this airline, 1.5 hours in the air with not even water and there was no turbulence. WIFI very sketchy, unfriendly staff. Small seats, Flight home they separated my husband and I into two different aisle middle seats. We booked this flight 6 months ago. When asked prior to boarding for help switching they were no help at all and that I would have to figure it out on board. Once I board I asked the stewardess to help me see if someone would switch and she said she does not do this. I expressed that I was terribly afraid to fly and did not want to sit near strangers. Absolutely will avoid this airlines in the near future.

I recently found that I had 2 United lounge passes that were about to expire. I asked United if they could be extended and they said unfortunately not but gave me two more passes. I’m traveling today by American Airlines first class international. I went to the AA lounge for breakfast and was told that my flight was excluded and I could buy a pass but for all of the money that I had paid for my ticket and my husband‘s ticket I would not be able to use the AA lounge. I went over to the United lounge and explained to them that I was flying American but would like to use my passes that were about to expire and they said no problem. I’m currently sitting here having a wonderful breakfast and a latte. Why I love United over AA.

commentHeader: threw the towel in the aisle
reviewContent: Sacramento to Houston. Flying on United last week, headed to continue more fireman training in Texas. Discovered my seat like this. Flight attendants didn’t want to give me anything to wipe this mess up with. Made me wait for 20 minutes to get a wet paper towel. One I cleaned it up, it took another 20 minutes to take the dirty towel. Then when she had gloves on, she wouldn’t take the towel from me. I was in the window seat and unable to get out, so I threw the towel in the aisle where it remained for another hour. I reported this to United’s website and have had very little contact.

route: Tampa to San Diego via San Francisco
commentHeader: I will not fly them again
reviewContent: Tampa to San Diego via San Francisco. For the first time in 15 years and hundreds of thousands of miles of airline travel, I was forced to gate-check my carry-on luggage because the overhead space was full. This normally would not have been an issue, except that upon arriving at San Francisco, I received a message requiring me to re-route back to Tampa. United didn't have a flight that worked and so I flew back on a different airline. It didn't occur to me that United wouldn't just send my bag back to my originating airport. Instead they want to charge me to have my bag FedExed to me - a very hostile staff in their baggage department clearly needs a vacation and a reminder that she works in a free country. I have tried to explain my circumstances as being unusual but apparently people book flights now and get off after only one leg because it is cheaper. I'm not sure if I understand this particular phenomenon, but I do understand when a company has blown past their sell-by date and needs to be cut down to size. If customers are using their system in a way that they don't care for - fix your pricing. It is unacceptable to take someone's bag, tell them that you aren't holding it hostage when you are doing exactly that. The airline has no right to insist that I prove anything nor does the airline have any right to penalize customers for not completing their itinerary. United lost a customer over this - I will not fly them again. We live in an age when personal liberties are used as toilet paper by companies that simply amend their terms of service to allow themselves to do whatever they like. United has clearly lost its grip. Fix your pricing, fix your system, grow a few brain cells and stop acting like a has-been monopolist that can't think themselves out of a paper bag - but keep your hands off of me.

Tel Aviv to Chicago. Our return flight was diverted to Detroit from Chicago due to weather. We were made to stand at their ticket counter for 1.5 hours waiting for instructions about a bus to take us to Chicago; the bus was 1.5 hours late and there was mass confusion as 150 passengers tried to get on 3 buses. It was apparent that United had no master plan in place designed to handle this situation even though I’m sure this was not the first time it had happened. Shame on them.

Salt Lake City to Chicago. United agents were extremely rude to my girlfriend. Tried to make her pay $100 for a carry on when she got her boarding pass. Then tried to board her plane was pulled aside for a seat assignment, and then denied her ticket said it was an illegal ticket and gave her seat away. Held her at the gate till she missed her flight and then said they would give her a refund. But when she called to get a refund they said absolutely not. And said she had no options there was nothing they could do. Most pathetic airline I’ve ever had to deal with. They do not live up to their “customer commitment”

San Francisco to Honolulu. Every time I fly United I regret it. The cost is not worth the aggravation. They don't even want to help. Asked me to switch lines to check my carry on making me rush to the gate, all while being as rude as possible.

route: Anchorage to Rio de Janeiro via Chicago / Panama
reviewContent: Anchorage to Rio de Janeiro via Chicago / Panama. I bought a ticket flight with United a long time ago and I choose United because of the short duration of the flight and short layover between the flights. Less than 1 month to the trip I received an email with a flight change using Copa Airlines flights. It was added another connection increasing my overall flight trip for more than 6 hours. The trip hours doesn’t make sense: I would arrive in Chicago at 11 am but my next flight time would be at 9 am from Chicago to Panama, which means I would arrive in Chicago 2 hours late for the next flight. (they sent it to me - company huge mistake with time sense) I called to customer service to try to fix it and they offered another ticket with 16hours of a layover or the reimbursement of the ticket! How I would find another international ticket in so short notice with a good price and good conditions of time flight? I asked to talk with the manager that was not flexible at all and said that I must accept the conditions of the changes otherwise the only thing they can do it is reimbursement. However, that was not a simple change condition... that was a huge mistake with time flight. I couldn’t get a plane that had already left because I flight that they added. I would miss the connection because of a United airline mistake. The manager was not doing anything to try to fix my problem and she said that: “ in my end, there is no more I can do”. I had to accept their change offer conditions resulting in a more 7 hours of increase in my overall flight trip. By the end of the call, the manager was impolite on her manners with an angry tone of voice. I travel a lot as well as my family and this has never happened to me before with the other airline's companies. This will be the last time I travel United. I don’t want this kind of problems for me in the future.

route: Orange County to Oklahoma City via Houston
commentHeader: Everyone I talked to was rude
reviewContent: Orange County to Oklahoma City via Houston. I landed in Houston and before I even got off the plane my connecting flight to OKC was cancelled. Everyone I talked to that worked for United was rude. I was told I was automatically booked for the next day late afternoon which was unacceptable. No one would help except one agent who got me on standby, but I was #20 on a full flight. Clearly I didn’t make it. Then I found out 2 people were ahead of me on standby and they already had a confirmed ticket on a later flight. Now tell me how they should take priority over someone whose flight was cancelled. I ended up buying a one way ticket on American. I will never fly United or recommend them again. Houston is supposed to be their hub so tell me why they can’t enlist another plane to make up for all the cancelled flights. Even flying today everyone I came in contact with was rude. I’m talking about the people behind the counters at the Houston United gates. The only thing they did right was release my luggage to my daughter at OKC while she was waiting for my American flight to land. My cancelled flight was #6295

Newark to Las Vegas. I am a 1K member due to my living proximity to EWR. My last 3 flights were over 1 hour late they have discontinued premier access so my wait time through security has been over 45 minutes and still every flight is full. I have finally signed up for Delta status match as this flight has really pushed me over the edge. Flight 2 hour delay, sat in front of door waiting to get on for 15 minutes because cleaning crew missed items. Food is disgusting and cabin staff attitude is worse than passengers that have suffered another disappointment. I travel every week or minimum 2 x per month i pay for first class as there upgrades as useless and never able to redeem and still suffer. I know my words wont change anyone's mind before buying a ticket on this airline the CEO should be embarrassed to represent such a horrible company.

commentHeader: doubt I will travel them again
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Newark. We ended up on this flight as our original flight which was to Montreal via air Canada was cancelled at the very last minute without warning and we had to rebook. We arrived early boarded on time. It wasn’t until we got on the tarmac and the plane was still sitting. Apparently the captain had to some systems checks and something didn’t pass. Once passed about an hr had lapsed fuel has been burned so we had to return to the gate to refuel. It took a total of 2 hrs for the process and we had a connecting flight to Italy and only had a two hour layover. All the while the flight attendants could not reassure that our connecting flight would be held for us to catch. There were issues with this situation from the get go. The thought of a cancelled flight was something I understand is normal but at the 11th hr was not appropriate notification to customers. For customer safety, one would think that the pilot both the ones on the previous flight and current flight should have some system of checks for the plane well before we get on the plane for the aforementioned safety and efficiency. All this added stress to customers could have been avoided if there was a better system of checks and communications going out to customers. After all this, this was the 2nd significant incident I had with this airline and doubt I will ever travel with them again in my lifetime if I had a choice.

El Paso to Houston. Truly a poor airline service all around. The plane from the small airport to Houston smelled filthy and had tiny seats, even for a petite female. I opted for the cheapest option for my flight - basic economy, which was a huge mistake. They did not authorize changes, cancellations, or adjustments at any time immediately after purchase. After waiting on the phone for 20 minutes, I was greeted by a customer service representative who basically just told me there’s nothing they could do and maybe try contacting my ticket issuer, Capitol One. I had applied some reward points to deduct about $93 from my over $400 round trip ticket from Killeen TX to El Paso TX. I contacted them only to be told that United is the only company authorized to make changes to my flight itinerary, which I can only imagine the original United rep has already known (or should have at least). Essentially she had just pointed fingers elsewhere to avoid problem solving. We are also not even allowed a carry on item at this rate, which seems completely unreasonable. The price of their economy tickets are not comparable to other airlines such as Frontier or Southwest, which makes it more confusing as to why they are so strict (the fact that I regularly use cheap airlines should indicate that my standards are not high to begin with, I just like affordable travel). On the same token, even if I had paid a higher fare to be able to carry on items and adjust my flight, I still would be sitting in the same dingy aircraft crammed next to the person in the seat next to me. I would almost be insulted that I bothered to pay the $50-100 more for the same poorly maintained vehicle. The aisles in my first flight were so narrow that I was shoulder checked every time someone walked by, while still shoulder to shoulder with the gentleman next to me. The seat did not recline either, so I sat there, sitting up at 90 degrees, being bumped for an hour from both sides. Furthermore, their WiFi is both overpriced and limiting. To be fair, I should have read more carefully where it states “steaming not supported”. I could not watch Hulu or Netflix with the $9.99 for 1 hour of WiFi that I paid for. Instead I’m using it to write this review, while on my return flight that was delayed for 2 hours this morning. Instead of watching the new Game of Thrones episode on the WiFi that could have paid for a meal, I will be sitting here with my elbows and knees completely tucked in uncomfortably, again, as to not be sitting on top of the man next to me. Overall, this airline is grossly overpriced for the lack of services it affords it’s customers. Will not ever be flying United again unless the military books it for me.

route: Sacramento to La Guardia via Chicago
reviewContent: Sacramento to La Guardia via Chicago. I travel quite a bit and this was the single worst experience I've ever had. I was with a group of people going to New York City, and we planned to arrive there in the morning, leaving plenty of time to rest, get lunch and dinner, and then see Mean Girls on Broadway. We got to the airport at about 9pm, made it to the gate to see that our flight had been delayed until 8am the next day. It was because one person called in sick. The airline did not get us a hotel for the night, so we slept at the airport on the incredibly uncomfortable couches because the tile floor, which would have been more comfortable, was too cold and we weren't even allowed through security to the gate so we were in front of the doors that were opening and closing, with loud announcements coming in every minute or so. United airlines gave each of us three $10 meal vouchers in compensation that were ultimately useless as we did not have a long enough layover in Chicago to buy anything. We missed Mean Girls, and received no refund. Thanks, United!

Newark to Buffalo with United Airlines. Very rude staff at the boarding gate. This is not the first time. Very disappointed. I would never recommend any of my friends and family to this airlines. No respect for customers. They have to teach their staff to respect customers first.

Miami to Newark. Travel with United Airlines is always getting delayed. This is just the 3rd instance in a row. United doesn’t care about customer service or satisfaction. United just want to make money and cut down the cost at the expense of customer satisfaction and happiness. United executives just care about how much millions they make at the expense of the customers and the employees. I wish a better airlines available like Singapore or other airlines who cares about customers.

Rochester to Newark. I asked to have a seat reassignment the attendant told me they won't even look at it then the flight is late because the airport did not have a power pack ready to power up the plane.. Horrible customer service and performance by United to meet their obligation to their customers.

I was supposed to leave from Houston to Rio de Janeiro on April 20th, 10 pm. It is April 21st, 2:30 pm and I am still at Houston airport with all the other passengers trying to get an extra flight to replace the one they just cancelled: "We're very sorry to let you know that your flight (UA 129) on 21 Apr. has been canceled because of a lengthy maintenance delay and regulatory crew scheduling restrictions. Check out your options on the United app or united.com under Saved Reservations. You may also contact us at 1-800-UNITED-1." Well, they made a mistake and the solution is just to cancel a 10hr flight - people made plans for that. Besides this problem, crew members have been rude to people that were just trying to get information. I am a loyal customer but now I don't even know what to be loyal for... if a service company charges more expensive prices and you still buy it, is because you trust on receiving a better service... not what I have seen today. Very frustrated and disappointed.

commentHeader: Never seen an airline this bad
reviewContent: Orlando to San Francisco. Service was very bad and aircrafts was very dirty. Due to some delays on another airline I was rebooked to return back to Tampa same day. I did not make that flight because of the incompetence of the ground staff in San Francisco. Very rude and did not really care to listen. Same day inbound flight horrible aircraft outbound could not even make it because of United staff. 25 years of flying over 200.000 miles per year. Never seen an airline this bad.

Hartford to Denver. First class is not very classy. After boarding the attendants were nice, offered a couple of drinks. Then breakfast one option cereal and yogurt. After takeoff and “Breakfast” we had another 2.5 hours with no beverage or snack service! And let’s not forget no wi-go! Thank god for solitaire. Worst first class flight ever!!

Denver to Burlington. I was supposed to arrive at my destination 18 hours before my life changing interview giving me plenty of time to be prepared. But of course, with United, I ended up landing in Boston at 12am (not Burlington, Vermont), and had to rent a car ($312.07 receipt attached, wasn’t planning on renting) to drive to 3.5 hours to Stowe, Vermont to make sure I got to my interview by 9am. I slept for 2 hours before my lifetime interview because United lost my bag and I didn’t have my suit. So, I had to buy a full suit for my interview ($150) an hour before my interview. This truly couldn’t be any worse of a situation and impacted my personal life dramatically. I made it to the interview, but 2 hours of sleep and cheap temporary dress clothes was devastating. No bag, cancelled flight due to maintenance, no flight to my destination, renting a car, driving hours after midnight, all could have been avoided by United. I would also like to add I still don’t have my bag and I’m flying back home. I’ve gone this whole trip with no clothes, no toiletries, nothing. United needs to fix this.

Newark to Delhi. This was first time i booked international flight for my family through United Airlines it was really worst experience i ever had with any airlines.The flight UA82 was scheduled from Newark to Delhi at 9:50 PM on 16th April 2019. We went to airport with 2 small kid (1 infant) and really struggled for checkin, United airlines agent were really arrogant and not responding properly on query, anyway i spent 1 hour and 30 minute finding what to do and agents sending me here and there. At last we have been asked to be on a long queue to get help, finally after another 40 minute on queue we have been told that flight is cancelled and that is the reason we had difficulty in checkin through kiosk. Wow this was terrible, i had to drive 60 miles to reach airport and now i hear flight is cancelled, there was no prior intimation on cancellation of the flight. Thankfully i kept few days of gap for my next flight from Delhi to Raipur. I was given only one option of connecting flight next day which i had no choice of denying so accepted. I really never thought United Airlines is going to be such a terrible experience. Now onwards UA would be a last option to fly with.

Chicago to Dallas. Well, United just lost a customer since 1981. Tried to check in online (and via phone, and with a live human) and was told that one cannot check in without a checked bag. In other words, there is a $30 fee for checking in online. Goodbye, United. It's been fun!

Chicago to Oklahoma City. We were told that we had to check our carry-on luggage because it wouldn’t fit in the overhead cabin. Once boarded, we saw the limited space and were shocked. The aircraft was very warm, small and uncomfortable. There were no plugs for devices nor were there any screens to view tv/movies. I was blown away with how little space there was, the lack of amenities and how cramped the flight was for the money we paid just to be on the aircraft. How is it we are now spending more and more money these days, yet going through hoops just to fly and getting less? There was little arm or leg room, no WiFi, there was water but no soap in the one restroom available, my armrest would not go up and the compartment holding the magazines was broken. I will think twice before boarding another United aircraft again.

route: Dublin to Chicago via Kansas City
commentHeader: will never book with them again
reviewContent: Dublin to Chicago via Kansas City. I have been a longtime miles plus and explorer member. I booked flights on United for my wife and son from Dublin to Kansas City through the United website using my account. This is one of those code share flights where Aer Lingus carries out the first leg and United, the second. The Aer Lingus flight was delayed and my wife and son missed their connecting flight. When at the United customer desk, they were told that it wasn't their problem. There were no more flights to Kansas City that night and they would not arrange accomodation. Instead, United made a ten year old and his mother sleep in the airport, and I still had to drive three hours to collect them at another airport, unless they wanted to remain in the Chicago airport for another day. I am astounded by the service provided by United. I will never book with them again and will take steps to cancel my explorer credit card with them.

Chicago to Waynesville. Staff was cold and unfriendly while being vague with directions and an unwillingness to help or answer questions clearly. They cancelled our flight and we were forced to stay in Chicago for 2 extra days without any vouchers for food or a hotel. There is not enough staff to address the customers who have paid lots of money for their poor service. Do not fly United Airlines. Ever. Unless you enjoy total chaos, poor service, and anxiety. I will never fly with them again.

Orlando to Frankfurt via Chicago. Worst ever customer service seen in my life. It took 2.5 days to reach my destination with each and every flight disruptions. I trusted Star alliance but seems to be they have lot of communication gape between airlines which gave me a nightmare.

We were shocked at the lack of customer service given to us by the airline attendants going from San Antonio to Denver for a connecting flight to Hawaii and LA to San Antonio coming back. An attendant coming home literally told my husband on our honeymoon we shouldn't of purchased these tickets if we wanted to sit together (making the assumption we are broke because we paid for economy tickets). I also observed the flight attendant turn down a mother and child to sit together. On the flight from San Antonio to Denver we asked to sit together for our honeymoon trip and all staff including the captain stated we could ask around but they would not help us. We ended up sitting separately on both connecting flights. I am very dissatisfied and disappointed in United Airlines punishing economy class fliers by splitting them up. We will not book with them again and will spread the word about their poor unprofessional practices .

Baltimore to Chicago. Worse customer service I have seen. Paid to have an assigned seat to be next to a companion in a flight and without notification of the airline changed the seat 3 times. When I called to try to rectify the situation the lady on the he phone kept repeating that she was not able to help and that the seats were transferred to the airport. I explained that I needed to be next to this person due to panic attacks and they disregard it and refused to give me a number to call.

This was the worst flight experience. The flight was delayed twice, due to weather, which is understandable. However, the app did not accurately update flight changes. The gate agents refused to address customer concerns in a timely and accurate manner. Finally, the jet walk was broken when we arrived 2 hours late to LaGuardia. Once again, the staff seemed unconcerned with the fact the a jet if tired, late customers was inconvenienced again by their incompetence. I will never fly United again.

route: Fresno to Honolulu via Los Angeles
reviewContent: My family and I are traveling from Fresno to Honolulu via Los Angeles. We get here at the airport 2hrs early and they told us that our flight is delayed 3hrs from Fresno to LAX and 4 hrs delayed from Los Angeles to Honolulu - and no one even notified us about the delay. They could have call, text or e mail us.

Orlando to Los Angeles. Zero customer service. I had to waste 32 minutes of my time to reinstate my ticket that they canceled. I was lucky the flight was delayed for an hour otherwise I would not have made it home to my kids.

I had a flight from San Antonio to Zurich via Washington. We got on the plane but they were driving us around the airport for 2 hours because of the storms in other parts of Texas. Finally we had to leave the plane and go back to the terminal, because the crew could not work more regarding to the regulations. We missed our connections on Washington, so we had to wait in the line til they rebooked the tickets for everyone. This woman rescheduled my flights so that I had to change one more time in London with only a half an hour time time span. Also the first flight from SA to Houston became critical because of the delay again. So I made them to rebook my flight again. So I had to stay one more night in SA, and leave 6 am at morning to New York. There I will have to wait more than 6 hours and finally get to Zurich a day later than i planned. Horrible experience. I'll never use United Airlines again! They do not cover any of my additional costs, but saying with big smile, that it was not their fault, but I can blame the bad weather.

A word of caution to those that fly United Airlines and their unreliability. Recently, my sister and I were on vacation in Las Vegas, Nevada and scheduled to be back in North Dakota on April 9, 2019 by about 4:30 pm, as we had plans later that day. Our flight was to depart Vegas at 9:58 am on Tuesday the 9th of April. We got up early at our Hotel and went to do check out at our Hotel, and also asked they print out our airline tickets (Las Vegas to Denver, and Denver to Bismarck). After they were printed I became upset with the lady at the counter and told her that those were not our tickets and she replied that is all she could do for us; we left the counter unapologetic. We headed for the airport and gave our luggage to the United guys at about 8:30 am or a little before and also asked them to check into our flights. They said the flight tickets we were given were our tickets, and there was nothing else they could do. Then we proceeded to our gate area as to our flight that was on our tickets. We asked the United guy there about our ticket matter. He said our flights were changed in January and that we would of been notified of our change. I told him that we booked our vacation in January and showed him our e-mail flight confirmation dated March 22, 2019 from our travel agent. The flight confirmation clearly stated that our flights were still departing at 9:58 that morning. I asked the United guy if the earlier flight that we were supposed to be on still existed and he said it did; he gave no further explanation for our changes made and seemed reluctant to talk on the matter. We were never notified of our flight changes, and neither was our travel agent notified of any changes. United Airlines are the ones that changed our flight schedules, as we were not asked nor did we volunteer. Often times those that choose to be bumped and make that choice get compensated and in our case they have totally avoided the matter and gave us nothing in return. Apparently United Airlines does not realize there are reasons as to why people choose the flight schedules they want, or for that matter as to what Airline to use - maybe United does not appreciate our business. When we booked our vacation at the beginning of January we could of used other Airlines, and maybe should have. United was giving bad excuses to our travel agent, and said that we were late in checking our luggage in and they got our luggage at 3:00 pm. This is a totally foolish excuse, as they already had our luggage by 8:30 that morning as we were hoping to get on with the earlier flight. Whomever gave that excuse should rethink their reasoning, as no Airline ever waits for anyone's luggage and they never wait for their customers in arriving on time, so the luggage was not a real excuse. We are seasoned travelers and have traveled to many foreign countries as well as much of the USA. In all honesty, it would appear that customer service in many Airlines in the USA is lacking, as having traveled to other areas in the world we find that those Airlines treat their air travelers much better. Our seats were next to the toilets.

Newark to Orlando. This is a disgrace. Waiting at the Airport from 12pm today. Got on the assigned flight which was suppose to leave at 4:05 pm had a technical difficulty. Was kept on the flight for two hours only to find out we have to deboard. No crew member knew what the status is. An hour later found out flight got canceled and was given a different flight and gate. Once boarded that flight at 7:30pm only to find out that this flight has a technical difficulty also. An hour later was announced that th iui s flight was canceled too. Its now 10:15pm no news yet. This is a disgrace. I have been flying United for a while, this is my third round trip just this year. This is not what you expect from an well known fight company like united.  I am suppose to attend a meeting at 9am tomorrow morning

Norfolk to Vienna via Washington. My family and me are heading for the spring break to Europe. Due the delay of the flight from ORF to IAD this afternoon, Apr 12th, we missed our flight to VIE for 5 minutes. The next connection even with an additional layover via FRA has delayed us for about 12 hrs and we had to wait with our 7-year old daughter for about 5hrs in Dulles. Hence, I had to feed our family for $80 - and we´re starting much too late in order to catch with our people, who are waiting for us. Asking at the United desk at the C1 gate dealing with the flight to FRA departing at 22.20, UA932, for an upgrade as compensation or a voucher, we were rejected. ("Because we don't do that with kids"!) It´s not the first time that United is performing like that. My frustration is manifest and paramount. I´d pay double the price, if there would be an alternative to your airline. One thing is certain - I´d do everything possible to tell the people what a creepy airline United is.

route: Toronto to Los Angeles via San Francisco
reviewContent: Toronto to Los Angeles via San Francisco. The worst company and the customer service that I have ever experienced. Was charged for the ticket that I persuaded more than I was supposed to, even though the e-ticket was showing an original price. Called the customer service they advise me to go to a bank. Went to my bank, they provided me with all the official information that proves that I was charged more than it was saying on the e-ticket from united airlines. Called the united airlines again, we had an hour and 30 minutes conversation 3 ways with my bank and the United Airlines company itself. They denied the fact that I was charged more, I asked them to provide me with an email where I can send all the proven documents with an official stamp of the bank that I was charged more than I was supposed to. It never happened. Very disappointed. I can’t refund the ticket, I can’t have the extra money that I paid back, nothing. Would never recommend anyone to use this company.

Burbank to San Francisco. Zero customer service. Was forced to use 2x do to last minute flights and both experiences were horrible. Forced us to check a bag when originally not notifying us that only one under the seat carry on was allowed. First experience we were on the phone for hours trying to get a flight when we had a international non refundable flight the next day. They refused to give a family member first class when they cancelled their crew due to overworking them. They refused to book him on another flight and as a result we lost 2500 because he could not travel internationally. Never use this airline.  There was plenary of cabin space when we entered the plane however they insisted on charging us to check my tiny luggage. If you want to be screwed over use this airline.

Denver to Los Angeles. I just wanted to sit next to my husband and they changed his seat to the back when we were originally sitting together! I even asked them to make sure we were sitting together before they changed him. We ended up sitting separate because of such incompetent staff! Worst people ever! When I complained they didn’t even care!

commentHeader: I need to vent about this
reviewContent: Chicago to Duluth. Worst experience ever: I normally don’t write reviews but I need to vent about this. The flight to my destination (Chicago) was alright. Not the nicest situation but I was okay with that. However, going back was a complete mess. There was a gigantic winter storm occurring in Minnesota, which was where my return flight was scheduled to go to. I assumed that there would be delays, which there were, but they didn’t inform us of this until after our flight was scheduled so I spent all day at the airport just waiting for my flight to get delayed. At this point they rescheduled it for the next morning, which was dumb because the storm was more than likely not going to be done until 1pm the next day, but because it wasn’t large enough of a delay they weren’t going to supply us with hotel rooms or discounts of any sort. Instead, they offered us cots to sleep on in a hallway of the airport. I, being a broke recently graduated college student, took them up on this offer and I really wish I hadn’t... the cots were stained all over and I guess they couldn’t shut the lights off in the hallway or the loud announcements that shout things like “no smoking in the airport” because those are all very necessary to hear at 2am... so as you can imagine I slept horrible waking up every 20 minutes to one of their announcements. It also didn’t help that the staff wouldn’t stop talking. They didn’t care at all that there were people trying to rest. I wouldn’t have cared if they spoke quietly or shut doors to the rooms they were in, but they were practically yelling while socializing. And to top everything off I was awoken to a lovely “4am wake up call.” That’s literally what they yelled at us as they walked down the hallway and they didn’t even give me a minute to get off my cot until they were standing over me waiting to fold my cot up. So I got up, left, and an hour later at 5am I received a text that my flight was delayed till 1pm. Yep. I slept on a cot for nothing and I now have 8 hours to kill and all I really want is a shower and a bed. Oh and they’ve changed my gate 6 times. Overall, I felt less like a customer and more like a prisoner at this airport.

This is the second time I have had few options to fly a certain route so I ended up with United. I was not pleased about this from the start. As expected, United Airlines dropped the ball yet again. They tell me on the same day as my flight that my flight has been delayed nearly three hours because of a mechanical issue that occurred several hours earlier in the day (without an explanation as to why this translates into a delay in my flight) resulting in my inability to make my connecting flight.  So, they basically say you can fly the next day and offer no form of real compensation for the inconvenience (they never do and will fight tooth and nail not to except perhaps in the form of a voucher for another flight with them). This resulted in wasted money and time on Lyfts to and from the airport and an unnecessary delay in the trip. The smug expression on the lady at the airport's face said everything about how little she cared about the inconvenience this had on a customer. Thanks a lot, United. Whenever someone asks me which airline they should fly, I recommend all of your competitors and recommend specifically that they do not fly United if they can avoid it. You know why? Because United does not care about its customers.

Las Vegas to Los Angeles. Charged for carryon bags, had to check them. We purchased a package ticket, flying to Vegas on Delta (which is a great airline), we were only here for one night so we brought no personal bags and just a SMALL roller bag each. We got to the airport and were told no full sized carry-on bags. Even though my roller bag fits under my seat I guess they qualify any bag with wheels as a full sized carryon. So we had to pay $30 per bag to check each bag. Had I known I would have A) not flown with United because that’s. Scam and B) brought a damn backpack for all my stuff. I will no longer be flying with United. My partner and I are avid travelers and it’s unfortunate to cut an airline out if the repertoire said this to myself every time I fly with United I have a horrible experience. It’s just not worth it. At all.

Denver to Los Angeles. First off I will never ever fly via United Airlines again. My children were 2 and 4 and you had them sitting on opposite sides of the plan away from their mother. Once I began to ask questions about why are my seats like this, a staff told me to be quiet, and that she was trying to fix the situation. Was very rude, not helpful, very cold.

route: Calgary to Rio de Janeiro via Houston
reviewContent: Calgary to Rio de Janeiro via Houston. Literally the worst experience of my life with a Airline. I fly over a 100 segments per year and have come to understand and appreciate the issues of the airline. But it began when the flight I was booked on to Houston was going to be delayed for 4 hours and would cause us to miss our connection. I realize this happens. I called Customer service was I was on line with them for 3 hours and 7 minutes, where they proceeded to let me know that the only option I had was to move my flight by a day and because premium economy was full, I would need to go to regular economy. Twice I was on hold for 40 minutes and I had to call in on a separate line to see if we had been disconnected. I have never never had a worse customer experience in my life, never.

San Francisco to Seattle. I have had horrible experiences with United over the years. Today however was a much better experience. The flight attendants were kind and welcoming. We fly with our 4 kids about 3 times a year. Today is the first time in years they were invited to the flight deck to say hello to the captain. We still managed to take off in time even with a late boarding due to maintenance. If this is how they function as an airline then they have certainly turned the corner on their previous challenges.

Amsterdam to Houston. I have recently flown from the USA to eastern Europe and have flown on a plethora of different flight carriers, but found United to be the least accommodating and the staff was rude. I am a mileage plus card holder and would expect better service to anyone that attends your flights. Hire more respectful flight attendants, they are rude simply for the reason to be rude.

Washington to Charlotte. United airlines has to be the worst airline out of all of the other airlines. I mean, terrible! Staff was bluntly rude. Delay after delay. Just the worst possible airline to use. Unbelievable.

San Francisco to London. Polaris cabin fairly nice, 1-2-1 set up. Had a window seat. FA didn't seem to know where my seat was. Flight left late. Seat reasonably comfortable, food average, drink selection excellent. Flight attendants lethargic and fairly rude. No acknowledgement of my Star Alliance top tier status.

Fayetteville to Seattle via Denver. This was a horrible flight. My seat was like sitting on concrete - incredibly uncomfortable. There was gum all over the chair back in front of me. The staff were incredibly rude and took 30min to complete a simple request. Altogether incredibly disappointing. To top it off the wifi that I paid for did not work and they refused to refund me.

Kahluhi to Denver via Minneapolis. Terrible experience overall. Booked economy class and wasn't allowed to upgrade, even for extra money. Staff very stressed about the "extra" wallet-sized bag I carried onto the plane, in addition to my backpack. Plane from Denver smelled stale. Will spend extra money to avoid United in the future

Chicago to San Antonio. Flight has been pushed back 4 times now from original departure time. Every push back, a new lie as to why they’re running behind. Unacceptable way to do business. Never flying United again if I can help it.

Aruba to Denver via Houston. United has become a complete joke. On original flight, staff were too lazy to pick up the trash more than once during the flight. There was trash in seats and on floor from previous flight, we had no choice but to leave our trash on the plane. Once in Houston they changed our gate at the last minute only to delay the flight for hours to clean plane and to get next flight crew through security. I flew Spirit a year ago and had a better experience. United is nothing more than a budget airline anymore with their new baggage policies and customer satisfaction. Fly Spirit, it is a much better experience for a fraction of the price!

Denver to San Francisco. Worst airline ever. Terrible flight experience. Awful customer service. I will try to never fly United Airlines in the future. I was traveling with my 83 yr old father and the attendants in both Denver and San Francisco were rude and made our flight terrible

Newark to Manchester. Business class check in at Newark is a very poor self service experience - it’s unclear, unhelpful and few staff around to assist. Also travelling business class out of terminal C gives no express lane benefits through security so be prepared for a long queue. From there it improves, the United Polaris lounge is excellent with good food and very comfortable. Showers too. Onto the flight, goodness the aircraft are old. But, they are comfortable and the seats in business are quite good. Food and drinks perfectly acceptable. And ticket cost reasonable. All in all a great option in and out of Manchester to USA which saves on travelling time to London Heathrow for anyone who, like me, is North based.

New Orleans to Denver. If I could give an airline negative stars I would - this is my single worst experience with an airline. First, they're no bags policy on some flights really does put them in the economy airline category. None of their kiosks we're working and there was only two representatives. I was told that I had to check a bag (I had a very small purse) even though it was backpack sized. Then because it was less than an hour before my flight (45 min) they said they couldn't take my bag that they were making me check. I swear that the attendant acted happy about this. I had to book a new flight for my vacation and I will never be flying United again. I'm perfectly capable of saying when I was wrong but the handling and customer service was crazy - they're trying to squeeze every last dime out of customers.

Philadelphia to Houston. This is the absolute worst airline, I have ever flown. I will never fly with this airline again. The customer service is horrible and the staff  gave me false information and do not honor their word for the information given.

route: Tampa to Manila via Chicago / Tokyo
reviewContent: I am a regular customer of United Airlines, and my recent flight in March was in most part enjoyable, with a problem with a delay by weather to start my trip, in turn causing us to miss our connecting flight in Japan, but upon landing, it was announced to the passengers to look for the attendants of your connecting airline to get your rebooked flight ticket with another airline to continue your flight. Along with travel voucher to take us to Tokyo Haneda airport. My wife and I were quite relieved , thinking we would have to stay in Japan and rebook a flight next day (lost time and hassle of trying to reschedule our remaining travel.) UA did a good job of taking care of the passengers on this flight. Our returning flights we received an unexpected upgrade/surprise to be seated in their Economy Premium Plus section, and priority boarding on our last leg. We have flown UA for the last 5 years on international flights and are very satisfied with the service we have received.

I am posting this review after several attempts to resolve my issue with United Airlines. We flew from St. Louis to Denver on March 9. Our return flight on March 14 was canceled due to lack of crew, which was understandable given that a major storm had canceled over 1000 flights the day before. Our luggage, however, was flown on to St. Louis without us on a different plane. There were so many flight cancellations and issues that our first available flight home was 3 days later, on March 17. United refused to compensate us for expenses incurred due to being separated from our bags because we do not fit the typical baggage delay case. If an airline recognizes that compensation is warranted for clothes and toiletries when bags are delayed, should not the same be true when your luggage flies on without you? I will never fly this airline again.

commentHeader: shout out to the gate agents
reviewContent: A shout out to the gate agents working the United desk this morning at Austin Bergstrom, Gate-32. A broken plane seriously disrupted my routing to Manila (Austin, Los Angeles, Honolulu, Guam, Manila). Y The team quickly found me a seat on a DC bound flight with onward routing to Tokyo then Manila - with a slightly earlier arrival time. Great to see awesomeness in action!

Boston to Raleigh via Newark. Reviews are not something I normally write but I feel compelled today 04/03/19. I Flew United and nothing was above a normal flight until my flight to Raleigh. Our flight attendant went above and beyond to make the flight a comfortable experience for everyone. A true professional who deserves to be recognized for their hard work.

Nashville to Reno. Worst experience ever! Flight was delayed for 1.5hr waiting for clearance.  Which happens, I guess. But when we landed no luggage. We were informed that our luggage was on another plane & would not arrive until 3pm. We arrived at 11:30am. We were told that our two luggage would be delivered to the home that we are visiting. They said it would go out for delivery at 5:30pm & we could expect it no later than 9:30 pm & if it was not delivered by 10pm to call back. We went & ate & killed time & call back at 4:30pm asking if it was there yet & could be just come & pick it up. We were told No because everyone had already left for the day in baggage claim. By 10:15 no luggage so we called & they said it was still there & we could expect it in the morning. Well it is now 12:30pm & we still have No luggage & no one seems to know where they are or even care.

We were flying to Orlando through Newark for our wedding and the staff went above and beyond to make our trip wonderful. First of all, they allowed me to put my wedding gown into one of the closets on each flight so it didn’t have to be in the overhead. We had been seated behind one another on the first leg of our trip and a stewardess got another passenger to trade so we could be together. She was truly so kind and took great care of us. The entire staff on that first flight were amazing. We appreciate you guys!

route: Santiago de los Caballeros to Newark
reviewContent: Santiago de los Caballeros to Newark. My last flight with United Airlines was on March 20th 2019. It was horrible, I went in vacation to D.R and went on JetBlue, really nice. However my come back flight was through United Airlines horrible experience. I had a carry on bag and I couldn’t carry my bag with United Airlines I had to pay almost $50 dollars plus 33.50 for my regular size baggage about $84.00 total. The seats are very tight, no TV and to top it off you get a bird size bag size. The worst airline I’ve flew. I will keep this on my mind when buying an air flight ticket in the future.

Springfield to Chicago. I have been flying only this airline for a few of years now, mainly because I’m a member of their frequent flyer program. The experience has been more often then not quite negative. United tends to change gate frequently and a lot of times at the last minute. I have missed two flights because of this and almost just missed a third. Not only do they change gates but they completely fail to alert you about his fact until it’s almost too late and one has only minutes to catch the flight at the other gate. The attendants attitude also is poor and at time down right rude. The seats have hardly enough leg room but I’m am 6’1” so maybe I was just born too talk to be comfortable in airline seats. One of the perks of being a frequent flier member was that you could pick your seats, at least in the economy-section without paying extra. Nowadays if you pick any seat you have to pay extra. Apparently the membership fee is not enough. Bottom line is they are very inconsiderate of their patrons and their staff portrays the companies attitude. If you can afford another airline go to that one, I’m certainly switching who I fly with from now on. The cheaper flight are just not worth the massive headache anymore.

Really ticked off by agent's rudeness. I was booked roundtrip Newark to Houston on a last-minute Basic Economy ticket. First flight was just fine on American, which allows one carry on in the overhead bin (bag maximum dimensions are clearly spelled out on AA's website) and one beneath the seat. Great, as I only had two small bags. Not so great on my return flight home on United. On checking in at UA's Houston/IAH kiosk I realized the airline's impossibly stingy policy that allows only one small bag under the seat - and nothing overhead. Okay, my fault for assuming United's policy was the same as American's. What really burned me though was the downright surly response from UA's customer service agent when I questioned why I had to pay a $30 bag check fee. He was really aggressive - glaring as he shouted "my problem was that I was cheap!" I was insulted, but paid the fee nonetheless. But I'm done with United. We've flown many miles together - too bad United's skies are no longer friendly. From now on I'm happy to stick with better carriers American and Delta.

route: San Jose to Boston via Chicago
reviewContent: I reserved a flight from San Jose to Boston and the initial flight has cramped seat and experienced heavy lower back pain. I struggled till I got down at Chicago. Now I had a second frustrated experience of connecting flight cancellation. They first messaged that the flight is delayed and then cancelled the connecting flight due to technical issues. My total travel plan screwed up and struck in Chicago. I called them later date and asked for a resolution. The representative held me up wating for 20 mins and finally said that he can refund partial amount. I asked him whether he can put me back on my initial departure location and he again held me waiting and spoke to higher authorities and finally said it's possible and we are at the verge of reserving my flight back to location where i started. I opted for seat preference and the guy told me to wait again and came back after couple of minutes and said that they can't make this reservation at all. We had conversation against the assured resolution and finally ended up with no resolution at all. I spoke to the higher supervisor with whom he was talking before and she said that they gave me misinformation providing me with the refund process application. The whole episode lasted an hr on call due to their ignorance of the customer issue and lack of knowledge and professionalism in whatever they do. I ended up missing my flight and appointments sheduled and with total loss of time, money and peace of mind. They don't want to resolve customer issues as far as possible. Their flights are junk. They have no professional knowledgeable staff or Representatives. I will never ever travel again with United Airlines!

Chicago to Spokane. On the flight. All passengers onboard. 8pm Friday night and everyone would just like to be home. Waiting on the runway for late passengers. In 30 years of flying, hundreds of flights, I have never had an airline hold a plane for me - even when on a late connection with the same airline. Who is so special that they hold a flight 30+ minutes for them? The airline either needs to wait for late passengers every time or never. This experience made me want to never fly this airline again - I have a lot of choices.

SeaTac to Houston via Pensacola. Bought economy ticket. Assumed i would not be able to bring a bag on because the overhead bins would have limited space. Ended up having to pay to check my backpack because of dimensions, meanwhile it would have easily fit under the seat in front of me or one of the numerous empty overhead bins. They only didn't want me to be able to bring a bag so they could charge me 30 dollars flat for checking a backpack.. This increased the cost of my ticket by roughly 15 percent. Saw this happen to at least 3/5 of the other people check-in in near me. Added check In time, possibility of missing bag, and pickup time on far end of my flight for no reason. Scam ticket prices for the basic economy so they can attempt to compete with legit airlines on price. Will not be flying with this company again. Their prices are basically false advertising. Feel bad for their customer service employees, cause I'm sure the line level eats all the stress of the CEO/execs eating profits.

Washington to London. Thankfully, on this particular flight United's business class was the new Polaris configuration, which is about 100% better than its pre-historic 8-across business class configurations. So, right off the bat, things were moving in a positive direction. And there were few disappointments. Service was friendly, efficient and pleasant on the flight and on the ground on both sides of the Atlantic. United's arrival lounge in Heathrow is such a nice touch! My only complaint would be that the meal was not up to previous standards I have experienced on United's international business class (even in the pre-historic business class). The pre-packaged meals look and taste as though they are - pre-packaged. Moreover, while upgrading the seating environment, it seems UA has chosen to downgrade some of the amenities. For example, the amenities kit is pretty sparse compared to those previously offered. No more plated meals, no more mimosa carts, no wine tastings, no chocolates.

Rome to Newark. On our flight, we had a school of students flying with us and a couple other difficult guests flying with us. All the flight attendants were lovely but there was pne flight attendant who was with us for our flight out to Italy on March 19th, 2019 was so wonderful. Very accommodating, helpful & really did her best to keep everyone happy & safe. The school kids all kept getting up and having a hangout session throughout the plane during the whole flight. I know everyone around me and my fellow friends flying back home were very displeased with them and how uncontrolled they were by their chaperone. As I imagine most passengers felt on this flight with them. The attendant was very helpful in trying keep the rest of us content and comfortable with our flight and all of them. Hope to see her again on my next flight. Side note: never seen a plane be left in the condition I saw today. No respect for the airline. Or the attendants for that matter from a few of the students.

Dallas to Cleveland. The cabin was not clean and I was dismayed to see that the air intake was dirty and possibly had mold or mildew on it. The flight was fine otherwise despite having some repairs needed, the captain’s oxygen mask had to be replaced causing a delay and the engine to run the airplane on the ground was broken so they had to wait to start the main engines at the gate to taxi. Nothing to cause any worry about safety.

Tampa to Chicago O'Hare. Started getting texts early morning for a slight delay after 6 throughout 7 hours our flight delayed 5 hours and all they offered were free snacks. Our entire day was wasted sitting in Tampa airport waiting for a plane to show up. Their customer service desk was less than helpful and sympathetic.

San Francisco to Papeete. Paid for premium economy for extra 500 dollars round trip for more leg room and narrow uncomfortable seats for 9 hours. Food was terrible. United airlines needs to improve long haul flights, crew services seat comfort to compete with the likes of air New Zealand, Qantas and similar long haul carriers. We are retired and travel a lot, are very leery to use United airlines in the future for such a long flight to most anywhere in the world. Very sad level of crew service, aircraft seat comfort, quality of food services and similar.

route: Cozumel to Oklahoma City via Houston
reviewContent: Cozumel to Oklahoma City via Houston. This airline is horrible. The measly amount I spend on travel isn’t a drop in the bucket to these people and it shows! They know that people have to fly and we don’t have all that many options and they take advantage of that. We were trying to get home to OKC from Cozumel and on our way to the airport from our resort I receive a text that our flight was delayed one hour..ok, no big deal. Get to the airport and I proceed to get three more texts just adding more and more delay time. We end up sitting in the tiny Cozumel airport for 5 hours. Finally get on the plane and the flight attendant is condescending and rude. I asked for headphones and she said “no..I’ve already been up and down this aisle asking 3 times”. That’s untrue, she asked 1 time and I said no because I didn’t realize I’d be able to watch the movie, I thought I would have to pay extra to watch. When I realized I was going to be able to watch, that’s when I asked for headphones. I did it politely and still she spoke to me as though I was a child. We get to Houston and the plane stopped, people thought we were at the gate and proceeded to stand (many people were desperately trying to catch connection..us included), come to find out we were not actually at gate (there wasn’t one available because we were so late) flight attendant comes on speaker and begins to berate those standing up. I get it, it’s a safety issue but a courteous please sit back down, we’re not at a gate would have sufficed. Again, she was condescending, spoke to all of us as if we were idiots. So we ended up sitting on the runway for 20-30 minutes or so and we did indeed miss our connecting flight. We went to customer service (we had already asked to be put on standby for the last flight of the night for OKC) just to be told the later flight was overbooked and we had a slim chance of getting on..my husband had looked on the app and it showed they had three open seats. Told by customer service something along the lines of “those are seats blocked off by travel agents for potential customers”? And to make matters worse, that all flights were full until 9:30 pm the next night! Putting us in Houston for over 24 hours. So apparently customers who have already paid aren’t as important and customers who might possibly book in the future? Makes no sense! I tried to tell them we needed to get home as we have jobs and kids and I was completely out of blood pressure medication. At that point I just wanted to rent a car and drive the 8 hours home. Asked about reimbursement for having to rent a car, it was a no-go. So we crossed our fingers and went to wait and see if we got on on standby (oh I failed to mention, this flight was delayed as well). We got the last two standby seats thank god, however the plane was very old, very uncomfortable and something kept banging under my feet. Needless to say I’m glad it was just an hour home. I’ve never been so glad to have my feet on the ground. I will be using another airline from now on and will suggest all my friends and family do the same. I understand sometimes delays are inevitable (this wasn’t weather related, we were never told what was going on) but the lack of customer service after the fact and the rudeness of the flight attendants is enough to turn me completely off of United.

Customer service is mediocre. Staff through and through were rude and not helpful at all. Don't ask any questions; if you need to do so, better to ask the stranger next to you. I'm sure not everybody working there is like that, but there's such a negative air provided there.

Worst experience ever! 9 hour flight and offered two glasses of water and one ounce of pretzels. For $1400 you would think that in nine hours you would get a meal. But the bigger problem was the return flight from Maui to Chicago on United flight 348. The flight got canceled due to mechanical problems. No hydraulics, I get that, you cannot fly then. But these things happen and there should be protocol in place. 300 + people stood in lines for hours trying to find their luggage, trying to book a new flight or trying to get vouchers. After 90 minutes in line 3, the voucher line, she finally starts handing them out, only to run out of vouchers after three passengers. The luggage line after 2 hours hadn’t moved hardly any people. Three reps from United had absolutely no clue what to do. People who had to stay overnight and needed to retrieve their luggage were sent on a wild goose chase all over the airport. Three hours after the flight was supposed to have left, the agents at the check in gates, overwhelmed and utterly confused, finally started, with three baggage claim checks at a time, disappeared for 15-30 minutes at a time to retrieve 3 bags. It took forever. It was so poorly handled! These mechanical failures can happen but these people should have been kind, apologetic, professional and above all helpful. They were not. A bad situation became out of control and every guest left (some are still there!) frustrated. We are in Maui, so another night is no heartbreak, but $10 vouchers for meals, seriously!

Houston to Baton rouge. Had an hour delay out of my control and it put me 16 hours behind, the airline would not help me with a room or food. Even though I paid for all of the insurance possible. Now I am sleeping in a chair by myself all night worried some one will still my bags. Worst airline ever. Very unsafe for a solo traveler.

Denver to Honolulu. United gets a lot of bad reviews but honestly when it comes down to it they are amazing. I was flying with my choir when I got stuck in the huge Denver snowstorm that caused DIA to cancel all fights and closed most roads in Colorado. United jump into action with everyone working really hard to get all passengers to their destinations as quickly as possible. Even getting my entire choir on a flight the next day. And when most of their passengers had to sleep on the airport floor due to the road closures, United provided re-usable water bottles with small toiletries (things like deodorant, toothpaste, a small tooth brush, ect.) inside.
