They also gave out United blankets to help keep everyone warm inside of the cold airport. One United women even brought my group games to play while we were stuck. They made the whole process as stress free as they could for us, and even thought they were stressed everyone seemed to be a good mood.

This has been the worst experience ever! First our flight was delayed which could’ve been ok however when we landed in Houston we literally had 45 minutes to catch our flight. After going through customs then getting in a line one of the reps told us to get out of line to get in another, once in that line the rep there told us we were suppose to stay in the line we just got out of. Once we’ve made it to our gate which was C40 we were told that they already booked us for another flight even though our flight haven’t left yet. So we had to speed walk all the way back to the other end of the airport to gate E. I’m typing this as I am walking to the gate, hopefully we won’t miss this one. Ok, now we are here at gate E3 and the rep here is saying we need paper work which the attendant at gate C took!  No one here is on the same accord!

route: Orlando to San Luis Obispo via San Francisco
reviewContent: Orlando to San Luis Obispo via San Francisco . I have traveled approximately 600K miles in my lifetime, and have recently avoided United because of all their negative customer service evaluations and beaches in the past. Now we have more limited options to travel into the destinations that we visit and chose to give United another chance... well big mistake. Weather delayed our departure 4 hours going into SF, which can happen, but the pilot came on the intercom and suggested; those that would like to deplane could do so, but the gate agent refused to allow that to happen, unless you wanted to give up your seat. Nobody from United would speak to any of the passengers to discuss alternative travel option, even though the pilot said that would happen - it was chaos. Needless to say we missed our connection, albeit by only 30 minutes, so we slept at the airport and boarded our rescheduled flight at 7:30 the next morning. This United flight is now delayed because we are waiting for travelers to be able to make the flight because of their delays, yet the night before they chose to leave many passengers behind, and it was the last flight out to SBP. The wait for us night before would have been less than this morning flight delay, and this morning's passengers had many flight options through out the day to get into SBP. I can also say that there was only one agent for United that was respectful and decent dealing with their customers during this period of time, it was disgusting. We tried United again but they failed miserably. Delta and Southwest here we come!!

route: Las Vegas to Orlando via Houston
reviewContent: Las Vegas to Orlando via Houston . Arrived airport at Vegas to catch 12 pm flight. It was delayed 3 times. Finally at 5pm left Vegas to Houston. We missed our connecting flights due to delays. Next morning to catch 7:30 flight Orlando arrived airport at 5am. Only two hours sleep. This 7:30 flight delayed twice already. Still not sure when will reach my home. United reps and service desk are not helpful at all. This is the worst airline in terms of reliability and customer service. I will cancel my membership.

Buffalo to Newark. My husbands luggage was lost and our next stop was to a different country. We have flown many different airlines and never have encountered this issue. We were not the only ones filing a missing luggage report either, with the airline. The flight attendants were okay too. I've seen way less attitude come from flight attendants

Los Angeles to Houston. I’ve never experienced such a rude flight attendant. She proceeded to give me the wrong direction as to where I sat. Then yelled at me when I had to turn around and find my seat. Not only was I embarrassed but I felt like I was being talked to like a child. Then she proceeded to give incorrect directions to boarding passengers and made them feel dumb as well. I will never fly with United Airlines again. After being out of the United States for a year I was welcomed back home by a horrible flying experience.

route: Detroit to Chicago via La Guardia
reviewContent: Detroit to Chicago via La Guardia. Great experience. Check in was smooth and fast, no charges for the 3rd bag as star gold member. Lounge in LGA offers nice coffee and seats. Flight on time with a nice breakfast. United has real first class seats for first and business class. Ongoing flight to final destination DTW on time. Luggage delivery quick, I can recommend United.

My boyfriend dropped myself & my 2 kids (11&3) off on Tuesday evening. We are from door county & it took 3.5 hours to get there. My car was running when bf helped us with our bags, and then he left. Long story short, I had my keys & he was stranded 20 mins away because it’s a push to start car & it turned off when he stopped. I asked customer service if there was anyway I could get my keys to the front or lost and found so he could take an Uber to come get them. They said there was literally nothing they could do unless I went back outside and started the whole process over. I said he isn’t here he has to find a way here. They said because he wasn’t a customer & they didn’t know him there was no way to get them to him. I said I could give you a picture, a name, a social, anything. They said “you could fed ex them” I said he is stranded at a McDonald’s while I have my keys 3.5 hours from home. They just kept saying we’re sorry there is nothing we can do. I think this was complete BS. How can someone just not walk to the lost and found where he could pick them up? They wanted me to go back outside to bring them to him, but he was 20 mins away. All in all, I think there was something someone could have done & because of this I will never fly United again.

Seattle to New York. With jetblue I had a small carry on bag for free, with United your standard carry on I have to pay extra 30 bucks. Greed all over this company if you fly United just go with your street clothing. Would never fly United again.

I have had nothing but problems with United from start to finish. My flight was cancelled going out from Honolulu (not the worst place to be stuck) so had to get a new flight. I had to call to find out my flight was cancelled. No email or courtesy call. When checking into my flight at the airport the lady there was nice but other than that, I would give the flight attendants a zero star rating if I could. I asked for a refill on water and got nothing but attitude and an eye roll. Also, they were super rude about the wifi and simple questions asked throughout my flight. Landing was awful.

route: London to Phoenix via San Francisco
reviewContent: London to Phoenix via San Francisco. I would not recommend this airline to anyone, my flight from San Francisco to Phoenix was cancelled due to weather conditions which I understand there is no control at all. But I at the airport for an additional 16.5 hours, I didn't get any accommodation or food vouchers as that isn't part of their terms, I got a discount voucher but they didn't know how much the discount would be for. I was told to go to the shuttle buses and ask which one takes me to the airport hotels, when I found out it would cost $300/£220 for the night, I went back to the airport to try and find somewhere to go or see instead of pointing me in the directions I was told to look it up on mobile phone and follow my google maps. I ended up being forced to stay in the airport until my next flight was leaving I had no food or water as I only had my English bank card on me and my bank would of locked my account. I was travelling alone they had no sympathy and i felt nothing could be done i didn't know what to do. Overall I believe they could have done more and should have done more to help me.

63 years old, always have 2 or 3 drinks and spend the extra to fly first class so I do to have to pull out a credit cards to pay. I am also 6 ft 4 so I like the legroom. Was just told by the stewardess that I would need to wait an hour as I had had 2 drinks. Flying from Denver to Los Cabos. Seriously quiet and composed. A new low.

Horrendous! No wonder United has such terrible reputation! I was demanded to check in my carry on piece (it's called carry-on for a reason!) and was charged $30 for it - and it was an international flight! When I boarded the plane, there were plenty of room in overhead compartments. In fact, I've never seen so much empty spaces before! The airline claims it speeds up boarding process (for my $30?). Probably. But after they closed the gate, we stood on runway for an hour and a half. Getting to airport, passing security is already stressful enough, do they have to add to aggregation? Customer service line had 16 people, in 10 minutes I was waiting no one moved, except 3 passengers who gave up and left.

Sydney to Houston. I had the longest flight I've taken and I had a wonderful time. The crew were so pleasant and nice and the food was tasty. The seats were comfortable and the entertainment selections were awesome. What's more is that they were able to get my husband on the same itinerary as me when, originally, he was not on my flight because we booked his flight with points. All we had to pay was a $75 change fee. It made the flight home so much better. They even were able to get us seats next to each other! I've flown United for a while and they have always been very accommodating and I want to give my sincerest thanks for a wonderful trip.

This is the second time in one month that I have had a horrible experience with United and how they run their business. I understand when things go unexpected, but when there is no one to help you, willing to help you and just plain terrible customer service, it makes everything worse. United employees tend to have no clue what is going on and half of them are simply rude. I experienced employees cursing out customers, walking away from customers and straight up leaving customers on their own to "figure it out." Fortunately I was one of the few that was able to get a hotel voucher for my night I spent stuck in Chicago, however when asking how to get there they told me the wrong information for a shuttle or where I needed to go. When I finally got to my destination the next day, I went to pick up my bags in Milwaukee and of course no one was able to be found at the United desk. When asking another airline where I might go to find someone, they replied, "I am not sure they are never here, I would try to ask ticketing."

Houston to Detroit. On this United Airlines flight which I normally don't take, my seat was for 24b but there were a group of guy's that wanted to sit together and asked if I would mind switching seats with them so I did. The problem came when I thought I heard something announced about complimentary drinks and snacks will soon be given to the passenger's. When they begin to pass out the drinks and snacks, I watched as the people behind me and in front of me was given these items and not me, but the stewardess looked me in the face twice but didn't offer me anything. So I stopped her and asked her if I missed something, she said no but asked me if I wanted something to drink as I perceived it to mean to purchase a drink and I said no. So I stopped the other stewardess and said the same thing to her and added was the complimentary for certain assigned seats or people and she said no its for everyone - "did you want something to drink" again I was asked when other passengers have more than water, now I'm stewing because she told me that she served those behind me and in front of me and then going to say maybe you were asleep, how can you say that when you're looking me in the face. -It took everything in me to hold my peace.

Newark to Austin. The worst check-in process I've ever experienced and I fly regularly. After leaving vehicle in economy at 5:40am and arriving at the terminal (C) by 6a, I had to find my way to a kiosk through the chaotic crowd which I was not sure if I needed to wait in the line or not. If I didn’t force my way to a kiosk and ask the United associate, I wouldn’t have no what process I was expected to follow. Then forced to pay for my bag ($30 now) which was of carry on size because I’ve carried on many other flights (see pic of exact similar carry on bags other passengers were able to bring on without paying). I just do not understand when my bag is the same size as all the other passenger bags, I am asked to check in and pay! Then I had to determine that I needed to wait in a line to check my bag, to find out half way through waiting (20 min now), I needed to wait in a bag drop lines and that was the security line. I know what people are thinking, duh dude, but as chaotic as the terminal was it was unclear what was where because you couldn’t see through the crowds. If they had united associates announcing the procedures for everyone instead of having to be asked, it would have been easier for me. I had to seek out help to figure out what to do and announcing myself to other passengers to avoid the same headache I had for their sakes. Then I get into the security line again (45min) which extended the length of the terminal (C) then to follow, another line for the security checks (at least 25 mins). I barely had time to go to the restroom before walking to my terminal to see my flight boarding (flight departed at 7:30a). Absurd! What you had created today was unnecessary stress for your passengers and I will never fly United again after my return. I just cannot do the frequent headaches and added stress I deal with on nearly every one of my flights.

Amsterdam Schipol to Chicago O’Hare with United Airlines. The usual horrible service and unhelpful staff on this flight. Just asked for some headphones and was told they can’t hand them out until we’re in the air. When I asked why was told that it’s for safety reasons. This despite everyone in the aircraft wearing headphones whilst I’m having this conversation. It’s exhuasting having these nonsensical conversations with United staff. They can never give you a valid reason for any of their unhelpful behavior. It’s like a game where they have to make the flight as miserable as possible for their passengers.

I am so disappointed with United. They canceled our original flight, had us on hold for almost 2 hours (during our vacation), and offered no accommodation. They wanted us to pay over 1000 dollars to get us on a different flight. We finally settled on flying out later, but United did not help with hotel fares, rental car, and any grievance they have caused. They simply did not want to help. We left to go back home 2 days later and had to scramble to figure things out. The people on the phone did not address our concerns. They then proceeded to send us texts about how we should look into changing our flight again. I called them back and again, over an hour wait time just to speak to someone unhelpful. The flight itself did not have screens for entertainment or a meal the way most 4+ hour flights do. United told us last minute right before we took off that we could download the app to get entertainment. Well, after the longest boarding process ever, it seemed pretty rude to let us know right before we take off that in order to get entertainment, we had to download things. They should have let everyone know before hand. The lack of communication, help, and uncomfortable seats have made United the worst flying experience I ever had. Do not fly with them!

Newark to Dublin. As a traveler I would never go through United Airlines after this ridiculous planning. Not only did they have us sit in the plane for almost 4 hours. They gave out one small water to everyone in that time. No one got to even buy beverages or snacks. Did I mention they didnt even have a pilot to fly the plane? Thank you all so much for wasted over 4 hours out of everyone's trip as well as 3 more hours from MSP airport to Newark. Save your money and your time!

Eugene to Denver. United now has a class called Basic Economy which is one class below Economy. You can not check In online under basic economy unless you check luggage for $30 each flight. This policy makes for long lines at the ticketing counter due to those who use to not check bags as a time saver. The long lines at the ticketing counter makes it so United does not have enough manpower to check in customers that use to bypass the line causing new added congestion. I have flown 11 flights with United in the past 2 months therefore I am deciding to avoid United until they change the policy to speed up my travel plans in the future.

My flight out of Vail, CO was cancelled the night before because of the blizzard that came thru the state. Working with Expedia and United, I was able to have my flight changed to Aspen. Unfortunately, my flight was cancelled another 4 times because of weather. Finally, all airports were shut down for the rest of the day. I was notified about each cancellation. I started out making changes on the app. But, once the airports were closed, it became too complicated to do that way and I needed to speak to an agent. I spoke with someone, on the phone, who was very emphatic to me and did whatever she could to help me. Since I was so close to the Aspen airport, I decided to go in and speak with an agent in person to make the changes. The man I spoke with was so helpful. I was switching from date to date, around to different airports, and went thru a lot of times. He had no problem spending as much time with me as I needed. He was also able to accommodate whenever I needed to change it to. This was a frustrating and exhausting 12 hours that was made much easier by everyone that I dealt with. Weather is out of everyone's control but, it feels so much better with the help I received.

United Airlines has provided me with the most affordable ticket to visit my partner twice now. The staff have always been so friendly, and professional. The food is on par with any other airline food I've eaten. I experienced one delay on my trips which was caused by a thunder storm, and I fully appreciate that staff must be kept safe, and nothing could've prevented it. The cheap seats aren't great for sleeping though, so bring a nice neck pillow on a long haul.

San Francisco to Portland. The only thing United's wifi is good for is writing a bad review. They have terrible inflight entertainment because they expect you to pay $10.99 for barely any workable internet connection and require you download a plug in to enjoy movies/tv but make it absolutely impossible to find. So then you're stuck with no entertainment options at an unfair rate. To put in perspective, that's more expensive than my monthly Netflix fee. In addition, unlike other generous airlines, they require you pay for absolutely everything. You might think you are getting a bargain flight, but when checking out, you are required to pay extra if you want to sit with your family, extra if you want a carry-on rather than offering it complimentary, and they charge you for everything else offered on the plane. Surprised they don't have someone waiting outside the door demanding money for toilet paper. Bottom line, it is worth paying a bit more upfront to fly with a different airline than being surprised halfway through your trip when the expenses add up and you're feeling more and more agitated by the second. Cheers and don't fly United.

Newark to Orlando. Flight attendant was very rude. He wanted my husband and I to pull up our seats for take off and he didn't even ask politely. It was like he was talking to 2 kids. "Come on come on pull up your seats" while he made hand gestures that are used for toddlers. He got even louder to attract an audience. Flew many times and the flight attendants were always so polite but this attendant today, I think he woke up on the wrong side of the bed. There are a lot of kids on this flight and maybe he was aggitated because of the kids. Worst experience ever. Please coach him.

Tampa to Calgary via Denver. Recently; my 3 boys, and I, plus our 2 dogs flew with United. The flight we booked was to travel home to Alberta after missing the ticketing timeline with westjet at baggage & ticket kiosk by less than 15 minutes, they refused to check our bags assuming we couldnt possibly get through security in time. As such we were not issued our boarding passes. So we took the cheapest flight I could find for the next day, with United. (Which was surprisingly reasonable.) There was issue when we first flew out of Tampa, and had to land in Houston and change plains. Once in Houston we were delayed maybe 2 hours, due to weather and we weren't the only travelers being detained because of the winter weather happening in Denver. When we finally arrived in Denver, we had missed our connecting flight and it kinda just gets longer from there due to so many travelers in similar situations. It wasnt pleasant nor was it really avoidable, and despite the several hundreds of people rerouted or detained - I can't thank United for their empathetic response throughout the venture and their commitment to customer service. From the booking and getting my dogs their boarding pass, to rescheduling both in person the first time, to calling and requesting a second choice to have us home a little sooner over the phone, United was cordial and apologetic and more than accommodating. It was an inconvenient couple of days and some issues resulted from the rebooking confusion that were human error, but put right with as much haste as they could. I had insurance for my original flight - and they dismissed me immediately and I tried to communicate with westjet at the time we were to travel on their flight and was rudely told, "be on time next time." (Which seems bs, since that plain departed 45 minutes late.) Extra thanks to Donna who dealt with following up on any grievances or issues she could help with after we arrived home. I very much appreciate everyone's extra effort on our behalf, knowing we were not the only ones in the same situation. Our flight home was short and sweet and we were as comfortable as we would have been on any other Express flight.

route: Cabo San Lucas to La Guardia via Houston
reviewContent: Cabo San Lucas to La Guardia via Houston. This is the worst airline ever. The lines were miles long at Newark just to go through TSA. We were a group of 8. Airport staff had to assist us in skipping the line just to make our flight that was boarding in ten minutes. We were literally on a 2 hour line. Our flight was empty because 80% of the passengers missed the flight. On our way back home, we left Cabo and arrived to Houston to connect to get to NYC. Once again Bs! The flight landed and we were on the tarmac for a while waiting for space. People were telling the flight attendants to make a announcement to let the people that have connecting flights off first. They made the announcement last minute, and it didn’t help because once again everyone missed their flights. There was a long line to get a receipt for customs. Then we had to get our bags and recheck them. Houston’s airport needs a AirTran because we ran for miles just to reach our gate. Of course the flight left everyone behind. There’s was only one flight leaving back to Newark. Only two people from my party of 8 was able to fly standby. 80 percent of our flight had to stay the night in Houston. I’ve never seen anything like this before. I would rather fly with Spirit or Southwest! You get to the airport hours before and still miss your flight. I have no idea why they would book connecting flight that they know,  there’s no way possible you can make the connecting flight. How can you make it from one flight to the next and make it through long lines and tsa/get bags/recheck bags/run miles to your gate.

Portland to San Francisco. I was very disappointed the Basic fare did not include standard carryons, and I had to pay extra $30 and had to be check in only and not able to bring on the plane. Other airlines basic fares still include carryons as always. But United decided to wanna be like Frontier. I will avoid flying with United again and would advise others to do the same.

Houston to Orange County. Put us on plane to wait over an hour for crew. Why put us on plane only to sit without a/c? Ridiculous. The stewardesses were clueless and couldn’t give us updates. Disappointing for sure.

route: Cincinnati to San Antonio via Chicago
reviewContent: Cincinnati to San Antonio via Chicago. United delayed flight from Chicago to Austin by 5 hrs for vessel repairs. United customer service at Chicago was not helpful at all to help arrange another flight. I had an appointment to see a medical specialist and had to reschedule Medical specialist appointment. United Poor maintenance and inspection practices cost will cost me nearly $500 for addition hotel charges, rental car charges, and flight modification charges. United airlines made no offer of attempt to rectify the situation. I will not use United airlines in the future. I can understand sometimes delay issues arise in the airline business, however United Airlines customer service failures should not be overlooked.

route: Los Angeles to Richmond via Chicago
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Richmond via Chicago. I should have read the reviews before booking the flight. Pretty much Everything I read has happened to me on this one flight. Late takeoff causing missed connection, very rude gate attendant, while in Chicago the gate was changed three times. It’s been a total nightmare. I will Never fly on United ever again. I’d rather pay more money for another airline than fly on United again. It is just that bad.
Raleigh to Chicago. Flight was to leave at 12:30 and it’s 4:45 and we are still waiting. Not sure if we will make our connecting flight and employees don’t seem to care. I am very disappointed.

Fort Lauderdale to Newark. The delay on this flight was unconscionable. The First Class food choices were awful and on this flight the second choice was not even available. Economy passengers were allowed to use the First Class restroom which limited their accessibility and it is something First Class passengers pay more for. This is a recurring theme on this route.

Edmonton to Panama via Houston. Fantastic flight and service. Thank you. Our flights going to Panama and the return to Edmonton Ab Canada were great. Service at Panama and Houston Airports were wonderful. My wheel chair and "pushers" were prompt and courteous. Thanks again for a safe and enjoyable flight.

Las Vegas to Baltimore Washington. I can't say enough good things about the customer service I received on United Airlines. As a mother traveling alone with a Special Needs child and a child who had gotten injured at a soccer tournament the staff at United Airlines went above and beyond. I cant tell you what a relief it was to have their support. Thank you to the staff. I would fly United anytime.

route: Frankfurt to Greenville SC via Washington Dulles
commentHeader: not be flying with United again
reviewContent: I have been flying from Frankfurt to Greenville over Washington. My flight to Greenville had a 3+ hour delay and was then cancelled an hour before the flight due to “weather”. First of all the weather is fine so that’s inaccurate but i’m not an expert on that so i guess i can’t really judge that. However customer service at the Washington Dulles airport was rude and dismissive and couldn’t give me basic information on driving distances. I had to look it up myself and i feel that this is inadequate at best. They would not give me an overnight stay so i had to rebook my flight over to Columbia SC which is a great inconvenience for me and my ride. I will not be flying with United again, since they have proved to not be worth my money.

Detroit to Newark. The incompetence of this company is staggering. Kept us on a flight for an hour and a half trying to fix the plane instead of just putting us on a different plane. Deplaned us and scattered us everywhere to try and rebook flights. I rebooked my flight and didn’t get to the counter before the loaded everyone. By the time I got my bag switched over (they have to manually do it through radio instead of having an electronic system) they overloaded the plane and I missed that flight as well. Finally I had to rebook again on 2 connections having me traveling the entire day! Then to top it off, they give me food coupons that weren’t even accepted by McDonald’s! Unbelievable.

commentHeader: First and last time on United
reviewContent: Washington to Newark. First and last time on United. I purchased a basic economy ticket. If only I had known. When I went to check in for my return flight tomorrow, I was given an option of getting a voucher if I took a later flight. I would have taken a later flight, as something has come up where I'm visiting, but it would have to have been a bit later than the three flight options presented. I then made the mistake of calling customer service to see if they would help. It only made me more aggravated. You see, even though they have extra seats on the flight I would have gladly taken to free up my seat on their overbooked flight, I was told not only would I not be able to do that, I would be charged a bunch more money - I'd mention the amount here, but I could not hear the supervisor and she seemed annoyed when I asked her to repeat what she said. (I was calling from a good landline, not sure what they use over at UA). I don't envy those customer service reps. I would not want to be representing UA. I have since Googled about them and their customer service and business practices seem to be lacking, to put it mildly.

Denver to Tokyo. Requested for window or Aisle seat. It’s ok to have them say No to me. But staff were very rude and they don’t want even help, although they got seats. They said I need to pay additional $230 for purchasing the seat and price is ridiculou.

50 min to check luggage. Long lines, first needed to get ticket then wait in 2nd long line to hand over bag. 1 person checking in. Plane delayed. Flight attendants rude to those "in the back". Attendant at boarding also rude. Did not get regular status but found it online. Pilot was nice and tried to be accommodating. Had to pay extra to sit next to my husband.

Washington to Columbia. United is by far the worst carrier I have ever flown and done business with. Over the past 15 yrs they have screwed our flights on every occasion! From missing flights to losing our bags for over a year. We have limited opportunity because of the small airport we fly out of. We will drive to a major hub in Charlotte to avoid this airline going forward. I highly encourage anyone looking to fly to avoide United Airlines as well.

commentHeader: See you, United Airlines, never again
reviewContent: QRO - Queretero, Mexico - to IAH Houston Texas - 2 hour flight seated in a United Arlines - Embraer 175 operated by Mesa Airlines. The seats had 0 - zero - padding and likened itself to sitting on a wooden church pew. I am not exaggerating. Literally no padding. If one inch (1") of padding was added to each seat, the plane would lose 2 rows of seats (8 seats) for that flight segment. Corporate greed couldn't be worse (of course it could be, but you get my point). See you, United Airlines, never again.

Today I flew from Newark NJ to Fort Myers Fl with my five year old. Since I bought my tickets late my daughter and I sat in different aisles. The Flight Attendant Sumará was beyond helpful and gave my daughter extraordinary service by keeping her entertained throughout the flight. I am truly grateful and happy and would recommend this airline to anyone specially families with children. United airlines hires the best customer friendly staff. I will always fly United!

I was flying from New Orleans to New York at 330pm and 3 Uunited pilots showed up 3+ hours late “due to traffic” (although everyone else arrived with out an issue for their flight). As you could imagine, lots of people to miss their connecting flights. When I called to get a new flight home I was told there weren’t any to take me to New York until the following day at 2pm. I had to stay in a hotel and was not given my luggage. The United staff I talked to about my hotel fought with each other for 15 mins before helping the customers and then when I got to the counter the lady “helping me” answered a phone call from her son on her cell phone and proceeded to talk to him while I stood there at 11pm waiting for a hotel voucher. The next day the weather was bad and the 2pm, 5pm and 930om were all cancelled. When I finally got home I was told by United that my flight would be refund to my card in 7-10 business day. When it wasn’t I called and wrote numerous online complaints. I was then told that I couldn’t be refunded because the flight was used. I told them I was supposed to be refunded and no one cared and I’m fact they were rude to me when I became upset. Then I was told they would give me a $100 voucher through email in 5 business days but AGAIN I have not received it.  They don’t care about your time or your business. I fly very often and the customer service is the worst I’ve ever experienced.

New York to San Francisco. After my experience with luggage check-in today, I will not fly with United Airlines if possible. 70% of the UA Staff have no compassion to anyone. Mainly rude, impolite, impatient, made personal judgement before asking and high ego. This is my overall experiences after flying with United Airlines. I am giving my comment based on comparing with my regular airlines like Air Canada, Cathy Pacific, British Airways, Lufthansa and Condor Air. Sometimes, I wonder is this part of the training of United Airlines by offering this type of customer experience or it was simply the culture of UA.

Norfolk to Vail. I’ve been waiting for 27+ hours now because our flight has gotten delayed a number of times due to what they claim are weather related reasons. Meanwhile all other planes have gotten to their destination of Vail. However, they graciously offered us snacks for our troubles despite our hundreds of dollars in hotel fees and meals. Overall, United Airlines is terrible, you should not fly United.

Never flying United Airlines again. I recently took a trip from North Dakota to Brisbane and back. United managed to ruin over 60% of my flights. It started on my 2nd flight on the way there. The aircraft was delayed for almost 3 hours and did not take off until it should have been landing in San Francisco. Not only that we as customers were given different reasons as to the delays. One said too much rain for 1.5 hours of the delay and the other said too much wind for the other 1.5 hour delay. Landed in San Francisco the ground was barely wet and there was no wind at all. Get off the plane to the overhead pagers telling us that they are going to close the door for the connecting flight to Auckland NZ, mind you 35 passengers were on the plane late from Denver. Plane gets into NZ late miss my connection and have to sit in NZ for 6 hours until the next flight leaves for Brisbane. Return trip stuck in Denver again. Flight crew lied to passengers said it was weather related when in reality they were out of hours. Given 6 hours in a hotel room to sleep and then back to the airport for the flight to be cancelled yet again. Crew blamed weather and that was a lie. The aircraft they were flying was not the proper aircraft to land on the runway in ND as it had no revers thrusters. Same aircraft as the night before so they lied about twice to their customers. Customer Service desk in Denver was not helpful at all. Had to catch a flight out that night to Bismarck which is 3 hours away from home when I should've been flying into Williston 45 mins away. Land in Bismarck and my luggage was sent to Williston and not moved over onto the proper plane. 3 hour drive back from Bismarck and my luggage should've been delivered to my door and yet it was not. Had to make the delivery company deliver it that night like I had informed Williston United personnel that it needed to be. Had to wait almost an extra 2 hours for my luggage to be delivered when it is a 45 minute drive thanks to slow and lazy delivery service. Wrote to Customer Care and they offered me a lousy 300 dollar flight voucher. They offer up to 1k dollar flight vouchers when they over book a plane yet 300 dollars is acceptable to them after wasting 30 plus hours of a paying customers life?? United has 100 percent lost my business and I will make sure I inform everyone I know to choose other Airlines. I am writing this so that if anyone considering flying United Reads this to be aware and to stay away from them as they will Lie to you without issues and they will do absolutely nothing to make things right when they provide horrible service and cause you to be late getting to and from your destinations. They simply do not care as a Corporation about their Customer base.
Austin to Chicago. My 1st flight was delayed and I missed my connecting flight. Ticket agent in Austin on return flight was very rude. Don’t plan to fly United again if I can avoid it.

Austin to Washington. I was harassed on 3 different occasions by 3 different United employees to check the size of my bag. At the 3rd time I made the comment that this is ridiculous and was told because I purchased a basic economy ticket that I would probably continue to be harassed until actually on board the aircraft and also said if I still didn’t like it that she could call a supervisor if needed. I fly first class to Hawaii twice a year and have never been talked to or treated like that ever by an airline strictly based on the status of my ticket. United Airlines you just lost my business forever. If you could treat people like lower class citizens solely based on the class of ticket then you don’t deserve my business or anyone else’s.

Houston to Los Angeles. Very poor leg room. Snacks? Can they spare the Tiny bag of infant sized pretzels? Lol I’d be embarrassed to pass them out. My flight was 3 plus hours. What happened to In flight entertainment? Plane had no TVs! They offer free entertainment, what happens if you Have no device?

Denver to Bismarck . United Airlines is the absolute worst airline to fly out of regional airport. Our departure flights were cancelled and we transferred to American Airlines who did a great job getting us to our destination in comfort. However, we ended up getting to Cancun at 1:30 am. We had a great vacation- but unfortunately flew United back. The crew from Cancun were quite rude and when we got to Denver we were delayed again! We paid a bunch of money to this airline and the delays and service is a joke! Go with another airline!

Houston to Cancun. I booked my reservation 3 months in advance with seat assignments (2 aisle seats across from each other). United oversold the flight and reassigned our seats to be middle seats, 7 rows from each other. This is totally unacceptable to us and we told the lady that. She said that it’s the best she could do like she was doing us a favor. What a joke on us. Avoid this airline if you can, they don’t care about people.

Houston to New York. Thank you to the kindness of United Airlines employees. On February 13 at 2pm the woman (who was on the VIP line), helped me with respect and kindness and the whole staff at United was great. I was on my 3 month MD Anderson Cancer Center treatment trip. I always fly in on a Tues and leave the next day (Wed) for medical treatments. There is a lot of stress involved with this quarterly trip and I will not go into that. In any event, I was in my Uber on my way back from MD Anderson to the airport and I had to call United because I was having an error checking in online. I actually was taking the trip to NYC instead of Rochester because the flights were to high and because of my medical situation, I am limited financially and need to be very frugal about my trips for my treatments. So I decided it would be cheaper to fly into NYC, vist the night with a friend and take the train the next day! In my call to United from my Uber, we realized that I had booked the trip back home on March 13th instead of Feb 13th. I had never noticed the error. The United employee on the phone said she could book me for a later flight that day but it would be $700 additional dollars on top of my flight. (I purchased the flight insurance because of fear of problems but since the error was on my end, I'm sure I wouldn't have been helped by the insurance.) In any event, I told her I would just talk to someone when I got the airport but she did say they wouldn't do any better!. I was beyond stressed as with the whole medical situation and having to travel alone and the cost the quarterly trips take with hotels and travel etc. I went to talk to the United employee who was at the Airport and when I started to explain what happened, I just lost it. I went to pieces. And I am the type of person who never cries in front of anyone, let alone in a public place.I couldn't even explain what happened I was too upset. In any event, I was treated professional and so kindly at the United desk. This woman and her manger (not sure who was either) really helped me. They worked something out for me and I was able to take the same flight that I thought I was booked on and it just so happened it was somewhat delayed so the timing was perfect. I can't express how much that helped me that day and how much I appreciate how I was treated!!!Thank you United Airlines! If cost permits, I will stay loyal to your airline because of how decently I was treated.

Horrible airline. Choose because best deal on Orbitz, didn't read fine print that my ticket didn't allow a carry on bag so had to pay an additional $60. First leg was delayed over 2hrs because their plane broke down, had to get another plane. Missed my connection and will arrive 5 hours later than scheduled. Will never fly United again.

route: Manchester–Boston to Palm Beach via Newark
reviewContent: Manchester–Boston to Palm Beach via Newark. I was surprisingly impressed with United! It was my first time flying with them, but I have to say it was a great experience. My flight to Newark was small and packed, but the flight attendants made it comfortable. Our connecting flight to Palm Beach was delayed (by 4 minutes) which really wasn’t too bad, only the last minute gate change all across the airport. Once we finally boarded and took off, the flight attendants were extremely nice and kind, and it made me anxiety of flying completely disappear. Also, the Boeing had TVs, I was not expecting that! Snacks could be more varied, but I don’t usually eat on planes anyway. We got to our destination on time, and safely, and that’s all that matters.

Washington to Denver. We always choose United over Spirit because of the allowance of Carry on bags. We're not sure this basic economy vs regular economy is new but it does not allow carry on bags. Which caused a lot of confusion. We trying to change our seating to regular economy at the front counter they said they could not from there area but to try at the boarding gate. We get to the boarding gate and we were told it's 130 for 2 carry on size bags rather than the 60 it would have been out front! We were a bit upset and ready to say forget United from now on but the gate representative did some serious service recovery. She was patient and kind. From now on we will always check our bags in the front and be sure to not get basic economy. We will fly United again. Thank you .

commentHeader: my small backpack was too large
reviewContent: Newark to Ft Lauderdale. I got to the airport and was barraided by the airline staff  who insisted my small backpack was too large to be considered a carry on. I won’t fly this airline again. Ended up having to pay for my small backpack, which never is considered on any other airline to be a checked bag.

Memphis to Houston. I had a 4 hour delay which I waited patiently then they scheduled me for another flight connecting in IAH. When we boarded they plane we had another 1.5 delay. So now I will miss my connecting flight and won't be able to get to LAX until the morning. This is ridiculous. I will never fly United Airlines again.

Simply the worst airline experience in my lifetime, and I have been flying for 62 years. No crew ready to take over flight from Denver to St. George, resulting in delays, resulting in cancelled flight due to weather that could have been avoided by having a crew available to stay on time. This resulted in 19 hours overnight in airport. Next flight to Phoenix, we were sent back and forth to gates 3 different times - again, late flight resulting in running to change terminals in Phoenix to change airlines - made it by 3 minutes. UNITED, your behavior is inexcusable!! I got to my destination a day and a half later. I can hardly wait to see how my return trip goes tomorrow.

route: Williston to Los Angeles via Denver
reviewContent: Williston to Los Angeles via Denver. We were 30 minutes late leaving and when arrived in Denver we waited on the runway for at least 30 more minutes. When finally exiting the plane we were already late for our connecting flight. We were then rebooked on a later flight and not the next available flight. We were showing to arrive at LAX around 3PM, which is the last boarding time for our cruise that was departing at 4PM. Nathan at gate B44 on February 23rd. Did a very good job at keeping me calm and getting us on the earlier flight. I appreciate him very much for his prompt professional attitude when my attitude wasn’t so good. As for the rebooking process, they should rebook to the next available. Maybe the circumstances were not what I was thinking.

Denver to Portland. Had my flight out of Denver canceled last night. Granted, they were getting snow, but the other airlines we’re getting flights off. After sitting on the runway for 2 hrs, they taxied back to let us sit at the gate for an hour before they let us off. The flight was now Saturday at 9:30 Had to traverse the entire Concourse twice because they changed gates, only to be delayed again. No weather. They are having maintenance issues with the plane ahead of us. Not anywhere near the first time I’ve had problems with them.

Boarded plane and waiting for a quick de-ice so we can get underway, storm expected in Omaha. Crew pulls back to gate and re-opens to let late passengers on. Then pull back out, now snowing heavy in CO and we have to go through a full de-ice. Huge delays and very frustrating. Especially, since we rushed once from a connecting flight and they had just closed the gate. Plane was still there but we were told it is against Federal Regulations to open the door once it is closed. Guess we were lied to. Flight prior to this one was to ATL for SuperBowl, due to engine trouble we had to wait a til the next day to fly and missed out on some events. No accommodations made, just “nothing we can do”. I am done flying United. Fix your customer service, and if you have issues accommodate passengers or find them flights on other airlines and by all means with inclement weather make good decisions. Do not delay and put people at further risk.

Denver to Chicago. United bumped me from the flight on the way to the check in terminal. No one at the airport helped it was all directed to a red phone. Called on the phone they switched to a late flight and couldn’t get any compensation. No miles, no seats nothing. Travel on business every week. Will never use United again!

Vail to Phoenix. I just wanted to give a huge thanks to the ladies at gate 7/8 in Vail. My first flight was delayed meaning I would be cutting it close and quite possibly missing my connection. They went and looked through all other flights and found something and rescheduled it for me. Thank you again for making it an easy change.

route: Tampa to Green Bay via Chicago
reviewContent: Tampa to Green Bay via Chicago. Where do I even start? First in the line at Tampa a question was asked if any military dependents were flying, yes was the answer so we waited with a giant flashing red light while staff looked at us and continued to ignore us and help even others who had come way after us, only to find out that because the military member wasn’t flying it didn’t matter. So we waited for nothing and why is that even a question? Then when printing my ticket the United Employee who had ignored us the whole time grabs the baggage stickers and sets them aside by someone else’s luggage! Luckily my fiancé noticed and got the attention of a different employee and she apologized for the other employee and put our stickers on in front of us. The flight attendants leaving Tampa were nice at least. We arrive in Chicago, our connecting flight, which we had an hour, but was cut short due to the plane waiting forever, (we as in myself and my 6.5 month old) I change his diaper and put him him the carrier and follow all the signs located in what looks like an area only United flights are...the signs lead me to another security line. Why am I doing this again when I’m trying to catch a connecting flight? The answer the United employee gave me was that I followed the wrong signs.  So here I have to go through this again and at this point my plane boards in 10 minutes and I still have to go through security again just to get to the plane. The TSA lady saw I was in distress and helped me as she asked how long I had. Made it to the plane just in time. Again, the flight attendant was very nice. Get to Green Bay, get off the plane and go to the baggage claim where everyone waited almost an hour before bags even started coming. Guess what? Mine are no where in site (one bag and a car seat). Go to the United Ticketing area and no one was there, multiple people at the other airlines and none at the one I needed. Another employee said she was probably in the back and points to the door, we go and look, I see my bags, no employee. Finally a different flight line employee goes and gets her and she comes out rudely as if I’m disturbing her. Get my bags and I’m finally on my way to my destination. I guess since my bags had a car seat they kept them elsewhere, but failed to tell me that? This did not happen when I flew American. But it doesn’t end there. Apparently United chose my bag, the one with the car seat, to go through. Broke a few of my things and some of the bathroom items were out of the bags they were put in to prevent any leaking. My stuff was all messed up and I know they went through them because they left a card saying they did. I'm dreading flying back with them.

route: Honolulu to Los Angeles via Boston
reviewContent: Honolulu to Los Angeles via Boston. I have used United services before and I had OK experience. This time was different. Honolulu to Los Angeles: there was no media device on the plane. Overall this is a flight over 5 hours - media device was something expected by all passengers. Couple of the flight attendants were very rude - I understand it's not very easy to work with so many people during a flight but being polite is still part of the service Los Angeles to Boston : this time the flight attendants were super sweet and polite but my negative opinion is based on one of the united rules that I was not familiar with : I ordered glass of prosecco (aware of the fact that I will pay for it ) and I was told that Prosecco could be served only if you are in 1st class! So if you are not flying 1st class you can only order and pay for a glass of chardonnay or cabernet. This might sound silly but what kind of a policy is that. You can't purchase something that is already for sale, because you do not belong to 1st class?

Charlotte to Washington. Very bad customer service, delayed my flight my flight supposed to leave 6:25 am,  I drove 5 hours from where I live to the airport, when I got to the airport they told me my flight was delayed. I told them I have international connection flight, they told me they don’t care I ask for the manager to talk to her regarding this issue, she’s not even trying to talk to me. I’m very upset they make me miss my flight, make me stay at hotel at my own cost. Never fly with this airline again.

Flew Fort Lauderdale to San Francisco with United Airlines. My worst flight ever. Very old plane recline and old seat. No TV or entertainment system. Very poor breakfast, very bad service on board. Impossible to relax or work on board.

Chicago to Nashville. Terrible airline. If you value your time do not use United because they could care less about your time. My last 5 flights with United have had 2 cancellations, and 6 delays. Whether it’s maintenance checks or a pilot has not arrived yet they always inconvenience there customers. You pay them in full before you get a ticket then they never give you what you pay for. Never again for me.
Cleveland to Newark. Worst service ever. Crammed an entire sold full plane into a small bus after waiting 20 minutes outside to Get luggage in 20 degrees weather. Rude people.

I fly a lot on this airline since it has direct flights to Denver and California, places I frequent. Because of the amount of flying I do, I have a Priority status. On several of my flights this year, entertainment was accessed only via the app on a cell phone. However, the connectivity did not work nor did the plug-ins for power to run a mobile phone or laptop. My last flight was to Denver on a ski trip. Even with my ski and duffle bags marked "priority", it took two hours from landing to get my bags. My impression is that UA baggage is understaffed (and also underpaid) where customer service is critical. Counter agents were pleasant enough, constantly apologizing for the delays. I am seriously considering changing my carrier selection. I have had enough.

Portland to Newark. I booked a flight for my daughter to come to visit during her school break. She's 17. They canceled the flight for some mysterious ATC delays that only seemed to affect United, because I was able to book another flight immediately to get my daughter here. Still inconvenienced by 1 night by the way. United tried to book her on a flight 2 days later. Most ridiculous thing I've heard of. Altogether different, but I always said after that video came out of United personnel removing that man forcibly from the plane. that I shouldn't book flights on United anymore. Now I have more of a personal reason. Weather is fine, but couldn't somehow find a way to get my daughter here until 2 days later. No thank you. Not acceptable when other airlines are operating in the same airport with multiple flights and not affected by the mysterious ATC conditions.

Why is it every time I'm stuck flying United the flights are ridiculously late. This time, flight 712, EWR to CLE. The departure time scheduled 6:14PM, there were at least 4 changed to the departure time with the flight finally leaving EWR at 10:12 pm. The airport staff were indifferent, no offer of anything, not that I expected much after the last United flight (out of EWR) that we were on. They held us on the plane at the gate for over 2.5 hours before starting to let people off, then telling us "wait, stay on the plane we were ready to depart", then spending another hour at the gate before finally pushing back. United, you wont get a third chance.

route: Hong Kong to Orlando via Chicago
reviewContent: As with all budget airlines the staff treat customers poorly. This was disgusting from the booking process. I am a high status star alliance member. But get treated poorly from beginning to end. Their website is a broken mess. I was absolutely unable to make the booking on the website. So I ring in. The price immediately goes up. They force me to do a currency conversion. But then just up the price. And charge me in USD at a higher price. Then I have to pay international fees anyway. But they don't charge me once. 8 times on this one flight I have now had. And the person messes up the booking so bad I have had to make many many phone calls to try fix it. I almost missed the flight because of incompetence of the check in staff. And again I am high status star alliance. So was at the premium check in desk. Came within minutes of missing the flight because of staff incompetence. Didn't get lounge access. Gate staff were surly and uncommunicative. I was trying to find out when the flight would actually take off. To go buy food or visit the toilet. Absolutely unsuccessful. Not bording star alliance customers with United star alliance customers. Entertainment system was broken. Power plug was broken. I paid extra for this SMH charging for services and not rendering. The flight was so late I almost missed my connection. There was absolutely no support from staff to assist me getting to my next flight. Missed the lounge again Same issues at gate. Staff just don't care. With the previous issues I had really hoped to go buy some food and visit a toilet. All of this was quite a way to go. So I sat at the gate. Broken seat. Extremely uncomfortable seat. Broken entertainment. The food. If you could call it that. Was disgusting. It really is the worst food I have seen on international flight. Couldn't even get a snack. I really enjoyed 30 hours without food and barely a toilet Break. United used to be the best. But are now the very worst.

Burbank to San Francisco. For some time now, I have avoided flying United airlines to San Francisco due to their consistent delays. Unfortunately, due to a last-minute change in my schedule, I was forced to change my outbound flight from Burbank to San Francisco, and was stuck with United and their lousy service and small Express airplanes. Thankfully, I was able to keep my JetBlue return flight. I arrived at the airport only to find that the flight was, of course, delayed by an hour. Now I sit here watching the departure time change again and again — and not towards the positive. I once again resolve to never again fly this lousy airline.

Los Angeles to Denver. I really didn't appreciate that I had to pay for my bags and there was only one personal item was allowed to be taken. The lady told me to put my purse inside my bag pack, so essential I am taking two personal items except now they are heavier so I have to hurt to my back and shoulders so it follows this ridiculous rule of United airlines. Customer service was not good, the way my ticket was printed, it showed my husband's name on both tickets. The guy who checked our boarding pass was extremely rude and made us feel stupid for the way our tickets were printed on the check in computers. Once we got to the gate a part of the seating area was closed and there weren't enough sits for people. There is no lounge that allowes individuals with platinum American Express to use it. The boarding was suppose to begin at 12:25PM and we are still at the gate waiting. Will never travel with United again.

Kentucky to Halifax via Newark. There was no flight crew available for our 6:00 am departure so we were delayed until 8:00 am causing us to miss our connection in Newark which meant instead of arriving in Halifax at our scheduled time of 1:06 pm we would not arrive in Halifax until 10:52 pm. No flight crew, who takes care of the scheduling? Poor performance, not the first time!

Denver to Dayton. Was not able to get a boarding pass until we got to the airport since we did not check bags and we're flying economy. Very inconvenient. They appear to not believe Travelers regarding luggage size. The plane was delayed more than an hour due to maintenance. The part had to be flown in. This should not be since Denver is a major United hub. The gate agent appeared surly. I would like to avoid flying United in the future if possible.

Los Angeles to Honolulu. Traveling with my wife for leisure, a very rude female at the entrance of the airplane checking the boarding pass, people approaching her for questions and clarifications and she kept on turning them down in a very rude and harsh way rolling her eyes all around as if she doesn’t like the fact that people are asking her questions. The other guy who was assigning the seats kind of he had the same temper and reactions. We were the first there waiting for our seats to be assigned. Checked with the agent and being told just wait and will call you. Flight no. UA1158 scheduled at 8:10, we got called at 7:55 to be informed that we will have 2 separate seats!!! That’s ridiculous and poor organization. You can tell from the people talking around no one is happy from the service in general. People were just going with the flow as there is nothing else to do. Never with United again.

commentHeader: suck every single penny out of you
reviewContent: San Francisco to Chicago. I have never encountered a company that wants to suck every single penny out of you, I couldn’t bring carry-on so had to pay to check a bag each way. I was late because of traffic but still before the flight and they told me it was too late to check my bag so they forced me to pay 75$ to get on the next flight or his exact words “just make the bag smaller”. I’m sorry I can’t just make things magically smaller.

commentHeader: scam you out of $55 at the gate
reviewContent: Fort Lauderdale to Washington DC. Basic Economy: Beware! Even if your bag fits under the seat, the box the airline uses to verify the size of your luggage is smaller than the area under the seat, and United will try to scam you out of $55 at the gate and force you to gate-check your bag -- even if the United attendant at the counter issues you a boarding pass, and has no problem with your bag. That is probably because they only charge $30 at the counter if you decide to check your bag then- but squeeze an additional $25 out of you for any bag they force you to check at the gate. I was stopped halfway down the breezeway, after the gate attendant had already scanned my boarding pass and told me to have a good flight. I was ready to throw away my belongings before I would allow United to scam me out $55. Fortunately, the attendant eventually let me board with my small backpack. I had already spent $17 to UPS some of my belongings home, so my luggage contained even less than when I had flown TO my destination. That was also Basic Economy on United -- and neither the counter attendant nor the gate attendant had had any issue with my backpack for that flight. I will never again fly United. Other airlines have Basic Economy -- but those rules are much less restrictive and those carriers do not treat their passengers nearly as poorly. United treats you like chattel. Also: my ticket was not even inexpensive!!! I had already paid more than I usually do for a ticket to Fort Lauderdale, which was why I had decided not to upgrade from Basic Economy or pay extra for luggage. Expensive ticket, very little luggage allowance, no choice of seat, and terrible treatment by the airline employees in the airport.

Memphis to Vancouver via Chicago. This is just one incident of many that have made me believe this is the worst airlin. Delays, long lines, rude hostesses, and 45min+ wait ties on calls and pulling teeth for legit refunds. Not to mention their non-existent inflight entertainment app is a joke that never works and when it does, feels like it was developed by a 12 year old in a basement, it's that horrible. These guys have made me miss holidays, family events, and so much more. I am sworn to never fly United again. I don't care if I have 3 connections and it takes 3x as long, I will never put myself through the pain and suffering of flying this miserable excuse of an airline.

Cancun to San Francisco. The absolute worst airline I have ever flown. I booked these flights months ago and have literally had nothing but problems since. To start out after well over twelve hours between on the phone and Facebook messenger (because god forbid they actually respond on the post they send you a private message to try and resolve. After all this time they said they had everything fixed then when we go to finally start our vacation they changed seats on my wife and I and we were no longer together (oh yeah and they were no help again) next flight was fine from Houston the Cancún. Leaving Cancún to San Francisco they told us to just keep our Duty Free with us that they didn’t need it. Upon arriving to San Francisco we are told we have to collect our bags and recheck them - and we have to be able to fit 4 bottles of alcohol in 1 checked bag that was already over stuffed. (United also charges for every checked back so no I know why, they get to make another 50.00 for an additional checked bag), after being sent to several different representatives by United personnel we ended up 30 minutes later back to the same one who gladly checked another bag (at that wonderful charge) My United Mileage Plus card will be cancelled tomorrow. United Airlines is absolutely horrible, they will take more and more and give the consumer less each time. Oh by the way Cancún to San Francisco left at almost 6:00 p.m. and was 6 hours they didn’t even offer a snack. Avoid them at all cost look around there are much better airlines.

Dulles to Plattsburgh. There were issues with the plane to Plattsburgh NY when arriving on flight from Orlando. We had to wait 5 hours for mechanics to arrive from Detroit. I would think being located in the nation's capital you would have mechanics on site. I'll pass on flying United in the future.

commentHeader: flight attendants did a good job
reviewContent: Sydney to Houston. I was told that I could use either the Singapore or Air New Zealand Lounge. I chose the Singapore Lounge and enjoyed the bacon and eggs and Champagne at 9:45 am. The Business cabin seating is 2-2-2, which makes sleeping on one's side and back comfortable but very tight when sleeping on my front. There was an excellent selection of movies to chose from. The salad was very small and no food was served for a good eleven hours--just lunch after takeoff and breakfast before landing. I would suggest more options in the galley. The fasten seatbelt sign came on many times during the flight with the recorded announcement, "please fasten your seatbelt." I was really happy that they did not make announcements in a second or third language which can make sleeping with United very difficult. The flight attendants did a good job and had a sense of humor but it was an older crew. The flight arrived 20 minutes late so I only had 40 minutes go through Immigration and Customs, claim my suitcase, go through security and transfer from Terminal E to Terminal C for my next flight to Orlando, but I boarded with Group 5 and made the flight.

route: Las Vegas to Rochester via Washington DC
commentHeader: worst airline I have ever seen
reviewContent: Las Vegas to Rochester via Washington DC. I have never seen some thing like this in my life. They have changed the flight schedule 6 times so far (I’m still at the airport and still there is a possibility for another change). At the beginning departure from DC was at 8:25 am then changed respectively to 10:00 am, 12:20, 12:40, again 12:20, 12:45 and finally 1:30pm and God knows if they are gonna change it again or not because right now the time is 1:35pm and they have not announced any thing for boarding yet. I think United is the worst airline I have ever seen. This is my last flight with United ever(if it happens at all)

Chicago to Kansas city. Given a chance would rate 0 for this airline. I had many bad experiences with this airlines but today was the worst till date. I had an email/text saying that they might experience delays and I called customer service for alternate options and nothing seemed to workout and so I decided to cancel the flight and go ahead with some other options available and they said they won’t refund until they cancel the flight and they gave me the worst options and made me stay at the airport for almost 12 hours transferring here and there almost 5 times delaying all my plans planned ahead

route: Cleveland to New Orleans via Houston
reviewContent: My flight was scheduled to leave at 6:30am from Cleveland. We sat on the airplane for 2 1/2 hours with incorrect and misleading updates coming every 30 minutes. We were told that the airplane needed an oil change and that we would only be delayed 30 minutes. After missing my connecting flight I went to customer service and was told if I hurry I can make it to the flight that was still boarding to make it to my destination. Was turned away at the gate saying they didn’t make accommodations for everyone on my previous flight. When I expressed that I was directed to that gate from customer service I was told that the previous person was mistaken and I was going to have to wait until 2:45. Putting me at my final destination 5 hours behind schedule. Making me miss my ride and events planned ahead of time. Board and crew were nice on the first flight but all of the misscommunication between what was going on while we sat on the tarmac and once getting to the Houston airport was awful.

commentHeader: bad luck of flying with United
reviewContent: Oklahoma City to Washington. Today I had the seemingly bad luck of flying with United.  After getting to the airport I found out my flight was cancelled. Once I found out I went to the nearest United ticket counter but on the way ran into a gate agent who said "you should have known the flight was cancelled since 1pm." I responded sorry I was at work I didn't know.  She tells me her plane is arriving which wasn't at the gate refused to help and does a slight jog to the gate and tells me to go back through security to the ticket desk.  Once I get to ticketing outside of security the agent simply keeps repeating that "flight is cancelled due to weather".  She reluctantly says after me asking repeatedly what does that mean, that I have to get myself a hotel for the night. She doesn't offer me any kind of information on how or who to call. She just ask if i was from there and I said no. After I ask another agent what does this mean she hands me a pink form with number and how to get a hotel. I then go back through security and once I look at the board I see a flight that will get me out of OKC with these very unhelpful United Employees. I call customer service and they rebook me on the IAH flight so I can get out of OKC and guess whose gate it is... The gate agent who says she was so busy even though the plane had not arrived and was being very dismissive The agent on the phone checked me in and I had them on speaker phone. I explained that to her and she goes policy is we can't let you on the flight because it's too close to departure. The same lady that told me I should have known in our previous encounter says says "you should have called earlier." I emphatically explain how when I'm checked in already and I'm on the phone with a United Employee. He was on speakerphone "are they not letting you board? You are checked in." She again says no and to talk to her supervisor and points. She says it's policy but then reluctantly walks over and let's me board as if she was doing me a favor.  Apparently policy didn't matter then and I wish the ordeal stopped there. When I get on the plane all of the bins are closed so I ask where can I put my bag. As far as I am concerned it could have been checked. The flight attendant gives me a bewildered how do I know look and ask what seat I'm in. It really didnt matter when I'm one of the last people on the plane and all bins are closed.  I go to my seat and open multiple bins only for her to to walk back and open one bin that has room and wasn't by my seat.

Houston to Ft Lauderdale. I booked a flight for myself and my wife 3 months out. I Upgraded to first class for an additional 400 dollars each ticket. I called back a week later to change my flight because our accommodations cancelled. They claimed that prices had changed and wanted to refund me $128.00 per ticket to go back to economy class instead of crediting me the S400 I paid per ticket. They also said that if i wanted to change the dates there would be a $200 dollar per ticket change fee plus an additional $200 dollars per ticket to get the same first class tickets one week later. This airline should be investigated for the outrageous practices they employ!

route: Los Angeles to Arcata via San Francisco
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Arcata via San Francisco. Return trip miserable. Rerouted three times, all delayed. Luggage sent to wrong airport despite my checking on it three times with Baggage Claim and gate reps. 7 hours late. Never ever again.

I was travelling with United to Denver International from London Heathrow. Cabin Crew were extremely unprofessional, they dropped a couple of items from my dinner tray as well as cutlery. Discourteous and non considerate at all. They didn’t apologise and left me picking the items up. As well as this they locked the dimmable windows from when I boarded the plane and after multiple requests from myself and others they finally unlocked the windows so people could look out. It seemed as if they didn’t know how to use the equipment and the Cabin Crews Customer Service was horrendous.

Kuna to Los Angeles. I have never experienced any worse airline customer service in my life. Nasty over the phone, nasty at the airport, nasty everywhere. One gets the feeling that they have special training for customers to be nasty to their customers. I honestly do not understand how they stay in business but most likely not enough competition yet!

route: San Antonio to Toronto via Chicago
reviewContent: San Antonio to Toronto via Chicago. All of our carry-on luggage was taken and put in checked baggage. An hour after the plane lands and the carousel is still not moving! Very frustrating. Will really think twice about using United. Flew down on Air Canada and it was 100x better experience.

London to Newark. Before our flight we read mostly bad reviews about United. We did not know what to expect but were much surprised when great staff, food, quality and service were offered to us. We rate it 9.5/10 because of a small delay on one of our 6 flights. Great experience, smooth without single problem, even the delay thing was solved easily and we caught our connecting flight.

Newark to Mumbai, delayed for over 13 hours. They said we cannot get hold of communication department, ll they said we are still waiting from 730to 1145 At 1140pm; our flight was canceled, by the time they arranged our accommodation and we got our hotel it was 145 am. Then we needed to be at the airport at 7am for boarding. For our flight at 9am It’s 820 am, someone announced saying that the cleaning crew just going to clean the aircraft then flight crew will go in and check safety related. They had all night and early morning to do this.

Milwaukee to Chicago via Springfield. Absolutely ridiculous. Flew out on Sunday from Springfield to Milwaukee with connecting flight in Chicago. Springfield was okay got right on and departed on time. Landed in Chicago, turned on my cell reception to immediately get a text stating my flight had been cancelled due to it needing repairs and to re book the next flight. No other flight we're available that day and I had to be where I was going by 8am the next day. So I was forced to take a bus to the Milwaukee airport. United could've provided a voucher or something instead of me having to come out of pocket to take that bus. Fast forward 6 days to the following Saturday. Trying to get back home leaving Milwaukee was no big deal. Landed I. Chicago and waited my 2 hour layover just to be announced over and over and over flight delayed due to plane needing repairs. This went on for about 4 hours. They wound up switching all of us to another plane. Finally get boarded and boom. Have to sit on the plane for almost an hour for them to repair a marker light on this plane. Not any compensation was offered for any inconveniences. Not even a complimentary adult beverage in flight. I'll never fly with United again. I'll stick to American. Their planes are newer and better maintained.

Denver to Honolulu.  I made the mistake of booking United. This airline is great at treating you like a second class sub human - and that was only my check in! Not to mention the bait and switch on carryon fees. It’s now Spirit Airlines quality but without discount pricing and with extra abuse.

Phoenix to Rochester. I travelled for the first time with a new born and a toddler and I was amazed by the help and support of the staff in Rochester MN airport and PHX airport. They were very friendly and supportive even helped us pushing the stroller and carry one of our bags. In terms of seats they were flexible and helped us as a family be comfortable. A family friendly airline.

I booked this ticket exactly a week ago. The app told me it was a 92% that the plane is on time. So of course I get to Houston just to find out the plane is late due to maintenance. I purposely chose this flight because it landed at 3 and i worked at 5. But now my flight does not arrive in TPA until 4. So now I do not have a ride and the Uber home is 45$. I have already paid 354.82$ with no carry on just so I could get out of the airport quickly. The ladies at the desk in Houston were so rude asking me why I am questioning them and they do not provide ground transportation. I contacted customer service only for her to tell me file the claim and they will get back to me in 7 days. After this I went to the customer service desk located in section C in the Houston airport. The gentleman there was the kindest and reassured me I would get reimbursed for something because it’s a plane issue which means it’s United fault but I cannot handle the situation until I get to Tampa. So now my options are a 45$ Uber or I have no way of getting home. As I walk the hallways I see signs saying United #1 in on time departures and then I get to the website and see there are so many complaints about flight delays and not because of weather. Save your sanity do not fly United. Thanks for nothing United.

Duluth to Orlando via Chicago. I've just spent 145 minutes on the phone with United. I paid $30 to check my bag on the way down. United flight cancelled and paid another $30 to check it with Delta. Checked in for my flight home this morning and paid $30 to check my bag. Arrange new flight home, baggage fee does not transfer. So in essence,  $120 to check one bag. Never again with United! Not sure what is so complex about transferring that payment over to a new flight. Agent kept telling me I'll be getting a refund, that doesn't help me now in getting my bag home.

route: Philadelphia to Rapid City via Denver
reviewContent: Philadelphia to Rapid City via Denver. We took only a carry on, no checked luggage to avoid unnecessary delays at the airport. Upon boarding the aircraft they took our carry-on as they said the overhead compartments were full. Once the aircraft was fully boarded, we were told there is a delay while they service the front strut on the plane. During the flight the WiFi didn't work. We arrived in Denver late and had to run through the airport to catch our next flight to Rapid City. We were to late to board, but they said it doesn't matter as the flight was going to be canceled for bad weather.
