When the flight was canceled we decided to drive to Rapid City, we requested our carry-on luggage which we should of had with us if but United took it from us. It took United Airlines 3 hours and 15 minutes to get the luggage from the canceled flight to the claim area. The staff was rude and uncaring, they said it can take up to 4 hours. Not 1 United employee apologized in any way for the canceled flight or the delay in retrieving our luggage. We paid $328.80 per ticket and United Airlines gave us a measly $101.94 back as a refund, for a flight they never provided. United Airlines service is terrible and they will rip you off! All appeals just fell on deaf ears.. F- The only thing they got right is we landed safely in Denver Colorado, half way to our destination.

Montreal to New York. The worst airline ever. Flights departure was at 8pm 25th January. I was surprised with a delay of 2 hours, then they added 2 more hours! I wanted to cancel my flight, I asked at the airport, they said you can cancel and reimburse. I spoke with an agent at flighthub.com and he insured that i will receive the complete amount! After 2 days i called for follow up and united refuse to reimburse me.

New Orleans to Chicago. My flight got cancelled due to weather which wasn’t so bad. Definitely understandable. But where I am annoyed is that they automatically transferred the flight to a flight to Houston. I specifically asked the bag check to not put my bag on that flight seeing as though I decided to stay another night and try a flight the next day - but they went ahead and sent my luggage to Houston anyways. And said they couldn’t send it back, that it would be sent to Chicago. So I’m stranded here with none of my things, I’m pregnant, and this is just flat out unacceptable. I will never fly United again. Also, tried calling someone to talk but was on hold for over 45 minutes so I have to resort to this. And lastly your planes are so uncomfortable, a measly 1hr and 45min plane ride was dreadful. My flight on the way to New Orleans was also delayed 3 hours! How can you operate and treat your customers like this?

Chicago to Tampa. Weather can be a significant challenge when flying. We arrived early for our 5.50 pm flight out of O'Hare to Tampa, and saw a 2.25 pm flight traveling the same route. We checked with a desk agent as to whether getting on that flight might be an option, and she kindly did a quick check to see if there were any seats. She told us we might have a good chance to get on but we needed to hurry to the gate where the flight was scheduled to load. It was quite a hike but we made it to the 2.25 pm flight gate. The first staff member we met seemed confused about our request, but we had received an email from United indicating that fees were not being charged to change flights due to weather so he eventually put us on Stand-By. While he was working on the Stand-By tickets, we struck up a conversation with the supervisor of the desk - and that's what impressed us. She was very cordial and gracious. She kindly asked us to give her a few minutes to see what she could work out and in a couple of minutes she called us up and had two tickets, and noted she was able to find two seats together for us on the flight. Her level of professionalism was unusual. The change of flights went well. The flight was fine.

Early evening departure from Narita on Dreamliner (B787-800). Upgraded 2 days before to Economy plus seats. Boarding was efficient, and we departed on time. Economy plus seats gave additional legroom, and this was much appreciated. The 3-3-3 configuration is a little cramped width-wise, you just have to hope that your fellow passengers are on the petite size. Seats were equipped with headrests, but no foot-rests. Blankets and pillow provided, and earphones. IFE was pretty good - sharp, touch screen, reasonable selection of movies and TV shows and even an eclectic relaxation channel. Downside was audio - no selectable tracks, just a series of themed audio tracks which meant you just have to leave it on and wait for songs to appear. Food choices ranged from tolerable to OK, basically it's calories to sustain you. Crew ranged from relatively indifferent to briskly efficient. The Dreamliner made it a little more tolerable, with reduced noise levels even in economy. The biggest downside was that despite the adequate legroom, I found it really hard to get comfortable in the chairs - I can't explain it. Perhaps a combination of thin padding and/or compressed width? At the end, it was a flight to be endured rather than enjoyed, but perhaps that is a good outcome for a United flight.

route: Las Vegas to Richmond via Denver
reviewContent: My flight from Vegas was delayed due to the weather conditions in Denver according to the pilot. Okay I was fine with that because If the weather is bad for arriving planes then it would be bad for departing planes as well I thought logically. Was delayed an hour because I got to Denver at 9:44am instead of 8:52am but when I got here my connecting flight had left. Leaving me to wait in the airport until 5:20pm and getting home at 12am. I am very upset because I wanted to change my flight to leave on the 27th but couldn’t and now I’m stuck not to mention the reason for the delay was incorrect so that United has no liability because it was not due to medical reason. You have my money and now satisfaction isn’t important unless I pay more. Never will I chose United again better off flying with Spirit at least you can expect certain service for the price.

route: San Francisco to Buffalo via Chicago
commentHeader: forced to check a carry on
reviewContent: San Francisco to Buffalo via Chicago. First- I was charged $30 and forced to check a carry on. You can only bring a small bag that fits under your seat- backpack type size. People that were boarding with say a purse and a shoulder bag were spoken to rudely about it and forced to put purse inside bag in front of a camera? Ticket taker said to next guy who had one small bag “I see you read the memo.” And they laughed. So demeaning and unnecessary. This was boarding in San Francisco 35 minutes late btw. People were going to miss connecting flights - but the women with a purse that clearly would fit in her other bag were the important issue. I get to Chicago, find my gate- Grateful I only have 40 minutes to sit. About 15 minutes before scheduled boarding the attendant informs us there is a 2 hour delay due to the fact that the plane is not functioning or something like that. Not sure he could have shown less interest. I know - don’t shoot the messenger- but this was 7:15 am, I’m sure everyone had been traveling as I had, and now needed to find some awful airport food to get through the new timeline. We all carefully choose flights to minimize this wasted time.  I don’t think people really care until they are affected. The flight from SFO was full. United will continue to do this.

commentHeader: status continues to fade in value
reviewContent: I made a horrible rookie mistake. Thinking that a Boeing 787 would have the appropriate number if business class seats vs economy. Bad move on my part. Back of the bus with plenty of seats. Business class has only 36 total. My $2000 refundable one way ticket with a Global upgrade and 100K status for 16 years with 2.7 million miles flown doesn't even get me close to the top of the upgrade list. Hugely disappointing and United status continues to fade in value as has been happening since the Continental merger. Once I hit my 3 million miles lifetime for 100K status lifetime I'll be switching to Delta.

Punta Cana to Chicago. This return was so much better compared to our outgoing flight. This time the crew we dealt with were smiling, friendly and attentive. They served a meal which was quite good actually, them came by twice more during this 4.5 hour flight offering cookies and snacks. All in all they acted very professionally and we appreciated that. Its unfortunate that other UAL flight crews behave so differently IME like anything goes. I certainly hope UAL is listening and will realize that the interactions by their personnel overall represents the face of their product to the consumer and will emphasize that their crew make passengers feel valued, welcomed and wanted. Then I think most will be happy to return. But there is much work to be done.
Orlando to Washington, D.C. Great flight with United, easy check in at MCO and nice staff all around. Plane was an older one, but the seat was comfortable and servcie was good.

commentHeader: the very worst for both of us
reviewContent: Purchased business tickets for my wife for 1/21 and myself to travel on 1/19 from Richmond to Paris. The first United Airlines flight from Richmond to Dulles was 2 hours late thus I missed my Paris flight. My wife’s flight was 1.5 hours late and she missed hers. The United gate agents in Richmond, with the exception of 1,  were untrained, ineffective and mostly ignorant. My wife’s agent forgot to switch her luggage when she was rerouted through Germany. At age 67 , I have travelled on business and pleasure most of my life, but these 2 experiences rank as the very worst for both of us.

I flew with United Airlines Dec 26 from Toronto to Houston. We encountered weather problems or turbulence by Houston Airport or that was what I assumed. We circled the airport in the fog for 40 minutes with no communication from pilot or staff the entire time to let us know what was going on. Was an unnerving experience. On Jan 16 I again flew with United Airlines from Auckland to San Francisco. Again no communication from pilot or staff regarding the reason for the excessive turbulence. The stewardesses seemed to be very irritable and also the washrooms very dirty. The only thing said by the pilot was thanks for flying United after we landed.  Will not recommend this airline for any future trips for anyone

Montreal to Buffalo via Newark. I had a flight scheduled for 5:45pm on Jan. 21st, and 1 hour before the flight they decided to cancel it. I had work the next day. And of course, nothing was compensated. No hotel stay, no food, because it was weather related. I had to sleep in the terminal. I despise this sort of treatment. I will forever avoid United.

We flew 1st class from ORD-PUJ in the Dominican Republic. I must say the flight back was good and that will be posted in a different review but this one was appalling. We were in the first row and had a birds eye view of the flight attendant having what I will call a bad hair day. She put her long, stringy hair in bun, let it down and put it up again and so on a few times. That wasn't so bad but at least twice she ran her fingers through her hair and dropped dislodged hairs and goodness only know what else directly onto the cabin floor! I can't believe it but she did. I never saw her wash her hands and yes she served meals too. The breakfast was supposed to be eggs Benedict. Well there was no poached egg, it resembled a scrambled mishmash and the Hollandaise sauce was baked into the egg instead of being a sauce. So in sum the food was poor and the sanitary practices simply failed due to negligence.

Cincinnati to Chicago. Worst plane ride ever and that says a lot considering it was also the shortest. Extremely small and uncomfortable plane. After telling me my carry-on bag was fine, they decided it was too big, as well as many other people, and made us leave our bags outside the plane without telling us where to get them. After the ride was over I had to search for someone to ask, where they made us all line up in the cold and wait for them. They may have actually told us, but whoever gave the instructions spoke such a poor excuse for English it was pathetic, and I really don't mind accents normally, as long as I can understand. They can't do the job if nobody can understand them and they just keep yelling and gesturing and even grabbing at my belongings because they can't compose a sentence to tell me what to do with them. I was also supposed to be in a row by myself, but out of nowhere the flight crew pulls out a seat behind the wall and blocks me in the aisle and completely blocks off the bathroom so nobody could use it and making one long row with no space in it. I would never willingly book with this airline.

Miami to San Francisco. Once again, a disappointing product from United on one of the longest trancontinental routes in the country. Old plane. Old seats. No seat back IFE. WiFi did not work. The food in First class was respectable though. United - please upgrade your fleet!

Denver to Chicago via Detroit. Was charged $30 per carry on bag, had to check our 2 bags, as they wouldn't allow us to carry on proper size bags cuz we booked economy. When we complained was told we should of done it at the airport which was crazy as they were backed up so bad and had no time. It's a trap! Just don't fly United, I know we won't ever again!

Madison to Newark via Chicago. This morning, I arrived at the airport and waited in line to check my bag for 25 minutes. Once I finally got up to the counter the agent at my desk disappeared for another 15 minutes. She finally came back but said I would miss my flight because I was a few minutes late from the checked baggage cutoff time. The agent tried rebooking my ticket for me. I’m not sure if she was new or wasn’t trained on the system well enough because it took her a long time to rebook the ticket to the point where her supervisor had to jump in. Her supervisor told her to push me to the side and said that they would “deal with me later”. I waited another 20 minutes for them to get through the rest of the line. Once I finally got my ticket rebooked, the flight is not only not a direct flight, it’s also supposed to reach my destination 8 hours after my initial flight. First of all, I shouldn’t have had been put on hold just because there’s a long line to get through. Secondly, right before I was pushed to the side, the agent promised to put me on the next possible flight at 11 am. But after being pushed aside, I got put on the 1:50 pm flight. The inconsistency and empty promising is so unacceptable. I am being lied to and neglected by your staff. I have never experienced this with other airlines. Delta next door had the same amount of people in line and they got through the line 30 minutes faster than United. Delta in the past had allowed me to board my airplane still while my baggage goes on the next flight but United would not allow me to do that. I have lost 8 hours of my time to spend with my parents whom I have not seen in 2 years due to the your staff’s incapability to work efficiently. How could you possibly ever replace this valuable time I lost because of your inconsiderate employees. Thanks to United, I will now have 5 hours to cry at the airport. This experience is making me reconsider ever taking a United flight again. Especially seeing that comparison of service quality side by side with Delta.

Newark to Cincinnati. Maintains a very bad quality of service in all aspects. Customer service is not at all satisfying nor try to make any convincing to customers. Most delayed airline I have ever seen.
Memphis to Denver. The Memphis United gate agents and managers have awful attitudes and lack professionalism. The manager on duty was one of the rudest people I have ever met.

Sydney to Newark via Houston. I was happy to book and fly with them because they use the Boeing 787 aircraft on the 14 hour flight to Houston. As an airline, they weren’t amazing, but they were fine. The food was fine, nothing to write home about, and the entertainment was okay, a few too many ‘old’ movies for my liking. The flight attendants were old and a bit abrupt, not overly friendly but not rude. I did notice the seats did not recline back very far, which was not ideal on a flight you have to sleep on. Luckily the middle seat in our row was free so we could spread out a little. Both flights left on time. Would I fly United again? It wouldn’t be my first choice, but I wouldn’t rule it out.

San Diego to Honolulu. They are terrible! I never leave reviews on anything unless I feel strongly about what I’m reviewing and this is one of those times. Starting out I could tell the day was not going to go well, me and my boyfriend flew from San Diego to Honolulu, with a layover in Los Angeles. The first flight wasn’t bad. it was a small plane and there were no amenities; no WiFi, no complementary drinks or snacks, or anything else. However the flight was less than an hour so I wasn’t expecting much and it was okay. The second flight however was a complete nightmare! We were in the very last row of the plane which may have contributed to our horrible experience but so many other things happened as well. This was a 5 and a half hour flight and there was no WiFi, they had “in flight demand movies” which you needed to watch, so that didn’t work. Also for the first 3 and a half hours of the flight, there was no drink or snack service, at all. The only people who got served were first class. Which I get. Those passengers pay extra for that sort of thing, but other airlines would have served us twice by now. The flight attendants werent worried about the passengers, The flight attendants were all in the back of the plane making fun of passengers, gossiping, etc all of which I can hear since I’m right in front of them. Eventually, I think they received a hint when a few passengers started walking towards the back of the plane and asking them for water, and drinks. Then a line started forming down the aisle of the plane of passengers walking to the back to where all 4 flight attendants were standing. The flight attendants seemed annoyed and irritated that no one was staying seating and the aisle was being blocked, so finally almost 4 hours into the flight the first cart of drinks and snacks was wheeled down and they started serving people. By this time, all the passengers were cranky and irritated by the rude staff and how we were all being treated. The attendants were rolling eyes and huffing and puffing and it was just an all around terrible experience. Not to mention when we were leaving the flight attendants were mocking us on how slow we were and how it doesn’t take that long to get off the plane. There were 86 rows of 3 on this flight, it’s gonna take a minute for everyone to get off. This was just the perfect example of how people who have money got treated immensely better than those in economy. I feel sorry for anyone who was a passenger on this flight! If I could give this a zero I would. This was my first time flying United and it will most certainly be my last.

Lima to Houston. Cancelled a 1:30am flight because of a sick pilot. Do you have no back up pilots? Your people told us our next flight would be at the same time the next day. Then you change it to 11:00pm the day after next. Then, to top it all off, they send a bus to pick us up from the hotel at 7 and we arrive at the airport at 8 and none of the lines are open? Its about to be 2 hours before the flight leaves. I am never flying United again, so beyond frustrated.

Flight there was ok. Flight back to Vegas became nightmare. From 12th of January when I suppose to go back home I came back today 2 pm and today is 14th. The worst experience what I had. First flight was delayed weather condition in Chicago where is my connection flight for Vegas - so obviously I will not make it. I cooperate and changing flight for 13th via Washington. I am came in the morning United app didn’t notify me that flight is canceled!,I need to wait 8h for next one. Then that one I delayed. They change me then to American Airlines convincing me that I will make it like that. Then that flight was late 30 minutes and then I didn’t make it again on my connection!!! So now it’s already 9 pm, next flight is in the morning on 14th of January from Philadelphia and United phone agent is telling me that they don’t know if they can provide me a hotel! Luckily nice woman name who is working there on United gates in Philadelphia helped me that I can have where to sleep that night. She is the only normal person with whom I spoke from United. I forgot to say when I wanted to complain and I did complain to manager of United in Harrisburg she answered me: well you chose by yourself to fly with United.  That is not cool. Was so so frustrated and angry.

Houston to Colorado Springs. Flight was delayed due to an issue with the emergency brake. It took 30 minutes to figure this out before they made everyone get off the plane. Said it would be up to an hour delay. Eventually they switched planes. After 1.5 hours we boarded the new plane. We sat on the runway for about 45 minutes before taking off. Terrible experience with United Airlines. Would not recommend flying with them.

Miami to Zurich, I wonder why their ratings are to the lowest. My experience with United truly upsetting and so much of a disappointment. Never received a compensation or refund after they left us in Rome Fiumicino Airport after flight was cancelled without a notification, they took our money and goodbye.

Honolulu to Los Angeles. United Airlines needs more check in assistance at HNL. I stood at a self check in screen for 30 minutes waiting for assistance. At this point I couldn't check my bags. The first assistant to help me forgot about me. Another 20 minutes pass and I have missed my flight and they had to book me on an American Airlines flight. In summary they cut costs on man power and it costs them man hours and customer satisfaction in the end.

Nashville to Houston. This is absolutely the worst airline. I will never fly again with United. I booked four flights and needed to change one of the passengers names. My husband was originally going but because of work he could not so I wanted to change the passenger to my son. They would not under any circumstances allow me to do so. It is apparent this airline cares nothing about their customers!

Washington to Tokyo. This was my first experience flying the highly touted Polaris product, and quite frankly, it is a vast improvement over the 8 across business class that we have been putting up with on this route for so long. Perhaps the crew was as pleased as the passengers to be in this re-configured and upgraded business section. Service was impeccable, lots of smiles, lots of personalization. Indeed, this experience was one of the best I have had on United. The meals were excellent, properly served and delicious. Entertainment was excellent. Lavatories were clean and comfortable. All in all, an excellent experience. Hence the 10 rating.

route: Los Angeles to London via New York
reviewContent: I was flying from Lax to Athens via New York and London! From the beginning of our flight you can see how rude are the people that are working for United. Nobody helps us on the checking our bags. I was with my wife and our doughter 13 years old and when we ask that our seats on flight UA 934 were not on the same row they sad in a really very rude way - you have to ask at EWR airport. After arriving there we ask again and they try but the couldn’t do anything! So, when we were on the plane, we ask our self other people if we can change seats. We notice that there were more people like us! Chaos! They took also all our small bags from LAX and they told us that you will get them in Athens! Finally we arrived with 3 from our bags broken! Dear United, you should learn service to your passengers from much smaller airline Aegean Airline or bigger one Lufthansa!

commentHeader: this is by far the worst
reviewContent: Bakersfield to Tampa. I have flown with many airlines in my life and this is by far the worst. They have continued their unbundling strategy for pricing. What this includes is removing carry-ons from the standard rate. This allows them to show a lower price 98% of people don't use because they're not going to walk-on role playing with just the shirt on their back. They have also used an algorithm to determine the most popular seats which aren't really any better than any other seats in economy but you have to pay extra for those. Top it off the service of the what is a Time counter recently especially terrible. Disinterested and rude, will not enjoy your flight.

This is the worst airline I have ever traveled with. I started using it about a year prior until i tried other airlines like Southwest, jetblue or Delta. Always delayed, rude staff and overpriced. You cannot cancel your ticket 24 hours after you book. You are overcharged for everything. I will never book it again. Bye bye United for ever.

Chicago to San Francisco. This airline charges $30 for bags checked, individually. I agree, but do not agree with charging for backpacks. The purpose of charging for bags was to get the TSA to screen faster, so sometimes people pack a lot of stuff and bring huge luggage that is ridiculous. Now if we want to check in a small backpack because we have 5 oz bottles of sauce from the country we visited, that does not make sense. At that point the airline is charging for profit and not thinking about its customer's needs nor about the origin of this screening rule, 9-11. The airline is taking profit from a tragedy we all endured and not thinking logically! For my family there is no more flying United. Our choices have power.

Madison to Chicago. I was flying home with a small bag and encounter fees that we were unaware of that cost 65 dollars. The lady was extremely rude and the above compartments were completely empty. This carrier has always been extremely difficult. Every other carrier American, Delta, Southwest are very accomodating and if you are looking to fly I would recommend using one of them. United will charge extra for everything you do with them.

route: Los Angeles to Salt Lake City
commentHeader: baggage fees we were unaware of
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Salt Lake City. We encountered baggage fees we were unaware of. When we checked in they made us check all baggage. I think we were the only ones on the plane not allowed carry-ons. The bins above our seat were completely empty and the flight was not even full. Very disappointed checking baggage cost me an extra $70.

Nashville to Houston. I booked a United flight for 12 January one way for $247 dollars three days ago. Upon checking my bank account it has occurred to me that United is holding $347 which is a $100 more than what I paid. When I called customer service to get the matter resolved they were no help. I talked to both a regular employee and the manager. Both admitted to a system error charging my account to much money and lied about when the funds would be back  available in my account. It has now been well over 48 hours since I booked the flight and this airline is still holding this extra money.

Chicago to Los Angeles. After this experience with United, they will not be my first choice any more. The flight had mechanical issues (which are understandable) but the service (by that I mean, attitude rudeness, and lack of information, or help) that we received from the employees at the gate was absolutely inconceivable and unnecessary. They were rude, absolutely unhelpful. And did nothing to help us during the 6+ hour delay. When I complained to United Customer service via their website after the flight, they were equally unapologetic and unhelpful. This has really soured my opinion of this airline and I will go out of my way in the future to avoid flying with them.

route: New Orleans to Houston via Seattle
reviewContent: New Orleans to Houston via Seattle. On the first leg of my trip they somehow screwed up on seating assignments - the result was 30 minutes of musical chairs before take off. Beverage service took forever. They require payment for in flight entertainment ($8 to watch Direct TV?! Ridiculous) and don't have charging ability for devices beyond row 21. The "remote " for the tv is located on the armrest, which means keeping one's arms tucked uncomfortably within the seat so as to not change the channel on your neighbor's screen. Wherever possible I will avoid United like the plague.

Newark to Las Vegas. United Airlines isn’t my go to airline but sometimes I have to take it due to lack of alternatives. Whenever I do take it, I get reminded why I dislike taking it. In flight customer service has never impressed me. Flight attendants are unfriendly and unwilling to help. I got stuck with my small luggage because of lack of space in the business class. The flight attendant directed me to go to the back of the flight to find a spot when I was sitting upfront. This not only resulted a long delay for everyone but took me 15 minutes to get back to the front and just to find out I could’ve fit my bag in the overhead near my seat. Zero initiative to provide any help. Let me add laziness too to my description.

I took United as domestic flight segment from EWR to AUS and back to IAD in December 2018 and had generally very good experience. There are many new machines, the staff were very polite. There is a large selection of free soft-drinks optionally served with ice cubes. I like the design and brand vision partly derived from Continental. Seats average, a bit tight. Unfortunately some delays occur often especially when flying from EWR.

Washington to Greensboro. Not the first time I have had issues with my flights, always end up needing to wait extra time! Next time I need to choose a company to fly with, United Airlines definitely won’t be my first option!

Shanghai to Newark. I ordered the ticket a month in advance and had to transfer from Shanghai Hongqiao airport to Shanghai Pudong airport. When I arrived to check in the staff told me all seats were sold out. It was outrageous they didn't give me a refund prior to flying out they instead promised me a seat that wasn't empty I was furious. The airline messed up on my order and still had the nerve to upgrade someone's seat instead save your money and book elsewhere United Airlines treat their customers like a joke. The staff on board were attentive but the leg room seemed to be smaller than other aircraft. In addition, the food was dry and mediocre it was hard to swallow. I will no longer book through United Airlines after this ridiculous first experience with them.

Denver to San Francisco. Over the top service in business class right from check in to the Polaris lounge ( centurion eat your heart out) To the staff being so attentive and trying to get everyone taken care of. 2 hr rain delay at sfo... they apologized for rain. And then they announced that a few people were trying to make an international connections if everyone could stay in their seats so these people could get off first... and everyone listened. Well 1 very anxious couple defied the stewardess orders and walked to the exit area and sat right in front of it while we were still taxiing on the runway, the stewardesses were firm and did not escalate the situation.

route: Las Vegas to Halifax via Newark
reviewContent: Las Vegas to Halifax via Newark. These people are the most rude and selfish people I have ever dealt with. I am in the Canadian military and specifically asked before booking my flight whether we were covered for checked baggage. I was told that I am and so I booked with them. Now being at the airport they tell me they only cover for US and refuse to do anything to help me out. They were condescending, rude, and refused to help out with anything wanting me to pay over $300USD for my 3 bags. Eventually rebooked to Air Canada and I would recommend Air Canada to anyone.

route: Syracuse to Las Vegas via Chicago
commentHeader: I realized I was lied to
reviewContent: Syracuse to Las Vegas via Chicago. United recently impressed me when I was promised a travel voucher and to be able to change flights by reservation agent. I confirmed the details multiple times. I asked if I would have to go to the gate and through security and he said no. The agent also said the voucher and changing flight was guaranteed and it was rare to be offered this. I showed up to the airport today with no bags (because I was guaranteed a voucher and to switch flights). Then I realized I was lied to. Lady at the ticketing counter in Syracuse was very helpful, but said that I was misinformed. I ended up spending over 2 hours between the ticketing counter and calling reservations today. I received a later flight but no voucher. I feel deceived and absolutely disrespected. There’s such a lack in their customer service experience and overall respect for people’s time, which is now something I can’t get back. I have now wasted non refundable minutes dealing with something I was promised multiple times. I will not be using United as my airline of choice and highly advise against using them.

Chicago to Los Angeles. One of the worst airlines I've ever flown on. Will never fly with them again. If anything goes wrong, be warned that they will not work with you to compensate. The service is horrible, their policies are worse. Very greedy airline, would never recommend.

Houston to Salt Lake City. The guy next to me was cool with switching with my wife so we could both take care of our kid. Then the stewardess came around and told us the baby couldn’t be in that isle because it was an emergency exit isle. That would make sense if it was, but it wasn’t an emergency exit isle. When I pointed this out the stewardess got mad, and made my wife and the other person switch back to their original seats. United do an attitude check on your people before hiring them thanks. Oh those maple wafers were so good!

route: San Diego to San José via Houston
reviewContent: I had the worst flight of my life with United Airline! They retarded our flight from Houston to San Jose Costa Rica and they were trying to let us think it was because of the weather, but all other airline managed to make their flight that day. They canceled our flight because they were missing staff, but still they were saying it was weather. The flight was schedule for 9:15am on the next morning, but they still didn't had staff. They finally made the flight passes 11:00am. That flight was schedule originally the day before at 9:30pm. Furthermore, after cancelling my flight back before the 24hours allowed to cancel it they confirm that my flight was canceled, but did not refund it. I'm still trying to get the refund... Worst airline: United Airline

We flew from Houston to Bogota in a night flight, so the first thing you would expect of a night flight is to have a comfortable pillow and a thick, nice blanket. That's the first mistake, no pillow and some cheap blanket that made no difference to the super cold AC. Well, we won't sleep, let's watch a movie or something with this nice DirecTV screen in front of us. Surprise! The screen won't let you open even the flight map  without swiping your card for 8 dollars.  I guess I will have to use the United App and watch something there, but I'm running out of battery. Surprise, only Business and Economy Plus rows have power outlets. United Airlines' staff are nice and caring but anyway those mistakes make me have a bitter experience with them. Not recommended.

Tampa to Zurich via Newark. Good ending for my florida Vacation. I brought a upgrade with miles , TPA to EWR on time with nice Fa `s and decent food. The Polaris Lounge in EWR is a huge hit. Nice food at the dining room and great cocktails at the bar (try the Manhattan) and a smooth and on time flight to ZRH with smiling and caring FA`s. Will fly United again!

route: Wilkes Berre to Albuquerque via Chicago
reviewContent: Wilkes Berre to Albuquerque via Chicago. I have never been so heartbroken in my life. I booked my flight months prior looking forward to a wonderful vacation reuniting with my family, then a couple weeks before my flight I get a call my grandmother is in the hospital and not doing well she has about 3 months to live, I figured okay I can still be there in a couple weeks to see her. Flash forward to a week before my flight, I get another call my grandmother is fading fast and is in comfort care (meaning end of life) and she wont last more than a few days. I  call the airline asking if there is any possible way I can get a sooner flight. And although the gentleman who was helping me through customer service was very kind and very sympathetic to my situation, trying everything he can do to help me, the manager denied me. I cannot believe how selfish this company is. They do not care about their customers they ONLY care about their money.

Norfolk to Houston. Booked through Orbitz. Paid $22 dollars per ticket for insurance. Don't do it! Even with the insurance United would not work with the agent to refund the ticket. Had to change due to Active Duty orders and still they would not work with me. I contacted Orbitz and got refunded my insurance on the tickets ($66) and they told me to call United directly to try and get a refund with orders. After being on hold for 25 minutes with United the rep told me she could not transfer me to the department refund and that I would need to talk to Orbitz again so that they could contact them. Requested to speak with supervisor and she had me submit a form online for my refund. Terrible customer service and the worst part is that I only needed to change my flights to an earlier time and cancel my return flight (not my families ticket) and they still would not work with me. Never will work with United again. I'm a rewards member with Delta and American and come to find out the extra $50 or $100 you are gonna pay is 100% worth it. If you are still reading stay far away!

Our family of 5 (3 teenage boys) traveled with United to San Francisco from Sydney and then we returned with United to Sydney from Washington DC (changed planes in San Francisco). Flights to and from San Francisco were economy on the new Boeing 787 which were fabulous. Seats were roomy (one of my sons is 6' 3") with good leg space. In-flight entertainment was great. We were particularly pleased with how smooth the flight was, little turbulence seemed to affect the plane. However it was the wonderful flight attendant staff which made all the difference. Attentive, polite, nothing was too much trouble.I am gluten free and had all my meals and snacks pre-ordered which didn't miss a beat. They genuinely seemed happy going about their work, chatting and laughing with my sons. Overall we couldn't have been happier. Only small complaint was the domestic flight from DC to San Francisco we had to pay for our in-flight entertainment on tiny little screens, $8US each (x5 for each family member) and no free snacks/meals provided on the 6 hr flight unlike Australian airlines, so be prepared with snacks.

route: Madison to St. Louis via Chicago
reviewContent: Madison to St. Louis via Chicago. I arrived in Chicago to transfer planes in order to make it to St. Louis. The flight has a creeping delay, currently at an hour and a half delay. No notice was sent out to notify of the delay. No explanation is given for the delay. This is already an evening flight.

Cancun to San Francisco. United Airlines desperately need to upgrade these planes. We paid over $2000 USD for each seat on this flight, and the first class seats don’t even have tvs or usb ports. The seats are basically just wider seats than the normal seats. I have flown on Delta and American recently and both of those airlines are more updated with nice tvs, usbs, seats that fully lay flat and are way more comfortable. The flight attendants are nice, but I definitely do not recommend United Airlines.

Newark to Port of Spain. If one’s wondering if customer service has died among the US carriers then any flight with United will confirm that sadly it is deep in the grave. If the insults of charging customers for every single small comfort ever conceived in private transport, weren’t already enough, the totally apathetic or even hostile attitude of the staff in anything but top tier business class, appears to demand that already deceased customers, rise just to be killed again. Passengers flying United are treated no better than cattle, or more properly cash cows to be milked, and then thrown off the plane. In both of our flights the only time the cabin crew even spoke to customers was to reprimand them or tontry and talk them into checking a bag. Heaven forbid they expend a calorie trying to welcome or make customers fee at home. The boarding process for our int’l flight was a keystone cops disaster which could have easily been avoided with simple crowd management measures. Instead they stuffed an entire four groups into two narrow lines - even though they had four and expected people to trample over each other. The solo cranky ticket taker was snapping at customers telling them to “go here, “ then no, there!” while a security person randomly deleted bags - by eye to get tagged and taken from customers as they entered the plane - no advisory, explanation, apology, nothing. Not a manager was to be seen during all this and our departure was over an hour late. Horrible experience from start to finish. That will be our very last flight on United ever.

Today I took a flight from Halifax to Nerwark (Flight UA4149) and I was absolutely blown away by the service given by the flight attendant. This lady went above and beyond for not just me but every person on the flight, I was suffering from terrible sore throat and cold and felt terrible. She went to her own purse and gave me throat lozenges, and got me a cup of ice to soothe my throat purely out of the kindness of her heart and without me even having to ask and she also checked on me. I gave this woman a hug before I left the aircraft, she was caring and very witty she had us all laughing.

Their online booking is misleading (out and out tells you one thing but you end up with another). The staff is rude and “just do not care”. Whatever happened to the days when people were just nice to each other just because one can be? What happened to businesses that cared about their clients? Well some still exist - but it isn’t United airlines. They have extremely rude staff every single time I’ve flown with them. Lost my luggage out of Cancun but didn’t help me in the least to hook in with the insurance I bought. So stressful I just ate it and went on with life. This is literally the worst company on the planet to date for me to review. Zero business ethics. Zero customer care ethics. Investing in anything to do with United is out of the question. Flying with them - not if my life depended on it.

Houston to Portland. Our flight was delayed for an hour, which is not a lot and I understand that delays happen so that was reasonable. When I was up at the counter asking the attendants a question, instead of looking at me, she was looking at her phone ignoring what I was saying and just nodding her head. I am traveling with a family of 6, and we just got the economy boarding. When flying from Portland to Houston, we were ok with the size of our personal item which was a few inches off of the “sample” so we figured it would be the same scenario on our way back. (Taking into consideration that we weren’t allowed a carry on, despite a lot of space available in the cabins which we saw once we got on the plane.) When we began boarding our attendant was very rude and asked us why we were taking our personal item when we “weren’t allowed anything on the plane” I proceeded to tell her that we got the “ok” from the front check-in as well as when we flew from Portland to Houston. Again, she was rude and said we had to pay in order to have our items on the plane and if not that we could just stay here. She was like “tell me know are you going or are you staying.” I decided to then pay, thinking that it would be the same amount as our checked bags, but no, it was $180 for two personal item bags. $180 + a rude attendant. But of course, we have no choice, who would want to leave their things behind? After paying and waking to board the plane, she proceeded to follow us and tell us to hurry up basically chasing us down the hall. When we got to the door there was a serviceman fixing something so we couldn’t actually step in; yet she was telling us to hurry. I’ve heard a lot of bad reviews about United Airlines, but I never thought it would personally happen to me. I will never fly with United again. Not only because of the outrageous amount for two personal items, but because of the rude service more than anything.

Charleston to Newark. It was a really great flight. Boarding was on time, departure was on time, but most of all, we arrived on time. Servicd onboard was great, flight attendent was nice, but the seats weren't really comfy. I started to get cramped when I slept onboard. But overall it was a nice flight.

Atlanta to Eagle. United is terrible. We had a 24 hour layover due to weather and not even a free hotel to stay in because apparently “they don’t cover that.” I’m sitting at our gate right now in which I was supposed to leave yesterday. There’s not one staff member and the plane was supposed to leave at 7:15 but could not because the captain was a no show. Please help yourself arrive to your destination easier and travel delta. I’ve never been treated like this on a delta flight.

route: Sydney to Newark via San Francisco
reviewContent: Sydney to Newark via San Francisco. One of the worst Airlines i have ever travelled with. Staff is rude, food is below quality. For international flight of more than 15 hours they dont serve you spirits as well. Seats are uncomfortable. They even missed to load our baggage and couldn't deliver it back on time. All in all i am never travelling with them again.

route: Los Angeles to Grand Cayman via Houston
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Grand Cayman via Houston. The United employees this morning were so rude, I was honestly taken aback. I had a question about where to go as I had a problem entering my passport information online. The employee I asked just repeatedly told me it was not her section so she couldn’t help me. When I did figure out where to go, I entered my info into the kiosk but needed an employee to verify it. She patronized me and treated me like a moron for not being able to scan my passport. I never fly United and will try not to again. This experience made me realize how politely I’ve always been treated by Southwest, and now I won’t take that for granted. United employees must be pretty unhappy. Their customer service is non-existent.

Chicago to Fort Wayne. Snow is falling in Chicago. The lady next to me misses her flight. The gentleman working C8 gates at 21:26 in O'Hare shrugs his shoulders and says go to customer service. No emotion, no apology. Was more interested in flirting with another passenger. I also bought a direct flight in March of 2018 for a direct flight to NYC from Fort Wayne. I never received my vouchers and trying to call to inquire about them is more difficult then walking through the Grand Canyon. Might be the cheapest airlines but step it up United.

Chicago to McAllen via Houston. Absolute nightmare! Worst experience I’ve had! Connecting flight canceled with no explanation. Waited in customer service line for 3.5 hrs - United employees rude and disrespectful. Lost luggage and stranded for 2 days with no clothes or toiletries.
Houston to Vail. Seats have gotten smaller and smaller. United overcharges and under delivers.  If your knees touch the seat in front of you how can this be safe?

Seattle to Miami via Houston. Absolutely garbage. Stuck in airport and goose chased through the Houston airport for 14 hours, finally got out of Houston through Delta. And then they completely lost our luggage. No ideas where our luggage could be, what airline it would be on. And a supervisor hung up on me. If I could give no stars I would.

Zurich to Tampa via Newark. A good start to my vacation. We arrived a little early in EWR with a smooth flight. The FA's caring and friendly. The IFE with new movies and TV Shows. I have seen the entire season "Sharp Objects" which was great

commentHeader: worst flight in my entire life
reviewContent: San Francisco to Portland. This was the worst flight in my entire life and I am 62 years old. I will NEVER fly United Airlines again. We started boarding on time and were about 1/2 full when they asked us to deplane for a maintenance issue. At first, we weren't told when they thought we might take iff. Then every 1/2 hr they would say it would be another 1/2 hr before we knew anything. I learned more about the problem in United's texts than from their Customer Service personnel. We finally were told it was ONE indicator light that wasn't working. After 2 1/2 hours they told people about another possible flight leaving at 7 pm. The problem with that was it was completely FULL & had people on standby. So you could give up a PAID RESERVATION for a seat on another flight with the slight possibility of getting on. This made no sense. They finally brought out free water and snacks but never bothered announcing this so by the time I'd heard about it they were all gone. They then changed our gate to a less comfortable location with fewer seats. People were seating on the floor. I've got health issues and this entire experience was awful . I usually fly with Southwest and I've never encountered anything like this. I understand that it is the holidays but United should have been better prepared for situations such as this. Think twice before flying United.

Cancun to London via Houston. Never again! Placed me in a complete opposite of the plane from my wife even though I selected my seats! United staff when we arrived at Houston said no matter where we were going with our connecting flight I would have to collect our luggage - waited 20 minutes for luggage only to be informed we did not have to collect it! Nearly missed our connecting flight due the stupidness of staff.

Houston to Saint Louis. I have never had a 50 pound bag completely lost. Somehow, United did it. The gentleman that helped me in STL was super helpful, but even he said that United workers in Houston were screwing up really bad. I do not think they care about their customers in Houston which is sad. I am disappointed.

Chicago to Houston. Miserable inconsiderate employees. Treated like cattle and shown no courtesy or customer service of any kind. Never fly this airline. Cheap prices maybe, poor training and courtesy nonexistent. Don’t do it.

Houston to Puerto Vallarta. Never again, and I’m not a picky traveller. Redirected due to weather/not enough gas. Airplane late, missed my flight to Guadalajara. United could not book me on the next two flights to where they were supposed to, so booked me to a different city the next day. I’m fine paying a bit to stay overnight, but now I’ll be in a different city and have to figure out a way to get to my final destination. Double accommodation and double the bus booked now and paid, and UA doesn’t even want to help by offering to pay anything, yet alone a taxi. UA we understand weather can’t be controlled, but if you can’t get me to my destination, shouldn’t that be compensated? I got a meal voucher though (laughs out loud, 24h limit). It’s 11pm and I’m tired, exhausted and fed up spending extra money, I’m not hungry and a meal voucher doesn’t cut it. I will never fly this airline again, as my travels may be ruined this time.

I had a round trip flight from Denver to Philly and back for the holidays. The trip to Philly wasn’t too bad other than a weather delay (not the airlines fault at all) and the rude flight attendant. However, upon checking into my returning flight I received an error that I didn’t exists as a passenger. I called the number provided and was informed that because I missed the train connecting me to Philly after my first flight (which I missed because of to the delayed flight) my return ticket was voided and I was no longer on the flight! I received no notification of this, not a text, email. And was not reimbursed at all. I spent 45 minutes on the phone with their Customer Service who then informed I would need to pay an additional $411 to have my ticket reinstated.(I had already paid 600 for this round trip) I’d rather hitch hike 1600 miles with strangers than fly United again. Happy holidays to me, right? I ended up having to spend another $525 I didn't have to get flight back with a different airline. I fly a decent amount having family and work locations all over the country, I strayed away from usual airline to save $100 bucks on this trip and it ended up costing me an extra $550 after all things in included. Worst travel experience of my life, even Spirit wasn’t this bad.

LaGuardia to Washington via Orlando. Worst flying experience ever. The airline Nickles and dimes you for everything made me take my grandbabys toys out of the boxes. Staff was every rude, my first time flying with this airline, and never again.

Newark to Tel Aviv. The worst experience of my lifetime! I was supposed to fly on 12/25/18 for a very short trip for a family reunion and my daughter's celebrations. My flight was cancelled when I arrived to airport (less than 3 hours before the flight) and the cancellation text message came from Expedia, not United! United did not even bother to let me know in advance so that I would not go to the airport for nothing! I hold the driver who brought us to the airport for a while to figure out what happened. At the entrance I was told by a United rep that the flight is still on, just the aircraft was replaced so I have to check-in again (I did online check-in the day before). So I let the driver go and was waiting in the line until I reached the check-in desk where I was told that the flight is cancelled and there are no seats on the replacement flight. Nobody apologized. None of the agents looked a tiny bit sorry about what happened and nobody rushed to help resolve the situation. It felt like a 3rd hand company in a developing country, not the biggest American airline. After lots of efforts I got a replacement flight a day after and with a several hours stop in Europe. I was not offered any compensation for the damage they caused to us as all our Israeli plans had to change. After spending quite a bit of time trying to find a way to submit a complaint I finally did it and received an automated message offering $200 e-ticket or bonus miles. I do not need any of them as I will do my best to never fly United again! What a horrible Christmas experience.

Newark to Los Angeles. Terrible experience, delayed over 5 hours! Not updating us what is happening! United service people were terrible and very rude. I will never fly with them again. Did not give food vouchers for evening flight. Just can’t believe this.

Newark to Mumbai. United airlines had the worst customer service on the ground. I flew on Christmas. But even accounting for the holiday rush, their services were just unbelievably bad! To begin with, they had a common check-in for ALL flights. To add to the chaos, everybody was supposed to check-in at the kiosk and there was absolutely nobody to help in case somebody got stuck. At one point 5 out of 6 kiosks were unable to complete the check-in, stranding people behind. There was a separate queue for travel assistance, which had about 20-30 people waiting and only 1 counter  was available for assistance. It took us about 1 hour 45 min to complete the check in and reach the security. On another note, I was traveling with my boyfriend and we wanted our seats together. We had selected the seats immediately after booking our tickets. The seats got reshuffled three times due to "a change in the plane" and "the system" reshuffled the seats such that our seats got separated. United surely needs to fix their "system" that is unable to do a simple one-to-one mapping and is somehow adding a random factor on its own. I hope United fixes these issues soon.

We paid $350 for my 12 year old to fly from Houston to Amsterdam with their unaccompanied minor program. The united attendant did not pay attention while they were in the baggAGe area and my son picked up an identical suitcase. I spent hours on our vacation trying to get the suitcase back to the true owners. They even had all their Christmas presents in there. Could never find anyone at United to escalate to. Had to buy overpriced clothes for my son. United is worthless. If they weren’t watching the baggage pick up - what else were they not watching.

Los Angeles to Kona. First since we booked through Air Canada and rerouted to United they refused us access in the lounge at the airport. There were six other first class guests who had the same issue as us on the flight. The 737 was old and did not have TVs, it was suggested we could download the United app since it would allow us access to Internet. Problem was it would not be accessible for about two hours of the trip. We were told United was removing all unnecessary weight from planes to allow for more seating and storage. Since just about everyone now days travels with a mobile device it was not something they felt clients needed. First of all we do not pay all that extra to fly in a stripped Dow situation. It is bad enough they have reduced the number of washrooms and the one at the front is in constant us from people in economy. The aisles are filled with people and the staff precariously avoiding them will trying to serve. What is the benefit now, wider seats, a $12.00 meal and a few glasses of inexpensive wine. Even your luggage which has a priority comes out at with everyone else's. Get your act together or change the statis to Elite Economy.

Honolulu to San Francisco. There were two staff members. First one was most rude and you could feel the anxiety in the air, she made us wait with my nieces’ belongings to “organize” it so it that we could carry it down the loading aisle, she continued to bombard my sister about the ticket for my niece when she is a lap child, stupidity. When we boarded the plane a stewardess had no idea what she was doing. I was flying with my sister and her 20 month old child and there was tons of seats available and our tickets had us separated but apparently it is too much of an inconvenience to let me sit with them from row 43 to row 37 - initially she said it was fine and then changed her mind and made me move all my belongings and sit in my initial seat and now my sister is alone without aid, (despite her being a strong mom that I know could handle the situation but anybody with children will always appreciate the extra hand). Anyways she was indifferent and unaccomodating to the situation and used whatever power she thought she had to control the situation. Unfortunately, these two employees made your business look bad today and your company has to suffer due to their inadequacies and pure ridiculousness.

commentHeader: one of the worst meals I’ve had
reviewContent: Tokyo to Denver. I’ve flown both trans-Atlantic and trans-pacific flights so long haul is nothing new to me. On this flight, I’d like to address the food service that United has. Airline food is a means to an end. You’re trapped in a metal tube and you eventually get hungry, so the food service is there to help pass the time. I have to say that this is one of the worst meals I’ve had while flying. The chicken was horribly dry and had some sort of paste covering it that made it inedible. The rice was also dry and crunchy. My seat mates made the same comment and eventually just covered the food back up. On other long haul flights I’ve had some sort of snack service about half way between the 2 meals but not on United. If you’re on one of United’s long haul flights, be sure to bring snacks on board!

New Orleans to Washington. Every flight I have flown with United in the past year has been delayed. They are terrible in informing passengers and are always vague with their information. Consistently the worst airline experience.

Will never fly with United again, and would give 0/10 if I could. We were all boarded onto the flight, made to wait, only to deplane and be given 30 minute delay after 30 minute delay. After 2.5 hours of this, the plane was ultimately delayed by 9 hours. The flight attendant was unfriendly to the irritated passengers and did little to help reschedule flights. Also no food vouchers were given. Worst experience with an airline I've ever had.

Gillette to Denver via Charlotte. Unbelievable, my wife and I bought our tickets 6 months ago and we were obviously placed in middle seats on different sides of the plane on purpose. We got to the gate early and we were informed we were not allowed to sit together with our fare, our 500 dollar fare. This used to never be an issue to move seats so family can sit together. This airline is budget trash now and we will never fly United again.

London Heathrow to Newark return, and both flights were delayed. My experience with United Airlines was horrible.  The first one was delayed about 2,5h because the pilot couldn't reach the airport (problems could happen, I understand) and then because the aircraft needed maintenance. But the worst thing happened from Newark to London where the flight was delayed about 5h because, again, aircraft maintenance. After an overall 8h delays in two flights, their horrible customer care could only offer me a useless e voucher(expires in one year, I am not from USA and might not come back within one year) that doesn't really match the real cost. I can understand they can have problems,  but they have to change compensation policies. You cannot offer me an evoucher in order to oblige me to fly with you again. Not recommended at all, I'll try to stay away from this company.

Houston to Newark. Same problem with the menu as with our flight from Sydney to Houston. Ran out of a dish by the time the staff got to me - there were only 16 people in business, 6 of those children so I had to have one of the snack boxes from economy. I don’t understand. You know how many people are booked so how hard is it to have both options available? Staff very helpful and polite. Not his fault I know. Tired little plane again with tired and very well used amenities. No internal entertainment on this flight either. Bad luck if you did not have a tablet or phone to use the United App. You need to up your game United and quick.

While flying from Reno to Los Angeles they ask us to put our carry-ons down the airplane. We did. As soon as we looked for them, after the flight, my husband’s carry-on was all mashed and rotten. I told the person in charge that “please next time be careful because look what happened”, he looked, didn’t say anything and totally ignored us. Very disappointed with his attitude and not even an apologize. Very sad experience, we will never trust United Airlines with our baggage.

San Antonio to Appleton. A terrible experience overall. The airline will get you from point A to point B but it will be very uncomfortable. The aircraft in the fleet are tiny. Most adults do not fit comfortably in the seats and many could not stand up inside the aircraft without hitting their heads on the low ceiling. There is also very little storage space on the plane. I am considering buying a one way ticket with another airline for the trip home because United aircraft are so uncomfortable. They claim the small aircraft are more economical because of cheaper fuel costs due to reduced weight and better aerodynamics, but other airlines use larger aircraft and provide far better service for only a few dollars more.

route: Sydney to New York via Houston
reviewContent: Sydney to New York via Houston. What a tired airplane with tired facilities and tired staff. The seats were so close to the isle I had to make sure my arm was inside the seat. Food when it came was great but when asked what my selection was from the menu I was told that I would be put on a waiting list to see if my choices were available I assume after feeding first class first which I have never heard of before. I asked for a bottle of water and was told due to cut backs it was one bottle per person per trip but they could refill it. Breakfast, I was told off by the stewardess who was super stressed during the flight, because I did not eat my corn flakes which she had to tell another passenger she could not have so I could eat them! My god, I paid over $7000 for a seat on this airplane to be told off because I did not eat my corn flakes! The bathrooms were so small I did not even bother to change my clothes not only because I could not move but there was either water or urine on the floor. Maybe I am spoiled as I have flown business with Qatar Airways and Emerites and they are spacious planes with stewards that are not stressed with big bathrooms that are cleaned regularly and a menu that when you ask for something that’s is on the menu you are not told you will be waitlisted. Selection of movies very old. No new releases. No offer of any magazines or papers nothing. So I sit here at Houston waiting to board for the next leg of my journey hoping and praying it’s better than the one from Sydney or I won’t be flying with United long haul again.

Nashville to Houston. Absolutely horrible. Time management is little to none. No staff updated on delay after delay after delay. Our flight was scheduled to leave at 6:25 and after one hour sitting on the plane we weren’t told a single thing about the status of the flight. Very unprofessional staff and crew. Horrible, horrible experience.

Chicago to Miami. We had an issue with wheelchair assistance on the ground at Miami airport, but upon reaching out to United they immediately rectified the situation. Everyone and everything else about our experience with United was wonderful! Exactly as we expected and more. Very friendly and helpful staff, and even better customer service. Thank you!

route: Pittsburgh to San Diego via San Francisco
reviewContent: We booked a flight from Pittsburgh to San Diego via San Francisco. The flight got delayed by 3hrs (they delayed for an hour at first, then for 2 hours and the final announcement said 3hr delay) and we missed the connecting flight. The crew are so rude that they didn’t even apologize. They said all they can do is book another flight the next morning for free of cost. Seriously? You ruined my trip and there’s nothing you can do about it. They are not even paying for my accommodation for overnight stay in SF. I’m never ever gonna fly through United again after this trip.

Nashville to Newark. Literally the worst airline experience ever. I’ve flown so many times in my life. United Airlines has the most unprofessional, rude, and unorganized staff and service around. I will definitely stick with Allegient from now on.

route: Pittsburgh to San Diego via San Francisco
reviewContent: Pittsburgh to San Diego via San Francisco which is having a layover of about 1hr 30mins. Just after 10mins of the boarding start time they announced that the flight is delayed for about an hour and later on they delayed it by another 1hr and then finally 1hr 30mins. They kept on changing the time. We knew definitely we would miss the flight, so we asked for other options that we would get as our flight is at 9:09. There is only one flight in the next day morning from SFO to SAN and we were on standby. We asked for compensation or even just providing us the accomodation but they said that they can’t as it is not the issue with maintainance and it is an air traffic issue. Finally they confirmed another flight from SFO to SAN which is at 12:52. This is too bad for an airlines, there were like almost 10-12 people who want to reach SAN and to do that everyone has to reach SFO by midnight and catch another flight at 12:52 in the next day. It’s like missing the whole day, and they can’t do anything for that. United are so irresponsible and they were just smiling without even saying sorry. They kept saying just wait here, don’t go anywhere may be the time would change but it kept on increasing hour by hour. I don’t even know how can they state themselves as No.1 in customer satisfaction which is completely false. The same kind of delay happened with few other airlines, but they are good at least they felt sorry and even compensated us.

commentHeader: worst airline I have ever been on
reviewContent: San Francisco to Reno. This is the worst airline I have ever been on. I have given this airline 5 chances and every time something goes wrong. I would understand if an airline had delays some time but every time is inexcusable, I feel like it was false advertising the times it says because that is most certainly not the real time. I have never given a review in my life but I am so mad I need people to know so they don’t have to go through the same thing the experience I have had with this airline is terrible, and I will not be flying with them again.

My wife and I booked a flight from Monterey to Colorado Springs. An emergency occurred an we had to extend our stay 8 days. United demanded $220/ticket or $440 to extend our ticket 8 days, hiding behind company policy (bureaucracy), even though the price of the ticket did not change. We contacted Southwest Airlines, which gave us our ticket back for $89 each. We love Southwest Airlines because they are personal and don’t nickel and dime us like most other airlines. We have changed tickets before with Southwest Airlines with no problems; if the new ticket is more expensive we simply pay the difference, which is fair. We are seniors and fly a lot, both nationally and internationally. This year we flew round trip to Colorado x 2, North Carolina x 2, Hawaii, France, and the Republic of Georgia. Nationally we prefer Southwest and believe they have the best overall value.

route: Los Angeles to Salt Lake City
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Salt Lake City. Slow boarding process on a full flight, very friendly and attentive cabin staff, the plane was very fresh and though the flight was short but a long taxing on take off and landing caused a slight delay.

Burlington to Newark. The United flight was delayed 3 hours, and when we landed I received a message that my luggage did not arrive, it will arrive on the following flight. The customer service is terrible, lacking compassion and totally inefficient. My luggage did not arrive within 24 hours, as promised. 2 days later and I still haven’t received my suitcase. They have lied on the phone and miscommunicated between me and the driver service. What a disappointing and ugly experience. I would not recommend this airline to anyone.

Toronto to Oaxaca via Houston. Holding customers for ransom? I recently had an unbelievable experience flying to Mexico on United with a bike. Booked the flight several months back, checked with the United call centre on charges for taking a bike and confirmed what I'd read earlier on the United web site. Both made it clear that if the bike bag fell within weight and dimensional limits it would be charged simply as a second item of checked baggage i.e. $50. When I checked in at the airport, the United agent insisted that I owed an extra $200 (!) for the bike even though it came in under 50 lb limit and was the standard dimensions set out in the Airline's limits. No amount of back and forth would bring them round to honour the original terms. And curiously my two companions who had checked in a little earlier for the same flights also with bikes were charged much less - one paid $25 as it was his first and only item of checked luggage and the other was charged nothing for his bike as second item (his was in an identical Evoc bike bag and weighed just a little more than mine). The experience left a very bad taste. What can you do but pay up when you have already bought the ticket and will be leaving soon? This seems to be the kind of business practice you would expect of a dubious, disreputable business or one might experience in some part of the world where corrupt practices are more common.

On an 8 hour trip from Honolulu to Houston the flight attendants sprayed the cabin of the plane with a bad smelling air freshener with no regards to anyone’s health, including babies and younger children. Many people on the plane were coughing. I’ve never experienced this on an airline.

Sao Paulo to Houston. United Airlines have a lot of old planes still it seems. This is not necessarily a bad thing, I love these old 767s they have substantially more personal space (pitch and width) than newer aircraft. Friendly crew, decent food. I pegged an exit seat as a result of status gained through status matching. None of the airlines from the United States touch my preferred airlines in Europe Air France, Alitalia but United is now for me competitive with American and not so far behind Delta as it was.

commentHeader: have never experienced delays this long
reviewContent: Flew United Airlines from Indianapolis to Denver. Took well over an hour from the original departure time to even begin boarding which caused many personal schedule errors to ensue after. I understand delays occur, however I have never experienced delays this long with any other company.

commentHeader: What kind of operation is this?
reviewContent: I have yet to be treated this horribly! I have flown for work for the past 10 years on different airlines including United and this has been the worst experience. Since when are passengers treated with such distrust and since when is it ok for United employees to be this rude to passengers? Initially I was questioned about the size of my carry-on which I travel with all the time. She right away said to check it and I tried to put it in the size checker and I explained that I had placed my laptop in the outside pocket which is why it looks “thicker” so let me just put it inside the bag and it’ll be fine and she just said “if you check it you can’t check the laptop” and I replied “no, the point is I’m not checking it bc it fits” and she said “it’s doesnt fit so check it - I made an announcement earlier so you should know”. Firstly, the bag fit, and so she just walked away without saying anything and then secondly since when is it ok to “scold” me like I “should know”? Really? Then I cut my finger on the size checker and I asked a flight attendant for a bandaid and she said she can’t get one. I said I’m bleeding. She said she can’t leave the front and the first aid is in the middle. I said isn’t there a flight attendant in the middle and she said “yes but they are assisting someone else”. What kind of operation is this? Then later after 10 minutes she comes by and gives me a bandaid without a word. What kind of customer service is this?

commentHeader: doesn't care about you or your money
reviewContent: Never warned about flight cancellations and was told it was confirmed the night before with no help from the desk. Was told there was a walmart and that was supposed to make up for it. Waste of time. Incompetence to the highest degree and a lack of care. Even told them I had orders to be reporting into for the military and all I got was an 'oh well' from the desk staff. Then when I tried to transfer flights they wouldn't because "they would lose money". United Airlines is a terrible airline, doesn't care about you or your money, and would rather you just stay put instead of getting you anywhere.

Houston to Minneapolis. There was no prior warning of our flight being delayed until five minutes prior to the plane boarding. Every 30 minutes they delayed our flight another 1/2 hour for a total of five hours. Then at 12:00am they announced our flight would be cancelled. They sent all 200 passengers to customer service where three employees worked to put customers in hotels. After 1.5 hour wait in line we were informed there were not hotel rooms left for the night and we were forced to sleep at the airport. There has been no compensation for our trouble and our seats for the flight we were booked on in the morning were all the way to the back. They upgraded the business class passengers to first class conveying they do not value the every day vacationer but cooperate business who frequently use their airline. I will never fly United again.

commentHeader: the worst customer service of my life
reviewContent: This morning I encountered probably the worst customer service of my life. The person at the check-in desk was incompetent and rude. I had a valid document for travel to Mexico with an official green card stamp in my passport and she got confused and told me she has never seen this and decided to leave with my passport and go somewhere without even explaining her actions. When I confronted her and asked not to leave with my documents she said: "I won't be able to help you, I just can't deal with the attitude right now". When I finally made her talk to the supervisor and he looked at my documents and said "oh yeah that's ok". I wasted 40 minutes of my life. One star United, I think that becomes a new normal for you.

Milwaukee to Leon via Houston. Today is a nightmare for us. We pay extra to leave Milwaukee early in the morning -  first we were delayed in Milwaukee for 3 hours then arrived in Houston delayed 3 hours. Arriving at night in Leon mexico. We had a wedding to attend and now we are not going to be on time. We talk to the staff from the airline they were rude. This is my first and last trip in this airline. Our worst trip ever.

commentHeader: try to never fly United again
reviewContent: Wiliston to Corpus Christi. On the way to North Dakota had to change planes due to maintenance issues. Now on the way back, so far, the first plane was over an hour late due to maintenance issues and currently having to change planes due to maintenance issues as well on the second plane. Still have one more to go, doubt that one will be ready to fly as well. I will try to never fly United again.
Washington to Hartford. Objectively, the worst airline I have ever flown on. No questions asked. Terrible service. Can’t even bring on a carry on. Never fly United. I would take a look at JetBlue.

Economy plus is always a pleasure, more legroom, very on time flight with an early arrival in Zürich. Again very friendly FA's and good IFE. The only downside is that they serve a warm croissant with jam for breakfast, but without butter.
On time flight from ZRH to EWR, very friendly FA, comfy seat and good food (a little below C-Class standard). Will fly United Airlines again, entertainment great with the whole seasons of tv shows.

Calgary to Cancun via Denver. One of the worst experience with this airline. Will not recommend anyone to travel with this airline. Staff at Calgary airport was very rude. Me and my wife were travelling to Mexico even upon asking seats were given separately through out our travel. We had to request passengers to switch seats. 2 hand carrys were allowed for 2 passengers. Staff was still forcing us to book the hand carry as it was too big. Me and my wife travel alot but next time we will pay extra $$$ to travel but will not be travelling from United Airlines. Not recommended at all.

commentHeader: have to wait for another 4 hours
reviewContent: Dallas Ft Worth to Houston. When we arrived at the airport (after our driver being pulled over which took time) we still had one hour before departure. As I have never flown on United before, I didn’t know the procedure. We went straight to the baggage drop and told them we’re getting late, instead  of informing us to go to a different kiosk to check in our bags, they referred us to the monitor.
