Had an internal flight Orlando to Houston earlier in the day, was abused by a steward for not standing up to let a passenger sit next to me although I had turned to the side to let her in. We were told entertainment was free through our phone, but it wasn’t. On return trip dinner was indistinguishable, was called chicken but was mixed in with cheese, pasta dish was also undescribable. A “snack” of a par baked turkey roll was dry. Once again omelette ran out 3/4 of way down plane, alternative French toast was terrible. The entertainment was good though and easily accessed.

route: Charleston to San Francisco via Chicago
reviewContent: Charleston to San Francisco via Chicago. By far the worst airline I've had the misery of using. My flights were delayed with no forewarning. I had a delayed flight from Charleston to Chicago where I missed my connecting flight. Then my flight got rebooked for the next day so I had to sleep in the airport. Then the flight the next day was delayed. Now I'm returning from San Francisco to Houston and my flight is delayed again, with no other flights leaving from Houston to Charleston today so I guess it will be another night at the airport. I will never fly United again nor would I recommend it to anyone.

Milwaukee to Newark. We were scheduled to leave at 6:40pm on 10/07/18. We boarded late and were not notified at all. It is currently 7:47pm and we have still not left the ground. Apparently their is trouble with a “navigational computer” going down. Then we were told that they could not find a route for us. I understand that these things happen but for the price we paid we should not be over an hour behind on our departure. This is completely unacceptable and unprofessional. We will not be flying United again. I wish I could give a 0 score for all categories.

route: Los Angeles to Buffalo via Chicago
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Buffalo via Chicago. I purchased my tickets several months ago specifically to get advanced seating because I am 320 pounds. My flight was changed going back from LAX to BUF. My assigned seating was taken away and currently I cannot assign a seat to myself for the changed flight. I called customer service about this issue and they could not help. This is the worst service ever. I will never use United ever again.

London to Newark. A big shout out to United Airlines. My girlfriend I got round trip tickets to the UK through Primera Air. After arriving to the UK, we found out that Primera Air went bankrupt and we would be stranded in the UK with no alternative way home. We read online that other airlines would be offering discounts to those effected. After calling multiple airlines to no avail, United Airlines was the only one that accommodated our situation. They offered us discounted tickets and we were able to make it home. I would like give a big thank you to United Airlines for helping us get home with no inconvenience.  Thank you United Airlines.

Newark to Houston. I booked first class a week ahead of time. A week later we rushed to the airport and still arrived an hour early before they boarded the gates. Right when we were at the desk they told me I couldn't bring my pet to first class. My mom had to argue with someone over the phone but since our time had been wasted and we were now in a hurry I had no choice but to downgrade my first class seat to economy. Not only did I end up wasting 150.00 usd but they also charged me an extra $75 to downgrade. The luggage were also suppose to be free for first class but of course I also got charged for them. While I had to literally run with two heavy carryon bags over to my gate my mom spoke to a customer representative and she was informed that a lot of their clients bring pets to first class. She even told my mom that we basically got scammed. We were trying to complain about this issue with the people working there but they have blatantly ignored us and made nothing but excuses. Service is not only really rude but they are basically scammers. We now have to argue with some people over the phone so I can get my refund. I highly recommend that you choose a different airline if you can. I hope to never do business with united again. Even my bad review doesn't do enough justice for these scammers.

route: Portland to San Francisco via Chicago
reviewContent: Portland to San Francisco via Chicago. Unacceptable customer service at counter. Flight attendants exceptional on flight from San Francisco to Portland. United now punishes you for choosing economy by not allowing you a carry on and charging you $30 per bag that you are mandated to pay or not fly. So every economy ticket is $30 more out of the gate. And if you are in a rush due to traffic car rental drop off etc., and get to the gate with bag that you have already paid to ck online, you will be charged $30 more for not taking time to check it which if you did take time to check it you missed your flight. We rushed to the counter for check in with mobile boarding passes in hand. They were three ticket agents and no one in line. and we were told they would not check bags because we were three minutes past cut off. There were five people in the security line and we would have made our flight if we had gone straight to the gate. Instead They rerouted us and that plane was delayed by two hours and at this point we do not know if we are going to make our connection and get home tonight.

Montreal to Seattle via Chicago. On 7 September 2018 I purchased two Economy Plus seats (upgrade) for our flight from Chicago to Seattle on 19 September (flight number UA8481). On 7 September I received an email confirmation that said our purchase was confirmed for Economy Plus seats and we had been assigned to seats 21C and 21B, exit rows. We paid $181 for the upgraded seats. On 18 September when I went to check-in, I was told our seats were 39D and 39E; the back of the airplane. I called the United help line and talked for about 90 minutes to Maria in their offshore site. I was reassured that the seats had been changed back to 21C & B. I was not convinced and talked to Supervisor and she too said our seats had been changed back. Upon my check in Montreal for our flight to Chicago, we received boarding passes for seats 39 D & E. The Supervisor said our seats had been given to standby revenue passengers and there was nothing she could do to get us back our seats. United without warning or any kind of communications decided that they know what is best for us and gave away our seats, after taking our money and saying the seat purchase was confirmed and we were assigned the exit row seats. United Airlines obviously does not care about its passengers and it is no wonder it is has such a low industry ratings for customer service. Their help desk is not to be trusted and wasted over 90 minutes of time. United did refund the $181 and gave us middle row seats of 9B and 10B, but we were not together and sat between some large passengers. I will never fly United Airlines again, as I do not trust them to keep their word. After this ordeal I emailed United Airlines, and they said they were sorry. I told them I am sure you are saying sorry a lot if this is how you treat your customers. We need to boycott United Airlines until they really get the message that they need to start treating their customers with respect.

route: Salt Lake City to San Francisco via Kahului
reviewContent: First left an hour late from SLC then when landing sat on the tarmac waiting for a gate for an hour which made us late for our connecting flight by 5 min which they could have held but didn't. Then to top it off they put us on a later flight and even though I paid for assigned seats ended up having to argue with customer service who didnt even apologize and was rude and very short with us. Very disgusted with this airline will never use United Airlines again.

Beijing to Chicago. Overall pretty good though United Airlines has a problem with lack of professionalism displayed by their FA's. The food and IFE were pretty good. The 2-4-2 cabin configuration was a bit cramped but not too bad. Seat comfort was ok though storage space was limited. This was a Polaris class flight BTW. We got off to a bad start before taking off when of all people the lead FA grabbed my wife purse to store it without saying a word. When my wife said she needed meds for her purse the FA turned this into power trip asserting her authority. I spoke with her before take off and told her we did not appreciate her approach. After all its not her purse and a simple explanation would have been in order vs. turning this into an argument. I also reminded her we had spend "a lot of money" for these Polaris biz seats and expected proper courtesy. To her credit she apologized and was most attentive during the rest of the flight. However I heard two other FA's gossiping about passengers with backpacks in a demeaning way. Unfortunately the FA's as a whole have a long way to go on terms of professional behavior. They could learn this valuable lesson from star alliance parties like ANA, Asiana and Thai whose FA's show true value towards the passengers.

Chicago to New York. I had a small personal item and suit. They asked me to check in one of those items because they are both considered personal items. I usually travel AA, but for unavoidable reason I had to fly United airlines for this trip. I have used other airlines with the same situation and they always give me a break because it’s just a suit and goes in the hanger closet. So I shoved my suit in to small bag because I didn’t want to pay for such inhumane thing. Even the FA’s at the gate seemed rude. This is the last time I’m flying United airlines. Never again. Very disappointed.

commentHeader: No room for carry on luggage
reviewContent: No room for carry on luggage was very inconvenient! We were not even the last group to board and they forced everyone to check the rest of their carry on luggage without letting any of us use the space under the seats in front of us to store necessities. I only had one carry on item as did my husband and was not permitted to attempt to fit it on the plane. When we got on the plane it was probably over 100 degrees and miserable. I saw plenty of room under the seat in front of me for my bag. I was reduced to carrying around my necessary medications and items in a trash bag so I wouldn’t lose anything. Very disappointed with this experience. Step it up United. I think incentive should have been offered from the beginning to those willing to check bags in order to not have this issue if it is known that your plane cannot accommodate the permitted carry on items or that people should be required to only store one item in overhead and one under the seat. Fix the problem.

San Francisco to Honolulu. As I was checking in a bag I arrived 3.5 hours before my departure time which was 2.05pm from San Francisco to Honolulu. We were then delayed 2 hours because the WiFi didn’t work. We had to sit on the plane whilst this was being fixed. Then we got onto the runway and a passenger in the seat behind me noticed a panel on the left wing was flapping, the air hostess said she’d check it out with the captain and then she came back and said ‘this isn’t right, the captain has said he needs to check it out’ - we were on the runway how did this not flag up before! This fault then left us delayed 1 hour, then 2, then 3 all the way through until 1.40am in the morning. I was offered a full refund - to which I wanted to take - but I was told that there was no way my checked bag would be leaving the aircraft so it’d be flying to Honolulu without me. This was the start of my travels so that bag had all my possessions in, including my medication! I was told I would not be able to retrieve my medication or bag! I explained to them that I wanted the refund as the delays were beyond a joke, to the extent that one of the managers from United airlines said ‘this has never happened to United airlines’. In the end we took off at 2am, I felt very forced to stay on the flight and I was told I would be compensated. The customer care team offered me a measly $150 e-ticket for another united airline flight - i explained how I am from England so I wouldn’t be able to use it. And in any case $150 wouldn’t get me far! I asked for the cash refund that I was originally offered hoping that someone in the customer care team would understand my frustration - but no they didn’t care at all. The e-ticket offered is laughable - my flight cost £270 which equates to about $350 so this $150 offered is a joke. Shame on you United Airlines , poor communication and poor customer service.

commentHeader: my carry on needed to be checked
reviewContent: Chicago to Denver. The gate attendant told passengers that purses were considered a personal item and that my carry on luggage needed to be checked. That has never happened to me before and I fly frequently on United from Denver to Chicago all the time. I got on the airline and asked the flight attendants if they changed something and told them what happened and they both stated that is was “personal preference to the gate attendants” as to what items can be brought on or not. I would think it would have to be based on the airplane itself? She was very rude and it should be a uniformed response.

route: Sao Paulo to Houston via New Orleans
reviewContent: Sao Paulo to Houston via New Orleans. United Airlines has the worst customer support in regards to missing baggage. My wife has been told for the past week that another passenger retrieved her luggage from the terminal carousel and that this passenger would likely have to return her bag in order to retrieve the proper bag since it was the only one left. We were told this for nearly a week. Then today we find out that the next day from the initial missing date, that passenger sent his brother to retrieve the luggage. Best part, luggage was given with first securing my wife's bag. This guest claims his brother did not grab any other luggage. We are told this a week later when prior to today we were told that we were waiting for this guest to return the luggage. This is beyond unacceptable. We were given no update that this had occurred until a week later! Their solution: file a police report so they can "process" the claim and access camera footage. This is unacceptable. My wife had priceless sentimental items from her family in Brazil that she will never get back. Thanks United your outsourced customer service was so helpful in making our life miserable for a week before we found out the truth.

route: Eureka to Los Angeles via San Francisco
reviewContent: Eureka to Los Angeles via San Francisco. I'm a bit disappointed. I spent a lot of time planning my trip down to see my mom, who has terminal cancer, only to find out the day before that my flight is cancelled. I had to reschedule for two week out, and lost my deposit on my hotel because of the short notice. Now, I have to wait two weeks more to see my mom, when she could pass at any time, and shell out even more money for a hotel. Not cool, United.

commentHeader: Not worth the money I’ve saved
reviewContent: Every time I have flown United in the last four months (5 separate flights) the plane has been delayed. This last time, it was delayed 2 hours leaving and coming back we were stuck on the ground right outside our gate for 35 minutes. I understand that often there are issues outside their control, but it seems unlikely that 5 times within the past four months was all out of their control. When there are problems they are not transparent and give very little information about what you can expect going forward. Up until now I have been flying them because they have had the best prices, but I would much rather pay more and not have to deal with this as often. And if this does happen with other airlines, I am always given more information. Not worth the money I’ve saved.

commentHeader: they don’t care for the people
reviewContent: Cancun to Seattle via Houston. Worst airline I’ve ever dealt with, we were delayed an hr and a half. Rushed through customs ran all the way to the gate showed up 15 minuets before departing and where denied boarding. Costumer service refused to help us with 3 little kids left us with 3 little kids to sleep in airport with no vouchers or any help, and they lost are check in bags. I fly all over the country for work and have never had any airline treat customers so poorly. It’s sad they are allowed to stay in business. All I can say is never fly United they don’t care for the people who keep them in business.

Munich to Washington. Reviewing United is not really easy. It is a huge airline and it is just not fair to judge them by just one experience. Fortunately I flew United in a couple of opportunities so I am able to provide a couple of reviews. In this one it is about Biz Class on an "old" B777. Well it is just one D Experience. Having a Biz Class with 2-4-2 configuration is just not serious. Seat too tight to sleep. Plane is quite old. Too many passengers for a crew that is however very nice. Food is decent. Entertainment is very good. Overall not very comfy for Biz Class flight. Look for B787 Dreamliner Review for a better customer experience.

Seattle to San Francisco. This is my second time flying with United this month. My first flight 2 weeks ago from San Diego to Seattle was delayed because of "traffic control " delayed at the airport waiting area and then once we finally were able to board the airplane they delayed the flight again. Lost of people were on connecting flights and they did not offer nothing more than to wait at the airport. Luckily on that one I didn't have a connecting flight. Now here I am again flying with United because who would of think their "traffic control" is a regular issue for them often. Again flight is delayed and this time I have a connecting flight that I might not make it on time. Their solution, "there is a possibility the other plane will wait for the passengers connecting to that flight" well my departure time for my second flight is 10:10 and I am arriving for my connecting flight at 9:58am. Unless I fly (not in the plane, like literally) I dont see myself making it to the flight. So I will be in stand by until God knows I will make it to my final destination.

Las Vegas to Los Angeles. Flight said it offers Wi-Fi. No Wi-fi was available! Flight attendants were only able to serve half of the plane the complimentary drinks. Incredibly uncomfortable and there's no leg room. Also the flight attendants were absolutely rude. I will never fly United again!

route: Albuquerque to Ottawa Canada via Chicago
reviewContent: Very small plane and totally uncomfortable for a 2 hour flight. The company had the gall to offer premium seats. The economy seats are terrible. Now I know why I love Southwest Airlines.

route: Los Angeles to Vancouver via San Francisco
reviewContent: Very disappointed by United. Their online booking system didn't process our reservation correctly even though I received a confirmation email for my purchase. They never acknowledged that their system was faulty and blamed it on my bank 2 hours before boarding. The bank confirmed that the transaction went through and still United told me there was nothing they could do about it. I then bought a new ticket in front of them and the same problem persisted. Again they blamed it on my bank. Long story short the customer service is completely clueless, they treat you like you a nuisance and won't even apologize for their mistake or for wasting your time. Highly not recommended.

route: Mumbai to Los Angeles via Newark
reviewContent: Mumbai to Los Angeles via Newark. Both segments had B777-200, but with different configurations and vastly different travel experiences. The B777-200 from BOM to EWR had 3-3-3 configuration with an old seat-back TV screen. The 31 inch seat pitch was inadequate for a 15 hour flight. The one advantage that United has over Air India on BOM-EWR route is WiFi. Unfortunately, the WiFi was not working, and United compensated me with 2,500 bonus miles. The food selection was average, and the timing of meals was puzzling. Instead of serving dessert after dinner, the flight attendants distributed sandwich and Kit-Kat bar. The B777-200 on EWR-LAX route was in 3-4-3 configuration and had no seat-back TV screen. The seats on this B777 were much slimmer. There was no complimentary meal service on this 5.5 hour flight. Overall, a very disappointing experience.

route: Louisville to Los Angeles via Chicago
reviewContent: United Airlines is the worst airline I have ever flown for having an issue with time. Tonight another delay of 2 hours. I have flown Delta and Southwest the last couple of years without a hitch. 3 times in the same time period United has issues. Last time for me. United can take a long walk off a short pier.

Houston to Roanoke via O’Hare. Very disorganized. Late boarding because incoming flight was late. Boarding stopped mid-way through due to thunderstorm, which never materialized. Delayed disembarking in Chicago because bridge was not working. No snacks because they forgot to board them in Houston. Missed connection as a result. Re-routed to Charlotte. Departing gate was as far from my arriving gate as possible, which seems odd since it was the same airline. Most of the staff were on the rude side. Gate for Charlotte trip got changed. No drinks because route was too bumpy. Arrived in Charlotte, sat on tarmac for 10 minutes. Just received email that 1 of my 2 bags didn’t make it to Charlotte. Might be ok, though, because I only checked in one bag! Overall, not a pleasant experience. Wasn’t really treated like a customer (despite all the printed propaganda surrounding me telling me otherwise). Not sure how they stay in business unless they are all like this, in which case I’m glad I don’t fly that often.

Bismarck to Norfolk via Chicago. Flight left Bismarck late because ticket agent was hand keying the tickets, so we missed our connecting flight. Instead of a 45. Min layover it turned into a 5 hour layover. Then our luggage isn’t in Virginia when we land. Still don’t know when our bags will be here. Do Not Fly United! The most unorganized worthless airline I’ve ever flown! I’ve even flown Tower Air (military contract) and they’re better. I only wish I could give them a zero out of ten rating, but the lowest is one.

Chicago to Louisville. Me and my family missed our flight due to the chaotic and confusing directions not given, but rudely yelled from staff while entering customs. Everyone in customs was confused, the staff was very unfriendly, yelling directions and arguing with people who did not know where to go or what to do making me sympathize with foreigners entering this country for the first time and receiving this type of hospitality. When I approached several different counters in the gating sections to ask for help, several desk employees walked passed me multiple times, with knowledge I was there for help as they were more interested in conversing amongst themselves or being on their phone. This was a terrible experience as the staff alone are all incompetent, rude, and very unhelpful. I refuse to fly with United ever again.

My flight from San Francisco to Honolulu had a delay of 12 hours until the middle of the night. At the beginning, we boarded the plane and waited for 3 hours for differents reasons until they told us that the plane had a problem so we had to get off. Each hour since 5pm they called at the microphone a “little” delay of 20-30 minutes and by now, I heard those “apologies” and excuses too many times. It’s midnight and we aren’t sure that the pilot will make it for 2am. It’s definitely my worst airline experience by far and I won’t ever fly again with United Airlines for sure!

commentHeader: Had to pay for carryon bag
reviewContent: Portland to Chicago. Horrible airline. Had to pay for carryon bag. Despite over fifteen open seats in the middle of the aircraft, passengers were not allowed to move unless they paid a ridiculous up charge. There was no sense of trying to do good to the customer, only trying to get as much money as possible at every opportunity. Will never electively fly united again.

Chicago to Knoxville. Attendant was rude and lied about why I couldn’t bring my small bag on because it had wheels. First he said it was an FAA regulation, then he tried to tell me it was a weight and balance issue, both false. I carried the same bag onto the same plane CRJ-200, 3 times in the last 4 days. It wasn’t until this last leg home that I ran into a problem! It would have also fit under me seat, but he wouldn’t budge! If they are flying under United, all regional carriers should follow the same rules! What a pain!

Before we booked our trip, we called the 800 customer service number to inquire if United offered discounts for retired military for baggage. We were told twice that two bags can be discounted (free) and show proper ID at ticket counter. When we were arrived, two staff members said that United did not offer free baggage and we had to pay $50 for two bags. We budgeted this trip and chose United because we didn’t think we had to pay for baggage so this was very upsetting. Then, our flight was delayed in TPA due to a flight attendant having the wrong schedule. It was announced they were trying to find a different employee but were unsuccessful. Then it was announced that we were delayed due to federal law of not enough time between flights for staff so that’s why they had to find a different staff member. Our flight was supposed to leave at 6:55 and we finally left at 7:40. We asked about our connecting flight in IAH and the gate employee said oh you’ll be fine, but don’t stop on your way to the gate. We had to walk very fast from terminal C to E and arrived at last call for boarding. This made this trip quite stressful instead of relaxing as what a vacation is supposed to be. To be continued for the trip back home, not a good experience either. Won’t be traveling United any time soon.

Atlanta to Newark. Horrible experience. The flight was basically empty I had no one else sit on the entire row with me and they would not let me bring both my book bag and suit on as an item under the seat. They started I had to pay 25$ and it had to be checked in as cargo because the flight was "full" and there was no space - all they care about is making an extra buck and not their customer service. Never flying with them again I'll pay the extra $ for Delta next time.

Los Angeles to San Francisco. Save yourself from hidden fees and humilitation: Never fly United. I think it’s no coincidence that all the airline horror stories I and everyone I know have have been with United. Their staff make up crazy rules about baggage - even small bags and backpacks - in order to secretly charge you more money, and I say sometimes because sometimes they tell you these rules and sometimes they don’t, every single staff member apparently has a different set of them. I have witnessed how they make their customers disassemble electronic-quipped bags in front of the boarding door, or made me stuff a cumbersome item into my backpack (to try make me pay for it) when later I was told it’s perfectly fine for it to be in my travel bag. Long story short, never fly United, and please tell your friends not to as well. You will be much better off paying $20 more for an airline that will not charge you hidden fees and not humiliate you. United is a terrible company.

I had a connection flights but my original flight from XNA got delayed by 2 hours. I had to go with my friend from Texas but unfortunately i couldn't catch her because they delayed the flight for two hours. Last time also i had same problem. Now whenever I have to travel I look for optional flight instead of United airline.

route: Maui to Atlanta via San Francisco
reviewContent: Maui to Atlanta via San Francisco. This company is a joke. Scheduled our fights 5 months in advance. They keep changing the times, the dates and now telling us we may have to stay overnight, due to their issues in refueling in San Francisco. They changed our departure by 2 hours and 20 minutes. Then they tried moving us back to coach, when we paid for upgrades seats. We get to the airport in Maui to be told our departure is going to be delayed even longer and they can not guarantee we will make our connecting flight in San Francisco to Atlanta. I would give them a zero. These people really need to get it together before no one flies with them.

Houston to Los Angeles. We boarded at 7:30 pm everything seem to be ok and we were on the run off ready to take off when he captain announced the plane has to returned to the gate due some mechanical problem, we were repeatedly asked to stay on the plane. After almost 4+ (11:30 pm) hours we were told the plane was fixed and that we would be taking off. 30 minutes later we were told they didn't have any flight attendants because they have to check out due “long hours” and if we waited a few minutes the replacement flight attendants were in the airport and on their way. After another hour of waiting we were told they couldn't get flight attendants and deboarded the plane. I was in lne trying to get in to the earliest flight posible and ask for arrangements to sleep since it was almost 1:40am airline personel where rude, refuse to make areangements to reroute baggage to my flight because there was nobody to do it at that time... they also told me as a local i was not entitle to accomodations they asked me to go home and return at 4am to board my new flight for the rest they keep telling people not to stand in line. United was completely unprepared, how could they not know if the repair took longer than 2 hours their flight attendants would time out. How did they not already have a back-up plan in case the repair took longer than 2 hours. they had plenty time to Make arrangements to help passanger they left stranded althdought they wait until last minute when everybody in the airport was gone, i even findout the flight was delayed until next morning by checking online before they announced it. Customer service is unexistant... even over the phone people lied to me with different stories and promises they knew they were lies, my luggage arrived late at my destination dispite several employees assuring me it was going to be on my new flight... on top of experience rude employee in IAH the phone personel are useless and several hung up on me.. nobody care how much they abuse passangers. Several of the United staff were clearly upset and they just stopped helping people and when I finally got to the front I was treated poorly. Every single employee i talked to redirected me to either complain online or file a form that could “possibly award me a compensation” within 10 business day after the incident. This airline has no sense of respect and value of peoples time and money.

San Francisco to Portland. We will now fly on Alaska Airlines when we have a choice between Alaska and United; United practices bait-and-switch by promising one price and then holding you hostage to pay a price to have a seat and to carry a bag.  Unethical and immoral.

commentHeader: not let me board the flight
reviewContent: Chicago to Oklahoma City. Terrible personnel out of the Chicago O’Hare Airport. Would not let me board the flight, gate attendant stated she saw me chanting (cheering for football, not yelling) in the sports bar across from the gate. Missed my morning meetings and basically got told by United Airlines Management to screw myself. I can assure you I was of no concern to that flight and will never ever again waste valuable money flying your airline. I wish I had the exact names of the individuals so someone who knows how to operate business at United could try and help solve their desperate need for people who don’t have massive power-trips by use of authority they have zero of. Bunch of goofs. I will never book a trip with United Aurlines again.

New Orleans to Indianapolis. I was very concerned when I broke my foot a few weeks before or trip and had surgery. I was non-weight-bearing and had a knee scooter. We called United two nights before the flight and they immediately did everything to be accommodating, changed my seat for free, changes my husband to be near me, described the process for boarding and leaving plane. We boarded four flights on that trip and everyone acted amazing, it was so easy, I am so grateful. Would definitely fly United again.

Los Angeles to Denver. First off customer service is terrible. Everyone was telling us something different and we could not get a solution for anything. We had a flight going from Los Angeles to Denver from there to our final designation which was Columbus. Our flight was delayed due to mechanical issues four and half hours which we would miss our other flight. There were two flights with Delta airline that would get us there on schedule but no one was willing to help and made us wait 2 hours so then we couldn’t make that flight. Now we are having to take an overnight flight which we did not want and we get nothing in return for this crisis. We even have to pay another baggage fee because we got transferred to a different airline. I would never fly this airline again in my life nor recommend this airline to anyone I know.

New York to Orlando. This was a pleasant flight. The flight attendant was fun and friendly and the seats were quite comfortable. The wifi was also surprisingly a bit reliable and the land service was a breeze including the boarding procedures. I would fly with United again. Also, the airline is quite generous when it comes to juice portions as they serve the whole cans and nit just on a plastic glass.

The plane had a mechanical problem, we were repeatedly asked to stay on the plane. After two and a half hours we were told the plane was fixed and that we would be taking off. 30 minutes later we were told they didn't have any flight attendants and if we waited a few minutes the replacement flight attendants were in the airport and on their way. After another hour of waiting we were told they couldn't get flight attendants and deboarded the plane. When we got off the plane we were asked not to stand in line and that they would call us by name and that they would give us a hotel voucher so we could come back in the morning to fly. After waiting more than an hour they asked everyone to get in line, then they ran out of hotel vouchers so had to sleep on the floor. United was completely unprepared, how could they not know if the repair took longer than 2 hours their flight attendants would time out. How did they not already have a back-up plan in case the repair took longer than 2 hours. I was second in line when they asked us not to be in line, why would they announce for us to get out of line and then tell us we have to get back in line and then tell most people, sorry there's no hotel. Several of the United staff were clearly upset and they just stopped helping people and when I finally got to the front I was treated poorly. I was asked why am I here and when I told them about the flight delay they said they didn't know anything about it and that they had just got there. I asked for my hotel voucher and they had to check to see if they could help me. I received a hotel voucher and by the time I got to the hotel there was enough time for 2 hours of sleep. United did a terrible job of managing the situation.

Chicago to Phoenix. Where do I begin, I can’t even find anything positive to say! The worst airlines ever everything was bad. Very uncomfortable seats and extremely rude staff. You can’t even ask them a simple question they literally just yell at you and don’t even use manners. I’d never fly with United ever again.

Edinburgh to Charleston via Washington. The flights to Edinburgh were ok but the planes we were on were very old and filthy. I used the warm towel they provide before the meal service to wipe off the center console between the seats and it was black. Yuck! The flight attendants were nice and the food was fine. Our return flights were not good. Our transatlantic flight was cancelled but we were not notified until we were standing in line to check in. We got a nice hotel room amd meals and the flight the next day was on time. But again the plane was filthy, the blanket smelled like body odor and had holes in it, and the wool throw smelled like a wet dog. There is no way those had been cleaned between uses. Again the center console was visibly dirty. I paid almost $5000 for this? The flight attendants were unfriendly and we were made to feel that we were an inconvenience for them. Our connection was in Newark and the plane we were supposed to leave on was diverted to another airport. Flight was delayed for hours while we waited for another plane. That one was United Express and that plane was very old and the interior was not maintained. My husband wents to the lavatory at the back of the plane and said there was a crack in the interior plastic. Part of my armrest was missing. I have to wonder what the state of the mechanics on these aged planes is like if the interior that is visible to the customers is so bad. I will avoid United Airlines whenever possible in the future. Think twice before you book with them.

route: Munich to Charlotte via Amsterdam / Chicago
reviewContent: Lufthansa/United failed to put my luggage on the airplane in Munich, for some unknown reason. Despite filing a claim, my luggage was still sitting in Munich three days later. Eventually, they flew it to Charlotte, NC where I had stayed one night upon my arrival before traveling onwards. I called every night to track the progress (or lack thereof) of my luggage. Even though I had updated the address from the address of the first night's hotel to the new location, every single time I called they had the address of the first night's hotel. Three days after my luggage arrived in Charlotte, I called for the 7th time because I still did not have my bag. They told me it had been dumped off at the hotel where I had stayed 5 nights before, despite the fact that I'd updated the address over and over. So now my luggage is at some hotel I stayed at 5 nights ago that I am not planning to return to. After an hour on the phone with United this evening, he's told me (for the 5th day in a row) that I should have my bag by tomorrow. United is incompetent. Over and over I heard them say, "I apologize for that, ma'am." It would seem that they've all be trained to deal with issues in this way, rather than by actually sorting them out. Very, very unhappy with United/Lufthansa and not fly with them again, even if it means paying extra to fly on another airline.

Denver to Philadelphia. The plane was delayed because of a warning light about a fuel pump after the flight was fully loaded. It then took 20 minutes to get a mechanic and another 20 minutes to figure out the warning didn't matter and we could fly anyway. "its a redundant system", they told us. The experience was made worse by the fact that there was no air conditioning during the period of the delay on a hot day in Denver. The airplane was not cleaned after arrival in Denver from San Francisco. I was stepping on crackers left on the floor and there was garbage left in the compartment on the back of the seat. My family flies UA regularly but this had me thinking I should look for alternatives now whenever I can.

route: Tokyo Narita to Hobbs via Houston
reviewContent: Tokyo Narita to Hobbs via Houston. I traveled alone with my 10 month old daughter both ways. No flight attendant helped me out in any way like putting luggage up in the cabin, picking up her toys for me, or even just being friendly. Everyone treated me like I was a hassle to deal with. One attendant refused to give me my bassinet because service had started, even though I had already been waiting for an hour. It only takes a few seconds to latch it on. One flight attendant actually made eye contact with my smiley daughter and waved, which was nice. One Japanese male attendant who I spoke to in Japanese, replied to me in English even though (he was speaking Japanese to the other staff so) I know he spoke Japanese. Why not speak back to me in Japanese? That is just plain rude. Other than that, after experiencing JAL last year, I thought the food was extremely disappointing. I also specifically made a phone call just to request a bassinet, but when I went to check in, there was no such request. I was baffled. I can’t say how disappointed and annoyed I was about the staff on both flights. If you are traveling alone with an infant, they will treat you like an inconvenience.

route: San Luis Obispo to Salt Lake City via San Francisco
reviewContent: Perfectly clear day. No weather problems. Delayed and we'll miss our connecting flight again. We have missed connecting flights several times with United Airlines. I hate to fly with them but this was the only option this time.

After arriving at the airport at 4:30am in San Diego we flew into Chicago. Little did we know we would not be leaving that airport for 36 hours. Our flight to our destination was scheduled to leave at 6pm. After our gate got changed 10 times and our flight got delayed further and further we scurried up and down stairs to each one. We then arrived at the last gate at 9:30pm. We sat and sat and were told no updates. We then were told we were waiting on the plane to arrive that we were flying out. The plane landed. BUT we only have one pilot, so we waited for another plane to land for a second pilot. Thenone of the flight attendants timed out on her shift and could no longer board our flight home. BUT by the time the other plane landed the staff timed out as we watched them walk right out of the gangway to the plane passed us never to be seen again. So, we waited on another plane for a whole new crew. We were assured for the first announcement over the intercom of the night that we were heading out soon! At this point it is 11:30pm. 30 minutes later, at 12am, we are notified that the flight is cancelled. after waiting 9 hours and running around the airport, it is canceled. This is not even the worst of it. We call United customer service to see what can be done 2 times (go ahead and listen to those calls- they are pathetic) only to be told there are no more flights to JAX and that we cannot be helped.  The couple in front of us got another flight booked automatically that left 6am the next day why our customer service experience was so different is beyond me. We ended up buying the only flight we could in a different airport. We ended up purchasing a flight from MDW in Chicago to JAX. Sometime after purchasing the flight I was so relieved to find one! That is until I realized the flight I purchased from Delta airlines was on September 27th when I need to leave ORD right then and there on now what is September fourth. So with even more stress added, I am out over $500 more dollars, I still have no way home, I have nowhere to stay no way to travel, I don’t have my luggage, I am defeated. So, after searching for some more time, there are no flights out of ORD to JAX for 2 more days. I ended up purchasing another flight for $935.60 from a different airline and airport in Chicago that did not leave until 1 pm the next day. We were left with no other choice but the sleep on the ground. So, it is now 1:30am. We are wondering where is my luggage that has everything I need in it and were told our luggage went to JAX already without us. It didn’t make sense. So, we then stood in another line and were told that our luggage is at ORD but if we exit to get it, we cannot get back in until the morning. So, we agreed to get our luggage in the morning before we spend another $40+ dollars to transfer to MDW where our new flight is.

route: Cedar Rapids to Toronto via Chicago
reviewContent: Cedar Rapids to Toronto via Chicago. First delayed flight due to weather, then after boarding there was a plane “malfunction” meaning we would miss our connecting flight. Couldn’t get us anything until the following night missing a day and a half of our trip! Then when trying to see if we could get a partial vs full refund depending if we canceled our trip vs still going they said those seats for the next day were now gone! Forget it what a joke! They were so quick to take my money but didn’t refund me for a checked bag I didn’t even take because of the cancelled trip. Phone customer service was just as terrible saying I had to fill out online for a refund when I told them it kept coming up with an error, sounds like lazy workers to me! Will not fly again!

Syracuse to Sacramento via Chicago. Never flying United again. If a representative is taking pain to go through the reviews (which I highly doubt), it’s high time to change your employees. What angered me was not the delays or inconveniences of last minute gate/terminal changes. That I can handle. What irked me was the sheer arrogance and attitude that each one of your employees show towards customers in general-especially the ones at Chicago O’Hare. I am yet to come across one who is civil and decent enough. As customers, we shouldn’t have to deal with your employees attitude and sarcasm. I give this airline zero stars. Nowhere else have I felt this poorly treated ever in my life.

San Francisco to Seattle. What a joke of an airline. The staff is rude and unprofessional. The whole experience was so stressful that I have sworn myself never again flying United. I don’t even think they care about customer service. The only nice people are the pilots!

Newark to Aruba. United cancelled my flight to give the seats to another group that was cancelled the day. Before then delayed my flight and cost me two whole days in an airport and 2 missed days of work . They offered a laughable 150 compensation to fly with them again. Please read before booking. They are over priced and have no one to speak to in customer service only emails and no phone calls or conversations. I will never fly them again and I suggest you do the same

Newark to Raleigh Durham. Flying United once again was a horrible experience. Even though a passing storm stopped several hours before the departure the outbound flight was cancelled. I had to go to a university to attend classes for one week and when I checked in on the rescheduled flight, the flight attendant made me check my luggage even though my luggage basically met the carry on requirement, which caused me to be late to my class though my rescheduled flight left at 6am and I had plenty of time to get to class by 9am. One the way back my flight was delayed 4 hours though only a 1.5 hour flight. Once I got back to my airport, because they made me check my luggage again, I was delayed another hour since the luggage were put into a room without alerting anyone. United airline operates giving zero consideration to the customer's time, paying good money. Their attitude seems to be ""we are doing you a favor"". The attendants are rude and I have never flown out on time nor reached my destination on time. United new carry on baggage policy is a scam. You have to board basically with nothing with you unless of course you pay more. It is a shame how United treat their customers so poorly and without much dignity.

commentHeader: put a damper on my day
reviewContent: Pittsburgh to Denver. It wasn't enough for United Airlines to make your life hell on the plane, they've overachieved and ruined your day before you even check in! I got to the gate to check in and immediately was informed I was restricted. Yeah thanks for alarming me. Then I'm notified my flight was delayed, but received no notification that this happened. Great, now I'm at the airport 4 hours early. But then it gets worse. I researched the night before and United states you are allowed a personal item and a carry on (sizes are listed) but they don't mention that it depends on the class. If you have basic economy you forgo your free carryon rights and must pay to check it in. Now they've put a damper on my day, trip and wallet. Then my flight was delayed 2 more times just to really kick me in the knees. Bottom line, I would much rather give my nonprofit salary to any other airline.

San Francisco to Medford . The flight was fine but we paid a lot of money and still had to pay more for baggage and to go on an earlier flight. We also paid to get premium economy so as to have a bit of leg room. The airline check-in was a nightmare. We were coming in from overseas on a different airline and had to re-check bags and get seats. There were kiosks, which I assumed were for checking in bags only. We wanted to try to get an earlier flight so I started to approach the “additional services” counter. However, the attendants started yelling that the counter was only for missed flights. The whole time we were there, the people at the counter were yelling at everyone to use the kiosk. There was no-one there welcoming us and answering questions, they assumed that we should know their process and yelled when we didn’t. After being in the UK and experiencing the polite service there, it was disappointing that one of our major airlines is so rude to customers. Frankly, I would rather fly Southwest where they will be polite to me and won’t “nickle and dime” me like United. Unfortunately, few airlines fly in/out of our little airport.

route: Wichita to San Francisco via Denver
commentHeader: I will never fly United again
reviewContent: Wichita to San Francisco via Denver. Horrible delays today without explanation from Wichita to San Francisco. Flight UA2188 from Wichita supposed to fly out at 6:25am, 4 hour unexplained delay. Missed connection in Denver. Flight changed to UA0733 that was also delayed 2 hours unexplained then canceled for flight UA3436 back to Kansas City at 3pm for connecting flight UA5312 to San Francisco which has now been delayed as well. Wide spectrum delays on United flights as a rule, come to find out, especially on the planes from Canada. The planes are old and in disrepair. I will have been bounced around 19 hours and missed a full day of work with expensive parking fees at San Francisco along with now ridiculous drive time. I will never fly United again and will not recommend them. I spoke with another passenger that stated they've been trying to get home for 3 days with United.

Newark to Delhi. Miserable employees especially entourage to lengthy nonstop destinations. Seems they should stay and work domestic. Hardly any courtesy or know how to respond to their customers. Maybe they are overworked. I had a terrible experience with a flight attendant who was rude and I mentioned other airline policies, she said well go fly with them then. I was simply asking her a question.

Paris to Newark. Very friendly staff (except one FA who was a bit cranky, but her colleagues more than made up for it). The food and beverages in business were good. The salads served for lunch and then for the pre-landing snack were fresh and tasty and the pre-arrival snack is a big improvement over the microwaved chicken or mystery meat wrap they used to serve. The seats on the 767-400 are still the old CO/UA BusinessFirst seats. Not bad, but not as comfortable as the new Polaris seats - which at this point you'd start to expect on NYC-western Europe flights, given what the non-US carrier competition now offers. However, we had plenty of pillows and blankets, including a cool gel pillow that was really comfortable. Star Alliance lounge at CDG isn't anything to write home about, but it was fine. The new United Polaris lounge the we used on our outbound flight is a huge improvement over the old United Club.

Tampa to Denver. Did not have a seat next to my daughter (she is 14). As I approached the service at the gate they ignored me for about 2 minutes and then told me rudely that they are not open yet. Second time after my trip in July which got me stranded in Denver overnight with no blanket or services or hotel room. I will try to avoid United and will never ever recommend flying United - service got extremely bad over the years.

United Airlines just lost a customer for good! Just finishing off a 2nd leg of a flight. The first leg from New York (LGA) to Houston (IAH) was an incredible 1st class flight with outstanding service. However, my connection from IAH to Lubbock, TX (LBB) was miserable. One would think that a tiny plane at 60% capacity with NO first class section would allow some flexibility, but apparently that’s not the case with UA. I ended up next to another 6’5 male in an already ultra-tight seating arrange (reason #1 I don’t fly United). I quickly felt like the ultimate “commoner” no longer in 1st class when asking to change seats to one of the 3 bulkhead seats with no passenger after the main doors were closed. “Sorry sir, only Gold and Platinum flyers are allowed” is not a comforting feeling after I just spent $1165 on a last minute first class ticket!! If that’s a company policy change it! That’s classless United Airlines. I didn’t request a first class seat. I requested a poor bulkhead with the tightest legroom of any carrier I’ve flown. I think the seat would have cost me $18, but it originally wasn’t available.

San Francisco to Seattle. I’m appalled by the horrible attitude from the ground staff in SFO. I was one of the last few to board (with 25 minutes to spare before takeoff), and was told that there was insufficient space overhead bin for the remaining passengers’ bags. I was asked: “Will your bag fit in front of you?” by one of the male staff, to which I answered “Yes, it’s just clothes.” I was then yelled at for no good reason. He said “I didn’t ask you what was in the bag, I asked if it would fit.” I’ve never been treated like this by service crew anywhere in the world. You would think that there would be some semblance of service!

route: San Francisco to Birmingham via Chicago
reviewContent: San Francisco to Birmingham via Chicago. Never again. Given a flight with an impossible connection. No way to travel over 2 terminals in 10 minutes. Logistics planner that sequences flights sucks as does customer service.

Flew Orlando to San Francisco. I travel on a regular basis, but not normally on United, Now I understand why! The gate agents, flight attendants and baggage workers are some of the rudist people I've ever met. They seem extremely incompetent and give you the run around if you have a question. I lost my wallet on a plane and it took me over an hour to find someone who could help me. I finally went back to the airport, which was a $60 Uber ride away to figure it out on my own. In addition, my husband was checking a firearm and it literally took 30 minutes to complete after being sent to several different places by several different people. I booked in economy because I didn't read the fine print that talked about the inflexibility of this type of fare. When we inquired about changing, they treated us like we were second hand citizens. Its not like the ticket was free, even if it was, that's no way to treat anyone. Finally, there was a child screaming at the top of his lungs on our flight and not one attendant offered any help to the mother. In addition, they didn't even insist that either of them put on their seatbelts. Unbelievable! Things look pretty in the terminal and everyone is dressed very well, however, the customer service is horrible.

I flew on a flight from Tokyo, Narita to Denver international, coming back from a family vacation. Our flight was a total of 10 hours and 10 hours and 20 minutes long. Departing time was 5:15pm - 12:35pm. The flight price was $1,394. I gave it a average of 7 stars, based on the overall stars of 21. I feel the value for money was not where you want it to be. The flight was bearable, but not extremely comforting, there were times where I had to really get creative in the position of my body to get at least 20 minutes of sleep. Leg room was mediocre at best. A passenger sitting next to me who was a little over six foot had 0 space between his knees and the seat in front, he sometimes had to press his foot against the seat in front. Seat Comfort = 2/5 - Value For Money = 2/5 In terms of the cabin crew, they were not nice, but they were not rude either. You could tell some flight attendants were a bit rough around the edges, wanted things to be done quickly. But some were more understanding and nice, but still have that edginess. That is all okay because they ended giving out some decent food. The problem I have with some airlines is that the food is just bland, and this is the same with United, but thankfully, they came with salt and pepper, good job. Dinner meals were okay, but breakfast was great. If your settling in for a long flight, try the omelette meal if they have it, the meal is rather delicious for airplane food. Cabin Staff Crew = 3/5 - Food And Beverages = 4/5. One thing I desperately have to mention is the washrooms in that airplane. I mean I had never seen anything like it. If your a person that frequently visits the washrooms, and does not like to wait, United might not be for you. On my flight, there was not a minute that the washroom was empty. There was also somebody in it, and there was also a lot of waiting, you couldn’t just sit at your seat and wait for someone to finish, because they’re people in line that will snatch that’s opportunity up right away. Man the washrooms on that flight were something I will never forget. My last topic is in-flight entertainment. I felt the roster of movies was pretty good, and I got to watch some very good movies, that are brand new. The only downside is the technology to watch it. It was a touchscreen tv on the seat, but to be honest it was challenging to use, a light press on the screen when you want to exit out will not work at all, and you might be stuck with thinking that your screen isn’t working and not watch a movie for the whole flight! But instead you had to press hard on every single button to get it to work. This is okay and is a lot better than the screen not working at all, but is frustrating. In-Flight Enternainment = 3/5 Well the flight was bearable, an above average flight as you can say, and above average is okay with me on a gruelling 10 hour flight but anything below that is a nightmare. Overall this flight was what you call plain mediocre. And if you have a bit of patience you’ll get though it fine, and if you don’t find another flight. Bearable, Above Average and Mediocre, are things that I feel itchy about, but for a 10 hour flight I would recommend it, but the price is a little bit out of hand.

route: Calgary to San Diego via San Francisco
reviewContent: I had a flight from Calgary to San Diego via San Francisco. The flight was delayed and my connecting flight from SFO to San Diego was already left. I have to stay at the airport for whole night . No other flight was provided or even Accomodation. Worst customer service. Won't recommend to travel with United ever. I even know this review won't make any difference to United Airlines

Jacksonville to Washington via Boston. My husband and I stay in airport from 10:30am until we thought our flight was coming at 7:50 only for them to announce that the flight is delayed. They couldn't offer us to go on another flight, they couldn't offer us a pillow or blanket to keep us warm and comfortable while we had to wait. Uncertain why the flight was delayed, they claimed weather, but other airlines were flying to our destination with no delays, because we had an economy flight we were treated less than.

I am a mom of 2 kids flying today from Dallas to Chicago. United asked me to reschedule the flight due to bad weather. After rescheduling my flight they sent a message stating that now this flight has been cancelled. We tried to book again the previous one but it was full at that moment of time. It's a terrible day for me, due to long weekend we had so many plans and all have been cancelled last minute. My elder daughter is so disheartened. The customer service representative will just say apologies and won't even give any benefits to you. Please don't book any flight with United Airlines if you are traveling on long weekends or holidays.

Hartford to Tampa via Chicago. First let me start by saying if United is your only option for an airline you may want to strongly consider driving to your destination, you will likely get there quicker. Second when your flight is canceled 90 minutes before departure because the aircraft is “not available” United will never tell you why, so do not ever expect any type of compensation for your loss of time or other expenses. Lastly, not only will you ever hear and apology, but instead the agents are rude and act like they are doing you a favor for rebooking causing you to lose an entire day of your time. Never again my friends, and yes please do use my real name! I rarely ever leave poor reviews but this is more than justified!

San Francisco to Frankfurt. Worst airline in the world is United Airlines. I'm a gold member for many years. The airlines constantly has flight delay, extremely bad or worst customer services - bad attitude of gate agent, attendants, and all known to everyone the worst food services among all the airlines I've experienced. I fly often with European and Asian airlines, even latin american airlines, all I have received much better services than from United. This is the latest experience I had just 2 days ago traveling from SFO to Reykjavik connecting at Frankfurt. Notified in the morning of departure, flight was delayed for 1 hour 15 min. I have 1 hour 35min connection at Frankfurt originally. Got to airport, the check-in agent said the flight should take off per new time and will arrive only 30min than original. It turned out flight was late departure for 2 hour 15min, and arrived 1 hour 10 min later than planned. And got text message at FRA saying they put me on the flight next day midnight arrival to Iceland. That is 1 and half day later. I only going to be at Iceland for 3 days. Then to make things worse, they couldn't get my baggage transfer to the new flight that I had switched to at FRA airport. Now I'm stuck at Iceland without any clothes and can't get out in the cold weather. Here is the contrast, at the SFO airport, a gate agent of United, at the elite / premium line, was extremely rude. I hand over my passport and he handed back and said "open to the photo page". With 1 hour delay, and line up, and even at the premium line, this is United's attitude. And to compare to the agent of Lufthansa airlines at FRA airport gate, the 2 ladies was very friendly, and went out of their ways to help me, and put me on a same day flight connecting to Iceland only 5 hour later than my original flight. They didn't send me to the United customer service, which is what I would expect any gate agent or airline services in US airports would do. They made many phone calls while asking me to wait and took care of everything and handed over my new boarding pass and told me they've notified baggage handling of my new flights.

Charleston to Houston. I paid for a 7:00a.m flight not 8:15a.m flight. Every time I fly United it’s never on time. I would recommend Delta or Southwest. United is a joke. If you would like to land late every time you fly, then fly United.

Booked to fly Baltimore to Syracuse. I cannot say enough negative things about United Airlines. This is is the second review I’ve left in the last four hours because I have very little to do since arriving in Newark. Delayed flights. Terrible customer service. Save yourself the headache. Every single time I don’t fly Southwest, I regret it. Do not make mistake I have made.

Rochester to Burlington. Absolute worst airline you could fly on. Found out our flight was over an hour delayed after arriving at the airport, however we needed to ask if this meant we would miss our connecting flight. Staff was completely unsympathetic. Gave us 2 options both would have us arrive at our destination a little less than 24 hours after our scheduled time. On top of that, the attendant was unsure if we would get a refund if we cancelled the flight. Again, completely unsympathetic. It’s 2018 United, try and figure out a better flying schedule so your flights don’t get delayed. In the future, I would happily spend extra money if this means I will not ever have to fly on United again.

Denver to San Diego. On July 22, 2018, I registered for the United MileagePlus Reinstate Challenge. It was my understanding that if I took a qualifying flight, then I'd reinstate 90,000 miles. However, after I took my qualifying flight, United told me that only 1,500 miles were reinstated. Given that they charged my $100, I asked for a refund since it was not worth paying $100 for $1,500 miles, but they refused. Their reinstatement challenge is a fraud so don't register for the program!

Houston to London. Worst return travel that never happened just because they were not able to match first name from a boarding pass to the name given on the passport. Instead of checking the surname on both the travelling documents and providing every possible proof that it was a booked by a family member who gave my Arabic initial instead of my actual first name. Every personal detail I entered and gave them such as passport no. DOB, Expiration date and ticket details all matched, but they still didn't let me go through. I'm baffled and wondering as to why didn't United rectified my ticket when I have given them my passport details and all. They took me to the TSA and adding salt to my injury, they kept me waiting for an hour, took me back to United Airlines and asked me to verify her details which the customer service on the phone did, but the United Airlines rep on the desk at the airport refused to verify it. The customer rep on the phone spoke to the rep at the desk and he still refused me to travel back. They have sucked the money out of me not only for the return ticket and $100 extra for an extra luggage I was supposed to take back to London today.

Portland to San Francisco. Worst airline to travel. They will try to suck money out of you in every possible way. They charged me extra $50 for 2 bags that were allowed free to carry on by all other 5 airlines in the itinerary. Also they insisted again and again that the “kind of ticket class” I booked, they are doing me a favor for everything. I am not sure how they treat economy passengers but it felt insulting at one point. It was unfortunate that I booked tickets through United Airlines. But I will not repeat this mistake again in future, it’s a lesson learned for me.

I was heading to Newark airport from Honolulu, with a layover in Denver. An electrical malfunction occurred on the flight causing the plan to land early in San Francisco. When I arrived at the airport, United Airlines' customer service could not find my reservation, they lost my luggage, and could not send me back on the same day. Please do not ever fly with United. It's really never worth the cheap price.

route: Los Angeles to Milwaukee via Chicago
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Milwaukee via Chicago. Never again. Leave Chicago late because “someone forgot to engage the steering”. Sit there for 30 minutes and they still call it an on time departure. Land in Milwaukee and the grounds crew wont do anything because of a chance of thunderstorms. I am sitting on the tarmac watching Southwest park and unload their planes. With their delay I am taking the time to write this review.

Rochester New York to Washington. I was on a small plane (2 seats per side) and I being a large man was also sitting next to a large man (probably the two biggest guys on the plane). There were 3 of 4 exit row seats open. They wouldn’t let us move because they the flight attendant said we couldn’t because we didn’t pay for them. They were already paid for but they didn’t show up for the flight. So she decided to make it an uncomfortable flight for us and then leave the exit row seats open which is a hazard.

commentHeader: charge for small carry on item
reviewContent: Portland to San Francisco. They charge you even for small carry on item. While delta allowed me to carry the small carry on bags United changed for both of them. This was the last time I did business with them. I think they will keep on losing customers if they do not focus on them.

Milwaukee to Washington. Terrible customer service. Because my ticket was purchased via 3rd party, it was deemed group 5. I tried to upgrade from economy time of purchase and check in but it would not let me. By the time you get to the gate you pay $50 for your hand luggage. Or you go back thru TSA to pay $25. Very hungry airline, seats are very tight. Stay away from them. Even Spirit is better.

route: Buffalo to San Juan via Chicago
reviewContent: Buffalo to San Juan via Chicago. My family and I were rerouted because we missed our connecting flight in Chicago when the first flight from Buffalo was almost two hours delayed. We were sent from Chicago to LaGuardia airport in New York and told that our luggage would be sent to LaGuardia. When we arrived at LaGuardia, our luggage didn't. We filed a baggage claim and were told that the luggage was still in Chicago but would arrive on a later flight. Since our connecting flight wouldn't be leaving until the next morning, we waited at the airport and when the last flight arrived around 11pm, still no luggage. We are now left without any luggage and we will be catching our cruise at it's next port of call. This means we will be without a change of clothes and toiletries during a one week cruise. United Airlines has only given us a lot of explanations why they can't help us. The only reason we will even be able to board the boat is because we purchased new tickets through another airline. After the humiliation and frustration that we have been put through by United Airlines, I would never recommend this airline. They give you a number to call but make sure that you can't contact a live person.

Maui to San Francisco We had a flight to Kauai from Maui which we could not make due to Hurricane Lane/ fires blocking all roadways to the Kahului airport. Because of this we could not go to Kauai. We had a return flight from Kauai to Maui connecting from Maui to SFO. We had already paid for our flight, we called in to see if we would have to do anything special with our bags. Then they informed us because we wouldn't be on the first plane in the flight arrangement they would need to "cancel" per policy and charge us additionally to schedule us a new flight, even though we already paid for two seats on a flight that is already leaving from Maui to sf which we would be on. United had "waived fees" for flight issues related to the hurricane up until the 26th August, but had no sympathy or sensitivity to the fact that our issue is directly correlated to the waivers they were issuing. Terrible customer service, terrible policies, terrible compassion, and overall I am not surprised with this experience given everything United has received heat for in recent history. I'll never book with them again. I have to believe our experience is part of UA's attempt to fix their stock price, never again. This experience was over the phone and not directly related to any flight attendants, pilots, or in flight experience. Just want to express the unbelievable ridiculousness we experienced with UA policies, call, customer service.

route: London Heathrow to San Fransisco via Vegas and LA
reviewContent: We had 4 flights over a period of 2 weeks with United. I have to say they are the best airline we have flown with. Leg room was excellent, staff were very attentive to our needs. Meals and drinks were of a high standard. Leg room and comfort were very good including pillow and blanket and flight entertainment was brilliant with so many movies, TV shows and games to choose from. It made our whole experience of flying so relaxed.

Las Vegas to Miami. Flight was terrible, tried to pay for seats prior to our flight but website was down so we spoke with customer service which promised us seats together with a window and in front, upon arriving the seats were not together. All staff members were unhelpful. Going home from Miami flight was delayed which caused us to be unable to make our second flight. They had no more flights until the next day and would not refund nor give us a hotel. So we will be missing work and lost a lot of money in Uber’s, hotel and food. Will not be flying with United again after lack of accommodation.

Newark to London. Get the seat comfort of Economy when you book Business class: the seat in business class was broken and could not recline. Quite annoying on a night flight. The crew tried to solve the issue but they did not manage to address it. The cabin was full, so no other options.

Chicago to Hartford. I'm currently sitting on a United flight as I type this.  Supposedly I checked in on my phone 24 hours in advance, then when i was in line to go through the general screening area the United app tells me I'm not checked in because I cant bring a carry-on with me. So now I need to get out of line and go back to speak with an agent. Then they tell me I have to pay for my bags to go through, $25 for the first bag and $35 for the second. And on the plane they stuck me in the last row. Where the people in front of me put their seat all the way back and my seat doesn't move! I paid as much as the person in front of me did, why did I get such a horrible seat? It wasnt fair for me to sit there all messed up, its ridiculous.On top of all of that, the plane is old, nothing is new. No tvs, no usb input, no headphones input, no entertainment, I am no longer a customer.

Flew United Airlines from Chicago to Toronto. My flight was delayed 2 hours because of weather, I know this isn’t the airlines fault but it was disappointing that they gave no snacks but did offer juice/water. It wasn’t anything special, the seats were pretty comfortable and the price is was ok.

This is the worst experience I ever had. I was flying from Boston MA to Atlanta Georgia via Newark with the flight scheduled 7:30 am with destination arrival 1:18 pm. The flight from the Boston was delayed for more than 5 hours due to thunder storm at Newark and the problem with generator failure at the gate which caused missing of connecting flight to Atlanta. After waiting in queue for 2 hrs at Newark, the boarding pass was issued for 5:40 pm that day(August 11th, Saturday). After the boarding was announced for 5:40 and the gate was opened for crew members, the plane was cancelled. There was already very long queue at consumer service there were no other options than standing in the queue because I was unable to reach customer service via phone. After waiting for line for more than four hours, the situation became very worse due to rude behavior of the customer service representative. She mentioned that next available flight is on Monday morning(August 13th) and there is nothing she can do to help. She also mentioned that hotel accommodation cannot be done as it is weather related although the flight delay from Boston was due to power failure at the gate as well. She convinced me to fly back to Boston next morning(Sunday) and forget about the family vacation or wait at airport until Monday morning. The representative walked away stating that she has other customer to take care of and asking me to make decision to wait until Monday or fly back to Boston on Sunday. It was already past 10 PM and my younger daughter(5yrs) was sleeping on my shoulder. The customer service representative did not came back to the window for more that half and hour and I walked to the next window and requested to talk to the manager. The guy at other window called their team leader who offered option for stand by tickets for next day and spend the night at the airport. I was already tired and hungry and there was no other option than crying or comforting wife and two kids. Spent cold night at cold airport floor. I was not able to get accommodated on 9 am flight on Sunday. I convinced my wife and two kids who where crying after loosing hope of getting flight. Next available flight for stand by was on 11:01 am. There was already about 60 people on standby list and I was flying in a family of four, so the hope of getting boarding pass was very minimum. But it was our luck to get boarding pass for 11:01 plane to Atlanta. I will never fly in United airlines until they review their policies about flight cancellation give education to their costurmer cervices representatives.

There was a delay of two hours at Washington airport. Once we were in the air, we landed early in Detroit and United Airlines had no instructions. We were only told to get off the plane and wait for instruction. After an hour of waiting they came to a conclusion that there would be another flight the next day. United did not help with any accommodation for a place to sleep in the night for any of their customers. When I checked into a hotel that I was forced to pay for, other people staying at the hotel had vouchers from the Amarican Airlines company because American Airlines cares about where their customers go to sleep at night in the event of a flight change or delay. The day of the flight there was no representative seen at the desk gate D10 from the hours of 7am-10.30am. There was no one there to talk or help any customer until the time of boarding. I sent in a complaint online and a reply came to me saying my request would be answered in 14-22 days. The representatives I spoke to on the phone for United airlines helped with nothing.

Bogotá to Newark. Definitely the worst flight experience in my life. A six hour nightmare. The space for legs is ridiculously small. Even smaller than Ryanair or easyJet. I couldn't even put my legs on the corridor because the crew was passing over my feet with the food's cart without any regarding. No vegetarian option. "Chicken or beef?" Even the bread was disgusting. Never again in my life.

Flew San Francisco to Denver with United Airlines. Flight was delayed 55 minutes and once boarded, we waited another 30 min to get permission for take off with no ETA provided after boarding. This lack of communication is unacceptable, we only made it to Denver at 1.30 am.

Newark to Boise via Denver. Was stranded in Denver overnight due to United's own issues. They refused to provide lodging. When I asked the customer service at the airport to provide lodging or compensation they replied "we realize this may be our fault but we can't help you and can't provide lodging near by and won't go to the effort". I asked him to document the conversation so I could follow up with customer service. He refused stating "I can't document activities for interaction with customers". Clearly he was poorly trained and was worried that his information was incorrect. Afterwards I followed up with customer service. I received an email stating that response time is 7-10 days. I received no response within the given time frame. When I responded I got another email stating the response time was now 14-21 days. Poor all around but par for the course for united.

United is the worst airline! I flew from Washington to NYC. My plane was diverted to Pittsburg due to weather. My bags arrived at LaGuardia even though I had to re-route to Newark.
