For your computer, you have to install certain softwares in order to stream them from your laptop. They offer food that they charge you for because it’s the passengers responsibility if they get hungry on a 9 hour flight apparently. The seat was tiny with the smallest amount of leg room you can imagine. Luckily I sat in the aisle seat so I was able to stretch my legs out into the aisle from time to time but if I kept my legs out for to long: a flight attendant would walk by having no promo em stepping on you or “inadvertently” kicking you as they walk through without any contrition. The flight attendant (I dread calling them that because they seldomly attended) would make her way down the aisle with a tray of coffee or tea, run out by the time she got to row 10 and never attend to the people passed that point. Finally when she did make it to me with her cart (which was 15 minutes before landing) I asked if I could get a coffee and cranberry juice and she snarled at me with the response “ok I really have to keep it moving”. Overhead compartments was so small and people were playing a really tricky game of Tetris to make their stuff fit in. The electrical outlet was humongous so my charger for phone and computer kept falling out and the only way I could charge is if I physically held the charger in the outlet. The food that I ended up paying for was gross and cold and the bread was stale and difficult to chew. They put up a sheer curtain between first class and economy so that you’re teased by the huge personal TVs and vast space they have. Clearly a ploy so that you only buy first class tickets since the alternative is physically painful. The bathrooms had toilet paper all over the floor (clearly no one tends to them during the flight). The call lights I would press for the flight “attendant” were just promptly turned off without anyone swinging by to see if there was anything that I needed. Honestly, so many more issues to list, it was mortifying flying with UA and I really do not know how they are still in business when you compare thEm to other American airlines

Absolutely horrible experience flying United from San Antonio to Cancun! I understand that things happen but United seriously dropped the ball today. Every flight was over and hour late, over booked and hot! Worst customer service when trying to get a new flight due to a 108 minute delay on our first flight causing us to miss our connecting flight. I was hung up on when trying to get a new connecting flight. Overall nothing has been pleasant about this trip. Unacceptable for how much money we passengers pay. If we can punctual for the flight so should the airline!

Newark to Ft Lauderdale. I’ve used United Airlines a lot this year (even flew from Florida to Hong Kong with them) and it has let me down every time. It has by far, the worst customer service. The staff is rude, super unhelpful and definitely not prepared. Absolutely every flight I’ve tried United has been delayed and I’ve had lost my connections. They never give updates on any information and when you ask for some they simply answer “they don’t know”. They do not care enough to help you fix things they just treat you like trash and relocate you, making it worse. Super awful experiences. I do not recommend United Airlines to anyone.

I want to acknowledge the special treatment that was given to my special need son while we flying from Frankfurt to Washington yesterday. The United airlines staff was very accommodating right from the moment we had to check in at Frankfurt. My son was given a priority tag on his wheelchair and consequently our whole family was treated the same way along with our son throughout. The guide stayed with us until we boarded the plane. The boarding counter lady was super nice and was really worried about getting us in first of all after the business class got in the plane. In the plane the flight attendants offered us every help possible and kept asking if my son is doing okay throughout. The lady attendant also brought my son a banana and some delicious chocolates, probably from the business class menu items. When we finally reached the destination not only we promptly received our son's wheelchair but also another special need helper was there with my sons name on an iPad displayed to guide us our way to the luggage carousel. I am super impressed they treated us throughout. We were a little hesitant to use the airline at first but now will use it over and over again.

Manchester to Houston via Newark. Never in my life have I had a worse experience with an airline. My two flights from Houston to Manchester were both delayed by three hours, but that's not even the worst of it! My flight back from Manchester was delayed over 5 hours! It was so bad that I missed my connecting flight to Houston and had to wait an entire day for a returning flight. And just when I thought I might finally be able to go home, that flight was delayed three hours too. When we finally got on the plane it took another hour to actually take off! I missed all my plans for the day at home because I was waiting 29 hours for a returning flight, and I now hate United Airlines with a flaming passion. Whatever you do, never ever fly with United Airlines, it is a massive waste of precious time and money and the awful service is nowhere near worth it.

My flight from Hong Kong to Newark then Dallas. However, on July 3 the storm would not let this plane landed, they had to fly to Boston instead. Although I had some difficulties but United did take care of me although they had many people to care for. They first gave $20 meal voucher, then after a few hours they could not find new plane, they booked me to a hotel and booked me through American Airline to fly me back from Boston to Dallas the next day. This is the first time I experienced this problem, but they did take care of us. I want to say thank you.

Boston to Orlando. My overall experience was absolutely terrible, my inbound flight got delayed four times and a total of 3 hours. When I finally got to my destination and asked for help at customer service they said they couldn’t help me, not to mention that I had to wait two hours to get my suitcase worst start to my vacation ever! Wait but it’s not over getting home my flight ended up taking off late but I wasn’t surprised at all! Then getting to the airport my suitcase was put on the wrong airplane and I had to wait a hour and a half again. Overall experience was terrible and unless I can feel valued right about now I will never be riding with United and will recommend to anyone not to take that airline either.

Flew roundtrip Chattanooga to Portland, ME I have not flown for several years, so prepared for challenges. Well, kudos to TSA recheck. Made security one big breeze. The plane in both directions were very small and had no overheads to accommodate the regulation size carryons which was included in my fare. Flying Economy Plus? Not sure, they have so many different levels depending on what a la cartes you picked! First the ticket agent in Chattanooga made me check my carry on and pay  $25. When got to gate the same agent gave everyone in boarding area baggage tags to check them for free on the jetway! Did file complaint with United and they have responded to my issue with a refund, so one plus for them. But, the agent, hopefully, will be reprimanded. It was dishonest to charge me and I did not realize till I boarded plane. Return flight, we got in early. They did not have bags in jetway as we deplaned! Instead, we waited 45 minutes after 11 PM for bags to enter carousel in baggage claim. Very exhausting that time of night. Why did they not make it convenient for us to grab as we got off plane? Overall, flying pinched inside a tiny seat with little leg room was awful. the plane was 57 degrees on return flight and stewardess said they were working on -  did finally begin to warm after 2 hours, just before landing. Did not partake of the free drinks and pretzels, so can't speak to snacks, seem crazy in short legs of flight. Would not look forward to flying again and booking online. Too many options you can pick from that just keep adding up and seem annoyingly presented on entire page to get you to spend more. Used to fly a lot, and will not miss it if never go again.

commentHeader: kept trying to get money from me
reviewContent: United's flight from Denver, 1.5 hours late. Missed airport pickup, had to pay for another ride $28. Pilot said we were waiting for mechanics to come to tighten some bolts (I do not know if he was speaking seriously). Food on board not as described on menu: hamburger had no lettuce, tomatoes, or pickles as promised. As small as it was and served bare it was just like a 99c white castle hamburger. Seats comfortable and cabin crew kind and gentle. Agent at PSP kept trying to get money from me: first he claimed I'd have to remove 3 lbs b/c suitcase was 73 lbs. He had another bag on the scale. After removing it he said I was 1lb over and I said that 23 kilos is 51 lbs. He didn't care. Then insisted I pay $25 to check a suitcase even though was making an international connexion to one of their partners, but the swarthy 20-year old doesn't know what qualifies as a connexion. I couldn't convince him or his supervisor and they refused to call a ticketing expert. I was firm and insistent but because this supervisor told me I was rude (limited vocabulary), I paid the fine. I am constantly baffled that people who hate coming into contact with the public and who have no talent for customer service seem to be hired by United again and again.

Our group was returning to the US after two weeks of international travel. At the United terminal we endured an overbooked check-in with rude ground agents. Some of our group waited for seat assignments until the plane was almost fully loaded despite the tickets being purchased a year in advance. The inflight service was just as rude as what we experienced in the terminal. Air New Zealand (the service we used in Australia and New Zealand) by comparison was staffed with a pleasant, polite and accommodating in flight crew. United needs to revisit customer service training of their entire staff. Improvement is sorely needed. Very disappointed and dissatisfied!

Norfolk to San Diego. Worst experience I've ever had flying. Every gate they told me to go to was wrong. I had no forewarning over the PA or on the website, flight gets delayed. These people have no care for your time and provide no real service or anything they just want your money. I'm never flying with United again. I've never had an experience this displeasing flying across the country.

route: Palm Springs to New York via San Francisco
reviewContent: Palm Springs to New York via San Francisco. You always know discourtesy is coming when the airport clerks refuse to wear their name plates. Charged me $25 for suitcase even though am making an international connexion. Agents don't know LGA and JFK are "co-terminals" in NYC and that an Intl connexion in North America is 12 hours. Although I was the only customer there they refused to call their international desk but instead called me "rude" because I was firm. I just paid the fine because I know the next step after they call you rude is to call a SWAT team to arrest you. This is usual customer service in 2018. They just want money and they want a lot of it.

First time flying with United and last time. Horrible experience our flight was canceled just when we were on the plane ready to leave, not delayed, canceled! They kept giving us the runaround, they aggravate the customer even more with their senseless behavior. I don't recommend United.

Terrible customer service. My wife missed her connecting flight because of a delayed flight and had to sleep at the airport because United would not get her a hotel. Not only that, but they did not offer anything else for the inconvenience. Will never being flying United again. They do not take care of their customers at all!

Newark to San Antonio. Worst airline ever, 3 hours delayed and still sitting. Pilot and staff have no idea when it is going to be on air. I frankly don’t know how it is in business with such low ratings.

commentHeader: worst airline I have ever flown
reviewContent: Traverse City to Newark. This is the worst airline I have ever flown. Every time I have flown United there has been delays. The weather is perfect both in my departing city and arriving city. There are no mechanical problems with the plane, but now we are sitting in the runway delayed for 1 hour. They give no explanation for the delay and no compensation Is provided. I am on a very small plane with only 3 seats in a row and no room for overhead storage. This airline should be ashamed.

route: Las Vegas to Chicago via Los Angeles
commentHeader: first and last experience with them
reviewContent: Las Vegas to Chicago via Los Angeles. On a business trip. Aircraft were relatively old and nothing special about the crew or the flights. The problem occurred when was flying from ORD to NYC LaGuardia LGA flight was supposed to leave at 5pm suddenly flight got cancelled without further information except due to weather conditions. The 4pm flight is going ahead and the 6pm flight as well. To my surprise the 3pm, 5pm and 7pm flights are cancelled to NYC however the 4pm, 6pm and 8pm flights are normal operation. Then the chaos started tried to rebook myself on a standby for the 6pm flight didn’t work out checked with the United staff and they are probably deaf or not listening or helping not knowing where my luggage are or how to locate them or where to go. No one from the ground staff is helping and all they say it’s due to weather we can’t help you and there’s no further flights to NYC till tomorrow afternoon while I have to attend an important meeting at 8:30AM. This situation was just a joke. Eventually located my luggage which already been sent to LGA on the 6pm flight which I don’t understand how would they send luggage without the passenger being on board the flight and had to queue with my colleague for almost 2 hours to rebook ourselves. When we reached the counter the only option the clerk gave us was to rebook to Hartford which is 2 hrs away from NYC we had to accept that and sort ourselves from Hartford then that particular flight got delayed which makes it arrive in Hartford at 3am which impossible for us to find our way to NYC. Eventually we booked ourselves on a different airline and paid 500 USD each for a one way ticket from Chicago to New York City. Seriously the most unorganised airline in the world. Later on we discovered that they had a system failure and that’s why they couldn’t operate certain flights but to avoid compensating passengers or booking hotels for them they delcraed it’s due to weather. Will never fly with this airline ever again. It’s the first and last experience with them.

Fort Lauderdale to Houston. Somehow United managed to turn from one of the best airlines in the US into the worst. Dated website and check-in portal that looks like it was developed in the 90s and has not been changed since then (especially the online check-in), non-transparent seating assignment for basic economy; I somehow end up at the very end of the plane almost every flight and sometimes separated from other family/friends on the same itinerary, despite early check-ins. Anyone from United can explain that? The airline has a low grade low-coster feel to it - old planes and dated looking everything. Did I mention the prices.... the ridiculous prices they charge for everything - even for basic economy airfare? Well there is a flex-economy, and a premium economy, and maybe an economy plus and economy XL to be added sometimes soon, but don't be optimistic with the names of tariffs. The price for airfare is ridiculously expensive, especially if you are based in Houston and out of luck as you don't have access to other airlines (United must be lobbying this very hard). Even the most basic economy option is way too expensive for domestic flights, especially if you want to pack up a swimming suite with you in a small suitcase as there comes the baggage fees, extra baggage fees if you take your small checked suitcase on board, pay if you want to sit next to the isle or window, or your family member, pay for obsolete entertainment options: lack of free wifi yet extremely slow if you finally decide to swipe your card for it. My favorite - pay if you want to watch Direct-TV on a contrast lacking micro-screen in front of you - a paid streaming TV on board of a plane - You. Must. Be. Kidding. Me! Culmination of this "entertainment" system happened on my recent night flight from Houston to Miami. The system glitched completely and was stuck in startup loop during the whole flight blasting that 100% brightness Direct-TV logo on and off (in my face!) the whole night without possibility to turn that screen off. Now to the meals and snacks! - What snacks!? - Ah the mini-pretzels and and that is it. At least soda and the lavatories are free for now! I have flown many airlines, and can confidently say that Easyjet, Southwest, AA and Delta are all better airlines then United, by all means - price, comfort, entertainment, convenience and transparency and fairness to its clients. How come I am able to fly between Miami, Vegas, LA and NY for 200-300$ with other airlines but it costs me at least 300$ to fly to the nearest major destination out of Houston, which most of the time is half the distance of the above-mentioned flights? How come low-costers in Europe can get you from Norway to Spain round-trip for 100$ while this behemoth is crying going out of business if they lower the prices. Unfortunately I am currently based in Houston and don't have much access to other airlines due to long lasting monopoly of this company on the local market so have to unwillingly stick to it. On the positive side I can mention ground and cabin crew. These folks are always welcoming. I used to like United Airlines back in the days, but if today you ask me to characterize and summarize this airline in 4 words, those words would be: expensive, dated, unfair and non-transparent.

This is the worst airline, I thought it was Spirit but no its United Airlines. I flew basic economy and they give you nothing. If you do not pay for a bag you get treat like a third class citizen. I was not allowed to check in online I had to go to the airport to check in and then see an agent so she could check my bag to make sure it wasn't too large to fit in the small box. I asked for assistance, the agent was very rude, she never came to help I had to figure things out myself and then on top of that I still didnt even get an assigned seat. After checking in you have to go to the to the gate and let the agent give you a seat after everyone else is assigned, this is only one step above standby. Everyone was scattered throughout the plane and no one was sitting with their family, people had to switch seats on their own. I paid for a checked bag for my wife and her bag never made it into the plane. We were told that they would have to deliver it. We arrive oh are at 7.30am and the bag wouldn't be delivered until after 2.30pm. We had to contact her doctor to call in her prescription to the pharmacy because it was in her bag.

Flew United Airlines from Nashville to Alaska via Denver. Worst flight ever. Cable didn’t work, headphone port was broken, sat on the tarmac for over an hour after landing and crew was unsympathetic and rude. This is why I fly American.

Buffalo to Chicago. Terrible is not even close to how bad this airline is. To begin, my flight here was delayed a full hour. Now my flight was cancelled last minute and after trying to contact the company they said our only option was to travel back home 2 days after  our scheduled date. We asked about stand by and they said there was no way we could do stand by because the flights were completely booked. First of all that's a lie. Then they said they'd be able to get us on separate flights one at 11am and the other at 550 the next day. So we accepted since it's better than waiting 2 days. we decided to go to the airport an hour after talking on the phone since we weren't near the airport at that time and the man on the counter said we were able to get on a flight that same night which was the flight after the one we were scheduled to get on but since the other lady had already booked our separate flights it was no longer an option. So already beyond annoyed at this point. My friend then goes to the airport at 8am the next day for his 11am flight and they tell him that there's plenty available space on the 830am flight!  How was this not mentioned the day before. He barely made it to the 830am flight and then I decided to head to the airport straight after to see if I can get on the next flight home. They finally allowed me to do standby but 2 flights later still no space according to them. I am missing work and important meetings because employees don't care about their customers. I will never fly United again.

route: Beijing to Rio de Janeiro via Washington
reviewContent: So disappointed! Actually the cabin staff were great, but there is no support of the company if the flight got delayed and you end up losing your transfer! I am now in Washington airport and I need to wait for one day, my flight in Beijing delayed for 2 hours, and consequently I lost my flight to Brazil, the company gave me no help, no place to stay overnight, only gave me a coupon that I could call a number so I could get discount for a hotel. I called the number and there was no available room, they gave me two choices: or you call the number and stay in a hotel or you spend the night inside the airport. Which kind of airline company does that? I unfortunately wouldn't recommend this airline due to this issues.

Tortola to San Francisco. United have no regard for their customers. We (group of 6) booked our flight 6 months ago. In that time our flight has been changed 4 times. A little over a week ago our flight was changed again and we called the airline to make sure that we would make it to our connection in time; we were assured that we would. Yesterday, halfway through our vacation, they changed our flights again. Now we are not on the same airplane and don’t have seats together and United are claiming they “cannot” upgrade us to economy plus so that we can all be together without charging us extra money even though our flight situation is all due to their screwup; they put us on a flight which they claim is illegal due to the narrow connection time being impossible to make. My family is done taking United flights and we are closing our United credit cards; this airline has gone so downhill it is in no way worth the cost.

An absolute nightmare. I am a 1k premier member only due to business travel. United has the absolute worst customer care in the industry. A result of grossly deficient leadership in the corporate office, where accountability is a foreign concept. I feel for those United employees that truly do care and try to help customers. I fly approximately 25 flights a year with United. 70% are delayed or I experience an issue. I dream of the day when I no longer have to board another United flight. It is very sad to see what United has done to a once proud and enjoyable carrier called Continental. I have attached a picture of the customer care counter where four agents were available despite 13 kiosks.

Los Angeles to Newark. Worst airline. We booked basic economy on orbitz and we did not know this had no carry on and we had a 6 month old baby. They made us feel terrible because we asked to take one carry on which had the baby stuff. My husband and I had to sit in different area on the airplane even though we have a baby and they were very rude to us.  Never ever will fly this airline.

Tokyo to Washington. Poor value. We paid over $10,000 for round trip from Louisville to Ho Chi Minh. The flight over was via ANA with the usual excellent experience. The return is via United and I am not at all happy with the business class cabin. I’m in an inside seat with a row of four. I’m 6’2” and I’m not able to lay in this park bench seat. Do your research before booking. I’m going to spend the next 14 hours stuffed in a sardine can.

My parents and I flew from San Francisco to Honolulu with United. The flight was operated by a B737 and did not have flatbeds in the premium cabin, but the seats were comfortable enough to sleep during the flight. The crew was very nice and greeted us with an Aloha. As probably everybody else on the plane we were on vacation and everybody on the aircraft was in a good mood. The service and the crew were perfect and I enjoyed my salmon. The departure was punctual and everything was to our satisfaction. I would choose United on my future flights and recommend this airline.

route: Calgary to Flint via Denver / Chicago
reviewContent: Calgary to Flint via Denver / Chicago. I had six different flights. Of the six, 5 left late for a variety of reasons. I am highly disappointed in United Airlines. I had to rush and rush and rush, to get to my gate, and the flight was delayed. I was not pleased by all this lateness.

commentHeader: United is now my last choice
reviewContent: Kansas to Frankfurt via Chicago, connecting to Cairo. My wife broke her hip in Jerusalem requiring a hospital stay and an immediate return to Kansas as well as a cancelling of vacation stopovers in Athens and Germany. United charged us an additional $9500 which was approximately the same as what we prepaid for both of our First Class tickets. They would not bargain, at all. As my wife was in great pain and an immediate return to the US was needed I had no choice. I contacted United upon my return to no avail. United is now my last choice for flying overseas. We are returning to Europe soon and have friends there. We always will fly First Class, just not with United.

route: Los Angeles to Pittsburgh via San Francisco
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Pittsburgh via San Francisco. It was a rough trip flying back home to Pittsburgh. My family and I woke up bright and early at 4am to avoid LA traffic. Our flight was originally around 6-7am but then I was notified of a delay. Because we had a layover, we would not make our second flight home. I had to change my flight last minute which was fine because we were only maybe an hour behind schedule. My family and I were finally on our first flight and I was getting ready to sleep for the next 5 hours before landing in DC. I believe it was the autopilot who came on to talk about how they were having issues with the plane but he assured us that they are working on it. First they had the maintenance people come, then there was something about paperwork needing to be signed and finally, the autopilot mentioned that the gas was in the wrong area or chamber. I've sat on this plane for maybe an hour and half and now I'm rushing to call customer service to get me on the next flight ASAP because the flight was cancelled. Apparantly, the next two flight to SF was booked but my family of 3 can be waitlisted in case someone canceled. Did I mention that one man was absolutely going nuts when we all got off the plane? He mentioned something about his brother is on life support. There was also a huge line of people waiting to be waitlisted. However, I manage to book a flight for 12:58pm. At this point, my family and I have been at the airport for 7 hours. Finally, we get on the 12:58pm plane and we land in DC on time for our flight to Pittsburgh. It was storming on and off while on the first plane with plenty of turbulance. We were also delayed on the second flight! I thought they were going cancel our flight due to weather but they didn't and we did manage to get to Pittsburgh around 11-12pm. United Airline actually gave my family $300 for our next flight but the chances of us flying ever again is slim. This whole trip was an absolute nightmare with the delays and cancellation. On top of that, sitting in economy class is the most uncomfortable place to be. Honestly, take some advice from people who make genuinely comfortable lounge chairs with cushions in it please. There was absolutely no support at all and no room on the plane. The only good thing about the flights was that I was given free apple juice. I will never fly again if I can avoid it.

Newark to Reykjavík. This is so far the worst airline from my experience. The flight was supposed to depart at 10:30pm and it’s delayed for 7 hours. It’s worst of all worst airlines. We were not given any food/water and place to stay. I have decided not to fly through united irrespective of the cost.

Los Angeles to Melbourne. United just don't get it despite what their competition is doing. I've just paid over $8,000 for a business class ticket return Melbourne Los Angeles and get asked to pay for "premium" scotch in their new lounge. We're not talking about top shelf scotch either - try standard 10 yr Glenfiddich at about $50/bottle. For free one can have some bottom of the rung local bourbon. United don't seem to function with anything other than a penny wise, pound foolish philosophy. I am looking forward to booking with Virgin Australia or Qantas for my next similar flight. On the flight over I was underwhelmed by the cramped business class capsule. The seat was comfortable but I'm slim. And I felt that I just fitted into the seat width. Service was non existent. Had to ring the service buzzer twice for water. Never handed out bottles when lights go out like other airlines. Neither did they go around asking selfish passengers to close their window blind when most were trying to sleep with daylight outside. On a 14 hr flight this is detrimental to all the other passengers wellbeing as it made it hard to sleep. There is basically no storage in the capsule in front of one, or to the side. The limited storage is behind and to the side, right where all the cables for headphones and chargers sit. Their business class cabin looks cheap. It is serviced like a cheap budget airline. But they know how to charge like a premier airline. They can't even offer a business class passenger before departing on a 15 hour flight a free scotch. Except you can have a very cheap bourbon. Cheap seems to be their mantra.

I was scheduled to fly from Washington DC (IAD) to Newark (EWR) with United Airlines and then continue via SAS from EWR to Copenhagen. Due to weather issues in the greater NY area the United flight was delayed by 6 hours and my connecting flight had left when I arrived at EWR. At IAD I had explained to United agents that my luggage was checked in all the way to Copenhagen, and that I needed guidance regarding if/how/where I needed to pick up my luggage when arriving in EWR. I was simply told to explain my situation to United agents when arriving at EWR. Following guidance from the United flight crew I stood in line for two hours to speak to a United agent at the United EWR customer care booth located next to my arrival gate. When I finally talked to an agent I was asked to go to the United baggage claim booth. After having waited another hour the United baggage claim agent informed me that she had located the luggage, but that I had to wait at least another 5 hours for my bag to be brought to the United baggage claim area. I was then told to show up 8.30 AM the following day to collect my luggage (*note that after arriving at EWR Scandinavian Airlines had manage to re-book me via American Airlines to go to Miami and then via a SAS flight to Copenhagen). By the time United told me to leave without my luggage it was 12.30 AM in the night – 12.5 hours after departing IAD airport. I was offered no hotel options. After having spent 35 min a cab to reach a friend’s apartment in NYC I spent another 30 min in a cab ($150 out of pocket) and returned to EWR 7.30 AM the following day to collect my luggage. A third United agent then told me that they could not locate my luggage in their system and that it likely was with SAS. I was then told that since the SAS office only opens 9 AM the right thing would have been to wait the five hours the previous night. This conversation took 30 secs and it was made very clear that this was not United problem and that I was advised to board my American Airlines flight without my luggage and file a lost luggage complaint with SAS upon arriving in Copenhagen, which I then did. I arrived in Copenhagen 8 am and had to continue straight to my air-bnb and then to the university. At this point I had slept 2-3 hours since my departure at Dulles on the 19th (2 days ago) and I had no new clothes to change into. Upon returning to IAD from Copenhagen on June 24th I still had not received my luggage. After being passed from one United agent to another at IAD I was told that my luggage was at EWR. I filed a lost luggage complaint with United and since received around 10 text messages saying that my luggage was not located. Early morning 12.39 AM on June 27th, while asleep, I get a text by a private company contracted by United stating that they are “attempting to deliver my luggage” and I am asked to call/text to confirm my address. 6.02 AM I write back to confirm my address and I text the private agent to call me before dropping off my luggage. I leave my apartment 6.40 AM only to discover that the private agent had left my luggage outside my building without notifying me.

Washington to Frankfurt. United Airlines continues to disappoint, which is why I have not flown them on an International flight for 4+ years. Was attracted by the "hype" of the new Polaris service, but it is much-ado-about-nothing. IAH President's Club is a joke. The beer & wine selection is limited to 1 or 2, or they want to charge $9 for a drink - nice touch after you have paid $5,000+ for a ticket. Food offerings consisted of some trail mix, some cold veggies & some soup. How United believe they can compete with this type of inferior International service is lost on me. No United Execs have apparently never flown on the International competition, or they would be embarrassed to hype Polaris. Flight attendant came around 1 time during the 1st hour of the flight - once. I had a glass of red wine, but when she returned for her 2nd visit, she announced they had already ran out of red wine for the remainder of the flight. This fairly well sums up the entire United approach to their International business class product. Won't fly them for another 4 years.

Los Angeles to Houston. Yet another dumpy old United plane. Further underscores why I never fly United for my International trips, and rarely fly them domestically. The only consistency with UAL is their continuing ability to disappoint. Both in equipment and service delivery. Even if you have a 1st class ticket it does not gain you entry to the UA Club Lounge, but that is no big loss, since UA's lounges are below mediocre at best. United, like American and Delta, are the best sales promotion tools that International airlines have.

Phoenix-Skyharbour to Chicago O’Hare. My flight departed from Terminal 2, which was a nice and quiet terminal without the regular airport hassle. There was no line at check-in and no line at security control. My flight was early in the morning and I had a light breakfast at the United Club. Interestingly enough, UA operates their won lounge at Phoenix: Staff was nice and the food offerings more than sufficient. It was a nice and calm lounge and the staff was very friendly. Even though it was before noon, the bar was already open and I had a drink or two. Boarding process at the gate was on time and professional, with us boarding in our boarding groups. The flight was good and the Economy Plus seat was comfortable and offered enough space. The A319 was stylish and had leather seats, Wifi and personal entertainment. Friendly crew, tasty food. I cannot complain and would choose United again.

Chicago to Munich. I reserved a seat in the Economy Plus section (emergency exit). Boarding was punctual and efficient.  I slept almost the entire flight. A friendly flight attendant woke me up for dinner to check if I would need anything. Whenever I woke up a couple times during the flight I saw that my empty water bottle had been replaced by a fresh one. I missed the ice cream but the flight attendant had reserved a cup for my breakfast. Seat was comfortable enough. I just used the TV the last hour before landing but the variety of programs is good. All in all a good flight with a friendly crew. I recommend United Airlines.

Houston to Frankfurt. Seats are much too narrow - you’ve got to hug yourself in order to leave your neighbor alone. My girlfriends entertainment system kept crashing. Everything seemed to be outdated and a bit dirty. Legroom in Premium economy was alright, but no space for the shoulders - it almost felt like a livestock transport. Service was nice, but I will avoid United in the future.

Las Vegas to Greenville. Never notified that flight was cancelled until checking bags. I didn’t get home until next day, had to sleep in airport, lost wages from job because returned a day late. I didn’t get a sorry, or a comp or anything I was thousands a miles away from my kids in Las Vegas scared and very bad experience for a first time flyer. I had a horrible experience and I have called and emailed headquarters and top officials and no reply or call back. Very unprofessional, very bad and unpleasant experience.

After a recent business trip to Tucson, my coworker and I received the worst customer service from not one, but two United representatives. We arrived at the Tucson airport about an hour and a half early and while we were heading to our gate we received a push notification that the flight was delayed so we went and grabbed food, and set up at a charging station a few gates down. When it was getting close to the time that we would need to start boarding, we walked over to the gate and found out that the flight left at its scheduled time. No updates, no announcement for boarding, nothing. The woman at the gate laughed it off saying that when the pilot wants to leave the pilot leaves. With no more flights leaving from Tucson that day on United, we were infuriated. The woman was not empathetic, wouldn’t look us in the eyes, and gave us no other options but to stay in Tucson (not comped by United, mind you) and arrive to Cleveland at 3pm the next day. We called the customer service line and the representative literally said “I don’t understand why you weren’t at your gate, you should have been there”. After he also unempathetically didn’t even try to help us, I asked to speak to a manager. I’m pretty sure I spoke to the same guy who just changed his voice into a higher pitched tone. He said the same and wouldn’t even give me a refund, gave me a hard time about missing the flight and said that he knows that they make courtesy announcements before taking off. Apparently you don’t, or I wouldn’t have been stranded in Tucson. After finally calling again and speaking to a much nicer woman, we were able to get a partial refund and bought tickets on American Airlines flying just a few hours later. I’ve never had such a poor customer service experience in my life and will never fly with United again unless absolutely necessary. Taking my business elsewhere!

Absolutely terrible service and we will never be flying with you guys ever again. We called the night before to make sure everything was okay with the flight and it was. However, when we get to the airport which is 2 hours away from where we live we get a call once we are at the airport that the flight was cancelled. So, we think that we will just be getting on another flight so we will still be able to get to our destination that day. We stood in line to check in for about 35 minutes and then the person there, after failing to put in our confrontation code 3 times, told us that our flight has been rescheduled for tomorrow and that we might not even be able to get on that flight. I’m really disappointed in United Airlines in their lack of communication. We weren’t even told why the flight was canceled. They wasted our time and lost our business. Not that they truly care but my mother’s family who were suppose to pick her up took the day off work and my mother, who hasn’t seen her family for many years now, is forced to go back home and wait because United Airlines can’t get their priority’s straight. Your customers should be your main priority and clearly they aren’t.

MBS Airport to Reno. Will never fly with United again. There were multiple maintenance issues - 2 on one layover at Denver, and 1 in chicago. The Chicago flight we ended up turning around due to hydraulics issues which caused us to miss our connecting flight. There were no agents at the gate to help us find a new flight so we had to call. The first time we called they hung up on us. All in all we were almost 7 hours late to our destination. I'm guessing they aren't using great planes if they had that many issues and awful customer service. Will not recommend to anyone.

Chicago to Phoenix. Due to a mechanical issue the airplane was delayed and we sat on the plane for 30-45 minutes. While I would have preferred an ontime arrival, delays can happen. The crew was very professional and served snacks and water and informed us continuously and the doors were reopened just in case somebody wanted to leave the aircraft. United proactively rebooked me on a later flight just in case the issue would not have been fixed. In the end we did depart with a delay. The rest of the flight was uneventful. I was flying Economy Plus and the seat was comfortable and offered enough legspace. United Economy Plus is the same seat and same onboard service as it is in regular Economy but with some inches of more legspace. I just flew with a different us carrier in the Premium Economy Class/Comfort Plus class and they also offer a free alcoholic drink and a premium snack in the Economy Plus section. United should do the same thing and upgrade the Economy Plus section.

Absolutely horrible, will not be flying United again even if I have to pay more. Terrible customer service. My plane way delayed for 5 hours because they were waiting for another plane to arrive. This caused many of us to miss our connecting flights, and minimal information was given. They did nothing to make this situation better for their customers. No company should be able to treat paying customers like this.

Denver to Albuquerque. From now on I will always pay more to avoid this airline. I’ve flown twice in the last month with United and both times were absolute terrible experiences. Long delays with minimal information provided as to why. You can’t bring a carry on if you’re flying basic economy class but they don’t have a good system for keeping track of baggage apparently because they managed to lose mine on a 45 minute direct flight. Pay extra to fly a different airline because this is trash.

I’m a small business owner, and if I treated my customers the way United Airlines treats their customers I would be out of business. I spent $2800 to fly my family to Turks and Caicos from Denver. United Airlines changed the aircraft and even though I booked our flights over a year ago, they separated our family all throughout the aircraft. Our children had to enter the aircraft on the back and we had to enter the aircraft on the front. This was on our way back home. When we connected through Houston I noticed that my luggage was damaged. So I have a three hour layover in Houston and I figured I would go and talk to baggage services, as I did not want to handle it when I arrive in Denver at 11:30 at night. I mean why not handle it at a normal time of day when I have three hours to kill, but the person working the United baggage service tells me she can’t do a claim for me and it must be done at my final destination. When I asked why couldn’t it just be handled right now she said that is United Airlines policy. I’m sorry, but when your policy causes agitation to a customer, and you have no explanation besides it’s your policy then that is something that should be changed. I found it comical that United airlines employee tells me that I need to post on social media about how negative my experience was. I doubt that will do any good. When I asked why couldn’t it just be handled right now she said that is United Airlines policy. I’m sorry, but when your policy causes agitation to a customer, and you have no explanation besides it’s your policy then that is something that should be changed. I found it comical that United airlines employee tells me that I need to post on social media about how negative my experience was. I doubt that will do any good. Amazing that a company could be this big and provide such terrible service. If I could give them zero stars I would, I will not use United Airlines if I have a choice.

Chicago to Ottawa. Got delayed 5 hours in the airport for a flight that takes 1 hour and 45 minutes. Not impressed with the airline at all. I am not even sure if there was even a scheduled flight; it seems like they are booking flights for nonexistent planes and crew.

route: Austin to Reno via San Francisco
reviewContent: Austin to Reno via San Francisco. This is the worst airline. My plane was delayed 4 hours in San Francisco the was my only first stop I was going to have. The plane was so supposed to go at 9:40 which never happened they change our time to 10:30 then to 11:15 then to 12:30 we end up leaving from San Francisco at 2:00 in the morning. The worst thing the ever happened to me I was flying with my kids and my self of course my kids fell to sleep waiting in the airport when they started to call everyone to get ready to go in to the airplane I ask the lady in the front desk the I need it help to get my 3 year old and my 7 year old out of the chair we’re they were sleeping, she went and ask her manager and the manager came and told me I can’t help you,you going to have to wake them up. While we were in line one lady the was going to bord with us was checking the depart screen she said our fly was delayed by 4 hours and on the screen it says the this fly the leaves at 2:00 am it’s on time ugh even worst we waited for more people so they could have there plane full so they wouldn’t have to use 2 planes. The was my worst experience at United Airlines like I said I will never buy a ticket form United Airlines

This has been a horrible experience! My flight got delayed 15 hours. Initially it was only delayed 2 hours then when everyone got on the plane we had to sit there for 2 more hours before they finally announced that the plane is broken. By that point it was 12:30 AM. Then we waited for a new plane, which arrived but the crew has left already so they delayed it until 11:00 AM until the next morning. They did not provide a hotel, did not provide an alternative earlier flight, and refused to give a refund.

We arrived at 10 A.M. for a 12 am flight because that’s what you are told to do. We get to the airport only to find out it’s delayed for a little over an hour. No big deal we can still make our connecting flight well of corse not they delayed it another 30 min. We miss our connecting flight they can’t get us on another flor 4 hours. (9 hours) then that flight is delayed another hour. So 10 hours in airports to go to a place that would have taken me 8 hours to drive to. If I fly a discounted airline I expect this type of service because you get what you pay for but United although gives cut rate service their prices are not cut rate. Then I paid for upgraded seats but they said that didn’t matter anymore. This is the fourth time in a row flying United and having major issues. I can care less about food, chairs or even the way the flight crew treats passengers but don’t charge me to get to a destination that I could have driven to in a lot less time. I will be asking for some money back. Not a voucher either because I will never take united again unlesss I have a sudden urge to spend a whole day in the airport. Their employees in the Houston airport are not nice which is probably because they are tired of coming up with excuses for their employers lack of management or leadership. I can’t even rate value for your money because they should pay me for my whole wasted day.

I have always thought that United is the worst, but for some unknown reason, I keep giving it another chance. I am currently sitting on a boarded plane that is delayed by six hours, and we have just been told that because of the massive delays, the crew can no longer fly us directly to Newark. We now will be going to San Fran in between. Oh and no one on board knows when we will actually take off. According to multiple flight attendants, there are no updates? So, we are stuck here on the plane with no options, no plan for leaving, and a required additional stop that was unplanned. United should take a hard look at airlines like EVA and Cathay, and learn a thing or two. It's shameful to pay for such abysmal service. Please do yourself a favor and choose any other airline.

Newark to Orange County. What a gross experience. The aisle was way too tiny to pass even for someone who is very petite making going to the filthy bathroom a chore. I had to go back to my seat in order for the snack cart to pass by. The economy plus really was a minus because we still didn't have ample leg space. What happened to the barf bags (just in case someone got sick) and the blankets and pillows? I think that we were overcharged for baggage. The aircraft loads by groups. We were in group 2. A fellow and his daughter, who were in group 4, got on the group 2 line. When he got to the gate, the attendant told him that he was in the wrong group but she would let me board "this time." He had 3 rolling cases plus a large backpack. The flight instructions specifically say "only one rolling case allowed per person". He was allowed to bring all 4 cases on the aircraft while people boarding in later groups had to check their carry on bag due to lack of room.

The ground service is really bad. I was on the flight from Denver to San Francisco via United Airlines, and was going to connect to another international flight. However, the flight from DEN to SFO delayed an hour and half, which made me only 30 minutes to get to my connection. Right after I got off the plane, I asked the ground service to give me a delay certificate, and they told me they didn’t have, and said that I should have asked when I was in DEN, but I was stuck on the plane for almost an hour, who can I ask for a delay certificate? The ground staff didn’t do the job well. They were supposed to know the situation of the flight and assist the passengers. When a flight delayed for an hour and half, they should have prepared delay certificates or at least told the passengers where to get the certificates. In the end, I ran to catch my coming flight and made it, but my luggage didn’t. It seems like United Airlines doesn’t care about their passengers if they can’t catch their connections.

Washington Dulles to Philadelphia. This flight was delayed almost 3 hours because it originated in Orlando and they could not take off due to severe weather. I must mention that the airport staff once we were notified of the delay immediately brought plenty of water and snacks to distribute to all of us that we’re waiting and kept everyone informed with PA announcements and the gentleman at the desk was extremely patient answering every single question from all who came up to him. It really looks like United is trying to do the right thing. Once the aircraft arrived the flight lasted under an hour, we quickly boarded the aircraft and no time we had taken off and landed in Philadelphia. Kudos to United for a job well done!

London to Washington Dulles. My experience onboard was very pleasant. Usually on an international flight you get the better crew, everyone was very friendly, polite, and genuinely happy. The airplane looked and felt old, the screen to watch movies was a little bit larger than my iPhone X however the entertainment options were very good. On this 7.5 hour flight I was served one hot meal, one hot snack, a small snack, and unlimited beverages. One flight attendant was extremely nice to me and even brought me two ice cream’s. I upgraded to economy plus for around $200 and the only thing you get is more leg room. The seat is the same as in the regular economy cabin and the service is the same. The Internet I thought was very expensive around $30 for the entire flight so I passed on that option however I would definitely fly United again. Good job United it looks like you’re trying to fix your reputation!

Flew Houston to St. Louis. This airline is terrible. They hit me with a last minute bag fee of $25 and I only had one bag. My return will include another $25. I had a very small bag but had large shampoo bottles in it so needed to check. Employees are rude. Plane was gross. Avoid United Airlines if possible.

Washington  to Seattle. Bad experience through out the journey with United Airlines: We booked the tickets with the infant who is going to sit in my lap. His name was not included in the boarding pass and we had to suffer standing in the long waiting lines. It's just common sense that when you give us an option to online check in, and we use it that means we want to avoid standing in lines. Since we are travelling with an infant on lap, and the flight had to start with 1 hr delay and we were on the runway, we asked if they can help me with something to keep my baby's milk fresh, they gave us the airsick bag full of ice for which I was happy, but unfortunately the bag was not water proof (not plastic, it was paper bag). We did not knew this and all our other bags became wet as the ice melted. This is a 5 hr 41 min flight, which means passengers expect some food on the flight. The male attendant was not at all cooperative with me or any of the passengers around me. I don't understand why they have a menu with 5 or 6 pages with different types of food options.May be they are using the same menu across all their domestic and international flights to save money from printing different menu cards for different routes. All over we had a very bad experience with United airlines and definitely will not take the flights nor recommend to anyone.

San Francisco to Orange County. I will avoid flying United at all costs. Their customer service is terrible and you have to pay to check in a bag if you buy economy. Didn’t even know that until I tried to check-in. They will find any way to nickel and dime you. I rather pay more and fly on another airline.

United Airlines at LAX literally the worst service I’ve ever received in my life and I have flown more than 3 dozen times. They forced me to check a small backpack for no reason other than I had a purse on me which they counted as another personal item. Many other people did this with much larger purses and carry on items. Complete and total garbage customer service at LAX. Will not fly United ever again even if it’s cheaper, especially in Los Angeles.

London to Denver. After flying BA and AA on this route I can safely say United Airlines is the worst airline. Certainly not the friendly skies! Food was poor. Aircrew were by comparison unattractive. Basically, after looking forward to flying on the Dreamliner, the way united have configured the plane and the service ruined my experience. Although leg room was fine, the seat width is dire. Also insisting on dimming the windows after lunch on a daytime flight with a daytime arrival at the destination is just plain dumb. If you have a choice, fly AA. I won't be choosing United for my next flight at all costs.

route: Sacramento to Port of Spain via Houston
reviewContent: Sacramento to Port of Spain via Houston. Worst trip ever. This was a nearly 6 hour overnight flight to Trinidad. We paid for extra leg room and got an additional 2 inches. No food was offered except a small bag of pretzels or small packages of food for fee. The seats were incredibly uncomfortable and some genius designed them so the controls for the video screen are on the top of the arm rest where most people put their elbows. My neighbor unintentionally reset the video throughout the trip. The video flashes endless ads for paid streaming access while you're trying to sleep. Even once I figured out how to turn it off my neighbor's elbow would turn it back on again. Who thought this was a good design idea? Finally, no pillows are offered and the courtesy "blanket" more closely resembled an oversized tea towel than a blanket.

Columbia to Chicago. United Airlines cancelled my return flight from Chicago to Columbia without any notice due to "operational difficulties." Ok, fine. Something occurred that may have been out of their control. Their response, however, was very poor in my opinion. I needed to change my flight into STL and rent a car to get to Columbia. This cost me an extra 170, plus gas. United didn't care at all to compensate me for these costs. Very poor customer relations - left a bad taste in my mouth.

I booked a flight out of Savannah to Philly. The flight flew to Newark, and I was informed at the last minute that I would have to take an Amtrak train from Newark to Philly as the 1 hour train ride was apart of my flight. Then on my flight back they made me miss my original flight because I did not check in at the Amtrak station. They then put me on another flight that was that was delayed for maintenance issues. Overall worst airline experience ever.

route: Aspen to New York via Denver
reviewContent: This was the worst experience I have had on an airline.  Our flight out of Aspen was delayed due to rain, which is normally for an Aspen Denver flight, however every person on the flight had tight connecting flights. The crew knowing many passengers needed to get off, would not open the door off the plane for 22 minutes. After majority of the passengers now need to run to the other side of Denver Terminal B (and for those who don’t know that’s close to a mile) we are told our plane will be waiting for our bags to be put on before take off. They were not. Not even put on the next flight, they will be arriving two days after our arrival. United so kindly asked us to pay for their drop off as well. Aside from incompetence, the aircraft themselves have abominable service, we flew first class and were served Mac and cheese as adults.

I strongly caution against flying United Airlines. They do not care about their customers, their customer's time, nor their money. On May 21, 2018, the United Airlines flight was canceled for 4 passengers, in which my husband and I had purchased all four tickets. This was the worst travel experience that I have encountered. The customer service of United Airlines is at most, deplorable. To begin, the flight that was canceled on 5/21/18 from BNA to IAH was canceled due to weather conditions that were non-existent. The cancellation was only reported 3-4 hours before the flight was set to take off. This placed us in a compromising position as we had a connecting flight to Honolulu (HNL) from Houston (IAH), the only flight for this destination, for that day. We had to scramble to find a nearby flight from Hunstville, AL, which is two hours away from where we reside. We attempted to call a United Airlines representative to help us find seats for all four passengers, but we were unsuccessful. My husband and I were the only couple that could fly from Huntsville into Houston and then into HNL. The other couple was forced to fly from Huntsville, to Denver, to San Francisco, to Los Angeles, and then to Honolulu. The customer service that we received over the phone from the representative was atrocious. The representative was ignorant when giving information on the flights, she rudely retorted comments back that reflected her ignorance, and due to her procrastination our travel plans were further delayed. We had to drive to the HSV airport and leave our car in long term parking. All of these incidents incurred an extra expense, for which should be compensated for by United Airlines. All we received was a measly flight credit of $75.00 for my husband and I and we purchased four tickets!

It has been more than three years since I have flown United Airlines. I stopped flying because of old planes, no in seat entertainment on long legs,poor service and surly flight attendants. Nothing has changed in these years. On my four hour leg (IAD to SEA) the entertainment system & wifi was down. Again, another United negative experience.

route: Los Angeles to Arcata via San Francisco
reviewContent: Los Angeles to Arcata via San Francisco. Absolutely the worst organization I've ever experienced, and I've been flying since I was 3 months old (24+ yrs). Every trip in the past 2 years has either been delayed or cancelled there's no point in even making a reservation because we end up renting a car and driving 8 hours anyway with little to no compensation for the flight. Have had multiple bags lost or 'misplaced'. I don't know how they can even keep business. Imagine if this was a 400$ hotel room and you get there to find your room isn't ready for 6 hours and they over booked so you have to stay in a budget hotel anyways, just ridiculous; meanwhile the executives are taking home million $ bonuses chartering private planes cause they don't even want to fly on their own airline. I feel bad for the employees who have to deal with all the customer service bs while they are just trying to do their job. The only positive thing I have to say is that the employees do try and are nice a majority of the time so please don't make it hard on them.

Shannon to Newark. Worst airline experience I’ve ever had. Flight was delayed because of mechanical problems and we were stuck for an hour and a half extra on the plane before departure. Then another hour after landing waiting on a gate on the other side of the airport and most everyone missed their connecting flights. Our connecting flight was then delayed again another hour and when we finally  arrived, we were stuck in a foreign country without our luggage because it “didn’t make our flight”. We had to call multiple times to get our luggage delivered. Will not fly again.

Worst flight experience I’ve ever had. When I got to the airport to drop off my bag (after self check in) it took 25 minutes for them to put a sticker on my bag and put it on the belt and I was the first one in line. There were only 3 people working and very long lines and wait times. When I got to the gate to fly out I heard that I would miss my connecting flight I went to talk to gate agents to see what my options are. They were not very helpful the only thing they did was rebook my on a flight for the morning and told me I’d have to figure out my plans once I was in Houston. They were condescending and blaming everything on policy. When I got to Houston, the customer service agents there were very helpful in getting me a room and other accommodations. But when I went to receive my checked bag for the night in the hotel, I was told that I was unable to get the bag and couldn’t have access to it til tomorrow. United is the worst airline I have flown, regarding everything from check in to reliability. At the Nashville airport there were 9 total delayed flights and 8 of them were United. I’ve also heard from several other guests that this is a common occurrence and had happened to them earlier this week. United needs some serious change in their operations as well as retraining employees.

commentHeader: I will avoid flying this airline
reviewContent: I booked my flight along with my husbands flight 9 months in advance. The day before my flight I discovered I was only getting one boarding pass. My husbands flight booking was under a different conf #. This would be fine however the united miles plus card no longer applies to him, therefore he looses priority boarding AND United took it upon them selves to change our seating assignments to where we were no longer seated next to each other for 14 hr flights. I have never had my seating changed by any airline after choosing a seating assignment if they "cant be guaranteed" there is no advantage flying United over Southwest aside from paying more money. They had availability to accommodate to economy plus but of course wanted more money. we had to change flights adding a 4 hour layover and pickup arrangements just to sit next to each other. No wonder United ranks so poorly in customer service. I will avoid flying this airline at all costs in the future, its more important to try and suck another $300 out of a customer than accommodate and make it right. I will also be canceling my United Plus card as it serves no benefits. It does us no good to travel together if only one person on the card gets priority. I was on the phone for over an hour and 30 min with costumer service that is a joke. My time is money but obviously United does not care about that.

Chicago to Birmingham. Every time I fly with United it is an awful experience. They have the most rude, arrogant, and unhelpful agents at the gate and on the plane. If you want a pleasant experience avoid United.

My parents and I were travelling from Frankfurt to San Francisco with United Airlines. United has a dedicated check-in area in Frankfurt, with dedicated counters for premium cabins and frequent travellers. The check-in is operated by trained Lufthansa agents and was quick, friendly and easy. Thanks to our UA status we were allowed into the Lufthansa Senator lounge at Frankfurt airport and enjoyed our pre-boarding snack and drinks. I love United´s unique and efficient boarding process. We were seated in the Economy Plus section and had plenty of legspace. The food in Economy is okay, snacks were served throughout the flight and wine and beer is available in all travel classes for free. The staff was very nice and the flight was enjoyable. Good selection of movies, internet and power outlets are available. Condition of the airplane very good (well, the B747 is retired now and it’s the new 777). Overall a very pleasant flight with on-time arrival in San Francisco.

Las Vegas to Newark. So they waited until 30 minutes before boarding to tell us about a 3 hour delay. After this delay, they let us board. After letting everyone get boarded and situated, they announce another hour delay. Instead of waiting another hour to board, they packed us in like sardines and continued to delay the plane. I understand delays are our of their control, but tell us as you find out. Dont trick us into being stuck on the flight. Nothing was added for a 5 hour delay, 2 of which were spent on the plane, sitting still at the gate. We paid for a flight that leaves at 11:15am. So, if you can't accommodate me, let me know. Don't drag me along. Get better at organizing flights before you have a whole company that screws over thousands of people. Never flying United again.

route: Los Cabos to Portland via San Francisco
reviewContent: Los Cabos to Portland via San Francisco. Absolutely terrible service. The employees in Mexico spoke better English then all but one person I encountered in San Francisco. Was told the incorrect gate multiple times causing my pregnant wife to have to trek from one end of the terminal to the other. Smallest amount of legroom yet and the leather seats are awful.

commentHeader: not be flying with them again
reviewContent: This has been the most inconvienent experience I have been through. The customer service was extremely difficult and did not provide any help whatsoever. I was sent back and forth across the airport to talk to different people and every worker I encountered was horrendously rude and inconsiderate to my situation. My original flight had been cancelled and I was informed that I may not be able to catch another flight for three days and that they would not be providing a hotel. I retrieved a ride and made it to my destination (13 hours later than I was supposed to be there) and proceeded to follow up with phone calls to ask where my baggage might be since the workers at the airport did not answer any of my questions. The people I spoke with on the phone were just as rude and inconsiderate as the other United Airlines workers I had previously spoke with. I will not be flying with them again. (I also did not get my money back and I purchesed traveler’s insurance).

An incredibly disappointing experience on United. Traveling to the Bay Area for a conference, I booked this flight on a 777-200, thinking it might be kind of fun to fly on a domestic widebody and that the cramped 3-4-3 configuration would be fine. How wrong I was. There was a half-hour delay prior to departure — annoying, but not a big deal. Once on board, however, I noticed that the TVs had been removed and replaced with personal device entertainment holders. However, we were informed that the Wi-Fi did not work and, as such, we wouldn't be able to use the Personal Device Entertainment. A six hour flight with no TVs or Wi-Fi. Unbelievable. Throughout my whole experience, the crew was incredibly rude and inattentive. Upon landing at SFO, we waited on the taxiway for 50+ minutes since (as the captain told it) United operations had screwed up and didn't have a gate for us. There were a number of passengers connecting on to other destinations, many of which there is only one flight a day to from SFO. All told, we arrived at the gate around 1.5 hours late. Combined with our delay leaving BOS, many of my fellow passengers missed their connections and had to be put up overnight. My experience on the return flight was slightly better — the Wi-Fi/personal device entertainment worked and the crew was more courteous — but the damage had been done. If I have any choice, I'll never fly with United Airlines again.

This was my first time flying United and it was a nightmare! After being delayed for several hours we never got an update for the reason as to why. We then ended up missing our connection. Stood in customer service for over an hour. Not that it would have changed anything, but they didn’t even apologize. We then got on our flight and sat on the runway for 2 hours. There wasn’t one update at all! I mean come on. I thought I was being pranked. I asked the workers and they said they would let us know. Never did we hear anything or get an apology. Not even a free cocktail. Heck I would have been happy with some water when waiting for so long. This was terrible and I would never fly United again. I fly 100 times a year and this is by far the worst. Do not make the mistake flying United. I thought it was just bad luck all the negutivity surrounding them but it all makes sense. We then had to have a United employee help us find the new best route possible. We thought the experience was going to get better, wrong! He ended up booking us on to the wrong flight which we didn’t figure out until we were supposed to leave. I could keep going but I think you get the point. Whatever you do never fly United. Even if you have to pay a little bit more it could save your trip.

My husband and I are platinum members of this airline yet we have been truly shocked by the rudeness of the ground staff in so many cities - ORD, SFO, HKG, DTW, BOS and Milan come to mind as places where we have had multiple bad experiences. This is United's biggest challenge and if they don't fix it they will be bankrupt again in the near future. I, for one, and seriously considering leaving them for good.

Newark to Tampa. Why are couples split up all over the plane? It is so rude and inconsiderate. Every couple we have met, including my husband and I are all split up. We also were not allowed to sit together because of “the type of ticket we bought.” I’m a paying customer like everyone else! On top of all of this, we have been delayed for two hours because the pilots aren’t here, but the plane has been here an hour. Oh, and they made people check their carry-on luggage and pay the baggage fee. This is the most disgusting experience ever and it will be our last with this company.

route: Mexico City to Tulsa via Houston
reviewContent: Mexico City to Tulsa via Houston. My flight from Mexico City to Houston was delayed an hour. I only had 30 minutes to go through customs and get my bag then find my connecting flight in this huge airport. I didn’t even make it through security, missed my flight home. So I got a standby and I know for a fact I was the first person from Mexico City to get a standby ticket to Tulsa! I used my mobile customs app so it took me seconds to get through. The women boarding the plane just picked random names. I’m confused on why the names aren’t in order! They should be first come first on a plane! So I didn’t get on it and was stuck in Houston until the next morning at 8am. But I’m mainly writing this review because everyone that works at United airlines in Houston TX are miserable. Everyone I’ve talked to has had an attitude and I don’t understand why. It’s your job - I’m just asking a question because I have no idea what to do! I’m by myself in a city I don’t know and a massive confusing airport, that likes to change gates regularly.

Las Vegas to Houston. Worst experience flying in 20 years. Flight delayed 4 hours and counting, notification was not sent until after the 2hr required time to be at the airport. Gate personell nicely told us it was an "Act of God" and was not the least bit interested in making our time at the airport pleasant. The poor man behind the counter asked for help and with a line of 2 carrier and his supervisor said, "Just excuse yourself, they can wait." We asked for a pass to the lounge to pass the next 4 hours and they wanted to charge us 69.00 like we were walking in off the street. The inflight entertainment was not accessible and our tablets are brand new and we had to pay an extra 100 just to be able to sit in our seat without the person next to you sitting in your lap plus we paid 50 to check one bag a piece. I have always flown United but this may be our last trip for the price of our flight I have much better expectations. I have flown internationally and all over the US on many carriers and this has by far been my worst experience and this is the 2nd time this has happened to me at this airport. I am very disappointed.

I have not flown with United in years. My experience flying from Chicago to Detroit reminded me why. The flight stays option does not label information which causes confusion when reading. This can be frustrating when making travel plans. The flight attendant was the main issue. As a representative of the company, I would think you would want your attendants to be clean looking. Not as if they were hungover from partying the night before. Hair a tangled mess and makeup smeared. Her attitude towards customers was welll below par, making faces after one gentlemen ordered extra and snarky with her responses. Needless to say I will not be returning.

route: Harrisburg to El Paso via Chicago
reviewContent: My son traveled as an unaccompanied Minor from Harrisburg to El Paso with a stop in Chicago. I paid for him to have an escort & the airline did not provide an escort & left him alone the entire time. My son called me very upset that he couldn’t find the terminal or gate. Every United employee he asked for help ignored him. If it wasn’t for TSA. He would have missed his flight. It’s about time we stand up against the airlines for stealing our money & putting our children at risk!

route: Sioux Falls to Louisville via Chicago
reviewContent: Sioux Falls to Louisville via Chicago. I was promised hotel compensation because my flight was delayed two hours which caused me to miss my connecting flight (no flights going out until the next day). Customer service first of all, was rude from the start (I was trying to be so patient). Then I was told “it’s the governments fault your plane was behind so we can’t offer a hotel voucher, just a discount.” I am now sitting in the airport overnight waiting. No meal voucher. Nothing. Thanks United. I paid hard earned money for this terrible experience. Warning: book an early flight so you can get home the same day you start traveling.

San Francisco to Newark. We boarded the airline and within a few minutes it was announced that the hydraulic system lights malfunctioned, we waited inside the plane for 2 hours. Then they asked us to get off the plane, and at a different terminal we took another United plane. We were originally scheduled to arrive at EWR at 11 pm and we arrived at 2 am. Reached home at 4 am these people are so clueless that they did not offer anything like snacks or lunch boxes as complimentary but instead we had to pay. Bad airline, bad service.

This airline sucks, tried calling and they have a telemarketer and you have to speak to it instead of pressing numbers and they can't ever get anything you say right. I've been flying with united for quite a while and now I have had enough. Had family problems come up and had a round trip planned and it costs $200 just to change the date and more money for the flight price difference. If it was cheaper I would be more understandable but when you have to pay almost $400 to get home 2 days earlier it's kind of ridiculous and I will never fly United again.

Orlando to Washington. Used the automated check in very user friendly and easy, flight got 1.30 hours delay and flight was sold out and got delayed even more because a passenger was boarded who did not have a seat - caused some confusion and the the door had to be reopened to let the passenger out. Attendants where very friendly and live direct tv was working well. Packed snacks were served, the plane was very old and seats were worn out. The delay caused a late arrival in Dulles .

My flight was pushed back to 1 hour causing a chain reaction of people missing flights. Myself and 500 other United customers waited in the customer service line and Denver Colorado after missing our connections. Choose between going to Eugene at 7pm the following day or I'm returning to Oregon by 9am, but Portland instead of Eugene. Having to stay the night in San Francisco I asked if there was any hotel compensation and they said it was an act of God -  this wasn't a very satisfying answer for me.

route: Chicago to Maui via San Francisco
reviewContent: Chicago to Maui via San Francisco. Not good. We were delayed by United. Upon finally arriving to our connecting flight we were forced to be late waiting for a gate to disembark. Once finally in the terminal, they would not let us board our connection even though the workers said they say they saw our plane arrive and knew we and others were on it. Needless to say, the connecting plane was still connected to the terminal. Had to wait an additional 3 hours for a flight. Will never fly with United again. Also most uncomfortable seats ever.

Worst customer service I have ever received from start to finish. Before even getting to the airport I called to speak to a rep in regards to my first flight being delayed and was cutting it close to the end of boarding of the connecting flight (15 minutes). I was told by the rep that they had no way of contacting the airport to let them know that there were passengers delayed from their first flight but would be arriving just as boarding closed.
