I asked to speak to someone else and the rep said "I can't transfer you, but you can call back and wait through it all again", not impressed. Then at the Buffalo airport we were reassured that we would make our second flight as long as this first one left on the scheduled time still, and if not we would be given a hotel room for the night, refunded for our hotel missed and sent out at 8:40 am the next day. Well what do you know, we missed our connecting flight by 5 minutes as they closed the gates, the "hotel" we were told we would be given was actually all booked as their was a rally in town and we were told we could "sleep on the safe airport floor" by the Supervisor at Washington-Dulles. Also, the 8:40 am flight we were told we would be on was actually 12:00 pm. Now for the "reimbursement" we were told we would get, that was a joke. We were told we would be reimbursed for our hotel that we had to stay in (IN VIRGINIA), the hotel we missed, our cab rides etc -  we were not. We were offered flight vouchers (I will never fly with them again) and then offered to be reimbursed for one night, and the cabs. Disgusting customer service. Everyone told us something different, and in the end we were out over $250 in the hotel room we missed, data overages to find accommodations and food. Book with anyone else, it is not worth the cheap ticket price.

Kansas City to Chicago. Terrible experience! Total chaos. Time to board and everyone got up and assembled a line. Then, flight was delayed an hour, then it wasn’t. Then it was time to hurry up and board. The line was a disaster. No one could tell where the line was. Or, exactly what was going on. Were we boarding or were we delayed? The app wasn’t updated. People were worried about getting their carry-on bags on because they kept announcing that it was a full flight and they were worried about space. So people were trying to get on plane as fast as they could to secure space. People were cutting in line and being super aggressive. The people in charge could have cared less. They were oblivious to what was going on, but seemed hurried. We finally get on plane, many had to check bags which was time consuming. Now we sit on runway. I have never seen a group of flight attendants so checked out.

route: Des Moines to Spokane via Denver
reviewContent: I have a medical condition, as a result of neck injury, that requires medication that makes me very nauseous. It is always a problem when flying. I have vomited on the airplane in the past. The only thing that helps is sitting near the front of the plane. I booked my flight accordingly as was able to choose appropriate seats. However, my seat was changed and all United personnel refused to help me find a seat to accommodate me. Then when I arrived at my assigned seat 17D, I discovered the seat did not recline. Therefor I cannot wear my neck support either. I will never fly united again. They should be ashamed of their disregard for customer safety and comfort, as well as their terrible customer service.

commentHeader: aircraft was old and very tired
reviewContent: Check in staff were friendly and polite. There was a 20 minute delay due to congestion at Dulles. The flight was OK but nothing outstanding, the attendants were alright they offered snacks and drinks all packaged. The aircraft was old and very tired, even the inflight magazines were all torn up. The seats showed the age and use my bag made it through and arrival at Orlando was smooth.

route: Newark to Santa Barbara via San Francisco
reviewContent: Newark to Santa Barbara via San Francisco. Worst. Experience. Ever. From start to - and not even at our final destination yet. I’d give them zero stars if I could. Flight from Buffalo to Newark was delayed for 2 hours (understandable as I’ve traveled extensively in the past.) While waiting, the company tag line used on the plan to the passengers was as follows: “seems like its an electrical maintenance issue on Newark’s part. Sorry everyone.” Still relatively understandable. This made us miss our 2 other connecting flights moving forward. When trying to reroute our flights once we finally got to Newark, we asked the customer service rep for the airline to put us up in a hotel in San Francisco because we’d be stuck at the airport until 8:45 am (after landing around midnight as it was the earliest flight to Santa Barbara/home.) “No. It was because of weather. We don’t do that if it’s because of weather,” the customer service rep advised. At no point was the weather cited as any part of the cause for the delay! Whatever. Horrible attitudes with the employees at the gate as well. Finally we were able to get on to our re-routed flight (which, by the way, was also delayed for almost 2 hours as well.) I have a roller bag that easily fits in the overhead compartment. Before the plane was even 1/2 full, they started pulling luggage to check in. At the gate, I explained explicitly said that if I check my bag, I need to grab it from the gate itself and not have them send it directly to our final destination (Santa Barbara) or the general checked-in luggage. There was plenty of overhead space by my seat, mind you. Nope! We had to leave the gated area to the baggage carousels, where the flight attendant told us to go, and nothing. No bag. Apparently they were “holding it” to get it on our last flight which leaves in 7 hours! I have things in there I need! And now the security checkpoint is closed so we can’t even get back into a nice quiet area to find a place to sleep for even a little bit because of the sheer lack of communication, horrible customer service, and complete lack of empathy. I will never again fly with United and I hope nobody else will either.

commentHeader: crew at Boston is still very bad
reviewContent: Boston to Newark. I used to fly United 50 weeks a year for 5 years and earn platinum status. I got treated badly by big percentage of the UA staff because I wear jeans and I don't look like a business traveler. The flight crew has improved but the ground crew at Boston is still very bad. I needed verification for luggage check in and I waited for more than 10 minutes.

Worst airline ever. Midland airport is a joke, the lady working at the check in counter is the rudest lady ever. I always fly Southwest but had a Jamaica trip that required United. Will be the last time I fly with them. Mechanical problems causing a delay to boot. A joke of an airline. Would give negative stars if I could.

Delhi to Newark. Worst customer service. This is my second trip from India back and forth to America in 2 months due to unforeseen circumstances. First I thought that few of the crew members were rude. Now since I have flown so much in 2 months and I have not met one nice united crew members.
Washington to Paris. The Boeing 787 was the best part of this trip. It was comfortable and fresh. Service was good with on time departure and arrival. I thought food served was scarce though.

route: Miami to Las Vegas via Houston
reviewContent: Miami to Las Vegas via Houston. Worst customer service ever and made me and my sons experience horrible. I missed my boarding time by 5mins even though my friend was on the phone with me while I was running to the gate because they told her to call me and tell me to hurry. So she got on the plane since they told her to and once she was on they told her they canceled me and my sons flight. The ramp was still connected to the plane when I was trying to get on and my friend said they hadn't even shut the plane door yet and on top of that when I looked at the flight after they took off the flight status was “early departure”. There was no reason to not let me on the plane and and the lady I was speaking to was rude and also the lady my friend spoke to on the plane was rude! My friend said the flight attendant had just shrugged her shoulders with a smirk on her face and said well we already canceled her and her sons flight. I had to sit in the Miami airport for 8hours with my 8year old son and they were just rude about the whole situation. Worst experience I’ve ever had.

Tokyo to Boston via Washington. United has the worst customer service. I was afraid I was going to miss my connecting flight so I informed a crew member. All they had to say was: “we cannot help it”. I asked them if I can exit the plane first when it landed, and they refused. I missed my connecting flight and had to spend an additional 5 hours. I haven’t flown United after my first-time horrific experience. Never flying United again.

route: Chicago to New York La Guardia
reviewContent: My flight from Chicago to New York La Guardia was supposed to leave at 5:00PM. Since then, the departure time has changed 6 times via the text updates. (5:55, 6:15, 7:30, 8:00, 7:45, 8:35) So I've just been sitting in the airport.  We were just told that they have "found a plane" that recently landed at 7:30, but we won't be leaving until 8:55  allegedly. The entertainment / wifi stuff on the first plane I took didn't even work.

commentHeader: sat at the airport for 5 hours"
reviewContent: Chicago to Milwaukee via Nashville. Horrible experience. Friends flight was cancelled. Our flight had a three hour layover. When we finally got to Milwaukee we never got our luggage. They lost our luggage. We live four hours away from Milwaukee and had to pickup our friends at a different support in Appleton because of their cancellation. They had no idea where our luggage was! We sat at the airport for 5 hours waiting before giving up and having them send it via mail. Checked our bags in at 4.40am and it somehow didn't get to even Chicago until 5pm! Never flying with them again. They lost multiple peoples luggage that we talked to that day.

San Francisco to Tokyo Haneda. I've had mixed feelings about this airline. I was careless enough that the ANA ticket that I purchased was actually operated by United Airlines. The horrifying experience with them starts from customer service. I telephoned them obtaining inquiries on how a less than 24 hour transit would handle baggage. I was informed that the baggage will transfer directly to my connecting flight (which was finally, and thank heavens, ANA from Haneda to Manila). The reservation agent said that connecting within 24 hour transit will not result the baggage to be claimed in HND and will be directly handled in MNL. Fine. We checked in Day of our flight with our luggage weighing less than 50 lbs, 5 luggage due to my star alliance gold status, along with my brother's normal traveler status. We were informed that the luggage will be offloaded in Haneda. This is a conflicting to the information I was provided few hours ago. The check in agent said "You can just re-check in to your next flght" I asked her, "are you sure", she was proud to answer "NO". Why suggest with utmost certainty to do such thing without verifying your sources. I had asked for supervisor and I was replied with "We do not have a supervisor, he is busy!" I am at my point of my fumes reaching to the airport's ceiling on the way how I am being handled. Finally, the supervisor at that time came and handled our baggage with manual baggage tags. The check in agent even uttered "good luck in finding these bags", while the supervisor gave her a blank stare. These words were also added to our fiasco Agent: There is no way I will write manual airport codes with these baggage tags, they will get lost for sure. (At least she cares about my baggage possibility of being lost). Agent: Your baggage cannot be held at the airport for security purposes. Really, security purposes? I will travel with my luggage for more than 12 hours (note it will go through a strict security check, hence, adding another 12 hours should not make any difference to impose threat to security. I am not sure why United continue to impress us with their undying no customer style of service. It was not United Airlines ticket that I purchased, it was under ANA but unfortunately, the operating flight was United. The check-in agent did not offer us any help that at least by reaching Haneda, a ground staff would assist us with our luggage to connect to another airline. I guess by customer's putting up their weak customer service to even lower than worst, keeps them in the market. Never again.

We were flying from STL on United to ORD. The STL departure was 10 minutes behind schedule. When we arrived at ohare at terminal B, our connecting flight started boarding at terminal F. Our ticket including on the United app said gate F16, so we ran like home alone a mile through the airport. When we arrived (F16) they had not started boarding, so My wife left her phone and bag with me to use the bathroom. They had changed the gate to f17 with no notice and told me I needed to board and they’d wait for my wife. She didn’t have her phone or her ticket and I was rudely asked to board and leave my wife. They could have easily just explained let me take your carry on to load and wait for your wife. There would have been no way to communicate to my wife where she needed to go, where her bags went, and where I went. I wasn’t going to strand my wife and leave her behind. Then my wife returned and sprinted to get to the gate where I flagged her down. After getting on board, the gate attendant came back and continued berating me in front of the whole plane about not leaving my wife behind and denying to board until my wife was with me. Terrible service, never flying United again. I hope this gate attendant is made to undergo public relations training and learns how to speak politely to the people to the people who are why she gets paid. Frustrating experience where I was berated by an awfully rude gate attendant for not leaving my wife in a different city because United’s flights weren’t on time and they changed gates without any notification. Here’s to never flying with United again.

commentHeader: does not care about their customers
reviewContent: Two customers and I missed connecting flights to Orlando by 10 minutes due to a previously delayed United Airlines flight from Paducah. United does not care about their customers whatsoever. How could they not communicate that they made a mistake and several customers would be arriving less than 10 minutes late to boarding time. Easily the worst airline I have ever flown. Terrible customer service.

Newark to Dallas Ft Worth. This airline is a glorified Spirit Airlines, nickel and dimming you for everything. I had a personal item that fit under my seat with no issue that was checked off by an agent on my flight to Newark. On my way back the agent refused to check off this same bag and said it was a carry on and had to pay $25. I could have paid the same amount including seat selection and carry on on another airline for less had I known without the hassle and frustration. The agents were incredibly rude. I  will never fly United if it’s the last thing I do. Terrible experience, customer service, pricing and policies.

route: Moline to La Guardia via Chicago
reviewContent: Moline to La Guardia via Chicago. Pathetic. They forgot to check levels of nitric oxide prior to our 6am flight from Moline. Then it took them 90 minutes to get a mechanic there to fill up the nitric oxide. We missed our connection, they then were rude trying to place us on a new flight. Then they sent us to Newark instead of La Guardia. Slow, lazy, and rude United employees cost us a day of our vacation without ever an apology. Will not fly again because they don’t care if you get to your destination on time.

Houston to Fort Lauderdale. I bought my 6 of Economy plus seat at the same time I purchased the tickets. After that when I go to the UA app to intend to change my seat to regular Economy instead. There is no warning appears to show that if you change to lower level you won't get a refund. Only on the website does not on the APP. Lucky that I just try of 1 seat, not all 6 seats. So, I lost 1 seat of Economy plus which is under my name. All 5 others seat still stay the same and never change. I was annoyed but I got my fault I went back and rebuy my former seat with extra $69. After that, 3 days later again I got extra other 6 times charge of buying Economy plus seat which mean they are total charged me 12 times. It messed up my bank account. I am really disappointed and upset about it.

Worst experience ever. This is the second time my international flight gets messed up because of aircraft maintenance. I arrived to Washington D.C on time to take my connection flight to London, they boarded the plane and then after 30 minutes  informed us that there were a problem with the software of the plane and they will be working on it! I understand that this can happen but it’s been occurring a lot to United airplanes! And then the attendant gave me an attitude cause I was checking about the possibility to do something about my other connection flight from London to Beirut cause obviously I will be missing it for sure having the first connection delayed. I was hoping that reviews on United Airlines were wrong but unfortunately it seems most of them are true and the airline needs a lot of improvement specifically to the aircraft, and mostly to the customer service.

Detroit to San Francisco. Terrible experience! Flight delayed 2.5 hours because of “fog” but other airlines were still flying to the destination. I specifically packed light to use a carry on and ended up having to check my bag because the overhead space was full. Only half of the passengers were boarded at the time of my arrival and I witnessed passengers getting on the plane after me that were able to find space in the overhead bins. Expressed my concern of checking my bag with the flight attendant and she said “I’m on the verge of tears too. I just can’t right now.”

commentHeader: learn how to treat your customers
reviewContent: I would like to start off by saying I have never been treated so rudely by any other airline staff. I was supposed to fly from Newark to Miami on May 15. Due to some of the weather we were experiencing united sent out an email stating that I was able to change my flight to an earlier flight or later flight because my flight would more than likely be delayed and or canceled. In this email it also stated that I was able to change my seat for free as long as it was in the same class cabin (economy-economy plus). I then called United to have my flight changed which would in turn change my seat. I was flying economy but the only available seats were for economy plus however that did not matter because United said that they would waive any change fees and any seat change fees. When I called to try and have my flight changed I was spoke into extremely nasty, I was told I didn’t know what I was talking about, and I was told "that’s just how it is", when I try to explain that United had already waived the change fee for the seat and customer service was still trying to charge me $150. I was determined to get on this flight as my scheduled flight was already delayed five hours. The flight I was trying to get on was delayed an hour. I did not give up as I went to the airport went through TSA and got to my gate. I had to physically show the email to her United worker to get them to believe me. I do not understand how the company is not in sync with their employees. How are you sending out mass emails that your own employees don’t know about it makes no sense at all. I was hung up on three times and treated very poorly. We used to like flying with United but lately something is gone bad. Take note from Southwest and learn how to treat your customers.

I traveled from Houston to Boston via Washington, DC on United Airlines in basic economy. It started off badly because you need help checking in at a kiosk if you are in basic economy and not checking a bag. A representative has to check if your item can got under the seat. I had one item that would go under the seat and a plastic bag full of paper work I was sorting. The United airlines attendant said could I get the small plastic bag into the other bag and I responded that I was sorting and it would be empty by the time I got to the gate. She said I am sorry but I cannot let you check in unless you put the contents of the plastic bag in the under the seat bag. I stayed at the kiosk and started the sorting through my papers. A supervisor came up and approved me saying I was only allowed one personal item, which I knew. I then went over to a seat and sorted my papers, then went through security with only one personal item. The flights were good otherwise with free soft drinks and coffee. I will fly them again in the future.

Houston to San Francisco. I had an absolutely horrible experience with United (as I almost always do), but this time will never use them again. I payed a lot of extra money for a late flight one evening (8 pm), and then they kept delaying it due to “weather” in San Francisco, even though every other airline’s flights had no delays or cancellations to SF. They eventually cancelled my flight due to said weather at 10:45 pm (another United flight to SF at 11 pm that night took off without delays so I know it wasn’t weather). Then I had to get in line for an agent to rebook, which was >100 people long. In the hour I waited, I called United and was placed on a “5-10 minute hold” that was actually >30 minutes, only to tel me there’s nothing they can do. When I got to the agent finally, around midnight, he rebooked me for an AM flight and gave me a 35% discount to nearby hotels but no free stay since the cancellation was “out of their control.” He promised me that if I payed for the hotel however, that United would reimburse me no questions asked. I confirmed this several times and he literally promised me this is the case. I payed $100 for the nearest hotel and spent the night. I filed the complaint to get my money back and they replied 5 days later with a short email saying they will not reimburse me anything but hope I can overloo this and continue to use their airline... I called United to clarify and they said customers are unable to speak to customer service on the phone, only email. This has been an infuriating process and I will certainly never use United again.

route: Albuquerque to Raleigh Durham via Denver
reviewContent: Albuquerque to Raleigh Durham via Denver. This has got to be the worst experience with an airline. Never in my life have a missed a flight and due to unforeseen circumstances we were running a bit behind. When checking in our bags there was a further delay due to some baglogs with the luggage’s. Since we were running behind, we asked how we were doing on time for boarding and the lady looked at our bags and said we had plenty of time. Then the TSA line was running very slow and were not able to do anything for us to expedite the process. We run to our gate and we find the gate closed but the desk attendant was opening the door for a passenger, but then as she is closing the door while the plane is still there, she just says YOU’VE MISSED YOUR FLIGHT. - again, she had just opened the door for a man right in front of us. The plane was Still there for another 7-10 minutes before it got disconnected from the bridge! Now there is no other flight to get us home until midnight, minded that we pleaded with her and told her that we have another flight to catch in the morning to Chicago. I understand the policy of getting to the airport with plenty of time to spare, unfortunately our morning was filled with issues that held us back. I don’t know what was going on with her day but that sure is not a way to show customer service. She was also rude and not cared one bit about our situation. I hope that as a corporation you are also training you employees about customer service, care, and a bit more of humanity. Neither her nr her manager at the ABQ airport showed neither of the characteristics of a position that requires customer service characteristics. I will never fly this  airline again and I will make sure to share my disappointing experience with others. I hope you can use this to train your employees better.

Newark to Boston. Although long waiting line at security screening, rest of the boarding process from check in to deboard was smooth. No baggage lost, clean cabin, on-time departure and arrival. No complaint at all.

route: Newark to Key West via Ft Lauderdale
reviewContent: United is the worst airline I have flown. All day of traveling. Flights delayed. Board a plane from Fort Lauderdale to Key West and have to get off cause something is wrong with engine. Miss my direct flight to Key West cause I was given the wrong directions from a worker. Had to pay $50 to check a carry on. Had to go through security twice cause lady wouldn’t take my bag at the gate. I will never fly United again.

Charlotte to Cancun. This will definitely be my last time to fly American. We were wanting to eliminate a long layover and had already sought out another flight to transfer too. We were then bounced around between customer service employees who would tell us they couldn’t help us but the next person would be able to. After meeting with three different employees, we finally had someone tell us our tickets were not applicable for flight transfers but gave us no rationale why. The customer service is poor, unprofessional, and lacks quality. I will never use this airline again.

route: Raleigh Durham to Medford via San Francisco
reviewContent: Raleigh Durham to Medford via San Francisco. This flight was delayed 5+hours meaning our connection in SFO would be missed. United refused to offer a food voucher, refused any hotel accommodations in SF and refused any compensation for the flight delay. Called United and talked to supervisor Chris after an 1.25 hour hold. He just said, “can’t help you, write a review”. That’s it. I have never had a supervisor be so rude. This is the second time I have had an issue with terrible customer service with United in the last 8 months. The last time they would not let me cancel a ticket when I had bought trip insurance. I have never been treated so poorly. Very sad that this airline has zero customer service, and has gone from one of the best airlines to one of the worst. Hopefully they will care about these reviews and try to improve. We will see.

Bozeman to Kauai. Flight coming out of Hawaii, 3 hours late getting out. My sister's flight had to be rerouted to Billings so she would make work. She will have to find a ride the day after back to Bozeman to get her vehicle. My daughter's flight was jacked kind of both ways coming out of Washington was fixed so she could make it to Kauai, her flight home which was a different flight, ended up with an 8 hour layover in San Francisco after an all night flight, I ended up with a 12 hour layover in Denver. After talking to my son, his last flight with United left him stranded in Seattle and he had to rent a car to get back home to Tri cities. No apologies, no refunds, this is not acceptable. Will stick to Alaska and Delta in the future.

Having travelled from Maui to San Francisco airport en route to London and was very impressed by staff and the standard of the cabin. The food served was very acceptable and drinks were available when required. The Polaris flight was certainly an upgrade to the flight that we had from the UK to San Francisco! As a personal thing i would have preferred to have had a window seat as I did feel a little hemmed in in the aisle seat. Just one thing spoiled a short part of my journey. The rising wall between the two middle seats, of which I was travelling on one malfunctioned and sadly it came down and wouldn't return to the up position. This resulted in me being in very close proximity to the stranger in the seat next to me. Several of the stewardesses tried to rectify the situation sadly the wall remained in the down position for a couple of hours. It did however strangely rectify itself after a couple of hours which made me more comfortable.

Boston to Chicago. This is the worst airline I have ever flown! Unfortunately it’s my company preferred airline. Old planes, uncomfortable,no technology, made me check my carryon and when we landed, discovered 4 empty bins in back! I do carryon only to avoid waiting 45 minutes for my luggage. Now I’m waiting for my flight back and the same, asking people to check their carryons! I’ve flown most of the other airlines, and United is at the bottom of the list, Southwest is even better!

Buffalo to Newark. Worst ever flight. Our scheduled departure from BUF to EWR was at 7 30 pm and it got delayed by 3 hours. After all the passengers were boarded after the very long wait, there was a further delay of 1 hour because of their mistakes in fixing some doors. We missed our check in time at New Jersey and arrived really late. Will never fly with this airline again.

Orlando to Nashville via Chicago. Our flight from Orlando to chicago was delayed by about an hour and a half due to weather, which in return caused us to miss the connecting flight from chicago to nashville, which was fine, however the man we spoke to first and worked the gate next to the customer service area was rude told me I could not talk to a supervisor then told me he would call one, so he picked up the phone said nothing hung up and said one would be right there, never saw a supervisor, then as his shift was ending and i was still standing there he said 'did one come?' I said no he said ok have a nice drive home laughed and left. The customer service people weren't really wanting to help my family get home finally gave in and put us on a different airline. This is the worst airline to go through, if you can spend a little extra go through someone else unless you are into getting stranded.

commentHeader: suck just as bad as Spirit
reviewContent: This airline is no better than Spirit or Frontier or any of the other cut-rate airlines out there. The staff was rude and gave us little information about our flight delay. Our flight was delayed for 4 hours! First, they claimed it was maintenance issues, in which case they would have to pay us for the delay. Then, they claimed it was suddenly the weather. What? Trust me when I say the weather was not bad and would’ve cleared up completely by the time we got to Chicago. The staff did little to try to inform us about what was going on. Trust me, it doesn’t make a difference if you fly with a legacy carrier or not! They suck just as bad as Spirit!

Chicago to Charleston. Traveled with Frontier Airlines this weekend and it was delayed 7 hours and wasn’t sure if the flight was even going to leave the airport. Had to Book last minute within the airport with United Airlines so I could get home, since Frontier didn’t have another flight until the following weekend. Had 2 checked bags and a carry on. United doesn’t allow carry on bags. I had to check all three for 210$ because I was already inside the airport and didn’t have anything else and had no choice. Baggage fees are ridiculous and both airlines were not helpful in this situation.

I traveled from Boston to Houston on United Airlines in basic economy. I was originally routed through Chicago but when I found out my flight was waiting an aircraft I asked the customer desk to look into the matter. They changed my flight giving me a direct flight to Houston. The flight was uneventful and arrived 20 minutes before scheduled arrival time. I originally had three seats but the steward told me to vacant the third seat for a man who I suspect was a United employee. Overall a good flight.

So unhappy with United! On our way to Las Vegas our flight was delayed 3 hours which made it impossible to get our flight mid way, so we had to get a flight 6 hours after which means we ended up being in an airport for 12+ hours. Not only this but we didn’t even receive a notification that it was delayed so we couldn’t even go back home or do anything but just sit. Then they refused to let us sit together, on any of our flights, luckily there was one person who offered to switch seats. They acted like because we paid for the cheaper seats that’s how we were gonna be treated. We couldn’t even take a carry on with our flight it was just ridiculous. We flew Delta a little less than a year before this and paid for the same type of ticket and when we asked if we could sit next to each other they said no problem at all and allowed us to have a carry on. United also overbooked our flight by 5 people, I don’t understand how do you overbook? Plus when we got our flight we had to PAY to watch anything on their little TVs, where in Delta it’s paid for. I don’t get any of this. Just doesn’t make sense to me! Just not happy with them at all. We will never again fly United.

commentHeader: I will never fly United again
reviewContent: Cancún to Nashville via Chicago. United airlines is terrible. They postponed our flight twice in Cancun then promised we should still make our flight in Chicago to Nashville. We arrive in Chicago and the gate changed 5 different and kept getting postponed from 7:30p.m and finally gets cancelled at 12:00am, after spending 3 hrs in customer service line we get told the only flight out is 24hrs later and there are no accommodations. I will never fly United again. I would never suggest united airlines to anyone.

Are you joking United? On my flight TO EWR from SEA, I had a 3 hour delay. Now on my flight from EWR to SEA, there’s a 25 min delay which turns into a 1 hour delay, which turns into a last minute gate change far away (just getting out of physical therapy mind you) which turns into another gate change back to original gate after I had made my way over to the new one and everyone is now still waiting in line with the aircraft yet to be seen. What are you guys doing? This is 2018 - learn about customer service - would’ve thought you should have learnt from all your mistakes in this area by now with all the lawsuits and bad press. Never flying United again, back to Alaska for me. Horrible experience.

route: Fort Lauderdale to Salt Lake City via Denver
reviewContent: Fort Lauderdale to Salt Lake City via Denver. Did somebody shrink the size of the international carry on size? Or is it just United Airlines? Wouldn't let us bring our carry on as it didn't fit in their sample carry on box. It fit in Southwest's just fine. Non-existent customer service. We were not rude, just asked why it was small compared the other airlines. Not even about the 25$. Just tired of dealing with people trying to nickle and dime. Thought for a minute I was dealing with dish network or comcast. I always regret not flying with tried and true Southwest!

Heathrow terminal 2 was pleasant enough and boarding started on time. The plane is old and lacks in a few places: built in screen was tiny and showed movies on a loop. The irony is they ask you to use your own device but don't provide any power. I could not get the app to work, I didn't try to find a flight attendant because I had a book. Seat was 25K in the extra legroom and they made it clear you could not just move into this section. I'd rather fly a 2-3-2 layout 767 than a 3-3-3 787. It's such as shame that the modern aircraft are so horrendously tight so you have a choice of space but old IFE/no power or IFE/power but really narrow seats. The legroom was not spectacular given the $140 cost. Food was poor. Chicken or pasta. I had the chicken and the liquid tasted like stewed tea. Didn't finish it and could see others left it. Snack before landing was much nicer. This was a very expensive ticket due to my particular needs for a specific day / route for work so I understand but it is still galling to know I surely paid more than a few of the business class passengers to sit back here.

I had the smoothest and the most comfortable ride on my flight back to Denver from Dallas. The flight crew was great. The only problem I had was at security at DFW. The United ticket agent cleared my under seat carry on. The power trip lady made get out of line and go back to the agent that cleared me when my under the seat carry on fitted on the check your baggage size. This cost me another 20 minutes in going back through a line that I had been in just for someone to say ok. This would be the only reason I would not fly United anymore. The power trip lady would cause me not to travel with them anymore. I understand security by all means protect me and my fellow Americans but a bag. For real.

San Francisco to Chicago. If you fly United you better get used to delays. Worst airline service ever. I fly almost every week, mostly of the time by United, but thinking seriously about a change to Delta.

London Heathrow to San Francisco. Our flight from London Heathrow to SFO, was a wonderful non eventful flight, except for the service! The staff and flight attendants were above par and the main flight attendant on our flight went above and beyond! He made sure not only we’re we satisfied on the flight, but I heard several passengers on the flight comment on how well he took care of them. Actually, all the flight crew members on our flight were so delightful and made our trip back to the States a joyous experience! Cheers to all of the United Crew for going above and beyond to make our travel experience so delightful! We will definitely fly International anytime with United! 5 Star Experience does not go unnoticed!

Houston to London via Newark.  This airline is unbelievably incompetent. I scheduled a flight from Houston to London to attend my mother’s wedding and it was canceled, delayed, then canceled again. I now have to buy $7k worth of British Airways flights so I can arrive on time and attend her wedding. After going to customer service for a refund they stated I’m Not eligible for a refund and told me good luck. I will never fly with United again. If you want to spend a few grand and a few days stuck in an airport,  choose United!

Newark to Saint Louis. After spending hours at the airport as the flight continued to be postponed until finally canceled due to “weather conditions” - when other airlines did not and the weather was fine in both cities, the customer service provided was very poor. I spent almost one hour to be able to rebook the flight and thank God I tried to check in right away with my reservation number because the email confirmation I supposed to receive never arrived. Then I found out that I did not have a seat assigned on my connecting flight when my wife did and I was never told that.

Flew United Airlines Denver to Los Angeles. Very friendly, courteous, welcoming and professional flight crew. Enjoyable flight through and through. No scales pitch for a credit cards. Comfortable seating. The flight attendants were accommodating for my request to fill my tea thermos as well.

commentHeader: this airline just wants your money
reviewContent: Flew United Airlines from Kansas City to Houston. Arrived at MCI with my usual bags I travel with, when I’m trying to print off the boarding pass, this rude employee comes up to me saying you need to check this bag on, I said no, I have never had to before. She made me as there was a wheel outside of the bin for $25. I was not planning on spending $25 for a bag nor the wait when I get off the plane. Every single airline I have flown with in the past (frequent flyer) I’m just fine with my carry on. The bins go length ways so it would have been 100% just fine. It’s obvious this airline just wants your money.

commentHeader: they were no help at all
reviewContent: Denver to Barcelona via Newark. Delayed and the circled in the air due to "weather" - checked Newark weather didn't see anything. Plane then rerouted to Cleveland because they didn't have enough fuel. All the while other planes were landing in Newark, including planes that left Denver after us. In Cleveland took 3 hours for plane to take off again. All the while the customer service reps were no where to be found to try to schedule a new flight for the missed connection. The desk was empty and united employees at the gates just stared at us and didn't even call over anyone to help any of us when we asked them. Once we finally found someone they were no help at all, just telling us to try to get to Newark and have customer service there rebook us. If we cant find anyone at 7 pm in a customer service kiosk in Cleveland, how are we supposed to find customer service reps at 1 am when we get to newark, 7 hours after we were supposed to originally get there.
London to San Francisco airport return. The food was absolutely disgusting. I advise not to travel with United . It is not worth whatever you pay.

Newark to Orlando. Extremely disrespectful staff by the gate (the first time I interact with them personally) wanted to charge me for an extra bag for my crossbody that only carries my phone(cause i have no pockets, and I carry a note 8, big phone to carry and too expensive to lose). Inflight Crew is rude, they throw the snack at you, literally - anything you request on the flight, you will be treated with attitude. I asked for spirit, then saw they had Ginger, I asked to change it, the attendant literally snatched the cup from my hands and looked at me like I was begging for money. The worst disrespectful, rude, disgusting service.

Chicago to Saginaw. This was the last leg of an international flight for me. They bumped me off of my scheduled flight before I even arrived, which I understood as it was a bit tight, but I would have made it. Than 15 minutes before we were due to board they delayed the flight, just a little bit, then a little more then a little more. Now it’s over 5 hours later and the plane still isn’t here. The worst part is that it wasn’t until after the 5 hour mark that anyone even told us what was going on. No one around to answer questions. This is a business trip so unfortunately I had no choice in the carrier, but I will be sending an email to our travel guys and ask them to avoid using United in the future.

Veracruz to Houston. Rude, as always. Told the stewardess that the non-english speaker next to me needed a seat belt extension and I was told not to do her job. Was told to stop using my phone while the plane was still parked and the lady just kept standing looking at me until i turned it off. I am aware I have to turn it off and will of course do so but it was not said very nicely. It is always the same but for some reason they keep having the only international route out of veracruz.

Newark to West Palm Beach. Flight was almost empty with about 40 passengers. My son is 6’4 tall  and we had paid already extra $17 for just reserving the seats together. Crew insisted we can’t change seats even though 70 percent of aircraft was empty. So most of passengers were squeezed in 3 rows. Last time flying with United. This is free, just being kind to your customers.

Just when you think United can’t possibly get any worse, they prove you wrong. The staff on the flight from Houston to Frankfurt were surly, unhelpful and generally more concerned with chatting in the galley than taking care of customers in Business Class. Food quality has been in steady decline for years as has the wine choices. No drinks offered before departure even when specifically asked for. compared to the other airlines, United has become a budget airline but with premium prices. Management please take note! Now let’s get to the cabin itself. Foot rest was broken, literally in half. Seat sound system did not function. Time to change my allegiance.

Los Angeles to Honolulu. I had the most stressful time trying to rebook a flight I wasn’t going to make. I talked to three agents and my phone dropped the call twice. Finally I was given a phone number to call and the person that answered was amazing, he helped me out in finding a new flight for the best price, even though it wasn’t with United, and refunding me for the flight I had missed. After a stressful morning it was so nice having his help and it makes me want to fly with United more!

San Francisco to Washington Dulles. They made us go to baggage claim for your carry-on. This is nonsense. We wanted to avoid baggage claim so we did carry-on but they made us to do baggagw claim anyway because the cabin is full. This is a bad design and bad customer service. They didn't even bring the bags to us which they took from us involuntarily. Very narrow seats and uncomfortable.

commentHeader: ran out of food by row 30
reviewContent: San Jose to Chicago. No food provided on the 4 hour flight. I was in row 35, and they ran out of food by row 30! It was an early flight, so no chance for breakfast, then I connected to another United flight will no time for food between. So, very poor performance. No apology from the staff - not their fault, though. Also a crummy little plane with no room, considering the length of the flight. No screens for movies, and no is to charge my phone. It was on time, so that's the main thing.

route: Norfolk to Los Angeles via Washington
reviewContent: Norfolk to Los Angeles via Washington. Going into Norfolk was ok. But coming back was the worst experience ever. No room for my small carryall on the flightfrom Norfolk to DC do it was sent cargo all the way to LAX. I asked for a fragile tag and was told they would put that tag in my expensive carryall. That was not done. My carryall was scratched.  My seat on the flight to LAX was truly a nightmare of discomfort. The phone charger under the seat. And you had no mobility. No food — just pretzels. You need to pay me for replacing my carryall and the broken things. Very irresponsible. I dislike United attitude.

Chicago to Tucson. Nice people, clean planes. Entertainment is lousy. On American Airlines I can download the app in flight. On United you have to download the app before the flight, no one tell you this until you get to see it at 10,000 feet. I purchased the inflight internet. It is so bad, I still can’t download the app. Thanks for wasting my time. I’m not approving any more United Flights.

commentHeader: make you check your carry on
reviewContent: Newark to West Palm Beach . They make you check your carry on, saying bins are full. You get in plane and lots of bin space to put carry on. No one using common sense - bad customer service, flight attendant agreed with me and apologized. Had to wait at luggage claim for carry on.

Washington to Nashville . Today, I remember why I avoid United Airlines at all costs. Not that I hadn't forgotten their unfriendly behavior in the past before, but you would think that after so much bad press and negative publicity, they would care to be more courteous to their customers and try to accommodate them more (at least more than competing airlines). You would think, but you would be wrong. United acts as if they are a "preferred" airline when really, I cringe at the thought of ever having to fly them. The only reason to consider them is cost, but you are giving up severe customer service while on board, while on the phone, or while trying to accommodate any emergencies that may come up. Their cancellation policy is bizarre and it isn't even clear on how you can cancel a flight on their website (it's not under their refunds/cancellations tab).

Houston to Detroit. I encountered the rudest and most unprofessional flight attendant. About 20 minutes after take off I had to use the restroom. I'm sitting towards the front of the plane in economy just next to the lavatory. It's lock and I haven't seen anyone go in or out. I look around the plane people are moving about and using the rest room in the rear of the plane. I proceed to head to the back of the plane to use the facilities when the flight attendant tells me to return to my seat. I explain my urgency and she proceeds to call me out over the intercom. I used the lavatory and proceeded back to my seat. She is now standing in the isle with the drink cart at my seat. With a disgusted tone she looks at the other attendant and says "Let me guess he's sitting right here" They both look at me like I have an arm growing out the side of my head and proceeds to tell me that there is a restroom right here, like I'm incapable of figuring that out on my own. I explain that it is locked! She flips the lavatory sign up and unlocked the door. What has happened to customer service these days?  I guess you get what you pay for.

Houston to St. Louis. Was 25 mins before board time and was not allowed to get my boarding pass, despite an empty security line and short walk to the gate. Customer service was rude and then thought replacing my ticket with a flight 7 hours later was acceptable. I was trying to see my little sisters college graduation, and I decided to try and catch my first flight and switch tickets back once I got to the gate. However, United had sold my seat in less than 10 mins, which makes me wonder if I actually had the seat in the first place? Overall, horrible experience. I ended up driving to a different airport and catching a flight on Southwest. On my way back to Houston, I wasn't allowed to print my boarding pass because I checked the box marked "no checked bags." Customer service lady was rude again and told me I would be charged $25 at the gate if I did not check my bag (which was a backpack). She proceeded to tell me that my "cheap" ticket did not come with guaranteed overhead bin space. Went to the gate and had no problem with the staff or using bin space. Didn't make sense why she would tell me that. I've always flown southwest and for some reason ended up with these United flights. They will be my last.

route: Denver to São Paulo via Houston
reviewContent: My family and I were traveling from Denver to São Paulo via Houston, and our international flight was delayed (11 hours) due to mechanical problems. United provided accommodation, but the staff was unnecessarily rude with passengers. We were all tired (we waited for almost 3 hours inside the plane until they decided to delay the flight for the next day), but little information was provided. For the ones who had connecting flights (that would be missed), the staff simply stated that they were off duty. I’ve heard and read about United lack of care with customers, but the way we were treated was lack of human decency. United never again!

After a 2 hour maintenance delay and then having to deplane then reboard after another hour, I barely made my connecting flight and had to run through O'Hare to race to my gate. I barely made it to my connecting flight. Then I got on my plane to Honolulu which is a 9.5 hour flight. They told us there would not be wifi or entertainment available. 45 minutes later the pilot comes on and says we might need to deplane and there could be an hour delay because of some problems they were having with their entertainment system. I'm frustrated because I am anxiously going to see my husband coming home from a 7 month deployment. I also spent a lot of money on this flight. Worst flying experience ever. Never ever flying with United again.

Charleston to Newark. I have flown with United for 4 years consistently now and have never had such a horrible experience as today. Customer service was terrible, no help was given, and no solution so I am now flying Delta. I arrived almost an hour and half before my flight - at 5:30am, bags paid for online and check in online done. All I needed to do was put my bags on the flight and get on security line - the line was so long that they pushed the 6:50am flight customers to the front, but when one woman complained about it, they sent us back and said that the flights would stand by for us since so many of us were on those flights. Being sent to the back of the line made me not get to security until 6:25am, with boarding ending at 6:30am. Furious no one could help me or would, and I managed to run to the gate and miss my flight by 5 minutes. I planned according as I have done for every single flight I have ever taken out of Charleston, and missed my flight because of incompetence and the disregard of United and airport employees. When I called to try and book another flight the representative was also extremely unhelpful only offering the most expensive routes or flights for tomorrow when I needed to be home today. When we mentioned I would be taking Delta he started badmouthing Delta and how it would be better to take United - rude, unhelpful, and disrespectful. The horrid stories of this airline disregarding customers needs or even attempting to be helpful have never been more evident than today and I am overjoyed with the care and kindness shown by Delta airlines. There is no doubt in my mind I will never fly United again.

Houston to London. United is horrible. We paid $1,100 to upgrade to First Class 8-9 months prior to the flight. Get to the airport and we are NOT upgraded. They say we paid to be in a waitlist.  They say they will refund our money (and 40,000 miles) ASAP. I get my credit card statement and they have only refunded $550! Why? Both our flights were on the same ticket. I’ve complained three times, only to get emailed back by three different people. They have not offered me one little thing for a big inconvenience of not flying first class, much less trying to scam me out of $550. We fly pretty often and we are done with United!

route: Grand Rapids to Brussels via Chicago
reviewContent: Grand Rapids to Brussels via Chicago. Our first plane was grounded for maintenance, and were stuck in GR for 4 hours. We missed a day of vacation, lost our personal pick up, lost a day at the hotel and our first class Euro train tickets. I paid for German airlines and United messed up so bad we had to take United to New Jersey. Our New Jersey flight was taking off late but had to be returned do to an passenger not being able to fly. I had to rebuy my euro train pass for twice what I originally paid and later then my original ticket. When we got to Brussels there was an extra security check just for United. Our seats were not on the ticket, even though I bought the tickets 4 months ago. On the way home from Brussels the scheduled the flight so tight that we had to rush to make the plane. You were not able to buy any food on the plane either. When we got to Chicago, again the transfer flight was so close we barely had time to get through customs with a few minutes to spare running through the terminal. But it was ok because they didn't have a plane to fly. We were another 2 hours late getting home due to no plane and when they got a plane it was held up for maintenance problems again. Most of the time me and my girlfriend didn't even get to sit next to each other. So after paying for a hotel stay we didn't use, extra 100 dollars in taxi fees, airlines I specifically paid for and was not able to use, an extra 300 dollars in euro train fares and lost time visiting my very close friend I had not seen in 6 years. United said the best they could do was give me 60 dollars in food vouchers. It was a horrible experience. I feel so bad for the two employees out of 15 that actually were nice.

Las Vegas to Newark. Flight was delayed 45 minutes to board and another 45 minutes in the aircraft for take off clearance. I was very anxious because i had a connection after Newark and it was doubtful i could make it. I asked the flight attendant and she couldn’t care less - she told me call your travel agent. Can you believe that. At that time a male flight attendant also on business class told me that if there is a problem United will book me on the next flight and told me not to worry. How hard was what be did? He was probably the only one paying attention to the training. Also the power socket on my seat was off. Again the female attendant turned her head the other way. The male attendant just said give me your cell phone i will have it charged for you. Again so simple.

route: Miami to Seattle via San Francisco
reviewContent: Miami to Seattle via San Francisco. This was the worst flight we’ve ever flown on and we were a party of 7, 5 children and two adults we had to sit on the plane for three hours before it took off and they didn’t take off - going to San Francisco should have it gone to Denver to refill with fuel and then it flew to San Francisco. Instead of getting there at approximately 10:00 PM we got there at 2am with five kids and the employees on the aircraft were super rude to our teenage kids. United airlines has the worst customer service we’ve ever seen on an airline they are just completely horrible they don’t take care of their passengers, especially people traveling with children. We had to stay in San Francisco overnight and then get all split up with the family because there were seven of us to be able to get flown home my husband left with four children at 9:45 and I could not get a flight with my other son until 4 o’clock the next day. It was completely horrible the process of getting rebooked took over two hours in the night time with nobody waiting in line and we had to have five people help us to get this all sorted out with the manager stepping in.

commentHeader: need to step up the efficiency
reviewContent: Slow, thats how I feel everything goes on this airline. On my flight to visit family I didn’t make it to my destination until approx 26 hours from when I boarded the first flight. 3 flights later. We sat on tarmac at LAX for who knows (no one knew) said something with the bathrooms. They need to step up the efficiency made me miss my connecting. Sat on the plane for over an hour when I was almost the last one to board on the way back. This is just becoming commonplace with United I think. Please, people, we have places to be!

Tel Aviv to San Francisco. Polaris business class seat configuration of 2x2x2 in this Boeing 787-8. Not a typical configuration and a bit out of date set up. The seats are flat bed but all the lower part is not 180 degrees so if you are tall this seat is not comfortable at all – half part of your leg are in a strange angle. Food is not eatable and very basic. Service in minimal. Overall they do the minimum to take you in a 15hr flight. This time with no entertainment system at all -it was broken for all passengers

commentHeader: definitely be flying with them again
reviewContent: I was a bit nervous about flying United because I've heard so many bad reviews, but we flew from Dublin to Tampa via Washington and then Tampa to Dublin via Newark and on all 4 flights we were met with nothing but courtesy, efficiency, friendliness and helpfulness. There were delays encountered on the Tampa to Newark flight due to weather, but we were kept informed all along the way and were even booked onto a standby connection should we have missed our original connection in Newark. We caught the connection with minutes to spare and fully expected our luggage to miss the flight, but to our surprise and delight it was right there on the carousel when we arrived in Dublin. There was an off-duty Cabin Crew member sitting next to us on the Tampa to Newark flight and she was also helpful and friendly, even though she was off-duty. She got information for us about our connecting flight and showed us where the gate was. I would have no problem in recommending United to anyone, and will definitely be flying with them again.

Quebec to Newark. The staff was incredibly nice, but they had to follow whatever United airlines policy was. I was in Quebec City, where they speak both English and French. My carry on bag was forcefully checked in to be in cargo and it was not handled delicately, I was not told to take my laptop or valuables out, at least not in English, and my screen cracked in the process. I don't blame the staff, I blame a lack of communication and United Airlines wanting to check people's bags in so they don't have to deal with people needing to get their belongings out. Also, who ever handled cargo almost lost my luggage, I had to wait almost 24 hours to find out if they found it because it was a late transfer to the right connecting flight. From the update I got, it was in Chicago when my connecting flight was from Newark to San Jose.

Flying United was a great experience. A wonderful captain who kept us detailed through the flight and manuvered thru the turbulence. Me and my family cause a hold up for the other passengers by being the last people on board and the captain waited for us. We had 3 kids and they were more than patient making us feel as though we we're first class when we definitely we're not. The staff was kind and caring and wonderful with kids.

route: Taipei to Raleigh Durham via San Francisco
reviewContent: I have flown international numerous times and never has my checked luggage been so neglected than with United Airlines on my last trip from Taipei to Raleigh Durham via San Francisco. My luggage was left in the rain and all of my personal belongings were soaked and beginning to smell after nearly 24 hours of traveling. Once home, I was still able to ring out some of my clothing but multiple books, journals and magazines were ruined, swollen and tearing because they had been wet for hours. I was shocked no one even mentioned this to me or took responsibility for everything in the suitcase getting damaged. Luckily, my laptop and other electronics were with me as carry on baggage or they too would have been ruined. I would not trust United Airlines with my personal belongings in the future.

route: Zürich to Reno via Newark & Denver
reviewContent: Was not looking forward to the flights due to previous reviews. ZRH to EWR was fine, food OK (nothing special) but plenty of drinks runs and nice snack before landing. EWR to DEN full and late but staff did their best to dispell fears of tight connections. No food offered in Economy, even for a 4+ hrs flight! Soft drinks offered (and nice cabin crew gave a hot pizza, which was appreciated). DEN to RNO full and free entertainment given due to late departure. Overall, UA does not offer a sophisticated product but every member of staff I encountered was smiling, helpful and professional.

commentHeader: went above and beyond to assist me
reviewContent: Phoenix to Houston to Orlando. My experience with United was superior! They went above and beyond to assist me. I missed my flight because of a traffic issue on the way to the airport. I was rebooked and arrived just 3 hours late, my seats were upgraded. I asked for nothing. After collecting my luggage for a 10 day vacation I went to the auto rental to pick up my car. It was there that I realized I had lost my wallet. A first for me and quite problematic. No license, no money, no credit cards , no atm. No ID at all. The car rental bluntly said, no license,no car! And so abruptly ended my vacation plans because I was to drive nearly 3 hrs to my destination. I was traveling solo. After filing a lost wallet report, I headed back to the United counter to see what I could do. By this time it was 8pm. The agents got very busy on their computers for reasons I did not know. Ultimately, they handed me a voucher for a hotel room, a thermos filled with toiletries , 2 meal vouchers and a return ticket to Phoenix in the morning at 8:30am. While it was a crisis situation for me, their concern and consideration went well beyond anything I expected. I was so very grateful for their assistance and to United Airlines.

Chicago to Kalamazoo. The heat was on so high, I felt sick. Everyone around me agreed. I asked the flight attendant and she rolled her eyes at me and ignored me when I asked if it could be turned down a bit. Customer service sucks. No smile, not polite, and plain irritating.

I unfortunately had an awful experience with United Airlines. Initially, my flight was to be a series of connections from Alexandria - Houston - Chicago - Toronto. Weather delays caused the entire chain of my connections to be missed and land me in Toronto too late to catch my next flight with a different airline. So, they rerouted me so that my connections were now Alexandria-Houston-Toronto. United Airlines refused to compensate me in any way shape or form because they claimed that if I have to catch another flight with another airline, that is not their problem. You are an airline, your job is to get me from point A to point B, how you are refusing to do that is beyond me. I was then forced to reschedule the flight I had missed for another day, but of course I arrive back in Toronto and United Airlines had left my luggage at Houston airport. When I retrieved my luggage the following day, a wheel had been broken, forcing me to purchase another suitcase for the flight I had rescheduled. Not happy.

commentHeader: repeatedly refused to even help us
reviewContent: Customer service sucks. Our United Airlines flight arrived late due to surprise de-icing? We arrived at gate 94 just in time to watch them close the door in front of us. The gate attendant, refused to make any attempt to get us on the plane and quickly rehearsed her "It's not my problem" script. We next had the misfortune of meeting the operations manager for United in Denver. He repeated the same "It's not my problem" script and then repeatedly refused to even help us to the customer service desk. Complete apathy and lack of ownership. The only small respite was a staff member who reluctantly agreed to help us complete a reimbursement request.

commentHeader: never ever again will I fly this airline
reviewContent: Flew Newark to Savannah. I fly 4-6 times a year but never United. I have to say, I now know what all of the negative public reviews are about. I was yelled at by the boarding guy because he told me my bag was not compliant with flight regulations. I told him that my bag was compliant but that I had my handbag stacked on top which made it look bigger. He held up the line and made me place the bag in the size checker. I took out my shower shoes which I had just placed in the front pocket and he tried to publicly humiliate me as if I were senile if my bag at the gate. My husband told him that I literally just put them in the front pocket because they were in my hand bag and he was so rude and obnoxious to my husband whom never speaks and is a proper gentleman. Due to Inited’s notorious treatment of its customers, I told my husband it was not worth it and let’s just let her get on with it as my bag clearly fit and was compliant with regulations. I guess my point is never ever again will I fly this airline!

Indianapolis to Newark. The flight delayed for 7 hours because of waiting for aircraft. We had to fly with different airline to get to our destination on time to attend an important event. Furthermore, without notification, our seats on a return flight was automatically cancelled. As a result, we have to take a much later flight to go back home. Our overall experience with United airlines has been terrible!

London to Washington. United's Polaris Business Class service on this flight was efficient and friendly. The 787's business class arrangement is a bit better than that of the 777, but still lags behind the comfort of some of its competitors. Still, the food has been upgraded somewhat, but gone are some of the original Polaris amenities - ie., the second pillow, the bloody mary carts, etc. Slippers must be asked for. Overall it was comfortable with generally good service. Entertainment choices are immense. My main course, ravioli, was a bit too undercooked for my taste. I did not take the second meal, but it looked quite tasty. My only real complaint here would be the state of the toilet which was a mess within a couple hours of takeoff. Obviously no crew member ever looked. But it would be nice if United had someone straighten up the toilet at least once during the flight.

Seattle to Oklahoma City. Flight was delayed for maintenance at Sea Tac airport. They told us it would be about 17 minutes and we would make all connecting flights. Then it was delayed 30 minutes, then an hour before they finally boarded us. They told me I still might make my connecting flight from Denver to OKC, but if not, they would switch my flight to Tulsa which took off 35 minutes later. She said they'd take care of everything mid-air. They told us on the plane there would be CS reps to help us with our connections. It was one guy who simply asked where you were going and he'd direct you to the gate. I walked 30+ gates away to get to my connecting flight. They didn't have me in the system, and didn't have my luggage transferred. He sent me back to a United customer service desk that turned out to be closed when I got there. He closed the gate, so I couldn't make Tulsa either. So I had to go back 30 gates, stand in line for 2 hours, and be told I wouldn't be able to get to OKC until about 12:30. There were so many people in the customer service line, not just people from our flight. I didn't see this with any other airline as I walked through DIA. Once I finally got through the long line, the lady at the Customer Service desk was friendly and helpful as she could be given the circumstances, but United really blew it and I missed my mother's funeral.  I will never fly your airline again.

Washington to Zurich. We had a delay of 50 mins, but keep good informed. Seat comfy, IFE great and crew very friendly, always with a smile. We arrived a little late. Food was the mediocre and the same till month, but okay for a 7 hour flight. will fly United again.

Fort Lauderdale to Washington via Newark. This is the most terrible airline in the world. My flight was delayed and then my airline was understaffed causing me to miss my layover flight. There were no more flights to DCA for the rest of the night so they put me on a little plane and flew me to Richmond (three hours from my house) so I could then take a taxi all the way home. In the meantime losing my luggage and getting that three days later. Cherry on top - they refuse to give me a refund.

commentHeader: Wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy
reviewContent: Nightmare Experience. Flying from Edmonton to Norfolk. Spent 2 hours on the tarmac in Denver before flying to Newark. Newark was cancelling and delaying flights left and right. United rebooked me onto a flight to Norfolk 30 hours later and I was not going to waste a day in Newark. My fiance said he would drive to Richmond to come get me if I could book a flight there. First time rebooking to Richmond, the United Service Assistant was very rude and didn't seem to care about my situation. Ripped up my luggage tag, as it was on the back of my boarding pass, even though I had asked for it back and rebooked me on a flight to Richmond that left at 6.30. It was 6.20. Had to run down to the shuttle to get from Terminal C to Terminal A in order to get to my gate. Plane was gone by the time I got there. Stood in another customer service line to get onto another flight to Richmond. This service assistant was a lot more helpful and seemed like he cared. So thank you to him. Got me booked onto the next flight out to Richmond that night. Got to Richmond and my luggage was not there. Spoke to a luggage assistant there who was really kind and was able to locate my luggage without the luggage tag. Luggage was in Newark still and I could expect to see it delivered the following morning. I've been here for 2 days now and still do not have my luggage. Everytime I check or call the number all I'm told is that "staff are still in the process of locating my luggage". What happened? It feels like after I landed in Newark and the flights to Norfolk were cancelled that my luggage just got tossed aside somewhere and now they can't find it. That or it feels like it's not a priority to them. Maybe I'm being selfish, but I literally only have the clothes on my back and what was in my carry-on with me. I have prescriptions in my luggage that I'm going without. I leave in 3 weeks, so I hope to have my luggage by then. But I'm considering cancelling and rebooking my return trip with someone else because I don't want to have to relive this nightmare again. Wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy.

San Francisco to Sacramento. Terrible service and attitude. I travel for a living and will continue to avoid flying with them unless it’s the last option! Bags were also late. It would seem fairly simple to me that service with a smile should be of the upmost priority. Hopefully they can and will put effort into fixing their issues.

Boston to Chicago. The flight was excellent and beyond expectation. Boarding went quickly and smoothly and we pushed back from the gate 10 minutes early. The IFE started to glitch out during the safety video, so the crew did a manual demonstration and also let us use the IFE for free (United normally charges for it). The service started a bit late but when it did the crew was friendly and energetic. I felt welcomed and it made my flight that much better. The legroom in Economy+ is excellent, it is almost 10 extra inches than regular economy - well worth the money! The seats were a bit tight in width but other than that, very comfortable. The pilots were interactive, keeping us informed. Overall it was a very good experience with United.

Sacramento to San Francisco. I had some trouble with the self check-in and the staff that helped me were plain rude and arrogant. They showed no interest in helping me out and rolled there eyes at my questions. I had never used the machines before and the staff made me feel like the most stupid person on Earth. When my bag were checked in the man behind the counter threw my bag on the belt, no respect at all. The staff on the plane were lovely but that is ruined by the bad impression at check-in. United should have a talk with their staff about customer treatment!

My fiancée and I booked our vacation back in September, so this should have been a very smooth trip. A couple days before our flight to Denver which was supposed to connect us to Vegas, United Airlines decided to switch our connecting flight and not update us about the change in connecting flights. Our new connecting flight was now leaving out of Washington D.C ten minutes after we were supposed to land. 1) Nobody can get off a plane and sprint down the terminal to board. 2) Our first flight out of Newark was delayed so our connecting flight left before we even landed in D.C. Now we have lost a day of vacation and hotel reservations that we can’t get a refund. We received a response from a United rep saying we could get more leg room on our next connecting flight, which is only 1 hour. I lost a day of vacation and only get maybe an extra foot of leg room on a one hour flight? No thank you. By far the worst experience flying and you can bet that I won’t be flying United Airlines ever again.

Norfolk to Boston via Newark. I have never written a review about a service before, but my experience was so bad with United that I felt compelled to. I had a round-trip from Norfolk(VA) to Boston(MA) with a connecting flight through Newark(NY.) Every flight was delayed or canceled -not delayed by a few minutes but hours. Delayed flights caused me to miss my connecting flights and have to rebook another flight. Delayed flights are one thing that I am capable of letting go. However, they didn't even load my bag on a flight home. When i asked about it they simply said "Oh it was supposed to come on an earlier flight but it got canceled." Okay so it was just forgotten? It feels like if the bags don't go as originally planned they get tossed somewhere and forgotten until I have to call them multiple times. Still currently waiting for my checked bag to come here on the next flight from Newark to Virginia. I was told it would be coming on flight 4925 - that flight was this morning. It's still in Newark. And I asked if they can be sure if my bag will make it on the next flight this afternoon, but they can't even confirm that. I'll just have to wait until they feel like sending it on the next flight. Who knows when that is. Completely terrible experience that I have never had before.  I suppose you pay for what you get. terrible service.

Redmond to San Diego. I called a United to change a ticket I purchased with my United Airline credit card through the Hopper app. The Hopper app keeps an eye on all the airline prices and compares them for you. It will then alert you when an airline has dropped ticket prices. When I called United to change my ticket to use for another day, I fully expected to pay the usual $125.00 change fee. I was told that since I used the Hopper app, which they consider to be a travel agency, that I was going to be charged $200.00 along with $125.00 change fee. For a total of $325.00. Nice work United Airlines for completely ripping off your customer.

route: Fort Lauderdale to Salt Lake City via San Francisco
reviewContent: Fort Lauderdale to Salt Lake City with a change of planes in San Francisco to SLC (1 hr 32 min.) Airline travel is hard enough without punitive agents. On March 31 we were making a coast-to-coast trip after our cruise. Our return tickets from Fort Lauderdale to Salt Lake City were with United purchased through Expedia. Our day started at 4 am. Most airlines that I know of allow a carry on and a personal item policy. We chose the United flight because it got us back at a decent hour so we could make the 3.5-hour drive back to our home in Idaho. We had tried to print our boarding passes online with the ship’s computer/printer but were unable to with the directive we would have to see an agent at the airport. We were informed, when were arrived at the airport, that we would have to check our carry on bags because of the nature of the ticket we purchased. We weren't happy about it but did so at the extra cost of $25 a bag. We had purchased a basic economy flight ticket so that did not allow a carry on. We were placed in the very back row 38 and had a bumpy and straight-backed ride for over 6 hours. Fair enough. On arriving at San Francisco for our transfer flight of an hour and a half to SLC we had something to eat and waited. We were the last passengers to board the plane. As we were being checked in the United Agent stopped my wife. He/she said the carry on bag of my wife needed to be checked even though we had just gotten off a United jet of the same size and model so there was no question that it fit under the seat and that is the criteria that was listed by Expedia and United: “Carry-on bags are limited to one personal item that fits under the seat in front of you.” I have to interject here that my wife has used this same personal carry on bag for over 20 years of flying with all the major airlines United, Delta, American, Alaskan, and Frontier. No airline agent of flight attendant had ever given her a problem because of its size or dimensions (9x9x18). It always fit easily under the seat, even with the small computer planes that have much shorter routes with much smaller jets. My wife was forced to give up her personal bag before she could board the flight. My wife sent me on to board since my protests were falling on deaf ears. But after taking about 10 steps I turned around and went back to ask the agent if this had anything to do with the ticket we had purchased through Expedia? She/he said yes. So I went to board. My wife boarded about 3-5 minutes later and when she reached our back seats she was seething. She told me to guess what they had charged her to check her personal bag. I guessed $25? No. $50? No. She was charged $175.00! She told me she had felt bullied and belittled by what took place. This whole experience has soured us both towards flying with United Airlines.
