Hopefully this will bring about some change.

commentHeader: not a legacy airline at all
reviewContent: Flew San Francisco to Tel Aviv. 787-800 at the Polaris first - Business seat 6B. United service is something I can't understand, they do the minimum during all flights. Right after takeoff most of the team disappear, during the long flight (15hr) I couldn't see air crew activity if you needed anything, the one at the galley was eating or reading emails. They forgot to give the amenity kit to 90% of the business class passengers, the plastic bags of blankets and water bottles left on my seat (at the seat upper storage area) were all over the flight and overall the Polaris that should be Business First is cozy and small for passenger above 185 cm with 2x2x2 configuration (meaning the window seat need to jump over you). Overall not a legacy airline at all, long way to go.

commentHeader: don't care about service quality whatsoever
reviewContent: Flew San Francisco to Auckland with United Airlines. Check-in staff were unenthusiastic. Service at the United lounge was terrible. The male attendant at the reception desk had a bad attitude. Some of the flight attendants were lukewarm. Overall the attendants' service was nowhere near the Asian airlines, such as Singapore. Polaris business class is decent but still falls short of Singapore's quality. Onboard Wi-Fi was slow even when loading webpages, and they explicitly said streaming videos wasn't allowed. On airlines like China Eastern I could stream videos smoothly. Airlines like Singapore pay attention to every detail, such as the check-in staff. United falls short every here and there. After the mergers, United has monopolized tons of routes, so now they make money off of the monopoly and don't care about service quality whatsoever. Will not fly them other than on exclusive routes.

Grand Rapids to Newark. I had a bad feeling when I booked with United but as this was for a job interview and I was asked to fly out in three days, I didn't have any other choice but to take whatever flights were available - my original sense of dread turned out to be justified and I certainly will not be flying with United again. The flight was scheduled to take off at 7:30 PM, it's 9:38 PM and I'm still here. Initially, they announced a 3 hour delay, then, figuring that wasn't inconvenient enough, they changed it to 4 hours. So instead of arriving at my destination at 9:30 PM as I was originally scheduled to do so, I will be getting in at 1:40 AM - no big deal. And of course the United employees at the kiosk make it quite clear through their laissez faire attitude, and at times downright rude behavior, that they really don't care about the fact that paying customers are waiting out a 4 hour delay. It's very obvious United doesn't give any thought to customer service. When asked what the issue is, they respond with "Oh, the plane is undergoing maintenance." Funny, I figured maintenance would be done routinely, not when it has the potential to ruin as many lives as possible. And, shouldn't there maybe be a backup plan? Is every single United plane currently being used with no consideration given to the possibility of unforeseen mishaps like this? I especially like the response I received from the snooty United employee when I asked if there were any other flights available - "No, probably not..." Probably not? Umm, do you mind checking perhaps? Which she begrudgingly did after I asked. Real problem solvers they got there. I'm also really glad I signed up for both their email and text message alerts regarding flight changes. I received neither. I'm sure they just didn't want to fill up my inbox or use up my monthly text message allowance. I suppose United figured this was the best way to earn back some respect. Nice job guys, this will certainly be my last flight with this airline. United has steadily been losing credibility amongst my circle of professional colleagues, and it's not difficult to see why.

This was a very pleasant weekend excursion to celebrate my birthday. I flew Tampa to Denver on Friday and then returned to TPA the next day via Washington Dulles. Check-in at TPA was immediate and simple, but Denver was another story. The Premier Access line was only 3 or 4 minutes long, but had I been a normal economy passenger, the line stretched interminably. Boarding for all three flights was disciplined and orderly; all flights pushed back early, departed promptly, and arrived ahead of schedule. On the TPA-DEN and DEN-IAD flights I had the forward, over-wing exit row window, with the middle seat unoccupied. On the IAD-TPA segment, the whole exit row was open, but I was upgraded to an aisle seat in first class. This experience confirmed for me that the exit row seats are the best in the plane and beat 1st class on narrow-body aircraft, particularly if one or both adjacent seats are unoccupied. On the DEN-IAD flight, I purchased the southwestern omelet for breakfast, and I was very pleased with the taste and the presentation. The crew on all flights were pleasant and efficient, my luggage arrived promptly, and I thoroughly enjoyed the trip.

Houston to Phoenix. 10 in our group. Missed our flight because cruise ship was fogged in. Called United, said we couldn’t make our flight. Agent rebooked all 10 of us on a later flight for no charge. Very impressed. Thank you United. Will definitely fly with you again and will tell everyone about our satisfaction.

commentHeader: shrunk the width of the seats
reviewContent: Denver to Washington. They have shrunk the width of the seats to such an extreme you feel crammed. There is literally no wiggle room and I'm not a large person. I feel sorry for the man next to me. Boarding on time, flight crew pleasant. They need to make room for real people and stop monetizing their passengers.

Tel Aviv to San Francisco. I was excited to try the Boeing 787  new Polaris at united. We had a nice welcome with the team and find my 6B seat The configuration is a bit tight- 2x2x2. Usually I see 1x2x1 in this 787 for business class. The seat was comfortable but the issue the for 185 cm and up- there is no space of your legs. Really disappointment. Service was so so, when I asked for the flippers that are in the menu ( we are so proud of verity of things we can offer to you just ask the air crew…- as it was written…) air crew forget what you asked - overall disappointment

Chicago to Des Moines. Worst service ever. Flight was delayed 3 hours and they switched the departure gate 3 times. All participating United Staff seemed thoroughly confused and did not know details about the flight. I would not recommend United to anyone of my friends or family at this point.

commentHeader: they lost track of my baggage
reviewContent: Everything was good with the flight, my issue was that they lost track of my baggage and I ended up receiving it 10 days later, they did not give me any compensation for the issue and every time I called them to ask for my baggage they were clueless to where they were and when they would arrive. Very disapointed because of this.

route: San Jose California to Houston Texas
commentHeader: They moved her seat four times
reviewContent: Flew United Airlines from San Jose California to Houston Texas. I bought a ticket for my aunt who has Alzheimer's and bought her premium economy so she has more leg room and made sure she had an aisle seat to grab an attendant if she needed help. They moved her seat four times! Each time I had to call and say, she can not be put in economy, that is not what I paid for, and she can not be in a window seat! She has to be able to flag an attendant if she needs something! They tried putting her in a window seat, economy instead of premium economy, etc.. Dealing with a person that has Alzheimer's is bad enough, dealing with a horrible airline that I had to call several times to argue about why they cant move her seat is just horrible. They have notes in their system that she has this medical issue and I think they are trying to take advantage of that!

Worst flight experience of my life. Sat on the runway for two hours in Baltimore, so I missed my connecting flight in Newark to Norfolk. Was forced to spend the night in New Jersey, and the airline refused to give me a hotel voucher. I had to pay $100 for a hotel due to the airlines negligence. The customer service was incomprehensibly rude. It was as if they thought this was funny. I have never experienced an airline as terrible as United.

Raleigh Durham to New York. The worst of any service that I have encounter. They were late for my first flight which result that I could not get on my second flight to Hong Kong. I got my travel agent go online and there are flights available but the site agent will not honor. The first agent is ignorant and the second agent is trying to verbally fight with me. I'm paying for this ticket but treated badly. I should have know when I chose this United Airlines; this name is not fitted for them.

Honolulu to San Francisco. Our flights to and from Hawaii were great! Even though there was an issue with the WiFi they made sure everyone was able to log on quickly and gave iPads for those who couldn’t log on. Also we ended up confusing our flight that was on Alaska and a similar flight and time was at United. When we realized this at the United help desk it was too late to get to our Alaska flight within seconds they put us on their flight and offered to move our bags to that flight as well.  Also those German waffle cookie things are heaven.

route: Boston to Hong Kong via Newark
reviewContent: Boston to Hong Kong via Newark. My flight BOS-EWR was delayed due to late arrival of the aircraft and I had a short connection in EWR to continue towards HKG. The customer service is unhelpful, as if the delay is your fault, not theirs. They refused to board me on an earlier flight, they could not offer re-routing nor sponsor the ticket with another airline to secure my journey. The delay was ultimately tight for my connection, but every UA representative I spoke to suggested the other flight would have likely waited. It did not. It left six minutes earlier than scheduled. Despite asking to the flight attendants while on flight whether my connection would have waited, the response was that United - differently from every other Star Alliance company - does not offer this "service". I landed and there was no representative to direct delayed passengers. I rushed to the gate to make the unpleasant discovery that my connection departed earlier. I thus went for the customer service. I stood on a line for 3h and 15m. Around 45 minutes after landing, a text message invited me to check-in for my next flight, from which I derived I was booked for the same flight the following day. After hours of waiting, I reached a representative that handed me a voucher for the hotel and US$ 30 for three meals: yes, $ 10 per meal. Not to mention, the hotel was sketchy and sub-standard. The flights were possibly the worst I have ever experienced in 14 years of flying. In over 16h flight (plus boarding, taxing, etc.) they serve two microscopic meals and one snack. No snacks in the galley. Never seen such misery. The crew was confrontational at all stages. They said: "We are nice to people who are nice to us", which is reasonable in abstract, but they seem to forget we are not fellow travellers! I am the customer, they are the flight attendants. As I have reached my final destination over 25h later than initially scheduled, I sought compensation from United. Unsurprisingly, their customer service is dismissive. I was told I can buy insurance next time. I do have insurance, but they cover unforeseeable events, not negligence of the carrier. I have been trying to hold them liable under the Montreal Convention, but so far all they offer are pointless vouchers in the illusion that I would ever subject myself again to the pain of dealing with such an unpleasant, unprofessional, unapologetic company. United airlines punishes you for making the unwise choice of traveling with them. Despite you pay for a service, they drop on you the cost of their inefficiency. Leaving aside old aircrafts, primitive forms of IFE that have disappeared in the rest of the world, broken controls, dirty and hard seats, meals that not even if you live out stamps. The point is the lack of consideration, the way they treat a paying customer at every stage of the experience, from check in to customer service when you try to claim damages for the disservice they caused you. Finally, UA cheats selling tickets with connecting time they cannot really respect or guarantee. They are cheating to rank higher on search engines with prices and journey duration. On any international flight, make sure you have 2.5h connecting time minimum. Few reviews will tell you UA is less worse than they say: don't gamble with it. Choose better.

Houston to Oklahoma City. I have flown United twice now and both times were awful. They had an issue getting us checked in and because of that, we didn't get checked in before the 30 minute requirement on international flight so they wouldn't let us on our flight. Then on the way back, our flight was cancelled. Their customer service representatives do not care and are rude. Their flight attendants are rude. They do not care that your flight was cancelled and you need to get home because you have kids, work etc. They didn't even want to give us a food or beverage voucher. I will never use United again. It was a horrible experience!

Flew New Orleans to David-Panama. On the website it said I could check in 2 bags. At the airport they said I could only check 1 bag. When I ask why they were rude, not wanting to help at all. They were unable to explain why, they start yelling and keep being rude. I will never fly with them again. I asked for a wheelchair because of a knee problem and they took forever to get somebody, I had to ask 4 times. They were rude again and told me I could start walking or wait until they had time to call the wheelchair person. If I paid for a service they should provide the service, not have a bad attitude with their clients. Not helpful at all. I wont fly with United Airlines again.

Raleigh Durham to Chicago. United Economy Plus has a significant advantage in its legroom comparing to regular United Economy seats. A dedicated overhead compartment was provided for Economy Plus passengers, meaning I did not have to fight over someone for a space in order to accommodate my carry-on baggage. The seats were narrow, and were poorly padded. Only non-alcoholic drinks were provided free of charge, when alcoholic drinks and snacks were available for purchase. I have attempted to use the inflight entertainment, which did not work since it could not read any credit card in my wallet. I bought the inflight Wi-Fi. It did work and managed to provide a decent speed (fast enough for internet browsing and photo sharing apps). The cabin crew on my flight were nice, friendly and helpful. Overall, United Economy is a acceptable product for flights that are 4 hours or under. However if I am flying intercontinental, I would consider flying another carrier, since the same seat product is applied to all planes in UA's fleet.

route: Omaha NE to Toronto ON via Chicago IL
reviewContent: A complete disaster. First leg (Toronto to O'Hare) on Saturday had a lavatory problem - so we pushed back (got that on time departure) only to sit for a while and then return to the gate. But since it was an int'l flight we were not allowed off the plane and the CSR refused to get on the plane. Eventually left 99 minutes late even though FAA's MFR rules do not require a working lav. On return flight first leg (Omaha to Chicago) Sunday we arrived early but there our gate was occupied so we sat for an hour, even though you could see multiple empty gates at terminal. Connection flight was very tight and when we ran to the new gate we found it had left 10 minutes early. So much for that thing known as customer service. I am a frequent flyer (about 100 legs a year) and a Star Alliance Gold Member, but this is the last straw (United has messed me over before). American, Southwest, anyone but United when US travel is required. If there was a zero rating - that's what I would pick.

Memphis to Chicago. I have never given a bad review to anyone but the ground crew at this airline was beyond rude yesterday. Flying with one additional adult and two children (two and four years) and they expect that the kids can sit by themselves! The seats numbers were 7, 9, 10 and 20! Not only did they not help with the seating they were passing rude comments throughout "Ma'am you're making this more complicated than it already is." "Didn't you hear, I just made the announcement". I heard "no" at least 10 times in 10 minutes. The lady was not only curt to me she responded very impolitely to the other passenger just requesting a seat. I am not flying United again if I can avoid it.

Flew from Edinburgh to Newark. Read a lot of reviews before booking about the demise of this once great airline company but in my opinion this is much exaggerated. The plane was clean, the staff were friendly and were happy to serve you whatever you wanted. It’s fine. Book with confidence for this route at least!

Absolute worst airline I've ever flown with. I had a bad experience with them in the past, but this was the only flight returning to Seattle from Fresno that I could find. Both flights (my flight to SFO, and the connecting flight from SFO to SEA) were delayed at least an hour, if not more. In SFO we were supposed to leave at 8.40pm, but were delayed. However, we still boarded even more passengers, and were told we would be taking off at 9.10pm. But, because we continued boarding we didn't leave the ground until after 9.30pm. No explanation was made by the captain or the flight crew, but there we sat, waiting and waiting and waiting. The flight was hot and stuffy. I also was incredibly annoyed with the baggage policy. When I booked my flight, there was no communication that I couldn't bring a carry on bag. As this was a very short trip, I brought just a carry on and my personal item. But when I checked in, I was informed I couldn't have one and needed to have it checked, for an additional $25, and that I couldn't even check it at the gate. I've never in my life, been told this before. I literally had to rethink everything I packed and how I packed it, as I had a layover and needed to do homework. When I got to the United booth at FAT to drop off my now checked bag, there was no one there, and the other customer and I waited ten minutes for them to return, again with no explanations. The kicker was when I got to the gate and everyone who had a carry-on bags was given a tag (no additional charge) for their tagged bag! Coupled with so many other things that went wrong today, having a horrible flight experience was the worst thing that could have happened. So take heed, if you fly Basic Economy, you have to a) pay a $25 checked bag for an otherwise acceptable carry-on bag on any other airline, and b) if you fail to check the bag there is an additional $25 fee on top of the checked bag fee if you check it at the gate. Absolute swindle. You buy a cheap flight because you can afford it, but then you have to pay extra for something every other basic airline ticket allows you to have. If I can possibly avoid it, I will never fly with them again.

commentHeader: be respectful of others dietary needs"
reviewContent: Flew United from Buenos Aires to Newark. Unfortunately this flight service was by far the worst I've ever had. Food in general is awful but when they came to my seat, the option would have been chicken or beef. The attendant said to me your option is only beef or beef. I looked at him like, what? He laughed and said sorry and my response was I'm sorry but I do not eat beef. His response was literally "you can eat the stuff around the beef". Mind you, I had seen a flight attendant come up and grab five chicken entrees before the serving was finished. I asked him if there was anyway to get chicken as I honestly don't eat beef nevermind eating around what the plate had. It had nothing except powdered mashed potatoes. This was a ten hour flight, I wasn't going to starve because of the lack of organization. In the end a flight attendant overheard how upset I was and they gave one of the ones they had taken. I know it is not the flight attendants fault at all but at least be respectful of others dietary needs. Our flight cost enough even on economy to provide us with better food services.

commentHeader: display of rudeness from flight attendants
reviewContent: Auckland to San Francisco. I was traveling with my daughter and 5 year old grandson. The airline had changed our flight but did not give us the same seats, which had put us not flying together. We talked to the United person at the gate which he changed our seats and were very helpful in accommodating and put us together. Once on the plane for the 11hr flight home the flight attendants were very rude. At one point we were snapped at because we hadn’t filled out the entry to the US card on time. I believe she screamed at us and said “you had 11 hours to do this.” Never been on a flight with such a display of rudeness from flight attendants. Do not believe I will be using this airline in the future!

Chicago to Portland. We were super disappointed with American Airlines. The problem was coming from Detroit to Chicago trying to connect to Portland. Our plane was a smidge late getting into Chicago but wasn’t a big deal because we had an hour and a half between flights. We spent 1 hour driving around the airport. The other flight was behind and we didn’t have a place to port. So we missed our connecting flight. We had to check bags in valet so we had to wait for that but they lost our bag. I But the lady was super rude and told us it wasn’t their fault and was convinced we never valet our bag. Even though I had the receipt and the claim voucher. When we asked the lady at the counter to call down and ask them to hold the connecting door for seriously only 3 or 4 minutes, she said no - we sprinted down there to find out that they closed the door early. We go to counter to get new flights, they were rude, and wouldn’t comp any meals or hotel or anything. They booked us on a United flight that left 14 hours later. We went down to check in with United since we had a million hours to kill. United Airlines not only gave us food vouchers, they put us up on cots and gave us toiletries for free. They upgraded our seats, then had a person personally escort us to the United club so we could sleep for the night. They then tracked down our missing bag and paid to have it delivered to our house the same day we arrived home. Plus their WiFi worked in board. And they have really good cookies too. Basically United went above and beyond to accommodate when it wasn’t even their fault. We were super super pleased by them and all their staff! Congrats United. You just earned yourselves lifetime customers!

commentHeader: one of the worst airlines I’ve ever flown
reviewContent: This has been one of the worst airlines I’ve ever flown in! I’ve taken this airline about four times because of how cheap it is let’s just say the cheaper the ticket the absolute horrible service! I have missed my connecting flight four times because of delays! Last night I took united from Boston to Washington DC as soon as I got off the plane I ran for the next airplane which was taking me to NC when I arrived it said now boarding I asked him to open the door because technically I was on time and they refused they were super rude they yelled at me I am in the service so I need it to be back before certain time they refuse to let me talk to anyone else to get for their assistance I ended up having to take a vehicle and drive to North Carolina absolutely horrible I will never ever ever take this airplane ever again ! And I’ve never been refunded for missing my flights which I have nothing to do with

commentHeader: you lost our business for sure
reviewContent: Kahului to Chicago. I understand, you can not control the weather, but the people at the customer service you can. Ruth, offensive, unprofessional, unpleasant in Chicago O'Hare. I was upset, due to 12 hours delay, and tried to talk to them to find sooner connection to Toronto. You paid for your check in luggage, wait in Chicago for 7 hours and sure enough your bag is not deliver. None of the people from the flight from Maui to Chicago got their checked bags. Onboard nothing is offered. United you lost our business for sure.

United gets a lot of bad reviews but I have flown them extensively and usually have a good experience. Recently flew Denver to Tampa in first and back in coach. Overall a good experience with excellent staff in Denver who helped me change my ticket due to urgent change in plans. Lounges could be a bit better in terms of food. On board all the crews were friendly and smiling and seemed to want to help passengers. Both flights totally full but boarded on time with early arrivals on both sides despite bad weather all over USA. I think the first class food experience could be a bit better but its fair in coach where you can buy what you want. Crews seemed patient dealing with a few difficult passengers. Wi-fi worked great in both directions.

commentHeader: ever fly with United after this
reviewContent: Indianapolis to Chicago O’Hare. The worst airline I’ve ever had to deal with. We knew we were getting sleet and ice since 3am. Waited on the runway for 2 hours to finally take off to Chicago and missed our flight from Chicago to Mexico. They state they will not pay for our stay since we leave tomorrow morning. Weather is out of your control. But being prepared for that weather is not. Will never fly with United after this trip.

Nashville to Rochester via Chicago. It is surprising how incompetent a company can be. I called to have my return flight changed from 12-30 to 12-27 for a family emergency. The agent charged me $200. On 12/27, I went to check-in, realized my return flight hadn't been changed, and I called them. After sitting on hold for an hour and a half, the agent was extremely rude and told me she couldn't change my flight to that same day because the fare difference was too large. Since then I have sat on hold for a total of five hours, talked to several different agents who claimed they recorded the information and sent it along to the complaint department. I finally found out nothing had been recorded, so I submitted a complaint online. When someone finally reached me, she offered a $100 voucher. My original ticket was worth $400, they completely messed that up, were rude about it, and I sat on hold for hours to resolve the issue because of their lack of communication between departments. Now I'm left with half a ticket, leaving me no choice but to fly with these people again.

Chicago to Columbia. Delay after delay after delay. We heard of inclement weather happening on our return trip so we called the airline and paid to have our tickets changed to an earlier flight. Now, we are stuck at our connection and will be arriving home close to the same time we were originally scheduled after the inclement weather has already hit. A waste of time, a waste of money. We literally could have spent an entire day working in D.C. but because of the ineptitude of this airline we lost a full day. This happened on our flight out as well, delayed in Denver. It seems that United cannot be held accountable to their own schedule.

Washington Dulles to Hong Kong. Not a lot of choices to fly from Hong Kong to the US, Unfortunately, the cheapest was United. Due to the holiday season, the tickets were expensive so this was my only option. My first flight from DC to SF as delayed, and I had a connecting flight so I almost missed it, we stayed on the plane for 3 hours before takeoff. Whenever I asked the flight attendants about it, they were so rude and defensive and seemed unwilling to help me. The plane was so old and dirty and no leg room. The international flight from SF to HK was also delayed though not the airline's fault. I think the service and flight attendants on international flights are way better than the domestic ones. They had a good selection of movies, though the food was just average. Overall for the price I paid I say it wasn't worth it, and I wouldn't want to fly with United again.

Flew Newark to Boston with United Airlines. The worst experience I have ever had with an airline. Every flight I’ve ever booked with this airline has been delayed due to a late aircraft and every United employee I have encountered has been rude and very unprofessional. I’m very disappointed.

route: St. Louis to Brownsville via Houston
reviewContent: St. Louis to Brownsville via Houston. Delayed in St. Louis by an hour and that caused me to miss my flight in Houston. Customer Service had an attitude when trying to get the next flight to where I was going and they made me sit at Houston airport for 8 hours. Finally get to my plane after sitting in Houston for that long and I am standing in line and they had to apparently “drain the lavatory” which then delayed that flight another 30 minutes. Over priced for the kind of service you receive. It is no wonder why Southwest does as well as it does. Avoid this airline at all costs.

commentHeader: they showed me very good service
reviewContent: Flew Atlanta to Denver. After all the negative publicity United Airlines has received, I must call them out for giving me such a great experience! First off, the flight was delayed and I decided to get a snack from a vending machine. It got stuck. One of the pilots and a stewardess helped me get it out without me even asking. I hadn't noticed they were also waiting for the delayed flight. They helped us with our puppy getting used to the plane, and when I got sick, they came quickly with a sick-bag and a cup of ginger-ale. So, they showed me very good service, were very friendly, and went the extra mile.

route: Columbus to San Francisco via Denver
reviewContent: Columbus to San Francisco via Denver. Don't fly United if you have a service animal. They put me in the middle seat with no where for my animal to sit or stand. So the entire flight she was forced in my lap. Every other airline is extremely accommodating, but United employees were unapologetic and just said next time upgrade pick your seat.

route: Newark to Seoul via San Francisco
reviewContent: Flew Newark to Seoul via San Francisco. I am a frequent flyer with United. They have my complete profile including food preference as vegetarian. However, they always starve me saying that I haven't notified the airline about my special meal. Crew are always rude and do not make any effort to provide me with suitable food. I am sure they have other food options suitable for vegetarians but they just get away with a sorry! I would never fly United.

Washington to London. The worst airline I have flown. Firstly for a flight of 7-8 hrs the Boeing 757 is a small plane with little or no leg space and cramped up passengers cos seats are 3-3. Thus each time I need to go to washroom both middle seat and isle seat passengers need to get out of their seats too which is really inconvenient to all passengers. Secondly there was no inflight entertainment despite the crew restarting the system several times which is outrageous for a long haul flight. Furthermore, there was no apology from crew until the flight landed in Heathrow where the crew finally apologised and said passengers to go online and get an appreciation voucher from United. This when I did that it gave me a USD100 discount code on any United Airlines with many conditions attached to it, unfortunately I won’t be flying United again at any cost, therefore even this voucher is of no use. On positive side I landed safely and food and drinks was ok for an international flight.

Flew Newark to London Heathrow. United apply the recipe of discount airlines to long flight and this is not going well. Their organisation in Newark airport is chaotic. The entertainment system look like it's from the 90's (Ridiculously small screen and no possibility of movies selection). The inflight service is minimum and/or replaced by paying service. The food is well bellow any standard of what you can expect on a transatlantic flight.

Could have driven faster, came from Chicago to Aspen, Aspen to Bozeman but didn't make it to Bozeman until 4.5 hours later after stopping in Great Falls. so glad I woke up at 2am to get there after 2pm. To top it off, now our baggage is broken. Wonderful. Thank you for an awesome trip to remember.

Do not fly United. My husband and I flew round trip from Tulsa to Los Angeles with a connecting flight in Houston, TX. The trip there wasn't too bad other than the fact that they had t.v,s on the seat in front of you with direct t.v. and a remote control on the armrest. The problem was most of the remotes didn't work, and you couldn't change the channel. It was ridiculous. We didn't mind too much though, because we were more excited for our trip than concerned with our 4 hour flight stuck on one channel we didn't choose. The real problem came during our trip. We were supposed to fly back from LAX at 10 pm on December 31, 2017. We got an email late at night on the 29th, we didn't even see it until the morning of the 30th, saying our flight was changed. Just like that they changed our flight to 12:50am on the 30th. We lost basically a whole day that we had already planned out with relatives with basically no notice because they overbooked the flight. But we went anyway. At the airport almost 30 people were on standby for our flight. Then we were delayed over an hour. Then we flew to Houston, TX for a two hour layover. Then back on a plane to Tulsa. It made for a very long, very angry night. I'd pay an extra $150 a ticket or more before I'd ever fly United again. They do not care about their customers or our plans. This was a terrible experience.

San Francisco to San Diego. So ridiculous and simply unprofessional. I have a connecting flight here in San Francisco, I arrived 4 hours before my connection leaves. I looked at a departures board and noticed another United flight left in just an hour. Went to the United customer service desk to see if I could switch. The woman at the counter didn't have the decency to great me with a hello and before I even finished asking my question she told me there was nothing I could change at all. Her response was simply "no changes". I went to the gate and asked if there were seats available, the gate attended said "possibly" then looked at my ticket and informed the contract I signed when booking basic economy forbid me from changing flights. I asked "even if there are empty seats on an earlier flight?" And she said "no changes can be made with this ticket if it were economy I might be able to do something". I'm happy the gate employee at least explained my situation but this is ridiculous. United wanted to charge me another $35 for this trip to be economy. I paid $75 so that's nearly a increase. I understand I bought a cheap ticket, that's why I wasn't even allowed a carry on bag. However, when there's something as simple as putting a passenger, with no carry on or checked luggage, on the same size aircraft going to the same destination and United won't do it. That's ridiculous. It wouldn't cost them a dime more but I wasn't at the right paygrade for the company to care. Basically what I heard from United today was "give me money and I'll give a sh*t about you". Needless to say, they won't be getting my business in the future.

Orlando to Newark. United economy class was absolutely terrible. You cannot even take on a carry on, you must check your bag if you are in this class. My flight was cancelled due to inclement weather, and there was barely any flexibility in my flight change (had to be moved to the next day, but very limited in support), zero flexibility in allowing a carry on even though more time had been accrued, and very little acknowledgment of the difficulty that arises with a flight cancellation. I fly often, within the US and internationally. If I can help it, I will never fly United again.

Due to fly United Airlines from Billings to Denver. Today is just another frustrating flight on United. 5.30pm flight already delayed until 8pm. Wont be suprised if flight gets cancelled. Last time I flew United I actually rented a car at midnight in Denver and drove 8 hours home rather than get stranded in Denver for 1.5 days with no hotel or any compensation. When I was flying from Pierre SD to Billings years ago they would often cancel flights for "mechanical reasons" and make you stay another day so they could fill planes. I try to avoid UAL, but they have a monopoly on some flights. Delta and NorthWest Airlines have always been excellent if possible. UAL is the worst!

Flew United from Omaha to New York. My flight was cancelled due to weather in New York. When I called the call center to book a new flight I was told the wait time was 30 minutes. It's now been 1 hour and 20 minutes and I'm still on hold. This is ridiculous. I have to travel with my wife and two small children and the flight automatically re-booked for us is not conducive for a young family. I'm incredibly disappointed.

route: Albany to San Francisco via Chicago
commentHeader: did a very nice job today
reviewContent: Albany to San Francisco via Chicago. We found both legs of our flight on an A319 from Albany to Chicago and our 777-200 flight from Chicago to San Francisco to be outstanding. Check in and boarding was painless. Drinks were served within a minute of us taking our seats while the crew was friendly, professional and positive. Albany to Chicago was a quick flight with the seats great, inflight entertainment working well etc. The second leg on the 777-200 was everything and then some. Yes we had to sit to wait to be de-iced for almost 45 minutes, no problem,. Crew was equally as friendly on our second leg, flight 470 from Chicago to San Francisco. Every 10-15 minutes they were around to offer drinks, blankets or see if we needed anything. Some complain about the new Polaris seating, not sure why, we found them to have plenty of room, while lying flat or in any position. The breakfast was really great with a protein or spinach egg white option, both served with fresh fruit, soft biscuit and Greek yogurt. Really have to say United did a very nice job today! Only reason I didn’t give 5 stats for inflight entertainment was no live tv without paying, still plenty of movie options though. Luggage came out fast, all in all a great experience!

route: Montreal to San Francisco via Newark
reviewContent: United Airlines is the most incompetent airline I’ve ever flown with. It started off as follows: we booked a flight from Montreal to San Francisco with a connecting flight in Newark. Upon arriving in San Francisco, we noticed that both mine and my husband’s luggage were nowhere to be found. They said that his was still in Newark and mine apparently was in San Francisco (at the airport). They couldn’t locate my bag for 3 full days. We had to spend out of pocket for all kinds of clothes and toiletries (putting a major damper on our time in San Fran). They only delivered my husbands luggage two days later. To make matters worse, when locating where my luggage was, I told them that I would pick it up at the airport later in the day, as we had a wine tour in Napa scheduled. We passed by the airport later in the evening only to be told that my luggage was now on a flight to LA. Myself nor my husband ever told them to go ahead and do that! Their level of efficiency and service is extremely poor and I wouldn’t ever recommend them to anyone. Unless you want serious unnecessary problems due to stupidity and lack of care, avoid this airline!

San Diego to San Francisco. They made me shell $25 to check my bag that I've literally never had a problem with in overheads in dozens of times flying, even on smaller planes. I'm 90% sure they shrink the requirement test basket so people have to give them more money. United may often be the cheapest airlines but they will get the rest of the money out of you somehow. I feel bad for the people working the desk who have to deal with the faces of frustration from their horrible policies.

San Francisco to Orange County. I’m onboard now and waiting for departure, the doors are closed that means no one else is coming in right? I have three empty seats around me then I told to my sister to come and sit right next to us as they gave her a sit 10 rows behind off us. The attendant come to us and made her to move back to her seat saying that was not allowed to do that. What? The plane is half empty and my sister is sitting 10 rows behind off us with some strangers while we have empty seats right next to us. I guess no common sense. I guess they don’t care about customer service. Last time traveling with United airlines.

Newark to Myrtle Beach. Once again, United Airlines has caused a problem. Not only did we have a nightmare experience on the out flight from MYR to Newark, the return flight experience was a nightmare as well. Resulting in my 2 children, who are flying together (17 years and 13 years old) to miss their flight. United Airlines allowed 2 minors to miss a flight. Even tho they were there when they needed to be. The check in process took so long, along with the security check thru process, that caused a major delay in there progress. Not only did they miss there flight, but now they have to wait until the following day, to experience this terror again. How is it that a major commercial airline, only has 1 flight a day. How is it that a multi billion dollar company, cannot take action, to get 2 minor children in a different flight. Instead, they make them travel back, a 2 hour travel, to do it again. First off, the "Unaccompanied Minor" charge is fraud. When booking these tickets, the website said nothing about added fees. The tickets were bought and paid for, and while attempting to do the check in process, United Airlines slams people with added fees. On the day of a flight. That is not ok. I get a voucher for our initial troubles (which We were under the assumption that could be used for the return flight fees) and got denied that as well. A $150 ticket, turned well over 400 dollars by the time this was said and done. Only for my children to miss a return flight, due to the faulty set up of United Airlines .

commentHeader: stuck in the airport on NYE
reviewContent: United made traveling during the holidays a nightmare. My husband and I flew out Christmas Eve and flew back New Years Eve and both experiences were terrible. Both had layovers in Chicago flying from Kalamazoo to Denver. The flight out got delayed 6 hours. We updated our connecting flight due to the delay and were supposed to have an hour in ORD before boarding our plane to DEN. However, our United flight spent half an hour searching for a gate causing us to almost miss our connecting flight. Additionally, our checked bag was lost and had to be delivered. It was also not delivered at the time it was promised. On our flight back, we got out of DEN fine, but arrived at ORD at 12 and with our connecting flight leaving at 3.45. Due to United's incompetence, we were stuck in the airport on NYE until 6.10 and did not make it home until hours after we were supposed to. It was 2 miserable days of traveling and United offered nothing to compensate for these errors that ruined our holidays. Do not fly United if you actually wish to get where you're going even remotely on time.

Flew from Chicago to Kalamazoo. I have been very disappointed by United on this trip. They had our flights booked several months in advance and now we have been delayed for 2.5 hours because we are awaiting an aircraft. Even if there is a delay for an incoming flight, there should be a back up plane. The level of disorganization with scheduling flights is abhorrent. If you want to be even remotely guaranteed to fly at the scheduled time, do not fly United.

route: San Jose to Cincinnati via Denver
reviewContent: San Jose to Cincinnati via Denver. Worst airline ever, always behind your wallet in some or other way. Never let carry on baggage will always check in. App doesn't even allow to check in if you do not select option to buy check in bag - even small backpack comes in check in category. Very expensive, very rude and seats assigned are stupidity -  my wife was sitting 2 lines behind me. This is second time for travel with them and both times it was worst experience ever.

Washington to Los Angeles in January 2017. Arrived from another UA flight and the transfer in IAD was eventtless. After a rubbish experience in MCO, I gave the UA Club lounge another try, as IAD is UA’s hub, but the same disappointing experience, although the lounge was more modern and had a nicer design than the one in MCO. However, food items offered again very poor, just soup, salads, some poor looking highly processed cheese cubes and crackers and some veggies with dip; self service beverages items limited to water, coffee and tea; others were served at a manned bar and there is a charge for alcoholic drinks, even for domestic beers. No cash is accepted, except of course for tips which are expected. The flight to LAX was initially announced as being on time, but 10 minutes after boarding should have commenced, a delay of boarding has been announced due to a maintenance issue (change of tire), but still no official delay has been announced. This is especially irritating as UA’s boarding procedure requires all passengers (including children, First Class and Priority) to line up in 5 different queues according to boarding groups like applicants for a free handout before boarding starts. So, instead of waiting seated for boarding to begin, people were standing in line or sitting on the floor for the boarding to begin. Also, the flight turned out to be overbooked. Boarding than started with a delay of twenty minutes. Departure was finally delayed 60 minutes, as in addition to maintenance issue, we had to wait for the baggage to be loaded. Pretty incompetent procedure. On board, classic first class domestic recliner seats in a 2x2 set up. Seats were big but surprisingly hard, so again not that comfortable. The plane had direct tv on a mini screen, but no headphones provided, so useless. Dinner was “chicken”, “salmon” or “vegetarian pasta”, no further information given, no menus provided. Starter was a rocket salad and dessert a sundae. Found the food uninspired and barely edible. Lights were off during the whole (early evening) flight - even during meal service - FA's best part of flight, however FA’s were professional. 30 minutes arrival delay into LAX. The wait for the arrival of the luggage was ok, but priority luggage came out whenever. Finally, UA also managed to mistreat my luggage (broken handle). Was told by UA, that this is not their problem or responsibility. No refinement in UA's service and the word "please" is clearly not part of UA vocabulary, as I did not hear it to be used once by any of their employees in the air or on the ground. How is this a First Class experience? My default airline for domestic US flights is AA, and they provide a much better overall product.

Orlando to Washington in January 2017 on a Boeing 767-400. Although this flight encountered no major irregularities this was not a first class experience. Check in - even for F - was through automated kiosks only. Short line, but taking longer than necessary through to the need to go through many screens focusing on upselling (e.g. to buy UA miles, even if one is not member of the UA frequent flyer program- thoughtless, unnecessary and irritating). UA did not provide TSA priority access at MCO for First Class passengers, but the overall wait was tolerable, as the line was moving fast in spite of many, many people standing in line. Visited UA Club Lounge, which was very basic and food items offered during lunch time poor especially when compared to lounges operated by non U.S. airlines, soup, salads, some poor looking highly processed cheese cubes and crackers and some veggies with dip; self service beverages items limited to water, coffee and tea; others were served at a manned bar and there is a charge for alcoholic drinks, even for domestic beers. No cash is accepted, except of course for tips which are expected. Rubbish and useless lounge. Also, was only allowed into the lounge as I had Star Gold status with an other airline. A First Class ticket alone will not give you access. On board 2-1-2 seat layout, which looked like an international business cabin. Seats were lie-flat, but I was not able to find a comfortable lounging position and fully flat the seats looked claustrophobic. Not an issue for a two hour flight, but would have been very frustrated to end up in these seats on a transatlantic flight. Pre-flight drinks were served. Otherwise, just beverage service on this 2 hour lunch time flight, cabin service professional with FA’s present in the cabin and trying to give good service with the limited options UA gave them, so flight experience was ok, without being great and nowhere close to a first or business class experience. On a positive note, there was IFE available (AVOD with good screens and nice selection of movies), which could be used before takeoff till touchdown. Flight arrived on time in IAD, despite a 15 minutes hold over IAD due to a medical emergency on another plane.

Kalispell to Charlotte via Denver. Due to weather delay, we had to reschedule flights to the next day. Three family members were traveling economy and needed to stay together for travel reasons after arriving to the home airport. The arrangement we were given conflicted with family plans so we tried to get on other flights. Two were given seats on specified flights, but I was told there were no seats available. There were many economy plus seats available and I suggested that I pay the extra fee for one of those seats. I was told that as an economy client, I didn't qualify for the seat. I spoke to five different agents including a supervisor and always offered to pay the uncharge. I was refused. That night, I upgraded my current seat to economy plus. The next day, I asked another agent and she gave me seats on the flight with my family! Was she nice or did my upgrade then make me suitable for a placement on the flight. That is what I had been suggesting I do to all the agents. I am disgusted with United Airlines lack of concern for their "economy" travelers.

Newark to Tel Aviv. After a long time I was flying on United and only because my preferred carrier was not available on this route. I was very pleasantly surprised by both the flights departing on time and arriving ahead of schedule. The 3-4-3 seating layout made for cramped conditions. You really were in constant shoulder touch with one of your fellow passengers! Leg space is barely sufficient. The back of the seat did not recline noticeably. Thanks to being in the aisle seat, I could stretch out my right leg at times. Boarding at both airports were smoothly organized by boarding groups and overhead luggage space was ample. Individual flight entertainment systems were easy to use and they had a good collection of Hollywood, Bollywood, Asian and European movies. Beer and wine were complimentary. Two meals were served, portions were small. Lot of special meals -- kosher, Asian vegetarian, etc -- were delivered by frazzled flight attendants running up and down to match meals with passengers. The plan announcements in English and Hebrew were overly loud and frequent. The toilets were reasonably clean given the nearly 11 hours flight. There were snacks in the galley to pick on. Small bottles of water were available aplenty. All-in-all, a well-managed, though crowded flight.

commentHeader: Horrible customer service coming and going
reviewContent: Horrible customer service coming and going. Air Canada and United staff both unintelligent on how to service customers between the two causing delays sending me back and forth between counters six times causing me to not be allowed to board though the flight was not leaving for another hour. Complete ignorance. Totally dumbfounded on staff qualifications.

I flew United Airlines on the 23rd of December from Los Angeles to Honolulu and I didn’t receive my luggage. I immediately opened a luggage claim. Today is the 26th of December and they still don’t know where my bag is. I am on my honeymoon without my bag. I am calling everyday the baggage resolution center and everyday they tell me that they need more time. No words for the incompetence of this airline. I would still like to know where my bag is and when I will receive it.

San Francisco to Burbank. Didn’t realize economy class would treat me like a second class citizen. Hated how I was treated and wanted to pay for business class and they did not allow for upgrades. I used miles and never flown United and didn’t know it would be like this. Southwest is way better and cheaper. I will use them in the future like I always have.

commentHeader: very clean and everything was working
reviewContent: Flew United from London Heathrow to San Francisco. Check-in was sluggish largely because passengers in front were attempting to travel with massively overweight bags. But once they were gone it went smoothly. Heathrow security was, unusually, working quickly and the staff were even smiling. Unfortunately there was a 15 minute walk to the gate. Boarding was a little confused having been selected for an extra TSA check. This meant that I circumnavigated the ticket process. They then asked why I was on the aircraft. It also seemed slightly pointless because they swabbed one of my laptops without noticing that I was carrying two. I’m totally in favour of tight security but this exercise seemed counterproductive. Boarding was otherwise very efficient. It was a new aircraft – very clean and everything was working. A good selection of movies and an easy-to-understand IFE. I like the Boeing 787. The lighting is perfect, air conditioning pleasant and ample overhead locker space. I usually travel business and was not looking forward to travelling at the very back of the aircraft but I was pleasantly surprised. The cabin crew were excellent – friendly, funny and assiduous in their duties. There was no problem with asking for more wine and the food was delicious. Another pleasant surprise was the lack of annoying announcements – a lesson some Middle East airlines could learn. The flight left on time and arrived early. Given how cheap the ticket was, it is difficult to find anything at fault with this flight. United should be proud of its cabin crew who excelled themselves.

Portland to Palm Springs. Pathetic, just pathetic. I was traveling with an infant on Christmas day and United made my life hell. The flight from Portland was supposed to start at 6 AM. They made us sit in the flight until 8 AM. My connection flight at SFO missed. They made us travel to Santa Ana. Because there were no flights to PSP, since the connection flight left. We had to hire a car at Santa Ana and travel additional 150 miles to PSP over car using personal expenses. We started at PDX early morning at 6 AM and will be reaching PSP at 8 PM loosing our valuable Christmas time with family. Is ur CEO even listening? I promise that I will never ever travel thru United again

Charleston to Salt Lake City. I booked a flight with United 2 months ago and my flight was re-routed over month in advanced before the flight and yet United failed to inform me. So we showed up to the airport at 6:00am to find our original flight didn’t exist and we were too late to board the new flight. The reason the flight didn’t exist is because United stopped service with our connecting city of Houston for a few months, so we were re routed through Chicago. We then had to come back for a 4:00pm flight instead of the intended 7:00am flight. This we had to pay for an extra Uber trip to and from the airport, we missed our car rental and wasted hours of our day. The entire situation would have been avoided if United had simply informed us that the flight had been changed and made sure we knew! It is now a few days before our return flight and I called United customer service and they have no idea about the re-routing and flight changes. So I am unable I find out the information on our flight going back to Charleston. I am blown away that United is this incredibly disorganized. Not only did they change our flight and not tell us, but their systems don’t even show when they no longer offer flights between two cities and their customer service had no idea that we were previously re-routed for that reason. Our current tickets still show flying through Houston on their end. I’m blown away by United’s incompetence. I definitely recommend staying away from them.

Houston to Seattle. On the way to Houston we were grounded for over an hour after we were supposed to take off from a mechanical problem (scary) but hey it happens can't blame bad timing but on the way back after booking our tickets in a year in advance for a family of 5 for the return trip they ended up over booking the flight for the second time in a row (both coming and going to our destination). They ended up scrambling our seats so we had to sit at opposite sides of the plane. When I asked the lady why our seats had be switched she replied in the rudest tone possible told me "if I would have just read the fine print we wouldn't be having this conversation" - if it wasn't an airport I would have not just taken my seat. Absolutely rude and uncalled for, did not want to explain what was going on. It is what it is though I would not recommend United Airlines to anyone and will pay the extra $50 to fly Alaska from now on!

Newark to Tokyo. I will try to avoid using United Airlines if its not a last minute option. Being a 5'7 male doesn't help at all since the seat is very tight. Food was horrible. Rice and chicken were dry with low quality sauce. Mango sorbet tasted horrible. IFE on my seat didn't work properly while service was okay. Lots of friendly chat with fellow attendants while not so friendly with passengers its more like let me do my job and thats it. Cabin looked tired. Not much left to be desired, just the same horrible experience I had 6 years ago on a memorable 16 hours mind exhausting flight.

Flew from Denver to Minneapolis. Worst airline ever, rudest staff. Will never fly United Airlines again. They kept delaying my flight and every time it got delayed they gave us a different reasons. When we finally boarded in the middle of us boarding they told us to get off because the flight was canceled. Seriously, worst experience ever.

Newark to San Francisco. I was flying back home from college and had packed so much that I couldn't fit my laptop back in my bag and left it on the plane. The night I got back, I woke up at 3am in a panic, realizing what I had done and filled out their lost baggage online form. To my surprise, I got a text back from United no less than 5 minutes later (at 3am – great service!) that said they had found it and gave me the option to pick it up or have it shipped to me. I chose to pick it up that morning from SFO and the woman working at the service desk in United's baggage claim terminal was extremely helpful – I had my laptop back in about 2 minutes! After doing what I never thought I would – leaving my laptop on the plane United provided me with excellent service on Christmas Eve and returned it back to me. Thank you United and thanks to their lost and found department!

Denver to Helena. Awful, 4 cracked flights 18 hours of layovers - no compensation, hotel or refund. Sleeping on the floor on Christmas Eve in Denver with 77 other passengers! Worst airline ever! We were in the sky and pilot turning around due to no one receiving in the tower. Once re landed in origin we were told it was “weather”, no compensation would be given - “sorry” next flight tomorrow at 1:45!

route: Austin to Baton Rouge via Houston
reviewContent: Austin to Baton Rouge via Houston. Outbound to Baton Rouge from Austin They tried to rip me off on baggage. I was told by reservations the laptop would not be a 3rd item. When I arrived to board the plane I was told I could not board with 3 bags. The laptop was a 3rd bag. Really? They finally allowed me to board. Inbound to Austin via Houston I thought I would need to check 3 bags. $25 for first, $35 for 2nd and $150 for third. Seriously? I was able to combine. Thank Goodness. Flight from Baton Rouge was delayed. The airline did not notify my connecting United flight so they could wait. Houston is a large airport. No courtesy. I will never fly United again.

Houston to Pittsburgh. Frequent significant delays. We have been delayed several times with United- once for seven hours due to no plane, then no crew, then other issues- we had about 10 updates to our departure time, so terrible estimates. Major issues like not having a plane? Isn’t this an airline company? Isn’t that your entire business? A two hour delay seems pretty standard. Yes the flights are cheaper, but if you need or want to depart on time don’t bother with United. Also, twice now the departure time has changed after booking before check in. We are seriously considering another airline since we’re tired of spending hours at the airport.

Laramie to Denver. They overbooked the flight, took half an hour to de-ice the aircraft and I has to run across the airport to find my gate in time. I was late and now I'm standing in a mile long customer service line. Thanks for ruining my holiday break United.

San Diego to San Francisco. Terribly rude ticketing agent, lady didn’t want to look up a flight herself, sent me to a kiosk to do what she was able to do without sending me to a kiosk. Her tone of voice was rude and not helpful. Ticket changing services for emergency situations are not permitted unless you pay an upgrade fee of $25 and then $200 flight ticket change and also the difference in ticket rate. I understand the policy, but emergency situations happen that we cannot foresee and have no reasonable way to change flight unless you pay ridiculous rates.

Kalispell to Denver. Rudest employees! None of them were friendly or helpful whatsoever. I’m pretty understanding of travel especially around the holidays but telling me that she can’t answer my question right now because she’s “too busy” is ridiculous. All I needed to know if the flight had been delayed any longer. I refuse to fly United Airlines again.

route: Brussels to Los Angeles via Newark / Chicago
reviewContent: Brussels to Los Angeles via Newark / Chicago. Flight departed late at Brussels airport due to deicing truck which arrived late. Service onboard was very good and aircraft was clean. I lost connecting flight to LAX and they gave a boarding pass for the next available flight. Returning flight was on Boeing 757-300 from LAX to Chicago, good service and nice crew.. Flight arrived on time and we had enough time to change plane to Brussels. That flight departed on time and the service again was very good. I would fly them again!

Cleveland to Phoenix via Houston. Not only did we almost not make it on the flight due to overbooking, but we missed our connection due to late arrival. We were lied to over three times when we landed in Houston. The flight attendant told us we would make our connection so we ran there to find out the gate was closed before we even got off our first flight. Each person we talked to was very rude and blamed everything on the weather, holidays or us the consumer. I have never had a worst experience with customer service. This whole thing is horrible. The lady that gave us our flights for the next day gave us a discount for a hotel. Needless to say I didn’t put a hotel stay in Houston in my budget. I will never fly United ever again and the only way they can make up for giving me the worst start to my vacation is a full refund. I didn’t pay to have to starve in an airport for 6hrs while I wait to fly to Denver and then finally to my destination.

Cannot thank the employees at United Airlines Savannah enough this morning. Made it 30 min before my flight and was told if I wanted to get on I could, but couldn't check my bags. Prepared to carry 3 bags, my purse and a 3 year old through 3 airports today to make it to Las Vegas. I get to the boarding where they were not only nice enough to let me board but the same wonderful people who checked me in were at the gate and checked my bags in for me!

Philadelphia to Chicago. United Airlines is another victim of less service for more money. What a horrible experience. Invented Basic Economy where I had to check my carry-on bag. First time in my life that I had to pay 25 dollars to check a carry on. The woman at the counter couldn’t explain the new invention. Unpleasant, unexpected, disheartening, Unforgettable.

San Francisco to Sydney. This airline will get you from point A to point B but not much more. You can see a big difference between flying an airline like Emirates and then flying United. Their customer service is very poor. One male flight attendant from SFO-SYD clearly didn't like his job at all. I asked for water because I wasn't feeling well and he made no attempt to get it, he had a sour look on his face the whole flight and he would just look at you instead of asking "what drink would you like" etc. Everything seemed like a hassle to him and every interaction with him was awkward. The airline is acceptable but if you have the money, fly any other airline with a better reputation).

commentHeader: didn’t do anything to help us
reviewContent: Newark to Ft Lauderdale. Bought a connecting flight for my return to Miami. The first plane arrived at EWR late and the airplain taking us to Miami departed early. When we wen to customer service for accomodations, they booked us (my daughter and I) on a flight that didn’t even take us to Miami, it took us to Ft Lauderdale instead and they sat my daughter ten seats away from me. My bags were delivered to Miami on the wrong flight. I am writing this review from Newark to Ft Lauderdale. My plane leaves at 10:06. I am hoping I can have my bag delivered when I get to Fort Lauderdale. My bags are some where now in Miami International Airport. United Airlines had poor logistics coordination. Customer service agents are not caring, and they remove themselves from the responsibility of answering a simple question. I purchased a connecting flight and because of their negligence I ended up paying for a hotel in New Jersey with no coats to protect ourselves from the cold. Me and my daughter stranded by this airline and they didn’t do anything to help us for this inconvenience. I know, I am never flying United again. This is the only way I express my frustration.

Edinburgh to Newark return. The check in, on board service and arrival in Newark went without a hitch. The ground and cabin staff were very helpful and attentive. I have flown United before but feel the service (nd aircraft is much improved. Only downside was the passport control at Newark which was a nightmare.

New Orleans to Denver. If I could rate zero, I would! Worst customer service. I would say we are frequent travelers and this is the worst airline by far I’ve ever flown! Total lack of customer service. Takes a lot for me to leave a review. Refused to provide any kind of assistance in letting our family sit together, no control over seat selection whatsoever, and wanted to charge us $50 per carry-on each way!! Save yourself the time and headache of this airline. What ever happened to trying to accommodate?
Boise to Seattle via Denver. Was a great flight. Staff is friendly, cabin is comfortable, tickets are nicely priced! Flights were on time and smooth.

route: Seattle to Fort Walton via Houston
reviewContent: Seattle to Fort Walton via Houston. This has honestly been the worst experience I have had with any airline. First, they make us pay to check our luggage, so if you think you're getting a good deal on your flight, think again. Then, the gate number changed 3 times during our layover in Houston with only 1 hour to spare and the gates were on exact opposite ends of the airport. My husband recently had bilateral hip replacement and was not able to sprint to either end of the airport in a timely fashion, so we consequently missed our flight. The woman at the check in was rude and told us we weren't paying attention, when in fact we were trying to run from the other end of the airport to make it in time. Then we went to customer service to attempt to reach some sort of resolution, and were met with hostility and deflection. We are now stuck at this airport until tomorrow afternoon. A 20 hr layover because they refuse to take responsibility for their incompetence.

Flew United from Newark to San Francisco. 2.5 hr+ delay. They made us sit in the cabin the whole time. No compensation offered. Actually, they offered $10 when I hassled them. Was able to get off briefly, then told to get back on again 10 minutes later. It was also 45 minutes delayed on the way out. Also, they wouldn't allow me to check in without someone checking to see if my bag would fit under the seat. As if I was a 4 year old. Never ever fly United. Horrible. Not even worth the mileage.

Flew United Airlines from Boise to Seattle via Denver. Was a great flight. Everyone is friendly, cabin is comfortable, tickets are nicely priced! Only airline I fly with. Flights were all on time and smooth. After flying close to 50,000 miles in the past year, I qualified to say they truly are the friendly sky's.

commentHeader: lost whole day on our trip
reviewContent: Chicago to St. Louis. First time flying with United and the last. Had us late for the connecting flight and had to wait many hours for another flight. Our luggage made it on flight but we missed it after running to the other end of the airport. Lost one whole day on our trip. Never again! They said to keep checking the United app online but WiFi was that bad you could not access it! Stand by on the next flight 2 hrs later which was delayed another hour - poor!

Denver to Tucson. Terrible airline. Will never use them again. Multiple times while using them, the flight has been delayed. Thankfully this time I had a direct flight and did not need to connect. I have never had a problem with other airlines (American, Southwest, Delta etc). I fully expect the the airline to do their job and be prompt. Ridiculous. Never again will United receive a dime of airfare from me, or any of my relatives/friends.

Worst customer service I have ever experienced. This is my first time flying with United and also my last! I was waiting in line for a kiosk with my friend on our flight back from Denver. Her kiosk went through and was able to check a bag, however, mine did not. We checked in at the same exact time as shown on my ticket printed from the kiosk showing me to go see additional services. They had me wait in line for 20 plus minutes after they knew I was already running late. As soon as I got up to the lady she tells me it is too late and I cannot get on the flight. I asked there has to be an alternative, and explained my roommate who I came with and was my ride also we showed up together at the same time and she was able to check her bags. I spoke with a supervisor as she told me the same thing, there is nothing they can do but put me on a 6pm flight (mind you it was 9am at this time) and I was originally on the 6pm flight and they moved me to the 9am flight because of weather delays in Philadelphia. This being said they did nothing to help try to accommodate me and did not show one bit of guilt or sorrow in any way. I went ahead and bought an American Airlines ticket and they were amazing. Do not fly with United!

commentHeader: not my idea of a vacation
reviewContent: I was disgusted during my entire journey from Newark to San Diego with United Airlines. Not sure if I was singled out or not but I was forced to check-in my carry-on. I carried my suitcase for a reason, I didnt want to check it in. Already annoyed, I boarded the plane to find out that there were multiple issues with the plane causing us to wait onboard. After several hours they told us we could deplane, use the restrooms and grab a quick bite. Being one of the first off the plane, the lady at the door said with an attitude that if we weren't back when they close the doors then we were out of luck. I asked her if there was going to be an announcement. She said we will announce it at the door but not over the loud speaker. How can you say that to people that are deplaning? It's their duty to announce the closing of the gate so everyone that left can hear. Long story short, there was a 6 hour delay and we had to board a new plane. We were given $10 voucher for food but that couldnt even buy me a sandwich. I lost all of my daylight time at my destination. Annoyed about having to wait at baggage claim, once I recieved my carry-on I noticed all of the zippers were opened. This is not my idea of a vacation.

Started with 1 hour and 45 min flight delay out to Santa Ana. The crew were unbelievably rude. Poor elderly folks trying to catch their connecting flights were trying to figure out what they should do and the advise is this, "if it were me, I would get off the plane and find another day to fly" or it was a short and impatient tone. The same crew responded to me in the same way when I asked if they could let the gate of the connecting flight know that I would be running almost a half a mile accross the airport to reach my connection. After running accross the airport and reaching my connecting gate, the guy manning the stand said I'm sorry they pulled the bridge back already, the plane had not even left yet. This was the last flight out for the night which led to me missing an event. The next day, the app made me walk a mile out of the way to the wrong terminal. I finally got on the plane and guess what, the plane happens to be the smallest plane available. To give you perspective, I am 6'7m, the height of the roof of the plane was about 5'8. To top it all off, my flight was 30 min delayed on my final departure. I will never again fly with United Airlines.

commentHeader: United has already wasted my time
reviewContent: I have flown on countless airlines, internationally and domestically and today, I encountered the worst of my experiences with United Airlines 18 hours before I even needed to be at the airport. Upon receiving multiple emails reminding me that it was time to check in for my flight, I went to the website to check in only to be told that I could not. After multiple attempts on multiple devices, I finally received an email telling me to call United in order to check in. The associates informed me that I could not check in due to the fact that I had booked an economy ticket and did not have a checked bag. If I purchased a checked bag, I would be able to check in online. Please note that this policy change is new and it is buried in the fine print way down a page that can be accessed through a prompt that is in fine print, in a nearly transparent color. There is a red box on the page where you confirm your ticket that offers trip advisory/restrictions on the flight and it can be seen clear as day and this policy is not addressed there. You have to dig for it. I needed the mobile pass due to scheduling and not being able to get to the airport in enough time to wait in line to check in and then again to get through security and after speaking to 3 people, I was informed that there was nothing that any of them could do. So now, 18 hours before I even get to the airport, United has already wasted my time, messed up my schedule, misled me and tried to extort me into purchasing the checked bag (which I don't need), just so I can get the mobile boarding pass and adhere to my schedule. Don't let it happen to you. Such a scam.

route: Auckland to Boston via San Francisco
reviewContent: Auckland to Boston via San Francisco. Absolutely terrible airline. On the way from Boston to Auckland, our first flight was delayed (for no apparent reason) causing us to miss our connecting flight in California. After significant asking, we were transferred to an American flight from LA to Auckland, because otherwise we would be stuck in California. Being aboard the American Airlines flight was actually such a luxury, the seats reclined and the TV's actually worked. Unfortunately we had to fly United back from Auckland to Boston. The seats were cramped, hardly reclined. Then flying back from SFO to Boston, the flight attendants were rude and we actually didn't even get pretzels. Only a glass of water for a 5 hour and 20 minute flight.

Terrible company. I used to think it was one of the best companies to travel with. Never traveling with them again. Our flight got delayed in Miami and had a connecting flight to Denver from Houston obviously missed our flight in Houston. Company refused to pay for our hotel room and claimed it was not their fault. Not even offered a amenity bag with products. Traveled with lower cost airlines had a better treatment. Next day flew to Denver from Houston made me pay 50$ for a small personal bag. Are you kidding me?

route: San Jose to Houston via Denver
reviewContent: San Jose to Houston via Denver. Very bad service with United. My fiancé and I had tickets together and selected seats on both flights but when we checked in they were changed twice and there were people in our seats with our same seat number on our ticket so we were forced to move.

Chicago to Columbus. Nearly missed the flight because they changed gates (to a completely different area of the airport) and only informed us through an indecipherable, static-y speaker. Extremely annoyed. Last time I flew with them, I missed my first flight on a round trip ticket because of a job interview. They cancelled my return flight with no refund and did not send an email or anything about it. It probably said that would happen in the fine print, but an email would have been nice.

commentHeader: aren't going to fly this airline again
reviewContent: Vienna to Newark via Zurich with United (Vienna to Zurich on Austrian, Zurich to Newark on United). We checked in two days before the flight and reserved seats, my one was 24K, so we do not sit split across the whole plane. When we arrived at the gate in Zurich, they gave us new Boarding cards with other seats across the whole plane. As we flew with our children, my wife and me would like to sit next to them. But United couldn't change the seats, so we had to accept it. Finally in the plane, most of the flight attendants were very rude, there was just one friendly FA on board. The food tasted horrible. It was the worst I've ever eaten in my whole life. Also the wifi didn't work. During the flight, the FA's were gone, we couldn't order something to drink and all the rubbish had to go into the seat pocket. Just before landing they handed out something like a Leach-Pizza piece. That also didn't taste good and it was full of fat. We aren't going to fly on this airline again.
